description: Good overnight place, no infrastructure. Shower and toilet in the Reception. Very quiet. You can camp in the parking lot or rent a cabin. They asked 20 usd without services for a 17 feet camper. Very expensive

name: Dominical beach parking Pazific
description:
Good overnight place, no infrastructure. Ev. can be used in the rest El Coco, for a fee, toilet and shower. WiFi in the restaurant. Quiet at night. The sea has strong currents, swimming is not recommended.
WiFi from El Coco reaches quite far into the beach

name: Beach campsite
description: Camping on the beach in front of the hotel is prohibited

name: Punta Uva - Roads End **WARNING**
description:
Nice beachfront camping. Many spots to choose from.
ARMED RAID AT 8.2.16 see check-ins

name: El Delfin RV Park
description: RV park in Liberia.  Looked like there were water and electricity hookups although we didn't use them.  Very chlorinated pool and filthy bathrooms, possible cold showers although we didn't attempt any.  No wifi.    Price: $10/night

name: Montana Linda Hostel
description: Hostel in Orosi, camped on the street outside of the hostel.  Use of kitchen, clean bathrooms, warmish showers, no wifi.  Felt secure as Orosi is a small town.    Price: $6/night.

name: Flutterbye Hostel
description: Hostel 200 meters from the beach in Uvita.  Secure parking, clean bathrooms, cold water shower, wifi, great kitchen to cook in. They have a restaurant as well. Helpful and friendly, camping available for less. Not a party hostel but packed with people, it's silent after 10PM. Price:  $12/night ($6/person).

name: Piscina Natural
description: Beautiful hotel with lush garden natural pool filled by tidal fluctuation.  Room with ensuite bathroom hot showers, fan, wifi, serve yourself cold beer and wine.   Price: $45/night.

name: Camping Maria
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution.

The price per night is 6.000. colones per person. Kitchen with gas stove, grill available, two newly constructed bathrooms with large showers, wi fi, parking, oceanfront. We have electricity in the common areas, but do not offer for large camping rigs, as we do not have adequate supply in campground.
The property is very clean, quite and safe. We can park up to ten cars but Tent top vehicle parking is only available in our lot by the rancho. Since they use two spaces it limits our space. There is no parking in front of the beach area, it is for tent campers, bur everyone has full use of our facilities.
Due to many problems we DO NOT accept Pets
50627550901

name: Lake Arenal Brewing Company
description: Yes!  A microbrewery with good beer and food as well as amazing views of Lake Arenal.  It is also a hotel with pool, hot tub, wifi etc.  They let us camp for free after we bought a few beers and dinner.

name: Lake Arenal Camping (Nuevo Arenal)
description: Communal recreation area. Camping by lake. Free. No Facilities but toilets during day. Although water tap available and possible power if parked near small building. Locked overnight.

name: Arenal View
description: Pull off by river at side of gravel road. Quiet overnight. No facilities. Free.

name: Playa Grande
description: Parking in small sandy Parking lot next to beautiful beach. No facilities. Free and very quiet overnight. Also a paid parking lot down the road with security.

name: Parking Area, Santa Elena
description: Flat disused piece of land in middle of Santa Elena. Relatively quiet overnight. No facilities. WIFI available if you go to Hotel and get password. Free. Alternatively ‘The Common Cup’ coffee shop is close, very good and has wifi.

name: Monteverde Reserve
description: Possible to Camp on road outside reserve. Difficult to get flat for big vehicles, soft verges – more suited to smaller vehicles. Toilets available in reserve.

name: La Paz Waterfall Gardens
description: No camping Admission is expensive – USD40 each but you can spend all day there, the place is very good with aviary, butterfly house, ranarium, big cats, sloths, hummingbirds , orchid garden, trout pool and waterfall trail through cloudforest. Toilets during opening hours.

name: Green Forest, Uvita
description: Hostel – space on driveway for 1 or 2 RV’s. Power and water available. Very nice host, can arrange tours for you or take you hiking. We were given use of the dorm toilets and shower as there were no guests at the time. USD10 per night.

name: Restaurante Doña Julio
description: A restaurant north of San Jose where we were able to camp for free for a night. In return, we ate breakfast at the restaurant the next morning. Views here are stunning!  Owners are incredibly friendly.

name: Playa Potrero - Beach Lot
description: Camping in a dirt lot on the beach... Seems like the main public access point... Several locals said it would be fine for a few days... Seems like quite and safe community... During our stay had great ocean breeze...

name: Playa Junquillal - End Of The road
description: Nice spot under some trees at the end of this quite beach. Apparently dangerous currents at the beach but has a nice tide pool area that suited our cool off/soaking needs.

name: Playa San Miguel - North End
description: The beach has several public access point, a few of which looked prime for boondocking. We chose the one on the north end as there is a vacant lot right there that we could pull into and it felt more remote (closer to the headland). We asked the neighbor if we could camp and he said no problem. A little buggy during our stay, but in all nice peaceful beach.

name: Playa Coyote - North End
description: Nice big quite beach with several public access spots you can camp at, we chose the north end by the river mouth as it was more remote/private. A little buggy during our stay with a beautiful sunset.

name: North Playa Manzanillo Pirate Camp
description: Large opening along the beach (likely a river mouth, thus likely only suitable for drier times). Need to drive down the beach to access. Good packed sand beach. A little buggy during our stay.

name: Pizza Al A Lena
description: Awesome pizza. You may be able to setup camping here if you are in a bind. Wifi worked ok as well.

name: Playa Hermosa - South End
description: One of the few public access sites along this beach. Beautiful spot with large shade tree right on the beach tucked next to a headland.

name: Bajada Las Rocas
description: One of the few spots not right on the road between Cabuya and Montezuma. Beautiful spot under coco palms (beware of falling nuts). There are two access roads in, during our stay the eastern one was in better condition. There are several spots to choose from.

name: Playa Organos
description: Looking for a place near the ferry and found this nice broad beach. Camping in a sand/grass lot by the beach.

name: Orosi Church Parking Lot
description: This is a parking lot across from the church in Orosi. We tried to camp at the Balneario but they wouldn't let us and told us about this lot instead. No amenities and it was a little noisy but it was free!

name: Mirador Orosi
description:
ADMIN NOTE: No overnight camping allowed, please respect the wishes of the locals.  
Beautiful views from this spot. Free!

name: 100% Aventura - Canopy Tour
description: I listed it as informal because though the camping is free we paid for the canopy tour. It is a nice level paved parking lot with use of restrooms. The place is deserted at 5:30pm and gets busy again around 7am. Very nice owners. We asked around and it seems like other operators would offer the same.

name: Volcan Irazu
description:
15 USD per person plus 2000 Colones parking. Online reservation needed which you can do at the pay stations using their WiFi. Park opens at 8AM and we got in as early as possible. Still... within minutes the crater was covered by clouds. Luckily only for a short while though until the clouds started to burn off. As previously posted, no more crater lakes or steam so this is definitely not our most impressive volcano. Really, if you wouldn't know it's a volcano... you wouldn't know. I'd look at this as just a different picture of Costa Rica. An high altitude, alpine landscape with amazing views of the surrounding mountains, valleys and, if you're lucky, oceans. Besides the main view point at the craters, there is another viewpoint up above which is accessible via rough road but wasn't a problem for our camper van.


We asked the guys in the main parking lot if we could spend the night up at the Mirador. We think they said yes, but I won't be surprised if we get kicked out. Price to camp is free. Price to enter park is $23. Restrooms available at the main parking area, as well as a little restaurant. ... And we got kicked out!  Just to be clear, you can totally visit the volcano but you can't camp here.

name: Restaurante Nochebuena
description: After getting kicked out of the volcano natl park, we stopped at this restaurant and asked to park here for the night. Price was free but we bought breakfast here the next morning. Didn't ask after restrooms or other facilities, but they should be available.

name: Aventuras Orosi
description: This is a restaurant right in the river that we camped at. Cost was $4 for the night. Good trout at the restaurant.  Ground a bit slopey.

name: Zgas/Tropigas
description: Open mon-thurs 8-12, 1-4:30, sat they are not open any more. Cost about $10 for a 20lb bottle

name: Hotel Interamericana
description: We parked here the night before our river trip on the Picuare. Free. But it may only have been free because our river guides knew the people at the hotel. No amenities offered but I'm sure the hotel would let you use their toilet if you asked. There is a lot for bigger rigs nearby, but you may have to pay. Plenty of restaurants and other stuff in the area to keep you busy. Here is a link to the company we used for the river trip:  http://www.ticoriver.com/contact.htm  very nice and they speak English.

name: Free Hot Springs
description: Situated right next to the $50 hot springs is a hot stream/river that runs under the main road. The entrance is opposite the resort down a short road blocked by a yellow gate/chain. You can park just up the hill from the yellow gate and walk in. Short easy walk to lovely little hot pools. And best of all free.

name: Therme los Laureles
description: Camping available on a field just ouside the gate of a developed hotspring. Location is about 10 minutes drive out of town towards Lago Arenal. the ground is not very level, but it is possible to find a decent spot. Should be okay also for RVs.  the entrance fee to the hotsprings is 6000 colones per person , They are open until 9PM.   Price: 2000 colones per person for camping.very nice pool, you will enjoy it!

name: Camping los Cocos
description: A small camp ground with a fantastic location on the beach on the Nicoya Peninsula. Surface is firm sand. Several good beach restaurant nearby, and a short walk to a grocery store. An easy place to stay for a few days or weeks. Tight corner which will give bigger rigs a problem.   Price: 6000 colones

name: Mar Azul
description: Another paradise place on the Nicooya Peninsula. Beach front camping, and not crowded at all. This place is 10 - 15 minutes from the town of (Playa) Santa Teresa where you can go for party, supplies, espresso, shopping, surfing, or just hang out with other travellers and backpackers.   Price: 8000 colones

name: El Arrecife
description: A fantastic beach camp right on the Caribbean Ocean. Good swimming and snorkeling, and there were several restaurants near by. The toilets are clean, outdoor shower by the beach.there is WiFi available at the restaurant,. the electricity cables to get in are quite low and may require you to stand on the roof of your vehicle and lift them.

name: Corcovado Information Center
description: Right across from the airport, this is where you can make a reservation for the hike/ranger station in Corcovado Natl Park. Closed on Sundays. You can also email reservacionesacosa@gmail.com

name: "La Tortuga" Playa Grande
description:
NO CAMPING
 Swimming pool, Jacuzzi, WiFi. Very quiet at night. A few steps from the sea.     Free, but we ate there.  Continue to the end of the road to the Playa Grande.

name: Hotel Giardino Tropicale NO CAMPING
description:
Comment: This hotel / parking lot no longer accepts camping . Playa paled is the closest possibility. 

Top Wohlfühlplatz with luxury camping on sep place of the hotel complex. Water, electricity. We were next to the parking lot with an office LAN, toilet and shower. Swimming pool with jacuzi. Quiet at night, 400 meters to the sea.     10./Night U $.  Take road to Samara, then turn to Nosara, 28 km dirt road poor, many holes.

name: Barra Honda National Park
description: Good overnight place at the football field. No infrastructure. Very quiet at night.     Free.  Turn left onto CN21 of Nicoya, then on the CN18 to the sign "Barra Honda." Turn left, follow the road to the right turn, turn left into a good gravel road. Shield it from Barra Honda are totally 8.5 km

name: Unlimited public place by the lake in Nuevo Arenal
description:
Good place, also for longer stays. Faucet presen
ce, no other infrastructure. Well lit. You can swim in the lake. Free.  Go to Nuevo Arenal, 100 meters after the German Bakery turn right. turn left at first road, left thru the gate.

name: Hotel Heroes, "La pequeña Helvecia"
description:
Electric Gate is always closed, you'll need to phone ahead. (506) 2692-8012
Good place to overnight in the car park. Swimming pool can be used. Toilet by the pool. It also has a shower with cold water in the pool. Quiet at night.     Trial, we have eaten in the restaurant.  To Nuevo Arenal, about 11 km

name: Parking "Fresa del Volcan"
description: Good overnight place, no infrastructure, quiet.     Free.  about 5 km from the Volcan left

name: Centre "Deportivo", Guapiles
description: Good overnight And day place, faucet (Drinking Water). Through road within earshot. Large gate will be closed at 18.00 clock. Night watchman. Col. 5000 but unofficial so you can try to negociate. swimming pool can be used with 2 pools, shower and toilet. Closed from 17.00 clock.  At the junction turn towards Tortuguero NP. After about 2.5 km on the right, signposted.

name: Grassy Spot in front of Shopping Super Villas del Caribe
description:
NOTE, Your reception may depend on what staff are on duty.

Good overnight place without infrastructure. Quiet at night. Free WiFi. Able for a fee from the current charging relate, otherwise free.     The place is very close to the animal shelter "Jaguar Rescue Center." Guided tours 9:30 and 11:30 clock. Highly recommended.     Admission U $ 15.--/Person  To Puerto Viejo to Punta Uva, right on the street

name: Unlimited public beach of Estrillos Oeste
description: Feel-good place. Directly on the sea, about 10 meters. At night, the waves are noisy. No infrastructure. Current could be obtained from a house, also water. Quiet.     Free.  Coastal road to Playa Oeste Estrillos turn. All the way down towards the sea.

name: Camping El Tecal, near Uvita
description:
Wellness area with swimming pool on lawn. water, shower, toilet and WiFi. Everything is still very well maintained. Electricity on every spot. Quiet. Col. 5,000ppn.
Eight hundred meters south of Uvita turn right on dirt road. Camping is signposted.

name: Parking Hotel Sierra, Golfito
description: Good overnight place, no infrastructure. WiFi. Quiet.     Free  At the end of the village, next to the free trade zone

name: Playa Pan Dulce
description: Wild camp on near the point of the Oso Peninsula. Parking area a bit muddy, and no facilities. Beach is beautiful.

name: Olivia's Playground
description: Wide open space right on the lake with view of volcano and surrounding mountains. Clear landing spot short drive off main road. No one around. Best boondocking on Lake Arenal so far!

name: Playa Matapalo
description:
WARNING  Access difficult for conventional vehicles due to steep track

Amazing beach next to jungle filled with monkeys, lizards, and scarlet macaws. Not great for swimming, but there are beaches within walking distance for that.

name: Carate Beach Pirate Camp
description: No amenities but the beach is beautiful. Great for walking, not so much for swimming. Free. Scarlet macaws and other animals frequent this spot.

name: Grass Road Beach
description: Just west of Jimenez a little overgrown road leads between two pastures and down to a lovely little clearing just off the beach. A few bugs around and the occasional cow deposit, but the seclusion and easy swimming more than made up for it.

name: Football Hideaway
description: Just off the lightly trafficked main road into/out of the Osa is a little football (soccer) field with a small access road leading off of the far end to a small landing. Not much to it, but peaceful and quite. Great if you get stuck waiting for a river to drain and find yourself traveling later than anticipated (talking from experience). Land is owned by the parks and the rangers we ran into said it was ok to camp.

name: Z Gas/Tropigas
description: Just off the main road outside of Limon, paid around $10  US for a 20 liter refill. Hours: Monday-Friday 8-12, 1-4:30, Saturday 8-12, Sunday closed.

name: Beach Camping North of Playa Manzanillo
description: Camping at the water's edge on a long swimming beach just north of town - just off a road that sees little traffic - Free

name: Tamarindo Beach Camping (southern end of Playa Tamarindo)
description:
Beware we were broken into here during the night 

Public access point right on the beach.  No facilities, howlers in the trees! Free!

Entrada pública de vehículos a la playa. Puedes estacionar justo sobre la playa. Muchos arboles que dan sombra. Sin servicios, pero Gratis!!!

name: Orosi Lodge
description: Nice hotel and cafe next door to the Balneario owned and run by a nice German couple.  Wifi, hot showers, kitchenette with sink, coffee maker and refrigerator.  Muy tranquilo!  We were here during low season (July) so we paid US$61 plus tax for a triple room (one double bed and a single bed).  I think the usual price for this room is US$77.

name: Carrara Parque Verde Technológico
description: Large treed facility, would be great for a large group.  Has a pool, showers, restaurant, covered picnic tables and barbecues, plus several playgrounds.  Vehicle camping is a bit far from the facilities and is in an unattractive dirt parking lot.  Expensive.  5,000 Colones to camp and 7,000 Colones to enter the compound (for 2 adults and 1 child).

name: Camping el Chaman
description: PROS: Covered (or uncovered if that is your preference) spots in fruit-tree filled campground/hostel/treehouse, electric and potable water hookups, dedicated kitchen sink for each campsite, clean bathrooms and showers, free wifi, short walk into town and the beach – CONS: We were unable to get the wifi in our campsite 9 USD/person/night or 5000 colones

name: Playa Santa Teresa
description: Public beach access dirt road off the main highway. Long strip of parking next to the ocean. Pizza place on the corner and some vendors during the day. Public shower next to pizza place reported as not functioning. Free!

name: Wild Camp
description: Large gravel lot on side of the road next to a livestock auction facility (which was not in use the day we stayed here).  Asked the nice caretaker (Herardo) if we could camp here and he said yes.  He even opened the sanitarios in the facility for us and ensured that it had toilet paper too.  The light in the bathroom was out so he offered us a lamp from his house (we declined as politely as we could).   Parking behind the facility put out us out of sight of the road but with a nice quiet and flat place to park, some nice trees next to us and an easy walk to the bathrooms.  He did not charge us anything.  (Free).

name: Playa Pavones
description: Flat grassy spot right next to the beach and "coastal" road that is rarely used. Very quiet. Very scenic. Big rocks in the water so not ideal for swimming but during low tide you can walk all the way down the beach to the town center. Nice breeze. Locals say it's the best camping spot in the area.

name: Gas/Auto Z
description: Gas/Auto Z In Front Of Coopeinsermu RL. Just outside of Cartago, located on CA 2.

name: SelvaWhiteWater
description:
under construction (shelter and cabins) but much space to camp close to nature. CLEAN RESTROOMS!!! spacious shower. very nice hosts (us/cr). direct at the sarapiqui river. perfect place for kayaking and rafting [host offers whitewater-tours(very good guides and equipment, all levels and nice price)]. also nice place for cooling down and swimm in the clean sarapiqui. supermarket near by. fast wifi in sheltered office area.
two dogs are taking care.     5 $ per person/night
contact ; travis@selvawhitewater.com. office tel. (506)24418054
cell. (506)87298739

name: Carate Beach Pirate Camp 2
description: This is also another beautiful clearing among the palm trees on the beach. It sits on a slightly higher ground so the tide is not a problem. Lots of coconut trees to pick from and a lot of driftwood for fire. The sand may require 4x4 for 30 meters from the road. We had one of our best camping times on this spot. The waves are fun to play with as long as you don't lose your footing and get dragged out. Shade is plenty and the beach is very clean and secluded. Parrots and monkeys are common. If you're lucky you may even see a turtle laying eggs at night.

name: Hotel El Regalo - Wilson Group
description:
- large hotel and restaurant complex
- the restaurant let us camp in their gravel/grassy parking lot (we needed to obtain permisson at the reception of the complex)
- free, we just had a couple of drinks at the bar (we had to teach them how to make Cuba Libre, strange)
- internet reached the parking area

name: Playa Tarcoles
description:
- free
- parking right by the sea in a park in front of a hotel (WiFi signal, we didn't ask for a password)
- Take the road to the sea, it ends with a little roundabout - turn right in front of the roundabout to get to a small concrete basketball field (we camped here), or turn left for a bit more private location also by the sea.
- The nearby Carara NP was ok, we saw some howlers, one scarlet macaw from afar and some other little animals. But nothing spectacular. There is a free wifi by the entrance to the park. Make sure to stop at the bridge north of Carara if you want to see some crocodiles, they usually hang out right underneath the bridge.

name: Estacion Biologica La Gamba
description:
- 15 USD per person, including park entrance
- showers, wifi (slow)
- We came here because we heard this place was supposed to be $10 per car including park entrance. The prices have since changed, unfortunately (in retrospect, they offer $5 per person entrance, but maybe because we specifcally asked for showers, we were charged $15 pp).
- When we arrived, there was just one girl working on her laptop. Looks calm, we thought. At 8 PM a busload of students came who proceded to make noise until almost 11 pm (singing Offspring acapella). Then again at 5:30 the bus, parked right next to us, started it's engine and everybody proceeded to board it.
- Included in the price is supposedly entrance to the park, you can even grab a laminated map at the station. To be honest, nobody checked for tickets, you could easily just walk in there. The map is available in PDF at the station's website.

name: Rancho Burica
description: "This is where the bad road ends and good life begins" reads the sign at the door. A few Dutch surfer friends started this finca and made it into a beautiful 'tica' hostel. It's not intended for camping but they seem to be open to the idea. We did not stay here because we didn't know about it. But it sounds like a good option for others on the road.

name: EXIT / ENTER COSTA RICA ,Paso Canoas
description:
See attached image

1. Park (A)
2. Walk across the street and pay exit fee $8 (B)
3. Return to immigration and exit stamp your passport at the windows (C)
4. Turn left and walk around the corner to the right and enter the double doors on your left to cancel your TIP (D)
Go to Panama

name: Playa Del coco
description: Be very careful camping in playa Del coco. We were camping on the beach when someone broke into our car (while we were inside), stole a wallet, phone, e-reader and threatened us with a gun. The beach is lovely, and the local police do the rounds all night, but I would still advise against camping here.

name: Congos Hostel & Camping, Playa Hermosa
description: Nice shady campground a block from Hermosa Beach. 4,000 colones per person for sites with electricity, light, and picnic table. Has BBQ, bathrooms and showers, flat level ground, friendly people, nice huge dog.

name: Tucan Hotel
description: Hostel with possibility to camp for tents and small campers. Very nice place with WIFI, hammocks, very clean showers and toilets, restaurant on site.

name: Finca Agroecologica La Flor
description: The farm offers accomodation for groups and individual travellers, courses and much more. We met Brit, the German director of the Finca while we were in Orosi and visited her the next day. She also would like to invite Overlanders with her Campers to spend some days on the Finca. Access road is a bit steep and in a bad condition and the entrance gate is a bit narrow, not recommended for vehicels wider than 2,10 m. Space for parking is limited, for smaller vans it would be fine. Price would be $ 10 for 2 people.

name: Total LPG
description: For US and European RV Tanks.  Delta gas station.

name: Restaurant Tinajas Arenal
description: Good and quiet overnight Parking in front of the Restaurant. Good food, very friendly.

name: Ostional Beach Front
description: Free camping directly at the beach right next to a small church, with a great view and just steps to the surf in the morning. Road 160 might require 4x4 due to river crossings. Local soda restaurant on Main Street 20m from beach. Ask locals if you can use their sink. They've been very helpful. Free toilet in the back of the small church

name: Avellanas Beach
description:
Parking lot right next to Lola's restaurant, directly at the beach. The restaurant has bathrooms and there is a shower next to the parking lot (ask the parking guy for permission). Restaurant only open until 5.00pm. No bathroom excess thereafter. Super quiet and nice site. FREE

Not free anymore, no facilities

name: TacoBar - Jaco Beach
description: Insanely good fish tacos and all you can eat salad buffet with a choice of 6 salads + potatoes and rice! Considering the all you can eat definitely a great deal for Costa Rica

name: Windsurfing Camp
description: 1 grassy parking spot next to the lake. It's a seasonal business and is currently closed (November 17). It was recommended to us by the owner of the hotel and brewery up the road. No services. It has a canopy and a couple picnic tables. Free

name: Parque Nacional Los Quetzales
description:
Free... Parking just in front of the park entrance, there is a big lot where you can park your rv or place your tent if you are brave enough since it is very cold at night at 2980mt. Of altitude. You can park or camp inside the park if you ask but it all depends on what park ranger is there.
Update 07/2020: Now its 10 dollars pp to enter.

name: Hotel Isla
description: Hotel Isla Inn is a HOTEL and DO NOT have camping. We do not offer camping posibilities.

name: CVS Veterinary Clinic
description: Really nice vet who speaks perfect english. Dr. Sandy Quiros.

name: Rocking J's
description: Campsite at Rocking J's hostel, right in Puerto Viejo. We had read that this is a party hostel so we weren't that keen to stay there but after trying numerous other places and no one letting us camp, we pulled in and it was actually fine. The camping area is just outside the main hostel so not too noisy and has lovely green grass. Bathrooms are nothing fancy but are ok, there is wifi and a kitchen and a laundry. Definitely big enough for all size rigs. The price is now $7pp. It is really central so easy to walk into town at night.

name: Gaudy's Backpackers Hostel
description: They let us sleep in our VW Van in their back gated driveway area (it was a tight fit) for slightly less than the cost of dorm beds $10/person. We have a 2 year old and needed to meet friends coming in on a late flight, so it worked okay in a pinch, but isn't highly recommended. Probably better to just drop the $$ on a private room.

name: rooms above Manuel Antonio restaurant
description: We dropped $40 for a pretty crummy room above the Manuel Antonio restaurant. There is plenty of room to park out back, but the woman at reception would not let us camp in our VW van, even though we had visiting friends who had already rented a room. It did have a great shared balconey overlooking the ocean and is steps away from the beach. BUT, really really expensive for what you get. And brown tap water eeewwww.

name: Fixed Tanks maybe, but no bottles
description:
Note that while bottles may not be filled here as per recent checkin,  it is possible that fixed tanks will be filled. 

 Propane filling station at the petrol station on the main road outside Jaco. Paid about c230 per litre. Connects to propane tank in camper easily. Look for the big propane tank.

name: Reserva Biologica Tirimbina
description: Nice private rainforest; non profit org. that combine tourism and sc. research - They accepted that we stay in the parking for the night if we visit (28/19usd adult/kid for night tour plus right to walk during the day until 5pm).

name: Grass spot on the beach
description: Right next to Playa Negra, in front of soccer field. We stayed there two nights in a row and nobody asked a question. 5 meters from the ocean;) there is also a campground nearby (500 m). Good for tents too.

name: Reggae Bar Cabins And Campground
description: Campground on a grass field ; 5usd per person; bathrooms showers wifi ; nice owner ; beach in front ; music until 10 pm. Maybe a bit later on friday night...12 am during covid-19 up to 2:30 am other times

name: Punta Uva Beach
description: We stayed here instead of the other nearby spot because locals told us it was safer here where there is more people. But there ants at this spot and not at the other. There is a restaurant nearby. The road to come at P. Uva can be bumpy (big holes) if it rained in the previous days. (All in all, we prefered the spot we had at Cahuita, thought.)

name: Hotel Del Aserradero
description:
$40 for two person room with fan. The rooms all have two single size beds. Secure parking out front. Doesn't look like much from outside but very nice inside and good layout with lots of sitting areas. Really fast wifi throughout. 

Great place if you are just driving by, very friendly staff , we camp in the open field and were able to use hotel s amenities , about an hour or less from Tamarindo

name: Camping Los Malinches (Manuel's Place)
description: ₡4.000 colones per person per night. Camping on bluff overlooking ocean, from the campsite there is a quick trail to the beach. Very beautiful and quiet campground. Can have fires in fire pits and plenty of firewood from surrounding area. The road is dirt for the last few k but fine for rigs of any size. Currently there are camping signs with arrows starting at the Iguana Azul hotel which is approx. 1 km away. Camping is to the left or south of the hotel. There is a good sink area in middle of campground for dishes or laundry. The area is groomed so no falling coconuts and lots of flat ground. Bathroom has two showers and two toilets and all clean with toilet seats and paper.

name: URSA Petrol Station
description:
Safe place to park if the night catch you on your way to the beach.
Big space, a little noisy and free.

name: Costa Linda
description: We stayed on the parking lot (gravel), lovely friendly family and good food in restaurant no charge for camping. Came off hi way to find somewhere to stop as getting late. Possibly camp on beach at far end of village but was very busy when we arrived on Sunday eve. Take cinder road from west, other route on my GPS is a rough track which goes over the mountain

name: Playa San Miguelón
description:
Driving south from Montezuma, cross the 2nd bridge and turn to the left.
There's parking space right on the beach and beside the river. There are recycling garbage bins, beautiful trees and a lot of birds!

name: Camping Adonis
description:
Large grassy field, 10 min walking from town center.
Electricity available. Lots of birds everywhere.
Adonis wasn't as helpful as he was supposed to be according to other comments. Couldn't find us a guidé to Corcovado. Said everything was now difficult with the pandemic.
It however a nice place but don't count on Adonis help anymore.
Toilets and shower are very basic
Wifi only available close to Adonis house.

name: Hotel Guanacaste
description: Its called a budget hotel - they have a big parking lot for trucks too which we used and slept in the van. They charged 2000 colones for that and let us use their toilet. Not the nicest but ok for a night!

name: BEWARE: Soccer field in front of police station
description: We were looking for free camping and anyone we asked about camping said we could camp in front of the police station on the soccer field. Lovely, flat spot with a gorgeous view of Drake Bay. I will claim 100% fault for being lulled into a false sense of security given our location, but we set up our tent, put our tank bags and dry bags under the fly (locked up our valuables on the bikes) and walked 200 meters down the road for dinner. While we were gone, the everything on the side of our tent facing the police station (where two police men were sitting outside for the majority of the time we were there), was gone through and they took whatever they found useful (flashlights, supplies from our first aid kit, tent pegs, etc.). We heard the next morning that this has happened to two other parties who had previously camped there, yet, oddly, the police didn't mention this when we asked them if it was safe to stay there. Hmmmmm... Nice spot as long as you don't walk away from it.

name: German Bakery
description:
Free Wifi great food. Thomas the owner is very helpful.
From 8:00 to 16:00

name: Playa Ocotal
description: Just before the beach, in the street just near the restaurant Father Rooster. Quiet but some workers ( fisher and diver) pass at 6am and make a bit of noise. Was nice, free wifi from the restaurant. Possible to ask water...  And it's really safe cause there is a hotels near and a lot of guards everywhere !

name: Auto Cori Iveco
description: Perfect garage for Iveco camper and truck. They have the technologies and parts needed, perfect service... And possible to sleep there when work is in process.

name: Playa Herradura
description: Really nice beach with plenty of space available to camp on it. No services for camper but restaurants are present. Calm and look safe. Easy to enter with our 24 feet long RV.

name: Hôtel Los Piños
description: Let us stay for free on a gravel place. Friendly and calm, nice place for us in transit.

name: Villas Tita Surf Camping And Parqueo
description: Fee for the night 4000 colones. (7$) A small campground with water. A few little villas and also a parking lot in front of the beach. A surfers beach with waves and black sand. You must ask to stay at the villas for the campground or parking lot. You can also call them at 8437-8510. The owners are not always there. Sometimes it is closed.  Very quiet and besides the restaurants and other amenities

name: Volcano Irazu Gravel Pit
description: 200 meters away from the entrance to the Irazu Volcano park. Free. Very quiet at night. Perfect to sleep at before the opening of the gates at 8 am.

name: Casita Azul
description: This is a unique place! (pls note that the coordinates are in the village about 2km away from the spot! due to the reason that the owners want that you call them first: 8658 2737) -Casita Azul is a small simple rustical wood cabin for 3 persons (or 2 adults and 2 kids) with a kitchen, hot shower, restroom and small room with a table. its truly placed in nowhere. the way to the casita is short but gravel and offroad, without 4x4 may be not possible. definitely not for big rigs not only because of the road, the parking lot is small. it's owned by a very friendly Austrian Couple who live on the house up the hill. they harvest there own fruits and vegetables and live there more or less independent. also if camping, you can connect to electricity and water. sometimes mobile internet also works well....sometimes it does not ;) you pay what you like there is no official price. also andi and angi offer breakfast. u can also check www.casitaazul.at

name: Truck Stop
description: This is a gravel truck parking lot next to a restaurant and opposite a fuel station. There are toilets at the restaurant but no showers or electrical hookups. It is near the main road so there is traffic noise and trucks keep arriving and leaving. It is at the bottom of the hill (5 km) from the forest adventures site that also has a treetop tramway, but they would not let me park overnight in their car park so I came here. Free.

name: Parking next to park entrance
description: The access road to the volcano is closed from 3.30pm - 8am. We pullet out on the little road right next to the ticket shop and found a nice place to stay after 10 m where we could park level. Great sunrise with a view of the cloudy valley. Late in the evening guards of the park passed and asked if everything was okay. At 6am the first park employees came for work. Admission to nationalpark: US $ 10 / person plus US $ 3 / vehicle.

name: Play Lagarto
description:
Nice little beach spot. We took our first right upon entering town and passing a farm. Asked a local if camping was OK, he said "no problem". No a good swimming or surfing beach, it's rocky. However thousands of hermit crabs, and cool tidal pools. We were in our pickup, and did use 4WD in sand. 
UPDATE 05/2018: The last piece of track to the beach is pretty rough and there are low hanging tree branches. We couldn't make it with our Unimog. Clearance was sufficient but we were too high. However, the family living on the land just before you reach the spot let us stay on their (fenced) property fir USD 5.00/night. Gate is wide enough but beware of the low hanging cable at the gate.

name: Salida Costa Rica
description:
1.One the left is Aduana, big blue and gray building. You need a copy of your Costa Rican TIP. Copy window is up the covered walkway behind Aduana. Go in the office to get stamped out. They keep the original. 
2.Pay Costa Rican exit tax of $8. You will likely be flagged over to the right to park. Below is a green Bancredito building, or we saw in the Salida Costa Rica building a Exit tax machine which is only $7 (saw too late for us, but you can save yourself $1 if you pay with card). 
3. Drive to have your paper worked checked by Costa Rica. This person will take the little piece of paper Aduana gives you and look at your copy of canceled TIP. 
4. Drive a little and give passports to a Nicaraguan offical. They checked our car right here in the road. 
5. Fumigation (pay later during Aduana proses) 
6. Get passport stamped. Building is obvious and on the left. Pay a $1 for entrada, then another $12 to guy who gives you your stamp and a piece of paper (do not loose, you'll need it to exit Nicaragua). 
7. Person in touristic office will ask for $5 (road tax, don't loose, keep with vehicle paperwork and you may be asked to present it to police) 
8. Find vehicle inspector, get a form to fill out and wait for the inspector to inspect your car, the inspector with sign the form. Take form to other side of parking lot (among the food vendors to have police stamp form, and they need copy of drivers license and vehicle registration ) Take stamped and signed form into Aduana desk which is in the room behind where you were stamped in. You also pay your Fumigation of $3-6 in the same room Aduana is. (Price is dependent of vehicle type). No charge for TIP.
9. Buy insurance. Ours was $12. Insurance both is just past Fumigation window, but outside. 
10. Enter Nicaragua. Vehicle paperwork is checked. 
11. We have a dog, but rumor is on Sundays the bank is closed and they don't care about the dog since they can't take money for it. No one asked or said anything about our dog. Today is a Sunday. 
11. One more stop, person checks all passports.

name: Arboura Cabinas
description: Affordable Open Air A Frame cabins and A/C Units. Price based on season and occupancy. No type of camping or RV parking permitted. No common area or public bathrooms. Kids under 4 not permitted. No pets.

name: Las Brisas
description: A lovely spot by the beach with a good fish restaurant. We had access to a cold shower and toilet-basic but clean. You literally drive onto the beach and park by the side of the restaurant-you could drive a 2WD onto the beach. There is a board up with tours, such as fishing tours, which the restaurant can organize for you. It cost 8 dollars/4000 local money for two people per night. Recommended if you want to get away from the built up seaside resorts.

name: Cabinas Villa del Sol
description: Nice rooms for rent with kitchenettes. We paid $30/night. Initially asked to camp in their parking lot, as it is very spacious and has electrical hookups. Owner was friendly and seemed open to it, but there were no bathrooms other than the ones in the rooms. We opted to rent a room, but if you don't need toilet access, try your hand here. Great family-run location. Walking distance to all you could want in Tamarindo.

name: Playa Islita
description: Very beautiful bay.  Small waves, good for swimming not great for surfing.  Garbage cans.  Feels safe with the fancy hotel Islita nearby.  You can use the restaurant there.   Police came to check on us last night, and they were fine with us staying the night.   (note: every night we have wild camped, a cop has checked on us, but always let us camp.  Mostly just for security)   You probably can only camp here for 1-2 nights, after that the police would ask you to leave I'm pretty sure.

name: Casa Camping Avellanas
description: 7.000 colones for two people. Camping right by beach with electricity (extension cord), questionable bathrooms, decent showers, sink. All pretty primitive, but the beach is gorgeous and has good surf. No internet.

name: Playa Grande
description: Public Access, nice sandy beach, room for Campers.

name: Walmart Turn Around
description: Turn around lot at end of road. Free. Confusing intersection on Walmart road, one road dead ends at a small lot big enough for a small rig to park and still allow plenty of room for people turning around. Not secure, pretty exposed, and a decent amount of traffic. Good for a free spot close to the airport for a break of dawn pick up. I felt more comfortable here than the Walmart sign for noise/traffic.

name: Gasolinera
description: Truck stop gas station. My GPS is a little off because I forgot to check in while I was there and checked in maybe five minutes up the road towards Nicaragua. Friendly, safe place to stay. Free shower, truck stop grungy but a shower nonetheless.

name: Wayside Picnic Area
description: On the side of the road by the bay. 2 picnic tables. Enough room for a few vehicles. Can be a bit muddy but enough gravel that you won't get stuck. Good for car camping. Restaurant across the street

name: Hostel Sabana
description: $10 to camp in secure parking. Access to a bathroom until 11pm. Access to kitchen all night. Water hook up available. The rooms are pretty cheap too, but they were full. Only one spot available to park in a tall vehicle, if you're under 2.3 meters or so you can park under a ceiling. Great option sort of near the airport.

name: Cabinas El Barco
description: Corky little cabinas with an old boat turned into a little restaurant. They rent rooms which look quite nice but we asked to park and camp and were charged $10 per night for 2 ppl. Good grassy campspot with pool, kitchen, bbq, Internet, bathroom and shower! You can free camp on the beach here but it was nice to have some amenities for a change!

name: Puente Coyote Not Playa Coyote
description: Local beach something for everyone swilling surfing nice beach park with shade we asked the locals they said fine we stayed 3 nights few day visitors busy on weekend we found some shade near the beach did not take there best parks left it for them we were going to drive thru to Santa Teresa but were warned that the road deteriorates from here so we returned via Jicaral realised that the little arty shop sells banos for $1 a day

name: Salon Los Cocos
description: On the esplanade within 50 metre of the high tide surfing here at Dominical clean facilities relatively quiet Feliciano is the manager we stayed 3 nights at 7000 c with electricity 5000 for 2 of us and our medium camper good value

name: TripOn Open House Hostel
description:
Jamaican owned, really clean, organised and well run. Breakfast is included and is a huge buffet- different types of cereal, eggs, pancakes, fruit, coffee and toast. We had safe parking in the garage, and the location is good and central, close to many shops. Dorms are 13USD and up for private rooms- the best room is 40USD and has a king sized bed and en suit bathroom with jacuzzi. Owner is super friendly and accommodating. Internet is very fast. Highly recommended

THEY HAVE TWO LOCATIONS - THIS LOCATION IS THE OLD ONE. NO GARAGE.

name: Cascata del Bosco
description: THis is the kind of place everyone is searching for: When we asked for a place to pop the top for a night, George (he's the friendly guy running this place) told us that he likes people who are travelling like us. When i asked how much it is, he said: just drink a beer or two at the bar and maybe have some food. So we did. We had delicious Nachos and cold beer at the beautiful giant patio. He offers Wifi and bathrooms (without showers) in the bar. The property is covered with small trails that lead through the jungle. We saw a toucan and sometimes you can even see up to Volcan Baru in Panama. We really liked it here!

name: Playa Ventanas
description: 1500 colones For a tent or 3000 colones for an rv. This prices are for one day.

name: Arenal Backpackers Resort
description: The hostel is $15 USD per person (hostel dorm rate)- pricey, but it includes a POOL, HOT showers, clean bathrooms, fast wifi, electricity (need an extension), outdoor kitchen/dining area with sink (but no stove), a restaurant on site, short walk to groceries. There are  private rooms if you want them.

name: Police Station
description: In front of police station there is place to park and they welcome campers. No facilities but it is safe, quiet and free.

name: stone mountain outdoors
description: very nice shop has caming gear, dry bags, hammocks, fishing gear. fair prices

name: Place with a blue VW campervan next to road
description: Hostel with large parking, level and with plenty of shade. High vehicles (more than 3m may find trouble because of hanging electricity cords. Location approximate, from memory, opposite the only roadside super market. 15USD with internet, decent toilet and poor kitchen. They claimed to have drinking water, but we did not use it.

name: Casa Bohemia
description: Nice camping but expensive for us so we did not stay. 5000 colones per person per night. Includes electricity and swimming pool. Average Internet

name: La Colina
description:
Looking through the fence, it looks like nice spot to camp, IF its open.
  
Clean bathrooms & showers but if the cabin is empty you can use that one. We just stopped to eat as our vw cooled down. They said they have always campers here. They ask 6000c per vehicle. Nice view of the Pacific Ocean and some trails to walk. Cool temperature compared to Nicoya Peninsula. Very nice couple owns the place. 

Better to call Fernando before to come: +506 8629 9899

name: EXIT Nicaragua - Penas Blancas, Nicaragua/Costa Rica border
description:
As of 24 FEB 2018

EXIT Nicaragua.

1. Park in the lot just pass the main building. 
2. Walk around the building and enter the back door for Aduana. 
Pay $1.00 for some useless ticket to get in line. 
Pay $3.00 for your exit stamp. 
Walk out the exit which puts you back into the parking lot 
3. Find the inspector and have your vehicle inspected. 
4. Find the policeman in the back corner of the lot and get your inspection stamped. 
5. Walk around to the back of the building again and go to Customs. Get your final Stamp 
Keep you papers handy as you drive away towards Costa Rica an inspector will take your customs form.

name: Suenos del Bosque lodge
description: Great camping along the river with your own ranchita that has electricity, running water and table. Fire pit and good bathrooms. Fishing in river right out your camper. Restaurant and bar available up the hill at the lodge. Super friendly lodge employees came to greet us and welcome us. Walking distance to hotel and spa down the road. Amazing restaurant serving the freshest trout at Cafe Kahawa about a half mile up the road. Down the road is a beautiful hike to a waterfall.

name: La Fortuna Waterfall/Tourist Information
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: No overnight camping allowed, please respect the wishes of the locals.  Guards no longer allow you to stay overnight.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/La_Fortuna_Waterfall,_Costa_Rica

name: Bosques De Fraijanes
description: Space to camp in vehicles and a small forested area with tables, electricity, water and sinks. Ok bathrooms and cold showers (and cold weather). Restaurant. Space for kids to play. 5000 colones per person. We also spent one night at the gates to the NP Volcan Poas. And there is also another place across the road called Laguna Fraijanes where I think it might be possible to camp too.

name: Walmart
description: Walmart store near San Jose, there is a gas station down the way too.

name: Finca Las Pumas!!!
description: We found this great place near Cañas to stay with everything we Overlanders need...very friendly Swiss owner (Speaks Spanish, English and German) wo helps in all situations...definetly a place to be and they also have rooms (incl breakfast) available and a good restaurant(if eat at restaurant no fee for camping, otherwise 10USD for a car and 2 people)...they also offer river rafting adventures and just 300m behind the restaurabt is a zoo (highly recommend!) (price 12USD pp) with Pumas, Jaguars and many others...

name: Cafe Bohio!!!
description: GREAT PLACE to drink really good coffee in all kinds of variations...forget Starbucks, this is the place to be...and the people here are very friendly!!!

name: Casa Paraiso
description: Very nice place to stay in samara!!! Sooo friendly italian owners, they have a very good italian-veggie-restaurant and also rooms aviable! We could enter thru the gate with our vw-bus (2.50m), but not bigger, you have a night guard as well by the way. Every thusday's evening they open the bar (But don't worry it wasn't loud at all!) and for a less price you can drink and have some "aperitivo"!😉They working now to prepare a place to camp with the tent! And my advise is check out here first before you go to the "camping el coco", we saw that place and the price it's really not worth it!!!

name: Free Parking Lot On Playa Panamá
description: Free parking lot in front of the beach. No services, quiet, between 2 hotels with security. Nice beach. Can use hotel wifi (Password removed by moderator.]). At night people coming and going all the time /// parking gratis frente a la playa Panamá. Sin servicios, entre dos hoteles que tienen seguridad. Linda playa y puedes pedir wifi a los hoteles.

name: Playa flamingo
description: You can park in the Main street just in front of the beach. Beatiful beach, super relax and quiet. No services and really safe. estacionamos sobre la calle principal justo frente a la playa. Súper linda, tranquila, segura y relajarte! Sin servicios.

name: Moya's Place
description: My partner and I rarely eat out as we are budget traveling. This was a treat for us and Moya’s place was definitely worth it! For a pesto vegetarian pizza that filled us both (8 slices) cost us 6000 colones after tip. The ambiance is great and they had a large book exchange where we were able to swap a few books! Highly recommended.

name: Cabinas Ostional
description: 6,000c per person for room with private bath and fans, including a fridge with freezer, good wifi, and parking in their courtyard. Very relaxed folks that let us cook in the courtyard, wash dishes, etc. Recommended!

name: Hotel Las Tinajas
description: Budget hotel in Nicoya. Courtyard parking area, okay wifi, private bathroom. Located around the corner from the Super Compro grocery.

name: Bowies Point Restaurant
description: We were directed to this place by a local. The owners name is Roger and he let us camp for free right on the beach in front of his restaurant. The restaurant has great food, laid back vibes around here. A few people put surfing, though the waves were too big for us. Bathrooms in restaurant / he offered us the outdoor shower on property.

name: Public Parking
description:
A user reported on 22 May 2019: Last night we had a robbery attempt in the middle of the night. At 1 am a suspect cyclists stopped by our motorhome and made a phone call. Five minutes later a car with 2 other suspects stopped by the other side of our RV. I jumped into the wheel, started the RV and left the place very fast. The 3 suspects kept staring at me but did not follow. 
---
A local told us it's free to camp here , many people do. During the days it is used for busses but at night it's free for anyone to stay. Wifi password from hotel across the road is : 
 [passwords are not allowed unless explicitly permited by the owner]
. Would not recommend on a Saturday night , people hanging out making noise.

name: Public Parking close to the airport
description:
Public parking next to Mc Donalds and in front of Hotel Aloft. 
Few minutes after we parked there the two security gards from Mc Donalds came saying that it was not possible to overnight there. After talking to them for five minutes they saw that we were not here to smoke weeds and make problems and asked us to move a bit our westy so they were able to keep an eye on us during the night!
Entrance might be to speep for long vehicules.
Toilets and wifi available at Mc Donalds (24/7) and Aloft Hotel.

name: Healthy Day Hotel
description: Good place for a moderate price (15k colones per night for a couple) with spacious rooms, balcony overlooking the large pool, decent wifi, flatscreen TV, private bath.

name: River Crossing
description:
Fun knee-deep and really wide river crossing if you want to take the backroad from Arenal to Monteverde. Beautiful drive after the river crossing as well! Must do.
____
We were travelling east and decided not to ford here. There are three river branches here, the first two were easy and below the knee. The third however had a washed out bank on the exit with large boulders and it did not seem like we could get out. Travelling with 4x4 but children and at dusk, it seemed unwise. There was also a cross in the middle of the river which seemed quite foreboding. About halfway across the river was over my knees (I am 6'2") and moving very fast after heavy rains.

name: Green Mountain Hotel
description: Nice place up on the hill overlooking town--18k colones for a room with two beds, private bathroom, microwave, coffee micro, mini fridge, TV. Good price for Costa Rica. Steep access and windy roads--big rigs may not want to try--with ample parking.

name: Beach Camp
description: Possible beach camp, off main road 50 mins outside of Puerto Jimenez, side road, left turn, shade from trees, house next door, small rigs only, did not camp here but it is a beautiful location.

name: Cascade Verde Hostel
description: Great tree house hostel 2 km inland from the town of Uvita. The hostel has dorms, doubles and privates with bathroom. They have an amazing kitchen and very cool open style common areas. Clean bathrooms, hot showers, fast wifi. Very relaxed atmosphere. Run by a german couple. They allowed us to stay in our vehicle with roof top tent in a pull out from the main driveway. 8000 cols for 3 persons. It is a small space and there is only room for one vehicle, small rigs only. There are some rules but it makes for a pleasant and clean environment. We totally enjoyed our stay. Family friendly. Close to Cascada verde waterfall with great swimming holes. May want to call ahead or email in advance.

name: Doña Ana
description: Beautiful little Restaurant/cabaña/camping area less than 1km from the entrance. No hookups or internet but cheap, $4 and could use the patio area with benches and a swing to relax. Covered place for my bike and plenty of space. Great find. The food in the restaurant was cheap and basic but really good.

name: Posada Don Juan
description: $20 ($10 per person) for a simple room with private bath, with access to an outdoor communal kitchen, no WiFi. Parking isn't secure, but is within the property and along a well lit area, felt secure. Nice hike along the creek to a small waterfall in the jungle. Short walk into the pueblo.

name: Bar Iguana Iguana y Cabinas
description: Bar Iguana Iguana also has cheap rooms available, just 8k colones for a couple in a simple room with fan and private bath (cheapest we saw in all of Costa Rica!). Secure parking, wifi, bar is located on site but couldn't really hear the music in the room. 10k colones for a room with TV, and other more expensive options. Let us cook in the parking lot as well.

name: Beach packers Hostel And Camping
description: Basic hostel, can camp in parking lot near beach, secure, wifi, kitchen, clean bathrooms, excellent helpful hosts, will change names soon to Beachbums, plans for renovations and improvements, 8000 to camp

name: Americar Delphi
description: Highly recommended mechanic with many credituals; speaks English; reasonable prices for Costa Rica; find Americar inside the property of the Centro de Servicio/ SUSA/servicios Unidos center, right off route 2 in the suburb of Curridabat; David Ortiz- mobile 88650103; best to call ahead so he knows to expect you; has wifi on site, takes visa/MasterCard

name: Playa Hermosa Beach
description: Most of the beach here has hotels or private residences, or is completely exposed. This spot is somewhat private and is set in a nice little grove of trees and coconut palms. Saw no one at night, and only a few surfers during the day. Very quiet. From what I can tell it looks like people occasionally use it for camping (there's a makeshift driftwood fire ring). Dirt road in, but no 4wd required.

name: Mareas International Homeschool Samara
description: International school based in Samara that accepts visiting students. Ages: 2-18 years; spanish/english school. Contact: Katie: www.mareashomeschoolsamara.com.   Excellent school, our daughter loved going to school here, professional staff and excellent teachers, highly recommended.

name: Samara- Luv Burger
description: Vegan and vegetarian restaurant, excellent food, great burgers, good smoothies, shady location, reasonable prices for Costa Rica

name: Almendor Lodge
description: A bit run down but they have 3-4 Cabanas with van vor 40$per night. There are also rooms with AC but we have not checked them. The Cabanas are next to the very nice pool. And walking distance to Playa Negra and its good restaurante. You can park on site but nothing for big rigs.

name: Cabanas Los Tucanes
description: Very clean , new rooms. Very frindly people. Double room with coffee and tee. The small room is 40$ the big room 50$, they make breakfast too. Nice view on the lake and vulcano. Next door is a snake zoo, and a few restaurants. Parking no problem. ( there is bit nicer place about 500 m further, called Essence Arenal, but they were full, cabanas, doorms and camping, really nice place)

name: Finca Pedro y el Lobo
description: Peter from Germay lives here for 20 years, her rents out rooms for 20$/person/per night. But you can also camp here with a van or two no problem. Peter has kayaks and knows the best rivers for kayaking. He also rides his KTM in the mud roads cross country and is a very nice host even if you only want to stay for the night. It is really a great place for a stop over or for a few days. But since he is not there all year around please contact him before you go there. Phone Number is 2761 1406

name: Super Maya
description: You can bring your 20lb bottle to the Super Maya in Cobano. They need one week to fill the bottle as a truck will bring it to the next big city. Paid about 9$.

name: Multi servicios Obaflet
description: Contact: Nata, great mechanic for electrical and multi- mechanical problems, good service, reasonable prices for Costa Rica, can get parts in from San Jose fairly quickly, no English spoken.

name: Playa Bandera Beach Front
description: It is a quiet area with tables underneath trees and palmtrees right at a empty beach. We stayed here on a sunday, so a few locals where here. An old women told us we should put everything away over night, cause people here like to steal things, we did that and still felt secure here. Showers and toilets are the little road along the beach 200m further north.

name: La Cristalina
description:
Filling station for built-in US and European propane tanks 
DO NOT FILL BOTTLES

name: Los Senderos De Colon
description: Parking lot of a mtb trail center, trails can also be used for trail running

name: Swiss Palmgarden
description:
We do apologize to all the Campers who made a bad Experience, due to the German Lady, who was at our Campground Caretaking, giving such a  bad Service, we are not used too. We are disapointed ourselfs. We allready changed her, hopefully for more caring people. We are still in Europe, because of Dr. Appoinments, and turn back at 26th of August. We do hope you get better Service now! 
We do have now Internet 10 high 3. The street get paved in July 2021 and then we also get fiber optic for great Internet.
All Bikers are wellcome too!

We can tell you now that we changed the size of our gate to 5 Meter heights. So campers with higher vans do have the chance also to pass by! You are very welcome!

Just after you turn away from the street at the fireworks, pass the Clinic of Parrita, then follow the board: " Playa Bandera" about 3 Km, until the last curve drive 200m further ahead, on the right hand side, there is a long yellow wall on the left hand side. On the right hand side, there is a red brown wooden gate, on the Gate there is a Board with red Switzerland on it, and this is Swiss Palmgarden, There is also a white dart with open wirtten, and a Blue black Camper sign. Ring the bell where there is the colourfull sticker. Incase nobody should answer, go 200 meter arround the corner there is a kiosk (Pulperia) ask for Mario. (Do not follow the NAVI! Sorry it is wrong!) Otherwise call us: +506 8421 6519
Price List:
- Camper over 7,5 Tons and + / cost $ 30.- first day, the following days each $ 25.-, Camper they want to stay for longer get better price.
- Camper under 7,5 Tons, with 2 people cost $ 25.- first day, the following days each $ 20.-.
Tents 2 people                    $15.- each further person each $ 5
Children till 12 years for free
Children 13 to 18 years      $ 5 each
Airconditioning:                   $ 6 per day extra
Washingmashine for 14 kg $ 5  1 hour til 1 1/2 to 2 hours
Washingpowder                  $ 1
Grill and Stove  Gas            $ 2 each day
Dogs                                    $ 1 each
Carwash                              $ 5
Swimmingpool and Kittchen area for free
Internet at Camp Internet and Pool Internet for free
Fruits and Coffee for free
If there are people they want to stay longer than 7  days, they can talk with us and we can make a different arrangement, according the price, we can make a flat rate for you.

When you want to rent a room, it normally costs $ 35.- one person, in the house, with private bath and dressing room, There is a cooking place and a grill, and a shower too.

The Bungalow costs $130 at high Season, and at low Season $ 90.-
During the raining time it is possible that rooms are available, at high season they are often occupied. please call us before.

You will find pictures if you google Swiss Palmgarden. We would love to serve you: Jörg & INKA Moser. +506 8421 6519.

Ein 5000 qm2  großes, sauberes, ebenerdiges, gepflegtes Gelände erwartet Euch. Der Platz ist  Moskito-frei. Geeignet für alle Arten von Campern. Geschützt sicher, eingezäunt.
Viele tropische Pflanzen und eine große Wiese laden ein zum spielen.  Angenehmes runtergekühltes Schwimmbad vorhanden. Eine außen Dusche, Grill mit Küche in der Pool Area. Waschmaschine wird vom Haus aus bedient. Das WC, Urinal und die Dusche, mit Abwaschtrog befindet sich im neuen gelben Häuslein. Es gibt da fliessend kalt und heiss Wasser, auch zum Abwaschen, Es gibt auch einen Aussendusche, Steckdosen für Stromentnahme, und einen Wasserhahn zum Tank auffüllen.
Es werden auch Zimmer und ein Bungalow vermietet. Zimmer in der Hochsaison für $ 35.- pro Person,  und der Bungalow in der Hochsaison $130.- vermietet (hat Platz für 4 Leute).   Hier hat es eine Menge Saisonale Fruchtbäume auf dem Gelände, von den Früchten und Kokosnüssen darf jeder gerne was essen.  Wir sind gerne behilflich wo wir können. Eine Moderne Klinik ist gleich in der Nähe,  Tierarzt ist auch erreichbar.
Es ist hier einen sauberer, sicherer und schönen Platz welcher innerhalb von 3 sehr schönen Parks liegt, und vielen anderen Abenteuer Möglichkeiten. Wir haben für unsere Gäste auch günstige Ausflugs Angebote. Bitte fragt uns danach bei Interesse.
Wir freuen uns auf Euch.

Jörg und Inka Moser
00506 8421 6519

name: Sunset Hostel
description: 16$/dormitory, clean, great ac, small dorm rooms, 6-8 beds max in each, good lockers, young cute Spanish owner she was very easy going and helpful, supermarket right downstairs, blazing Internet, 2 min walk into town, clean kitchen and bathrooms

name: 4you Hostal
description: Beautiful brand new Hostal, 18usd$/night in dormitory. Private rooms available, large double kitchen with new appliances and cookware, big bathroom with many toilets and showers, exceptionally clean, outdoor showers as well. Very fast wifi. 10min walk to beach with the nicest waves I've seen in Costa Rica. Surfboards and beach cruiser bicycles available. Marco was an excellent host, extremely helpful and jovial, he let me park my motorcycle in his front yard. Warning to the budget traveler: Nosara is VERY expensive, be prepared to pay over American prices when eating out and getting groceries.

name: Kaya's Place
description: Very nice place just north of Puerto Viejo but easy walking distance into town. 10$/night for a shared room with 4 beds 2 fans and shared bathrooms (had the room to myself). Private rooms available. Fast internet. CRAFT BEER FROM VERMONT BREWER (at a decent price)!!! Good coffee, restaurant, and brewery. Other cheap options for food in town. Friendly staff that speaks English, Spanish, and Patois. Stunning black sand beach out the front door. Secure parking for motorcycles and cars.  Very quiet at night.

name: Al Cerro - Parking Lot
description: The plan was to hike to the top of Chirripo. As we did not get a permission (you have to make reservation beforehand) we still stayed here to do some hikes. Stayed 2 nights at this parking lot for free. The lady of the restaurant was very nice and the food in the restaurant is cheap (for CR) and nice. Behind the restaurant you can go down to the lake and have a nice swim. We also were allowed to use the bathroom facilities. The road is really bad but you can make it.

name: Beach
description: Just a nice spot on the beach to camp. Crashing surf drowns out the nearby road. Dark, hot sand. Lots of firewood. Pure Vida!

name: Beach Perfection at Manzanillo
description: Punta Uva. Too many good spots to mention. Great chilled out vibe. Gorgeous beach. I may never leave...

name: Marbella Beach
description: Nice place for camping under palm trees. Very good surf spot. Massive waves. Restaurant/Bar just 300 m away, where you can fill up water containers. There is internet there as well.

name: Bolita
description: I was hesitant to add this place because it really isn't overlander friendly.  But we loved it there and just want to tell everyone about it.  This basic, open concept hostel is located a 30 minute hike from the nearest village. It's on 61 acres and has free hiking trails for guests and a few waterfalls with swimming holes under them.  Vehicles can be left parked outside their office in town on the side of the road. We felt safe doing so because it is such a small and remote community.  There's spring water for drinking but you need to bring your own food up to cook. Since it's such a unusual place I recommend checking out their website for more info www.Bolita.org. Make sure you have good directions to their office, do not trust Google Maps. dorms $12, cabinitas $35 for two people

name: Dry River
description: Assuming it's dry- a nice spot. Lagoon separates you from beach.

name: Dry River 2
description: Up from coast. Dry river bed. Good spot.

name: Under The Parrots
description: Grea camping under several massive parrots. Divine! Shade on otherwise hot as hell black sand.

name: Puerto Viejo center
description:
If you are looking for a free place in the center of Puerto Viejo, looks like a good spot.
At the beach. Our water tank we could fill at the police station, maybe they have toilets too.
The place still is good for camping, but there’s no police station anymore. The building was put down. No services at all. Restaurants nearby.

name: Playa Pitahaya
description:
Places like this is why Costa Rica is so great. We parked under some trees just where the road runs into the beach. There's a table and chairs there and a few other shady parking spaces to the north and the south along the beach. We spoke with a local when we arrived and he said it'd be safe and offered us water if we needed any. Only three houses on the beach they all looked unoccupied while we were there. In 24 hours we only saw 6 people, paradise. There was a knocked over sign warning of rips so be cautious while swimming. Good fishing and nice water to swim in regardless. 
- DO NOT CAMP ON TOP OF THE HILL OVERLOOKING THE TWO BEACHES. ITS BEAUTIFUL BUT PRONE TO LIGHTNING STRIKES.

name: Essence Arenal Boutique Hostel
description: The hostel is set on a small Finca with a marvellous view of volcano Arenal and Lago Arenal below. Only for small units. You park in parking lot for the dorm rates of $7 a person. Very clean bathrooms and hot showers. Wifi is good. Very friendly staff. English spoken. Tent campers have a secluded spot that is 10 minutes from the main building by foot. driving to the campsite is on your own risk, you need a strong four wheel drive and experience because of the steep roads. the volcano as well and a private natural pool.

name: Yoko Termales
description: free parking lot of a thermal place, 10 $ /pers/day to access to the 4 thermals pools, big grassfield to chill the day, a restaurant if you want.

name: parking lot front beach
description: free parking just in front of the beach, and in front the police office. benches and lights, little playground for kids and trash bins  ; -) there are plenty of restaurants near the place but it s quiet, only waves music.

name: huge hardware store EPA (ferreteria)
description:
Open every day from 7am - 9pm. 
Big yellow building next to the highway

name: Monteverde coffee center
description: car park in front of the cafe and small grocery store is public parking. Quiet and toilets available, nice grassy area and safe at night. Wifi available from the cafe

name: Super Servicio
description: Good, though expensive, mechanic in Liberia. One of the managers speaks very good English and his mechanics seem to be very good. We had to order parts for our F250, which only took them 1 day. We were allowed to stay in our camper on the site of the garage. There's a guard at night and we even had electricity. Next morning they offered us to take a shower in their apartment, which is next to the office of the garage. Coffee and water is free and toilets are clean. Pricey but professional!

name: Flamingo Beach - Playa Flamingo
description:
Its a very quiet and safe place, no worries at night, few visitors at beach, no water, wifi, or electricity. Banks, supermarkets, ATM, restaurants, stores and hotels close. You can camp with tents or RVs next to beach and on the roadside. 
Un lugar tranquilo sin preocupaciones durante la noche, pocas personas en la playa, no hay wifi, agua o electricidad. Hay restaurantes, tiendas, bancos, hoteles y supermercados cerca, se puede acampar con tiendas o con campers a la orilla de la carretera y a la par de la playa

name: el chontal
description: cabinas and camping:beautiful place with a big garden on the golfo dulce, camping area in shadow near the water, common area very chill. price: 7$ p. pers. If you want electricity, it is 10¥ pp.

name: ZGas (Fill bottles, not tanks)
description: One of the few places to fill propane tanks that we have found in the area. Can fill US portable 20lbs tanks. Can not fill fixed tanks.

name: Riverside Camping La Virgin
description: Quite spot next to the river just across and next to the bridge (on the eastern bank). Rocky but possible to get level, quite a few rafting companies use the area during the day but very quiet at night. Police stopped by in the evening and again drove past at night, felt very safe. Toucans in the area.

name: Gas Station TOTAL
description: Overnight place between San José and Puerto Limon. We could park in a parking lot and use the toilet of the gas station. Nearby there is a Taco Bell and an ATM. WiFi

name: TamaHostel & Glamping
description: Hi, perfect place to camp only with roof-top van in the parking, they don't acept tend, the place is newly renoved with hostel and glamping and pool, good vibe, super equipped kitchen, confprtable rancho with amok and very clean bathroom, price is 10-15$ por person, very cloose to center and beach

name: Solis Motors
description: VW shop specializing in aircooled motors. stop by with any vw and they will either be able to help you or point you in the right direction for parts stores or other shops. They have a Facebook page.

name: Playa Linda
description: This gps location is for the road leading to Playa Linda. Look for the two cellphone/radio towers for the turn off. Park anywhere on the beach. Don't leave vehicle unattended-there were two rental vehicle break-ins while we were there in one day. Cops drove by a few times and were looking into it. Felt safe even with the petty theft. Watch out for the hordes of crabs if sleeping in a tent. Bautiful beach with lots of coconuts to be had.

name: Dry River (at least now)
description: Dry river. Lots of shade. Good campsite.

name: Isthmus Extraordinaire!
description:
great camping spot but not much shade. busy but nice bay, stunning sunset, ok for snorkeling. short walk to isthmus. expensive grocery store up the road. fishermen throughout the night

-locals said camping is allowed on he beach. Absolutely breathtaking beach. 
* paid toilets and showers during the day*

name: Big & cheap Pizza - Solo Bueno
description:
Well.. tomate sauce was too sweet but pizza was ok. Definitely price is the best. Family restaurant with loud tv sound. Is ok. I'm argentinian so know about good pizzeria.

la pizza tenía la salsa de tomate muy dulce pero la pizza es rica. Esta bien no esperen gran cosa. Lo que si el precio si es muy barato. pueden llevar bebidas especialmente cerveza ya que no venden

name: Playa Ocotal Carrilo
description:
On a parking lot 2 steps from the beach semi private estate behind the Picante restaurant, free of charge, no wifi, we were allowed to use the toilet and shower from the restaurant, beach shower. You have to pass 2 controls where you are just asked your name. Beware of the big DC road is narrow. 

Sur un parking à 2 pas de la plage lotissement semi privé derrière le restaurant Picante, gratuit, pas de wifi, nous avons eu l'autorisation d'utiliser les WC et douche du restaurant, douche de plage. Il faut passer 2 contrôles où on vous demande juste votre nom. Attention au gros CC la route est étroite.

name: Beach Near River
description: Loads of camping spots. Just a beach. Near a river.

name: El Caiman
description: they offer camping at this location for 3000 colones on the river, no electricidad but beautiful area as well as cabins available 12km further down the road.

name: Hostel Rio Danta
description: Hostel where they allowed us to stay and use toilet, hot shower, kitchen and wifi. Very friendly owners, who really took care about us. So we used the laundry service of the hostel and they gave us a key to get into the hostel at night. We payed 4$ per night/camper.

name: Public Beach Playa Hermosa
description: Good place to hang a couple of days. Just between the road and the beach, 10 meter away from high tide under several trees with good shade. No services, just a couple of stand selling coconuts or souvenirs... and several surfers around. You can see Ballena Marine Reserve from here or even walk the beach for a couple of hours to visit it avoiding the entry fee. Feel safe with beach watchers during the day and the police was patroling every hour during the night. FREE

name: Public Beach
description: Free camping right on the beach, frequent police patrols at night and during the day. Can use shower and toilets from the campground on the other side of the road for 300 colones. Beautiful beach and some shade for your camper.

name: Parque Recreativo Los Manantiales
description: Large recreation area with pools, trails and other activities. Nice. Good cold showers and restrooms. Water, picnic tables and power at site. Weekend extremely busy. They would like call or email ahead. 2458-4535 or info.losmanantiales@gmail.com. We had no reservation and it was ok. Closed on Mondays

name: Parking Lot "La Pavona"
description: Parking lot where the boat leaves to the "Tortuguero National Park", $10/night, watchman, we didn't sleep there because we didn't know if its possible but we ask the guard, driving from Guápiles to "La Pavona" takes you around 1h 30min

name: Reserva Biologica Lomas Bardudal
description:
Park entrance. Rangers were agree for we
 park here overnight. They sleep in a house here. It was the first time a RV comes here ! :-) ( edit : toilet, shower, water, electricity) Only big and quiet place for sleeping with a lot of monkeys all around.  Super easy dirt road for 15 min. Don't miss this little road, between Liberia and Bagaces, just near Pijije (there isn't any sign). After few kms, at the cross, take left.
This area is only for people who like lost land in the world.

Entree du parc. Les rangers sont ok pour qu'on y dorme. C'était la première fois qu'un camping car venait jusqu'ici. Il y a un wifi sécurisé mais nous n'avons pas demandé le code.
