description: Flat space without trees. Always free. No service. Pick up our garbage. Quiet at night despite the proximity of the road 2. Restaurant 300 m. Facing the entrance of the park with toilet and sink available even if restaurant closed during our visit

name: Turnout beside highway
description: Ample parking off highway with views for days! A bit of garbage. Cool breezes, could have a fire.

name: Sleeping House
description:
$10 per person for private room with two beds and breakfast. Or $25 for one big bed and breakfast. No on suite washroom. 
Breakfast includes 4 different type of fruit, cereal, milk, bread, jam, coffee and tea. Also has a kitchen that is available. 
The owners are super friendly. And they offer a discount for canopy tours with 100% Aventura.

name: Camp among the coconut trees
description: Beautiful hidden spot right on the beach. Come here after dark...quiet...beach to myself. Windy so no mosquitoes. great sunset although no houses around just high walls

name: La Moto Ag
description: Amazing shop run by John Berry. if you need anything for your motorcycle this is the place to come. Parts, service or just to talk to John. Great owner goes out of his way to help you.  Very fair on prices. Can't recommend enough. Any bike make or model.

name: Road side
description: Little parking lot beside the road. The road is very quite between 8pm and 5:30am. Not an awesome place but good to be early in the Rincon de la Vieja NP.

name: Piedras Blancas National Park
description: great place!!! Trails, rivers, wildlife. Only 4x4 on dry season!

name: Hotel Tres Banderas/Restaurant White Eagle
description: Nice place with delicious Polish cousine. A hotel with big AC rooms, swimming pool and a bar. Very clean and prepared for tourists. Kitchen near the bar. Great atmosphere and Polish drinks🙂 When you want to eat something good and tasty from Poland you need to try it. Bigos and pierogs. We paid 80$ per room but was the biggest one for 3 (included big breakfast).

name: Casa Chino
description: We were looking for a place to fill up some water and we stumbled into this guys house. We parked our van and trailer in the front drive/yard. Andres Sam runs the place. We were able to do laundry. There is a shower and a communal kitchen. 50 amp hook up. 5 min walk to the main surf spot. This house is one house closer to the beach from Caza olas. The guys here are really chill. They do coffee every morning. Camping is ok and they also have private rooms with private bathrooms.

name: LIWI CABINAS
description: Great place with clean rooms. AC, hot water, wi-fi, fan, TV. Closed parking for moto or car. Safe and quiet, near is policy. Small bufet inside, parter or 1st floor, big rooms. For double we paid about 20000 colones. Ask for little discount;)

name: Parador Turistico San Buenaventura
description: Huge (large) campground grass field. Easy acces for all rigs. Some shady trees. Near the lake. Very quiet. Only nature sounds. Only 2000 CRC per person per night.

name: Don Pancho Camping
description:
Everything was full so we asked at Orosi Lodge for a parking possibility. They sent us to Don Pancho in the rosa House next to their Hotel. Its quite a steep gravel path. Upthere its level with a nice view to smoking vulcano Turrialpa. Don Pancho is superlovely. He offers horseriding! The 'camping' is very basic but quite!! We could use the facilities of Orosi Lodge as toilets and wifi.
Don Panchos toilet is superbasic but as a hardcore overlander you are used to!! ;-)
He also offers a level area with fireplace to pitch a tent.
We loved that place. It's free for a propina. (We gave him 3000Col/night as he gave us some fruits...).

name: Pinapple organic farm tour
description:
Follow the sign at the mainroad!
Interesting and informative  pinapple tour.
1 hour / 30US$ pP with a delicate pinapple buffet after the tour. Ask for a discount! 
Probably you could ask for camping, we did not as we have been here in the morning.
Clean restrooms and showers. Very friendly.

name: Rancho turistico mirador
description: Excellent little place in the mountains. Definitely a hidden diamond. Food drinks and tours. a bit steep road. made it here with two motorcycles.  If you want to see one of if no the best view in all of Costa Rica come here. Very friendly

name: Hotel flor Blanca
description: Nice private accommodations. wifi, hot showers and breakfast included. Comfortable beds. we stayed in a room with three beds for 55 us. Had some trouble with are motorcycle and the owner spent some time calling people to help us out. Small parking spaces in front of hotel with a security guard all night.

name: Gasolinera Rio Tempisque
description:
Mini super, toilets, caferestaurant, wifi, plenty of place on the back for camping. We ask in the minisuper if we could stay and they opened the staf toilet for us.
Quiet and secure. Opened 24h

name: Gugas
description: A bar and restaurant in the centre of Punt Arenas with six or so units at the back. Not cheap at $50 but good if you need to catch the early ferry. Simple clean rooms but no wifi in the rooms - only available in the ajoining restaurant. Large secure carpark with a guard for your car or bikes.

name: Gugas Bar / restaurant
description: If you are hankering for German food this is the place! Pius has lived here for 28 years and does huge schnitzels and beer the Bavarian way. His home made bread is fantastic too!

name: Front of Carlos House
description:
Carlos clean the beach in front of his house and you can park there for free under the coconut tree. It's very quite, safe and beautiful.
If you need, Carlos rent bathroom and shower. I'll probably also offered you to cook a entire fish. He did it for us, for 6$.
Nice place.

name: Community center parking lot
description: We asked the police where to safe camp for a night, they showed us this place located in front of the church. Was quiet enough at night and we felt safe. Free.

name: Gas Villareal
description: Quick and easy place to exchange US-bought bottle (7500 colones for 26 Lb). truck comes to fill several times a week, you can get bottle filled if you are there on the right day!

name: Habitaciones Rosita
description:
A cheapest place we found in this town. 12000col for a room with double bed. Clean bathroom, towels provided, spacious room for all our motorcycle gear, air conditioner and fast wifi. 
Private parking for motorcycles.

name: Playa negra near 'the point' restaurant
description:
Nice flat area in front of the beach. The sand is soft in some places but avoidable. Was assured by 2 locals that it is okay to camp here.
A bit of garbage but I'll pick up what I can ... hopefully none for the next person! There is a bar/restaurant a couple hundred meters in either direction.

name: goyabo monumento
description: A few kilometers up from the monumento... Right at the intersection, a small part of the land where you can camp... The owner lives in the house just down the road. Nice people, farmer and his farm is right under here also

name: parqueo Barú Waterfall / Nauyaca waterfall
description: We camp on the small grass area which is supposed to be the parking for the access to baru waterfall. There is two access to the waterfall, one from each side. On this side there is no one... So we camp on the parking... Ask the neighbor for water

name: Playa azul
description: Road ends by a sort of roundabout and there is a pass going right. We camp right there under palm trees. Asked the house beside and there was no problem

name: Vitemca - auto glass
description: These guys can make any glass for your car, we paid 60,000 colones for our Toyota Tacoma side window and installation as the Toyota dealer wanted $300US. The window works well but the motor sounds like it works harder to put it up (might just be a bit thicker than a standard window). Great place if you need a quick cheap fix or can't find what you need elsewhere (usually take 5-8 days but we got ours done by the next day)

name: Playa San Miguel free
description:
Very nice and quiet place in the coconut palms 

Sehr schöner und ruhiger Platz in den Kokospalmen

name: Llantera/ Tire Repair Shop
description: We had a problem with a tire and found this place on the way to La Fortuna.The guy was super nice and honest. Our tire was irreparable but he found us a used tire that would get us to Panama. Good price and service, and super quick.

name: Propane refill fixed tanks
description: Is a gas station with propane service. they filled up our RV fixed tank.

name: Great value hotel (Aldea)
description: This is by far your cheapest option ($60 2pers. secure parking AND great breakfast!) in Punta Arenas. Located next to Beach Hotel Punta Arenas Beach. Super friendly staff too!

name: Gravel Pit
description: Good in a pinch. Some sort of gravel pit. (Can no longer stay at Purruja Lodge with their 24-7 roosters crowing. I'm glad I re-read my review- I had nearly forgot the two sleepless nights there!)

name: Rincon de la Vieja Mountain Lodge
description:
Camping $7 usd per person per night on a grassy area behind a building you can use if it pours rain. Running water in the building and good spot for cooking. Apparently potable water, but use your own judgement. Cold shower and toilets near reception. Restaurant with a choice of a few dishes. Nice hike to a sulphurous hot springs. (Hike included in price of camping.) Great trails. Don't get lost like the French tourists who just did it without lights or much common sense. It's gets dark in the jungle people, and the trails are poorly marked. Use gps, map, and bring a light.

Wi-Fi available at the Lodge but not at the campsite. Beware of bloodsucking gnats that seem impervious to bug spray. Windy/blustery conditions at night.

name: Bahia de la Peninsula, Tronadora
description: Campground with several flat parking spaces on peninsula into Arenal. Good swimming spot. Would be nicer without cemented-in tacky yellow tables and chairs which look like they're stolen from a cafeteria!

name: Field across from police station next to playgroud
description: A nice flat place to camp for the night. Very nice policemen on duty. Very safe. They offered water as well.

name: PHOTOCOPY SHOP !!!
description: This is a no-brainer... get your copies here for border crossings. Passport, vehicle TIP (temporary import permit), vehicle ownership, insurance docs. It's good to have several copies of all this to make border crossings smoother. Staff is nice and it's affordable. Don't wait until your in the border area... it's a gong show! (This place is directly across from the Gollo and the Tienda La Pampa)

name: Public shower
description: Useful for those of us who are on the road, stinky, salty, and dusty. Next to skateboard park.

name: Playa Mal Pais
description: Nice quiet place close to Santa Teresa. Very safe. Right in front of a beautiful beach. Clean flat space, no problem for the big rigs. We paid 2000C for two to use shower and bathroom to the private house next to the cemetery. They accept campers. We loved this place!

name: Playa Buenavista
description:
Quiet beach, few tables to sit at and bins for rubbish. Good place to set up for the night . 
Watch out for crocs in the estuary!

name: TJM Costa Rica
description:
Great products and service!
Open Mo-Fri, 9am-5pm

name: La Ventanita
description: Great little place that serves really good (and huge) burritos (and a couple of other things) for only 2000-2500 colones. And the juices are fantastic!

name: Kapazuri Hotel, Restaurant and Camping
description: Hotel restaurant and pool complex with camping facilities. $6US/₡3500col pp, lovely pool, good wifi, nice bathrooms, nice breezes, minimal noise except for some from highway nearby. Pool can be popular on weekends and holidays, but even then it'll empty out after 5ish and then you'll have the place to yourself. No power at campsites, but there are power points next to the tables by the pool. Uncertain if water is potable, but it has been at most places so far in Costa Rica so it may well be.

name: moto fast
description: motorcycle shop.  moto oil tons of parts and friendly people.

name: Gringo Petes 2
description: Gringo Petes 2 is Gringo Petes second and cheaper location that also has indoor motorcycle parking. $6us for a bunk in a dorm room with attached bathroom. They also have $8us bunks and private rooms. Cute little purple place in the sea of mega resorts.

name: Bahia de Santa Elena
description: Beautiful cove for camping and swimming. weekend after Santa semana so the locals were nor too happy to see us! Large trees w 3" thorns b careful. One lady does have some electricity hookup. some very soft sand w truck n camper so we opted to camp on grass . Free. Several Mikes if dirt road. Not good if pulling trailer.

name: The hammock hostel
description: Very nice, clean and cheap hostel. Breakfast is included. Nice stuff. You can book all of the adventures here. Walkable distance from bus station. I recommend it a lot.

name: Metal Del Coco
description: Metal shop specializing in welds, marine, stainless steel, forged steel, aluminum, and artisanal.

name: Servicentro JSM
description: Large multiservice station with gas pumps for filling fixed propane tanks (not sure about bottles).  Late hours and open 7 days a week.  Drive in and gas up.  Super easy.  Pay at station with card or cash.

name: Alburgue Montaña Verde
description: Awesome rustic hostel tucked up on a lush hillside. We booked via AirBnB which they say is the best for them. We paid $23 for two beds in a dorm room. If your in a pinch you can just show up but during the slow season sometimes they aren't here. Great spot to sleep with the sound of the babbling brook.

name: Cafe Mono Congo
description: Yummy coffee shop with good food including some vegan/healthier options. Great place to sit to do some work online while sipping a matcha latte. Good wireless connection. Wireless PW [passwords not allowed unless with explicit consent from the owner]

name: Playa Bejuco
description:
Many places under palm trees, right on the wide sandy beach 

viele Plätze unter Palmen, direkt am weiten Sandstrand

name: Cerro de la Muerte
description:
On a side street of the Panamericana, on the way to the Cerro de la Muerte 

an einer Seitenstraße der Panamericana, auf dem Weg zum Cerro de la Muerte

name: Finca Santa Maria
description: Soccer pitch/field behind the headquarters of Santa Maria Night Tours. This is part of a finca owned by Norman who let us camp for 2 nights for free as we did his night tour. He's not an 'established campground' per se, but listed as such as there is power, water, showers and toilets. He'd happily let other overlanders stay here, and maybe expect to pay 5 pp/pn. There really aren't any camp options in Santa Elena so we lucked out by asking Norman's help! Flat, quiet, cool campsite and right next to free walking trails into the cloud forest where we saw agoutis, opossums and a sloth!! About a mile to Santa Elena downtown. We walked in for groceries etc. but there are tiendas with limited stock closer by. Norman is super friendly and he also owns a Honda mechanic shop next door if you need any car/bike work done. We loved it here!

name: Santamaria's night walk CAMPING
description:
Great place for anything from tent to a big rig.
Well protected soccer field next to AWESOME walking trails & small farm.
Toilet, simple cold shower & agua potable. Power.
Talk to Normand at the night walk Santa Maria, he's really friendly.
Me & SumoGoesSouth were his first overlanders, I had an oil change at his brothers Honda shop  next door & they booked a night tour so they let us camp for free.
 He's building a kitchen, camping spots etc. so in the future it'll probably be  $5-$10 plus power etc. (update:$5pppn free if you do the nightwalk)

name: Mama Toucans Grocery
description: Cute, hippy grocery store. Has most of the essentials plus specialty items like vegan ice cream, nuts and seeds, good coffee, kombucha (although the place next door, mono congo, has great kombucha on tap), variety of cheeses, natural toothpaste, etc. A little pricey but some stuff is very hard to find on the road. The tumeric water "Te Namaste" is good stuff.  Owners are cool.

name: tapanti hotel restaurante y camping
description: ir's a hotel and restaurant with possibility for camping.good overnight place.we paid 10 dollar for a tent,and it's the same price for a van without electricity.The wifi is very fast at the restaurant,and the family who owns the place is very friendly....great place to stay and it's safe and quiet

name: Aguamatic Lavanderia
description: Cheapest we could find in San Jose area. 2800 per machine (3000 now for washing yourself)

name: Arenal River Tubing and Hiking
description: Plenty of green grass to pitch your tent, basic electricity, independent bathroom & shower facilities, parking area, killer views of the Arenal Volcano, Cerro Chato, and nature, as well as personal assistance with a smile! Located half way up the road to La Fortuna Waterfall, a great spot if you’re planning to visit the La Fortuna Waterfall or hike Cerro Chato. There’s also a local swimming hole just around the corner for swimming close by. Short drive to activities & hot springs.

name: hotel Real Victoria - fenced parking lot
description:
200m from Panama border crossing. parking lot next to road on front of hotel. early morning traffic but noise not too bad. 
our rig is 24 foot long no problems getting in and no height restriction at gate. the reason i have put big rig  friendly unknown is that we are 24 foot long so I don't know what they would say if you came here in a 35 foot rig but I can't see any physical reason for them to refuse.
they charged us 5000 colones for 2 people and the rig. 
access to bathroom and shower all night.
toilet and shower were clean and had tp.  shower cold only but it is so hot here that's perfect.
there is a pool but it was empty for repair when we were here. 
great stop overnight before crossing or after crossing.

name: Santa Rosa National Park
description: Convenient for tents and rigs, 4 usd, showers and toilets.

name: River Crossing
description: 40 cm deep when we crossed. We could see the underground. Going direction Manzanillo, you need to take the crossing 50 m upstream!

name: Camping Playa Pilas
description: Nice family run this camping area/farm meters from the beach. We camped under a tree with a light, electricity, and sink. Level - ish ground. Toilets and shower are rustic, but clean. The family was surprised to have us ask for camping during this season, and quickly tried to get things up to there busy season standards. They cleaned the sink, replaced light bulbs and cleaned the bathrooms. The younger guy is deaf, and also does not speak but is really friendly and enjoys playing tour guide. Took us to a natural swimming tide pool, and told us of a hike up the headland. $2000 colones per person per night. Dogs allowed!

name: San juanillo
description: Beautiful little town with supermarkets, restaurants and places to sleep. Go to tree tops bed and breakfast for Info, the owner speaks perfect English as she is from LA. She will tell you where to get food from cheap to expensive. If you can afford it she makes delicious 5 course meals at the bed and breakfast. beautiful beaches everywhere.

name: Melina's house
description: Sign outside her house says she sells fish and some other things. Go in the house and ask for Melina. Ask for a Plato Casado. It's rice beans fish and it comes with a salad and some platanos(banana). All for 3500 colones. Tons of food and sooooo good. She will ask you what time you want it at and you can go explore the beaches and come back whenever you asked for it. Highly highly recommend it. So good and cheap

name: River crossing
description: Around mid calf level water. May 8. Could get worse later in the rainy season.

name: El dorado
description: 25$ for a private room with two beds and a cot. The private room comes with a mini fridge and a private shower and bathroom. The hostel is super chill and everyone is nice. Only down side is no ac but apparently most hostels in Samara don't have ac

name: Rancho Curubande Lodge
description:
just 2 min. off the #1 and 10 min. outside of Liberia. can accommodate large trucks and tent camping. green and shaded space - a nice haven from the heat. no hook-ups but use of bathroom and showers. pet friendly- nice staff.
paid $10 for the night. gated and secure. very quiet. fast wifi in the lodge.
phone: (506) 2665 0375

name: Playa Pochote
description: We arrived after dark on our way to Santa Teresa. It is a nice beach/river mouth to spend one night for free. Calm bay in a small safe fishing village.

name: Playa Hermosa
description: We camped at the public beach access for two days. Gorgeous beach with lots of shade and good beginner surf. It is currently low season, so not sure what the police would say during a different time of the year.

name: Hidden from the road
description: Nice place by the road heading to Rincòn de la Vieja. It's quiet and you can hide a bit from the road. Not over charming but really recommended for a night or 2 to visit the park. It is not possible to sleep at the parking of the NP, and there are apparently cameras and control. But you can refill water at the Park entrance!

name: San Gabriel Medical Service
description: 24 hr medical service. This is the most affordable emergency service in town. We went to 2 others before this. They took a very deep urchin out of my foot. Cost of the visit is 20K colones. Highly recommend them.

name: Centro de Servicio Automotriz
description:
This is a very good mechanic shop. We had a problem with our breaks and they checked them and fixed them. Family owned, very honest. Jorge and Michael took care of our Ford van, and were super nice to us. 
Mon-Fri 8:30-5:30 / Sat 8:30-12:30

name: Canyon
description: Beautiful canyon with zip lining. I want to explore it later so we are dropping a pin.

name: Almara Salon
description: Good beauty salon. Did a great job on my blonde color and a great cut. Charged 18 colones for a haircut and 25 colones for color. Got us both in within 25 minutes of walking in without and appointment.

name: Boca Barranca Parking
description: Safe parking in front of the world class wave. you can spend the night for 5000 or park for the day for 1500. they have cabanas to rent too.

name: Pavones - best spot for surfers
description:
After crossing the bridge (or the river if the bridge has been taken away by the rain), you will find a bit further on the right a spot under trees and palm trees. People park here during the day as it is the best spot to enter the water and to ride Pavones. When I was there, at night, there was either nobody or a couple of tents.
For surfers: You're at the beginning of the point. To get into the water at high tide, walk a bit to the left of the beach to avoid the impact zone. At low tide, to avoid the rocks, walk all the way left, next to big rock into the water.
And the morning, you can be the first one to be in the water, as everybody has to walk or drive to come here.
This is a dream spot for me.
Enjoy!
Rafa & Dino

name: Laboratorio Mac
description: Our MacBookPro got wet and luckily we found this place! They are certified Apple engineers, repair and also sell used MacBooks. It's one of the rare shops who even repair motherboards! For us, they were very helpful and tried to find a payable and especially fast solution. In the end they changed our motherboard and the display for 450 USD within 30 minutes. Very, very lovely people, highly recommended! Contact: www.laboratoriomac.com

name: Paradise Restaurant
description: Restaurant and day parking on Playa Chiquita. There's a gravel parking lot next to a restaurant/bar where you can camp, toilets, cold shower and average wifi available. Calm spot, lovely beach, friendly people. They haven't had campers until now, so we made up a price with the owner, it was 30 USD for 4 persons/2 cars/2 days, but probably he would also accept that you eat at the restaurant and stay for less/free, we just had full fridges.

name: End of road.
description: Drive down a side road from the highway. It ends in an opening big enough to park and set up a tent or two. We aren't camping here but it looks crazy peaceful and isolated. It's in a huge grove of I think palm trees or something that looks like them.

name: Monkey mangrove tours
description: 45$ per person to kayak or take a boat down the mangrove river to isla damas. The guide is crazy friendly. We saw iguanas, Jesus lizards, boas, slothes and white faced monkeys. They bring bananas with you on the trip and the monkeys come and climb on your kayak and on your body and eat the banana out of your hand then lick it clean. Crazy cool experience.

name: Luis Gamboa Mechanic Shop
description: Best mechanic in town. Our breaks had been an issue for a while and he fixed them. Luis has all the tools, the space, epic shop and of course the knowledge. He was very fair with the price and did all the work himself.

name: Drake Bay non profit hostel  with tent option
description: You can camp in his yard behind a fence. He is super friendly and fairly bilingual (English and Spanish). He asks for 5$ pp and that gives you access to bathrooms shower kitchen wifi etc. Very nice common area. Lots of space and hammocks. You can also sleep in a  big tent he has for 10$ per person which we recommend doing if your set up isn't 100% water proof and you are here in the rainy season.

name: Panoramic Place
description: Nice place to stay for a night with a paoramic view. Hidden from the road. Check for a red satellite with white letters, that's the spot to enter. There is a big empty space were you are able to camp with an amazing view of the mountains surrounding you. Just more in the back you can find the best spot, take the slope down and park there to have the best view and enjoy the sounds of howler monkeys to there thing from a distance. Quiet at night.

name: Panoramic view
description: Great place in the hills, walk the small trail to the hilltop for a breathtaking 360 view. Parking lot at the end of a good gravel road.

name: Niels Cruz 4x4 specialist
description:
ARB Costa Rica, very helpful for suspensions and all kind of offroad problems. Very nice, speaks german and english
www.arbcostarica.com 
It's a gatet Area look on the mainstreet for Niels Cruz

name: Hotel Savegre
description: Very nice hotel, spa and natural reserve. We asked to sleep in our truck if we take the dinner in the restaurant. They said OK, without aditional charges. The dinner is a buffet and cost 24 USD pp. It was very good. The place is full of flowers and food for birds. They're just everywhere. Very nice staff, very quiet night. The bathrooms are open from 6am to 11pm. Did not ask for showers. Open good Wifi at the bar. There are 3 trails in the reserve where you can see Quetzales. Also birding guides availables for 35 USD pp.

name: Mistico Arenal Hanging Bridges Park
description:
Not dog friendly at all. Would not allow us to park our car in the shade on a regular parking spot (because vans have to go on a separate parking lot, no matter their size). This was on a day where the regular parking was practically empty. Definitively not pura vida there.
better option: sky adventure park
they also have hanging bridges for 26$pp and a lot of other things, zipline, skytram.....
the staff there is very friendly, dogs are allowed on the parkinglot, you can walk and play
overnight parking is possible , they have a nightsecurity

name: Riverside Wildcamp
description: Next to a river, well hidden from every road, maybe high clearance requiered, check first, very quiet, river is high in the night, so dont park to close.

name: Playa del coco
description: we parking in the street near the beach. we ask the police (60 mts) and they say no problem. also security of the communication tower (30 mts) WiFi hotel m&m "ola k ase" pass "[Passwords are not allowed]" we stay 4 nights without problem. only some noise. free.

name: Hotel Emanuel
description: Very clean hotel with super friendly staff. Fast WiFi, warm showers. My room came with a fan. Though not needed in June. Secure parking, might be tight for a big rig. Great restaurant on-site that will prepare you breakfast, lunch or dinner.

name: En la playa
description:
We stopped for several nights at the parking lot on the beach. Super quiet, ideal beach for surfing !!!! You can take water out of a tank!!!

Paramos varias noches en el estacionamiento de la playa. Super tranquilo, playa ideal para el surf!!!! En el lugar se puede sacar agua de un tanque que hay!!!

name: Cerro de la muerte
description:
We spent the night in the upper part, there are several abandoned houses, super quiet, very cold. In the morning the view is incredible, you can see the Pacific Ocean and the Caribbean !!!

Pasamos la noche en la parte mas arriba, hay varias casas abandonadas, super tranquilo, mucho frio. Por la mañana la vista es increible, se ve el mar pacifico y el caribe!!!

name: Country Inn & Suites San Jose Aeropuerto
description: Hotel in between airport and downtown San Jose. Simple clean rooms with secure onsite parking, we are 6m long and there is no height limit to access lot. Parking spaces are average width and length so large rigs may not be able to fit. There is a pool, fitness center, and restaurant onsite. Breakfast buffet, including hot food, is included. 100m away is a shopping center with a Fresh Market, ATM, and several restaurants. We stayed here 2 nights before flying to the US and 2 nights after returning to CR, airport shuttle service is provided. We paid $86 per night after all taxes etc

name: Ostional - turtle spotting
description:
Campground at the beach front.
Gilbert, the owner, is very passionate about turtles, been the president of the conservation program for years. Once he starts talking, make sure you have a beer around 'cause it'll take a while :)

This beach is one of the - if not THE - best turtle spotting beaches in the world. Every might they can be spotted, ranging from a just a couple to thousands of them.

He knows when and where to go spot them. Normally you have to take a guide, but you can just walk out of the camp ground onto the beach and start looking for them. Walk along the water line and look for belly dragging marks. You're not allowed to use white light, only red light.

The amount of turtles you'll see is highly depending on the moon so if you have time, I'd contact Gilbert (NV below) and ask when is the best moment.
Two options: go North (to the right) and walk about 300m, or go South. South there are more, but there's also a river with crocodiles, so not recommended to do on your own.

The camp ground itself is basic: no designated spots with light or electricity but lots of shade and a sheltered area with light and running water.
Price is 10USD pp, non negotiable. 
The entrance is a big white and brown metal gate, with a yellow arch. All rigs can fit in.

Owner is very friendly. You can contact him on +506 6123 9003 or via Facebook: Gilbert Rojas Araya
UPDATE 10/JAN/17: Now 10$ pp to camp. No negotiating .

name: Panoramic view
description: Gravel pit on a very steep panoramic road through the mountains. Amazing view over coffee plantations and lake, quiet in the night, nice for a cool night up in the mountains

name: Coin Laundry (Aquamatic)
description: Hours: Monday - Saturday 7:30-12:30 and 1:00-5:00. Self service is 2,900C to wash and 2,900C to dry. Drop off is 3,200C for each. Limit 5kg per load. Front load washing machines.

name: Clínica Veterinaria Los Álamos
description:
Dr. Diana Zuñiga Casal is a friendly, good and professional veterinary.
health certificate for the border possible
the official "SENSA" costs 90us$
a vaccination 24us$

name: camping bajos de toro
description: lovely little campsite in a man's front yard, no name, but you will see a sign saying 'camping and picking area'. owner is super friendly and the temperature is awesome after the heat of the rest of the area. facilities good and clean with a hot shower and lovely little covered area on the middle of the duck pond. good flat and shaded area, big enough for maybe 5-6 rigs, but nothing bigger than a panel van would fit through the gate. drinking water right out of the mountain, 200m from the town with little shops and a restaurant. plenty of hikes and waterfalls in the area. we negotiated the price for 2000 colones per person.

name: Total log
description: Total /delta fuel station open 24/7 , have LPG fuel station for in vehicle filling service ...

name: Taller Enderezado y Pintura IBS
description: Mr Isidro was the only taller in Liberia able to fix our pickup suspension. Nice and reliable. Did a really good job and fair price. +50670116770

name: Cafe Delicias
description: Cafe and bakery serving breakfast, lunch, dinner, coffee drinks, etc. We had a breakfast burrito combo with meat and veg and French toast with homemade strawberry sauce for C3200 and a plate with eggs, bacon, toast, and avocado for C3000. Both breakfasts wee good and included coffee. There were also many cakes, pies, etc., but we didn't try them.

name: Camping Veranera
description: offers camping area in larges green areas, a safe environment for only $3 per person , includes drinking water, electricity, toilets and showers, free access to the bar and restaurant area, just 100mts from the beach.

name: BM Super Mercado & Gas station
description: Large BM Super Mercado and across street a big gas station with water

name: parking space near basketball court
description:
Right on the beach, level parking lot with some shade. in the middle of town. Perfect for larger rigs as the spot near police station is too narrow and gets filled quickly. This is on the other side of the building. Spoke with a policeman last night who told me it was safe to camp there. great spot for a few days of shopping 👍
picture was taken at 7am. parking lot will get busy but still lots of room for rigs.
There are tons of restaurants around with Wifi, an Internet café just around the corner and down the beach a store that offers showers for 1,000c pp.

name: Plaza del Café
description: It is a very nice Coffee and Restaurant on the Northsite from the Lake Arenal. It's direkt on the Crossing Road 142 to 927.  We ask in the Restaurant, they calls the Owner, who said that we can in the Back from the Parking stay overnight. The People was very friendly, so we bought Coffee. There is in the Back a Coffee Roasters. The Overnight Parking was free.

name: Soda Tiquicia
description:
There are lots of great expensive places to eat on this stretch of road. 
This is the best inexpensive place and maybe just the best. Order a typical meal for 3000 col.

name: Tico Wind
description: Second windsurfing exit after Tilarán. 1.5 km before Piedras. West shore of Lake Arenal. Quiet and gorgeous. No services.

name: orosi
description: Parking space right next to minisuperpalimo. Helpful people, nice children, played all eve with ours. Traffic noise in the morning.

name: Playa tambor
description: Right at the end of the road in front of the beach we found this place. We were looking for the camping near by and once we saw it we decided it would be better just to park on the side of the road.

name: Mirador Manzanillo
description: Crossing the suspension bridge over a fraction of the river sixaola, between beautiful beaches and jungle vegetation is this viewpoint. Gandoca Manzanillo National Refuge.

name: playa manzanillo
description: Beach with parking space! Hostels, restaurants and markets nearby, with access to bathrooms paying 500 colones aprox $ 1us, spent one night, all quiet

name: servicentro La Tica
description: Service station with parking area and mechanics. Friendly staff. Nitrogen filling service for free tires!

name: police station El Carmen
description: On the street next to the police station and close to the train tracks, close to the city center

name: santuario de las iguanas
description: Free tourist hostel in which you can see dozens of iguanas in the natural state  (Edit- free to see iguanas as noted below, not free to stay at hostel)

name: playa carrillo
description: Great parking space that can accommodate any type of rv. About 200ft long just in front of the ocean. Ground is level and has stone so no mess in the rv. No shade but that is Good if you are on solar power.

name: Cabinas Coco Alegre
description: Owned by a couple of charming middle aged locals. 4 private double rooms equipped with clean bathrooms and cold showers. Cute outdoors kitchen corner and furnished terrace. Private parking. 40$/ night in July

name: Cafe Rico
description:
Great cafe in town that serves breakfast (1,500C - 4,000C), smoothies (2,000C), Coffee and Cappuccinos (1,000C-2,500). The Ana Rosa (4,000C) and Chilaquiles (3,000C) are delicious. Grande cappuccinos are 2,000C and very strong. Probiotic ginger ale called Jungle Juice is available by the glass or bottle (2,000C-5,000C)...some of the best we have had and not too sweet.

They also have bikes for rent and laundry service, ask to ensure they use the dryer. Laundry is 1,500C per kg unfolded, 2,000C per kg folded. Restaurant hours are 7:00-1:00pm Saturday through Wednesday, bikes and laundry hours are everyday 8-6. We were able to park along the street near the restaurant.

name: At Emilsa
description:
We were told about the very friendly person emilsa😀 we could park in her garden and use the toilet and shower.
Shower is ‘challenging’.

name: Nice View Place
description:
You can contact at (506) 8391-8743 the Owner Egidio, he let us camp for free in his beautiful garden with amazing views. He met us 2 km away on a dirt parking lot and asked us if we are looking for a campground and told us that we can camp in his property. He also have a travel agency and build this place for that reason.
He's very friendly and like overlanders.
He lives only 2 houses away and the place is very safe and locked al night. Please call in advance because I'm not sure if he stays here permanently. Highly recommended ⛺️👍

name: Indian village next to the Arenal cafe
description: quircky little stopover for a picnic that turned into a lesson on the Maieku native Indian tribe. A couple welcomed us in their traditional attires. Not worth it as per se but funny. The guy was wearing a palm skirt and holding a lance/spear. With a price written on it...

name: Campo Ferial de Coyolar
description:
free water

the gard of this place gave us free tap water.
As exchange we gave him a sprite :-)

name: Campo Ferial de Coyolar
description:
We actually didnt stay here. But we got some water.

We are sure that you could stay there over night. Not a really nice place but good to make a stop on the way to San Jose.

Looks safe as there is a gard day and night.

name: Hostel Orozco - Rio Cuarto
description:
Great hostel run by Eida and Alvaro. With all facilities (woodfire kitchen just above a small river, toilets). Not sure how much they would charge for park&sleep in the car yet their cabanas are very nice and cheap too. We rented a huge one (aircon, hot shower, huge bed + 1 single) for 20$ per night. That should give an idea given this is cheap for Costa Rica.
We were lucky enough they even took us to a fabulous spa for free ! And gave us indications to a great hike next to their house.

name: Parque y Soda
description: Truck stop parking for the big panamamerican rigs . Asked to camp here for the night and they said it was fine . Used the bathroom too. They have a shower too, I sure I could use it if I offered to pay. Food from the soda was good too - 2500 colones for a meal. Really kind people.

name: 8 carataras (waterfalls) de Paraiso Manantiales
description:
Access to 8 wonderful waterfalls after a short (but steep in the jungle) 1.5 hour hike through Carlo Mario's property, down to the river. The path is marked all the way and it is safe but it feels like you are in the middle of nowhere. We were by ourselves for more than 1 hour.
8 great waterfalls along the way. one can swim like we did.
prices: 4000 each

name: parqueo 8 carataras
description:
possibility of camping in the parking lot of Carlo Mario's access to the 8 waterfalls.
5$ per person per night negotiable. 
Carlos Mario and his wife are nice people.

name: Playa Muda
description: Direct at the Beach. We parked directly at the entrance before the forbided sign. Had no priblem at all and was really quiet! Took us like 20min from cuajiniquil, last 15min on a small dirt road. Road was okay. Not sure if u can reach the place in a big rig. But once there is enough space.

name: Playa Matapalo
description: Various spaces close to the beautiful beach

name: Gas LP
description: easy to fill propane for a fixed tank on our RV.

name: Hacienda La Central - Volcán Turrialba
description: Hacienda La Central at the foot of Turrialba Volcano

name: Servicios Electromecanicos Bejarano
description:
Very nice people. They do a Very
 profesional work on our van.They fixed our energy generator.

name: radiadores reparacion
description: Very kind people. they made a Very complet and profesional work on our radiator.

name: Playa Bochinche
description: Wild camping on a very pretty beach with Scarlett Macaws. Our very first first wild camping experience (7 months into the trip). Lots of level shady spots. Only ones on the beach after dark, quiet night but the policía did drive thru in the middle of the night. Other than the biting ants and no-see-ums this was an incredible experience!

name: Tivives Playa
description: Ay the end of the street, front to the last home, security all night.

name: Mechanic "Mi Garage"
description: we recomend  this mecanic. They are Very kind and they make a great work on our van, they fix several parts of it. They also sell some accesories, we find antique lights for uou 1960 van.

name: Playa Bejuco
description: Desolate place where you can camp. Road easy but could be muddy when raining. Beautiful beach and waves

name: Manzanillo - wild camp
description: Wild camp spot right at the beach. Beautiful sunset 🌅. Cool breeze and shade

name: River crossing El Bongo
description: Crossing was 40 cm deep. Underground is stoney and we could see the bottom

name: Mirador Paso del Quetzal
description: Super nice spot to camp. 3000 C per vehicle. Very nice lady, called Jenny! During weekends you can eat as well. BIG BONUS: early in the morning you can see the magical bird Quetzal. We saw a Quetzal several times eating and spitting out the nuts . Season to see them is from July till December. The other months they migrate somewhere else to nest

name: Playa Tortuga
description: Free beach - beautiful place if you like remote places. Very special beach landscape with river coming in and peninsula - especially wonderful at low tide. We camped there. Saw many Ara's, many birds and a 3 m long snake on the beach

name: Carate beach
description: Spot on beach. Sandy but pretty hard. Beautiful big waves. Too bug for swimming

name: Playa Matapalo 2
description: Arguably the nicest. Grass, hammock and bench in situ. A very clean and tidy spot. Right in front of a house but the beach and views are stunning. Coatimundi, Macaws too. Trail to spot is tight. We had a Ram 350 with pop top camper, might not want anything much larger unless you like forcing your way a little through leaves and branches.

name: Camp spot by the river
description: Beautiful camp spot at the river bank. There is a small boat transporting people over the river.

name: Wilson Botanical garden
description: World renowed botanical garden. Many trails to do, very well organised and indicated. 8 usd per person. We did many trails in 3 hours but there are additional jungle trails that we did not do.

name: Hotel El Rio
description: Technically on a river. Private room with your own private bathroom and shower. Option to have hot water.  10,000c cold shower, 12,000 hot shower. Hotest shower I have had in a long time. Dogs allowed but insisted we take a 12,000c room. Microwave and fridge to use. Good wifi. No secure parking, but just a few meters away a very nice 24 hour lot (closed on Sundays). Lot charges 5,000c for 24 hours and we plugged our fridge in with extention cords.  Just past the parking lot is a fantastic bakery open early that serves coffee too. The owner of the hotel is very nice. He arranged a rafting trip that was with Adrenaline Rafting for only $65 usd with lunch. They pick you up out front of the hotel. The trip was great. That is the cheapest we found by $15 per person. The hotel owner also told us where to get beakfast before the trip. We would have never found on our own. There is some grass to walk the dog across the street from hotel. We were allowed to leave our good dog in the room while we went rafting.

name: Cerro Amigos & FREE cloud forest hike
description:
Cerro Amigo is the highest point around, and TBH the walk up isn't great - a steep track gouged into the hillside to let ATVs summit. Apparently it's only 300m up and it takes about an hour. 

BUT if you continue past the small buildings on the left you see a little trail. This takes you down into the cloud forest on a 90 minute loop.

The trail is pretty easy to follow (particularly if you have Maps.Me) although a but squelchy with occasional dead fall bypasses, but you are in prime forest probably without another soul around.

Monte Verde reserve is only 2 km away and that costs $20 entry, so I know which I'd choose. Plus no problem with dogs, which is why we are here in the first place.

name: Moon House Restaurant & Hotel
description:
NO CAMPING- as of April 2018
Was looking for a shower after a hike (check out Cerro Amigo post) and the backpackers in town were thoroughly bemused by my request. Tried at restaurant over road who said no to overnight camping so ended up here. No shower but good spot for camping in secure parking lot in exchange for eating. Not pushy - even suggested we eat the $6 daily special, the cheapest thing on the menu. Right in the heart of town.

name: Surf House Pavones
description: Nice hostel in the middle of Pavones. It is run by a nice Israeli vegan couple. No meat allowed in the hostel! They charged us 6500 colones per night for two people (camper + electricity + bathroom and showers). Once or twice a week they organize a common dinner. Nice view of the wave.

name: Playa Agujas Beach Camping
description:
An easily accessible beach with lots of camping spots between the trees just off the hard packed track running along the back of the beach.

Lots of locals using the beach on the weekend but just us staying on the Sunday night. Houses the other side of the road, but set back so no concerns about intruding, and felt provided some safety.

Beach very clean. Dark sand and pebbles so not idyllic postcard type of beach but definitely a good camp spot for the night.

No services but there was a couple of restaurants at the road in, and they advertised baños/servicios for 500/300.

Scarlet macaws in the tall trees behind camp in the morning, and turtle tracks in the sand :)

name: Free Potable Water
description: Potable water tap by football pitch. You can see the sign from the road as you drive south. Blue AyA concrete structures contains the tap.

name: Casa De Las Baterías
description: Batteries of all shapes and sizes, including deep cycle. Most choice was marine dual purpose but they did have one AGM one. $345 for a 100AH, which is certainly not the cheapest but I was amazed to find one. Lots more stores in San Jose, but they will ship a battery here the next day for you.

name: Bajos del Toro. Private "camping"
description: We camped for two nights in the yard/driveway of a French couple. The space is quite small, so only one or two rigs would fit. Big rigs ok but be careful as the road and the entrance are narrow. We had access to their bathroom, showers, electricity and kitchen. They were super nice, and can give tons of advice on Central America and especially Bajos del Toro. Couchsurfing kind of atmosphere. MUST call first to book, since it's not an actual camping. Adeline and François: +506 8542 9516.

name: Iyok Ami Hostel
description: We camped in the parking area, you could also pull down a driveway for a more secluded spot (might be too steep for some vehicles).Right off the highway so trucks using engine brakes often but otherwise very peaceful and dark. Fabulous sunrise. We paid 8000 colones for 2 people for one night. Use of bathrooms, warm shower, kitchen and great hiking trails. The bilingual hosts were totally cool.

name: Super Cristan Supermarket
description:
We stayed one night here in the gravel parking lot across from the grocery store. Lots of restaurants around. Wifi from the restaurants reach. Grocery closes at 10.Pretty quiet after that, with the exception of an occasional motorcycle. Spoke to several locals, and they said it's a very safe area. One of the safest in all of Costa Rica. Next to a hotel, that said we could probably park there, but  they were full. 
Nothingl, just flat dry parking convenient to all amenities.

name: El mirador
description:
We stayed there for a night with our camper 25 feet . The friendly owner of this restaurant was happy to let us park on his site. He gave us access to water, electricity and shower in the restrooms and did not charge us.The restaurant is cheap and the decoration is pleasant.
The site has a great view on the lake , it is safe . 
He told us he would be happy to host other travellers. Don't hesitate !
The location on the map is approximate.

name: Berna Tica - no camping
description:
ADMIN NOTE: No overnight camping allowed, please respect the wishes of the locals. 

Note: does not allow camping.

Very nice Small hotel with Cabinas , Bed & breakfast.
In a beautiful tropical garden near Alajuela. Nice place to rest. Breakfast is very great.
Dora the owner is a very pleasant person born in Switzerland, gives you very much information for your travel in Costa Rica. Also some parking places to let your car for a longer time. meetingpoint for globetrotters.

name: Hotel Loma Real & Hot Springs
description:
Small Bed and breakfast hotel with Cabinas in view of the arenal. Very nice place to rest on a farm.
The cabinas are situated in a tropical garden. There are several pools with thermal water, you can use for free.
There is located also a kitchen area. You can camp with your tent .

name: Servicento JSM
description:
Propane filler station : External and Internal tanks 

I filled up my attached propane tank on my 35yr old truck (had the right fitting)  from this station before we got the ferry to Nicoya.

They had my fitting which was considered old from US standards, they said they had the most latest fittings too, it looks like a petrol station with different hoses.

name: In vehicle propane fill , brand new oct 2017
description: In vehicle propane fill from October 2017 all new equipment

name: Gas Station
description: A good gas station to sleep. Free bathroom.

name: Huacamole sodita
description: restaurant and cafe vegan, organic products.

name: Parque Antares
description:
Well lit park and street where I spent a Saturday night. Only noise was occasional car passing by. Very quiet from 11 pm to about 7am.
No services but well lit and a nice little park.

name: Nauyaca falls
description: We parked here, on the main road across the admin building, to do the 5km hike to the falls. You can also choose to drive 1km along the trail to a parking lot. It's steep and muddy *edit: still steep but paved all the way. no issue with any type of vehicle* so make sure your car can handle it. Once we got to the entrance of the actual falls we apparently needed to pay $8 pp entrance, which we didn't bring on the hike so we didn't get to see the waterfall. But hey, we say a family of monkeys and 2 stunning ara's so we were happy. On the left side of the adkin building here is a tap and road side shower (non potable water)

name: Instituto forestal wild camp
description: We were happy to find this quiet free camp spot. It's next to a little travelled gravel road, on a flat grassy area, at the entrance of the forestal institute. There is a guard at the gate of the institute, which made us feel safe, who told is there was no problem camping here. It's in a green area, good for one night passing through. No facilities but free, which is great for Costa Rica

name: Los Gallos
description: Great little restaurant along the road. 5 tables inside were taken the whole time we were here on a Sunday lunch. Plates between 1900 and 4500 col. Very tasty and fresh, good portions

name: Multiservicios La Trocha
description: So difficult to find good mechanics, so nice to run into them. We broke down a few km up the road and locals recommended this place. It was Sunday but we were invited to sleep on the driveway. Monday at 7h30 Jerry, the owner, was ready for us. It's a large workshop, would fit all sizes of rigs since they also service trucks. Jerry is very friendly and really knows engines. He proposed us a few possible solutions and got a spare part within a few hours to solve the problem. We were invited to use his wifi, take a shower and have coffee with cookies while waiting.

name: Cabinas Brisa Del Mar
description:
The best place to stay in this area!!
it's few steps from the beach and the waves, there is a small market a few steps from the place too and there are a few restaurants close by. 
The owner is suuuuper friendly!! 
The place is beautiful, it's almost everything new! There is an open area, shared kitchen, a good pool to relax after the beach, and a parking lot.
the price is 45u$ for 2 pp. All the rooms have AC and private bathroom, with hot water! 
We loved stay here, stop to stay a night and ending staying 6!! 
Totally recommend!!
The beach is amazing, always have some waves for the surfers, or you can swim or relax on the sand, there are space to hang on the beach in the sun or under the palapas reading a book, for the non surfers like me :D

name: Hostel La Suerte
description:
Really nice and comfortable place owned by a lovely family.

We payed 20 dol for a private double room with shared bathroom (low season). It includes a tico tradicional breakfast (pinto, eggs, tortillas, bananas and coffee)

Sorrounded by nature and close to supermarket, restaurants and ATM.

name: Total station
description: In vehicle propane fill station , big rig friendly

name: La Casa De la Hormiga
description:
Cheap good food.

Open for breakfast and lunch

Prices range from 1000 - 2500

I had a big plate of Gallo Pinto con Carne y Pan for 1800, added a glass of tamarindo juice for 500

2300 total

name: En la playa
description: We parked here for a week. safe and quiet. in the door of the hotel M & M arrives the wifi there are showers and drinking water next to the track of bmx. lit all night. The beach with sand and soft waves. to 1000 more at low tide you have access to a bay with a small beach of clear and warm water

name: end of punta uva parking
description:
Beach paradise with lots of shade. I've spent one night here and I think I'll spend another. Only the sound of the ocean at night. Nice snorkeling around the bluff to the beginning of el Aricife. People come to fish fairly early and others fairly late. I wouldn't leave my stuff here unattended, but everyone's been friendly.
Rigs taller than 3 m will touch tree branches and vines but nothing destructive. I walked in first thing in the morning and was only 1 car in the parking so I brought the rig in and did an immediate turnaround for easier exit when I want.

name: Cementerio de la Cruz
description: Magnificent views, street parking. Close to Costa Rica border. Good place to stay when entering or leaving the country. Free. Good 4G signal, kolby.

name: Frente a la policia
description:
Super quiet and safe place. It's the supermarket parking lot, the people are very good. In our case we were 72 hours since we left to Costa Rica to renew the 90 days of stay in Panama. We made the entrance of the people in Costa Rica but not the one of the vehicle, with this we avoided the expense of the insurance. We waited 72 hours and returned to Panama to get better.
--
Lugar super tranquilo y seguro. Es el estacionamiento del supermercado, la gente muy buena onda. En nuestro caso estuvimos 72 horas ya que salimos a Costa Rica para renovar los 90 días de estadía en Panama. Hicimos el ingreso de las personas en Costa Rica pero no el del vehículo, con esto nos evitamos el gasto del seguro. Esperamos 72 horas y volvimos a ingresar a Panama lo mas bien.

name: Hostal Nanku
description:
Bryant & Ana are the most welcoming hosts and just opened this place in July 2017. The rooms are clean, there are a few communal areas, you have a kitchen at your use, and you really feel like part of the family. They can also help with questions and arrange shuttles/offer suggestions. Great place for a layover in Liberia or if you want to visit a few of the sites close by. Located right next to the bus terminal. 

1 dorm room with 2 bunk beds with shared bathroom- $10
4 private rooms with 1 double bed and a bunk bed  with private bathrooms- $25

They are listed at the moment on booking.com too if you would like to see photos.

name: Casa Playa Sol y Arena
description: Kind and friendly hosts of a small, simple hotel. Nothing's fancy; A/C, good wifi, pool, cable, cool shower and they offered us use of a roomy communal kitchen. Our 25 ft RV fit into their parking area which was locked for the night. We paid 50$ for two adults and two kids. Good enough stop for the night.

name: side of the road
description: this is a wide spot in the road that is flat in a very hilly area. we spent a night here because we were running late and didn't feel like driving at night. it is very safe as we were on a hilltop with a view surrounded by farmland. very little to none vehicle traffic after dark

name: Beach front camp
description:
Moderator Note: There is a report of robberies at this location.
.....
This is a very safe street in front of the beach that is patrolled regularly by the police. we spent three nights here and had no troubles. it gets busy in the mornings and evenings with surfers but by sundown it's empty and there are street lights to keep it well lit. there are no bathrooms but the hostel Room 2 Board, which is right behind this spot, is open to the public and will let you use the bathroom or pool if you get a drink from the bar .

name: Hotel restaurant manuel Antonio park
description:
Great place on the parking of hotel restaurant Manuel Antonio national park 
The night is free, we eat the breakfast at the morning and at the night we take drink at bat 
In the day we stay in the parking and te boss look for RV during we are visiting the park
Friendly staff 
We give a tip

name: El Avion Restaurant
description: Yes it's a Restaurant and a Tourist Attraction as well. It's an old plane (for history you have to google or go there to find an old newspaper article ;-)) where they build a Restaurant around. We didn't try the food but it looked very good, especially the tunafish. We just had a drink here and enjoyed the nice view. We saw monkeys as well. Worth to visit.

name: Spanish by the River
description: hostel with good communal areas, kitchen well equiped, a little far fromtown 2.3km by road which i would not recommend walking at night, need to get on the bike. we stayed in Private room shared bathroom US$30_ per room p/n. parking for 4 or 5 bikes or a couple of SUVs not suitable for large trucks. offers spanish school riding and kayaking(we did not try these). very clean. there is a very large dog and numerous cats in residence. owner speaks english well and whilst we were here a Dutch lad manned the reception. very friendly lot.

name: Other gravel pit
description: I don't know if the other listing for a gravel pit is inaccurately placed on the map, or if this is another gravel pit. I saw this place from the highway, not well hidden but the spot under the bride is not a good idea in rainy season. This spot works fine... has rained a lot and no flooding. Close enough to town to ride the bike in. Relatively quiet for being so close to the highway.

name: Surfer Factory buy/rent your Surfboard
description: Good Shop with very helpful owner. He explained us a lot about surfboards and offered us a good price for a new Board. Just ask for Alain, he is 24 hours around and lives next door. They also offer lessons at the beach close by. There we tested some boards to decide which one to buy at the end. For surf-newbies like us, it was the perfect consultation. Recommended!

name: Municipal lot
description:
Was the only big-rig friendly spot I could find. The 'lot attendant' said it was municipal and then said it would be $20 per night. I said no so he said $20 for 2 nights. They are also pushing tours and equipment rentals.
The lot is close to the beach but not quite on the beach. Was promised that it was safe for the night.

name: JSM Cervicentros
description:
We filled our US LP 34 Lts tank for about $17.-
Open 24/7

name: Sendero las Sorpresas de Rio Celeste
description:
USE REPORTS: "they close the toillet and we paid a bit more. end up really expensive and not worth at all "

A MUST visit!!!!  Flat, grassy area behind a barbed wire fence with a beautiful view of the entire valley and volcano. Clean bathrooms with cold shower. Strong wifi.  $15 USD per vehicle. They allowed us to have a fire with wood we found on the land. They also offer a river tour for $6 PP (doesn't include the waterfall so we didn't go). If nobody is around you can contact the caretaker at 5015-1343 or 8356-0285 or stop by Posada Rio Celeste (just down the road, also on iOverlander). Very friendly people and an amazing location!

name: La Casita de Barra Honda
description:
Da gusto compartir con la familia de esta casita, porque son muy buenas personas. Si quieren comer ahí, puede hablar con ellos.
---
It's nice to share with the family of this house, because they are very good people. If you want to eat there, you can talk to them.

name: Thomas's garage.
description: Thomas grew up in Austria in the village they make KTMs, where he trained as a mechanic. He fixes KTMs, & BMW motos.  Local expats use him to repair 4x4 vehicles we saw numerous Mitsubushis Toyotas and a Jeep. Thomas did a thourgh job on my wife's and my KTM690 enduros. he came highly recommended by the local expat community and I am happy to endorse this. Was able to source KTM parts, through contacts & he has arranged for brake pads etc to be available in Mexico for us in a few months. EMail: - tnecht69@gmail.com  tel 00506 84702565.

name: basílica nuestra sra de los angeles
description: Parking of the basilica. Very safe with police presence and security cameras. Very quiet at night. good free wifi. bathrooms available in the basilica.

name: Costa Nera
description: Nice new place $55w fan and hw include breakfast

name: Casa Jungla Hostal
description: about 21000 for a double room. communal kitchen, secure parking, shared bathroom

name: Riverside
description: Quiet spot beside the river on the way to Parque Amistad.

name: Gasolinera UNO
description: Amazing place to stay one night and then continue traveling. There is a flat parking space for several cars. There is free toilet.

name: Gasolinera Uno
description:
permiten parkear para dormir. pequeño estacionamiento, mucho movimiento día y noche, seguro y ruidoso. Baños y agua potable.
---
they allow parkear to sleep. Small parking lot, lots of movement day and night, safe and noisy. Bathrooms and drinking water.

name: next  to the Police station
description:
Next to the ocean next to police detachment. shadow and ample space. very quiet and safe. we consulted the police everything OK! FREE
We are staying for one week.

name: Rio Fortuna - Natural pool and Waterfall
description:
It's a nice place to swim and jump in the river and it's free. You can park before


 the bridge and walk down to the river. Lock your car!

name: Juan Castro Blanco Ranger Station (4WD required)
description: After hiking the beautiful trail to pozo verde, we asked the ranger (Oscar) to stay the night in our rooftop tent. It was no problem as long as we closed the gate after us if we left. We offered him a cold beer and he was all smiles. We parked the car on the leveled concrete just in front of the entrance of the ranger station. During the night he closed the ranger station with the toilets inside. Running water at the back of the building. Streetlights are on all night around the building. Sheltered picnic area.  Free.

name: Los Piratas
description: Camping between the track and the beach on a leveled bit of sand in front of a deserted hotel. Nice cool breeze. Asked the neighbour (Mario) if it was ok, he even offered us to use his own shower and bathroom facilities. This place was recommended to us by Marcos and Mariane from 'You Are Costa Rica' in Playa Grande. They are just the nicest people! We hope to spot some turtles tonight.

name: Ranaria
description: When you make the tour in the ranaria you can stay here for free for overnight. The ranaria is open till 8 pm, means toilet as well.

name: playa uva
description:
bajo palmeras y almendros a 20 mts del mar más turquesa y transparente que puedas encontrar por aquí. excelente para snorkel. muy tranquilo y seguro. 
---
under palm trees and almond trees 20 meters from the sea more turquoise and transparent that you can find around here. excellent for snorkeling. very quiet and safe.

name: playa manzanillo
description:
Frente a la iglesia sobre la playa. mucha sombra lugar amplio y limpio. pueblo muy tranquilo y seguro. en la puerta del parque se puede vender con el carro. muchos turistas todos los días. hay baños y duchas a 500 colones 1u$s mercado y restaurantes cerca. 
---
In front of the church on the beach. Lots of shade place wide and clean. very quiet and safe village. At the park gate you can sell with the car. Many tourists every day. there are toilets and showers at 500 colones 1u $ s market and restaurants nearby.

name: supermarket megasuper
description: fast wifi free in a supermarket or street. open every day

name: Pesqueria da Limonta
description:
Best fish restaurant in town! 
Tiny place but number one in Trip Advisor and for a reason.
The food is made with love and precision and this you can taste! 

The main food is fish, but they also serve pasta and rice recipes.
The owner is originally from Italy and speaks perfect English. Probably Italian too, we didn’t try ;)
We went here the evening before our flight home, but it’s worth going several times. Best (fish) food we had in a long time. 

There is only place for +/- 15 people, so to make sure you can eat here I would recommend to make a reservation. Tel: +506 2430 3572. 
Definitely worth going here. Parking can be done right in the street of this restaurant. Is safe with guards.

name: Soda Restaurante/Jimenez
description:
Good cheap food. Got two plates which included dessert (arroz con leche) for 4 mil total.

The chuleta/pork chop and pescado were tasty. They were served with rice, beans, plantains, and beets.

name: gecko hotel
description:
nice hotel at a good price right at the beach near the national park border
all rooms with private bathroom
we paid 20$ for a double room and got a room which sleeps 5
a little further from town but only 5mins
Wi-Fi not good tough

name: Poponjoche
description:
Place with camping area and cabana, organizing tour to Cano Negro wildlife area.
The owners are friendly. Camping is 3000C per person, and wildlife tour range from 20000C to 25000C regarding the length (the price was for two person). We really appreciated both the camping site and the tour !

name: River crossings
description: River crossing, this is a shortcut, and the river may look shallow. We couldn't make it with our 2WD RAV4 and had to be pushed back by some nice locals.

name: Matapalo n’est the beach
description:
A good place to stay several days very near the beach, on grass. Free. Wifi hotel near (password : 
 [passwords are not allowed unless explicitly permited by the owner]

name: Playa Agujas
description: We spend a night here. Small place near the sea, next the bridge of cocodrilos, on the way to San Jose. Free

name: playa  platanares
description:
a one car pull-out spot next to the beach road north.
this north point is where tour operators come after dark to swim in bioluminescence. just magical
We encountered a big boa one one of the paths so watch your step 
no facilities but free

name: Marino Ballena NP
description:
for people wanting to go to the whale tail peninsula this is the entrance to the park.
6$pp just for the beach when it's not the season for whales. don't know what the price is when there are whales

name: Taller de Sancho near Jaco
description: Excelente mecánicos. They repair the clutch pedal of our motorhome and the horn. They change oil filter and gasoil filter and they clean air filter (for 68000 colónes).

name: In front of Villa Bolita
description:
Just a place in front of the ocean with some palms.

Slept here just one night, but felt really safe.

If you wanna surf, there is also a beachbreak in front of you 😀👍

name: Ecocentro Danaus
description: Very expensive. 15 dollars p/person and we don’t intéressant animals

name: En face du restaurant Mar y Sol
description:
spent two weeks on this great beach, under coconut trees. Little shade but the wind makes it bearable.
Very quiet during the week but can get very noisy on week ends.
Very clean.
The restaurant serves good food

name: Taller Canales - 4x4 specialist
description:
General mechanic and 4x4 specialist. The owner is Gustavo Canales. The 4-wheel drive of our Toyota 4Runner got busted in the mountains of CR. We were referred to him by ARB Costa Rica. He does all the off-road mechanics for them. He was super helpful and knowledgeable in diagnosing the problem and connecting us to the right parts from the local Toyota supplier. 
He does many custom jobs for Overlanders in his shop. Mostly Toyota. 

Definitely the place to go for overlander repair or custom upgrades. 

Tel. +506 8893 1638

name: Hotel Rio
description:
Pretty grungy hotel in Puntarenas but it is cheap... 11,000 for a room for two/shower/tv/fan/WiFi (only works in office) 
Ask for room 69, it’s on the ground floor and you get everything I mentioned. We’re bike touring so needed to store our bikes. Don’t stay in upstairs rooms. Cheaper (8,000) but basically just a tiny room that only fits a bed, no windows, shared bathroom. We’re not picky but this room was like a prison cell lol. Ask to see the upstairs rooms if you’re curious what I’m talking about. Hotel is down a little alley and hard to find. Maybe I shouldn’t be recommending it but I heard all the other hotels in this town are pricey! Only stay here if your only concern is saving money...

name: finca la isla
description:
visit a botanical garden in puerto viejo.
really nice walk into the tropical garden 
3000 colones per adult 
finish with a fruit degustation 
really worth it

name: Gigante Auto Parts, Awnings sold here!!
description: Nice auto and motor parts store.  They sell LEDs, Awnings, OBD2 readers, and much more. super helpful, and clean bathrooms.

name: Playa Galardonada
description:
ADMIN NOTE: WARNING!!! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution. 

Beach parking lot. empties out after sunset, some tourist kids came down to make a little noise around 9pm, but otherwise quiet. a few vehicles came and went during the night, possibly police patrols as they make rounds during the day. try to camp away from the trash area as some racoons or other animals came at night. howler monkeys will greet you with their song in the morning. Free. 

some people set up tents on the beach, unknown if this is officially allowed

name: Scenic 4WD-Track to Playa Hermosa
description: if you'd like to take a little 4x4 track through forest and beach, leave Road 160 at the location of the marker and follow this one-lane track south. It crosses a river (quite shallow in dry season) and heads towards the beach through the forest, where you can see monkeys from time to time. The track then continues for about 2.5km directly on the beach - I suppose this is only possible at low tide. Along the way you'll find several openings in the forest that you can access for boondocking, one is also on iOverlander. Later the track returns to land, goes through Manzanillo and then you can follow it further along the coast line to Hermosa - again with several spots for boondocking. The track isn't difficult at all, it's just lovely,  but because of the part on the beach I'd say it's 4WD - only. But I guess someone will prove me wrong and do it with his Chevy van :-)

name: El Higueron - giant ficus tree
description: a giant ficus tree that you see in some travel books about the area. It's right on the main road.

name: hotel Verde Mar
description: Nice, clean, small and friendly hotel. It is located just on the beach (100 mts). It is 500 mts from Manuel Antonio Park. Lot of space for parking and camping.

name: Cruz Roja Liberia
description: In the Cruz Roja are very kind, they have a spacious parking lot where we could camp. Maybe can accept RV. They ask us for passports and they keep it until we go. Bathroom with shower clean.

name: Cruz Roja Bagaces
description: A perfect place to stay! They are beautiful people, they offer us a bed, AC, the use of the kitchen, of the TV, the bathroom and the shower and a safe place to park our bikes. They are the best place to stay for free. We love them!

name: Risco de Lagartillo
description: Has a beautiful view, the sunset os amazing

name: Finca Turri Poas / Pavones Turrialba
description:
Great Familiar place with small swiming pools. local restaurant if you dont want to cook (reservation needed during the week. restaurant just open on weeke ds) and great place to set up your tent. Nice place for family and kids. 
enought room for big rigs and 4x4 with roof top tents. Nice view of the Turrialba Volcano. Electricity and clean bathrooms (cold water). one of our spots in Turrialba. You can leave your car here and go for Rafting or any other activity and come back with no problem. very safe and calm place. Recomended by www.costarica4x4experience.com 

contacto. Freddy al +506 85681460
o en ingles/francés al +506 83126273
info@costarica4x4experience.com

name: Cabinas Olguitas
description: Less than a five minute walk to lovely Playa Pelada and restaurants, 2 mini grocery stores. Place is a big but somewhat ramshackle collection of cabins and parking areas. Small restaurant on site. Toilets, shower, WiFi, sinks and water hookups. Quieter than staying right on the beach, which is party central for some of the locals. Electricity if you’ve got an extension cord. They wanted $20 per night but we talked them down to $15. 45 minute walk into Nosara, or a $6 tuk-tuk ride (or hitch- plenty of folks willing to give rides into town)

name: Santa rita cabinas
description: 6 thousand Colones a room a person, shared bathroom the wifi comes and goes, it is clean and there is safe parking

name: La Marta Refugio Silvestre
description:
It is a private nature reserve with 17 kilometers of trails to walk. You can visit some ruins in the park, as they had some agricultat here 150 years ago. There are some nice Miradors with a stunning view over the primary forest.
Entry fee was CRC 6‘800$ including way night of camping. No pets allowed in park.

name: La Marta - Refugio Silvestre
description:
Campground right next to parking for the park.
Tent camping on grassy field, car camping on gravel place next to information center. There are shelters to cook inside with tables and a fire place. Building with shower and toilet is 50 meters from parking place. The entry and camping costs CRC 6‘800.
It is a really quiet spot in the middle of the nature.

name: golden bean coffee tour
description: whatsapp Tyrone : +50687012637 for booking

name: Cruz roja pital
description: The guys very kind offer us a very spacious place with roof to put the bikes and the camp, so noisy for the cars but very safe, in the backyard you can see frogs, tucans, and iguanas. You can use he showers, the bathroom and the kitchen ! We stay two nights free of course

name: Monte de la Cruz
description: natural park excellent for picnics and familiar travels

name: Playa Coyote
description: Great spot under palmtrees directly on the beach. Every size of rig fits. The beach is beautiful. Sandy, wide, empty. Good for swimming too. Some private homes around. There is one restaurant at Playa Coyote run by a german couple. You will pass it on your way. 200 m from here. Go for a coffee or pasta and use their outdoor-shower.

name: Manuel Antonio
description:
Awesome, beautiful wild camp right at the beach. lots of shade. Showers available for 500crc. Toilets in restaurant next door, also 500crc or you buy a batido, they are very good. Only small rigs, we just fit with our 2.5meters, on the campspot there is space for the rooftop tent. A couple of surf schools right there, also parasailing and Jetski and kayak rental. Not too many people at the beach even though it's high season. people here are very nice. We didn't have to pay anything. Another couple we met had to pay 3000crc, I don't know if that was the parking fee, They arrived during daytime, we arrived late afternoon...
You can get potable water from the man who lives here for a donation.
Very safe here. Highly recommended.

name: PN Volcan Tenorio
description:
private parking at the entrance of Volcan Tenorio NP. fee : 1000 colones
the guy said we could stay for the night with the fee. 
toilets and water are available at NP nearby. 
access to the rio celeste from 8am to 2 pm

name: dog sitter
description: We found d a dog sitter just opposite the ticket office his name is William $5 for the day

name: clinica veternaria
description: Decent vet and pet store we got rabies vaccine for $18

name: Cabinas Anita
description:
It is a hotel and hostel but it also serves as a camping. They have secure parking with tree shade. Toilet, shower, Wi-Fi and hot coffee. For $5000(9USD) pp pn 
The owners are very nice people 
The place is next to the road but there's a steep concrete ramp and it is between two rivers, one of them they say is the best for rafting.

name: Pacific Fast Lube
description: This car repair shop is run by a local Costa Rican (Mauricio) and his business partner is a Canadian (Johnny) who had a car shop in Canada for 30 years. Johnny inspects all the work done by his mechanics. These guys got the parts I needed from San José the next day and completed the work quickly and professionally. I had tie rods, bushings, brake rotors and an alignment for $250.  It's definitely worth it to make the trip to Jaco to have Johnny look at your rig and let you know what he can do for you. Everyone in town recommended him to me.  Johnny, Mauricio and the clerks all speak English.

name: hotel Plaza changuinola
description:
Sweet little hotel

You can just see the front building from the road but there's a larger gated area behind it.  They have grass, playground, nice pool., free laundry room. Rooms are simple and clean  we paid $50 for 4 people but he quoted me $37 for one person 

Highly recommended previously or post birder stop
