description:
Good place to stay directly in a wonderful bay.
Easy access on paved road. Good for one night after or before border crossing. Very quiet at night and we felt very safe.

name: Queso canaàn
description: The Family Mata Hernández sell homemade cheese here! Swiss recipes, cheese with herbs and many more! They even give you some samples! Best cheese in Central America for us ;)

name: Hotel Bristol
description: Nice little hotel close to airport. Good breakfast ! perfect for a stay before traveling further

name: Hostel Sámara
description:
Very nice and clean hostel. Dorms with fan for 10$ pp. Big well equipped kitchen and nice common areas. 
Owner is super friendly and full of advice. There is space for bikes and motorbikes inside. Otherwise you can park at the street close to the entrance and they will watch your car during the night. Decent WiFi and also AC rooms available if you prefer that.

name: Police Station
description: We spotted a hose outside so stopped to ask if we could fill up our shower (which they said was no problem), and they said it was potable too. Just ask nicely to one of the officers inside if you can use first!

name: Boca del Toro Road
description: Parked on a big flat lot,360 excellent views a few minutes from playa Carrillos. Very quiet spot. A lot fresher than the beach, the spot is 431 mts above see level. Temperature is a few degrees lower. Good boondocking spot. Good for truck campers 4x4

name: Next to the Police Station
description: In the evening we asked in the police station if we can set up our tent next to the building. There is a huge area of grass and gravel which is used as a parking lot for the police staff as well. It was no problem for them to pass the night there and I think with a camper it wouldn't be a problem either. Good place to stay.

name: Cabina Roca Mar
description: Chill clean Cabina with a hot shower and a very nice lady that runs the place! Bit pricey but we were drenched from rain and dirty from the cycle. Wifi is good a/c is good. Paid 20,000 colons

name: THERMOMANIA
description: Thermal water with facilities, cabins, restaurant, grills. Small water park. Free parking overnight at front parking lot. Open from 8 to 22h. 6000₡ p/p.

name: Luxury Hostel
description:
This is a great hostel! We stayed here in the 16 beds dorm (in reality a 12 bed-dorm) and we had it nearly for our own. We payed 4600 Colones ( 7.50 Dollars) per bed. Breakfast with toast, fruits and cereals is included. The shower is a dream! There is a kitchen as well and in the lobby one can play table soccer, table tennis and billiard for free or you can just chill in the pool. 
There are private rooms as well and dorms with shutters at the beds for saving the privacy. 
Busses going for 350 Colones (50 cents) to San José Centre. Big supermarket is only two blocks away. 

One of the best hostels we've ever been!

name: Playa Loros/ Playa Punta de Pelencho
description: Beautiful lonesome beach camping! No amenities but a very pretty bay with an island to walk over! Police pops by once in a while! Recommended!

name: Road blocked
description: If you are following Maps.ME's directions to Lake Arenal, it will try to lead you through this dirt road among farms and those big fans (sorry, I don't know their name in english). The road is not a problem for 2WD, at least if it's dry, but after a while, you will come to a locked gate through an area that seems to be for the maintenance of those fans. I was forced to turned back.

name: Airport Costa Rica B&B
description:
If you need to storage your car for a while this is an excellent option! We left our car and trailer for over a month at Fernando's place and everything went perfect. It is really close to the airport and in case you need it, you can rent a room in their B&B for $50 USD. It's clean, comfy and best of all, pet friendly. 

The entrance is gated, and the parking area is next to the owners houses, so you don't need to worry about safety at all.

$5 USD per day

name: Supermarket Media Luna
description: This is a modern family-run supermarket with high-quality products and also contains a little cafe with a great bakery section. Perfect stop to quickly grab some groceries or to have a break along the way.  Good coffee!

name: Bomberos
description: Good spot for bike tourists to camp for a night. Shower, kitchen, grassy area, Wi-Fi and most important: Friendly staff!

name: Beach
description: This place is a paradise for bikers/hikers. Imagine camping out on a beach that feels like it's made for you (I haven't seen anybody), surrounded by coconut trees that enable you to make your own Rice & Beans and to top it off: There is an awesome night sky if you're lucky with the clouds. Stop imagining and camp right here, there is an entrance on the side of the road. No facilities. Don't leave your garbage please.

name: Cabinas Padaroda
description:
Great place to stop, if like us, you got stuck at dusk and didn’t make it to Puerto Viejo! Very friendly owners. Felt very safe here. 

Large, gated and flat gravel parking lot in front of the cabinas for parking with trees and plants around, grass and trees beyond. Covered tables and spaces we used for outdoor cooking & sink we used to clean dishes. Power outlet available for hookup.  7,000 colones for both of us. Washroom available but no shower (unless you pay for a room). It’s right off the highway, so you will hear traffic, as well as frogs and crickets.

Rooms also available with private washroom, kitchenette and A/C for 13,000 colones and can sleep 3 (2 beds). Rooms are clean and comfortable looking, well maintained. We think we’re the first people to camp here, but she said more overlanders are welcome. We did not ask about tents, though there would be space on grassy areas.

Apparently malaria is an issue here, so keep yourself covered/ sprayed. 

There are dogs on the property (we never saw them) so unsure if it would be pet friendly.

name: Campyng Bar El Indio
description:
Hard soil under shady trees. Clean toilets and basic outside shower.
3500 CRC pP/night; 5000 CRC pP/night with breakfast.
We didn‘t stay there because we wanted to proceed, but the place seems to be agreable and safe. Beautiful beaches nearby. We would have stayed if it would have fit at our travel schedule.

name: In front the police
description: We park in front the police, they are very kindly with us and feel safe.

name: Bomba Huacas
description:
We were on the way to Playa Conchal, without safe options to sleep. So, we stopped in this gas stations and asked for stop here to sleep. They said it was okay, we used their toilets and water to fuel our tank, giving them a tip. It was okay, not too much noise and they had a truck sleeping here also. 
***
Estávamos a caminho de Playa Conchal, sem opções seguras para dormir. Então, paramos neste posto de gasolina e pedimos para parar aqui para dormir. Eles disseram que tudo bem, usamos seus banheiros e água para abastecer nosso tanque, dando-lhes uma gorjeta. Tudo correu bem, sem muito barulho e eles tinham um caminhão dormindo aqui também.

name: On the street
description: We park here 2 nights with no problem, near the beach and feel safe

name: Vicovet
description: A veterinarian who does exportation procedures for your pet.

name: Hostel Tortuga camping
description:
Great hostel, with a river in the backyard and just minutes from beautiful beaches! (4 minutes to a swimming beach & 10 for surfing). Access to kitchen, toilets, showers, WiFi, electricity for charging phones etc, pool, river, plus they’ll provide towels and soap if you need. 

We went on the recommendation of some local friends and it turned out to be a brilliant spot. It’s just off the main road, so super easy to reach, but because of the amount of nature around, you really don’t hear the road. Plus you have access to a beautiful river to cool off in (just meters from the front door!) 

Camping is on a grassy area just outside the hostel, but as the road dead-ends at the river, it’s not a through-road so you’re just parked in the middle of the jungle, it’s great! 

$25 for two people with car (additional $5 pp for extra people in the same car). 

Also, to a laundry machine (wager & dryer). $6 of you do it yourself, $12 if you leave stuff to be washed. 

Mari and Fabio (Costa Rican / Swiss couple) are brilliant. Super welcoming and have lots of info about places nearby, including a beautiful waterfall. 

Definitely recommend.

name: Coral Reef Surf Hostal
description: Lovely little Hostal with 2x private parking gated spaces. No height limit but wouldn't want a long wheel base. Close to the beach. $50 for a 4 person room in high season.

name: laboratorio diesel-taller Santamaria
description: Helliot and sons are true diesel performance specialists. Very knowleadgeble and really friendly. Prices are very good versus Costa Rican standards. very recommended! you can find them in Facebook: Laboratorio Diesel Taller Santamaria LDTS

name: Restaurants/ Hostel parking lot
description: Small parking lot located behind the line of restaurants and next to the Arenal container hostel. Free bathrooms right by the parking and free WiFi from the neighbouring hostel. We paid the container hostel for use of their facilities in advance but in hindsight really didn't need to. You can definitely just park here and camp for free. Guy who owns propane shop is a camping enthusiast too and wants to make this trip. Feels super safe. FREE

name: Viewpoint to sea with sunrise and sunset
description:
We went to “You are in the Costa Rica”, a recommended point but Mariane and Marcos said that the parking near them was a private land and they didn’t allow someone put it on the app. So they recommended this place. Wonderful! Quiet and with stunning view. We arrived at sunset and there is just 2 guys looking at, after in the sunrise came a couple, but it was okay. It is isolated but not too much as there are some houses near (200m/400m). Quiet and safe.
***
Nós fomos em “You are Costa Rica”, um lugar recomendado pelo app, mas Marcos e Mariane não nos autorizaram ficar lá, porque o estacionamento é uma terra privada e eles não autorizaram que fosse colocado no app. Então nos indicaram esse lugar onde há uma bela vista e se pode ver o pôr-do-sol e o nascer do sol. É muito bonito. Quando chegamos havia dois caras assistindo pôr-do-sol e pela manhã um casal assistiu o nascer do sol, mas tudo bem. Estamos isolados mas ao mesmo tempo não totalmente pois há duas casas próximas (200 m, 400 m), tranquilo e seguro.
***
Nous sommes d’abord allé à « You are Costa Rica », recommandé par l’application. Finalement le lieu n’est pas approprié car c’est le parking du voisin. 
Marcos le propriétaire nous a indiqué un autre endroit bien plus sympa. Le lieu surplombe la ville et permet de se coucher / lever avec une vue sublime sur la mer. Site tranquille, sûr et un peu isolé (une maison à 200m). Peu fréquenté car connu des locaux. 
Très bon choix!!

name: Garden House
description: Hiked Cerro Chirripo and was able to park at this cafe/house for free for 1 night in exchange for eating lunch at the cafe upon our return. Food cost $4,000 colones per dish (pasta) and it tasted great!

name: Viewpoint
description: There are couple pullouts along this road with amazing view of San Jose (especially at night). On the weekends it gets packed by locals hanging out. Around eleven they start leaving. Night was quiet. Nobody bothered us.

name: Ferreteria Tecnica (Hardware store)
description: This is a really nice store for any plomber problems, and other constructions stuff. People really helpful and good prices.

name: farmers market
description: Big empty lot where farmer markets operates on Tuesdays. Plenty space to wild camp shaded areas two

name: Square
description: Huge Gras quarter mas o menos in town.. looks good for a night

name: Rancho del Sabito
description: Huge area very friendly economic... RV friendly flat Free

name: Pali supermarket
description: Cashier told us water from tap in the bathroom is safe to drink. We filled our 20l jug there. Apparently all tap water in Costa Rica is good to drink, except in some rare very remote places...

name: check point
description: This was a checkpoint looking for drugs or guns. They said they were going to bring dogs to sniff around but we said that's fine and that we dont have any drugs (which we actually don't). They looked through a few things and tried to be a little intimidating but it was fine in the end. They seem pretty keen on finding drugs here this is the second time weve been searched in this region. Were not driv9ng some crazy looking hippy van either just a plain white newer model ford. So it just just be all foreign people, they didnt seem too concerned with latin american looking drivers.

name: El Chante Verde organic Restaurant
description:
New restaurant, all organic and good! Amazing menu and the place is beautiful! 
The coordinate might not be exact but it is on this street, about 15 min walk from Arenal Tubing and Hicking Camping spot!

name: Santa Teresa Chiropractic Clinic
description: This clinic is run by Neill in the front section of his home. I had a bad surf injury on my back and Neill not only slotted me in last minute but kept in touch and have constant advice and thoughts towards my injury and remedies. I have seen a number of chiropractors with injuries in the past and believe that Neill is definitely one of the best out there. Highly recommended and please tell him Daniel from Canada said hello.  His what’s app is +50662582824

name: Caribe
description:
Asked at the Hostal Caribe if I can park up front in their driveway! It is not inside the premesis but seems save! There is only one spot! Beach is directly across the street!
Friendly staff, super fast wifi, electricity, kitchen, shower, toilet etc...
nice!

name: Police station
description:
Under the trees next to a gravel road, 100m of the Police station Barrio la Trinidad.
On the way to Arenal from Tortuguero, it was dark and we really appreciate to find this place where we felt safe, there was no traffic on the gravel road and the place was very quiet with a lot of birds in the morning .
Super market very close and we had dinner in a magical restaurant just 3 km away ( La Cueva del Marisco : Paella, Swiss fondue, Mussels,  Ceviche, Tuna tartare, ..... )

name: police checkpoint
description: wanted to look at all our papers. everything fine

name: restaurant and campsite in front of NP park
description: Flat parking behind the restaurant. Owner ask us 5'000 Colons for two pax. Another camper was here, the place is very large.  Not really suitable for tent as the ground is really rocky, but perfect for cars and campers. We reach there as the NP was close (7pm). Free Wifi from NP. Toilets are really clean, and you can ask for a shower (we didn't). We don't know if the water was drinkable, but there is water.  The restaurant owner rent also 3 houses. We stay there as we visited the National park. Quiet.

name: flat ground aside the road
description: Almost flat ground aside the road,  not far from NP. Suitable for small camper. Ground very rocky to build a tent. No facilities and not the best romantic place but it's perfect to have a night.  There is not toilet onsite,  but the nature is everywhere and you're alone. very quiet at night,  safe place,  lots of birds.

name: Posada Rural Oasis
description: Lovely Posada family run and very close to the village of caño negro. There are 5 cabins all with bathroom, hot shower, cable tv and wifi. There is a  huge and beautiful garden, a small kitchen and tiny museum. There is also space for camping. Everything is very well kept and the family is very friendly and welcoming. Helps with all diferent kinds of tours.

name: Playa Cabuyal
description: Beach front. Great sunset swim location. Light and soft sand, little shade, prone to rip tides and may be inappropriate for children swimming alone, security guard on duty at parking, mostly locals, road in from junction at Bar El Cruce is mostly paved but watch for a washed out section, medium to high clearance recommended, 4x4 not required.

name: Camping and Cabinas
description: Rustic campground with pool. Tent and vehicle camping (4000c/pp) with air conditioned cabins (15000c/2p) as well. Shared bathrooms and showers, pool was clear, clean and smelled of chlorine, decent shade relative to the climate, good trees for hammocks, food prep areas, wash basins, music system, all in a mixed state of neglect and little effort around sanitation but a genuine pura vida vibe.

name: wild camp in the rainforest
description:
wild camp near a river in the rainforest.

you have to follow a dirt road from the exit of Puerto Jiminez. Follow the sign  : "reserva Chimpol" x4 easy river crossing, better with a 4wheel drive. (we do it in the dry season )

there is a place for one or two vehicule along the river (be carrefull in the rain  season) or there is an other place in a higher position under the trees opposite to this spot.

if you continue the dirt road you pass in front of a farm and after that, the road is undrivable. But you can continu by foot, cross the river and there is a little trail that goes inside the rainforest. very gorgeous!

name: Hotel Puerto Viejo
description: Large hostel with tons of rooms and a big kitchen and small bar. They have parking and let us set up camp and use the facilities. Well kept place with a big common area. Three dogs onsite. Located right on the center of PV

name: MATUTE GAS
description:
A propane cylinders distribution and filling centre for campers. Matute is the owner, and he helped us because we did not have the necessary adapters. A genius!!!!

Un centro de distribución y llenado de cilindros de gas propano para campers. Matute es el dueño, y nos ayudó porque no teníamos los adaptadores necesarios. Un genio!!!!

name: Talleres ISAURO MURILLO
description:
If you drive a Land Rover, this place could be help you in this area. Lots of spare part and nice people lovers in all type of LR. Raphaël and Annette are kind people. Annette propose us to camp in her garden till end of work.
Phone number of Raphael (spanish only) : 695-5285.
Phone number of Annette Flottwell (she speak spanish, english, Germán and french) : +506 8828-3705
They did a good job. Not realy cheap but it Costa Rica Standard.

name: Casa de Napoleón
description:
FREE. Napoleón is a fisher with a nice house that let us camp our van in his garden. Right in front of the river. Toilets, shower and kitchen al for free.  You can hire Napoleon to take you fish 100kg Tarpons (dont know the price). 

GRATIS. Napoleón nos dejó estacionar la van en su jardín. Enfrente al río, muy lindo lugar. Cocina baño y duchas también gratis. Podes contratar a Napoleón a que te lleve a pescar tarpones de 100kg

name: Rio Claro Mechanic
description:
These guys were very helpful in finding what's wrong with our car. They have parts shop right across the street and one more in town so you know how much the parts are and if they have it.
They were very sorry they didn't figure out our problem right away and said we can sleep in front of the shop as they have a bathroom there. The main road is loud though. 
I don't know their hourly rate but they worked on our car for several hours over one and half day and we paid about C 60000.

name: Flor y bambu
description:
Very nice hotel with little bungalows, nice swimming pool in a luxurious garden.
very friendly staff

name: Hilary
description: Small soda on the side of the road not so many on that road friendly and helpful to choose with local dishes.

name: Tenorio Adventure Co.
description:
We met the owner of this place on the road nearby. He invited us to stay. 
The restaurant is open for breakfast and lunch till 3pm.
There is a huge area for camping behind the restaurant with outdoors showers, running water, toilets and WiFi.
We camped for free without eating in the restaurant. 
Recommend free place to stay.

name: La Olla Motocross track - best city view
description: This is a motorcycle and 4X4 track, so beware of noise, but we camped here for a race.  Not a formal campground, but we were charged 5,000 colones each.  The highlight is that this is an amazing view of San José, if you're into that sort of thing.  There are bathrooms, but no showers.  It was quiet at night except for some coyotes and there is ample level space to park.  There is a woman who lives at a little house on the northeast side of the track- she is who we paid.

name: Cabaña Corintos
description:
We met Rolando at the JSM station while getting LP Gas at Punta Arenas and he invited us to his Finca. What a place!! Middle of the mountains, full of monkeys and every other animals on their environment. They need some help getting the space more capable for camping so you can stay for free and give them a hand with it. The last KM from the road is dirt as you can imagine here in Costa Rica but we made it with no issues with our 29ft long class C. At the entrance there is space for 2 or 3 van and if you are in a 4*4 you can access inside. 
They have tons of fruit trees and also cultivate fish inside the Finca. We were able to help him gather the dinner there ;)
Around here you have a river with incredible Pozas and views from the top where you can see the Pacific. 
They don't speak English but welcome everyone here. 
Rolando's WhatsApp: +50672143370

name: Parking to hike Cerro Amigos
description:
Here is where you can park your rig if it is not 4x4 to do the hike to Cerro Amigos. The 4x4 road until the trailhead is tough and very steep.
The hike in the forest is super muddy (even in dry season) and with some obstacles but totally worth it!

name: Multiservicio / pay national park
description: The national park has to be payed by bank transaction. So here you can pay the ticket of the national park.

name: Mechanic behind gas station
description: We made an oil change and we switched the front and back tires here for a good price. The guy works really well and is very friendly! Recommended!

name: Ins instituto national de seguros
description: Insurance next to immigration desk de Costa Rica. $34 for 90 days which is the minimum. $44 for a car. There is an obligation to get it before customs,

name: wild camping by np
description: hidden from the road nice flat space for maybe 2 rigs  talked to rangers.  said it's ok. quiet place you can barely hear the road. you can use bathroom and take potable water from ranger station.  be prepared it gets really cold at night

name: Piguyo
description: Best pupusas I have ever had ($1 each ) , parking in restaurant $10 plus $3 for electricity , paid a tip because my rig is 28ft long , tight fit down the street if you are over 30ft you won’t fit in the side entrances  .... best place in El Salvador ( ps very clean no trash ) a cool surfing style community ... too bad was just passing through ... well worth checking out

name: Beside the police office
description:
Nice spot in a quiet park beside a police office.
We didn’t spoke to an officer but locals advised the place.
There are some shops, restaurant and bar close by.
In the morning we could use the toilets in the police office.

name: Parque Ecological Arenal
description:
The campground is in a nice area direct by a lake. There is a grassy patch where you place your vehicle but you will find nowhere a flat patch. Beside there is a 3-floor wooden construction without any wall. On the groundfloor there are some tables and benches where you can sit and eat on the 2 other floors there are built-up tents which you probably can hire. 

Toilets are not working you have to flush with water from a bucket. Showers are only cold. There is no electricity at the place which makes it very uncomfortable at a cold and rainy night and your torch isn't the best. 

We asked at the entrance for the fee and the keeper said 15 $ to us. We had to do some shopping in La Fortuna and when we came back, he said 30 $ because the 15 $ is only for one person. We asked to visit the place before paying which he rejected. We should have been warned since 30 $ is definitely too expensive. 

The last few meters to the area are very steep and narrow so it is not for sure that a big rig can manage that. We watched a normal campervan which had problems to come up.

name: Super Pali
description: Closest supermarket after border crossing. Pretty ample selection of food. Few parking spots.

name: Wildcamp in the jungle
description:
Good place to camp out and fall asleep listening to the sounds of the jungle. Very nice view over the jungle and very isolated. 

Dont forget your bug repellent though!!

name: Asia Hotel
description:
Cheap hotel very close to the border. Nice family is running the place. The rooms are not on the street side so not to noisy.
Rates are $10 per night. Private room + shower, fan and tv.
The restaurant next doors has good local meals for 2500col.
Our bicycles did fit in the room.

name: Cloud Forest pullout
description:
Flat pullout close to Selvatura and Monteverde reserve (both dont allow overnight parking) so good choice to visit those places.

Beautiful night, quiet and safe

name: ATM BCR La Cruz
description: Atm at La Cruz. Good option if the one at the border is not working

name: Casa Victoria
description: Nice hotel the owners speaks a bit if english - very friendly - this place very close to the airport and $60 inc breakfast nice rooms wifi

name: Servicentro La Palma
description: Safe place to sleep. Free and clean bathrooms and shower. A little noisy because the trucks. Has a little shop that closes at 8 PM.

name: Giant tree, arbol de la paz
description: very interesting stop, by the road, giant old tree.

name: Miguel surf camp
description:
Really beautiful garden on the beach on a small island (1mn crossing ferry boat, 4000colones). 

You can rent a very nice room for the price of a basic camping in Costa Rica (12000colones for two people). 

Miguel is really nice and helpful, he gives surf lessons right on the beach in front of your room, his wife is very nice as well and can cook some good meals for you! The whole place is really clean, you will find either rooms with common bathrooms or private rooms, and a well equipped kitchen. Much cleaner than the other campgrounds we visited in Costa Rica. 

Probably possible to put a tent but difficult to get there with your camper van (ferry boat and tight access between the trees). Definitely recommend this great place (see the pictures in booking, or contact Miguel in WhatsApp +50671024521

name: Riverspot
description:
Nice spot next to a river close to Monteverde. Not as windy as other places we tried out in the area! 

No facilities and next to a road (we didnt hear any cars passing the whole time we stayed) but nice and tranquil.

name: Fresas Maye
description:
Perferct view from the city douwn the montain. 
We asked the owner Marcos Francisco do park and sleep with our car with rooftent, and he said it was OK. Ofered clean bathrooms even gave the bathrooms keys for us use through the night.
Has cheeses, wines, sweets, bread and al kind of groceries to by here.
Fresh strawberries. Coffee shop.
Here you can buy your ticket to visit the Poás Volcano for CRC 10‘000.
Quiet and safe place to spend the night and sleep with a perfect view.

name: Indigenous etnoturism place - Terraba - El Descanso
description: A local indigenous community there. Friendly and really interesting people would host you if you take some tour with them... And you definitely should!! It is a different experience from the main tourist activities in Costa Rica. Cultural tours are diverse and all really interesting (chocolate making, petroglyphs, cascades, traditional carving, ...). Plus they offer meals with them in their houses at night. Highly recommended!!!

name: Etnoturism centrer - Indegenous Terraba - El Descanso
description: A local indigenous community, Terraba. Friendly and really interesting people A different experience from the main tourist activities in Costa Rica. Cultural tours are diverse and all really interesting (chocolate making, petroglyphs, cascades, traditional carving, ...). Plus they offer meal in their houses at night. Highly recommended if you want to discover really nice people and their culture off the beaten track!!!

name: Isolated from the road
description:
Nice spot with sunset and sunrise view! Beware though; it can be pretty windy!!! 

Isolated from the road and.... free!

name: PN Los Quetzales
description:
This is the correct ubication of the park. Open 8 am to 4 pm. Don't expect to see quetzales! The gamekeeper told us is almost impossible to see them in this place even when the name of the park is Los quetzales ¬¬ There's only a trail of 2km out of the park but we didn't see anything. You don't need to wait the park open to do the trail. 
Good place to pass the night. quiet and safe.
Internet of the restaurant, very kind people in Chespirito.

name: Cerrajería Tecnillaves
description:
Helpful if you end up losing your car keys and need to make a copy. They also deal remotes in case you also need an additional one.
Copias de llave para vehiculos. También puedes obtener controles remoto adicionales por si fuese necesario

name: Pacifika Centro Dental
description:
Very good dentist. The standard are like in Europe and its quite cheap. Very friendly doctor, who gave us an appointment on a short notice. Business card from the dentist at the photo. 

This gps point is the crossing. But you should see it from there.

name: Lubricantes Primo
description:
All kinds of repairs. Came for an oil change for a Ram2500 and was about thenonly place where i could find the oil needed.
Does everything from oil changes to transmission repairs.

name: Casa Mandala
description: Casa Mandala is the private home of. Costa Rican Plant Based/ vegan chef.  Inside the main house she offers a room with a/c, private bathroom and a spacious space. House is inside a gated property were car and equipment will be safe.

name: Beach Camping between Manzanillo and Playa Hermosa
description:
Pull out along dirt road right on a beautiful beach, way less crowded than Playa Hermosa (south) or Manzanillo (north).
During the days cars and ATV pass but as soon as it’s dark it’s quiet and nothing but the sound of the waves rolling in.

name: LoCoworking
description: Nice co-working space run by two French journalist in downtown Samara. Has AC and strong WiFi

name: Restaurante Sol y Luna
description: Carribbean Restaurant along the way to the Caribbean coast. Nice atmosphere

name: Ferreteria Iguana Verde
description: One of the few places in Central America where it's possible to buy gas for camping stove

name: Lubricentro La Garita
description: Great place to get an oil change.  The guy who owns it is super helpful and it’s close to a campground.

name: Vista Cola de Ballena
description:
Good view point of the wail tail. FREE! Bad road

Buena vista de la cola de la ballena. Gratis! Camino bastante feo

name: Rio Celeste
description:
Free view of Rio Celeste

Hermosa vista del Rio celeste

name: Quiet spot by Rio Corrogres
description:
Nice little parking in Santa Ana. Close to a proxi market and the neighbors said there was no problems to park there. 
There is a little river passing down and there is plenty of space for big rigs.

name: Taller Vega
description:
Super nice and helpful family garage in Escazú.

We went to so many mechanics all around to try to find discs for our Chevy and nobody could find them or it was highly overpriced and they would say the job would take 2 days to do. 

After one call, Ricardo got us the part  instantly  and for a fair price. Pito made a fast and great job, and in the same morning, we could continue our journey in peace! 


Highly recommendable place to check out! They do American Brands and Land Rovers a lot. 

Phone: 2228-1950 , 8384-2720
Costado sur, Piscina del liceo de Escazú

name: Casa de la Morpho Azul
description:
mariposario where you can admire 30 species of butterflies, including many morpho azul. 11$ entrance. 9am-4pm everyday.
may be hard to turn around for big rigs.
we arrived at 4pm and it was raining. we asked and they let us stay for free in their parking, secure, flat, nice temperature and fast wifi. 
hot shower and toilet free as well. they even asked us if we wanted to stay in a room (always for free).
and beautiful place!

name: Steakhouse bbq grilled meats
description: Delicious!!!! Had the ribeye with mashed potatoes and salad, was less than $12. Wine is a bit pricey, and no prices are listed for drinks. Beautiful place and excellent service. Steak was slightly over cooked but was still so delicious it didn’t matter.

name: Parking close to the beach
description:
Camping on the beach or on the parkings right on the beach is prohibited; this parking is 10m from it (on the left before you arrive on the main beach's parking) and you are allowed to stay there for the nights. There might be a fee to park during the day: guys who watch out for the cars will ask you 1000col or 2$. But since you're camping there you can negotiate not to pay (we paid nothing during the 3 days we spent there).

Very safe parking spot, very quiet at night, flat ground.
Perfect to go surfing (at high tide) or just enjoy the Playa Grande. 50m before, on the road, the green house is a tourist center and you can get free water and access to toilets.
There is also a craft brewery next to it (in case you miss IPA).

Parking is right next to the hotel Tortugas (I let you guess the password to their wifi).


For surfers: this parking is in front of the main surf spot, kinda crowded. You can go a bit on the right or left for less people and smaller waves.

name: El buen sazón (very good)
description: Very good restaurants, menu for 3000 colones, with a natural juice. Very very good and nice people. Good wifi. Pet friendly and very clean. Highly recommended.

name: Hostel California
description: We were alloud to stay in the parking of the hostel for 10$/rig/day. It's close to everything and has a green backyard where we could put our table and chairs. We didn't ask for using the bath, it's might be possible, but there is a water-hose that you can use to fill the watertank.

name: Road to playa penca
description:
Busy during the day as people go the beach, much better than playa hermosa/coco.  At the end of the road there is security until sunset as petty crime is common in this area. We asked if we could sleep here; camping is technically not allowed but they let us stay as long as we didn't park right next to the road.
The property is gated, 
there is a security guard at the entrance and they stay there all night, we gave him a few dollars in the morning before leaving. A few cars passed by overnight but it is relatively quiet. the locals advised us to  park rather close to the security guard at the entrance, the end of the road being more risky for robberies/thefts. Fires are strictly prohibited.

name: Hotel Yamural
description: Clean room with private bathroom. Coffee, drinks, snacks available for a fee. 11000 colon for two people. Right across from firestation

name: Hotel de Montaña El Pelicano
description:
Very beautiful Hotel with rooms and Cabañas in an awesome scenery! They let us camp in their parking lot next to the pool, which is far away from the street and therefore very quiet. We paid 15USD including the pool, the WiFi, the toilets and hot showers. 
BUT: the way to the pool is steep and the last meters are grassy. Because it rained here the last three days we nearly didn’t make it up the hill (Volkswagen T4 Syncro). Not doable for bigger campers. Just cars and vans. Tent camping possible.

name: Cascada Bribri
description: Linda Waterfall with refreshing pool below perfect for bathing, 3km from the road, by gravel road, and then more 300 meters by footpath. Recommended the visit. Nobody in the entrance. Nobody at the entry. Free --- Linda Cascada con piscina refrescante abajo perfecta para bañarse, a 3km de la carretera, por camino de ripio, y después más 300 metros por sendero. Recomendable la visita. Nadie en la entrada. Gratuito

name: Taller Quico
description:
We went to taller vega first (see on iOverLander), but he didn't have time for us and directed us to this other taller.
Quico is very kind and nice. We were kinda in a hurry so he accepted to help us immediately.
We needed to change the front breaks, which he did very quickly after getting the parts in San Jose. He also revised a few things on the car, which was very helpful. to us
He didn't try to make up any false issues and gave us a fair price. We paid 30000colones for the two front brakes (our car is Dodge caravan and the parts were not easy to find) + 10000 for manwork.

His garage is a very friendly place: it has a kitchen and many people come by to say hi, chat, eat...
Quico also offered us a papaya smoothie and some peanuts.

We recommend!

name: Heolicas - view of Santa Ana
description:
Amazing view of Santa Ana, especially by night. There is a small public road where you can park and spend the night close to the wind turbine park. People are coming to enjoy the view and the nature but by night it gets super calm. 
The road to come here is super steep but in very good condition: no need of 4 wheels drive. 
No facilities but pure nature.

name: Beach of Puerto Viejo
description: Stayed here for a night, because our hostel host told us, that we can’t enter Playa Conchal by car, but this would be the same beach, just divided by a river in rain season. We parked right before the beach in the shade of some trees. There is a restaurant, but it didn’t look inviting and the toilets, which you can use until 6pm for 500 Colones, were very dirty and run down. The owner live in the same house and will be there during the night. But because they weren’t very friendly it didn’t feel like an advantage. There is no village nearby, just the restaurant and another house. The close by Playa Mina is much more inviting, but harder to reach with low clearance and without anyone around.

name: Waterfall Llanos de Cortez
description: Beautiful waterfall with lake to swim and a beach in the middle of the forest with monkeys. Quite crowded, but ok because the space is ample. There is an official entrance, from the city hall, which costs 7 dollars (children over 6 years old pay 4) and the lifeguard - which is at the waterfall - said it has toilets and showers. There is another entrance to a private property, which charges 4 dollars (child $ 2), with only simple toilet. We entered through this one, where a group of residents of the region received us and one of them - who would be the owner - said that we could stay overnight without paying extra.

name: Quiet place on a quiet road
description:
After being delayed on the panam. by fog and roadwork, we looked for a place to spend the night.
We ended up parking here, a very quiet spot. No facilities, just a flat ground next to a blue building. No one bothered us and we bothered no one.
The road there is very nice, and the surroundings are very peaceful.
In the morning we went for a small hike in the forest nearby and had a wonderful time

name: Osa Tucan
description: We met the owner on the ferry ride over. We were charged 8USD for two people to camp on the property, access to bathroom (NICE shower), kitchen and wifi. Rooms also available though not sure the cost. Not busy so we were able to hang out on hammocks in front of empty guest rooms. whasapp: 0050672702872

name: Camping Casa Viva
description:
This place is a very nice camping, clean with free access to the beach of National Park ballena. (50 meters) The owner is very helpful and the place is full of Mangos and iguanas! Nice beach break. Facilities are basic but very clean.

Tel :85554223  Luis arce 
3000 per person per night.

name: Piscinas y rancho las tilapias
description: Nice campspot (not specifically a campground but the owners are very welcoming to campers) for 5000 Colón (8,33US$) per vehicle and night. Comes with two pools (one to swim and one for kids) and a beautiful green garden with a big natural pool. Roxanna also has small fish farms on the property and she offers food like the typical tilapias (delicious!) in the restaurant. You can also hike up the mountain if you follow the road and the entry of the National Park Tenorio is just 20min away. It is pet friendly but be aware that they have some dogs on the property. The town with shops is very close (3min by car). Devices can be charged in the restaurant. You will also find a small sink to wash dishes in the restaurant area. Clean toilets and showers are next to the pool. Very friendly people! Highly recommended!

name: bajamar
description:
nice spot ocean view quiet 
safe place no problem to stay

name: playa Puerto viejo
description:
good place to stay.
safe. 3 m from the sea

name: Hippie landia
description: This place has some of the best coffee in town lots of handicrafts and vintage stuff,  you can ask for advice about the city amenities, just great people and cool stuff.

name: Slow Monkey Hostel
description:
Nice and calm hostel, above a supermarket. Dorms with fan for 10$, with A/C for 15$.
Toilet and shower in the rooms. Big kitchen, terrace and a small pool. Beer for 1000c, but you can bring your own. Parking space besides the supermarket: not really safe, but away from the main road.

name: Pochotel/Cerro Alto Lodge
description: Hilltop cabinas with "rustic cabin like" feel to rooms. Restaurant with 365 degree views including Volcano Turialba, Cerro Chirripo & Volcán Irazu. Big flat parking available for 3-4 rigs. Our room had a double bed and 2 twin beds for 25000 colones with breakfast included (coffee, fruit, eggs, beans, tortilla)- good for a family. Camping available covered or uncovered. Warmish water in rooms and wifi available in lounge area. Located in cloud forest so we saw many birds & Amelio (owner) was kind enough to identify them for us. Very welcoming owners!

name: Surf Lessons with Tony
description:
Tony is a private instructor & offers surf lessons at Playa Negra and other locations in Puerto Viejo. He is very familiar with the beaches and surf of Costa Rica and is working locally to create a flag system so tourists can know the level of surf to expect (beginner, intermediate, dangerous surf, etc.). He doesn't have a brick & mortar building but you can contact him via WhatsApp to schedule lessons.
Whatsapp: ±506 6478 0745

name: Hotel Venecia
description: Hotel in the center of the village. 6000 cr the cheap room

name: Cabinas Buenos Aires
description: Quaint, simple rooms with everything thing you could need. Extremely clean. Vicky and her husband are warm and welcoming hosts. There are a total of 6 hotel rooms each with covered parking on concrete. Covered parking clearance looks to be 3.5 meters. Additional rooms available without parking. Large gravel area for parking rigs. 13000 Colones for a nice night in an air conditioned room with cable and a warm shower. Wifi available but did not use- unsure of strength . Walking distance to Frog Heaven (200m). Per Vicky, overland vehicles welcome!

name: Open gravel parking next to gas station
description: Space used for parking, we asked at the petrol station and they said it was fine to stay for the night. They have a small shop and garages open 24/7.

name: Suretka
description:
Nice place in the river bank. no problem at all. very safe. nice people. start of the boat to the native community Bribrí.

sur la rive de la riviere. coin tranquille aucun soucis. d'ici partent les bateaux vers les différentes communautés Bribrí.

name: Evacuation route next to Arenal NP's entrance
description: Flatish road next to Arenal NP's entrance which was quiet besides the jungle's sounds. The police came to check on us and a "pura vida" sent them on their way. Not much traffic on the main road during the night so overall quiet night.

name: Facing Emergencia Promedica
description: We spent one night here and it is a bit darker and quieter than at the park and there is a soda open 24/7 with restrooms for 300C just across the road. Downside is they get the occasional clients in the middle of the night on their way back from parties/ bars who seem to race their cars across town and are in jolly mood but they rarely stayed more than 10 minutes. It felt safe and there are many other streets spots like these where to boondock in town and all amenities are within walking distance.

name: Choza In Hostel
description:
9$ in the 6 bed dorm with A/C (A/C just during the night). Hot showers! Breakfast included. Kitchen/fridge available, lots of place to hang out, hammocks, etc.
Parking only available in front, but reception is open 24/7, so it’s pretty secure.

name: Mirador whale tail
description: Nice flat place, pull out. Steep Gravel road to go here.  Quiet at night and beautifull view on thé océan

name: Laguna don Manuel
description:
Nice place to camp with several hikes
5000 col pp.
Lot of places with tables, clean toilets, cold shower

name: Cowork Puerto&Co
description:
Excelente cowork place to take some coffe and be online with you laptop. good wifi, Nice place, a little bit expensive but worth the value.

it's at second floor. there are coach to hang to.

name: Sloth watching: Bogarin Trail
description:
Entrance to the trails to see the sloths, red eyed frogs, toucans and other animals.
This entrance is on a side road and costs 15$ or 9000c (colones cheaper)   for an unguided tour of about 2 hours (or as long as you like) You get a band so you can enter multi-times the whole day. 

It can be hard to find the sloths! Around noon there are a lot of groups, so just go watch where they are looking into the trees...

name: Natural Bridge from Fiscustree
description: An extraordinary natural bridge from a fiscus tree. You can climb on it and shoot good fotos. It's a little bit hidden. From the street you have to go right (coming from the terminal) on a little path in the woods. You will see the tree after 2 min. walk.

name: Gas Express
description: A place to fill or exchange gas bottles. Had to wait 2 days to fill. Didn't want to exchange because bottles seemed to be very old and rusty. 7000 C to refill. All the gas stations before didn't offer to refill/exchange anymore because they changed the law in costa rica

name: Toilets and showers
description:
Toilets 500 Colon per person
Showers 1000 Colon per person
Close to the beach. Accessible via sideroad that goes to the beach. They have a sign.

name: La bomba: Free showers, toilets and water
description: There are ok cold showers and toilets for free. Also potable water.

name: Wide Mouth Frog Backpackers
description: Nice clean place to stay. swimming pool, communal kitchen. meals also available at restaurant. friendly helpful manager and staff.  good for any budget. double rooms plus dormitories, parked camper safely on street with security overnight.

name: cold water Canyon
description:
Nice little canyon with cold water (even end of dry season) and possibility to jump at 5 or 12m. 
To come here look at the other tourist attraction sign I created near by.

name: PARKING cold water canyon
description:
great camping!

Here is the parking for the cold water canyon (see other tourist attraction point nearby)

Some parking space on the street before the river crossing. 
You need to go up the stream
Pass the fence at the little pass through on the left side of the stream.
Always follow the path till you get to the canyon.

Stay always close to the stream on the left side walking stre⁹am upwards. You never need to go somewhere steep uphill - that's a wrong path.

name: Taller Arturo
description:
Very good and thourough mechanic.

Friendly and cheap, will not scam you. Parts are being brought from the other side of the bridge, in Palmar. You can get them yourself or he has service to pick them up for some payment. 

Very Recommendable.

name: Quetzal tree n.2
description: Groups come here every morning between 5:30/7am to spot quetzales. They typically eat fruits from trees and stay put for 20 minutes until they move to another branch/ tree. We saw 3 of them this morning. Hotels charge you a fortune (70USD for 2 adults and 2 kids) to come here so come on your own and join any group in the search for the rare birds. If someone asks you to pay to enter either negetiote the entrance price or say you came with the group. No one asked us anything the 2 mornings we came here. There are few places where to boondock around here, mostly gravel parking lots including one for big rigs such as unimogs 0.5km down the road from here. BThere is a brilliant hike to a waterfall 1.5km south of here on the left which goes for 2km through an amazing forrest with slippery ladders (most of which are missing stairs) and a hanging bridge. A bit demanding specially if it rained but we managed with kids of 2&4yo.

name: Good & economical restaurant-Soda El Garabito
description: Hours are 6am-8pm Sunday through Monday. Meals starting at less than $4 U.S $ (c2300). Great spot if you don’t need A/C. Great price for the amount of food. Good as well if you need a quick meal. And if you don’t see something on the counter that you want, just ask

name: Arábigos Coffee House
description: Great place to taste a high quality coffee made in Costa Rica.

name: Arenal 1968
description: Great private place with very good infra structure 1 mile before Arenal Volcano National Park. Same landscape with trails and hikes around forests, lakes all the way to the top of a lava tube from Arenal Volcano. Awesome views from the volcano and Lake Arenal. Might see some Mono monkeys and other small animals. Same ticket price of the National Park but better infra structure.

name: El Callejero
description: Awesome casual food done by a very talented chef! Gourmet burgers, salads, octopus, and Mexican food + rib eye and others. Simple but with high quality and reasonable prices. Don't miss this place!!

name: Playa Conchal
description:
Beautiful beach only reachable by foot through Brasilito beach or Puerto viejo beach
Clear water, white sand and almost anyone at it. Lot's of Conchas (Sea shells) and great spots for snorkeling.

name: Tapioca Brazilian Food
description:
Amazing brazilian food this "tapioca" (similar to a wrap)!! Starch extracted from the cassava root filled with either sweet or savory toppings, making it the ideal meal at any time! extremely friendly staff, great prices, and many more delicious options to choose from!!
Gluten free and Vegan options!

name: Café & Macadamia
description: Very good restaurant by the road with great food (try the boness trout with cannelloni and red sauce) and freshly baked pastries. Lots of parking lot and trees around. Recommended!

name: Roots Bakery
description: Very good bakery that serves coffee, different types of bread, sweeties, juices and smoothies. Downtown Samara.

name: Buena Vista Hotel e Restaurant
description:
Great place to eat very well done food (sandwiches, salads, pasta and snacks) in front of Espadilla Beach.
Great service and relaxed lounge. Not expensive. We also overnight here outside the parking lot with security. Gave the guard 3 dollars per night.

name: Ranchito Surf Spot
description: Cool place with good waves in case Pavones is too big. It's like a little Pavones for beginners and intermediate surfers.

name: Hotel Casa Amarilla
description: Great hotel literally around the corner from the Costa Rica - Panama border crossing. Fenced, secure parking lot. Clean, big room with aircon. Very comfortable beds & pillows (we had room 1). Good wifi. Cost C21,500 in March 2019.

name: VET Pet Cafe San Jose
description: We needed to get exit papers for our dogs to leave Costa Rica because one of their rabies vaccines expired and was renewed here. Dr Raquel speaks English and did the exam the same day that we called. The export papers get stamped at an official office and she had it all done for us and ready for pick up the next day! Great vet and great service.

name: Los Chorros Cascadas
description:
The official road to Los Chorros is temporary closed, but this house has its private path to them. The owner charges 3000$col per car. Amazing waterfalls, worth stopping.

You can camp on his property for another 3000$col. The viewpoint is amazing, super calm, we loved it. You can use his restroom and shower. Enjoy!

name: Camping palm field
description: Nice silent place, big field, closy to ocean, friendly lady owner.

name: El Sueno B&B
description: Great Hostel/B&B right in Monteverde townsite. $20 USD for a private room with attached bathroom, breakfast included. Secure parking for motorcycles behind the building. Also parking for a few regular sized vans or SUVs. Would not be able to fit tall vehicles. Great find in what is otherwise a very costly area. Wifi also included, although it is typical Central American wifi and thus cuts out every now and then.

name: Heladería La Parada
description:
Flavia and Mariano have an ice cream parlor, which by the way, they have delicious ice cream, and they live behind in a little house.  They have ample space to camp with the van, and they like to receive travelers.  There is a shower and bathroom available. // 
Flavia y Mariano tienen una heladería, que por cierto, tienen unos helados riquísimos, y ellos viven atrás en una casita. Tienen un espacio amplio para acampar con la furgoneta, y les gusta recibir viajeros. Si les apetece conocer a esta hermosa pareja y a sus 4 perros, no se lo piensen y vengan a visitarles! Hay una ducha y baño disponible.

name: Don Juan 3 in 1 Coffee, Cacao and Sugar Cane Tour
description: Amazing tour and tastings, plus all you can drink coffee at the end. The tour guides are super animated and funny. We learned a lot about all three crops and everything tasted lovely! Very hands on too! The tour is $35pp. We also asked our guide about staying the night and he said we could by the home on the finca.

name: Taller Sigfredo Murillo
description:
Garage specialist for brakes and clutches.
very nice staff...very helping and honest...

name: Blum Showroom
description: Great place if you need to replace cabinet hardware such as concealed hinges, gas struts, drawer slides, etc. they also sell cabinets doors if you’re looking to build/renovate. Wilbert is super sweet and helpful. It’s an industrial complex strip and they are located in workshop #29

name: JSM servicentro
description: Here you can refill tour RV tank. us$12 for 3-4 tank

name: Cabinas Anita
description:
It is a hostel that has a camping area and offers all the necessary services for a motorhome or camper. It could also be used for tents. The family that manages the place is extremely friendly, they like to talk and share stories. They also serve dinner if guests wish. Super recommendable to stay in this place!

Es un hostal que tiene zona de camping y ofrece todos los servicios necesarios para un motorhome o camper. También podría servir para carpas. 
La familia que administra el lugar es extremadamente amable, gustan de conversar y compartir historias. También sirven cena si los huéspedes lo desean. Súper recomendable quedarse en este lugar!

name: Chalet Orosi
description:
THE place to stay after few days at the beach or in the mountains! Fresh, no mosquitos, a little paradise in a beautiful garden. 
3 dogs & 3 cats live here, all of them are adorable and quiet. Maëlle, the owner, lives here since always. She speaks perfect English / Spanish and French. There is a wash machine pour 5$ /3000c per load. 
She offers a spot for a vehicle. Might be 2 vehicle if you travel together. 10$ /6000c per vehicle. 
Please call Maëlle before to be sure you will get the spot! +506 2533 3268 
----- 
LE spot qui fait du bien après la plage ou même la montagne ! Au frais, pas de moustique, un petit coin de paradis dans un superbe jardin. 
Il y a 3 chiens et 3 chats sur la propriété, tous adorables. Maëlle, la propriétaire, vit ici depuis toujours et parle parfaitement Anglais / Espagnol et Français. Il y a même une machine à laver pour 5$ /3000c par load. 
Elle met à disposition une place pour un véhicule, éventuellement 2 si vous voyagez ensemble. 10$ /6000c par véhicule. 
Idéalement, appelez Maëlle avant de venir pour vous assurer de son accueil : +506 2533 3268

name: Casa del Viento
description: Decent hotel in town - $30 for a room/ night - pool - breakfast - nice bar - middel of town - nice overview to the bay accross the street - free wifi - the owner speaks english.

name: Parking @ NP-Entrance
description: Parking at the entrance of the National Park. 2000 C/night. Flat area between road and jungle. Baños of the NP-Entrance available 8-17 o'clock. Kölbi-Internet-Reception. You can sleep in your car or even a tent. Rocky surface, so tent is maybe not that confortable. Nothing fancy, but not expensive and we even saw a coati the moment we arrived :)

name: El Mirador Osa
description:
Parked and slept in our VW on the restaurant's property a week before the new owner reopened it. He did still make us breakfast.
Luis is a very nice guy and lets you stay on his property. Be so kind and show your gratitute by consuming something in his restaurant.
Ask where you need to walk up for 4min to get 2 splendid lookout points.
With a 4x4 you can drive up and camp there after asking at the restaurant.
He has 6 very afordable cabins at just 28usd/night, with pool.

name: Bajo bosque drake Cabinas
description: Very Nice place ! It’s 2 little home for 2 person it’s perfecte but you can coming for 4 persons ! The guy is very very Nice ! In this place you can watch monki, boa, toucan, ... if you are luky !

name: Nauyaca Falls
description:
wo ways to get to this beauriful waterfalls.
1) Entrance on the paved main road. Pay 8usd/pp and hike about 4km.
2) Drive about 7km on good but steep gravel road road from Tinamastes to San Salvador. Park next to soccer field of Iglesia (church) San Salvador. Walk on road and later on trail to Waterfalls.
Landowner seems to be opening up a competition to entrance 1 by building a new road access and parking lots. No one charged us.

name: Naucaya waterfall
description:
Update 2022: this access costs now 20 USD per person (ride on 1 way per 4x4 track) or 30 USD (ride both ways per 4x4 track)

Park here to walk less than 2km to Naucayes Waterfalls. Road to park closer to waterfalls too steep and muddy even for 4WD at the beginning of rainy season.

It is steep and muddy so use decent shoes otherwise you'll end up walking barefoot.

After walking about 800m on road, you enter private property with sign saying 'do not enter without ticket'. No one there to charge us. Land owner seems to be building new road access and parking lot. Lots of work left, because road is far too steep and muddy. Maybe he will just be operating in dry season, if he operates at all.

name: Taller Muñoz, for Travellers especially VW
description:
Manuel is a very good, trustworthy and very helpfull car mechanic. His workshop is simple but his skills exceeded our expectations. VW fan and enjoys what he does. Is very knowledgable where to find spare parts, within Costa Rica or different car model. If not available in the country Manuel in many cases finds a local guy to fabricate it before having to order them from abroad. VW Oldtimer owners come from San Jose to work on them. Has a passion to restore Combis, Vanagon and Syncros.

His dad works in the same field focused on carburators.
Reach him at: +506 87910777

You can camp on the workshop grounds. We were offered water and shower and could even do our laundry. As you can see very, very helpfull but please be gratefull.

name: Lavanderia Sanchez
description: Very good service, fast and clean, here in CR laundries are really expensive but we got a good price here and good service, so totally recommended if you go to Quepos, run by a young tico family with a lovely baby, José the owner is really kinf and helpful.

name: Camping Cola Ballena
description: 24 hours open. Good place, nearby the beach, 20mts. 12$ per person the night

name: Los Cafetales Eco Lodge
description:
Eco Lodge in the San Ramón mountains, very close to the city center at only 9.4km.
We have equipped cabins, more than 5 areas for all types of camping, restaurant, internet access, showers, restrooms and all amenities.
In addition to being an Eco Lodge we are a Gourmet Coffee production farm, we have coffee tours available throughout our Finca that has a lot of flora and fauna.
Much privacy, security and peace, ideal to live with nature, coffee and Costa Rican traditions.

name: cheap restaurant
description: If you want to eat in a cheap place near Casco Viejo, that's your place ! You choose the panamanean specialties presented like in a cafeteria. Breakfast for less than 3$, Tea or coffee included. Lunch less than 5$. Free water. We went there for the dinner and we paid 5.40$ for two ?!

name: Local coffee
description:
2 years ago Christian started to package up and sell the coffe which his parents and maybe also grandparents always used to sell to wholesellers.

Many farmers in the area do produce coffee but are still selling their harvest to wholesellers.

The red coffee bags called Café Ventisqueros are taken with their familiy pick up truck to be sold to the surounding hotels restaurants all the way to a Super BM in Quepos.

He sells 500g for 2500colones.

Tel.: +506 8661 9765.

name: Honda Motorcycles Store
description:
Oficial Honda Motos Store. 
+506-2680-4662

name: Honda Motorcycles Store
description:
Official Honda Motos Store.
Great Service, same as the one in Lberia City.
+506-2680-4662

name: Truchero Cocolisos
description:
Trout farm with restaurant. A small family business very friendly serving you trout either fried or grilled.
They grow the trouts from in 9 months from 2cm baby size to about 25cm eatable size. If you want you can fish them yourself.
3500 colones for one trout with french fries, rice and salad plus a natural juice.Cash only.
Open friday, Saturday and Sunday till 17:00 or 18:00 depending on how busy the day is.

name: Truchero Don Juan
description:
Trout with 2 side dishes 3500-4500 colones.
wifi available
Trouts are bought full sized and fished for the clients to eat. Used to grow them from baby size but had too many losses because of animals eating his crop.
Open all week.

name: good trees for hammaks
description:
vary nice place next to the beech
good parking easy to set up a camp 
vary quiet no sand bugs around on this beach

name: Hotel del Rio
description: 12.000 /n for private room with bathroom, hot shower and fast wifi. nothing special but everything I needed. Cheepest I could find around here. Restaurant across the street, bikes fit in the rooms, cars on the enclosed parking lot.

name: Truchería Los Lagos
description:
7000 colones for Trout Menu
Soup
Salad
Trout with french fries
Dessert
Natural Juice


Seems pricey in comparison with Trout places in San Gerado de Rivas, but it is worth the difference as you get more variety to fill your belly to the rim.

See pictures.
Very nice old lady owns and still runs this place.

name: Cabañas el Bosque
description:
6 cabins with scenic views of the volcano Turrialba. Alejo is a very nice owner and lets you stayin your camper and you'll get:

Outdoor shower
Big and deep pool soon to be heated
toilets
decent wifi
power plugs in common area
breakfast
parking lot not 100% flat for campers

We were cold and wet and decided to splurge after 5 weeks in our van and got a big cabin with kitchenette for 30.000C. Normal price 34.000, weekends 38.000.

For camping he is thinking of charging 30usd/van. You'll sure get him down to market prices.

Beautiful 1km footpath with the chance to see Tukan, smooth, monkeys and many birds

www.cabañaselbosque.com
alejo.cab.elbosque@gmail.com
+506 8432 5125

name: Cabinas Claribel
description: Small rooms to have past the night, some rooms equipped with A/C, fresh water, ideal place to be in the town of La Virgen. Camping Not allowed.

name: Kincho's Pizza
description:
Needed a quick lunch and stopped here thinking that a 3900colones for a 8 slice pizza (filled two hungry people) is reasonable. When paying we were told that the menu prices are for half pizzas. Got to talk to the manager and ended up paying the price in the menu.

Fotos of menu attached you decide if you want to take advantage of their faulty menu.

Pizza was with plenty of topping and good cheese. Their meat toppings are average but likely won't be better in hardly any Pizzeria for Ticos considering the crappy ham the supermarkets offer on this country.

name: Hostel Villa San Miguel
description: 10000 pppn, beautiful hostel with fully equipped kitchen, warm shower and I think a very good vieuw of the valley, but it's misty. Perfect for cutting this 40k climb in two and postpone death by not cycling through the mist with trucks on the road. Steep downhill to get here, so I hope I'll manage back up tomorrow. there's a small store at the intersection with the main road.

name: La Casona Del Cafetal
description:
Upscale Restaurant and Cabins which are very popular on Sunday for their all you can eat buffet for 12.500 colones.

We arrived with our Van looking for a campspot and ran into a wedding party. The security guard (Xiamora) was very excited to ask for permision for us to stay the night. It is a 500m drive from the road through coffee plantation to the restaurant. Guard closes gate to access road between 20:00 and 21:00.

Cost of stay, 0 colones.

You can check out the lake in the morning and on weekends run into a 82 year old man fishing shrimps and selling the kg at 4000colones.

name: Riverside Wild Camp
description:
Fantastic view, next to a little potable river on a very quiet and safe road. Road is an access road to a hydro powerplant and is therefore not transited. Stayed there - a very quiet night with campfire and had only 2 mountainbikers and one car pass and enjoyed the sunrise view the next morning.

Spot even fits 4-5 big rigs. Access from South is about 4km on very new asphalt and than about 4km on good gravel road. You will go through two gates which seem to be from ICE and seem to be always open. Once you cross the paved river crossing you arrive at the wild camp.

Access from north - we did not try out - but we were told by a local afterwards that 500m north from Miguel's wild camp there is even a better view.

After the night up there go down to Rio Macho for a swim and breakfast.

name: Eduardo
description:
Eduardo is a traffic policeman who has a gas delivery business.

He took the time to fill our 9 Bernzomatic 1lb cylinders and paid him 6colones for gas and the significant time it took. We brought our own adapter to pass gas frpm a 20lb cylinder into our 1lb Bernzomatic cylinders. He is a very nice guy and is interested to buy an adapter for himself. See pictures of gas tank and adapter (black plastic) we used.
Best to call him on +506 8356 8518 as he could be on duty when you get there.

name: Memo's restaurant and Cabins
description:
Memo runs a restaurant and basic cabins. He let us camp on his land and use the hot shower and bathroom of a cabin which he was repainting at this moment. Cost 5000colones for one camper with two people.

Many free running chicken, roosters, ducks and 3 friendly dogs. Some ponds and rain shelters to hang out.

Memo you will recognize by his big mustache.

name: Solera Animal Center
description:
A large clean veterinary clinic/hospital where there are English speaking staff members. 

They were fast and efficient when we needed to get stitches for our dog after she was attacked. 

They also sell dog food, treats, collars, leashes etc. 

They also have wifi, so while nervously waiting you can be occupied. It’s nearby coffee shops and restaurants.

name: Bici tienda & café (bike rent)
description: $10/day bike rent, decent and we'll maintained simple bikes (decathlon frames, cheap series, but decent dange gearing). I'm a here with my bike, but picked up a fried to go cycling through the vulcano area. Bike preformed just as well as the 30 dollar/day high end bikes you can rent. Very friendly owner, supplied extra tire/helmet/reflection vest/lights at no charge. Highly recommend.

name: Bar y Restaurante Lo Que Tu Quieras
description:
On the left side of Fresas Maye parking lot there is a road up to the restaurant and bar. Camping there is nicer than at Fresas Maye because it is more secluded and protected from the wind. 2-3 level spots for vans and fantastic city view from the bar and its terrace. Fran the manager and co-owner of the bar was very interested in our van and showed us were to refill our water tank.

Toilets open as long as the bar is open and this depends on the hour their last clients leave.

Fran said that he is about to finish a camp spot with, shower, toilet, campfire spot and shelter and is planning to charge 4000colones per person.

End of August 2019 his first cabin will be finished up in case camping ends up too cold for you.

As of June 2022 they are charging 25
00/person per night to camp in the parking lot.

name: Rainbow Valley Lodge
description:
Rainbow Valley Lodge Monteverde is close to the town of Santa Elena, about 15 minutes walking or 3 minutes in a vehicle. 
Saw great reviews on the net and they were right. This place is a gem. The owner let me park my camping van just left (if looking the reception) of the parking. It’s near the road but due to heights, no trucks. I gets very very quiet after 9 o’clock. Amazing owner and staff. The cost 0$, I gave them a bottle of wine (Pinot from Burgundy) and they were happy. Pura Vida! Near everything, I recommend it a lot. Best!

name: Costa Rica Animal Rescue Center
description: We wrote them an email in advance and asked to come do a tour and volunteer for the day. It didn't seem like they knew we'd be coming that day but they put us to work and problem solved. We prepared food for the animals, cleaned their spaces, went down to the little river to try to catch some fish, and separated good veggies from bad ones (donated food). We got to interact with the animals A LOT and the staff warmed up to us throughout the day. Lots of people volunteering here! The highlight for me was feeding the sloths and seeing over 20 of them at very close distances. We paid $20USD for the tour and they fed us lunch for free because we volunteered. You can buy dinner and breakfast as well. They also let us camp in our van but it was clear nobody had ever asked them that before so it took some explaining and they came around. Recommended!

name: Brisas del Lago
description:
Hellen and Jorge and their kids are adorable and helped us out when we figured out that Camping Don Manuel was closed.

They run a small secluded campground with hot shower, electricity on the campground and shade. All roads, the shelter/cabin where constructed by Jorge. All of the wood used there is from trees from his friend's property.

The road to get to the campspot is a good gravel road but was to steep for our FWD VW Eurovan (T4) 1993. With 4x4 or RWD you will definetely make it and  anyway Jorge will pull you up with his machinery.


Call Hellen to open up the gate and attend you. +506 8818 5623
Jorge speaks english.

name: Gas Station
description: Big orange coloured gas station with auto propane fill.  Filled the fixed rv tank no problem.  Price is 235/liter.  Helpful fast service.  Large station for any size RV.  no over height problems.

name: Santa Rosa National Park 2
description:
This is a parking lot at the end of the road for Santa Rosa National Park. 

The road becomes a 4x4 path after the last camp location. 

Beyond this there is an area for tent camping and a large parking lot one could sleep in. 

There is an expensive park entry see and also a camping fee but there are pit toilets, a sink, washboard and cold showers outside!

name: Camping la Olomina
description: Great camping place , don Hernán is a sweet person. Clean bathrooms and a cabin

name: Balbo's Hostel
description:
Balbos, the place where world travelers meet.
At our crocodile river borders the dry- forest of Liberia  where our camping and hostel are located. In this beautiful area we organize various hikings and horseback rides. Also we are also happy to serve traditional food for breakfast, lunch or dinner. The bar with ice-cold drinks is open throughout the day and evening.
tel: 506 71921049
email: balboscr@gmail.com

name: Balbo's Hostel
description:
Balbos, the place where world travelers meet.
At our crocodile river borders the dry- forest of Liberia  where our camping and hostel are located. In this beautiful area we organize various hikings and horseback rides. Also we are also happy to serve traditional food for breakfast, lunch or dinner. The bar with ice-cold drinks is open throughout the day and evening.

name: Hotel M&M beach house
description: Beach hotel with very nice staff. Somewhat basic but very clean. No air A/C but lots of fans in the room so you could have a good sleep. Security guard at night with a protected parking. I’m certain they will let you park for cheap. Needed a good night of sleep so I paid 40 USD. Showers, wifi, laundry machines and a very tasty breakfast in the morning. Go!

name: Soda Valeria - free parking
description: We stayed 3 nights in the street outside the Soda (where the basketball area is), felt safe and even left the van one day to go to Corcovado park. The soda’s WiFi works well all day. The food is really good, fresh and a lot for what you pay (casado is 2500 cordobas,gallo pinto 2000). Tap water for free. The lady is just like a mum;)

name: Lavandería Exprés Cartago
description: Good laundry service in Cartago, every other laundry/laundromat was closed for the week end. The lady is very nice. It’s 2000 colones for kilo but everything included (plus a discount). Recommended if you really need a fast laundry. Call WhatsApp number 8327-7788 cause there’s no signal on the street.

name: Walter Alfaro tyres: MotoZ
description:
Walter just started importing MotoZ motorcycle tyres from Australia and this was the only place that has them. Walter travelled to Ushuaia on his KTM in 2017 and is looking to go to Alaska in 2020. This is Walter‘s phone number: +506 8834-9495.
Also don’t be confused by the shop for stoneworks on the ground floor. You are in the right spot; just ask for Walter and the tyres.

name: Madre Tierra Restaurant & Cafeteria
description: A coffee plantantation with restaurant onsite and a big open flat parking area on grass. Cooler temperatures from a higher climate with the sound of a running stream nearby and birds singing in the trees. Spoke with Hilber who lives just below the restaurant, said 3,000 colones for the night with eating at the restaurant.

name: Beach
description: This place is right at the beach. Accessible through a pretty rough road (lots of roots) of 8 meters long that leads to a great flat sandy spot to put up your small camper/tent. You can watch a beautiful sunset here. Bonfire not allowed.

name: Homestay: Llanos del aeropuerto
description:
10min drive to SJO airport makes Marta's house a perfect place for an early departure or late arrival.

The second floor of her house has two bedrooms and a bathroom reserved for her guest at 22USDpp. Includes Wifi, hot shower and Marta's great hospitality. She is starting to offer breakfast very soon but the price for it was not yet decided on during our stay.

It is a calm safe neighbourhood with 24h security guard. 50m from her house us a shop, print shop and small student restaurants.

Because of the proximity to the airport you will hear a few planes taking off at 4am. Earplugs did the trick for my wife  who is a very light sleeper plus jetlag.

Marta arranges airport transfer and helps out with anything else you might require and might even surprise you with a dish made by her passion for cooking and authentic recipes.

Across the street lives Marta's grandma with a flat and fenced in parking spot which could serve as your campspot before your flight or car storage during your overlanding break in Costa Rica.

Load of laundry and drying for 10USD.

name: Rio Arenal
description: Nice spot beside the river. It is sandy. There is a few level locations just up beside the shoreline if water was to rise. Big trees to park under for shade. If not camping here it´s a great stop for the dog to get out and play in the water.

name: Marina Bella National Park (free entry but not free to stay)
description:
6$ per person or you hope the rangers don't ask you for your ticket. 
Beautiful. 
Busy on weekends.
Good surf. 
Shower and toilet

name: Hotel Floresta
description:
The Resort offers spacious and very comfortable rooms! Prices from Us $60 per night in August. Excellent restaurant, swimming pool and Scot bar. The hotel is close to the forest and can see various types of monkeys and birds! Very good Hotel with reasonable prices!

Resort com quartos amplos e muito confortáveis ! Preços de Us$ 60 por noite em agosto. Excelente  restaurante, piscina e scot bar. O hotel fica junto à floresta e e possível ver varios tipos de macacos e aves! Hotel muito bom com preços razoáveis!

name: Street Parking
description: Safe street parking in a nice area across from a fancy grocery store. grocery store (fresh market) has bathrooms and WiFi and is open 6am-10:30pm. Parking is limited/pay during the week but we parked on a Sunday afternoon/evening and left at 7am on Monday morning when you have to start paying. Spot was flat- seemed more level than the hostel and was free!

name: Parque Nacional Barra Honda Camping
description:
Camping at the entrance to the park, $2 pP. Big rigs are probably a problem as there is not enough space. Parking with our Suzuki Jimny with rooftop tent was fine.
Showers and toilets can be used, water available, very friendly staff, very safe and quiet, sourrounded by nature. Electricity for charging mobiles or other small devices available.

name: Perfect tent spot beside stream
description: Beautiful little spot beside a stream that accommodates a tent or 2. Perfect to bathe and filter water from. Hidden from the road and very little traffic here. Has an overgrown hiking trail behind it that leads to a hidden cascade. There are a few tiendas and services about 2km away in San Jorge.

name: Pizza Time
description: Amazing wood fired pizza and delicious craft beer on tap. With toasted cheesecake for desert. Other Italian dishes also available. Not cheap, but definitely worth it.

name: Tanok gas station
description: Parking lot at Tanok gas station. Some noise from the road, but useful if you are late in the day and don't want to drive at night. Free. Gentle staff.

name: Cabinas Terra Mar
description: Spacious rooms with WiFi and air conditioning. Friendly owner who speaks good English

name: Great spot to see both oceans and the sunset
description: From the nearest camping spot find a path into the vegetation and go up to the hill. If no clouds surrounding, you will be able to see both oceans and in the late afternoon an amazing sunset. See the picture.

name: Delegación de Policía de El Empalme
