description: Really nice little cafe in the center of Paquera. They serve delicious cakes, coffee, tea, cold drinks in a relaxed atmosphere. Everything looks stylish and decorated with love. Enjoy your time in the beautiful garden!

name: Las Orquídeas
description: A great place to stop in route with friendly service and you have to try the chifrijo!  (A bowl with rice, beans, chunks of pork and the delicious pico de gallo on top). This is our second time coming here, and it didn’t disappoint! I highly recommend.

name: small spot : campfire/forest/river
description:
One spot under trees, close to a road (low level of attendance) and a river (possiblity to swim).
A few kilometers from here, possiblity to buy local products like fruits, cheese, etc.
For going on, cross a ford. 4x4 recommended.

name: Casa Soley
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager. 

We are located 2km from Puerto Soley, Papaturo, Copal, Jobo and Rajada, one of the prettiest beaches on the north pacific of Costa Rica. 

We have rooms and camp area available and a warm smile to welcome people from all over the world. 

We offer a very well equipied external kitchen, shower and common area. 

Come visit us!
+506 8347-8943

We are open! (March/2021)

Adress: (Casa Soley) Tempatal - La Cruz -Guanacaste

name: Close to river and town Uvita but quiet
description: Close to the river Rio Uvita, with natural swimming pool under somes trees and a road but few traffic. Close to the city Uvita, you can shop or go at the beach. Secure, some ticos in the day and for the sunset.

name: Riverside
description:
we slept in a tent on the banks of the rio, the place is very popular with locals during the day but in the evening there is no one.
Quiet, clean and very pretty place.

name: Rancho Cucho
description:
Nice place with little lakes, homemade and fast food, inexpensive place. Run by the owner and family. 
.....
Bonito lugar con laguitos, comida casera y rápida, Lugar económico. Atendido por el dueño y familia.

name: MegaSuper
description: Grocery store in a small town with all yow need.

name: Cafe Avenida 4
description:
Beautiful little cafe. Really good pastry and delicious coffee products. Fast wifi as well.A lot of shade but you can sit inside as well. Prices are especially for Costa Rica quite good. Staff is very nice and english speaking.
Alternative milks like almond etc. available.

name: Pizzeria
description: Amazing little Pizzeria with a super super friendly owner

name: MiniSuper Verita
description: Small local grocery store. Wifi available.

name: Arenal 1968
description: Big parking lot behind the visitors center for tour buses to park. Views of the volcano if the clouds allow! It was $17 which included access to the trails for two days and parking for the night. The showers are minimal but they exist. There is good WiFi up at the observatory platform or at the visitor center. Also there is a small cafe at the viewing platform which is nice to grab a coffee and view the mountain before your hike.

name: Cervecería Porteña
description:
Local micro brewery. Free parking
+506-89175163
Located close to the interamerican way.

name: Big Vehicle Alignment: Alineación Automotriz
description:
whatsapp: 89930459. phone: 89930457

It was difficult finding alignment for our Promaster van. This was the third place I visited and I called a few more. we needed the alignment done after having some suspension parts replaced.

name: La Muñequita Car Camping
description:
La Muñequita offers safe space for your car and camping essentials, including drinking water, access to common areas (shared bathroom/covered patio), and WiFi accessible close to the main lodge. 

Guests have access to wander the grounds of our farm and enjoy the nature, fruits, and ambiance. 

In addition, authentic familial meals are offered daily at an affordable price. 

Please note that cellular signal is limited on our farm.

Our location is accessible by main cities such as Uvita and is on the way to attractions in Sierpe, Drake Bay, and Puerto Jimnez. In addition, we are only minutes away from the most important archeological sites in Costa Rica: The Stone Spheres (Las esferas de piedra).

name: Arvide Moto service
description: Motorcycles work shop, brands BMW, Ducati, Triumph KTM Japanese brands.

name: Minisuper Pocora
description:
Local asian supermarket in the town.

Host: Leung Ching

name: The Night Poacher
description:
I don’t know whether I should share this special place or not. For me it is exactly what I have been looking for and have travelled Costa Rica in search of.  Raw wild riverside camping. It has everything; jungle behind you, howler monkeys and friends, river, waterfall, warm spring water, secluded, an abundance of different kinds of birds. 

Great swimming in the river but be respectful - she’s strong. Look out for the warm water rock pool I made for bathing in. 

To get here you’ll need to ford across one and sometimes two rivers making it exciting to get to. Occasional locals further upstream playing on the tree swing or paddling in the river. 

Flat ground but needs a 4x4. Other vehicles could park down river nearer to the weir but less secluded. The only place I stayed for two days. Not ready to leave but must continue my adventure. Enjoy ;) x

name: Arenal Cacao House
description:
Nice place outside La Fortuna crazyness. Has electricity, water, bathrooms, great forest in front and a lot of nice frogs and birds. Private access to a river too.
Best place of peace to camp in Fortuna.

name: Just in front of river Caño Negro
description: Spot in front of the river. Within the week, no people at all, only the river at night. Really peacefull.

name: French Bakery
description: Sells baguettes and some sweet European delicacies. Because bread goes limp easily in this high humidity, its not fully baked. Either you have an oven yourself or you asked the French owner to finaly bake it, right away. Don't expect light, fluffy baguettes.

name: Waterfalls La Piedra del Indio
description:
Restaurant and waterfall trail.

Alejandro is a certified guide that will take you in his truck to see a carved rock. Then you can walk the trail down, see four waterfalls and take a dip in fresh water. There is a group of monkeys around and birds.
Typical Costa Rican food at the restaurant and fruit smothies (and beer), also bathrooms and water.

name: Laundry Service El Almendro
description: Laundry service in town. Price is 2000 colones per kilo. Clothes ready in 4 hours.

name: Malekus Mountain Ecolodge
description: This countryside hotel is located in Upala, north side of Costa Rica. You can enjoy two small lakes. Miravalles Volcano view. This is a very quiet place, excellent for relaxation. There is a green forest where you can enjoy a 8km hike or you  can camp in the highest part of the mountain and wake up with a panoramic view of Nicaragua Lake

name: Hone Creek Park
description: Free WiFi, speed is ok, easy to register.

name: Servicentro Cerro Cortez
description: Gas station with vehicle propane filling service

name: Salón Comunal de Parismina
description: Place where travelers (including motorcycles to trucks) can stay overnight.  Community safety person pops up a few times.

name: Río Iroquois
description: Small pond of the Iroquois River, acceptable to spend the night in the place.  Local shops 200 m.  The water is not drinkable, but you can swim

name: Parque Nacional Cahuita, Ticket Office
description: We took a taxi from Cahuita (3'500Col) to this entrance (5US$ for foreigners). The first 2.5km are a raised wooden walkway over a flooded area. We saw howler and white face monkeys, a sloth, numerous hermit crabs and iguanas. After 5km, you have to cross a small creek (knee high) and an other at 7km (thigh high). After 9km (we needed 4 hours :o), you arrive in Cahuita again. Recommended.

name: Parque Nacional Manuel António
description:
Early on at the road to the park entrance, guys in luminous vests try to make you park your car and sell guided tours (group 40'000C/p, private 45'000C/p, incl parking/5000C and entrance fee/13'000C/p). Instead,
drive on to the car park 100m from the entrance, at the right. We took a guide (2 hours) and we could see more animals then without one. The beach at the end of the tour is nice. But in the end, for us, the experience was not worth the money.

name: Free WiFi
description: Free wifi in the park. Easy to register, speed is okay.

name: Puerto Viejo Free Wifi
description: Free WiFi in Puerto Viejo. Easy to register, speed is OK.

name: Campground Piratas Place
description: Great small campground with power, water, wifi, bathrooms, indoor and outdoor showers and close to the beach! I stayed two weeks in my truck camper! It’s a 15 min walk to Tamarindo but a world away. Don’t sleep on Taco Star nearby! Laundry service at Hotel Manglar nearby and if you’re staying for a few days, you can call the gas guys in Villarreal to come pickup and refill your tank.

name: Bakery
description: Their pañuelos with dulce de leche are very yummy! We stopped here to get a treat and asked to get our bottles refilled - they were so kind! :)

name: cachi
description: this place is next to the road is very quiet and is close to tourist places

name: La Jama
description:
Very nice place with GREAT cold brew! We stopped here after biking from Liberia and this was such a great little break. It’s super well ventilated and they have WiFi and great food - with vegetarian options. They have a good variety of licuados and coffee and other fruit drinks. It’s very clean too, you can pay with credit card or cash

The chairs are very comfy :) stop by!

name: River Crossing
description: Our 7m motorhome could not make it because we were to long and had not enough clearance at the back. Had to turn back to Sámara.

name: Playa conchal by bike
description:
We biked on the beach from playa brasilito (cars and motos are not allowed but walking/bikes are). The ride on the beach was gorgeous (we lowered our tire pressure to make it more pleasant - we have tubeless). 

From brasilito to conchal on bike is probably 10min on the beach.

name: Supermarket
description: Good grocery right in front of a big park with shade. Perfect stop to get some shade. We got some food at the store and ate breakfast in the many benches around the park.

name: Comedor
description: Small comedor under a big roof and with some hammocks. Food was good and affordable

name: Albergue ostional
description:
We are on bikes and this is exactly what we needed after a long day on the saddle + rain! 
We had heard a lot about the camping spot in this town but decided to look for a small hotel. 

We saw the sign for this place and knocked on the door -  big rooms (bunk beds) for 4-5 people (25,000) and they can also be rented for 2 people - she asked full priced and then we explained that we will use only one bed. 

We paid 20,000 ($32). The room was simple but very clean. It had AC, private bathroom with hot water and very very comfy beds. The mattresses are big and comfy!

name: Falafel Cafe
description: Good falafel and yummy natural drinks. Does not has WiFi. Very clean place and very friendly staff

name: Atardecer dorado restaurante/tienda
description:
This is a big local restaurant with lots of wooden chairs facing the beach. They have a lot of dishes with vegetables- for the vegetarians! And their vegetable Casado is fully vegan :) the service is a bit slow but the servings were generous. 

We are on bikes at the next door store (connected to the restaurant) if we could pitch our tent in the storefront once they close, they said yes. The store front had a little cover and protected us from the heavy rain that night.

You could ask to camp in the restaurant once they close (at 10pm). 

We had access to water (a spigot right next to the store front!) and bathrooms from the restaurant.

name: Parque Nacional Rincon de la Vieja
description: This is the entrance to Las Pailas of the National Park Rincon de la Vieja. Before you arrive here, you have to pay 700Colones/person to cross through a private hotel property. The entrance fee to the park is 17US$/person. We walked the Las Pailas Sendero (3km, 2h) and could see some geo-thermal activities. Depending on what you have seen in your life, its either a interesting walk or a nice stroll through nature.

name: Road to Las Pailas, PN Rincon de la Vieja
description: Take this road to drive to Curumbé and further on to the entrance Las Pailas of PN Rincón de las Viejas. Its all paved. Shortly after Curubandé, you will have to pay a crossing fee of 700C/person (privat hotel property) before reaching the park entrance.

name: Soda Curubandé
description: After having a delicious fish dinner in this restaurant (local & international food), the owner allowed us to spent the night in our motorhome at his parking lot at no cost (incl. access to toilets during the night if needed).

name: ATMs
description: Intersection with a few ATM machines. BAC, BCR and others.

name: Restaurant car park
description:
A large opening in front of the bay beach that is also used as the car park for the Kalaluna Bistro. Park here for one night, but beware that it’s busy with fishermen in the early hours of the morning (5AM) and late hours of the evening (10PM) coming in and out. Incredible view however and safer than next to the “police” station in our opinion.

Do not try driving here from the East via the road from town as you will get stuck (too narrow even for normal cars) don’t drive on the beach either, take the longer southern loop road from inland!

name: Biciclo - taller/bikeshop
description: Really good bike shop with lots of high end and also affordable stuff. We got our tubeless tires fixed in here. They have a great store and also really good bike mechanics. They also sell very affordable bikes and very pricy ones, food mix

name: Oban taller
description: Allan and his father are great mechanicals and they help a lot the Overlanders. The Best option in San Jose.

name: Rancho Edén & Chocolate Tour
description:
We arrived on Tuesday and the restaurant was closed. The owner Rolando came-up from his house, nonetheless, to greet us and offered the carpark with toilets for overnight (traffic noise during night).
The next morning, we had a delicious continental breakfast in the Rancho (3'500c/p; see foto) and did a very good chocolate tour (30$/p; schedule 8-9.30 & 13-14.30; phone 2200-5497) on their finca. Later on, we came back several times for drinks and food - all were delicious, highly recommended (see also our iov entry of Arenal Cacao House).

name: El Fogón de Chela
description:
Autentic Costarican food.
El Fogón de Chela offers a typical lunch and our authentic Costarican Cooking Class with organic products in a Rural community near to La Fortuna.

name: Soda Flor
description:
Nice soda with WiFi and nice meals. This is the place we sat at before we cross the border to do the panama health affidavit/download bank statements to show at the border. 

The hotel next door has private rooms for $10

name: River Crossing
description: River crossing next to road to Palo Verde. Beautiful spot next to the bridge on a little sandy beach. We asked the family living on the other side of the river if we could camp here. That was no problem and they assured us it’s safe. Many animals around: Mexican porcupine, iguanas, basilisk, howler monkeys, kingsfisher and a lot of other birds.  We also saw a scorpion coming from under the car. Locals liked it that we camped here. A lot of honking and waving from the bridge. The water is nice to bath and swim in, lots of tiny fish that give you a free Spa experience. The local family also came for a swim with kids and dogs, and came for a chat, very nice and friendly! We found this place because the campsite in Palo Verde doesn’t exist anymore. Lots of mosquitos from dusk.

name: Santa Rosa - playa naranjo
description: Campspot in between the ranger station and the beach, in the forest. There are picnic tables and BBQ’s. The toilets (latrines) smell very very bad... When you come with a car with rooftop tent you can’t camp at the campsite, but in the parking lot next to it. But that’s nice also. The road isn’t open all year, only in dry season. You need a 4x4, the road is very bumpy and a bit tricky. Lots of tame animals, like deer, iguanas, crocodiles (in mangrove), crabs, snakes, birds of prey. You have to pay entrance + camping $ 19,- per day. The ranger is very friendly. Strong currents at the beach, not good for snorkeling or swimming. There are surfers though.

name: Parqueo da Sabana
description: We arrived in the afternoon and parked/slept for 2 nights under the roof of this 24h guarded and fenced-in parqueo (22'000c incl. electricity). Some traffic noise, but ok for us. 1.3km from the city center, perfectly located to explore its tourist attractions.

name: Tienda
description: Small tienda with some snacks and food. Not a lot but one of the only stores around

name: Hotel Cabanas - Siete Colinas
description: Beautiful cabinas in private, secure (gated) green space backing onto wild rainforest. Parking inside gate, small swimming pool & table football. Trail into the forest, small ponds & landscaped seating in trees. WiFi (v slow) electricity, fridge & coffee machine in room. Lovely, clean rooms with ‘viewing window’ into canopy. Owner Jose on site, friendly, spoke mainly Spanish a little English, asked for $40 USD per cabin, with a little kind persuasion got down to $20 USD. Bobbly cobbly road to get here, seemed in the middle of nowhere, but stunning.

name: Hotel, Restaurante Mystica
description: After unsuccessfully checking other places to stay overnight, we found this place, had pizza & caprese salat in the restaurant and a quiet night in our 7m motorhome for free on their parking lot. Toilettes and wifi in the restaurant.

name: Finca Modelo Ecologica
description:
The best view you will find with a tent or small-sized-rig in Monteverde. Entering this place is tricky, and for our 3.5 meter high rig we needed to slowly and carefully lift the electrical wires at the entrance, but it was worth it. 
This place offers great tours. Night tours, 40 meters ficus tree climbing, waterfall repelling, etc. We wrote them an email asking to do the night tour and stay in their place and we ended up paying only for the tour and staying 2 nights in the most amazing place they have!!! Email them- it is worth it. Also, don't miss the 30$ night tour that begins in climbing the ficus tree and seeing the sunset from there!!! 40$ if you want also dinner!!!
‏‪info@familiabrenestours.com‬‏

name: Rescate Automotriz
description: Mechanic,family business. Josafat the ownerSuper friendly and super fair on his price. Rescued me a couple times here in San Jose he is an angel! Works with automatic american cars also. Fixes motorcycles cars buses trucks anytjing. Big space for bug rigs while fixing, under roof.

name: Passo del Mar
description:
Big rig friendly, stacks of room parked against the fence, opposite the theatre, overlooking the marina.
Safe... just past the police station.
No facilities. Easy stroll to town.

name: Farm
description: Front of the house there is 2 options. Gardens are big enough for camping I asked people and they gived me permision for camping. Also there is a small market near the houses

name: Football Field
description: I spent all day near the beach. After that I started cycling, the rain started and I found this place. There is a nice shelter, potable water, and a plug for charging my equipment. Between 22:00 - 05:45, no cars came by. It is a good camping place for one night.

name: Camping Catarata Tesoro Escondido
description: Tourist spot and main entrance for the Hidden Treasure Waterfall. Established campground, because of Covid you need to reserve online. They offer clean bathrooms, breakfast, lunch & access to waterfalls. Camping area is definitely not flat nor is the parking lot. Very muddy during rainy season. Entrance is open for big rigs. Pet friendly. A good option to visit a beautiful waterfall and crash for the night.

name: parque de lleno grande
description:
In the founded park you can camp, ask people no problem has water and a bathroom

En el fundó del parque se puede acampar, pregunte a la gente no hay problema tiene agua y un baño

name: Hacienda Blu Beach lounge and grill
description: Can is the owner of this place. He is very kind  person. His restaurant is amazing. also foods are perfect. If you have van you can park here for one or 2 night . he has a parking area with security.

name: Servicentro Uno
description: Fuel station with space to park overnight.  It has bathrooms.

name: Feria de Food Trucks Los Angeles
description: This is a great informal place to stay with your rigg downtown in Cartago just adjacent to the impressing Basilica de nuestra Senora de Los Angeles. It's a flat Parking area with an additional entrance gate around the corner for big trucks. We just asked the owner Jose where to park at the basilica and he said; come in to my place here, you are welcome to stay here. There are clean toilets, water and electricity, wifi you might pick up from one of the food trucks. We stayed here for two nights, due to the bad impact of the pandemic Jose is reorganizing the place, he and the colleagues are very very kind. A laundry you can find on Avenida Central  shortly before the corner with calle 7 on the left if you come from the parking, a 4 minutes walk. At about 10 pm all gates close, this place is very safe.

name: Riverside Lodge Sarapiqui
description: River Side Lodge camp site located right next to Puerto Viejo River. Easy to find, there is every things you need.

name: Taller de Scott
description:
Mechanical WorkShop. Repair all type of motors and brands.
The prices are standar and normal for Costa Rica. 
The quality is garantized.
This workShop fixed diferent issues of my camper, such as, brakes, transmision, gears. It Has a network which can repair other problems (electric, radiator, soldering).

name: Sol y luna camping
description: campground in playa herradura. showers and room for rigs/tent camping. run by Alicia and luis.very friendly. 10.000 CRC per vehicle or 5000 CRC pp. best found with Google maps and not with Waze

name: Beach front spot isla palo seco school
description: Cool beach front spot between palm trees, super flat great for parking or stay few days, just in front isla palo seco school , there are two blue giant tires .

name: Oasis Place
description:
Alberto and his wife Carmen have a beautiful finca here where they live when they are not in their other home in New Jersey.

They welcomed us warmly and invited us to stay in their generous driveway as long as we wanted, to use their restroom and shower and to wash and dry our laundry. 
We also spent a lot of time together sitting around the table, talking and eating. 
For all of that they did not want anything in return but we at least managed to share some self-made bread and German sweets. 

Alberto and Carmen are in the process of building a campground and cabañas on their property so this place promises to become a fully equipped overnight spot soon. In the meantime they already like to meet and accommodate other overlanders and collect ideas for this ongoing project. 

We highly recommend this place either for a quiet comfortable night or for a few days making awesome new friends. 

IMPORTANT: Before you go, call/WhatsApp/text Alberto (+1 973 517 0237) to check if they are currently in Costa Rica or the US. 
They speak Spanish, English and a little French.

name: Rincon Beach Campsite
description: The camping spot is right at the end of the street (on the right hand side). The street here is only doable with a 4x4 at least if you are not a local (these guys do crazy things with normal cars). The river you have to cross was at least knee deep (during rain season). Once you are here you get a paradise beach all for yourself with perfect sunset and camping on green gras right next to the beach. About 20min walks down the beach is a restaurant and hostel where you can get something to eat. The place is perfect for small tents and also for big rigs. Also there are open showers like 10min down the beach.

name: Estacion Altamira
description:
Parque Internacional La Amistad, established campground 200 mts from ranger station. Clean plain ground with a ranch, bbq, toilets, lavatories and electricity. 6$ pp pn residents, 8$ pp pn non residents.
Two trails for visitors, the first one 1.5 kms Los Gigantes del Bosque, clean path and safe. Second one 13.5 kms El Valle del Silencio. This is a bit unsafe, not clean path but full adventure.
Rangers are polite and helpful in anything you need.

name: Finca la Pipilacha
description: Beautiful range of 14 hectares in Monte de Oro with a mountain view plenty of animals

name: La Selva Restaurant
description: This is a very pretty and good restaurant where we could stay with our Unimog in the backyard, well protected from the main road and save. The owner Diego is very nice, he offered us to stay here while visiting San Jose which is about 20 km from here. He supported us with lots of information, we could use the toilets of the restaurant, you get electricity, water and very good WIFI. The meals are outstanding and worth their prices. Diego   welcomes overlanders and likes traveling himself.

name: Puerto Moreno
description:
We stayed here for one night on a concrete platform next to the ramps and old harbour office, which now are used by the fishermen. The people are very friendly and the place seemed to be safe. No amenities available. Always 
a nice breeze from the ocean.

name: Finca la Pipilacha
description:
Beautiful place to sleep in the middle of nature, with spectacular mountain views.

The price per night is 10$ per person. If you would like to use the amenities of the kitchen the price is 13$.

Please contact before: +506 8416 8463

name: Water Supply
description: this is a free and potable water tap, it is part of a small monuments that Acueductos y Alcantarillados (national water supply company) locates in rural towns to be freely used

name: Top of the mountain
description: Nicest Please to camping on the high to the mountain.

name: Street parking
description:
Street parking in front of the Fuerza Pública. At the Cruz Roja they told us to go here. We asked for permission and they told us it is safe as they are here all night.
No facilities.
There is a Soda in the same street with good food and a very nice owner.

I left my old Flipflops out in the morning. 5 minutes later they were gone. Pura Vida I guess. So look out for your stuff.

name: Sd automotriz. Sergio solis
description:
Translation: Auto shop. General Mechanics and Autotronic Diagnosis in injection systems and also diagnosis in LPG equipment

Taller automotriz. Mecánica General y Diagnóstico autotronico en sistemas de inyección y también diagnóstico en equipos de glp

name: Water Supply
description: this is a free and potable water tap, it is part of a small monuments that Acueductos y Alcantarillados (national water supply company) locates in rural towns to be freely used. need a long hose for tanks, in front of church off main road

name: Water Supply
description: this is a free and potable water tap, it is part of a small monuments that Acueductos y Alcantarillados (national water supply company) locates in rural towns to be freely used

name: El Jardin
description: Nice Peruvian restaurant. Good Seafood, affordable prices and very nice owners.

name: Public parking next to Jardin Tamarindo
description:
Between the beach, the restaurant El Chiringuito, LA kitchen and the food truck area Jardin Tamarindo is a wide public parking.
We arrived there by night. Locals said no issue to stay there, you might have to pay during the day, we left at 9 am and had seen no one asking for money. Locals said worth to give 300-400 colones if it happens.
Not that quiet because of the night restaurants/clubs around so you hear some loud people at bar closure time, but felt safe. 
Just next to the beach which is great in the morning.
We had a drink at LA kitchen, very friendly owner who let us use the toilets during the night and gave us quite some advice.
Wifi available from his restaurant or from jardin tamarindo

name: AyA free potable water faucet
description:
This is one of the free potable water faucets supplied by the Costa Rican agency for water and sewage AyA.
The water tastes great, there is space for park and you can attach a hose to tab to fill your tank.

name: Slautomotriz
description:
Mechanical , Electromechanical, Repair, Ecu programing, Resto mod , custom works and a lot more  Whatsapp 88544712
shop 2291-07

name: CarClub Firestone
description: Oil, brakes, engine servicing, wheel aligment and Tire Shop

name: Plaza de la Mujer (outside)
description: Big open site where trucks park and stay for the night. Very safe. There are restrooms inside Plaza de la Mujer. Also, there are a lot of restaurants or "sodas" with good options to eat. People are very friendly. It's 1km away from all the big markets and institutions if you need to prepare some documents to cross the border.

name: Beach Dog Cafe
description:
Good food (a bit on the pricey side) and guest wifi that has a decent speed. 
Very close to the beach!

name: Hotel Paraíso Del Cocodrilo
description: Cheap hotel for the area, no 4x4 needed to access. Pool, bar, cold showers, AC, I think some of the rooms are equipped with a kitchen. We payed $65 for a night. They have room for tents and campers, so they may be amenable to that.

name: Thelma
description: This is a restaurant where truckers stop to eat and they have showers also.

name: Tsunami Hostel
description: Nice hostel very close to the beach. I think it might be the cheapest hostel in Tamarindo. We paid $30 for a private 2-person room. $40 for a room with airconditioning, but it wasn’t so hot that we needed that.

name: Restaurant EIMI
description: No signs for camping, but when we asked, it was $5 each for overnight. Toilets and showers available, but did not use showers

name: Camping Victor
description: Multiple sites, each near electricity (outlets), shower and toilet. Across from beach. 2000 Colones per person. Victor doesn’t speak English, but lives on site

name: Trova Propan & Fuel Station
description: Here you can easily fill up your Propane tank. 446CRC per liter 11/2021

name: El Cafetin
description:
Cafe with breakfast, lunch, dinner, and coffee. Free wifi for guests, pretty quiet because it's away from the main road. Outdoor seating as well.
Outlets are hard to find, we found a pair tucked behind a plant. 

They have a large gravel parking lot, so they may be amenable to a campervan staying overnight, we didn't ask.

name: Camping Don Juan
description: Several grassy tent sites, at the end of a dirt road, near a black beach. Nice flush toilets, showers, shared kitchen, etc. Really friendly family that own it

name: Copicentro
description:
Easy place to make copies. 

Also sells drinks and office supplies

name: Banco National ATM
description: Bank of 3 ATMs, they don't dispense USD, only colones

name: Cattleya Hostel
description:
Another nice hostel across the street from the others already listed. Has a decent size parking lot with no height restrictions to get in. I stayed in the dorms for $9/night (the best deal I could find). Dorms are nice with only 2 beds to a dorm. There might be larger dorms but I only saw ones with 2 beds each. They also have larger family rooms and privates with queen beds.

Garage parking for probably upwards of 4 or even more large ADV/touring sized motos. I didn't ask about the possibility of sleeping in the parking lot and using the facilities, but the owner is a chill guy who might be up for it. At any rate there is better parking here than any of the other nearby hostels.

Owner is very nice and hands on and speaks English. Beds are comfy with extra blankets as it gets chilly up here in the mountains, hot shower, nice kitchen. Highly recommend this place.

name: Parking lot on dead end road
description: We were looking for a quiet and free place to stay the night. When driving through the village, we found a big parking lot almost at the end of a dead end road. Big open paved place next to the road. Perfect place for wild camping and no traffic. No facilities.

name: Woodstock Hostel
description:
parking
cheapest in town 
excellent price/comfort ratio since its very comfy with great atmosphere and good kitchen

tents are around 4 dollars
beds around 11 dollars in dorm (good beds with walls and privacy)

privates are around 25 - 35 usd depending of if they have private shower

name: l'Authentique
description:
Raclette restaurant / tartiflettes / charcuterie boards.
Interesting fact: they managed to teach the locals how to produce good French cheese!
€ 13.50 unlimited cheese raclette with cold cuts and potatoes
€ 10.50 tartiflette
€ 10.50 cold cuts board
If you're fed up with the redundant, tasteless local food, you know where to go!
(comment not affiliated with the restaurant) 
Restaurant de raclette / tartiflettes / planches de charcuterie 
Fait intéressant : ils ont réussi à apprendre aux locaux à produire du bon fromage à la française !

13,50€ raclette fromage illimité avec charcuterie et patates
10,50€ tartiflette 
10,50€ planche de charcuterie
Si vous en avez marre de la bouffe locale redondante et sans saveur, vous savez où aller !
(commentaire non affilié au restaurant)

name: Playa Rajada
description:
Beautiful place, the local government put toilets and showers for a cheap price. There are some tables and chairs around the beach for people to use. Very bad telephone signal. It says that it’s forbidden to camp, but during Holy Week we stayed here for two nights without any problem and many people too.
Beautiful beach, very safe, the police travel 3 or 4 times a day, there are no facilities, camping forbidden, the police take you out at night. --- Hermosa playa, muy segura, la policia la recorre 3 o 4 veces al día, no hay facilidades, prohibido acampar, la policia te saca al llegar la noche.

name: Wild camping next to road
description: It was already late, so we decided to just park in this small space next to the road a few meters before the Suenos del Irazu restaurant. There’s a gate and some empty space. Felt safe and very quiet at night. Also a little bit protected against the wind by the trees.

name: Free WiFi
description: Free WiFi at the small park just off the main road in town.

name: Cabinas Buenos Aires
description: Only 9.000 colones for a 2 person private room with bathroom! We were looking for a hostel, but found this instead. We even had a private indoor parking lot. Definitely recommended!!

name: Uniwasher
description:
Very good laundry with good machines, good prices and very polite and helpful staff.
It is clean, they have WiFi, a toilet, and you can park in front.
9 Kg machine 2600
13 Kg machine 3700
17 Kg machine 4900
13 Kg dryer 1200 / 15 mins

name: Automotriz AC
description:
We had problems with the AC. This is a specialist for AC only.  Changed it for 140$. 
Contact in the picuturee.

name: Montezuma
description:
Here you can refill your water:)
Next to the beach

name: Playa
description: A very unique and quiet place. A lot of shade.

name: Faucet
description: By coincidence found another water refill, tap water. A faucet next to toilet

name: Cabañas Authentica / Bogarin Trail
description:
Great place to stay of you want to do the Bogarin Trail. You get a cabana for $40 / 2 people ($30 if you are alone) which includes the entrance to the trail. The trail is already $15 per person, so for just $5 more per person you get a room with hot shower, good wifi and AC as well!

Our cat was allowed on a leash only, but this is very understandable with all the wildlife around.

name: Cabañas Authentica / Bogarin Trail
description: This is the same place as the Bogarin Trail. I am adding it here because you can basically camp if you get a cabaña (it's 20$ per person for the cabaña including the entrance to the trail, so your are effectively paying $5 to stay in a cabaña with AC, hot shower and Wifi). You can park you camper right in front of the cabaña. They have a shared kitchen as well.

name: La Gamba Rainforest Lodge
description: A few minutes walk from the entrance to Piedras Blancas national park. We messaged Ronald, the owner yesterday via his Facebook page and asked if we could camp. He has let us park out front, where there is a water tap, parking for 2 or 3 trucks, and use one of the rooms in the lodge for toilet, hot shower and changing. Also offered food and laundry if we want it. More than most campsites, but at $10 per person, with use of a room, and this close to the entrance, it's worth it. On the road up to the lodge in La Gamba village you pass a SINAC office where you can buy park entrance tickets.

name: Los Toros
description: Just a little outside Tamarindo beach you can no Los Toros, established campground with little huts, clean bathrooms, showers, power outlets and even wifi. The owners are super nice and it’s very safe - good hub to stay a couple night & explore the area.

name: Hotel Heliconia
description:
Nice quiet little hotel with secure gravel and grass parking lot and restrooms 24/7.

Oscar and his family own this hotel and a restaurant closer to the river. Whenever there is room in the parking lot he is open to letting travellers spend the night. This place is usually more busy during the week!

We could use the restroom at the reception during the whole night. There are also several sinks and tables under the roof outside.

Oscar is a really friendly guy and did not charge us anything. So we invited him for a cold beer and had a great chat over dinner we bought at his restaurant (he speaks Spanish and some English).

Perfect place to spent the night before or after the border.

name: Kendall’s Miradores
description: Kendall can give access to some beautiful spots above Orisi with views on the town and the surrounding coffee plantations. He lives down at the gate which he can open for you after which you follow a steep road (4x4 only) to a flat ground perfect for camping. The view is amazing. No facilities, just the spot. There are more and more beautiful sites higher up he says. Give him a call on 8551-1988. He didn’t ask for any money but he is open to tips.

name: In the wind hostel
description:
Around 11 USD for comfy dorm bed, no big dorm, smaller sized

secure parking for motocycle

overall for the price and quiet location near to everything you could need in SJ, pretty good

name: Groupo Camping Club
description:
Great little place if you’re looking for some camping items. Sell green Colman propane bottles, hiking stoves, lights, little axes…everything you might want if you’re into camping and hiking. We came here to pick up a solar shower. Prices seem decent.

It’s a private residence so there’s no store sign. Look at the picture for the door and ring the bell to get let in.

name: Super Los Angeles
description: Local supermarket where you can find grains, fruits, hygiene items, liquors, motor oil and various supplies.  It has a toilet and picnic tables

name: Finca two waters
description: Finca two waters is a private property owed by a family. You can visit these waterfalls for a fee 1000 colones per person. On this property is a mirador (view point) with a stunning view over the jungle and Caribbean Sea. After asking at the entrance if it would be possible to sleep a night on the mirador they allowed us to stay for 3000 colones per person. It’s gated property. It’s very steep up, not completely leveled.

name: High up with a view
description:
After Waze sent us to a dead end in the jungle, we decided to stay the night somewhere around. We stumbled upon this place. It’s a big flat plateau next to a very steep gravel road (4x4 might be needed). We had the best sunrise ever. You can see the pacific and the Whale tail at Uvita from here. If you like to be alone, this place is perfect. We have seen absolutely nobody.
Enjoy!

name: camping tronadora, lago Arenal
description: excellent place for camping.  It has toilets, showers and electricity.  very safe, quiet and a spectacular view - good phone reception

name: Aya - potable water
description: An Aya sign with potable water at the highway next to a bus stop. slightly chlorinated

name: Washed out road to viewpoint, try uvita entrance
description:
Seriously steep, muddy, and washed out road. Google maps wants to sent you this way when you try to go to the viewpoint coming from the south.
Do not trust it, we made it half way with our 4x4 in low gear, but a local living there advised us to not try any further. Difficult to turn around.

We have quite a bit of clearance and still were scared that we would smash our differentials onto the rocks in some washed out parts.

Try to go through uvita instead.

name: Centro Manu
description:
Very Nice place to chill out.
You can park for 5000cpp. Or pay 15000cpp for a cabana (breakfast included). Open 6am-5pm
We parked next to the basket-ball field to plug to the electricity. There is a big palapa with tables and fast wifi. Clean flush toilet and HOT shower. Very good drinking water at the tap (the Spring is nearby).
There's a little pond to swim and a one mile trail in the forest. They have Feeders. Many hummingbirds, toucans, parrots. The umbrellabird is present from september to december. Capucine and howler monkeys are also around.
Don't Know about pet friendly but there are dogs on site.

name: Camping Tío Lalo
description: Beautiful campground with lots of trees and lots of shade. Clean bathrooms, showers, electricity, common area with tables and sinks. And even has a wooden fire BBQ. Very friendly owners. We stay there to catch de ferry early in the morning. We paid 4.000 colones per person per night

name: Aya blue water point
description:
MODERATORS NOTICE:We could not verify if the water is in fact portable
Use filtration system.

Public water point, most likely potable. Next to the soccer field.

name: Mirador in Uvita, 2wd friendly
description:
We couldn’t make it to the mirador further south because of a really bad road (high clearance and 4wd necessary. No big rigs!) so we searched for another spot to see the whale tail. (It’s visible at low tide. One tree blocks half of the view. We sent the drone) 

Found this spot 5 minutes off the main highway, enjoyed the sunset and had a quiet night (except for howler monkey noises from the trees early in the morning). 
With rain it gets pretty muddy and we towed 2 locals out of the mud while there. it’s totally doable with any car with a bit of driving skills, just avoid the mud puddles at the mirador and at the side of the street.

name: Tranqui FunKey
description: Allowed us to fill our 26 gallon tank with well water for $10 USD. Not cheap, but water is really hard to come by around here.

name: Jungle riverside
description:
Beautiful place by a river. There is an old suspension bridge over the river, with a big sign telling its out of use. Basically the road is a dead end, so you will be practically alone. There were two motorcycles passing the bridge though. 
There are signs warning about changing water levels (hydropower plant nearby), choose your spot well and you’ll be good.

name: ICE (to buy Kolbi SIM card/chip)
description: Bring your passport. closed from 12 til 1 for siesta. It's not pronounced like ice in English it's hice (with no H). only pay with card no cash. 1000 colones. 8am-5pm mon-fri

name: Taller Automotriz Mora Serrano
description: Services and repairs diesel and gasoline powered vehicles of all sizes, including RV conversions of vans and skoolies (buses.) Also does electrical work on these vehicles and is a great source of information about all types of repair/service. Not fluent in English (yet) but will work with you through Translate. Young couple, very friendly and motivated with a large workshop space. Top notch service. Tell them you learned about them here, on iOverlander.

name: la finca
description:
it is a small farm, in which you can use your camping tend, there is a place to cook with firewood and grill. if you a vehicle there is no problem with it.

you can reach the owner at this phone number +506 8598-0175 and ask for David. you can send text messages as well

as this is a private place, you will need to talk with owners, you can ask neighbors to talk with owners. 4 kms north from gas station. +506 85980174 you can ask for a place.

name: lubricantes chavarrí (auto parts and service)
description:
parts store with basic service facilities. 
If they have the lubricants that you need in bulk, they just charge retail price to do the oil change. note - they don't have many exotic grades in bulk in the mechanics garage. They greased my ball joints for 3500c. they have a lunch siesta from 12-1. lots of parts in the shop, reasonable prices. no USA car parts. they don't do complex mechanic work just oil changes. they wouldn't pull of my diff cover to change the oil. only pull out drain plugs but it's basically a free service you just pay the retail oil in bottle price and they pump it out of a drum

name: Soda Tapia
description: Soda Tapia has a lightning fast unlocked network that reaches far into the parking lot. The area is locked up at 10pm, no camping permitted.

name: Parque de las Esferas
description:
A public park where you can see some of the spheres for free instead of paying to get into one of the archeological sites. As a bonus there is an old train across the street and we saw 6 scarlet macaws in the trees of the park! 

Definitely worth a quick stop

name: multiservicios el relampago wheel alignment and mechanic
description: they have a proper wheel alignment machine. also do mechanical repairs. paid 8000c for alignment on a ford e150

name: La Calle
description: GO HERE!! They have a great variety of burgers, sandwiches, tacos, shrimp dishes, beers, and margaritas. The potato wedges are quite literally the best I've had ever!! About $6000-7000 per meal, plus drinks.

name: Puesto Quebrada Gonzales
description: Braulio Carrillo National Park Quebrada Gonzales Sector. It's a big park but this part of it is tiny. 1100c for locals and $13.56usd for foreigners. There's 2 walking trails: a one-hr track and a 45min track... if you walk slow. I went on a Tuesday and it was really quiet. Didn't see any animals or birds. lots of highway noise. Safe parking, no one dodgy hanging around

name: Water Supply
description: this is a free and potable water tap, it is part of a small monuments that Acueductos y Alcantarillados (national water supply company) locates in rural towns to be freely used

name: Water Supply
description: this is a free and potable water tap, it is part of a small monuments that Acueductos y Alcantarillados (national water supply company) locates in rural towns to be freely used

name: La Pamar Campground
description: Nice place if you need some facilities. Hookup available with an extension. You can use their washing machine for 3000c too. Friendly family also told me that while they don’t have WiFi their neighbours to the left with the kayaks may let you use theirs if you ask. 500c just to use bathrooms/showers. Also opposite on the other side of the road is a big open free spot which is really nice. Some kind of restaurant on site, but not sure if it’s open as we didn’t need it.

name: Monteverde Brewing Company
description: Nice brewery. We enjoyed our beers and the food was really nice with huge portions. Fast WiFi and plug sockets easily available too.

name: Canadian Embassy
description: Canadian Embassy, only open until noon on Monday to Friday but accessible by phone at +506 2242 4400 after hours

name: El descanso de la mona
description: It is a place in the middle of the forest, with some waterfalls, horses and a lot of nature.  The price is 4.000 colones per person. Cel: 8624-7457

name: Mirador Tapachula
description:
MODERATORS NOTICE: iOverlander cannot verify if wild camping is permitted at this location. It is your responsibility to verify local laws or obtain consent before staying the night. 

A view point where you can observe almost entire San Jose. An even ground and a lot of space for all sizes. High clearance needed!!!

name: IguAnitas Place Camping
description:
IguAnitas Place Camping is little different from traditional Costa Rican camping sites. It offers you the possibility to camp on different levels and with a roof over your head. We also have a fully equiped shared kitchen and common areas to spend time with your friends, family and other outdoor aficionados. In IguAnitas Place we want everybody to feel at home and just enjoy the good vibes of the Southern Caribbean coast of Costa Rica. 
Please contact us before your arrival! +506 8824 0904

IguAnitas Place offers you
- new sanitary facilities with hot water shower
- fully equipped kitchen
- hammocks and swings
- drinking water
- pet-friendly
- only 200m to the beach
- private parking
- calm neighbourhood
- only 1km to down town Puerto Viejo
Please note we don't offer: wifi (working on it), tents for rent, pool, restaurant service.

name: Family Resturant Overnight Parking
description: Family restaurant by the sea with overnight parking. Beautiful place, very quiet. There are toilets and shower. The owner Madeline is very nice and hospitable, free parking and good food,

name: Vivero antorcha
description: beautiful grassy place for a few tents or one or two rigs close to the river in a wonderful small nursery. Basic facilities with cold shower. No light. No shelter  for cooking. electricity on request at the owners house. very friendly and helpful owner. We payed 5000 colones for 2 people in a tent.

name: Water Supply
description: this is a free and potable water tap, it is part of a small monument that Acueductos y Alcantarillados (national water supply company) locates in rural towns to be freely used.

name: great view in the corner
description:
We parked in the corner but the location is quite wide.
We were not bothered by the traffic, in front of Arenal, a magnificent view!

name: Taller Secre
description:
Translation:Automotive mechanic service and precision lathe

Servicio de mecánica automotriz y Torno de precisión

name: Lagos del Rio
description: very nice place, everything looks brand new. located beween the river and two small lakes. very well maintained. clean shower, toilet and small kitchen. perfect to spot frogs at the lake and birds like red macayes. 10000colones for two and a tent. If you ask the owner you can get access to recharge batteries.

name: Parque Nacional Piedras Blancas
description: This is the trailhead to Estacion El Bonito from where you can do different hikes within this beautiful park. Hike is 3km, approx. 1 hour. Be prepared for some river crossings during the hike. This is the furthest point you can drive into the park. Map and information at Sinac office in Gamba available.

name: Parque Nacional Piedras Blancas Wildcamp
description: Wild campspot by the river. Very nice and calm place. No one around except of a lot of birds. Don't need an entry ticket for the national park. There is one small river crossing (dry season) to get here.

name: Train Tracks - Free
description: The guards at the Denny’s parking lot kindly told us we could park overnight next to the train tracks right between their guarded lot and another. We felt safe. Surprisingly quiet for being right near the airport! Large enough for big rigs, vans, and campers. WiFi doesn’t reach here, but you can pick up the Denny’s WiFi in their parking lot or the casino public WiFi if you’re closer to the other side of the building. Denny’s password: abierto24horas

name: Tecnodepositos
description: Long term parking option. Fenced in. Left our van here for 2 months - no issues. 2 USD a day

name: Next to the road in front of Playa Cacao
description:
It's possible to park and stay on a steep road close to Cacao beach. It's not possible to stay on the beach because during high tide it's all flooded. There is a lookout you can visit. It's 15 min up the hill and costs 1000 Colones per person. At the restaurant or soda it's possible to go swimming and take an outdoor shower. The owner allowed us to come back in the morning and use the shower and toilets as well. It feels very safe here. There are not many people around. The water is very calm and warm. In a little house to the right they are selling coconut ice cream  which is delicious. The road is a gravel narrow road but many potholes. Our car is around three meters high and we didn't have any problems. The site itself is a little bit steep (maybe you want to use a levelling kit). There is no water or supermarket down here.
there's Zii free WiFi signal but weak.

name: Cuipilapa
description: Roadside space just enough for a rooftop tent - almost level - might require a bit of digging to level the car completely - nice valley view - NOT protected from strong winds ... - phone reception good - locals honk and greet when driving by

name: Don Olivo Chocolate Tour
description: Stayed for free after doing the chocolate tour ($25), used shower and toilet in the plantation. Nice owner. Completely safe.

name: potable drinking water tap
description: behind blue and white at a building, to the right of the white garage. small white tap/spigot. can reverse up to it. they told me it's drinking water

name: Passenger ferry to Puerto Jimenez
description:
C3000 p/p each way (March 22)
see timetable and directions on photos attached

name: Gas station
description: Plaza Ventanas gas station. free showers, toilets, and tap/spigot with non potable water. open 24hrs. didn't ask about sleeping

name: Cabinas Rosas del Mar
description: A simple, very comfortable, gated hostel with 5 cabins, some with kitchen. Secure parking for many bikes and a few cars. Cabins with 2 bedrooms and bathroom. Cold showers, thankfully on 36°C weather. With fan= 8.000colones pp. With AC, 10.000colones. 1 Block from Coco Beach. Close to everything. Elba, the manager, is very friendly and helpful. Cash only, but they accept either colones or dollars.

name: Nueva Chinchona
description: Very good overnight place for all size of motorhomes! Quiet and safe. right after the sports hall. from here 6,3 km to beautiful Lagune Hule. But not possible with front wheel driven motorhome!  think you need 4x4

name: San Jorge soccer field parking
description:
we moved to this place because chocolate place one km west was not possible for us.

in front of the soccer field and beside the sports hall is space for one motorhome of all size. ours is 7 metres and we had no problem. 

very quiet after the soccer training was over.

Last of the neighborhood is the whole village very save and quiet

name: El Pavon waterfall
description: Nice waterfall with lots of shady rock pools to swim, easy steps to access, 4km from main road with fairly good quality dirt road. Restaurant nearby. We parked on the road overnight but in the morning a local knocked on our door to tell us that he has heard that people has been robbed up here.

name: Rancho la Cascada
description:
We took a decent gravel road to the National park la Amistad (we went there in dry season, 2x4 should be enough to get there). Just a few hundred meters away from the entrance, we found the Rancho la Cascada. It's a nice restaurant with a beautiful view over the valley and a huge parking lot. We ate there in the afternoon (reasonable prices) and the owner allowed us to stay there overnight without charging anything. She told us that there is another property close to the restaurant which also has a lot of space for big camper, if we were interested. She also told us that we could stay as long as we want to. We stood in a hut in the garden for the day, there she provided WiFi (slow), electricity to charge Laptops ect. In the morning we could take a warm shower and she told us that we could make laundry in her big spare sink. She also allowed us to fill out water tank with delicious, fresh water from the Nationalpark!
There is a street leading to the Nationalpark sector Altamira, it's not on Google maps, but the owner of the restaurant knows how to avoid driving all the way back to the street 612.
There is also a hiking trail which leads to a waterfall, the hike is one hour long.

name: Beachfront Tortugero
description: We can't recommend this hotel. Everything is very basic and more or less clean. The staff is unfriendly and we felt not welcome at any time during our stay. The only good thing is the fast WiFi.

name: Roots Tours
description: We can recommend this Tour Operator. You can make diffrent tours to a good price. The staff is friendly and knows a lot about the national park, animals etc. Enjoy!

name: Playa Mangos
description:
At the end of the road there is a very nice beach where you can safely park your car and sleep. During the day it’s quite active with ticos enjoying the beach, at night it’s really quiet. We loved the serene beach basically all to our selves and the amount of stars we were able to see! 

There is some water nearby to do the dishes and wash the sea water off but this seemed a temporary solution when we were there. There is also a bin. 

Lovely place to stay! We felt safe and were offered help and fruits by a tico who was also camping in a van at the same time.

name: Riverside spot - Rio Zapote
description:
At the end of an old road there is a really nice spot to camp. It’s alongside river Zapote and there’s green and jungle all around you. Rocky underground. Would recommend a 4x4 to get there, in March it was necessary. Without a 4x4 you can camp 20m back, a little further from the river. 

We felt safe here, totally secluded from the road. We only heard the jungle sounds all night! Also no wind.

name: Riverside camp on private land
description:
We stayed here for one night after asking the owner of the property if we could stay the night. (When you enter his land to go to the river, on your left there will be his house. He will be somewhere inside the house, outside or on his  land. In our case he came outside to check on us.)

He was super kind, offered us sugarcane and pipa and let us stay there quietly. The road goes down to the river which is really nice, camping (with your car) would be recommended a little higher up on a level part of the road. The river gets higher fast when it rains so it’s not recommended to sleep down at the river. 

We really liked the place and you don’t hear much of the road. You mostly hear the river and jungle sounds. Oh and there seems to be howlers living in the trees above, which is nice and fun! 

The river here seems to be not suitable for swimming because there’s a strong current. We played in the water though, building dams and such :) =

name: Hotel Margarita
description:
We slept on the parking lot of this hotel with our 4x4 rooftop tent. We paid 10$ which included the use of their pool. We absolutely loved having the pool as it’s very hot and clammy around here. You can use the outdoor shower of the hotel and the toilets of the restaurant. 

They don’t accept overlanders anymore! You have to pay a room $100.-!

name: Mohagine
description: This is a wonderful place to spend several nights. There is a kitchen, bathrooms, hot showers and the possibility to do the drakes bay tours (caño island and Corcovado). You can camp at his parking lot or use of his cabins/tents. Price for the camping is 10$ a night. With all the rain we choose the option of the floored tent/cabins for 15$ a night. Absolutely loved our stay here and the owner is extremely nice. He can also arrange a discount for the tours if you’re interested.

name: Sabor y Cafe Dona Eli
description:
Fantastic Lunch Buffet for 3200 Pesos/Person inluding soup, main course where you can select out of 4-5 dishes, and desert.
They also offer other stuff if you dont like what is offered for the set lunch menu.

Staff is very friendly and can speak english.
Lots of locals here around noon.

name: Camping Playa Esterillos
description: Camping next to the beach. Electricity, shades, showers + bathrooms all clean. Very good wifi. Also table and sink at each spot. 4000 colones pp

name: Prados Park Atenas
description: Small adventure park with a camping area. Just 30-40 minutes from San Jose and a great place for traveling families. There’s clean bathrooms, showers and 2 swimming pools. Campsites are in a wooded area with a lot of shade, some spots include a sink and 12v plug. Super safe and the staff is incredibly friendly.

name: Kappa Sushi
description:
Tasty sushi place, surprisingly good for Central America. Variety of rolls, tempura, veggie/vegan items too (see pics for menu).

Best value is the boat- 4 rolls of 10 pieces for $28US (4 rolls for the price of less than 3). Boat rolls use a separate menu, see pics as well

Wifi also available

name: Hotel La Cascada
description:
Cheapest option on Booking.com. If you have genius discount, it's 11US for 3-bed dorm (I had the room to myself my 2nd night), 9US if you book much in advance. 

Private rooms available as well for ~35US, but they book up early

Close to the park with many shops, restaurants, etc

Secure parking for a few motorcycles in the entranceway, street parking for larger vehicles

Wifi is decent during the day, very slow in the evening when everyone is back

They'll do your laundry too for 4-5000C

name: De La Finca
description:
Really good food available here( Burgers, Wraps, Pastas and lots of other good dishes) and exceptionally good fruit juices. Seems as if this is the best restaurant in whole quepos as its recommended by many locals.
Staff is also really friendly, welcoming each guest with a cold glass of water.

name: Llantera chucillo - Tyre repair
description: Local guys do a good job at a good price. Paid 2000 for new valve. Open 7 days till 10pm. Whatsapp +506 70928935.

name: Rincón de la Vieja - Santa María sector
description: A great option to escape the crowds. Hot springs lookout and waterfall. Good road. Last 2.5km rock road but good. Try to work out if it's open before you go as they are a bit slack up here with opening. The website isn't accurate.

name: Corcovado Hiking Tours
description:
Rudolfo offers diffrent tours in the Corcovado Nationalpark. He is a great guide and finds a lot of hidden animals. He knows the nature and animals. We had a great time, saw much animals and can highly recommend him!
www.corcovadohikingtours.com
+506 8701 6266

name: Technomotors Ford
description: This garage specializes in Fords.  The owner worked 15 years in the car dealership before opening his garage.  From the outside it does not inspire but the team is very friendly and competent.  We had a power problem on our vehicle and everything was resolved quickly.  We spent the night in the safe garage.  Very honest about the prices, he told us that it was cheaper in Guatemala but we preferred to do the repair because he knows the brand and the vehicle.  I recommend 100%

name: Taberna
description: It looks like bar and event place . We have been there Wednesday. No one was around. So delicious and cheap food and drink . Friendly owners . You can stay at the amazing view parking lot .

name: Rio Coto (next to BAR EL TURISTA)
description:
On the river bank of RIO COTOS next to BAR EL TURISTA. 
Super nice and flat. Some action from people crossing the river to go the next town (Naranjo). The river can only be crossed in summer, so they take advantage of that. The river was only about 1 foot deep but if it rains it can get impassible. You don’t need to cross the river if you just camp next to the bar or along that side of the river. 
There is a big shaded tree next to the bar, but if you drive alone the river you can find other good spots (4x4 required if you adventure a bit further along the river). 
We stayed here 2 nights (on the weekend) at the end of March (which is the end of dry season) and it was very peaceful. Lots of birds at sunrise and sunset. 
Great spot. Super safe. And we got to swim in the warm river all day. 
To get here you likely need to drive about 10km in the palm field on a dirt road. It’s well maintain and was not a big deal with our truck camper. It’s a bit bumpy at the beginning, but got better after the first 3km. You do have to cross several pretty narrow bridges, but they are the same buses, semis, and tractors with huge loads of palm oil fruits cross. So I would not worry about the weight. It felt 100% ok for us as we saw many other much larger and heavier vehicles cross it. 
The bar used to serve food several years ago. They might still do. They also have toilets you can probably rent for a small fee or just if you buy a drink or something ;). Super nice local people.

name: Black Sand Beach 4m from water
description: Insanely gorgeous spot just walking distance from town. Room for only one vehicle but it’s perfection. Be careful as the sand can be a little soft. Prob not best for big rigs.  Palm trees offer a little shade.

name: Water supply Matapolo
description:
free water at the schools football field. 
AA supply
Wifi as well free via Zii para todos
big trash cans
nice little town, few sodas

name: Ruedas del Atlántico
description: Got changed our tyres here (after s flat tyre). Super easy and quick on a good price! 60‘000 Colones for a new tyre including work.

name: Iglesia Oasis
description:
Nice and safe place to stay and relax, plenty of ground to camp, running water, close to the city of Cañas.

Pastor Guevara let me in and offer space to camp, he is living at the place, they have a guard overnight.

name: Jaspers Coffeeshop, Restaurant and Handcraft Souvenir Shop
description:
Javier and Sofie are running a Coffeeshop and Restaurant with very beautiful handmade wooden souvenirs. The main business from Javier is a carpentry for handmade beautiful carribean furniture. 
The family share great hospitality and it is the perfect place to stay for one night with a camper van or tent before going very early to Tortuguero via La Pavona (10 min drive). In the beautiful garden you can see monkeys, sloth, different iguanas/lizards, frogs etc. and it’s pretty nice to wake up with all these animals directly surrounding. The food is very good and  has a fair price! We enjoyed it very much and as well our clothes got washed during our trip trip to Tortuguero. The facilities are very clean including a shower.

name: Laboratorio Hospital San Rafael
description: This hospital has the cheapest PCR tests in Liberia based on our research. It costs 50,000 colones or $76. It takes 24-48 hours. Quick and easy.

name: Finca Rosa del Mar
description:
Finca Rosa del Mar is not only a beautiful campground but a source of nature and inspiration. Surrounded by a mangrove, with a big family of monkey visiting every day, you can enjoy both the river and the beach. With the hide tide, you can take the boat and visit the mangrove til the neighboring lake. Just hundred meters away, you have a beautiful and quiet beach, where locals go fishing.
Javier will make you feel at home. You can contact him by WhatsApp +50662158874
There is plenty of space for big rigs and tents. Clean toilets, shower and wifi available. Open kitchen, BBQ and a mini swimming pool for kids.
We spent 3 great nights here. Absolutely recommended!

name: end of Samara bay
description: public beach access with many places to park in between trees. quiet place to sleep close to the ocean. good view on Chora Island at the end of the bay.

name: on a beach close to a all inclusive resort
description: secured place for a night on a beach. this place very close to the " fiesta resort all inclusive". you profit from the security guard that protect the resort because you're close and no one bothered. they use Fiesta in their name but on a week day there is no noise at all.

name: Guacimal
description:
Great stop for the night, in the shade, in the company of howler monkeys and birds, very safe.
.....
Super étape pour la nuit, proche du torrent, à l'ombre, en compagnie de singes hurleurs et oiseaux, very safe

name: El Higuerón Chirripó
description:
Small family restaurant tucked-away on hillside across from Vivero Antorcha.  Steep walking trail leading from small gravel parking area at bridge across narrow river.  Friendly people, delicious food, inexpensive Tico pricing.
Recommend to call ahead 8598-6142 (might be 6742, tough to read sign).
Owners expressed interest in an iOverlander listing once we got to talking.
They may offer camping in the future, feel free to inquire.

name: Park with FREE WIFI
description: Found this park with free and good WiFi! Slept here spontaneously after border crossing. Felt safe. Not much traffic, police drives around. Not busy!

name: Street parking for Cero Amigo trail
description:
You can park here on the curve before the very steep path wich lead to the cero amigo trail. Around 1 hr to go to the antena. Then you can make the trail (bucle). Very nice. Free. 
We saw more birds and animals than at the Monteverde park. If your vehicle can do it you can go 850m far (see overlander camping spot). use Mapsme for the trail it is perfect.

name: Finca Don Rafas Adventure Tours
description: I'm just dropping a camping pin here because we almost missed this gem because it's listed as a sight seeing pin, which I don't click on when trying to camp. the road in here is very steep in a couple of sections, and a guy at the beginning of the dirt section made sure we had 4x4 before letting us pass. not recommended for big or very heavy rigs. despite the warnings we made it in and out of there in 2wd, as a challenge to myself, but we have a ton of traction and it was dry. I'm not sure how people would make it out of here if the road was any kind of wet. reception asked for 5 dollars each to camp. restaurant was 6 bucks for a generous lunch, but beers were 3 each... this place is awesome and highly recommend making it up here if you can. it's high enough for a comfortable temperature after the sun goes down. clean bathrooms and shower area. lots of shade. dog friendly! some claro cell service, but no wifi or 4G.

name: Numu brewing company
description: excellent beer! all styles are very good. 4.8 dollars per pint. no food served at this spot but they have another location in cocos that has food. American owner/brewer speaks English and Spanish. dog friendly. it's in an industrial area and you need to check in with the guards before coming in. recommended!  there are 2 other breweries in this complex, but both were closed for the holiday.

name: THERE IS NO WILD CAMPING IN THIS AREA
description:
BY ORDER OF THE OWNERS

after putting up multiple no trespassing and no camping signs this area is now completely no camping. You will be reported to the police, and face a severe fine and possible arrest.

name: Palo Verde National Park
description:
At the entrance we asked if we could camp overnight in the park. They called their rangers inside to ask if they were ok with this (no problem as we were the only guests that arrived this day). They provided us with multiple places to camp for the night, we choose to stay near their building to make use of the toilets and shower. The 25km road is half paved but any vehicle can make it here, they keep it in very good condition.

We payed the 14$ entrance per person but nothing extra for camping and could actually be in the park for 2 days. SO MANY ANIMALS it's just amazing, it is dry season and the animals are drawn to certain spots with water. Close to our campspot was some water, and we've seen monkeys, agoutis, boars, deers, possums, birds and more.

name: Restaurante Mediterraneo
description: nice little Mediterranean place that serves traditional thin crust wood fire pizzas and pasta. pizzas 7000ish for a small and 10000ish for a large. several breweries worth of craft beer to choose from and great cocktails. the basil lemonade was incredible. the patio tables are dog friendly.

name: Libreria Francesca
description:
French bookshop. New and Used. Variable selection.

Librairie Francaise. neuf et occasion,  choix varie

name: Aldina’s Guest House
description: Nice guest house 2 min walk from Playa Negra and 10 min walk to Cahuita.  We also walked to the national park. Large secured parking space. Good wifi everywhere. Nice garden.  Hamacs on second floor balcony to relax. Very good breakfast included. Lots of restaurants in Cahuita. No kitchen to cook but mini fridge in the hallway. They have only 5 or 6 rooms, some with private bathrooms and some with a shared bathroom. We paid $45Usd through booking.com for  a room with shared bathroom. Not a budget price but a reasonable one if you want to stop and relax for a night or two.

name: Brunka Lodge
description: Good little cabins. Lots of parking. Good wifi. We paid 25,000 colones for a cabin with 1 double and 1 single bed, AC and a mini fridge. Pool is a nice add on. 5 minutes walk to town with  resto and shops. Good value for a place for 1 night.

name: coconut camp
description: nice spot below trees next to the shore. the beach in front is used as an informal street by quads and motorbikes so expect a couple of people passing by and greeting every hour. the ground is quite flat and somebody built a kitchen from sticks and stones. plenty of coconut trees but most reachable ones have been harvested. had a calm night during the week.

name: Hotel Cocodrilo
description:
Hot shower, parking with view to the mountains.pool, share kitchen.
+506 71008929

name: House of Conexión Nómada 506
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.  

Free sleeping in my House, shower, Food or whatever U need.

A placer for me receive in my little House.

My personal phone +506 88418639.

Pura vida maes

name: Playa Blanca
description: This place is located in Punta Morales and is easy to arrive by any kind of transport, this beach is secure, the local people are coming around to have fun and the police is passing all the time. good luck 😉🤙🏾

name: Lucas Oil
description: Is a 24 hs gas station, quite and safe, with bathroom, fast wifi and security all night.

name: Las Toñas
description: Private Property in the best weather in the World. Enough space to be safely distanced, in a quiet, peaceful, landscape perfect for birdwatching. Wake up to Toucans singing above you. Family owned. Close to 27 Hwy that will take you within an hour of beach towns on the Pacific Coast! 10 minutes to Downtown Atenas which has all you would need supermarkets, banks, restaurants, laundry mat, clinics, veterinarian and plenty of English speaking people.

name: Casa tucan
description: Nice spot to stay with campervan or tent. 6000 c per person. Shower, towel and kitchen available

name: Tecnomotors costa rica taller automotriz
description:
contact Andre by text whatsapp +50688954931.
we got a F150 with a power steering problem. first we went to the ford shop but the parts was BO. Andre help us to find the parts on ebay and install it. We made the parts deliver to Hostel relax while we where waiting in San Jose.very good technician and helpfull. plus ford was charging us 10k$ with minimum 3 months wait. Andre was verry helpfull and the cost was considerably reduce thanks to him. open from monday to friday. he only have a gate of 2.20m. he kindly work on our car on the street. specialized in Ford and volkswagen. Only Espagnol

name: Pagan and Poetry
description:
Gwenola and Yotam have 2 chalets (the blue logo next door that is at the exact point of their property) and make their own French cheeses. 
They propose to sleep at home without paying the night but paying the meal they do. Everything is homemade and just for you! Several possibilities of meals / cheese trays. For a full meal (flat dessert entrance) we paid 20,000 C / person. 

For the moment, no showers. Toilets where you eat as well as electricity. You can have access to water too. They have a small panel slightly sloping sloping for 2 vehicles for now. Call before coming. +506 8545 3481 (watsapp). 

The road to access it is very good (702 tarred) and only 300 meters of own track. 

Quiet, very quiet even. No mosquitoes !!! There are several activities similar to Monterverde. For example, the Adventure Park in the San Luis Forest. Close to the city of San Ramon where you can find everything. 

It's a peaceful place and Gwenola and Yotam are really welcoming and very beautiful values and it feels in their cheeses in particular. In short, a different place in Costa Rica, where it absolutely applies to stop!

name: 708 road closed
description: route 708 from this point north for about 2km is closed due to a giant landslide. this area is possible from small detour nearby that is marked but it's not in great shape.

name: rickety bridges
description: there are 3 bridges on this road, within maybe 10km that are not in very good shape. wood planks for the deck and some were pretty rotten! there were thin beams of concrete below but definitely not confidence inspiring. this one has a sign that reads, "bridge in bad state" but no weight limit listed. our rig weighs 4 tons so we waited for a while to see if any big trucks would drive by. none did. so we lined it up and floored it across the maybe 12m span. I didn't feel good about it but we made it across all of the bridges. just a fair warning.

name: Estación de apoyo al ciclista
description:
Free Bike support 

Public Water 
Inflate pump 
Solar charger

name: Next to the Tico wind
description:
The lake was very low so we can go directly on a small field like a península surrounded by the lake and grass. 
wonderful spot with view on the volcano!
If the lake is higher you can still stay more close to Tico wind there is a lot of space but for campers only. 
The road to come here is in good conditions, just take your time and it will be fine

name: Llantera bijagua El Salvadon
description:
Very serious and efficient garage.
He repaired a wheel and lent us the equipment to do an oil change!

name: Soberanos Brewers Escalante
description: nice brewery in a nice section of town. they didn't have either of the beers I really wanted, the saison or the IPA, but the others we tried were pretty good. way better than the Costa Rica beer factory on this same block, everything there tasted terrible and was very expensive. but where this place really shines is in the incredible Asian fusion dishes they have. so delicious! pints for 3500c and main plates for around 7000c. dog friendly!

name: Track for Volcano Arenal park
description:
In the curve, 100m after the beginning of the track, you will see a small space on your right where it possible to park a small camper like a Sprinter. 
You can leveled your van depending on the way you're positioning it. 
Quiet, at the beginning of the tropical forest so there are many animals, we saw toucans, sloth and monkeys. I'm pretty sure you can find some frogs at night because you can hear them. 
Free and next to Místico park and Volcano Arenal park

name: directly by the water
description:
Nice place with  picnic site, easy to reach.  Local fishermen said it is fine to stay.
