The street is not to noisy and there are lots of birds

name: Mirador La Armonia
description: Fantastic views of lake area. The views alone make camping here worth it. Clean toilets and showers available. Wifi at reception during the day. Cost is 12 dollars per person per night to camp

name: Hotel Coope Crucenos
description:
We checked every hotel in La Cruz and this one was the cheapest. Also the price is negotiable.  We paid $30 ( off season) for a 1 bedroom apartment.  You will have a separate bedroom with air conditioning and a living room/kitchen area ,(the kitchen is fully equipped , even with a fridge!!!) and a bathroom with hot shower. WIFI included.  You will have a little covered entrance area with a laundry room ( washing machine and laundry soap included) . This area is lockable,  so we kept our bicycles outside the apartment.  
The owner is an extremely nice lady who will do everything to make you comfortable and happy. 
They have secured parking available for cars and even enough for a van or a smaller RV. 
I didn't ask but I think she would even let you to put your tent up in the garden for a small fee.
Her whatsapp +506 8707 4558 
tel : +506 8559 9410

name: Poza para Nadar - Upper Catarata
description: Way beter than the 20$ waterfall. Hike past the la fortuna waterfall entrance. At the end go around the big blue gate. Hike straight and down the trail to the river. Cross river and continue the trail on the other side of the river up and over down to the beautiful swimming hole and cascada. Amazing place. No one is there. Beautiful. Enjoy.

name: Bakara Bistro
description: Really nice french bistro with real good food and French recipe. It was perfect. We takes fish and clams for 20$ approx for 2. Awesome food and real cheese you can even try the camembert in fire. Gastronomy french and awesome couple. French and english speaking. And of course good wine. Try it it's worth it !

name: Casa Escondida Jungle view
description:
Very little place with 2 rooms. 
From the outside, it seems to be really old, but everything is ok! The rooms are big, with nice bathroom, wifi, fridge and kitchenette in the balcony and all equipped. 
We paid $45.- the night (room for 4, with 2 beds). Taxes included. 
The owner is very nice. 
You can book via Booking.com or +506 8705 6856 or +506 6333 3220. 
Not a parking place to sleep in your camper or to sleep in your tent.

name: Water Tap next to the street
description: Water tap next to the street, seems potable, but not 100% sure (nobody around to ask). We tried it and it tasted good. Filled our 100 Liter tank using our hose. If we have any side effects, we will give an update. Free.

name: Casa de Emilio
description: Found this perfect place at Emilio home. Wifi + outside shower + parc to visit at the morning the Manuel Antonio parc 10 $. He is very Nice. I feel safe. it's a little sloping so plan on chocks. he works with the jungle beach hotel restaurant so a guard is present at night and during the day in the parking lot opposite. Good place to visit Manuel Antonio parc. advice do not go to the hotel manuel antonio because he is a thief and a liar. Here its better  Call Emilio +506 72 91 37 05

name: Water Supply
description: this is a free and potable water tap, it is part of a small monuments that Acueductos y Alcantarillados (national water supply company) locates in rural towns to be freely used

name: Gas Station
description: Gas station with free WiFi. Didn't ask but seems to have enough room to park for a night. Small shop and bathrooms. Gasoline works for most combustion engines.

name: Jungle Life Costa Rica
description:
Marking this place for what it is... a tourist attraction. But there's also free open wifi, bathrooms and looks like a good place to stay for a night although we didn't ask.
They just started this a few months ago. We did a guided tour and saw many sloths, frogs and birds. 20USD per person and recommended!

name: Free WiFi at Public Park
description: I have to write 40 characters here but the description says it all. Wifi reaches street so may also be a good place to stay for the night..?

name: Fabrica de Carretas Eloy Alfaro
description:
This is the factory where the oxen carts have been built for 99 years.

Sarchí is Costa Rica's most famous crafts center. The town offers more than 200 stores and small family-operated woodworking factories producing wooden bowls and other tableware, fold-up rocking chairs of wood and leather, and a wide variety of kitschy items. The most popular items on sale are "carretas", elaborately painted oxcarts that traditionally carried coffee from the highlands down to the port on the Pacific coast.

name: Buenos Aires
description:
district Buenos Aires Jimenez

quiet place with a river in front

name: Gasolinera
description: We were travelling in a big storm and was hard to keep on going so we stayed here. Excellent bathrooms, nice people, a restaurant to eat, a liquor to buy coffee, and a parking.

name: Camping El Grande
description:
This is a house building that behind has an established campground with palapas and nice grassy zone.
Maybe you clap and nobody answers because most of the life is behind the building. The bathroom is simple but clean and so the shower. You have access to electricity. They gave us access to wifi and the kitchen. They are a group of families that live here. We felt is part of the culture. They were really kind and shared some fruits. It was 5000 colones per person they let us stay in a car for 5000 for two because the one whi received us made a mistake and then told us but accepted it. We stayed for a night and we slept with the car doors opened  We also visited the national park and came back. Safe and quiet and just two blocks from the national park and the main street

name: Saningo Tires
description: We had an issue with one of the tires on our Ford Transit. Found these guys on Gmaps and stopped by without appointment. They were able to take us right away, located the issue (damn screw!) and fixed it. Fast and professional. 3000Colones

name: ATM without fees (Dollar/Colones)
description:
The ATM of the Banco de Costa Rica charges no fees upon withdrawal. You can get dollars and colones. Next to the road, convenient to park in front and access (big rig friendly).
We got the dollars here we need in Panama and for the container shipping, as its cheaper than to withdraw at the ATMs charging fees in Panama.

name: Boat Trips and Tours to Tortuguero
description:
Private boat trips and tours to Tortuguero. +50688961221. Guided trips, transfers, wildlife safaris, tours from Pavona public dock to Tortuguero National Park
https://wa.me/message/AAOAM4HIFHWNJ1

name: Arcturia naturaleza
description: camping area, cabins, all natural, bamboo cabins, only those who enjoy nature to the full! speak to Akiana to reserve. +506 60753603 cheap and fantastic space for nature lovers --- área de camping, cabins, todo natural, cabañas en bambú, solo quienes disfruten la naturaleza plena! hablar a Akiana para reservar. +506 60753603 económico y fantástico espacio para amantes de la naturaleza

name: Beach Parking
description: Beach Parking in front of Buena Vista hotel. Stayed here in front of the hotel outside their gated parking for one night since the official beach parking up the road was closed. We had a few drinks and dinner at the Buena Vista hotel so were able to use their bathrooms and wifi which also reaches the first spot outside the gate... guy running the bar in the afternoon was super nice and said it's okay to park there but another employee in the morning was super unfriendly which is why we left. Pura Vida!

name: Tambie's Bro
description: Excellent place for breakfast brunch or something to eat. Attended by two nice Argentinians. Bakery is really good. And prices are OK for this zone (black coffee for 500 cn and croissants for 500 cn also). They have a shady and comfortable place to sit in the back. Wifi works well.

name: Fuego
description: The famous Fuego Brewery and Coffee Roasting Co. Great coffee and good food. More on the expensive side. Free open wifi.

name: Nature Cafe
description: Great breakfast place with an awesome view over the jungle. Possible to spot some birds. Free WiFi and good food.

name: Side of dirt road
description: From here the main road (which is a wide dirt road starting right outside Puerto Jimenez) continues uphill westwards. A much narrower and rockier dirt road branches off downhill towards the beaches. We initially wanted to drive further down to the other places marked on iOverlander but because of one muddy patch decided not to. It may have been fine with our Ford Transit Extended and AT tires but we did not want to push it. There are also a couple shallow creeks to cross further down and some sections with low hanging branches.  Definitely not an issue during dry season but we had a quite night at the side of the road. Beach is a couple minutes walking down the hill. Saw a bunch of monkeys!

name: Centro medico los angeles
description:
laboratorio that does PCR tests before crossing to Nicaragua at affordable price :

"only" 29900 colones per test, you get the result the next day in the morning.

name: Laboratorio San José
description: PCR test for border crossings. $70 USD, results in 24 hours. Super quick, no line for us!

name: Veterinaria Doctor Solano
description: The absolute best vet experience we've ever had. Dr. Solano not only took great care with our dog, but also great care with the other clients he had. He was able to help us with paperwork for exporting our dog out of Costa Rica. He even paid the bank and set us up for the Senasa at the airport (even though we're leaving CR by land).

name: Los Reyes gas station
description: We asked and were allowed to fill our 80 liter water tank with the hose next to the pumps. According to the guys working there, it is potable (and free).

name: River crossing
description: A river crossing that is impassable, even with 4X4. We did the walk test beforehand, and the water came up the top of my thighs, and I‘m 6 ft tall! Probably OK in dry season but wouldn’t attempt in the rainy season. Big detour for us! So, make sure you check with Google first.

name: Guacimo bus station
description: The bus station has free Wi-Fi, cafeterias, small clothing stores, groceries, a bakery, and restrooms.

name: River crossing
description: River crossing -driving across the peninsula. About 50 cm deep in rainy season. Our 4X4 truckcamper crossed no problem.

name: mechanic undertin roofs
description:
great guy, has a high roof for big rigs, helped me to get my lights working again and a few small things..
right coordinates: 10,5470105, -84,8920142

name: Olguita's Place
description:
ADMIN NOTE: Descripton provided by owner.

The camping site includes access to electricity, water, showers and restrooms. 
Our motto is "Your Escape to Tranquility.

name: Camping Club
description: A really well equipped camping store. Got everything you could possibly want to meet your camping needs. We were in need of a camping chair. There were a wide variety and we got a decent one for $12. We walked away with a usb battery fan/night light and strong lamp too. Staff extremely helpful and even provided our very curious 3 year old with a toy to entertain her whilst we were looking around.

name: Big blue water tank
description: Potable water by the road.. (I need to put 40 caractères here bla bla bla)

name: Hacienda Ganadera Tapanti
description: Campingspot next to the river with several covered places for barbecue, tables and wather. Really calm nights and a clean spot. Electricity and clean toilets next to the covered places and clean shower next to the restaurant. They serve food in the restutant from 7:30 am to 5 pm. Can be busy on weekends. 4000 colones/ vehicle/ night and 1000 colones/ person/ night. There is a little bridge to cross while you are driving to the covered barbecue places but they have also options to stay on other places when you are to heavy for the bridge.

name: Quijote Rainforest Reserve / Finca Quijote
description: Campground surrounded by forest and farm. Located on a lookout, the camping area has 360 degree views with two volcanoes in the distance. The farm has a river where you can swim, trails in our 400 hectare forest, and large family farm. The camping area has two bathrooms, fire pit with grill, table and benches, plus now a bamboo structure to camp under. We can provide meals when reserved in advance. Electricity can be provided with a generator, and all cell phone service works here. Wifi can be provided in another part of the farm.

name: Gas Station
description: We were filling up on diesel and asked if we could fill our water tank as well. No problem, potable too!

name: next to the end of the canal
description: on the way to Bijagua follow the canal to the rigth, on the end is a nice flat place for set the tent next to the canal, is close to the  river to, and very quiet, is better with bicycle or bike, not imposible with a car

name: Tecnimotor San José
description:
This is a private workshop that is specialized in all kind of BMW Motorbikes.
Christian is a super mechanic and has a lot of spare parts. (also for older bikes)
He helped us a lot and we could work in his workshop.
Highly recommended!

name: Lava Max
description: Lavandería that charges per kilo. We had 8 kg of laundry and the cost was 8,000 colones ($12 USD). We received our clothes, washed, dried, folded and shrink wrapped same day.  Located in an alleyway between SJY cross combat fitness club and XTC club.

name: Salon multiuso Katira
description:
Flat place, a little noisy with the road next to it.  Wifi available for free.  In the shade in the morning.  No problem overnight.

endroit plat, un peu bruyant avec la route à côté. wifi disponible gratuitement. à l'ombre le matin. pas eu de problème durant la nuit.

name: Lavanderia Bahia Ballena
description: A laundry service out of the home of a local family. They charge 1800 colones per kilo. The family is super nice and depending on when you drop your laundry off, it can be done the same day.

name: Parking lot at Sandpiper Hotel
description: We stayed here 2 nigths in the parking lot and the owner charged us 20 dollars for the car per night (we are 2 people). We could use the facilities of this nice little beachfront hotel (swimmingpool, barhroom, outside shower, beachfront covered terrace, hammocks, deckchairs). We could also cook at the little barbecue spot. The owner is very nice and the hotel very beautiful and clean. We had a really nice and relaxed experience here :) just in front of the beach and good surfing spot.

name: Cabinas Lumbres del Arenal
description: camping for tents or camper vans, maybe small RVs. $10pp to camp. cold shower and toilets as well as two sinks for cleaning and a couple of covered areas. decent cell reception. wifi available. pool and breakfast advertised.

name: Casa de Ires Bed& Camping
description:
House with camping , kitchen, shower and toilette
Wifi , and more. 
15$ night room p/ person 
8$ night camping with kitchen 

Whatssapp +50688148876 with JOSE

name: Casa de Nena Room /Camping
description:
Camping for cars or room for two people with shower and farm-gardens . Nice point close to city , securuty and friend people. 5$ x person with camper or tend and 35$ privet room prior reservation If you want food you can book here too
Dinner or breakfat prior reservation too. 

Whatssapp info +506 88148876 with jose

name: Casita Gabina
description:
We booked an eco lodge but when we got there we decided.to put up the rooftent on our 4x4 instead.
Huber and his wife were very friendly and even cooked us dinner. He has a tilapia farm and grills it right there for you.
Breakfast is also possible.

name: Wood house fortuna
description: Quaint little place, very rustic vibe. Comfortable rooms. Right behind / attached to a soda (local restaurant) includes typical breakfast with the room. Hot shower available but bring your own toletries and towels.Has a private driveway and parking space for a couple of cars but be aware that the driveway is kinda small and if your car is very tall you might not for through it.

name: Camping Verde
description: If you want somewhere with full amenities and close to Monteverde and all its attractions, then Camping Verde is for you. It‘s a small site and can fit three small rigs and perhaps one big one. The grounds are very clean and beautiful with a lovely flowing river beside it. Charly is so relaxed and hospitable and will help you out with anything. His wifi is fast, and showers hot. And if you want a close up of a Motmot, then look no further, he’ll have them feeding off your hands. Definitely recommend! 6000 colones per adult, children free.

name: Scenic Pull-Over for River
description:
Large gravel parking area, made for looking at senic Rio General below. 
Could be possible "wild camp" too.
No litter!

name: Nieves Surf Camping
description: Nice rustic camping next to Playa Avellanas. Space for campervans and tents. 5.000 colones per person per night. Bathroom, cold shower, outside common area with basic kitchen, pottable water and wifi. They also have a little cabin to rent. Dalma and Omar are locals and very nice people. A lot of surf spots near by (specially for longboarding). Some small supermarkets and good restaurants in the area.

name: DESERTS - Cafe & Macadamia
description: This place is painfully touristy, but it was amazing deserts! Worth grabbing one of the cakes or huge cookies to go!

name: imporcarsa
description:
a place to find BlueDef (10 liter container).  for 21652 colones/30$).  tell the guard that we are going to imporcarsa.

un endroit où trouver du BlueDef (bidon de 10 litres). pour 21652 colones/30$). dire au gardien que l'on se rend à imporcarsa.

name: Reserva Natural  Cerro Alto
description:
Private property with three trails (2, 3 and 5 km) in rainforest. The fee is voluntary. 

We arrived late in the evening and spent the cold night in their parking lot for free but just because there was no one to ask.

name: Villas Vista Arenal Hotel
description:
Nice and Cozy Hotel
One bed to three Bed cabanas near the center of La Fortuna in Costa Rica
Free Breakfast

name: beachfront next to bus stop
description: quiet parking places next to the beach, few other campers here

name: ferreteria Remo
description:
we came here to change the gas cylinder America gaz.  we wanted a bigger one (30lbs) for a long time.  the owner was very nice and helped us change the gas hose connection, took back the old bottle and sold a bigger one.  for not very expensive.  I recommend for kindness.

on est venu ici pour changer la bouteille de gaz America gaz. nous en voulions une plus grande (30lbs) depuis longtemps. le propriétaire à été très sympa et nous as aidé à changer le raccord du tuyau de gaz, a repris l'ancienne bouteille et vendu une plus grande. pour pas très cher. je recommande pour la gentillesse.

name: Next to the arenal lake
description: Great spot to spend a night, with a view on the lake and the Arenal Volcano. Next the road but not much traffic so it’s quiet

name: Airbnb with garage
description:
Nice airbnb with 3 rooms, kitchen, big 2 car garage, washer, dryer, BBQ

https://abnb.me/hI5oYAGuBsb

name: Jaulares Mountain Lodge
description: Contamos con wifi, cocina, agua caliente, instalaciónes tipo glamping por si las necesitarán, pueden ingresar vehículos grandes. Las vistas son increíbles, los precios son por noches y la forma de pago es en efectivo y también por medio de paypal

name: Aquaparc Cabanas
description:
family friendly water park.  3000c/pers.  good restaurant and not too expensive.  nice to spend a relaxing day.  see macaws and toucans.

parc aquatique sympa familial. 3000c/pers. restaurant bon et pas trop cher. sympa pour passer une journée détente. voir des aras et toucans.

name: Hostel Dodero
description:
Nice and well maintained hostel. garage parking available for motorcycle or small cars. Door is 15 x 9 x 102. Water hose available, drinkable water from tap. They let me use the place to do my mecanical maintenance on my motorcycle. 

Helpfull and friendly staff. Car mecanic garage across the street, car parts store 5 min walk, close to bus station. 

Jesus is the owner. Pura Vida Hostel is owned by his mother.

Dorms 11$ USD, private available for cheap.

name: Carlos Pacheco jungle tree house
description:
Super friendly owner who made his own tree house. 

Basic, hand made, tree house 10meters above the ground. Basic facilities. Brought our own cooking gear. 

The tree house is a 10min walk from Carlos’ house where you can park (seems save). The. Facilities are basic but there is running water for shower and toilet. Please contact the owner for information to reserve. +50689312451. 

The owner is also part of Pacheco tours which offers all kind of tours. I joined the floating tour which was a super experience with Carlos.

name: Entry to Carlos Pacheco house and platform
description: See other description nearby. Entry is here

name: Banco Metropolitano ATM
description: ATM in Havana centro. It ONLY accepts VISA. NO Mastercard!

name: Panamericana Mercado
description: 5 liters jar for 1.90 CUC (or 1.90 USD). By far the cheapest bottled water you can find in Havana!

name: Correos De Cuba/ Post Office & CADECA (foreign Exchange)
description: Post office in Havana Vieja (Old Havana). (You dont need stamp for postcards. Its included in the price. We paid 1 CUC (or 1 USD) for one postcard including the stamp.) Also, there is a foreign exchange bureau just across (CADECA/ Casa De Cambio). Be aware when you exchange US Dollars. They deduct a 10% plus the exchange rate (check the picture). Prefer EURO, Canadian dollars or Mexican Pesos.

name: FREE WIFI
description: FREE WIFI in Cuba!!! Deadly slow! Forget about social media or streaming! You just need patience! Ask for the password from the locals. We never managed to send/ reply to our emails. No skype also. We just managed to connect ;-)

name: La Juliana
description: Pizza, pasta, sandwich and COCA COLA in Cuba!! One sandwich & one pizza 3,5 euro (90 cup). Its an Oasis of cheap & quality food in Havana. Forget about the 10 pesos food and come here for breakfast/ lunch/ dinner! Its worthwhile to visit this place and experience the slow (or fast? You decide) transformation of communist & authentic Cuba to a capitalist modern economy similar to its neighbors (US & Mexico). All prices are in Pesos Cubanos/ Moneda Nacional. The exchange rate is 1 CUC (tourist currency) for 24 CUP (Moneda Nacional). Off course they accept CUC.

name: Wifi Hotspot Havana Centro
description: Buy your ETESCA card from someone around and surf on the web in Cuba!! You pay 3 CUC (or 3 USD) for 1 hour. Normally, ETESCA sells for 2 CUC if you manage to buy from an official store. Dont expect great speed. Forget about FB, streaming etc. Skype works ok.

name: Wifi Hotspot Viñales
description: Buy your ETECSA card and surf here. Its a nice busy kiosk with picnic tables. There is also a nice store/bar to buy drinks, alcohol or snacks.

name: Da'Tuty Bar & Restaurant
description: Nice restaurant in Viñales with reasonable prices. We ordered arroz mixto, artoz a la cubana & ropa vieja. All were nicely cooked. Good service also. Good prices compared to most of the touristic restaurants in Viñales.

name: Valley De Viñales Viewpoint & Tourist Info Centre
description: Stunning views of the valley just before enter to the little town of Viñales. The building hosts also the tourist centre of the Valley de Viñales National Park from where you can get useful info about the area & the National Park, read about the history and check some trails.

name: Los Jazmines Hotel Mirador
description: Excellent place to catch stunning views of the Viñales Valley. You can have lunch/ beers at the bar of the hotel also. 3 CUC if you want to swim in the pool. In a busy day (especially during weekends) dont bother. Just go in & jump in the pool! Nobody will notice. Its a public hotel so dont expect the service to be fast or good! Everything is slow. There is also WIFI (they sell ETECSA cards). If you want to stay, get prepared to splash the cash!!!!

name: Horse-back Riding In Viñales Valley
description: Jose is doing horse back riding in the Viñales Valley. You will visit a tobacco farm, a coffee plantation/farm and a cave where you can swim (its 2 CUC extra for getting into the cave). The cost is 10 CUC per person. The tour lasts 4-6 hours. Jose is a great guide, he is very experienced with horses & we had a great time. The activity is very good value for your money & the landscape is stunning. You can also buy cigars from the tobacco farm for 3 CUC per piece. You will also have the chance to try the cigar before shopping. The cigars are super nice. Jose rents casas & he also rents bicycles. The location of the place is his house. Its a two floors white-blue building. Just ask for Jose (or Pupito). Jose's house is in the basement (first on your right).

name: Los Cocos Beach - Playa Giron
description: If -for a reason- you end up to Playa Giron, since there is anything else to do, you can pay a visit to Los Cocos beach. Nice sandy beach, a bit rocky as you walk in with coconut trees in line. There are also some tiendas who sell stuff (souvenirs, summer hats, drinks etc). If you think its a typical Caribbean exotic beach, you are absolutely wrong!

name: CADECA/ Bus Station/ Grocery Store
description: A little complex that hosts most of the basics for travelers in the little town of Playa Giron. An exchange bureau (CADECA), a small grocery store (alcohol, cigarettes, some food etc) and the central Viazul bus station. Remember: book in advance for any destination (Cienfuegos, Trinidad, Varadero, Havana) as it gets too crowded in the morning.

name: CADECA Cienfuegos
description: CADECA (government run exchange bureau) in Cienfuegos city centre. Expect long queues (as usual).

name: Restaurant Inside Mercado Artesanias
description: A little hidden gem inside the Mercado Artesanias in Calle 54 (the main paseo in Cienfuegos). Just across Restaurant "La Verja", go inside the mercado and look for the little restaurant. It does not look great at the first sight but food is awesome and dirty cheap. Really big portions, good service and tasty cuban food. We had fish, ropa vieja (a cuban classic) and  mixta (including 4 soft drinks, we paid 205 cup for 4 people). All were delicious. Dont miss it when you are in Cienfuegos! Highly recommended.

name: Viazul Bus Station Cienfuegos
description: Viazul Bus Station Cienfuegos. Departures/ arrivals to/ from Havana/ Trinidad/ Varadero. Remember: ALWAYS buy/book in advance

name: Playa Ancon
description: The place to be in Trinidad. Take the bus from the town (4 cuc return ticket pp) and spend your day in Carribean! Lots of places for drinks and food around!

name: Wifi Hotspot Trinidad
description: Buy your ETECSA card and surf! Excellent place for socializing as well. Free live music shows at night.

name: Casa Cary Y Lazaro
description: Casa particulare in the city centre. Has everything (AC, hot water, kitchen, privacy) and its location is super. They usually charge 25 CUC. Bargain hard. We paid 20 CUC per night. If they ask if its your first time, say no and pretend that you know the price range.

name: P12 Bus Stop (Havana Centro-Airport)
description: Bus stop for P12. This bus goes to Santiago de Las Vegas. You stop to Boyeros & walk roughly 2 km to the airport. You pay 1 CUP (literally 3 cents). OR you get a taxi for 25-30 CUC (or 25-30 USD). You choose ;-)

name: La Borla TRD CARIBE
description: Cheap water in Havana Centro. 0,45 CUC for 500ml, 0,70 CUC for 1,5lt & 1,90 CUC for 5lt.

name: Soda Obispo Helados (Ice Creams)
description: Best & cheapest ice cream in Havana. Dont miss the coconut (coco glasé). You pay in CUP.

name: Hostal Elena
description: Excellent Cuban hospitality by a lovely family. Great colonial building with all the basic amenities you can find in Cuban houses (A/C, hot water, power). They also provided us with filtered water to drink for free and they let us make use of their kitchen. Only two blocks from the main avenue of Cienfuegos and less than 10 min walk from the main plaza. We paid 35 CUC for a room (we were 4 people). If you bargain, she will let you stay for 17-18 CUC for a couple. Recommended!

name: Immigration
description:
Get your Touristcard extension here

Bring:
25 CUC in sellos (you get them at a bank)
old tarjeta turistica (must be expired!)
Confirmation of your next night at a casa or hotel
Passport

name: Casa Azul
description: This Casa is about10 minutes walking from center. There is terrace, relaxing at terrace was amazing. Hot shower, air conditioner, fan, refrigerator, TV. I stay here 3 nights, room is 12 CUC, breakfast is 3 CUC, dinner is 4 CUC. Food are very delicious. If you stay only 1 night, price is more high maybe. If you are 2 people, price is more low maybe. Owner Maira is very nice lady. She speaks only Spanish but she is used to meet foreigners who don't understand Spanish.

name: Casa de Emma
description:
Home stay style accommodation. There are 2 rooms, each room have 2 beds. Room are simple but very clean. For 1 parson is 10 CUC. Price is include breakfast. Dinner is 5 CUC. Emma is very kind and wonderful cook.
Baracoa is not too much touristic, sea and mountains are beautiful. Baracoa is NO.1 town of Cuba for me.

name: Villa Colón, Casa Particular
description:
Nice casa particular with 3 rooms, for max. 6 people, newly renovated (last steps in progress, A/C planned). Very friendly, English speaking hosts. We were 2 persons and paid 35 CUC pn for the whole house. 
Breakfast and great local dinner at their friend's house next to Villa Colón. Be open! Its the simplest hut, but Roberto is the most warm-hearted cook. His tortilla is unique and dinner with fish, octopus really great. 400 m from the Caribbean beach. White sand, blue water, almost no people.

name: Salto del Guiabol (highest waterfall on Cuba)
description:
5cuc entrance fee, can see one slightly smaller waterfall from restaurant without paying entrance. i did not enter but heard it's nice, you have to hike to the bottom to see it, swimming in the pools possible (get out of your riding gear).

the road from Mella to here is loose gravel with big stones, not the best, down to Mayari is good dirt.

name: beachcamp next to bucanero bar
description:
the bar closes around 6pm and there is a guard staying all night who also looks for your bike if you decide to go for a walk.
everyone is super nice here and they say it would be no problem to camp here.
had a nice quiet night, even in daytime there is not much going on, it's beautiful, highly recommend.

there is a 24h restaurant with excellent food for ~5cuc, 5min walk direction la boca, if you walk along the beach you can't miss it.

name: Abandoned
description: Abandoned place. Camping free directly at the beach. No infrastructure. Ocean water is clean. Looks like a place where couples go to have some time together.

name: playa ancon beach camp
description:
best to make friends with the security as early as possible, went for a swim and for a "small" tip (1cuc) he allowed me to use the outdoor shower of the adjacent resort.
i also paid 1cuc for parking till people had left...

name: Playa Giron Camp
description:
another nice beach camp with cocktail/beer supply till ~6pm. beachguards and bar guys are really cool, deliver drinks, get food (from somewhere else), cut down coconuts from the palm trees as needed and are generally very friendly. 
there is lots of grass around for camping. quiet night.

name: Cueva de los peces
description:
i'm not sure what the guidebook says, but there is some really nice snorkelling around here, best to bring your own gear and be here before 9 (it gets really crowded around 10am).
snorkel/diving rental opens at 9-9:30.

nice shipwreck if you swim out straight just before it gets really deep to your right.

if you worry about getting into your riding gear with sticky saltwater, there is a beautiful natural freshwater-pool next to the restaurant (which i think serves things like crocodile).

really good place, many beautiful places for camping along this road.

name: Marina fuel
description:
this is the very end of the road, there is a small marina and a locked pump for boats, they have especial and diesel.
i had to personally pick up the fuel guy from las tumbas to get fuel here. easier you fill up in Sandino. there is also a bar which serves drinks (pricey).

name: Guanahacabibes National Park
description:
entrance gate to national park.
very nice ride to the western end of Cuba.
better ride slow, many animals crossing this road, pig families, iguanas, birds, huge crabs, horses and cows.
some great spots to camp near the beach, not 100% sure it's permitted (the manager of las tumbas hotel said it's not) but rangers found me around 7pm standing next to my tent, waved hello and left. some spots have wooden shelters (seem to be made for camping)

there is a shipwreck close to the road too, you can't miss it...

i can't say if there is an entrance fee as i took a short dirtroad into the park circumventing the gate, when i left through the gate (ready to pay) they asked for my permit and just let me go without...

name: wooden shelter
description: very nice place to camp, hard ground to park the bike and sheltered spot to put up a tent. many seating/cooking options. pigs might visit. there is an old man living nearby (the house to the west) who might come over as well. he didn't talk much, maybe he is the caretaker of this spot and expected some money, but he didn't say. i left a tip.

name: María La Gorda
description:
hotel and diving center.
5cuc to spend the day in the compound
7cuc for snorkeling gear
12cuc for snorkeling boat trip
63s/85d for a room
has wifi, food, bar
i just rented gear and snorkelled from the beach, enjoyable but nothing spectacular, i think the diving trips are good though.

name: hostal el jardin
description: 20cuc in high season, garage with space for two bikes, nice family and big room with attached roof terrace. 5 small lazy dogs.

name: Place at the ocean
description: Incredible nice place at the ocean. Big rocks and lot,s of fisherman. The street from the east is pure adventure for motorbike riders. Good sleep. Safe. Also worth a short visit. Good swimmers can have a lot of fun...

name: bike importation/exportation
description:
blue building at the window.
for exportation bring a 5cuc stamp. they will take engine and chassis number (again). 
importation expect one full day, exportation a few hours.

name: Hostal Sra. Maylan
description: Very nice hostel with huge garage. place for at least 6 motorbikes. Right now they can host 3 people but they a building more rooms. The lady of the house is super friendly and you shouldn't miss her food. You can wash your motorbike in the garage if you like. Perfect spot if you are leaving Cuba from Cienfuegos since it's just 60km away... Highly recommended.

name: Maritza Rent Room
description:
This a guest houst located at about 2 km from La Habana Vieja. You feel in the heart of The true city, you live in a family house very friendly and helpful.   When we arrived the house was full but Maritza has many links in neiborough and she found another family (Elvira) that could rent a room for us, a few meters further. 
We paid 30€ for a double with bathroom and shared saloon and kitchen. Everything very clean. 
Possibilty to have breakfast at Maritza's for 4€/pers. 
A good place to stay in La Habana.

name: Jazz Cafe Trinidad
description:
buffet and a main course for cheap in this restaurant located in the heart of Centro Historico. 
Price : 7.50 CUC if meat as main course
Or 11 CUC if you choose as main course the grilled lobster tail (Big and delicious). 
In the free buffet you can find : rice, beans, raw vegetables, chips, squash and fruits (pineapple, papaya).

name: Taxi driver with old Pontiac in Cienfuegos
description:
His name is David Pérez he drives a magnificent ancient Pontiac from 1959 and practices good prices to ride from a town to another. 
We paid 25 CUC (for 2 of us) from Trinidad to Cienfuegos. 
He can drive you everywhere in Cuba. 
From Cienfuegos to Viñales he charged 100 CUC (420 km).
Phone cell : 0143579038

name: Terminal Connection Bus - Almost Free Airport Travel
description:
To get to Havana City or back to the Airport for 2pesos (2cup), yes literally about 6cents.

1. From Airport take terminal bus to this location cost 1peso.

2. Use Maps.me and walk to the terminal 2 bus station (image attached)

3. Catch the P12 bus it is squishy and takes about 1hour but this bus with cost another 1peso (3cents)

4. Get off at Parque El Curita (corner of Dragones and Águila) you are now right in Old Havana about 200metres from the National Capital

Follow the directions in Reverse to get back to the Aiport, somone has already pinned the park / location of the P12 bus in the city.

This saves you 35USD each way. 

Heads up 1cuc = 24cup = 90cents USD

Enjoy

name: casa galicia (maximiliano ramos 112 street)
description: colonial house. very clean, friendly. you can park the car. we paid 15cuc and we park the car inside. very close of centrum. you can breakfast for a few money. with a patio inside they do some times mojitos in the patio.

name: hostal Elida
description: clean, nice and family very friendly. we paid 12cuc but it was low season and after the Irma hurricaine.

name: La Lonja
description:
Cool simple bar with outdoor seatings. Very very cheap! The prices are in CUP but in can pay in CUC (1 CUP = 1 CUC). Nice and polite staff (how difficult is to find this in Cuba). Beer costs 35 CUP (1,40 CUP), Cheese Sandwich 25 CUP (1 CUC), Pork Sandwich 25 CUP (1 CUC).
Maind dishes around 80 CUP (3,20 CUC).
Nice place to stop for a beer!

name: Free wifi access point
description: weird...but free wifi in this little square. there s also a small restaurant with a horseshoe table setting. paid 2 cuc with fresh tamarindo juice

name: Cristina casa particular
description:
I arrived late in Havana and had to leave the next morning. useless to go back to Havana city and then pay 25cuc for a taxi in the morning, so I stayed in this nice house. 20 per night (but maybe you can work your way towards 15) with air-conditioning and private bathroom. single room. Cristina is very helpful and friendly.
nearby there are few food stalls where you can eat with 1.5cuc a huge meal with fresh juice.
walking distance to the airport. follow maps.me and you ll get there in 45 min.
there are also fancier options in the area too for 30-40 a night.

name: Leyanis y Jesus A.
description: Nice spot with view in the valley. Price 15 CUC per night/room

name: Shipwreck
description: Massive Shipwreck in the Sea, amazing! Would be cool to explore i guess. Entry to national park free and without problem if you speak a bit spanish and tell you want to come to take pictures. Hard to miss!

name: Family house
description:
It´s a house with 2 floors. In the first floor there is a kitchen, bathroom and a room with a really big mattress (2m), and A/C and fridge. In the 2 floor there is a room and a bathroom with A/C and fridge.
 You can rent just one floor. Belongs to a really honest and nice family, nice conversations with them. 15 minutes walk to the beach. 
Near the house you have a lot of restaurants ( la cocinita de yumi and super Mochis are delicious). 
Ask for Arley, the color of the house is dark red and creamy.

name: Casa señora Miriam
description: This is Miriam´s house. Has 3 rooms with toilet and A/C. Is about 2,5 km from the center. Miriam is a really good cooker.

name: Niuka's house
description: This is Niuka's house. The house has a room with two big beds. The family is really honest and friendly. We did a laundry there. We felt like at home with this family.

name: Casa Conte
description:
This is the house from Eric and Yemney, they are a really nice couple, nice conversations with them. The house has 2 rooms with a double bed, bathroom and A/C. 
Also they have a small house that you can rent with kitchen, a bedroom and a bathroom.
 There is a nice terrace. They make good breakfast for 5 CUC.

name: Milagros y Yamile
description: Room with 2 double beds with toilet inside and fridge. Milagros and Yumile are a very nice womans. I really recommend this people. Telephone number is +5353311915. Good breakfast.

name: Venado hostel
description: This is Venado hostel, is working with volunteer workers. Has 2 mix rooms with bunks (12 persons ) and a girl's room. Also there is a private room.  You can use the kitchen and all the utensils. Also if you are travelling with your camper, you can pay 100 pesos and use the kitchen, shower, hammocks... Just Infront there is space for park the car, the hostel has cameras looking the street and at night always there is a person in reception. The workers are really nice and interesting travelers :)

name: Camp at the beach
description:
A really nice wild camping site at the beach of the nice and small village, Guasasa. 
The road from Playa Giron is really nice by bike. Many spot to stop for a bath or a night close to the amazing see.
Luis from the «  casa particular » just in front the beach in Guasasa is such a nice guy and told us that’s super safe to camp here even his hostel was empty! 
You can find some diner here too but no shop.

name: Cayo Jutias
description: beautiful beach with lots of space to camp and robinson feeling. on weekends busy but everyone is leaving before nightfall. nearby restaurants and bars for food and drinks. lots of moscitos during rainy season.

name: Villa Jardin Yusniel y Lida - Awesome view!
description: A wonderfully friendly young couple own this place. A basic room with two beds but nice bathroom and really good hot shower. The view from the small patio is great - hills, tobacco fields, drying barn and workers. The breakfast is also really nice. To top it off we paid just 15 CUC. Highly recommended.

name: Hostal Weber
description:
A nice new hostal with a garage at Salvador Cisneros #155.
Simple, clean, friendly people. 
Good location in the center of town.

name: Casa Heydi en la Montaña
description:
Heydi the owner runs a nice little casa with a couple of rooms. She speaks English too and can organise trips to the nearby park.
Breakfast and dinner can be provided. a room cost me 15CUC.
motorcycles can be parked on the property, but if it's big and heavy it might be more of a challenge riding it up and down into the garden.

name: 2 hermanos
description:
Spotted a casa with private parking. 
Had some trouble finding one myself and my bike ended up in someone's living room, but thought I'd share this one.

name: Villa "El Pescador"
description:
Nice hostal, friendly people ('Syviadis" offered me her laundromat for washing clothes). Very clean bedrooms (available for 10 - 20 CUC) and delicious food (especially the fish plate).
Only 5 minutes walk to the Beach, where you can find some shade under Mangrove trees.
Nice to hang out for a while!

Contact:
Phone: 55460925 (in Cuba, Puerto Esperanza)
E-Mail: siviadys.cuella@nauta.cu

name: Villa "El Pescador"
description:
Nice hostel, approx. 200 m away from the beach, where you can relax in the shade of the mangroves and swim in the clean water (I have seen a really big sea star!). Very delicious food (especially the fish plate, because the owner is a fisherman!).
They even let me use their laundromat for free!
Prices for rooms range from 10 to 20 CUC.
Reservation contact:
Siviadys y Joel David Fernandez 
Phone: 55460925
Mail: Siviadys.cuella82@nauta.cu

name: Bar
description:
The small bar in the middle of 2 restaurant is the best. 
just sándwich to eat but coconut, fruit, beer, cocktail at good price and the guy is very friendly

name: casa anay y jesus
description:
Best view in Viñales!
The house "casa particular" is in front of a field with spetacular panorama of mogotes and all the valley, sunrise and sunset are superb.
Place is clean, brand new bathroom, quiet, fan and a-c, good breakfast, añso offer dinner at "viñales prices" 4 to 10 cup but i found a local place for eat at 1.
In low season if you speak spanish is possibile to pay just 10cup but also 15 is a deal.

name: Beach camp
description:
This is the first free place to camp after playa larga.
Dirt road and nice beach, some trash.
If you check the low tide times you can probably pitch your tent on the second beach in front of the lagunas.
Good swim, because of the river water at the bottom is warm and cold at top.
Met some nice guy fishing at sunset.

name: WiFi 1CUC / 1h
description:
Get WiFi here for 1 CUC / 1h.
The small tienda is located on the south side of parque trillo. You need your passport to buy the cards (max 3 allowed per person)

name: Casa Manolito y Nory
description:
We normally don‘t add the casa‘s here in Cuba on iOverlander but we really really enjoyed this one so here it goes:
You get the whole upper floor to yourselfs which includes: 2 beds for 3 ppl, AC, double windows for air circulation (we didnt need ac in late december), good shower (our previous casa‘s had really low water pressure, this one was nice), a second room with rocking chairs and a fridge with minibar, two separate terrasses with chairs and table (one on the roof). The location is great, you are in the middle of the center. 
We paid 25cuc but it was around new years eve and everything was booked so maybe you can haggle the price. For 5cuc more per person we got a huge breakfast which no restaurant near us could beat for the price.
Also, Manolito the owner is a hilarious and honest guy, even if you dont speak much spanish you will get a kick out of it.
Totally recommended.
Adress is Gustavo Izquierdo 41
Mail from the owner: manuel.lagunilla@nauta.cu
Phone: 41994299

name: hostal orishas
description:
nice hostal near the center.
20 CUC for room with 3 beds. 
5 CUC breakfast. 
excellent secure parking.
calle 51 c/e 54y54

name: wifi
description:
smal placa with wifi. not free! 
look for the ETECSA office and buy your card.
wifi is fast!

name: lake side
description:
campside next to the lake.
go past the old hotel and open and close the fence.
may you have to talk to the guard.

name: motorcycle parking
description:
official motorcycle parking.
5 pesos national per night.

name: Nicho Waterfall
description: Beautiful waterfalls where you can take a bath. Next to El Nicho, down to the left if you are coming from Cienfuegos. No entry fee and we had the spot for ourselves. You could also camp here. Enjoy :)

name: Las Clavellinas
description: They call it "camping" but you sleep in small huts. Expect nothing special, it's very basic but cheap. We paid 120 COP. and had space for 3 persons. On a friday night there was loud boom boom music 'till 2 am.

name: Embalse El Yeso
description: We wanted to camp at the official campesina but they refused to let us in. So we set up our tent right next to it. Beautiful place at the laguna and quiet at night. Some local horse riders came in the morning but they didn't bother.

name: Casa Andrés y Mary
description:
Very good option for Viñales. Andrés and Mary are super welcoming hosts. The Casa has big and clean rooms with double and single beds and private bathrooms. Very good and huge meals for breakfast and dinner (not included but highly recommended) . Big Parking lot for cars and motorcycles.
5 cuc pppn.

name: Hostal D'cordero
description:
Very lovely hotel. Nice ambiente. Friendly people. 25 coc for room with 3 beds.
Parking near by.

name: Batabano
description:
Good spot for camping.
Talk to the guard and they let you camp.
Had a very quiet night.

name: Corrazon del Mundo
description: Probably the cheapest option to stay in Havanna. Very basic but clean rooms and a very nice rooftop terrace. Small kitchen for guests. 15 Cuc for 2 persons. 25 cuc for 5 persons. Parking next door 5 cuc per night, probably negotiable.

name: Gas station scammers
description:
Be careful at this gas station. They told our friends, the pump is broken and the "especial"-gasoline is inside the 84 octane pump (probably it wasn't). Then the guy from the station filled up and told them it's 40 cuc (should have been around 20 cuc for especial) 
Pay in advance and fill by yourself, like it is normal in Cuba and let them give you a receipt.

name: playa amarilla
description: good spot for camping. may you have to ask the locals. not many people around.

name: In the mangroves
description:
probably the only place to camp on varadero right next to the sea.
a lot of trash and noise of the road and the city.  There was no on around!

name: fast food
description:
it says abierto 24 hours.
local prices.
taste was ok.

name: fast food
description: not the one in the front! the one in the back has local prices.

name: cenote
description:
cristal clear water. 
bring your snorkeling mask.
also good for camping.

name: enigma de las rocas
description:
here is the entrance for the enigma de la rocas trail.
nice walk true through the forest.
you can spot some animals.

name: Coppelia
description: The local ice cream chain. All locals come here, it's fun to watch them. If you want to blend in, you have to order at least three big cups each ;)

name: Casa del Cheff
description:
Good local Restaurant with fish, meat and chicken dishes. 
Dishes from 40 to 110 CUP
Bistec de cerdo 40 CUP
Lomo de cerdo 60 CUP
Camarones 110 CUP

name: Beach road
description: This road follows along the ocean. There are maybe 6 excellent camp spots right on the beach and are in the mangroves out of the sun. a little trash from locals but so remote, not that bad. I was camping from my motorcycle.

name: Beach East of Gitmo
description:
Moderator Note: The User did not apparently stay the night. Please check the situation carefully before setting up for overnight. 

Did not camp here as too early in day. But perfect spot for tent camping with huge sandy beach. There looks to be a bar of a sort at the entrance to road but closed due to Covid. Take road all the way to the end for best access. I am on my motorcycle-  tent camping.

name: Cascorro Wifi
description:
Wifi signal in the park with shady park benches. Decently fast. 

I'm not sure if there's anywhere nearby to buy an ETECSA card.

name: Casa Particular Mileidy y Papo
description:
Top notch Casa Particular. Superbly clean. Great views. Spacious, covered outdoor patio.

Two rooms are available. Each room will sleep four. I traveled solo. Cost for me was US$25 per night, plus US$10 for dinner and US$5 for breakfast. Excellent food.

Street parking for cars/vans. Room in the carport for a motorbike or two. 

Hot water. Air conditioning. 

Responds quickly to WhatsApp messages. +53 5 3642623

name: Roadside
description: When you get to Siboney take the road out of town west. Soon it will be a dirt road rolling along the coast. Lots of spots to camp with some in the mangroves. Only issue I had was the crabs came out at night and made a bunch of noise. Still a great spot. Camping off my motorcycle.

name: Cotilla Spring Water
description:
Natural flowing spring. This was a welcome site as drinking water was hard to find when I was in Cuba. 

Looked clean. Had no odors. So I took a chance and filled up two 1.5 liter bottles and suffered no ill effects. 

Even if you don't drink it, it's a nice place to stop for a bit.

name: Road end for tent near ocean
description: Quait place, for tent with car, ocean voice, no peoples, little basura

name: Near road and ocean
description: Quait place for o e night on the beach. Street light lighting all night, nobody ask us.

name: Playa iOverlander
description: Quait windy place, for one or two nights. Possible to buy tunas in Boca de Canasi, up from Puerto Libri, 150cup per kg.

name: Casa leo
description:
Beautiful and cozy place where you can get in touch with nature and explore a beautiful valley and mountains. 

———————————————————————————-

Lugar hermoso y acojedor en el cual puede ponerse en contacto con la naturaleza y axeder a un hermoso valle y montañas

name: Hotel El Faro
description: There is indoor parking here, but might be hard to fit anything with a big roof rack, or larger than an SUV. Very friendly service. Sketchy neighborhood.  Showers were hot sometimes.

name: Portezuelo Park
description: The best kept secret in El Salvador. Friendly staff, awesome camp sites, plenty of firewood and a huge fire ring. Also, the food fair on weekends shouldn't be missed. Can take a horseback tour of the coffee plantation for less than $16 per person.  Electricity available in restaurant.

name: Hostal Cumbres del Volcan
description: Breakfast included. Excellent kitchen and spacious rooms in a good neighborhood of San Salvador. Has indoor parking two vehicles as long as they aren't bigger than a 3rd gen 4Runner.

name: Hotel King Palace
description: Has a pool and secure parking across the street. Good place to stop if you want to do the crossing through Honduras to Nicaragua in one day.  Wifi and computer terminals available.  Parking available nearby.

name: Firewood Hotel
description: Parking lot 2usd for small vehicles, we pay 3usd for a 28feets rv. 1usd extra for power. 150 feets from the beach. No toiletes or water ( we never asked to the security guy, but maybe u could use his toilet) Safe! Policemen sleep there also. /// Estacionamiento enfrente de la policía turística. 2usd x vehículos chicos, nosotros pagamos 3usd x un bus. 1usd extra si queres electricidad. No hay baños o agua. (Aunque quizás si le preguntas al cuidador te lo preste!) A 50mtrs de la playa, y se siente seguro ya que hay policías q duermen incluso ahí.

name: Hostal Casa Frolaz & Quattro Estaciones Restaurant
description:
Francisco and his family was amazing. Private room for two $20-23 per night. Great jazz music during the day, lovely garden, hot water and didn't use it, but laundry service available ($3)

Private parking (space for one car, no big rig friendly). You could park in front of the place, very safe street and close to everything.

Try Pupusas Rosita. It's a must.

name: Cangue hostel
description:
Super chill small locals surf hostel on the beach. Parking in grass lot behind the hostel. Really quiet most of the time- occasional [good/big] weekend parties.

Toilets, outdoor shower, access to kitchen, access to electricity for the parking spots closest to the main hostel. Wifi available - ask Zancudo the owner.

Cars: $10 per car, 2 people. Tent camping $5/person. Rooms $10/15 s/d. Access through the back- turning left off at the last road before the main road ends. Access through marked gate on right.

Families better to stay at hotel next door. Juan runs the place and him and the crew that helps around or hangs around the hostel are all great people.

The extra dollar or two you might spend camping will be well worth the local experience and good vibes of this place- and you'll make up for it with cheap-ness of local food and beers.

Stayed 2 nights in our van out back for $7 USD pp/night. Toilets, outdoor shower, kitchen, Wi-Fi. The owner Zancudo is very kind and helpful.

name: Rancho Clemente
description: A little paradise at the Restaurante Playa Clemente Jagüey  Price: $ 5.00

name: El Mangal, Suchitoto
description: El Mangal Restaurant and swimming pool. $8 per night. Power available from toilet block with long lead. Water available from near shower block with long hose. Flush toilets and cold showers. Bus 60c up hill to town. Restaurant only open for lunch. Small cabins also available.

name: Cerro Verde National Park
description: $3 per person to enter the park and $1 for car. Can camp in the large gravle parking lot or if you ask the police stationed there you can park furthur down in the park. The lot gets busy but is dead quite once the park closes around 5PM, police stationed overnight (they live there).

name: Shell Gas Station, El Salvador
description: USD6 to stay. Toilets. No other facilities. Secure parking area behind gas station.

name: Laguna de Alegria
description: $1 entry fee. per person plus 1 x car Outhouses around lake but they are pretty grim. Camping near entrance on lake shore for a large vehicle– Many spots around lake for smaller vehicles. Height issues due to low hanging trees for vehicles over 3 metres. Locked overnight.

name: La Poza De La Culebra-Rio Sapo Protected Area
description: On the right day this would probably be one of the highlights of El Salvador. Remote, quite, isolated camping on the banks of the Rio Sapo with swiming holes and hikes to nearby waterfalls. $5 for a couple in a gated camp, pit toilets, showers (occationally) and cooking area (fire wood supplied). The turquoise river is the "cleanest in El Salvador." If possible avoid arriving after rain as the river fills with run off and looses its color. Also, we were swarmed by termites at dusk after a rain though believe it to be a freak isolated occurance. The roads in is not on OSM and require good ground clearence.

name: Hotel Larios
description:
Conveniently located along the Panamericana 15km before the boarder to Honduras. 

Room with ants on floor and mosquitoes hungry for your weary flesh. Wifi does not work anywhere, walked all around trying to get a signal: nothing. We complained about the room, but lady was unhelpful. At least the AC works. Parking with cameras, but they don't close the gate. Not recommended.

name: Hostal Sol y Mar
description: Small hostal/parking lot/pulperia/restaurant.  Camping is in the back by the hostal.  On the main street of El Tunco, new camp kitchen has been built since we were here in April 2014. 6usd/night.  Electric available for an extra 2usd/night.

name: Posa da Luna
description: Little hotel with 9 rooms (each room has little patio with hammock and chair), swimming pool and kitchen to use. Very relaxed atmosphere. Our room had A/C unit and ceiling fan. We paid $25 for the whole room.

name: Termales De Alicante
description: Update 10/2021: They didn't let us stay for the night. For $5 per person, we were given a flat parking lot right next to the thermal pools and restaurant. This is a very well kept and secure establishment with beautiful nature surrounding it. Highly recommended after (or before) a long and annoying border crossing. Watch out though , they get tricky, when we were ready to pay another day they asked for $ 30.00. Had to argue with them about the price, not the first instance South of Mexico.

name: Layback hostel
description: Free secure parking. 100m to beach. 3 good surf breaks  within 5 min walk. Kitchen use, coffee, wifi and h20 included. $7 pp for dorm. Camping possible, but no space for tents.

name: Hotel y centro recreativo Sunzal
description: Parkinglot near the restaurant, under some shady trees. Just some meters away from the beautiful beach. We did not use the pool, it was really dirty. Toilets available, but just outside showers. There are two entrances, take the first left on the road to the beach. 8 USD/night, electricity included (long wire, connected at restaurant).

name: Termales de Santa Teresa
description:
... Try your bargain skills ;-) 
panamericana2013: watch our video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P0Z8eOWblPY

name: Rancho Mama Juany - Mariscadas Parqueo Y Cabanas
description: This is a secure family-run site with a restaurant, small RV parking lot (our truck camper fit comfortably at 24'long x 11.8' high x 9' wide), and cabanas. Nothing fancy,  but has banos and outdoor showers. The cabanas are $12, or if you sleep in your camper like we do, it's only $5/night.  Lots of palm shade, super nice family, Dad speaks English, has a place to wash your laundry, and a walk-thru to El Cuco beach. Very fast wifi, electricity and a swimming pool included. Right on the ocean power $3

name: D'Takito Horizonte Surf Hotel
description: Great hostel with large place to park and camp for $10 a night which includes wifi, showers, use of kitchen and use of the amazing pools (x2) and lounging areas upstairs which look onto the beach. They can provide long extensions for electric hookups but no water hookup. It may be possible to tent camp but unsure. There is space for large rigs but the roads on the way down are narrow so may be tight. We are in a Westy and there was plenty of room for higher and longer rigs than us. They have 2 dogs, unsure if they would let you in with other pets.

name: Cafe Mezcal
description: 4x4 with low box only. Beautiful spot right on the beach but sand very soft. We arrived at 21.30 and they cooked a wonderful fish meal for us after a horrendous border crossing where they initially refused entry into El Salvador even though we had an official permit to bring our RHD vehicle in. Problem was our UK vehicle registration states it is not proof of ownership. Eventually, with help of a fixer and a letter from a local agent requesting a 24 hour pass through the country we managed to meet with 'administration ' and persuade him that the truck was BFF ours and he gave us the full 60 day pass! Be very careful, they confiscate at least 1 car a week ( but these usually have Guatemalan or Salvador plates). I recommend using a fixer here, ours caught up with us on his motor bike, he asked $20 and I gave him $40 as without him it would have cost $600 to be escorted back to Mexico and another 90 days before we could  get back into Guatemala. Meal and 3 large beers cos $25 and nothing extra to camp.

name: La Tortuga Verde
description: Hotel/campground right on the beach owned by an American from New York, same owner as Rio Mar down the street. Camping $10.00/ night for two including electricity. The place seems to be a popular one. Restaurant and bar on site. A/C room for $30 per night, or fan only for $25, small fan room for 18$. Free activities like liberating baby sea tutles, yoga, etc.

name: Nacional Parque El Impossible
description: Camping in a grassy field. The park entrance is at the end of a very rough road  , need 4x4 and low gears for road. Not a go out of the way spot but fine for overnight. Potable water available also bathrooms and showers. Lookout tower with good views. Paid 26 usd.

name: Sunzal Garden
description: Private Small Hostal, pool, close private comunity, private parking , camping secure area, wifi, beach access to World class Surfing destination Sunzal!. Professional Massage, Video and Pisture service, 10 mon walk to Tunco village, lot of bars restaurants, etc!.

name: Parque Acuatico Casa De Benedicion
description:
Update 04/2018: Guard asked a total of USD 21 for two adults and camper truck for overnight incl. entrance fee for pools. See details in check ins.
10usd for the night. 5 clean pools with slides where you can swin for 2 usd (kids) or 3 usd (adults). Showers (ext. Better than int.). Bathrooms. Nice manager. Bottle water at the second gas station after. 2km from the archeological site Joya de Ceren. Gas LP in the area. Security guard on site all night and fenced parking lot.

name: Gas Station UNO
description: On the right side of the road (ruta militar, not Pan Am) if going to Honduras, after the city of San Miguel. About an hour before borders. Large parking lot with a lot of trucks and buses; closed at night, but security guards all night. Nice employees. Free, but gas and tips are good maners ;). Station opens at 4:30 in the morning (so expect noises)! You have to be out by 9 in the morning.

name: Hotel Alicante
description: Nice mountain hotel with great garden. Rest., spa and mini-zoo extra cost. Friendly staff. We stayed 2 night for 10usd/night. Closed and guarded leveled parking. Near to nice towns of Ataco and Juayua. Gas station next door. We were able to shower (after a sweaty bike tour in coffee plantation) in the spa center.

name: El Parqueo
description: Rio mar has a party every Saturday night so we went down the road a little and found this spot, people come and park here to go to the beach, nice little spot in between coco palms with mediocre bathrooms for $5 a night (2people)

name: Km 61 Restaurant Parking Lot
description: If you surf and are traveling in a truck camper, van, or other rig 24' long or shorter, this is the only parking you'll fit into to access surf at K59 and K61 (the K59 road is very bad and narrow, and the parking next to the beach is only big enough for a couple small cars). The nice lady in the tienda at the top of the K61 road on the highway owns this restaurant as well. Ask her for permission to park your rig here as this is a gated area. We paid $5 for the night. The land between K61 and K59 is private with several armed guards patrolling the fence all day and night. I chatted with them; very nice. There is a public pool right on the ocean side of the fence that the guard, Luis, said we could use safely any time. He said it is safe here, very tranquilo. It can get busy on weekends so best to visit during the week.

name: Joya de Cerén - Ruins (UNESCO)
description:
The site is open. It costs $10/person and $1 for a van. They will only let you park here for 30 minutes. 

There is not much to see here and they’re not too fond of camper vans, hence why we were hurried along.

name: Campo Bello
description: Beautiful grassy and forested campground. Such a welcome change from the sweltering heat of the coast. $5 per person as of May 19th 2018. New rate $7 per person Jan 2022.

name: Surfers Inn
description: Really nice family run hostel/campground minutes from amazing surf and short walk to tunco. Paid 4 usd a night p/p

name: Hotel Continental
description: Good hotel run by a local family. It is located at 23 Calle Poniente between 6 and 8 Avenida Sur passing the Centro Medico. On the opposite you'll find a bakery. Cost us $23.80/night for a double room including breakfast and wifi. There is a lush patio inside and a big breakfast room. There is a secure parking lot inside the building. Its a safe place with an easy walk to the nearby shopping mall. Take a cab by night.

name: Dona Mercedes
description: $20USD for two people. Home with several rooms for rent. Kitchen available to use. Internet included although a little slow and only works in courtyard. Incredibly kind, welcoming lady runs the place. We were able to park our 4Runner in her secured garage, but there are many secured lots around town for $1USD.

name: Auto Hotel Costa Real
description: Simple clean hotel with spacious rooms. Good place to crash if you're late getting through the border at Hachadura. Secure parking for cars and motorcycles. $14 or 15 $ per night.

name: Turicentro Apulo
description: $7 for foreigner access to this lakefront park with picnic tables, restaurants, swimming pool, etc. We asked about camping upon entry and were told no. Later we asked the parking attendant, who took us to the small police station within the park. They were incredibly friendly and insisted we camp across from the station, which patrols 24/hrs. After park closure, we were allowed to use bathroom at the police station.

name: Rancho Mango
description: A small campground run by a lovely woman who speaks good English. $5 per car per night. Safe and quiet location near Mango surf break. Clean bathroom with cold running water, outdoor kitchen, fridge, sitting area, electricity to site with a long power cord. Also some rooms available. A good choice.

name: Armando Reyes
description:
Great mecanic near San Salvador, specialized in VW bus but used to work on others vehicles. If you have lots of repairs to do you can stay there for the night, there are toilets and shower. Really nice people too!
Here is his phone number: 77651743

name: Entre Nubes cafe - camping possible
description:
This place is a great stop along the ruta de Flores. Fast wifi, good coffee and reasonably priced breakfasts. Very cozy, green cafe area. 
They now offer camping for 10$ per person including breakfast.

name: Hospital San Fransisco
description: If you require emergency care on your long journey this hospital is a good stop. We received an English speaking doctor who took care of us well. Spent two nights in the hospital, comfortable, ac etc. The public hospitals are reportedly much worse, and if you're heading south this may be the best one until Costa Rica. (Not to sure about Nicaraguan health care but it is a poorer country)

name: Hostel Amacuilco
description: Room for one vehicle under 2.6 meters tall. $5 per person. Mexican restaurant attached.

name: Agua Express
description: Small do-it-yourself outdoor filling station in front of McDonald's parking lot. $1.25 USD to fill 5 gallon container. Lots of shopping complexes nearby.

name: Olas Permanantes
description: Lovely hotel on beach. No kitchen but they have a restaurant and there are many places to eat near by. Price is $20 per night but as we stayed for a week, we negotiated $15 per night. Secure parking.

name: Hotel El Altillo
description: We chose to stay in this small hotel off the main road after being stranded with a failed clutch and suspension on our bikes. It has secure parking behind a gate, big enough to fit cars. Big rigs will fit but not comfortably. We paid $30 for a double room with AC. There is hot water, friendly staff and the rooms are clean. They sell cool drinks and there is a small restaurant.

name: San Cristobal, Guatemala to Piedras Azules, El Salvador
description:
Border name: San Cristóbal  
Closest major cities: El Progreso, Guatemala and Santa Ana, El Salvador 
Cost for visas: $0. 
Cost for vehicle: $0. ($.60 for copies)

name: Hacienda Vieja, Ciudad Pedro de Alvarado, Guatemala to La Hachadura, El Salvador
description:
Leaving GUA: WARNING -If you cancel the TIP you can't return for 90 days. 

No costs except the necessary copies if  cancelling the TIP. Personal emigration is 5 minutes. 

Entry into ES: immigration is fast and easy. Vehicle TIP is valid for a stay of  60 days. All free.There is a 5$ tax per person at the exit of the border area if you are not from Central America.

name: Leaving El Salvador
description:
You need the original TIP they gave you when you entered the country and some copies of it. Vehicle permit, license, passport.
Aduana leaving El Salvador opens at 7am.

name: La Sombra Hostal
description: Decent place with secure parking on site. We found it to be the cheapest in town at $25 during the weekend for a room with private bath and fan. Shared kitchen on site, small pool, short walk to beach. Good wifi connection as well. They did strangely charge us $25/night the first night, and then a different person the next day said the rate was $22. The original guy said the higher rate was for the weekend even though it was Sunday night...

name: Condado Cucolandia
description: Nice spot at one of the many hotels there close to El Cuco, right next to the Hotel Tropiclub. Camping on grass in the shade. Directly on the beach. We could plug in. Paid 5$ for one camper, 2 persons incl. electricity. Gustavo, the owner, is very friendly and also wants to build up a bigger campground on the other side of the road. No WiFi!

name: Casa de Cristal
description:
update: on weekends and holidays just over overcrowded! Every family plays their own music out of big speakers. 


Nice, quiet camping in grassy field with views of volcanoes and covered areas for cooking in case of bad weather. Picnic tables and fire pits. Can be windy. 2.50$ per person plus 2.50$ for the vehicle. Tigo service works here.

name: Entering El Salvador / Aduana
description:
This is where the "aduana"is and where you have to come for all the temporary permit paperwork for your car. They were really nice!
Get photocopies of your passport, drivers license and vehicule registration.
Ask around where the aduana is feels like they keep on changing place.
You have to give a copy of you freshly new temporary permit when you come back on the main road.
Didn't had to paid anything.

name: Rancho Alicia
description: Rooms and RV parking/camping right in playa las Flores, as you get down you cross a dry creek (it has water just on high tide) and you go into some palms. They charge 5 per person and 3 more if you want electricity

name: Lot across the road from the beach
description:
Stayed in a lot accross from the beach. Sally owns a place right on the beach and is taking care of the house(looks abandoned) accross from his place. offered him $5 to camp(2 people). no services but well water available. 
This spot allows you to camp at the Mizata surf spot. coordinates are approximate.

name: Perquin Real
description: We stayed at this hostel in Perquin. ideally located to visit the war museum and visit el mozote. we payed $5 for two people. tried to charge us $10 for the second night because we spent the whole day there.  Argued  that this was ridiculous and payed $5 for the second night.

name: El Tibet
description:
Hotel and Restaurant a few kilometers before park entrance. On the main road, we were unable to drive the steep rough road to Campo Bello, this was right on the way to Cerro Verde. $30 for clean double room with private bathroom, although cold showers. A few liters of purified drinking water provided each night. Secure parking in large lot behind gated entry.  Dog friendly. They would probably allow camping if you asked although bathrooms may only be available with a room. Restaurant was good, simple, limited Salvadoran fare. 

They were in the middle of building what looks like an obstacle course/adventure park on the hill behind the hotel, with a zip line, trampolines (some kind of game), and picnicking areas. Incomplete, but the walk up the hill is nice with beautiful views of Volcan Santa Ana and Lago Coatepeque.

Having been overland through actual Tibet, this isn't really the same of course, but their attempt at faux-Asian design combined with the 2km altitude and warm hospitality is just charming enough to hint at nostalgic feelings.

name: Santa Ana
description:
In front of the town hall full center of the city municipal police ensuring the security 24/24 

Devant la mairie plein centre de la ville police municipale assurant la sécurité 24/24

name: La Palma
description:
On the quiet village square during the week 

Sur la place du village tranquille en semaine

name: Suchitoto
description:
Next to a park facing the tourist police super quiet, "wifi del pueblo" on the other place at 150m 

À côté d'un parc face à la police touristique super tranquille, "wifi del pueblo"sur l'autre place à 150m

name: La Cubierta
description: The restaurant is an open, 2 floor palapa that had just opened 5 days ago. We are allowed in the parking overlooking the cliffs and onto the Pacific Ocean.  The restaurant closed at around 1800 hours, and we had a complete run on the place.  Beautiful beach, beautiful cliffs, great place, possibly the coolest place on the whole trip.  Ask for lobster with garlic!  To kill for!! $20/night.

name: Parking by Monkey Lala
description:
In front of the Policia Turistica, just a huge parking with two trees for shade. We was almost alone all the week, but bussy during the weekend when they charge 2-3usd per car/day, free during the week. the police informed it is very safe around. Next to there is other parking similar with some more trees.
If you ask to the security of Monkey Lala maybe you can use the toilet and shower, we did. 
Just 50m to the beach and the main street. Every night there is some laud music all around the village.
Add. Notes (Oct 2018)
There's an electric box for plug in - you'll have to check if it's available for camping use + offer of pool shower only (poor flow and no privacy) - check review but do not pay more than 5-6$ for a car park and use of a toilet???

name: Fish market @Libertad (Pier)
description:
Fish lover`s paradise. Great fish market on La Libertad Pier. Watch the small fish boats unloading their catch, buy gigant red snapper, camarones, lenguado... or let them to prepare for you at the kisosks outside.
Safe parkings with security around.

name: Nuevo Altamar
description:
On the parking lot of the restaurant $ 3 no service but super quiet the restaurant closes at 5pm 

Sur le parking du restaurant 3$ pas de service mais super tranquille le restaurant ferme à 17h

name: Hotel Tejano Amigo
description: Auto hotel with locked parking. (+-4 meter high gate) There are some more auto hotels in this town wich normally rents rooms for 3 hours. So don't expect luxury... We payed 15 dollar (normally 20,-) for a private room with bathroom and Ac.

name: Pueblo Viajo
description: A small village with very friendly people by the bay.

name: Gaz station Puma
description: Big area with some trucks and buses but not so noisy. Friendly security guard. Station closed from 11pm to 4am. bathrooms and showers (need ask to the guards). Should be possible to refill water too.

name: Ronald Diaz REYES
description:
this place was fast ,helping and was great .The did to know what to do.we hat a breakkaliber break down on of the calibers was broken the fluid was just running .we wend there at 7 am and the car was fixed by 10.00
the wend away and the made a caliber with a Maschine and change all break pads (we hat them with us) .great place

name: Posada Blanca Luna
description: ok hotel, 10 to 15 for room, with shared kitchen, no private parking but safe to park outside on street. its in lonely planet. wifi ok. cold shower. near church in centre.

name: hotel Florencia
description:
hotel with secure parking just outside  of the city and crazy roads. great wifi, near by restaurants and there is an armed guard on patrol 24/7 for security. 
Room with 2 beds breakfast included 55$

name: Puma Gas Station
description:
Gas station puma , 6,5km before border El Salvador/Honduras . Perfect if you Want to cross early the n'est morning! There are toilets in store and (open and dirty out back) shower if you need. You can fill up water too. Big place for severals camper/motorhome...
Last ATM before the border. $2 to stay

name: S.C. Autoservices
description: We passed by because we had a problem with our clutch. Didn't have it fixed there because we lacked time. Seemed to be a really good mechanic with new tools etc.

name: Hotel Pacific Surf
description: Right off the hi way at the north town entrance. Charged $5 a night to park my 40ft bus. Includes use of bathrooms. Locked gate with night security.

name: Auto Hotel Marsella
description: Secure & clean auto hotel about 5 minutes outside of Santa Rosa de Lima just off the road to the border crossing El Amatillo. (Signs on the road direct you 1 block to the hotel.).  Each room has its own garage with a door that closes though it's a little low and our Westy with roof box didn't fit inside. The entrance gates are closed at night so parking is secure even if you can't fit in the individual garage. Few overnight guests ("We're not that kind of business. Most people come for a few hours during the day," according to the owner) means a quiet night's sleep. $25 for room with 2 double beds. No wifi but room service available. The entrance gate was pretty high.

name: gas tomza
description:
We were able to fill our bottles without any problems! 

nous avons pu remplir nos bouteilles sans problème!

name: Los Cobanos Village Lodge
