Parking available in a safe area for travelers. We know that it is difficult to find a safe place to spend the night in the car or caravan.
with the possibility of having a coffee. NO CHARGE. That to help the traveler  the parking lot is in front of me --- Parqueo disponible en zona segura para viajeros. sabemos que es difícil conseguir un lugar seguro para pasar la noche en el auto o caravana. 
con posibilidad de tomarnos un café. NO SE COBRA. Eso lo para ayudar al viajero

el parqueo es frente a mi 🏡

name: Workshop Taller Electric-Mechanico Automotriz
description:
Johnny Motoro is a local legend when it comes to vehicle electrical systems, air-conditioning, mechanical and suspension.
English speaking, smart clean workshop.

name: Laundry service
description: Laundromat owned by a young, friendly and hard working couple. Open 7 days a week, from 8am till 5pm. Drop it in the morning and you will have clean dry and folded laundry that afternoon. .90c per pound. Fast, cheap and efficient! Highly recommended!

name: Board repair Yepi
description:
Small repair shop right on the beach at Las Flores.
Yepi is super friendly and helped us out right away.
1 ding, 1 crack of 20cm and some small crack was usd25 in total.

name: Road gets really bad from here
description: Road gets really bad from here, didn't try it in our 4x4. Wanted to go straight to Juayua from the volcano, but didn't risk it further. We are almost 3m tall, so maybe a regular pickup would make it. Try at your own risk.

name: Road gets bad to Santa Ana
description:
Tried the scenic 4x4 with our Iveco 4x4 truck but turned around here. We tried to go straight to Juayua, but the road got bad quickly so tried this path and it turned bad quickly to : Spoke to a local farmer on this junction and he said it gets worse from here. He said the road to Juayua is the worst (I put a warning there too), from here to Santa Ana is second worse and returning back to Cerro Verde would be the best option.

As a funny coincidence we met Alvaro at Café Granja Don Alvaro and he drove us in his pick up to Los Naranjos, so drove up up the mountains from the other side. Let's just say we were happy to not drive our truck, he went in 4x4 low gear and hit the floor quite a few times going up. So I would say only do that in a pickup with high clearance or Land Rover Type vehicle, anything bigger gets ugly fast.

name: Cabañas los Asoles
description: Asked here after asking at the termales. They want $20 for camping on the car (probably negociable) or $40 for a cabana with breakfast included (2 people). Didn't stay because we needed wifi or cell service and we couldn't get either here. other than that it looked nice and has a little restaurant.

name: Entre Nubes
description:
Super friendly owners ( Ivania & Daniel) welcome travellers with open arms. They allowed us to pitch our tent in the private fenced off garden where the peacocks live… we planned to be here for a night or 2 after crossing the border from Guatemala ended up stay much longer! On the second night it rained real hard and they invited us to stay with them at their house… we ended up staying at their house for 5 days, doing day trips from there! 
It was a fantastic experience. There is plenty of room for campers and medium size rigs you might even be able to get a big rig in there.
We were shown the entire property, they have hot showers, probably can sort out some power. We paid $10 per person including breakfast.
Ivania and Daniel were super hosts! Definitely swing by this place even if it is just to have a coffee or a meal. They both speak very good English.

name: Cadejo brewing Co.
description:
Good restaurant / brewery with a decent selection on beers on tap and a menu covering all tastes. The view over the ocean is awesome, they have a fresh and seawater swimming pool open to clients (must spend over $15 per person)
Good place to stop for lunch or smash a few decent cervecitas

name: Maxi Dispensa
description: Tried 3 different supermarkets before, this was the biggest.

name: Pueblo Viejo
description: One if not too many places to stop for a feed! Nice view, big outdoor terrace… simple.

name: Taller Moto del Cuco
description:
Humble motorcycle shop, they also work on cars but only have a small floor jack. They fix tires as well.
They have a concrete slab fairly covered ( sun & rain) that fits a rig the size of a VW Van. You can fit an autobus in the back if you want to but it's on compact dirt, no gravel.
I slept there 4 days fixing my van as I have my own tools but they have tools on site and a stick welder.
Bathrooms, showers, little kitchen that cooks food for people passing by, some fluids and random small parts supplies in the shop.
If you need parts delivered from San Salvador or San Miguel, contact C807 Xpress, they deliver for cheap 3 times a week I think.

name: Parking Lot (Shaded and Peaceful)
description:
Possibly the best place to park your vehicle (and overnight) when visiting the town. Parking lot is shaded and peaceful. Owner, Jose Hernandez, is a super friendly guy.

Surrounding the parking lot perimeter are tiny homes housing small families, so there is a nice community here.

Gate is tall enough for big rigs. We were 3.2m high and absolutely no problems. See picture for reference. Longer than 23’ might have problems making the turn into the parking lot, however. 

We did not sleep here but paid $2 for the entire day. Did not get an overnight price, but it can’t be expensive.

Bathrooms and shower available. Water also available.

name: Casa #34 block E
description:
Hello to all travelers by car, the place that I show is my house, it has 2 parking spaces for cars that do not exceed more than 2.50 cm, I can offer some services inside my house and negotiate the price.  I would like to help all travelers and help in whatever they need.
ADMIN NOTE: this is clearly a post by the person offering service. Could the next user here please add independent comment.

name: Casa #34 block E
description:
Hello to all travelers by car, the place that I show is my house, it has 2 parking spaces for cars that do not exceed more than 2.50 cm, I can offer some services inside my house and negotiate the price.  I would like to help all travelers and help in whatever they need.
ADMIN NOTE: this is clearly a post by the person offering service. Could the next user here please add independent comment.

name: Casa #34 block E
description:
Hello to all travelers by car, the place that I show is my house, it has 2 parking spaces for cars that do not exceed more than 2.50 cm, I can offer some services inside my house and negotiate the price.  I would like to help all travelers and help in whatever they need.
ADMIN NOTE: this is clearly a post by the person offering service. Could the next user here please add independent comment.

name: Casa #34 block E
description: Hello to all travelers by car, the place that I show is my house, it has 2 parking spaces for cars that do not exceed more than 2.50 cm, I can offer some services inside my house and negotiate the price.  I would like to help all travelers and help in whatever they need.

name: Centro Veterinaria La Mascota
description:
This is probably the most established, ritzy vet in San Salvador. Seems all the rich locals take their pure breds here to get vet care and grooming (yes, there is a very busy grooming salon here).

We gave our cat a rabies booster and a microchip for $72. Definitely not the cheapest but this place is professional and speaks English.

name: currents
description: If you swim, preoccupation with the currents. A few years ago swimming there the current dragged me, very strong, I saved my life because I was wearing fins.

name: Water Fill Machine
description: $1.25 for a 5 gallon refill. Machine is right next to the entrance of the Mr. Donut shop.

name: Condominio San Blas
description: Hand washing station with three taps, conventional hose threads on each one. Non potable, but clean with good pressure. We used it to fill our shower tank and no one bothered us, the nearby guard approached but was curious and friendly.

name: La Guitarra
description:
Small private cabins feet from the beach. Shaded by a beautiful tree canopy.
$35/night 
Decent WiFi 
Secure parking

name: AST Surf Hotel
description: Ocean front room, including breakfast for $95. Gorgeous views from my room and the restaurant/bar at the top. Very friendly staff. They don't have a dedicated motorcycle parking but they let me park inside of a restaurant next door after it closed down at 9pm. A big curb to get in but nothing an adventure bike can handle. They have laundry service if you ask. Nice neighborhood around. Out and about drinking beers.

name: Parque
description: It is super nice place. Parking lot big enough for 3 big caravan . We paid 10 dollar for night. They have toilette . Fresh water . We didint use so I am not sure it is included. You need to ask . Safe place . Owners are so friendly . They have dog but dog is so friendly to . I am surprise no one was here before  . This place is amazing . You can see Volcano and sea  . If you want visit stuff 8 km has nice place for visit and eat . Volcano , river , chruch on the beach and sea you can see .

name: Restaurantes
description: Has many restaurants around . And parking lot for many cars . You can consuma some ( food , drink ) and you can stay here during to night . Nice place e . Google don’t have road . So you need turn after bridge if you are coming from el zonte

name: Playa punts chiquirin
description:
After to visit amazing Espíritu de la Montaña , We come to this beach for past the night . Nice calm beach . You can drive till to beach . Try to stop before the sinked in  . Village is calm . Mostly fishermen. We pass the night without problem before the border . They have nice view . Green building is restaurant. They have nice shrimps and fish . They said „ be carefull don’t go far at the sea , it has some current“. 
We spended night almost everythings open at the car  . In the Morning 4 o’clock they started to do kraket. Other than this is was super calm 
( please consider that I have two dogs and my house is big artego . We looks intimidating )

name: Dentist - Clidente
description: if you ask for Doctor Olga - she is a very good dentist and reasonably priced. You will need to know some basic spanish. I tried other dentists here and they aren't as good. there is parking in the complex but I didn't see a guard there. it's easy to get here with uber just search for clidente. The clinic is in the upstairs part of the complex, on the main road side. They practice good hygiene.

name: Cuscatlan ATM 24/7
description: ATM 24/7 built into the side of the building. Street parking for easy access

name: El Pelicanos
description: La Tortugas Verde no longer received R.V. but their partner El Pélican ok for $5 per night electricity included.  But no WiFi.

name: Sea Garden Mizata
description:
Beautiful place by the sea, nice views, super friendly people, free camping with food or beverage purchase

Big menu, local food and amazing jalapeño pizza, fair prices

Totally recommend
Enjoy the place

name: Start of the walk to the antennas.
description: Take path on the right between two trees. No sign posted, walk on tight dirt track up.

name: Analiza Laboratorio (covid test)
description: You can get covid test for borders here, Analiza have many other locations. Bring your passport. US$25 each. They email results afterwards.

name: Nahui Hostel
description: Nice little cinder block hotel/hostel.  Rooms are simple cubes but have a bed and a fan.  Secure parking right outside our room.  Easy for bikes or a small car, not big enough for most vans.  15$/ night gets you a mattress, cold shower and decent wifi.

name: Coconuts field between sea and river
description:
At the end of an easy sand path, we found this nice coconut field. We asked the first shop they were so nice and told us it’s safe, and they stay here for the night too.
100m after there is à local chill restaurant, food is good and they told us we can Park just neer the restaurant… (we stayed at the first place)
Here you can chose to swim in the sea or in a river just near (no so clear but ok)
They may have lot of people here during week end and holidays.

name: hospital comsalud
description:
24-hour Clinical Laboratory to carry out a PCR test for travel to Guatemala, the result is in 20 minutes, price $40 USD

Laboratorio Clínico 24 horas para realizar prueba PCR para poder viajar a Guatemala el resultado está en 20 minutos valor $40 USD

name: Restaurante y Cocteleria “Julita”
description: Nice and friendly restaurant. We were allowed to camp with our tents for free, if we buy something from restaurant. Prices are like on mainland. Driving here requires 4x4 and some skills as approx 1km is pure sand. So not for big rigs. One can also come with local banana boat from mainland.

name: Finca Macedonia
description: Found this restaurant with a camping area on the Ruta de panoramica. It was probably some of the best hospitality I have had in a while. The owner Brenda speaks very little English but loves practicing with you. There are clean toilets plus she let us use the hot shower in the cabaña that is currently being built. The bathroom in the cabaña is probably the nicest bathroom I've used in all of Central America.  Brenda also gave us 2 big bags of her coffee that she grows and roasts herself as well as offered to take us to the beach at the lake if the road was in good condition. It sadly was not that day so we didn't go. There is a large grassy area where you can pitch a tent with swings. The pupusas and yuca Frita at the restaurant are delicious. I didn't look at the price break down of my bill but for the food, two drinks and the camping for two people it was $24. She also said that there usually is wifi but the router wasn't working that day.

name: Laboratorio Lopez - COVID Test
description:
$25 antigen test on the way to the border, results in 10 minutes.

Avenida central local #22 frente a comer el Cristal, Cara Sucia, El Salvador.

+50376374376, lopezlaboratorio75@gmail.com

name: Cadejo Brewing Company
description: One of the 3 cedejo breweries in this town, located in a paid parking lot with guards. I attached a picture of the beer list with prices but in case you don't have internet it's 4.35 for an actual 16 ounce pour in a proper pint glass. and they have a 23 oz pour for 5.50. food was fairly priced and quite good. they validate your ticket for the first hour. otherwise it was a dollar per hour to park. this shopping area also has the nicest grocery store we have been in since the USA. definitely worth a stop for both!

name: muffler internationales
description: after 20k km's our exhaust on our van had really taken a beating and was literally hanging on with tape and bailing wire. we ended up at this shop that was tall enough to accommodate our 2.8m tall van. the height limit here might be 4m. I showed up without calling, expecting to order parts for a later install, and thanks to a guy that spoke enough English to help me describe what we needed we came up with a game plan and they actually had everything I needed in stock and started on it right away. they cut out several feet of my damaged DIY exhaust on both sides and installed new pipes with new mufflers and hangers. took a couple of hours, naturally, and only cost 320 dollars, for both sides (true dual exhaust)! really quality work with mandrel bends and actual MIG welders, not some hoopty booger welds from a stick welder.  this place also specializes in radiator repair and maintenance if you need that too.

name: Playa Mueludas, next to fishermen boats
description:
Beautiful quiet and good spot to spend the day and night, you can easily swim here, just watch out for jellyfish if you go far away!

After a night at the Rancho Clemente next door, we spent the day here and met some really friendly locals (all the family is living around here)
They told us it's very safe to spend the night here, just watch for the tide if fullmoon. 
They will probably come to you and speak with you, a lot of childrens and the granfather is a fishermen.

name: VEGA’S GRANDPA HOTEL
description:
Amazing Hotel (hostel style with big common kitchen and dining space).  Tall vaulted ceiling in the rooms with private bathroom and shower.  Beds are only ok kind of old. Nice and clean facility. Super chill central courtyard with room access around the yard.  Lots of birds. Lots of lounge chairs and a hammock. 
25$ pp/ per night for a private room with A/C.
My room had two queen beds.
Good take. I enjoyed it.

name: Coyote Restaurante
description: good pizza

name: Albani@
description: Can't believe this place is not marked here yet... Zip lines, labyrinth made out of pine trees, good food and drinks. Nice place to stop when driving ruta de las flores...

name: Clínica Veterinaria Asís
description: We were looking for a vet for health certificates for crossing into Honduras and Nicaragua. There weren't any iOverlander pins for vets in the city so I googled and found this one near by. +503 7751 5315 for the WhatsApp to schedule an appointment, but they were able to get us in the same day and we only waited for a few hours. they gave us color originals for each country and a black and white copy each. 15 dollars for each dog for a health checkup. the vets in San Salvador wanted 78 each! the main vet there was able to speak English with us to explain everything.

name: Max Bloch
description: The only clinic in San Miguel doing covid PCR tests. requires making an appointment online beforehand. $100 bucks. Very small outfit but not busy at all. In and out in less than 10 minutes.

name: Cadejo Brewing Company
description: A popular brewery in central America that offers good beer and better food. a bit on the pricey side at $4.50 for a pint and entrees around $9-14 but it's all delicious. this place is up a flight of stairs on the second floor. A large outside area available on the patio, but also a large indoor area in the AC.

name: Great view point of the Laguna
description:
You can reach this view point by a small trail which is marked on ioverlander. I uploaded a picture from the beginning of the trail.
You don't need to hike up all the way to the antennas to see the whole Laguna:) To get to this point it's 15 minutes uphill.

name: Only ATM in El Cuco area
description: As of when I posted this, this is the only ATM in the area different from what Gmaps may say. Right in the front of a small tienda. Plenty street parking right in front.

name: conchalio playa
description:
Beautiful place in front of the beach. You can park on flat land 2m from the beach. It’s an abandoned house managed by José who lives next door where he has showers toilet and tables under shade on the beach. 
You can surf here too. 
We paid 10$ for a night after negotiations.
Our rig is 25 feet and Struggled into the gate so bigger rigs would not fit. 
José is really nice and helpful and has 3 beautiful daughters. He will do anything to make you feel at home.
Best place so far in Salvador (according to us).

name: Puma Oriental
description: Ultra low sulphur diesel (Ion Diesel) available

name: MAR-AJAI
description: Enrique’s place it’s a local bohemian house where you can stay for a few day just with a small contribution for the mantainance of the place. It has everything you need for a rest next to the beach ( just a few steps )

name: Parking
description: We arrived at 3pm and paid $5 for the afternoon and night.  The car park is closed and access to enter and exit on foot is through the hotel, which is on the corner of the street.  Everyone was very nice.  The night was very quiet.  You are right in downtown Santa Ana.

name: Valvoline
description: We drained our Ford F250.  Very professional, quick and kind.  Change oil filter, oil and air filter.

name: Texaco gas station
description:
Esta es una gasolinera amplia con parqueo en la parte de atrás, es gratis, tiene agua y servicios sanitarios. Al principio dijeron que no era permitido quedarse, pero como nosotros pedimos permiso entonces que sí podíamos. Hoy nos contaron que otros viajeros se han quedado aquí. 

This is a big gas station with parking in the back. It has restrooms, water and it’s free. At the beginning they said it wasn’t allowed to stay for the night, but as we asked for permission the would allow it. Today morning another safety guard told us that more travelers have stayed in the past.

name: lavanderia lava Rapido
description: lavanderia, wash and dry for 6$ per laundry.

name: Taller Emmanuel Mecanica General
description: Big shop with full lifts. We only had our oil changed here ($45 including oil and filter), but we had some questions about our squeaky belt and they were helpful and not pushy at all. They have good reviews on Google. Spanish only. At the end of the side street there.

name: Columpio Buena Vista
description: Amazing swing out over the valley. $3 per person. Worth the trip out just for the photo, but there are basic facilities including washrooms and camping.

name: Mirador Rio Chicito
description:
Super friendly hosts. The owner Jose is almost finished building a cafe (should be done August 2022) that reaches out over the hillside. INCREDIBLE view. Flat parking for a few vehicles. Jose speaks English. 

New basic washrooms. No showers. Power available (basic 110v). No WiFi (yet) but solid Tigo signal. Probably pet friendly but I didn't ask.

Probably not big rig friendly - narrow entrance, low cables over entrance (2.6m maybe?), and the road up to the village is stupid steep.

Not a long term spot but great for a night or two. He originally asked $4 for two people for the night, but that may increase. We were his first guests and we just showed up randomly. Once he gets things organised properly, it may be a bit different. 

Call in advance to check availability +503 7557 1459.

name: El Chele
description:
Super friendly and welcoming family which owns a restaurant directly on the river. They saw us on the road under a palm tree and invited us to camp on their property for the night. They put us in front of the swimming pool and filled it for us! They offered us food every day (amazing fried fish)!
All free just in exchange of some help with little things (clean the dishes, the fish, the floor). They like to welcome travelers and spend time together.
It's a paradise, please respect it and be kind!

name: Comedor Joanna
description:
we stay here for the night very nice quiet and safe place 2 min walk from the beach we park with ford e350 they have enough place and they have a restaurant also the owner tell us that she can connect us with surfboard rent and lessons
the owners name is Idalia 
+503 70627568

name: comedor
description: Right next to the fresh juice place, right in the center

name: Beach front
description: At the end of the road you can access the beach directly with the car. The sand was hard today, but be careful if only on 2wd. Local fishermen are friendly and said no problems to stay. Safe and free.

name: Lake front
description: Beautiful spot right on the lake. Free. There is plenty of palapas around you can use for free as well. Local fishermen sell talapia at the end of the road. The road to get here is unpaved, a bit bumpy and a bit narrow in some spots, no 4wd needed. Big rigs might find it a bit hard.

name: Just a street
description: Literally just a road that ends on the beach, nothing more. Nice houses for rent around, we spent a quite night here. Good if you don't find anything else. There is another more grassy road like this one a bit further down the street, with also a bit more shade.

name: Hotel Pacifico Dorado
description: This place is amazing. It has 17 rooms for rent, 3 swimming pools, a restaurant and a bar. Family oriented with wifi available. Very private and safe with locked gates at night. There is also an area to park an RV. I have a truck and trailer which is 40 feet in length and the spot was long enough for both. Owners Claudia and Carlos are welcoming hosts and Claudia speaks perfect English.

name: Auto Quick Repuestos
description: Auto Quick it’s a part store where you can ask for a part of your vehicle or hydraulic hose and also cable auto parts. You can also have advice of a vehicle failure by phone. They speak English and Spanish. Have free water and all type of lubricants for vehicle.

name: Laguna de Apastepeque
description:
Parking at the restaurant El Acapulco overnight free and quiet. 
The people are friendly and the kids too.
We bought fresh fish $2.50 dollar (pound) 
Coca cola $1 dollar 

There is access the lagoon from the restaurant. 

En el estacionamiento del Restaurante el Acapulco pasamos 1 noche  tranquila. 
La gente del restaurante son muy amables, los niños son simpáticos y curiosos. 
En el restaurante compramos pescado fresco a $2,50 dlls la libra. 
Cocas de 350ml $1 dólar 

En el restaurante hay bajada para bañarse en la laguna.

name: Jaguar Inn
description: The best place to stay if you want to see the ruins with few other tourists in it. You can get up early in the morning before the busloads of tourists get there and then go back late in the afternoon when they have all left again. There is a small grassy area for pitching tents/parking a campervan that can get crowded at night. 50Q/pp

name: Hotel Cancuen
description: There is secure parking in the hotel grounds, but they don’t allow camping. This is a good place to stay if you have a vehicle and want to go to the Candelaria caves.  They have terminals for internet but no wifi.

name: Parque Nacional Victoria
description: Hard to believe this campground is in a city, it's very quiet at night. Good place to overnight between Tikal and Antigua, or if you're heading to Lanquin/Semuc Champey and get delayed.

name: Zephyr Lodge
description: The view is insane, but tent camping is on uneven ground between the cabins. Ok for small tents, but difficult for larger tents, and there is nowhere to setup a cooking area. Outside food and drinks are not allowed in the common area. It's cheapest to stay in a cabin and cook on the patio, however the food at the restaurant is quite good and not too spendy. Reportedly they are building more accommodation.

name: Biotopo del Quetzal
description: Excellent park, but the camping area is a bit of a walk from the parking lot. Rangers are really friendly and there is great hiking. Chances of seeing a quetzal are slim, but the cloud forest is amazing.  Electricity available in the office. No showers, but you can go for a swim if you like.

name: Ranchito del Quetzal
description: Best place to go if you want to see a Quetzal! Owners are very nice and the comedor onsite serves good cheap meals.  Showers were sometimes hot

name: Hotel Larry’s Place
description: A nice place to crash for a night on Lake Atitlan. We were limited to finding a place with parking which was a big reason we chose this hotel for the night.

name: Gran Sueno
description: A short walk up from the Panajachel ferry dock in the middle of town.  Parking lots nearby.

name: Cafe Chuasinayi
description: This is a nice little coffee shop with a decent sized parking lot right near the center of town. Fairly private given the central location. Paying 40Q. Can pay an additional 10Q for power and 5Q for wifi... Or get a cup of coffee and get the wifi free. Cheaper weekly rates available for 30Q a night. Nice friendly owner. They also own the lot across the street that can accomodate larger rigs. Food and drink not half bad either...

name: Tikal Campground
description:
Campground right at the entrance to Tikal. 50 Q per person. Camping area with Palapa on every pitch. Shower and toilet, but had little water (cold) and light did not work. Common area with sink for dishes and washing near the bathrooms. Restaurants near by. 

BE CAREFULL with the powerplant in the left corner, close to the palapas. It operated from 5.30 to 9pm, and in the morning started at 6.30am... not very authentic for a National Park and UNESCO site

name: El Muelle
description: Combo hotel/restaurant/trailer park. Came here after visiting Tikal in the morning. Nice pool and great views of the lake. $75 Q per person.  Reasonable WiFi even down at the lakeside. Restaurant food is ok, nothing special.

name: Ecocentro Holanda
description: An eco resort on a beautiful lake just outside Coban. Swimming pool, warm showers, quiet forest lake.

name: Turista Police Car Park
description: Great spot for a camp in Antigua Guatemala. Check in at the guarded gate, and they should let you stay for at least two weeks for free. If you ask you will probably get access to their WiFi as well. We were told that they close the gates at 10 PM, but we never had problems getting back in even a little bit later. It is in the city center just next to the market, and it takes a couple of minutes to the main square.

name: Bruno's Hotel (Marina)
description:
Parked in the car park and had use of showers & toilets. Restaurant and wifi.
Electricity available with minimum 25' cord. Restaurant/bar closes at 10, so quiet after that.

name: Camping at Tikal
description:
Campground facility outside the entrance. Price: Q50 for hammock and Q50 for camping permit ticket (from Banrural or entrance). 
Same campground as Tikal Campground. Not Jaguar Inn camping.

name: Ixpanpajul Nature Park
description:
Charming tourist area with many hiking trails and suspension bridges. 
This is an excellent, very clean, and spacious campground that appears to be underutilized but well maintained. There are large bathrooms that are cleaned twice-daily and two covered common areas. Both common areas have picnic tables and power outlets. One common area has sinks that are perfect for doing dishes, etc. It was raining during our stay and it was approved to put up our tent under the roof of the large common area.
Camping: 40 Queztal pppn.
Trails: 100 Queztal pp.

name: Finca Ixobel
description: Very nice camping in the countryside on big, beautiful property. Clean showers (lukewarm) & WC. Wifi. Good restaurant and nice natural pool. 50q pp.

name: Finca El Paraiso
description:
Beautiful place at the lake in front of the houses of the Finca, clean toilets, cold shower, restaurant. Probably crowded at the weekend. Quiet in the night. Quetzales 60,00 per night.
Update 05-2021: 80Q per night for camping with 2p (+2 kids, but they were free)

name: Bahia Atitlan Inn
description:
Comment: Not closed. See the neighbour, they have the keys. 80 gtq {G150 @June 2018) per day for 2 people with camper van. 

Nice resort with great grassy camping area. Gorgeous view of Lake Atitlan and the volcanoes San Pedro, Toliman and Atitlan. There's a pool (can be empty) and restrooms near the camping area. Price 60 Quetzales for two persons and a smal motorhome.
Turns to swamp in rainy conditions.

name: Turicentro Auto Mariscos Balenario
description: Full Hookups and small palapas with grills. Pools and Waterslides. Flush toilets, outdoor showers for men, private showers in the ladies bathroom. Closed on Mondays but someone should still be there to let you in.

name: Car Eros Hotel
description: lawn in the courtyard of an hour Reception, quiet at night.  Price: $ 16.25

name: Balneario Las Conchas
description: Semuc Champey a second! Similar to the Rio On Pools in Belize it has here natural pools in the river levels. Perfect January-March and June-July. In April and in the rainy season the river swells and becomes too strong. We stayed here in September, the waterfall was like the Rhine Falls in Switzerland, absolutely monstrous! Admission is 50QZ/Person for foreigners. You can sleep in front of goal in several parking areas. Update: 10 QZ additional for one vehicle. The area should be quiet. But we are on, because we could not swim. Dogs were also allowed! Access is via a gravel road in very good condition. On the paved road you have to point at N 15.82680 ° W 89.45043 ° north direction, turn to the point here.

name: Pasaj cap - Lago Atitlan
description:
One of the nicest spots on lake Atitlan. Pierre offers RV and tent camping and has several appartments to rent. Furthermore, he sells fresh tenderloin meat, seafood and wine. There are 3 lounge areas with hammocks, lounge chairs, BBQ and amazing views. Camping is 75Q per night (per v Aehicle). Call or email ahead as there are only 8 spaces for RV's.

Pierres phone number is: (+502) 7723 4055

BEWARE: The road on the last 8 km has recently been paved with excellent asphalt and is no longer a trail. But it is steep and has several fairly tight switchbacks. Caution with camper more than 6 meters. Otherwise the campsite is beautifully located facing the lake and volcanoes. Travel time to this campground from Pan Am can now be done in an hour with new road surface.

NOTE:
Owner wishes to declare the place pet friendly BUT then wants to give permission on a case by case basis. This obviously means that the campsite is NOT unconditionally pet friendly. But then aren’t all campsites allowed to decide whether they accept a pet or guest. Tthe public boats between Panajachel and San Marcos and vice versa stop at Pasaj Cap when asked. Very convenient when arriving on foot.

name: Grutas Candelarias Camping & Tours
description:
From the main road it's 1.6km gravel road to reach this place. It's the entrance/parking area to the Grutas and Tubing Tours. The road gets very steep,  smooth-graded gravel. 4x4 shouldn't be necessary now that they have graded the road, but maybe anyone with a trailer might struggle with the gradient. There are clean toilets and cold showers. Camping/park-up is in lovely gardens.
"Official price" is 50Q pppn, but it's negotiable, esp if you stay more than one night. 
 Flashlight/torch is provided by them for the cave tours. They also offer an abseiling tour and a Mayan Cultural tour, but we only did the cave tours. 
No restaurant as such, but they will cook food for you if you want it.
Note: Driving distance from Santa Elena is about 4h (including a stop at ferry) roads where in really good shape, no potholes, some Tumulos (bumps)

name: Candelaria Camposanto
description: Two dry caves and one for the tubing. You can sleep for PRO Auto 25QZ here. It has toilet and cold shower. Was a right on the street, but it looked clean and the people were very friendly. The cave tour is 50QZ for each dry cave, 60QZ for the wet cave. If you are visited every 3 160QZ/Person.

name: El Baul Feld
description: We slept here in the middle of sugar cane fields. A little weird, but you can look for other ways, it's all very twisted. It is also below rauffahren of the minds here. It has 100 evil ways. Was a bit noisy in the evening from the village, but later absolutely quiet. Path can be muddy when it rains, but it is very hard and grippy.  Price: Free

name: Turistico Paraíso
description:
Although somewhat close to the street, it was quiet at night. Small meadow for camping.  Bathroom clean and even gad soap.  Shower very rustic, but good (cold) water jet. 

From here it is 5 minutes walk to the amazing hot waterfalls.  Approximately 100m BEFORE the waterfall you can walk across the river, and walk along the path on the waterfalls. There you can lie in the much warmer water. Under the waterfall, you can also climb inside and spend hours let the warm water raining down on yourself. At the weekend as always crowded, so you should be on weekdays only here! 25QZ/Person for Accommodation and entrance to the waterfall.

name: Fuentes Georginas
description: Hot springs that allow you to camp in the parking lot. Price is 60Q per person per day plus 25Q to park. Area is nice and has little areas to grill and eat food. Hot springs are amazing and super hot!

name: Lanquin - Grutas
description: You can sleep in the parking lot to the caves here. The entrance to the caves costs 30QZ/Person. Furthermore 10QZ, for coming to park to park to where you can even out if you will only look at the caves. And sleep is then 35QZ/Auto. Long drop toilets.

name: La Caballeriza Hotel
description:
This is probably the nicest place we've stayed at in a while. It's a big property so you first need to ask at the restaurant about camping. You'll be directed to the area near the pool and hotel rooms where you can camp. Access to the pool is 25 Quetzales per person per day. It gets hot in Chiquimula so the pool is awesome! Clean restrooms, changing rooms and showers. The place is very well kept and has a very nice relaxing vibe. We used an extension cord to access the electric outlets in the restrooms. Camping was free. 
Oct 2017: Entrance fee also on 10Q p.p.

name: Mirador San Lucas Toliman - ?
description: Here would be a big car park a mirador. Next direction Panajachel it has 2 more Miradors. Would be possible to stay. Other travelers have slept here. We are just drove through.

name: Momostenango Los Riscos - ?
description: We ate here only noon, but had slept here without problems. Was the place very quiet and cozy. Next to it are the Los Riscos stone formations.

name: Nakum
description: Here we are indeed still only noon, but one might as well Yaxha camp with the ticket from Yaxha Park. For details see Yaxha. Super clean toilets, showers also available. Ruin was great! Eini tailed downside was the very bad road. In July, it was very muddy and needed Diffsperren and good M / T tires. From about September no longer passable! Best time is then April, when it should be totally dry. From here the road goes even further to Tikal!

name: Nebaj - Hotel Ilebal Tenam
description: Basic hotel no WiFi, hot showers, reasonably comfortable beds, gated parking behind hotel with no height restrictions. We found the staff to be friendly. Pretty nice courtyard to work or eat at.

name: Quirigua - Ruins (UNESCO)
description: Entry is 80 Q per person, parking is free. Archeological site with UNESCO status close to village of Quiringua - you reach it on a well paved road. It is possible to stay here for the night as well - friendly staff.

name: Semuc Champey - Hostal El Portal - NO CAMPING!
description:
ADMIN NOTE: WARNING!!! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution.
We stayed here for 150Q for two people in a private room with shared bathroom. Someone stole a piece off our motorcycle from the parking lot, which was unfortunate. We also did see people camping in tents on the property..

name: Semuc Champey
description:
We have stayed here in the parking lot to the park. It took for sleep 20QZ/vehicle. Admission to the absolutely beautiful river is 50QZ/Person. It has several cool caves in the lower part, which you can discover at the Pozas. The place was very simple, since it rained at night even muddy. 

UPDATE 07/2017
There are toilets with running water and cold showers now. Also big shelter with tables and benches. A bit challenging to find level spot, we slept well close by the bins.

They put on the generator and have a couple of sockets but that's so the guys that spend the night here can charge their phones. So no electricity for you :)

You're sleeping in a parking lot so don't expect anything fancy, but perfect to sleep one night.

By 5.30 - 6pm all tourists are gone and you're left with just the couple of guys who sleep here. Super chill.

Price is still 50Q for park entrance + 10Q for the parquadero. They should have charged us 10Q pp extra for the camping, but didn't.

The park is really beautiful btw. Start with the climb to the mirador, pretty steep but the fresh dive afterwards is very rewarding :)

name: Tajumulco Vulcan
description: Very easy parking on the way up to Tajumulco Vulcan. Ill 4x4 route in the rainy season coming up around here! Path is actually some 100m further, but wiir have chosen here, for fear of further rains in the night. Very quiet, great view. FREE!  Price: Free

name: Volcan Ipala
description: Yes, you can drive up to the crater and camp either in your car about 100m from the top or in a tent at the top. To get to the road, drive PAST the main entrance to the park (about 10-15 minutes) and you'll see a sign that says "Laguna Ipala" on your left. Take that turn and follow the road all the way up. It's about an hour drive. You *do* have to pay 10q per car to park and 10q per person for admission. So worth it! It was beautiful. No wifi, showers, or electricity but there are bathrooms.

name: Yaxha
description: Toilets, outdoor showers, by lake. Free with entry to ruins. Camping area is just down the road from the day parking – next to the museum. There is also a nice spot right by the lake down a small track – better for smaller vehicles.

name: Laguna Lachua
description: Camped in the parking lot of a restaurant.  Grassy, clean bathrooms, showers, no wifi, no eletricity.    Price: 25Q/night ($Very friendly Staff.They have a grassy field where you can camp also used as parkinglot.It lies behind the restaurant with a playground for the kids,trampoline,swing,...Also lot of animals,ducks,chikens,cows and 2 friendly german shepperds. Basic toilets and cold shower. We loved this place, ideal for kids. The laguna is in walking distance of 4km. 90Qtz for 2 nights with 2 rooftoptents and the whole family.

name: Pirate Camp
description: Pirate camping in a gravel quarry outside of Barillas.  Price: Free

name: Hotel Villa Sol
description: Nice hotel by the Santiago dock. We paid 120Q for a double room for two people. They have large gated parking area and they even let us leave the car while we stayed with a local family while doing a Spanish course. No height limit for vehicles. Decent Wi-Fi, hot shower, good location (5 minute walk from the restaurants and the centre of town).

name: Parqueo Don Alberto
description: A parking lot at the trail head of volcan santa maria. They allowed us to spend the night. 50Q total. You might be able to arrange bathrooms and showers here, we jut didn't try.

name: Utopia Eco Hotel
description: Parking lot of the hotel. Tenting in the huge garden. Beautiful scenery. Close to the caves and pozzas of Semuc Champey. Very rough road to get there (4x4). Flush toilets and cold showers. 25Q p.P. per night. Very weak wifi.

name: Carisa Gasolinas, Tactic
description: Gas station. No Charge. Toilet available. Large level area away from pumps for parking.

name: Hotel Tzanjuju, Lake Atitlan
description: Hotel by the lake shore Hot showers and flush toilets available at hotel. Swimming pool in good condition. Beautiful gardens and only 5 minutes walk to centre of town. Adding current rates. 100 Q for tent camping, 125 Q for small size camper, 150 Q for medium size camper, 175 Q for large size camper, 200 Q for extra large camper. This prices are for two people, you havd to pay for kids as well, and pool is not included in this price (that is 50/p/d and 40/kids). Although there are no measurements that help define what size your camper/vehicle is. It is up to their discretion to charge you based on their vehicle size assessment.

name: Gasolinera, San Bartolome Milpas Atlas
description: Paid Q37 to nightwatchman to stay. No facilities.

name: Parqueo, Antigua
description:
Secure Parking Lot (more like a park with paved alleys) in town opposite bus station and Mercado. 
Update 2017-08:
Parqueo is Q100 per day BUT tell at the entrance that you gonna visit Salomon who own the red house, drive inside (without paying) turn left to the end and you will encounter Salomon house (WhatsApp +502 4859 4953) there  he will organize to let you a big place in front his door for 50 Qtz per night. 
Main gate opened at 6am and Locked at 8pm.

name: Agua Caliente
description: Parking lot of hot springs on the banks of a river. Paid 70Q though previous overlanders had paid 40Q, still not exactly clear why. 10Q to park, 15Q pp for the hot springs.... And i guess another 20Qpp to camp??... Springs are alright, not a go out of your way for destination, but if you need safe parking and a toilet this will do.

name: Hotel Sarita Escuintla
description: Hotel with secure parking. 50 USD for double room. Clean and safe. Pool.

name: Hotel Fuente Real
description: Hotel right on the Panamerican in Huehuetenango.  Water, electric, wifi.  Good stop to cross border between Mexico and Guatemala.

name: El Recreo
description:
A quiet hotel just outside the town center (10 minutes walk) that will let you camp on their parking area. Okay place, but almost a little too quiet when we were there. The place felt kind of too big for only the two of us and two other guests..                                              Price: 100 quetzales
30q pp per night for camping

name: El Zots Park Administration
description: The road in was a lot rougher than we thought. 4WD is an absolute must, and there can be low hanging branches. Bring a saw! You can camp in a big area behind the admin buildings, and there are some facilities available. Nice and quiet spot in the jungle, and the only place to camp close to the El Zotz ruins. From here we started our trip through the jungle to Uaxactun (4WD+winch+saw&axe!).   Price: free (park entrance was 80 quetzales)

name: Airstrip
description: A quiet little village as close to the El Mirador ruins as you can drive. From here they have five day treks into the site. We asked around and locals told us we could camp anywhere, and that it was a friendly neighbourhood. We popped our roof top tent just next to the airstrip that went straight through the village. We ate at a small restaurant nearby.   Price: free

name: Playa Escondido
description: Wohlfühlplatz right on the lake, very good for bathing. No infrastructure, restroom, quiet.     Quetales 60 / night.  9 Turn side street from CA to Mariscos, before the village turn right into gravel road, well signposted

name: Parking Volcan Ipala
description: Stopped to check out the place but didn't end up staying the night here. Parking lot with pit toilets. The road is steep and paved. 10 Quetzales per car to park/camp. This is also the trailhead to the summit of the volcano / crater lake which is about an hour hike. If you hike up you need to pay 10 Quetzales per person to enter/camp by the lake. There toilets you can flush with a 'bucket' and a shower stall. There are palapas with tables, benches and BBQ pits.

name: Parking Panajachel
description:
Public parking: Good place to stay overnight and visit the town and lakeshore , and close to the boat harbor. No infrastructure. On the night quiet and safe. Tourist police drive their rounds. Free.  Directly at the Rio, or at the lake.
Had a few things stolen after mistakenly leaving them out (under our van) overnight. 
Lots of paid toilets and showers around

name: Balneario Arroyo Verde
description: Good place to stay overnight. For Camper on the Parking lot, No infrastructure, but swimming. Quiet and safe.     Quetzales 75 / night.  CA 14, Village Purulhá

name: Hotel Chi-ya
description: Small bungalow with full kitchen and bathroom (hot water and bath tub!!) for 350usd/month. Parking for free on property.

name: Gringo Perdido
description:
PROS: beautiful spot, right on the eastern edge of Lago de Peten Itza, electric hookup, sink area by showers for washing dishes

Update 04-2021
40 GTQ/person/night with acces to campsite facilities and wifi.
70 GTQ/person/night with acces to hotel facilities, hammocks, kayaks, stand-up paddle and free coffee.

name: El Retiro Lodge
description: They don’t actually have a spot for overlanders to camp, but let us park in their driveway. – PROS: Beautiful campground/hostel right on the river, friendly owners and staff, delicious food and huge portions (55 GTQ for veg dinner, 65 GTQ for meat-eaters), easy access to tours to caves and Semuc Champey, clean bathrooms, warm showers, free wifi in the restaurant, quick walk into town if you need supplies, you can set up a tab at the restaurant and pay for everything at the end on a credit card (10% credit card fee) – CONS: As mentioned before, not a great camping spot with your rig (driveway location means you hear every tour bus and passenger bus that pulls into the driveway starting at around 7 am), no kitchen sink area, no hookups – 30 GTQ/person/night – NOTE: We took Franja Transveral del Norte to Route 5 from Ixobel which is currently being paved but is essentially a gravel/rock path through the mountains. The drive took us about 7 hours. There is a longer (distance) route that is mostly paved for those of you not wanting to off-road for 7 hours.

name: Corazon Maya Spanish School
description:
We stayed at Corazon Maya for two weeks and took Spanish classes
– Affordable yet quality one-on-one spanish classes, quiet part of town but walking distance to ‘Gringolandia,’ free wifi, secured parking
– 75 USD for 4 hours of private classes for 5 days, 60 USD for 3 hours of private classes for 5 days, 30 USD for smallest casita (stove but no fridge, sink, or private bathroom), the more expensive casitas have more amenities and are still dirt cheap
– NOTE: They let us stay an extra night for free in the casita because there was no one moving in.  They were also going to let us camp in the parking spot at apparently no charge, pretty cool.

name: Hostel Del Lago
description: Great spot on the lake in San Marcos. Hot showers, wifi, water. No power hook up and parking for maybe 2 RV's. 40Q / night if you stay for more than 3 nights, inclusive of breakfast. Ultra eclectic group of people here from RV's to overlanders on motorcycles to backpackers. very cool spot to hang out and check the lakes attractions.

name: Hotel La Villa
description: Basic, safe and clean. Restaurant and pool included.

name: Boondocking on Isla Flores
description:
- free, but noisy.
- some open wifi networks (not very reliable)
- restaurants close by
- police and military driving through the streets every now and then, felt safe enough

Parking gratuit a cote de l'hôtel Ramada nous y avons dormi un vendredi soir tres bruyant si non l'endroit est super sympa

name: Boondocking at a mirador
description:
- free
- beautiful view of the city
- after 10 pm only few cars passing on the adjacent road, the traffic started again at around 6 am and vendors came to put up their stands
- according to some locals the area around Chichicastenango is not very safe

name: Finca Chicoj (coffee Tour)
description: Nice coffee tour with zip line. Coffee farm just outside of Coban. We were allowed to camp in grassy parking area at center of complex for 50Q (25pp) per night. Tours are Q75 per person. Our Tour Guide spoke good English, and we really enjoyed the experience. Clean bathrooms with flush toilets. If you love coffee, a must see/do.

name: Lake Chicabal - NO SWIMMING
description:
This is the ticket office and the parking lot for access to Lake Chicabal. From here, you can hike up the crater or use the shuttle (which also services the town below).

Parking/camping  beside bungalows and the football pitch. We arrived after the ranger station closed (3pm), you may be able to request the bathrooms be unlocked overnight if you arrive before it closes.

The road to this parking lot is steep and may not be suitable for non 4x4. The last 1600 meters (1 mile) are cobblestone. There is a tienda on the left just before the cobblestone begins, camping there is possible as well.

Other Overlanders drove up to the Mirador to camp there. That last stretch requires 4x4, high clearance and low gear. 

A lake inside an extinguished crater, accessible by climbing (at least) the rim of the crater. Several Mayan groups celebrating their religion - very authentic. It's like visiting a cathedral but the altar is a lake. From the waypoint, it's about one hour on foot to the Mirador over an uninteresting steep track also used by the shuttle service. From the Mirador there's a staircase down to the lake. They want you to take the 'nuevo sendero' back up (one way traffic because of the pandemic), but signage is unclear. Going back, walk left of the stairs until you find a trail going left (no sign). That is the nuevo sendero. We spent a few hours of mindful 'being there' (and meditating) . Paid GTQ 50 per person and GTQ 15 to park.

name: Talkers Agri Mec At Gas Station
description: Good and fast mechanic. Oil change done for 50Q. Did not have the oil and filter but a shop nearby had it.

name: San Augustín
description: Pulled off Hwy 9 heading to San Augustín and pulled off on the right into what seems to have once been a quarry and now has 4x4 tracks. Quiet with a nice view of the valley below.

name: Los Leones Comedor
description: Nice place to stop for a break if driving from Coban to Guatemala City or Antigua. Open 6am - 6pm. Have restrooms and a large gravel parking lot. You could probably camp here if needed.

name: Policia Substacion
description: The local police substation. You can arrange for a police escort along the south route around the lake. Best to arrange this a day in advance.

name: Todo Riesgo  - agencia de seguros y fianzas
description:
*update (March 2019): only one version and it does NOT cover your vehicle! Same prices as listed below...but this insurance only covers damage or injuries you caused to a third party!*

Version a)  Insurance agency. Can purchase optional auto insurance here. For 15 days coverage cost was 229.32Q, including all taxes and fees. 

Does not include other countries even the insurance guy says so. Not accepted at other borders. Just buy the time for Guatemala

Version b) Liability car insurance can be bought here. We tool one that covers Guatemala, El Salvador, Honduras and Nicaragua. 611 Q for 3 months. Very friendly and efficient.

Take your pick

name: Idea Connection
description:
A great restaurant for fresh bread and cheap delicious sandwiches and salads. Plus they have the fastest wifi, easy to skype or download. Must try the fresh chocolate croissant!
Managed by an Italian man. 
Great food, we tried the sandwiches and pasta. Really yummy. But there is no "two sandwiches for one" deal as stated in another review (never has been, according to the owner). The sandwiches are just cut into two pieces if you choose the bread over the foccacio. Wi-Fi works well.

name: Nazareth Parking
description: Nice parking spot, you could sleep here but the gates are locked at 10pm. Huge gate to fit big rig, $200Q for 7 nights. Sweet couple live on the grounds, they even gave us a complete car wash while we were parked.

name: Restaurant/Cabañas Los Kascadas
description: We had dinner (good food, little bit pricey) and they let us stay for free. They told us we could use the swimmingpools as well. Friendly staff!The entrance gate was closed at night, armed security on place during the night.

name: Tropigas Metro
description: 100Q for 20lbs propane

name: Volcán Pacaya trailhead
description:
Fun hike up active volcano. You get to hike around on the lava flow and can observe molten lava glowing in some spots. Drive all the way to the trail head for free parking (also overnight camping possible). Tickets $50Q(100Q now) (20Q if you're over 60) per person. Guide was $200Q per group right from the ticket booth.
in some cases you might be able to hike by yourselves without guide (see comments for more details).

name: La Recoleccion
description: Good parts shop for cars and motorcycles, also car mechanic. Good selection of tires and oils and oem parts. Great service!

name: Gasolinera Raxruha
description: Big parking lot beside the gasstation, relatively quiet the night.

name: Zaculeu
description: Free parking al the entrance of the archeological zone

name: Hacienda Ecologica Rio Escondido
description:
Lots of bugs but not too bitey. The riverside campsite is tranquil, but don't swim in it, we paddled our kayak down stream a little and the water is super polluted. We were told hot showers, but they didn't work, so shower during the day before it gets too cold.

Price:  GTQ 75

name: Linda Vista
description: Small campground on the shore of Lake Peten Itza in El Remate. 40 Q without and 50 Q with electricity. Adonis will take care of your dog until you visit Tikal. Small camper vans will fit.

name: Hotel D'MENDOZA
description: Nice clean basic room with bathroom, Q130 for 2 people.  We were able to park our landcruiser in front of the Hotel which had locked gates at night, but not big enough for big rigs. Fast internet in evening and apparently hot showers (electric) but power was off in the morning. No restaurants in area, but there was some decent looking street food stalls in the market area by the church (turn left outside Hotel) and we ate in a takeaway pizza place with a few tables around the block to the left from there.

name: Hotel bombil pek
description:
Just before Chisec going from Candelaria's caves, we stayed at this hotel for 50 QZ for the two of us in our vehicle on the parking lot. (at first he asked us for 100) I have no idea of the hotel price or tent camping.
Restrooms were very clean and we get to use a hot shower in one of the hotel's rooms.

name: Maya Jade
description: General a Cabana/Hotel, but quite a big sandy(!) area to park and camp. Nice pools. Salt Water (pool and hook up). During weeks very quite but weekends are supposed to be crowded. Clean toilets and lots of outside showers. Not a fenced area. Electricity available if you ask. Price is VERY negotiable

name: Biker Lodge, Rentals And Tours
description: This motorcycle rental and tour company as well as bar is a great stop for information about routes and road conditions for motorcycling. If you are interested in trading four wheels for two then this is your place. They provide everything including a motorcycle. We found the owners extremely helpful in sourcing tires as well as talking about route options.

name: Alice Guesthouse
description:
ALICE GUESTHOUSE
Your home away from home in El Remate, Peten, Guatemala 
- only 35km from Tikal
- a 5 min walk from lake Peten
- right at the border of the national park
- right next to ancient mayan graves
- shops in 1km distance

Alice Guesthouse offers travellers and backpackers from all over the world the possibility to spend the night with a beautiful view on the Guatemalan rainforest.

ACCOMMODATION: 
We offer a number of bungalows, dormitories, camp grounds and there are lots of options to hang up your hammock if you like, depending on your preferences and budget.

FACILITIES: 
- Kitchen - with gas stove, fridge, smoothie maker, water cooker, coffee machine etc. 
- Water filters - provide you with fresh water every day
- Open fire place - for long nights under the stars
- Warm water showers - comfortable if temperatures get a bit lower at night
- Living room - we have lots of games for you to play as well
- Wifi Internet (on request, just to check email off Dimitri's cell phone data plan)
- Infinite outdoor possibilities (hiking, fishing, etc.)

THE AREA
- the guest house is surrounded by nature. If you are looking for a quiet place to relax with like-minded travellers and enjoy a beautiful view on the rain forest, this is the place for you. 
- only 35km from Tikal, you can visit Tikal on a day trip from here
- a 5 min walk from lake Peten (the lake is 500m downhill, where you can enjoy stunning sunsets and go fishing if you like)
- right at the border of the national park (beautiful views, infinite hiking options)
- right next to ancient mayan graves 

HOW TO FIND US
- From the village crossing, take the side road around the lake and walk 1km to the hostel MonAmi.
- Take the little side street on the left side of Hostel MonAmi
- At the little intersection, keep going straight (the street continues along a stone wall slightly to the right further  up the hill). 
- pass the first house you see at the left side
- our place is 50m later at the end of the street
- if you cannot find us, ask villagers for the two French people, Dimitri and Nathalie

name: Hotel Penelue
description: 50Q - 70Q for a room, depending on what kind of view you want to have. Secure motorcycle parking. Communal kitchen. Hot showers are possible, but perhaps not in every room. (We had a good hot shower.) Wifi worked well for us but others seemed to be having problems.

name: Hostel Villa Esthela
description: Clean hostel with motorbike parking in alley-like-entry. The gates are usually closed overnight, but neighbors with cars may enter and leave the gate open?? Private rooms range from 75Q for a single to 150Q for a double double (2 queens). Dorm beds are 45Q per night. Clean. Roof with a nice view of the city and volcanoes. Warm - hot showers and decent internet if you don't use it while everyone else is.

name: Diego Canil's house/parqueo
description: Nice family; one of the sons speak english; closed and leveled parking (family's house backyard); 2 minutes from mercado. We paid 200 quetzales for 2 night.

name: Hotel Posada Antigua
description:
One of very few secure parking possibilities in Xela. We stayed in their rooms for one night (paid 250 QTZ) and slept in our bus for one night for free. Fast wifi and very friendly family managing the place. Would go out for breakfast;) 

Update sept 2019- 150q pp for a room, 50q pp to camp.

name: Metroplaza Mundo Maya Mall - parking lot
description: Free Wi-Fi (and quite fast) in the children playground area and the adjacent small food court area in the Mall. We are unclear what is the name of the mall, but next to the playground there is Megapaca shopping area. There are electric plugs available in the 'food court' area, and it seems that you don't really need to buy anything.

name: Thor Marine
description: Boat repair place two doors toward bridge from Bruno's. Wifi, shower, bano, covered parking and secure gate. $75-100Q (during Semana Santa).

name: Hotel La Paz
description: Paid 73Q for a double and 44Q for a single - with that there is free secure parking. No wifi

name: El Paredon Surf House
description: Nice hostel with pool. We were charged the day use rate 25Q and free camping in the HOT parking lot. Great surf break.

name: Church in the village
description: Whe asked the mayor of the city where we could stay for the night and he told us to park on the parking lot of the curch. Meeting with the inhabitants was an absolute highlight for us. The night was very quiet.

name: Parking at Volcan Chicabal
description: On the way to the vulcano you have to drive on a gravel road with more than 20 grade. You could go further up to the volcano which we avoided due to the muddy road and therefore spent the night on the first gravel parking lot. The night was very quiet.

name: Turicentro Nelly
description: Parking lot of a small swimming pool next to the house of the owner, about 20 meters away from the road. When cars drive over the bridge of steel Sacapulas at night, it can be a bit noisy. Next to the pool there are toilets and cold showers (unfortunately without water when we were there).  (Price is made up of 10 Quetzal / person entrance fee for the swimming pool)

name: Parqueo Los Tres / Hotel El Portal
description: Q50/ night Parking lot across from hotel. Large fairly flat area with 24 hour guard on-site. Next to a few restaurants.

name: Fruit Control
description: Fruit control while going north only. very friendly, our fruits for private consumption were ok. They didn't ask for vegetables, meat, cheese or anything else - only fruits!

name: Hotel Ciudad Condal/Euro Maya
description: We parked at the Tourist Police lot, but decided to splurge on a cheap room with showers and a real bed while we explore Antigua. This place was cheap, but REALLY nice and friendly. Not only were the rooms great, but an easy walk to everything...and free breakfast! We paid Q375 per night. Money well spent in our opinion.

name: Benque Viejo Del Carmen, Belize to Melchor de Mencos, Guatemala
description:
Guatemala to Belize:
Just drove through the fumigation device and stopped the car at the parking lot. The migration is together with the customs in the same building. Personal immigration was free. For the car they charged fumigation (we had to pay 5 USD at the yellow building next to the fumigation station) and some kind of entry fee for the car: 15 USD. It was possible to pay directly in USD. In addition they checked the fridge for fruits, vegetables, diary products and meat: Tomatoes, Peppers, citrus fruits, eggs, cheese and fresh meat are not allowed - as well as the import of beer?!? Wine, rum, apples, cucumbers were fine...  The whole process was absolutely friendly and professional and in English language. The required insurance for Belize you can get after the import procedure down the hill on the right side at the small huts - you will get a sticker for the front window. We didn't need any copy's! See next post re insurance.

name: Hotel vasquez
description: Rooms for 40Qpp or 55Qpp and 20Q for car. Secure parking

name: Delica Food store
description: Food store for fine cheese, wine bread and a lot of other import products. Best Pretzel since we left home! Germans have to go there :-)!

name: Hotel Los Olivos
description: Nice hotel with safe parking-garage. They charged us 200 Q / night for a double room (would be 260 Q with breakfast) cause they didnt have a lot of guests on a sunday. Hot showers, TV, Wifi. and its near to the park.

name: Restaurante Hotel Grand Caporal
description: New Hotel with free Wifi, Restaurant,Toilettes, Pool and Showers. Free Water and Coffee. Very friendly Staff. Paid 1000 Quetzales for 1 Night. Safe Parking.

name: Hostal Doña Lety
description: cute little hostal with shared bathrooms, cost 120 Q/ night for a double or a room with two beds. secure parking is about two blocks away and included (belongs to the staffs family). in zona 1 at 6a calle, take care of the one way-streets

name: Hotel Posada familiar
description: This is one of the cheapest and most basic places we found. The city is very chaotic and full of motorbikes. The place is at 4a calle in Zona 1 and has no parking. A room costs 70Q with shared bathroom or 120Q with own bathroom. The safe parking lot is around the corner on the opposite of Hotel Casa Blanca. Between 7pm and 8am it cost 25Q, the rest goes by hour.

name: Casa Real Del Viajero
description: Excellent, clean rooms. Secure motorcycle parking. Center of town. 80 QZ for one person per night (2015)

name: Rincon Suizo
description: Awesome restaurant with excellent food in a very authentic (Swiss) atmosphere. The parking lot is big and two security guards protecting the rig. You can buy cheese and delicious meat.

name: Tukur Balenario
description: Sweet little balenario with 3 pools and private cabins with bathrooms for 150Q/night for two. Found this place after late start and long stretch of dirt on way to Coban. Owner Oscar was very nice and let us park our car right next to the cabin away from the road.

name: Oasis Chiyú
description: Tired of stairs in Tikal or the bustle of Flores?  This place is quiet, slow and relaxing. An Eco hotel with spots for camping. Close to Las Conchas waterfalls (10 minute drive), 50q per person per night. Eco out-houses, showers, kitchen. You can swim in the river that goes through the property. We came for 1 night and stayed 2. Felipe will also guide tours if you want.

name: Tropigas
description: Stop at gate. Guard will open it for you to drive into filling station. 13,5QZ/Gallon

name: Central Park Pizza
description: This is now called Central Park Pizza and it’s a TREAT! Very delicious thin crust pizzas with gourmet toppings from about 100-160q. They are big too- 16” and so tasty. It’s like the crust melts in your mouth. If you need your pizza fix after a day of hiking volcanoes, don’t miss this place. Good selection of beer, wine, and booze as well.

name: Football Field
description: This field is rigth next to the police station and they said it was ok to park and overnigth in here. Is just blocks from the center where the Chichicastenango market is set up on sunday and thrusday. Quite at night, during the day there are some things going on,  like footbball games and school band practices.

name: Los Cuernos
description: Guatamala side of the border 100 meters before the check point on highway 2 (north side of the road). 200q for small 2 star room. Restaurant on site, small tiendas around. Decent wifi and secure lot. We stayed in our camper in secure grounds used shower and toilet in the room safe. And secure  but mucho noise as the check point is open 24 hours lots of trucks crossing 100q per night

name: Purificada Santa Ana
description: Side road off of diagonal 12. 8q for 5 gallons.

name: Xkape Kob'an
description:
nice place. 25 for menu of the day. including drink and dessert. can be with meat or veggie.
portions are rather small but very tasty.
would recommend this place!

name: Posada Doña Leonor
description: Big clean rooms and bathrooms. Room for 3 people: 180 quetzals. Can park in courtyard or in covered, safe and locked parking garage connected to the hotel.

name: Hotel Bella Vista
description: We stayed at this hotel for a week while we recovered from a medical incident. The staff are very friendly and accommodating. The rooms aren't big but they are clean. 150 Q a night.  It is conveniently located just off of  highway 1

name: Marinita Restaurante & Hotel in Mariscos
description: Hotel and restaurant with a parking lot in front Laguna Izabal at Mariscos. U Will find it at the end of Mariscos rd. Nice place, very quite, lovely owner!!! We pay 30 quetzales per night. Toilets, cold showers and good food at restaurant. Nice Dock and hammacs to relax on the lake. /// Hotel y restaurante con un buen estacionamiento frente a la laguna de Izabal en Mariscos. Lo encontras donde termina la calle de Mariscos. Lindo lugar y muy tranquilo. La dueña, Araceli, muy amable! 30 quetzales x noche. Baños y duchas de agua fría, y buena comida en el resto. Un muelle y hamacas para relajar y no hacer nada mas que disfrutar del lago.

name: Gasolinera Morjan, 15Q per night
description: Since the possibility to camp at the tourist police's place is no longer available, we parked our bus at this gas station. It's not the most beautiful place to stay but it's quiet and safe at night. There is a guard that watches for you in between 11pm and 5am (when the gasolinera is closed). The price is 15 Quetzal per night, which we sorted out to be very good! Furthermore, you can stay in town as long as you want and don't have to hurry to drive up to the Parque ecologico. There is a restroom! Domino's Pizza across the street :)

name: Posada Las Marias
description: Posada las Marias is a Hotel that allows camping in its parking lot. We payed 25Q p.P. The showers were very clean and it's only 250m away from the natural monument. River access across street with rope swing and swimming. it's the closest possibility to camp, if you don't want to stay at the parking-lot. You can walk to the pools. Everyone was very friendly. Electricity stops at 10pm.

name: She'll Santa Cruz
description: This is a gas station next to a nicer hotel. A local guy told us it is very safe to park in the gas station parking lot that is right in front of the hotel. Free. No access to facilities. Just a stop for the night. Up in the mountains a bit from here is a beautiful river with hot springs which are public and free. We thought to park there in the big parking lot but were told it is not the safest at night for vandalism from guys on motorbikes.

name: Parqueo El Salvador
description: Nice large parking lot with room for camping. Three tall white metal doors mark the entrance to the drive way. 40Q per night can be negotiated for longer stays.

name: Mechanic "Don Chico"
description: car mechanic but allowed me to change the coolant on my bike myself.

name: hotel casa lola
description: private rooms with hammocks and views of the lake for 60 quetzals a night. secure parking for a few motorcycles. not far from the gringo strip but pretty quiet.

name: Mira Valle Hotel San Pedro
description: Guatemala side of the border  at El Carmen  2 hours into Guatamalla lovely old grand clean friendly with comfortable beds and great service $41 for a double excellent hot showers

name: Hotel Calle Ancha
description: Nice family run hostel, clean rooms with private bathroom, fast wifi, warm water with electric showerhead, secure parking for a big number of motorbikes and possibly cars (height restriction 2,5m ), restaurants in walking distance, in walking distance of the centre.

name: Edan
description: UN USED ECO LODGE. UNDERCOVER, POWER,TOILETS NO WIFI. A TRUELY BREATHTAKING SITE. BEAUTIFUL SWIMMING AND SMALL WATER FALLS. There is a house across the road. ask the lady or son and they will point will show you.

name: Mon ami
description: Nice hostel on the lake. Pier out on lake with crystal clear water. Rooms clean and shower is warm. Wifi depends on how many people are using it. Expect it to be poor. There is a small parking area in the back. Great for motorcycles and maybe one car. We paid Q150 for a double room without private bathroom. Rooms have fans. From here is a 45 min drive to Tikal or the hostel will organise a bus for you. Awful food and unfriendly service in the restaurant.

name: Corinto, Puerto Barrios, Guatemala to Corinto, Omoa, Honduras
description:
Honduras-Guatemala, Corinto Border: 

NEW ONE STOP SHOP BORDER - AT THE BORDER - BOTH HONDURAS & GUATEMALA MIGRACION & ADUANA IN THE ONE PLACE - WINDOWS SIDE BY SIDE!

Exit Guatemala:  The immigration office (sign posted) is about 10kms back from the Honduran side and the aduana is 15 mins back from the immigration office. The aduana was not signposted, just a small office with a blue door after a small bridge, I think called Rio Negro. 

Enter Honduras:  At immigration, passport was stamped, entry fee cost USD$3 or 58 Honduran Lempiras(HNL). Aduana was in a building across the car park. 

(Note: First person processing Honduran TIP collected $40 US without receipt but later returned this from his wallet after confronting him with his ill deed.)

Nothing really at the border until around Puerto Cortez, where there are nice hotels, restaurants, gas, ATM's etc.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Exit Honduras: 
1. immigration of both countries is right next to another. Very fast and simple.

2. Aduana: the building behind migration. 
A. Go to Honduras booth. Show passport and TIP. They cancel TIP and keep the paper.
B. Go to Guatemala booth. Show passport and vehicle registration. Vehicle gets checked quickly. You have to pay 160 Quetzales (Moto). Has to be payed at a bank!
DONT CROSS ON A SUNDAY! 
Banks are closed and I had to pay 100 Quetzales for somebody to use his online banking to pay the receipt. No other option.

name: Jalacte, Belize to Poptun, Guatemala
description:
UPDATE May 2019. STILL NOT OPEN

NEW BORDER CROSSING  BELIZE TO GUATEMALA ,     JALACTE   , proposed     opening     2016   ,   JALACTE is a   small   community of Mayan farmers  in the   Toledo   district of southern Belize  west of San Antonio.     Opening date for the new border crossing is planned for sometime in 2016 but much  depends on how the Guatemalan side  gets their side up and running, and if no political disputes  arise. In Guatemala the road hooks into the one to POPTUN  on CA 13 . This should provide a short route to GT City for commercial traffic.

name: Valle Nuevo, Guatemala to Chinamas, El Salvador
description: This is a border crossing between Guatemala and El Salvador.

name: El Florido, Chiquimula, Guatemala to Copan Ruinas, Honduras
description:
Guatemala to Honduras in El Florido
Guatemala customs across from the parking lot and up a little hill. Show your import paper and they will ask for you to get 2 copies of the import paper (they made the copies after cancelling the permit for free), plus your passport and license. 
If you plan on returning to Guatemala, don't cancel your  TIP,  just make it a temporary exit.   

VIN will be checked and you will get two copies, one for the Guatemalan guard that is behind you.  Immigration next door.  
Drive  100 feet into Honduras. Park on the right, in front of the office. 
Immigration and get your passport stamped. A sign on the wall said the fee was $3 USD, but the official insisted I pay him 30 Guatemalan Quetzales.    
Next door  to customs. Need copies of  passport, license and registration. 
Fill out  paperwork and theneto the bank next door. 880 Honduran Lempiras for the import permit. About $34 USD.   Back to the customs office with your receipt and get your papers. 
No insurance is necessary nor available. 
Fumigation may be required.
Guard will check papers as you exit.  

Its possible to temporary stop your import papers to Guatemala and go and visit Copan Ruins.

name: Hotel La Posada de Don Pedro
description: Cheap hotel with gated parking in the entryway, TV, good wifi for only 160q per night for two beds. 15 minute walk to the historic center.

name: Chaltunha Hostel
description: Great spot, beautiful views and amazing host. Cabanas and camping only a 5min boat ride away from Isle de Flores. 200q for cabana including breakfast for 2 persons. 35Q pp per night camping. Very clean and secure Eco lodge with restaurant, bar and pool. The host Neil was very friendly, super helpful and has a great knowledge of the area, travelers needs and he is a 4x4 enthusiast. Highly recommended.

name: Las Cataratas
description: Water falls

name: Crossroads Cafe
description: Mike is a super cool guy and he knows how to make a good coffee. Bike rider, traveler and will help if need be. Most probably the best coffee in Guatemala.

name: Hotel Dionisio
description: Affordable place located right in the old town--we paid 200q per night for a room which was offered if we stayed at least two nights. There is not secure parking, but the hotel is on a quiet dead end street with good lighting and three hotels. We parked there for three nights with no incident. Good view of Volcan de Fuego eruptions from the second floor, good wifi, access to shared kitchen, and a few blocks to the main square.

name: Johnny's Place
description: Great hotel located on the beach with various options for rooms: cheapest is shared bathroom/shower with fan for 120q per night during the week (140q for the weekend) for a couple which includes breakfast at the restaurant (good food). Prices increasing for private bathroom, aircon, etc. Good wifi. Secure parking lot. Loads of hammocks and four small pools on the property. Short walk to town or the turtle farm. Highly recommended.

name: Ferry
description: If you are heading to/from Monterrico and El Salvador (operates between La Avellana and Monterrico) you can take these rickety wooden boats on a 20 minute ride on the river to save you from having to drive all the way through to Escuintla. The boats take two vehicles (maybe a moto or two as well) and charge depending on the size of the vehicle. It was 85q for my standard cab small pickup. Nice and interesting ride through the mangroves as well!

name: Jenna's River Bed And Breakfast
description: Amazing bed and breakfast with secure motorcycle parking, very moto friendly. Clean rooms, comfy beds, hot showers, free water, awesome brekkie included. Right in town, walking distance to everything in Pana, boat dock is half a block away.
