Highly recommend to go to Motopolis if you have to do something on your bike. Check out there website http://motopolis.com.gt/ or facebook.
We've been at first at the BMW Workshop and we couldn't talk to the mechanic - it was not allowed...

name: Casa Perico
description:
Great hostel/hotel to stay. It's running by some swiss guys. It's in the middle of the jungle and very quiet and special. You can relax there for a few days. We payed 60Q for a dorm. 
You can also do a daytrip to Livinstone for 200Q.
Showers are cold, internet is good and the stuff is very friendly - the speak spanish, english and german. 
It can be reached by boat only, so they will pick you up in the village with our shuttle boat. Arrival and leaving are free of charge for our hotel guests.
Any additional roundtrip to the village to Rio Dulce: Daytime 25 Q - after 8 p.m.: 40 Q
The "SunDog" Cafe or "Bruno's" Hotel/Restaurant will call the shuttle boat for you - you can also storage the motorbike/car there. 
See post at Sundogcafe.

name: Lavanderia Express - Laundry
description:
20Q per load (5kg) for wash and dry
the shop entry is in the small street, there is a sign

name: Auto Mike
description:
Trustworthy mechanic.

Owner explains things which need to be done, before starting, by using an online translater for English.

name: Dos Americas Bungalows
description: 158Q for a double room with kitchen & private bathroom. 90Q for one person. Plenty of space for motos, not enough for big rigs. Can fit only one car probably. Quiet & clean little hotel about 10' away from centro.

name: Hotel San Jorge
description:
Very nice hotel with secure parking and close to everything. Only $ 45 us. Very clean.


Très joli hôtel avec stationnement sécuritaire et près de tout. Seulement 45$ us. Très propre.

name: La Torre Supermercado
description: well sorted supermarked, general parking.

name: Hotel Portal del Occidente
description:
Hotel very clean and very good. For $ 35 us. Resto ok but nothing extravagant. Secure parking and good wifi.


Hotel très propre et très bien. Pour 35$ us. Resto ok mais rien d'extravagant. Stationnement sécuritaire et Bon wifi.

name: Hotel Villa Real
description:
Hotel very close to the starting point of the Tajumulco trail. Don Abigail provides secure parking for campers at 30Q per vehicle (which we used). Water available, did not ask for electricity but there is a plug in the parking lot. Hotel accomodation is 50Q per person. 
Right next to the road, so traffic noise  (was tolerable at night).
Owner can organise a guide for the hike, also with horses (around 350-400Q guide + horse overnight trip).
Phone number on the sign is incorrect, correct is 57608022.

name: Casa De Coco With Adolfo
description:
Adolfo no longer lives here, he left his family, but María Luisa and the children are still here doing coconut oil and avocado workshops and hosting people and doing immersive lifestyle hosting in their humble home
 20quetzals for a night to stay with the family. 15-20quetzals if you want feed.
 You could camp in the yard thou the house is fine if you can handle living like a rural Guatamalan with pit toilets & a shower sort of.
They also offer classes in Coconut & Avocado oil making.
Big family, all extremely friendly. They have people coming & going all the time. Also good place to learn Spanish, the mom & kids know English.
 It's easiest to WhatsApp Adolfo ahead of time. +50232198537. I put the number in photos too.

name: Automecanica Ventura
description: Great mechanic. Ask for Hector, the owner.  They are able to scan new computerized vehicles.

name: Balneario
description:
A local natural Swimmingpool on the river. About 500 m off the mainroad on gravel. 
Very beautiful. 
We travel with bicycles so I'm not sure if they allow Campervans, but I guess so. 
We paid 25 Q per Person.

name: Balneario
description:
A local Swimmingspot 1km off the road. There is a sign on the road. There is a drop toilet, some wooden tables and some roofs where you can pitch a tent under. Enough space for campervans I guess. But we travel with bicycle, so haven't tried that. 
Entry costs 10 Q for adults, 5 for kids under 10.

name: Mirador Juan Dieguez Olaverri
description: super schöne Aussicht auf Huehuetenango, Altiplano und mehrere Vulkane

name: Panajachel Agua Purificada
description: 8Q for 20lt. We were able to fill up our truck camper... they had an extra hose we could use.  NOTE- they did not offer us a hose when ours was too short

name: Suzuki Motos Guatemala
description: Suzuki Motorcycle shop. They had all parts on stock that I needed for my DR650. Also the workshop service team is very friendly. I had concerns about my stator/regulator and they checked my electrics immediately and didn't charge anything (everything was ok on the bike). The service manager Oscar Quintanilla was very welcoming and they also took care of my buddy who had to wait.

name: Kaffee Fernando's
description: Great coffee, relaxing patio, shop for chocolate, coffee and more. Some locals say it's the best coffee in town! Wifi available. Named for the owner's cat! Less expensive than man other similar cafes.

name: Hecho en Casa
description: Small and cosy restaurant with good Sandwiches and Quesadillas for only 15Q and Hamburger for 22Q! A very good deal for expensive Antigua. Wifi available. A Locals place!

name: lavanderia Arcoiris
description: laundry 35qzd/ load for washing and drying. very friendly guy!

name: Hospedaje Caballero
description: Very nice and clean rooms. Paid only 100 Q for a doble with hot shower and WiFi.

name: Santa Maria Volcano
description:
Santa Maria volcano trail head. there is a gated parking lot you can leave your vehicle as you hike the volcano. hike is steep and at some points difficult terrain.
took us 3 hours up.
Amazing views. if you are lucky you can see Volcano Santiagos small eruptions.
you can also camp up top or in one of the fields.

name: Hospital Veterinario Petcetera Poptun
description: Competent vet with good equipment and nice people .. if you have an issue with your pet(s).

name: Hôtel Centenario
description:
Un Hotel simpático 150Q con 2 camas dobles o 100 con una cama doble con ventilador TV y Wifi, parking seguro que cierra a las 9 pm
Y una pequeña piscina en medio de las habitaciones.

name: garage
description: purchase bands reflective and Triangle safety

name: Car ferry from Sipacate to El Paredon
description: 100Q per car. Also plenty of just people ferry boats.

name: Hotel Tolimán
description:
Amazing hotel, with great staff. It has large secure parking, pool, wifi, and breakfast is included. We hiked the volcanos and camped on one for a night. The staff arranged a guide and let us leave are motorcycles parked for the night free of charge. 

Price for one night is 65us for a room with two beds,two people.

The town is very quiet compared to the rest around the lake.

name: Car Ferry El Paredon to Sipacate
description:
Car Ferry El Paredon to Sipacate 
100Q...fun!

name: Balneario el Boqueron
description:
Here you can go with a small boat into the canyon. it's 20 qtz/p. And the 
trip is about half an hour. It's really worth to stop here. the Entrance to the balneario is 10 qtz/pand 10 qtz for the vehicule. for camping It's 50 qtz/ nicht. we didn't sleep here. we just had oud picknick here. There is also a playground for the kids.

name: Hotel Y Turicentro Paola
description:
This place is decent for a night's stopover. We decided to stop here to avoid driving through Guatemala City late at night. Wifi and TVs in room. 

Price. $25 USD for a room for two people, with private bathroom
Parking. Secure parking in a gated lot.

name: Parqueo publico
description:
good secured parking with shadow
50Q per day, 50Q per night
you can go and come 24 hour
3m high and 6m long vehicle no problem
very central
next to a metrobusstop
toiletts and water available
they have wifi but did`t check
opposite the hotel clariss

name: In front of Ramada
description: Not much traffic noise here, nobody bothered us, and a beautiful view of the water !

name: CHAPULTEPEC
description:
Incredible place to drink home-grown coffee and natural yogurts of their own cows. Very good.Possibility d visit and sleep in the hacienda in a wonderful and surprising place.

Increible lugar donde tomar cafe de cosecha propia y yogures naturales de vacas propias. Muy buenos.
Posibilidad d visitar y dormir en la acienda en un lugar maravilloso y sorprendente.

name: Petrol Station
description:
We travel by bicycle and tent. They allowed us to camp here. Quiet place. Clean toilets. All for free.
there are some shops and easy local places to eat.

name: valdez
description: Good Fair Welder can handle just about anything. enough time and he could build something for you. He welded part of a luggage rack and got us a bolt from a moto shop down the road for free. highly recommended

name: Honda Guatemala (bikes)
description: excellent mechanic there taking care of overlander bikes, also allowed me to work with him. we changed the gaskets of my rear cylinder (honda transalp). highly recommend. (only spanish)

name: Bruel gourmet
description:
Excellent French fusion restaurant. 
Came for the daily lunch special. 40 Q for baguette sandwich, drink, and dessert. Has WiFi, parking with height restriction, and accepts credit card.

name: Posada San Carlos
description: By paying cash we could have a large double room for 57USD including breakfast (coffee no included !...) and a place to park our Defender at Tourist Police Parking lot (about 500 meters further).

name: Centro de Formacion de la Coperacion Española
description:
An ancient covent transformed in a museum with temporary expositions. 
Great place. 
Free entrance. 
No bags allowed inside, but they have free lockers. 
Nice bathrooms for free.

name: Hotel Aurora
description:
DON’T GO TO THIS PLACE!! (read below comment with the title “Place to avoid” to understand why)

—-

The other hotels we visited on waterfront charged at least 60 USD; this one gave us a large double room (#5) with AC, bathroom, balcony, TV, view on the lake (the best TV...) for 150 Q (20USD)....
Probably this price is impossible to get on high season (Q300+taxes written inside the room door...). 
Hot shower didn't work but not necessary because the heat. 
For AC they charge a little extra fee; we didn't use it : fan was enough for us. 
Sure, this is not Hyatt but in relation with price...
They have also dorms for Q50/pers and many backpapers stay here. 
Our car was parked in the street at the entrance of hotel and we could monitor it from balcony. 
Flores seems pretty safe and "parqueo" are very very rare in the city.

name: laguna magdalena
description: This is the trail head for the laguna. you can tent camp at the laguna for 20q. There is also some cabanas not sure how much. Also there is a home they will rent you a room for 60q for the whole room. small store downstairs.

name: Hiking to the Mirador
description:
This a point on way to the Mirador. 
Nice hike from San Miguel (about 1 hour one way). 
Trail is not indicated on Mapsme

name: Mirador
description: Wonderful view from the Mirador on Flores and the whole bay of Lake Peten Itsa.

name: Posada Montaña del Quetzal
description: Nice hotel. Friendly staff. We were told Q250 for the simplest double room and Q348 for the cabin, with private bathroom and a living room with a fireplace. Nice hot shower. No internet.

name: Grutas Rey Marcos
description:
Beautiful place with palapas and balneario the cave has not convinced us


schöner Platz mit Palapas und Balneario die Höhle hat uns nicht überzeugen können

name: Repuestos de motos
description: Selling spare parts tyres and accessories for motorcycles

name: Bmw motorcycles
description: Sales services parts and other aftermarket accessories.

name: Ktm Guatemala city
description: Sales spares parts, services and everything else

name: El Jordan, km93.5, zona de recreo
description:
English: Lovely and well maintened place by the river (where its possible to swim). With tables, bbq area, drinks (no alcohol) food options, swimming pool and wc. Open from 8 to 17 but when we came the owners stayed for dinner until around 7. We stopped by and asked if we could camp here, Yuma and her husband were very friendly and helpful and said no problem at all. Very safe, gates are closed at night and there are 3 dogs looking after the place. We could use water, light and electricity. 
They let us camp and didnt ask us for anything, but we gave them what they usually cover for the entrance from local people (15 Q pp).
The most sympatic people we've met so far.
Spanish: Bonito lugar cerca del rio donde uno puede bañarse. Zona de recreo. Mesas, barbacoas, piscina, wc, bar/restaurante (bebidas NO alcoholicas). Abierto d 8 a 17h ahunque nosotros llegamos a las 17,20 y los propietarios estubieron hasta las 19h. Muy amablemente nos dieron algo de comer y nos dejaron acampar.
No nos cobraron nada, pero les dimos lo q cobran para entrar a la gente local, 15Q pp. Pudimos usar agua, electricidad y wc.
Lugar seguro, puerta cerrada durante la noche con tres perritos q vigilan.
Yuma la propietaria es MUY amable.

name: Paradise Inn
description: Simple hotel, Q250 for a double room. No dogs

name: Restaurante Hana
description: Delicious Japanese restaurant. Authentic cuisine. Japanese owner. A very pleasant and welcoming environment. A little pricey, but totally worth it. Main dishes starting at around Q65.

name: Estacion Linda Vista
description: gas station with small shop/restaurant, playground,  clean bathrooms and car wash.  secure (open 24hrs). free wifi in restaurant.  great stop if you  cant make it all the way to chichicastenango in the day!

name: ICAP - Spanish Classes
description:
Instituto de Capacitacion Adventista del Peten is a closed religious campus where there are 350 students and the families of 50 teachers. They are a self sustained school quite isolated from Poptun ( 12 km of bumpy road but we were able to make it with a 24 ft RV)
We were looking for Spanish classes in a less turistic and crowded environment and we ended up here. The college did not have such a program but they paired my husband with a teacher for 3 hours a day (one on one). They didn't have set prices for the classes (we were the fist to ask for such a service) so they asked us to eat at the cantina and pay 30 Q per person per day for 3 meals (all lacto ovo vegetarian). They said we didn't have to pay the teacher but a propina and a donation for the college would be appreciated.  The Spanish teacher Leonel Lopez was amazing. We camped near his house ...sewage, water, electricity, and weak wifi available. Before coming here you should send an e-mail to ask for further information...because it is a religious school and you will have to abide by certain rules (wearing shorts, no loud music and party, no meat, no alcohol, etc). We spent 16 days here and overall, although we are not adventist, it was an great experience.(icap9t@gmail.com; phone: 31093251) 
Note there are no showers an bathrooms available, so you have to be self contained.

name: Las 24 Horas Hotel
description: A 24 hr Hotel with secure parking, bathrooms and hammocks to hang out in. They seem to be an event venue, but had nothing going on the night we came. They have ample parking secured by a gate and a restaurant on-site. 50Q to park, 120Q for a room with private bathroom& shower. There are outdoor open air showers in the back corner (closest to the entry door).

name: Restaurante Las Orquídeas
description: Amazing Italian restaurant. Homemade pasta, bread and pizza. Tagliatelle with local chaia greens, very tasty. Very welcoming Italian chef, Angelo, and his very friendly Guatemalan wife, Ileana, are wonderful hosts. They have amazing stories to share. It's a little more expensive then others around, but well worth it (a well served plate of pasta was Q60 when we were there). Open for lunch and dinner, no breakfast. Go!

name: Hotel Gloria's
description: Terrible room, not so clean. BUT CHEAP. 70 for two...with wifi. Cold shower. Secure parking.

name: Hotel Paraiso
description: A beautiful hotel by the mountain. We got here after a terrible fogy day. Nice and cozy rooms for Q75 Per room. Hot water, wifi and sauna(+Q10) Very friendly family who runs the hotel.

name: Hotel valle del sol
description: Parking lot of the hotel. Guarded 24/7. You can park in the shade. There is a restaurant with wifi next door. 25 quetzales. You can take a bus from here to Lanquin to go to Semuc Champey.

name: Cambio casas
description: If you need to change your mexican pesos to Queztzacoles...this is the easiest place in town.

name: Scenic route to see 3 volcanoes
description:
Volcano Agua,Acatenango and Fuego!
Scenic route on the way to Antigua.

name: Valhalla macadamia farm
description:
Organic macadamia farm, tour and restaurant. The nice owner even ask if we wanted to sleep at the parking lot. 
Not easy access for double rigs (trailers) or tall/wide rigs. Park and check it first.

name: Villa Canaan
description: Super cute and very quiet little haven, just off the main road to/from Guatemala City/Coban. Very secluded, very pretty cabanas with private outdoor patios, hiking trails, hot showers, cable tv with English speaking channels!! Great spot to stop after or before Semuc.

name: Petencito Park
description:
there are toilets on top of the small hill

No facilities. Nice place just aside of the lake. Very quiet & safe!

name: Fresh veggies
description: Local man has a perfect little jard where he grows lots of different vegetables. All organic and veggies are as fresh as it can get. Still growing :) Cant beat that! Geronimo even has his own digged out well to water the plants. Open everyday. Prices are cheap and owner lives on site in a small hut. Added pictures showing some stuff what he grows. A must visit place if you are in San Pedro!

name: Parque ecológico Pino Dulce
description: Nice place to stay and have fun, they have like 3 trails to walk a canopy and bridges to cross (Q100/$13 or Q50/$7 depends on how many cables and bridges do you want). We do de Q100 and was worth it, more than the Q50. Also we stay in a little mountain that is near and enter with a little car don't 4wd needed. They charge us Q60/$8 per person to camp. Very quiet at night and very crowd in the morning. Cold weather so you better bring a coat. There are cabins available Q250/$33 there is room up to 10 people per each cabin.

name: Bank
description: Bank atm, accepts visa, gives US dollars

name: Finca Trece Aguas
description: Beautiful place, beautiful sights, need permission to enter, call + 502 52024008

name: Vet Santarita
description: Decent place with an English speaking vet.

name: Taxi
description:
ENRIQUE The taxi driver was the only one who could find Quetzalroo!
Because of all the one way streets. we r friends now!he speaks english.....saved us......called a tow truck for us and got us to a great mechanic. He is a champin a Guatemala local. does tours etc. great prices. +52041974575.

name: hotel y ranchon brendita
description: 24h openend hotel with restaurant at the parking lot and armed security guard who is watching the cars the whole night! we needed a safe place to sleep in our car before we cross the boarder to honduras...so we asked if it is possible to stay here for the night! he wanted 150Q but we traded him down to 100Q for 3 persons and our van! still very expensive but we felt safe here so we stayed. we could use toilets from the restaurant the whole night but no other services like wifi etc. available. didn't ask for water or showers, so not sure about this but the hotel looks very new so i guess they have hot showers if you ask for it

name: Hotel San Antonio
description: Great rooms with private bathrooms and a kitchen on site. Awesome location and views of the lake for 100Q for the room for two (or 70Qpp). Hammocks on the balconies and really helpful staff. They let us park our truck behind the gate (very tight for big rigs) room for plenty of motorbikes and probably 2-3 smaller cars. The road to the hotel is super narrow and hard to turn around for longer vehicles.

name: Quetzaltrekkers
description:
A volunteering organisation running multi day hikes up the volcanoes or around the lakes, and support an local school and orphanage. 
The school has 180 students and at the orphanage 20 young people between 10 and 18 years lives. 
Your hike supports these young people and we can highly recommend it.
You can stay at hostel Argentina where they have an office. 
They have hiking gear and backpacks you can borrow for the hikes.

name: Antigua Motor Group AMG
description:
Great motorcycle mechanic in downtown Antigua. The owner Caesar(originally from New Jersey) is super guy happy to help out travelers and his young prodigy was very knowledgeable. We spent a weekend helping take apart my brothers top end. Highly recommended. 

5a Calle Poniente 6-10, Antigua Guatemala, Guatemala

name: Hotel Mirador del Lago
description:
Secure motorcycle parking for four of us, could also fit an SUV with a roof box in a tight squeeze. Descent wifi in common area.
 Rooms with lake views and terrace. 150 Quetzals (~20 USD) for a two person room with 2 beds, private bath. Had a happy hour in the bar like every other hotel on the island. 420 friendly.

name: Hotel  Cuna del  Nene
description: Nice clean hotel. Very nice family. Clean rooms. Paid Q 125.00 for 2 persons inkl. privat bath. WiFi. Secure big parking  lot. Restaurant, Comedor, bakery etc. in walking distance. Update: 50 pesos for two people in vehicle includes use of wifi and bathroom/shower.

name: El poete
description:
Nice little Hostel with Dorm beds for 65 gtq with included breakfast.
Lots of guarded Parkings around for 30gtq the night.

name: Nice View place
description: A big gravel pit with almost no traffic beetwen 2 villages. Great view and we felt save, quiet at night and also trough the day. Near the big Antenne. Road through the village is a bit narrow.

name: Flores Behind the Salon
description:
grassy Park quiet as night m.

Someone broke into our van during the day. So be careful

name: Chacula Nueva Esperanza
description: Comunity of former refugees.  Has a little lake where you can camp.  Also a small facility to eat and stay. Very safe.

name: Laguna Brava via El Aguacate
description: You can not drive all the way to the lake. Can park small rigs midway down and walk abour 30 minutes to lake on a steep incline. Breathtaking view!!

name: José Gustavo Velasquez
description: Fantastic mechanic.  we had carburator problems,  brakes that started on fire, and then i killed the starter. he spent a night,  the next full day,  and a morning replacing everything and was extremely cheap on his labor.  very honest and i highly recommend.  he's worth going out of your way if you need any repairs.

name: Border Guatemala n Alvarado El Salvador
description: Really easy boarder crossing today - less than one hour.  We were riding an motorcycle with Guatemala plates and travel with Canadian and Czech passports.  Road passed / through all the transports and other traffic -- some ditches and really, really tight squeezing between transports required.  Got stamps and a ticket from the Guatemala side and then breezed through the El Salvador side without questions, fees or anything.  Almost feel too easy.  It would have even been faster if we stopped on the Guatemalan side first to get stamps instead we had to double back after hitting the El Salvador side.  Everyone was nice and easy.

name: Tequila Sunrise
description: Nice and cheap Hostel with big parking. Payed 110 for two nights in a dorm. They have private rooms as well. Breakfast included...In case you are a motorbike rider - Honda is just around the corner. Bmw and KTM as well. Good spot to get some service done. Very helpful people...

name: Toko Baru
description: The Falafel and the Tikka Masala was good, the price too. But we think the food was cooked longer time before and just heaten up again. Nice place and nice People who work there.

name: North West Gas Station Free Camp
description: Big parking behind the gasstation. Traffic noise not completely blocked, but far enough (200 metres) from the mainroad. Tree line gives a bit shade in the back and you have valley view. One of the larger parkings we found aloung this road. Free when you buy gass. Little restaurant with gasstation shop present.

name: Foto Sanchez ( B52 USA )
description: Behind the US ambassy. They make, print and email your picture for your Non-immigrant B52, DS 160 application form. You have to change the picture file a bit. Rotate 90 degrees, shrink to 600 pixel width and cut of a bit on top and bottom to get 600 height. Save to a max file size of 240 kb. US ambassy close by. Advice: When you go north and wanna apply for B52 prepare yourself on the internet. Heldesk and embassy staff are very helpful and welcoming.  No worries.

name: Police Station
description: We asked the police and they let us parking on a small street near the station. Off course was free. Not the quietest place but OK for a night before boarder crossing.

name: Jalpatagua Purificadora
description: 8 Quetzales for 1 Garrafon Agua purificada.................................

name: Texaco Gasstation Free Camp
description: Buy some fuel and you have a free place to spend the night in your car. Behind the station enough space, approx 200 metres from the mainroad. If there isn't a cooling or cattle truck parked next to you, you will have a quiet night. Little restaurant/shop/wifi:12345678 available. Toilets and shower are poor.

name: Next to church
description:
Flat spot in a gated area next to the church. Several tiendas across the street to buy beer/supplies. Was night  and raining when we arrived so it was nice to have a tin roof awning and covered patio on the church to cook and sit under. Water faucet nearby. Super friendly locals - surrounded our car to say hi but left when we said we needed to start cooking dinner. One of the tienda owners recommended this spot - seemed very safe and we had no issues. Quiet at night.

We took the road very slow to minimize stress on our shocks. Took 4 hours from the end of the pavement  after Bartolome until Lanquin. Would've gone the long way through Coban had I known how bad and slow this road is.

name: Riverside freedom camping
description: Nice spot next to the river, in a grove of trees. Flat spot to park or tent. Fire pits. River is great for swimming. Breezy and shady. After passing Hotel Las Marias look for a big grassy field and small pull off to the left. Hotel Las Marias had a descent restaurant and cold beer if you don't feel like cooking. This spot is 10 minutes walk to the Kanba caves and 15 to the entrance to Semuc Chempey. 10 minutes after setting up camp a middle aged man and his 3 sons approached and said it was private land - asked for 20 pesos and we happily paid. Probably fine to park your rig here or you could drive and park at Semuc Chempey.

name: Casa del Cerro Hotel (GREAT)
description: Stayed here for 3 nights while exploring Antigua. Private parking in courtyard big enough 2 large SUV's with roof boxes (entrance is just over 3 meters tall). Nice courtyard garden seating area to relax. Rooms are spotless and well decorated. Queen bed with Private baths with hot water. Feels more like a boutique hotel - all the fresh flowers made the place smell like my grandma's house - in a good way :) just 5 minutes walk from the historical center but on a back street so no traffic noise. Free real coffee all day - cheap breakfasts for 25Q (Vs 40+ in town at most restaurants). Can't say enough good things. Loved the place, couldn't get my wife to leave! We paid 160Q per night for 2 people including free parking. I think they were running a deal since it's a new property - my guess is it will be 225 or so once you read this post and the place gets more online reviews but still worth it! Check on booking.com for specials or call Ahead and ask. Hector was the manager on duty for us.

name: Mi casa, tu casa
description: Great place run by a great family. the rooms are luxurious. The hotel is in a gated secured area located right next door to the airport but it is quiet. Mynor the owner is very helpful and his son Ricardo very cool. 2 rooms available at 40USD and 45USD with access to kitchen and laundry. Entrance calle 18, ask the security guard. Mynor's number is 502 5000 0527

name: Restaurante Cahui (Comida Tipica)
description: amazing view of the lake, worth coming to enjoy a beverage on the back patio. food, not wonderful. but again, the view/atmosphere on the patio is killer. come enjoy a gallo and relax the day before tikal, or after!

name: Hotel Las Cumbres - AMAZING!
description:
Q 75 per person per night, ex sauna entry. 
Q 150 PP incl breakfast and saunas

Boutique eco lodge about 20 minutes drive from Fuentes Georgina. Much better and cheaper option than camping at the falls. This hotel is fantastic. Park your rig in the walled parking lot in back and have access to all facilities, including a nice covered patio overlooking mountains and villages, fast wifi, super clean bathrooms, and best of all, unlimited access to private steam saunas which are heated with steam from natural volcanic vents. There are 7 private saunas each could hold max 4 people. Cold shower in each sauna room so you can cool off then hop right back in. Absolutely amazing place and the staff are happy to have overlanders camping - you could probably pitch a tent in the lot in the back - just ask. Nice looking bar and restaurant on site too but we didn't eat there as we cooked on our stoves out back. We only found this place after getting deterred from camping at the springs which now costs 130Q per person, absolutely no negotiating with the gatekeeper. We skipped the hot springs altogether and don't regret it a bit. But if you want to see the springs, consider doing just the day and then sleeping at Las Cumbres.

name: Shore of lago Petexbatun
description:
Moderator Note: This Place is accepted as much detail is provided. However, be aware that the User did not stay overnight. Please add your experience if you stay overnight.

Great lunch break stop along the road from flores to coban. Beautiful view of the lake. Almost sure that this is also a great spot for free camping. We didnt sleep though since we arrived at noon. Would consider it as safe.
Right at the lake. Same spot as locals living on the other side of the lake use as lancha stop. Bus arrives a couple of times a day to/from main road bringing locals to/from lake. Nothing else around and you are not visible from anywhere. Except when bus arrives. Locals seem very nice. 
Along the main road you pass a sign saying Lago Petexbatun. From there it is about a 20 min drive to the lakeshore. When you arrive at the small village turn right and after a couple of minutes drive there is a deviation on the left hand side. No sign. But there is a black plastic garbage container as indicator.
If you are around at the time of the bus arrival local lancha owners will be able to take you to the Aguacete ruins. They asked us for 300 Q for 5 persons. Supposedly entrance to ruins is free. We didnt go though since it was extremely hot!

name: Quarry
description:
Quarry outside of Barillas. Situated at a higher level than the road via a very short but steep dirt track. Big open area where, depending on the site you choose and the size of the van, you are only little visible from the road. The quarry itself is suitable for bigger vans as well, but the track to reach it might be difficult. Quiet at night. We felt safe. 
This spot is the same as the other spot marked as pirate camp. 
Free.

name: Sendero ecologica Maceta
description:
Parking at the sendero ecologica Maceta around 6 km before arriving in Todos Santos. We arrived in the evening. No one around. The parking is quite level accomodating up to midsize vehicles. If you have a small vehicle you can park on a small grassy spot beside the parking. You are visible from the road. But above the road and not right by it. A local came by, he told us it was fine to spend the night there for free and the trail is free, too. He considered it safe.
We spent a very quiet night but cold night there. 
Next another local came by. Nice enough but he presented himself as a guide and he asked 20 quetzales  per person per night for the camp and the trail! We politely refused to pay. When you arrive there is a small hut with a description of the trail and the rules. No sign indicating that you have to pay anything. We explained this. He could not present a "recibo" and he just left.
Good place to stay!

name: 4x4 track from todos santos to San Juan Atitan
description:
If you have a 4x4, high clearance vehicle you can drive between todos santos and San Juan Atitan. Ask for directions in todos santos or san juan. We came from Todos Santos. Very steep uphill drive at the beginning until you arrive at the ridge. Steep downhill when you arrive in san juan. Not possible to drive into san juan that way if you have a big rig.
The track is very steep and narrow in sections but funny to drive with great views. Would not try to drive this way after heavy rain.
Tip: Arriving at the small bridge at the end of the downhill drive from the first ridge you have to leave the main track and turn left into a narrow track in worse condition.
When you arrive at the last ridge before driving down to san juan you will see some graves. Here you have to keep left. We spent 1 hour 45 min.

name: Hospedaje Magdalena, Acul
description:
We got help from a local to find this nice place to spend the night. magdalena is a very nice woman who speaks som english. 
She has a couple of big clean rooms with bathroom including shower for rent. The price for one person is 50 Q. With a small vehicle like landrover, landcruiser it is possible to enter the small garden in front of the house and camp there. We just managed to squeeze in with landrover and two rooftop tents. We paid 40 Q for the vehicle - we are 5 of us - per night including use of bathroom. Very nice family! You are right in the village. Met nice people.

name: Gas station. Blue Oil
description: Free overnight possible. Not big area available. Lots of parked buses. A smaller vehicle fits in. Toilets. Friendly people. Not a lot of noise during the night for a gas station to be.

name: Parking/football field
description:
A quieter place than the main beach area, at least for us, on a saturday afternoon.
Right at the shore with great views. A gravel road leads down to the area and passes behind it. Its in front of a childrens playground and a hotel.  To the left boat dock. There is street light. A couple of sanitary places around till 8 a 9 pm. 
Local who lives here considered it to be a safe and quiet place to sleep. 
We had a quiet night except for the usual street dogs.

name: Taller Lisardo Mazatiegos
description: It is a very good and correctly Auto mechanic. We had a broken cylinder head and need  new auto parts from Europa. So we must wait 4 weeks for the new parts. In this Time we could stay by the Company and became elektric and Water from Lisardo. He is very friendly and corretly. We can his Company realy recommend.

name: Banos El Recreo, Almolonga
description:
Outside of Almolonga towards Zunil you find Banos El Recreo.
More about what they offer on the tourist attraction marker for the same spot. 
After having a bath we could stay for the night on their parking lot, for free.
Not at all a beautiful spot, but enough fairly level space, you are not visible from the road unless you have a very high vehicle. Some people passing by in the evening but otherwise quite quiet for being a spot in a build up area along a road. We could use the toilet of the banos till about 10 pm and again around 6 am.

name: Banos el Recreo, Almolonga
description:
Outside of Almolonga towards Zunil. Two Banos, El Recreo and Saludable. We visited El Recreo because we could stay overnight on their parking lot which is not visible from the road. 
If you long for a long, very hot bath in your own private, big bath tub, you should visit one of these places. 
El Recreo is under reconstruction and it looks as something closed down and not attractive at all. 
They are open though, and they have a few reconstructed private bath tub rooms on offer. Nice and clean. You pay 30 Q for the tub for one hour, and we had enough room for the whole family of 5. All the very hot and cold water you like  to use! As our giude book says: you could drown an elephant. We enjoyed it a lot!
Saludable looks better from the outside. Small bar etc. Different tub sizes available, 20-30 Q. Also a common inside pool for 20 per adult, 10 per child. Bath rooms are a little less attractive looking since they are older and maybe less clean. 
You can sleep on their parking for free, too. At least thats what the actual guard told us. You are very close to the road, though, and visible.

name: Propane Place
description:
Near the dock for San Pedro, just before the pedestrian Zone ends, there is a concrete building advertising Banos on the right side. 

 There will also probably be a few propane bottles outside. These guys can't fill your bottle (from what I could find, nobody around the lake can) but they'll take it and have it filled, returning it in about a week. It was 60q to have one of our 10lb bottles filled. 

Connections handled include North American POL.

Friendly guys, good service, I even got a receipt for the bottle showing I had paid up front.

name: Playa, Lago Izabal
description:
A lake side spot a couple of km before arriving at the hotspring waterfall coming from El Estor.
A simple, nice beach like spot with a huge palapa and simple toilet. Electric light in the palapa. 
Area supposedly owned by some Finca owner. The caretaker and his family very nice people. 
Charge 10 Q per day/ pp (you can camp for the same price). No charge for children. We paid only for the 17 years old. 14 and 11 didnt pay. The second night we gave extra 20 Q as propina to the caretaker.
Away from the road, quiet except from frogs! We stayed two nights around saturday, no one else around but us. Nice swimming in the lake. You can park your vehicle right at the shore or under the palapa. Some trees for shade.
Good for up to midsize vehicles.

name: Gas station, Don Rolando
description: Nice gas station for staying overnight. We only stopped for lunch but asked guardian if overnight is allowed. Answer was YES. You can park in a small area near the car wash. Not visible from the gas station itself, but you are visible from the road. And of course there is road noise.Parking is right by a clean grassy picnic area with stone tables and benches. All in shadow. Light and hook ups (didnt check if hook up worked). Right by toilets and there is a cold, very simple shower, too (free). Didnt ask if you have to pay something for overnight but guard didnt mention it so think it is free.

name: Flor Izabalence
description:
Nice recreational area, the lady stop us on the street to ask us if we needed a place to park. Lovely women, she have a nice land by the lake with hammock, toilets, outdoor shower, electricity and water. She run a mini tienda as well.  
They have kayak and a deck where you can swim. 
They cooked us a dinner meal for the 5 of us for 15Q a plate. 
Big rigs will fit here no problems. 
50Q per night. Good value!

name: Casa del Tejido
description:
If you are interested in weaving and fair trade shopping, this cooperativa is a MUST. 85% of the prize goes directly to the weaverfamily, the other 15% is for their administration.
They show you very friendly everything about weaving. Highly recommended!!

name: Hotel Petén
description: Right in front of the Lake, we park on the street, they aloud us to use a bathroom for 50 quetzales 7 us

name: Hostel Argentina
description:
Cheap hostel. Dorms and private rooms. dorms are 30q pp and private rooms are 40q pp. if you want private bathroom too it's 50q pp. 
it's very basic but clean. good wifi in kitchen area. also drinking water in kitchen.
if you are on motorcycles you can ask to park behind the rear entrance gate right next to quezzaltrekkers office. 
the owners of the hostel is really nice. 

Quetzaltrekkers offers cheap guided hikes and the money goes to a local school.

name: hotel guox
description: nice hotel in the border town. ac/warm showers and comfy beds. the staff are incredibly helpful. the charged us 120 for two persons. there is a little restaurant across from it that it pretty cheap to eat at.

name: Livingstone - entry of Garifuna community
description: We met Filip Flores here, who is the local Garifuna leader. He is famous here and is also an international musician. You can ask for him to show you around. We gave a small donation for the Garifuna community who still suffer from the last hurricane. At these coordinates there is also a small restaurant where you can eat delicious Tapado and other local dishes

name: Laguna del Pino
description: Campsite on the side of the lake, stars view points and little ranches to make BBQ. you can ride around the lake (preferably in a 4x4 in winter). you can rent little boats to cross the lake. I camp on the lake side with my tent and the only thing is you need to ask for permission​ (there is a police point where you can ask for directions inside of the park)

name: Ruta del Cacao
description:
Warning, high clearance, low gear,... hardcore nearly off road, sometimes. Most parts are ok and gravel road is well maintained. But no big rigs! Narrow, steep, bridge new! Full adventure from Semuc Champey to Senahu.
UPDATE SEPT 2018 - locals told us the track is now only passable by motorbikes. Rockfalls have blocked the track.

name: Hotel Chalet
description: Very nice bed and breakfast with friendly host and local decorations. Room clean and hot water. We paid 290GTQ for a double room. No parking but we parked our Land Cruiser in the street in front of the hotel. Very safe. Walking distance to the market. Go for dinner at Casa San Juan good food reasonably priced.

name: Macaza alignment and balancing
description: Great place for alignment and balancing. Has the fancy 3d machine and gives you printout of before and after.  Ideally know your vehicle weight before coming because they program it into the machine.  Even very very tall rigs can fit.  For balancing four tires and alignment it was $36.  They take visa.

name: Tikal Main Entrance
description:
Since a few month it's very strict:
-no dogs past this gate. 
-All tickets must be purchased here at entrance (you can buy for next day if you are going in to camp for the night)
-Sunrise / Sunset tours only with a guide (see note from tuckstruck below if you are thinking about the sunrise tour).
-Tickets for the two museums only here available (30q pp, not really worth it)
-Credit cards possible (update: not possible)
-You get a ticket 'Control de velocidad' so they check the time you needed for the 15km distance from entrance to visitor centre (speedlimt 40km/h)

Prices:
Archeological area 150q
Camp 50q
Museums 30q
Uaxactún archeological area 50q
Sunrise or sunset 100q

name: Antigua Green School
description: If you are traveling with children, you can enroll your kids in this great bilingual school for minimum of one month during regular school year, or one week at a time during summer camp starting mid June. Wonderful school and teacher doing hands on activities centered around nature. They have a farm on site, and some small animals.

name: Entrance NP Pacaya
description: Overnight parking at the trailhead to Pacaya for free (park entrance 50q), toilets during the night available. They recommended a guide but let us go without. We started the hike at 6:30 and were completely alone, when we got back the entrance was full of tour groups, so don't go later! Worth the hike, great views!

name: Canella, Yamaha dealership
description: This places sells and services Yamaha bikes. The mechanic workshop has been very friendly and helpful to overland moto travelers.

name: Connection to Chicacao
description: There's a new paved road from Santiago de Atitlan to Chicacao, in our OSM it stops here, so don't worry, now it's finished and provides a good connection to the CA-02 - and nice views!

name: Parqueo @Manolos House
description: We camped at the iO spot at the trailhead, but had a nice chat with the owner Antonio of a parqueo at this location here. He offers parking during the day for 25q, staying overnight for 50q, baños available. His brother is a tour guide and they also offered to make tortillas for us. He asked us to recommend him and share his number: 30950211. We cannot say anything about it, except that he was a nice guy!

name: Playa El Pedegral
description:
FREE Recreation area on the lake shore. Trees, an old toboggan for kids, a covered BBQ pit and a hudge gravel lot to park your rig. 
Claro 3G signal.

name: Vulcano Pacaya
description:
Nice alternative to the parking lower. Behind the fence you can sleep out of sight. We paid Q50 to the guy in the building underneath the antenna but he's not always there. Most people hike the 4 kms up to here but the nice views are from here on.

Warning: low gearing 4x4 necessary because the hill is steep, long and narrow in places.

name: Lagunas Sepalau
description:
Don't bother coming here.
Was recommended to us by the tourist information in Cobán, nice looking lakes but all has been said. They make you pay the entrance (60Qpp normal price, negotiated it down to 30Qpp) before you can see the lake. A tour in Kayak is included. We went to see the lake by foot first, way too small to enjoy a kayak on it. Very hot, infested with mosquitoes and very muddy trail. No tables or anything alike to sit and eat something. Kayaks nowhere to be found. When we got back to the car they all had vanished. Not that we felt like doing the kayak anyway... rip off, don't go :(

name: Uaxactún
description: Worth a visit, nice ruins, no people around (we were the only tourists for 2 days)! Very quiet surrounding and friendly village people. On the way up to Grupo B, kids are offering their guide abilities for a tip, it's worth it, we learnt some interesting things about stones, plants and animals ;-) At this gps location there's a museum, the owner shows you around in a big collection of Maya ceramics, very informative and impressive to be able to touch all the stuff!

name: Kasa Kiwi Hostel
description:
Kasa Kiwi is Quetzaltenango's newest hostel!
Classic hostel in the historic center with 5 private rooms (two with private bathrooms) and 3 dorm rooms (one with bathroom) and No Bunk Beds!
We are super central (2 blocks from Parque Central), super safe, super friendly, and super clean (bathrooms cleaned 2x per day).
We have a lovely patio surrounded by plants and flowers and a roof terrace with 360 degree views of the city and surrounding mountains.
The WiFi is super fast; we have plenty of power sockets in each room; the kitchen is fully equipped and has its own terrace with tables and chairs.
We offer free filtered water; free bicycles; free computers; free luggage storage; free hugs and an internal smoking area.
We also operate as a travel agency and can book all manner of tours, hikes, shuttles and even internal Guatemalan flights.
We can advise on volunteering; studying spanish; taking salsa lessons; and all the sights Quetzaltenango (Xela) has to offer.
Kasa Kiwi is owner-operated so for anything you need please ask and we'll do our very best to help.
A Kiwi (Mark), a Gringo (Bryan), and a Guatemalan (Valeria) walked into a bar... and then we bought a hostel!

name: Auto Hotel El Roble
description: Paid 80q for a room with two beds. Small, loud and primitive, but you cannot beat that price. The owners were very nice. We fit our 3m tall van in their small secured lot. Seemed safe to us.

name: publico parking
description: small parking lot to sleep in your rig, semi level on one side with a slope on the other side. toliet and shower that were both clean and working. a family lives on site and it's gated. not a bad spot

name: Casa Elena
description: A reasonably priced bread and breakfast about a mile from the Central Square. Gives a 50% discount to touring motorcycle riders including breakfast. Contact them in advance to make sure they have space

name: Textiles and Sewing
description: The nice man who owns the shop sewed some bug nets for us, we brought the mesh fabric and other materials to make it and he sewed it for us! if you need anything sewed up, he's your guy!

name: Refugio del Quetzal
description:
At 1804 meters above sea level. This is a Natural preserve area runs by the municipality in order to protect Quetzal habitat. Best time to quetzal birdwatching 9:30 AM only 10 mn walk to the tree where quetzales come to eat, other trails available.

Entrance fee: 50Qtz ppers + 10 Qtz per car (30 Qtz per bus or big rig)
Open from 8:00 AM to 4:00 PM every days. RV's can park overnight for free in the upper (best view) parking lot.

name: Purificadora Copante
description: Get your garrafón filled at the yellow and red building at the lights. Just before the arch.

name: Trailhead of the path to Indian's nose
description:
This is the beginning of the trail leading to Indian Nose.
We did it with a guide, but the path is actually easy to follow
entrance fee, 40 quetzals.

name: Sailboat Charters
description:
Private sailboat charters at very reasonable prices. They offer customized trips around the river and lake. They work with you to create a trip based on your interests and budget.

A fun and unique way to see beautiful places you would never normally get to visit in Izabal and Rio Dulce. 

Really nice boat and great captain!

To book:

call: +502 5060 5813
Email: sailwithcaptainjack@gmail.com

name: CA Travelers
description:
If you are looking for a different experience in Guatemala, exploring  Volcanos, adventuring the town of Antigua, eating traditional food etc. this is the agency to contact. 
Farah and Pablo speak fluent English and Spanish and will make sure you have an outstanding experience. 
Give them a call or a text and they will do they best to make your wish come true. 

Farah: +502 3115-6478
www.centralamericatourist.com
Facebook:@CAtravelers502

name: Gas station: Market Xotil
description: There was a few trucks parked in the back but they told us we couldn't park in the back but we're nice about it and said we could park in the front. It seemed safe and we had no troubles. Really clean bathrooms. Music shut off early (8p) and there was just a bit of road noise but nothing bad. There's also a nice little resturaunt next door, a kids play area and Ostriches! Just a decent spot for pulling off the road for a night.

name: San Pedro Sacatepéquez- parking lot
description:
Free parking in the park beetween puma gas station and palacio maya monument. 
We spent the night next the entrance of primary school (Blue fence)
No noise during the night.
Public toilettes near Palacio Maya.

name: Reserva natural Atitlan
description:
It's a nature reserve which offers hiking trails to waterfalls, zip lines, butterfly garden or you can have a Picknick by the lake. They have a camping area, 130Q per person! Pricy! We did not camp. The park entrance fee is 70Q pp.
We enjoyed hiking to the waterfalls, visiting the butterfly garden and chilled at the lake. 

atitlanreserva.com

name: Casa Real
description:
Super nice owner (Dutch) spoke perfect English.

Rooms and very nice and clean. Got a double room with bathroom for 100q, (normally 120 I think) 

Fast wifi and secure parking for maybe 20motos or a few trucks / RVs in the long driveway.

Won't be disappointed.

name: Hostel Antigua
description: Great little hostel, parking outside for small rigs, speak to the owner if you have a big rig and he will organise it for you close by with armed security and cheap - 60Q dorm bed

name: Hotel La Estrella
description: Hotel, wifi, hot water, secure inside garage parking for bikes, cars, vans and SUVs. Not large enough for bigger rigs. Views of the lake and volcano from most rooms. Walking distance to public dock for boats to other towns on the lake. It's next to the city park so sounds of children playing until around 9pm. Not too much English spoken but they try hard to accommodate. Super nice people!  170 for 1 person, 250-300 double.

name: Lavanderia Dona Berty
description: Laundry service- drop off. Counted our pieces for recording!

name: Parkinglot oposite of the NP Entrance
description: Here you can park a big rig and spend the night as well. Paid 20 Q to an old lady. It's in the middle of the village, so for the night it's safer than the other entrance. This entrance is called 'San Francisco'. Toilets available across the Street. We hiked in the afternoon with a guide to the very top and stood there after sunset to make photos of the eruptions. Unfortunatly the weather was really bad. Wet and windy. We came back in the dark with flashlights. Paid 200 Q for the guide.

name: Hotel Silani
description: Guesthouse right on the shore of Lake Atitlan with incredible views of Lake and volcanos. Rooms are basic cabins, one tree house and a cool outdoor shared bathroom. No wifi but plenty in town. Parked on street in front of property. Owner said pay parking available from neighbors with gated lot. Cars, vans, bikes only. Located at the end of a dead end street. 250q for 2 people. Owner speaks English. This town is really laid back, hippie, spiritual, yoga vibe. The drive in is straight downhill for 4K. A million potholes but worth the view and vibe if you make it.

name: Cascada La Igualdad
description: Here is the entrance to a hike to a massive waterfall. 12Q per person. There is a very hot hot spring pool and a second fall. You will need 4x4 to get out here at this time although they seem to be working on the road. Dogs allowed.

name: Franco'o Hotel & Restaurant
description:
Nice, clean, big room with T.V., private bathroom with very hot shower, comfortable beds. Option for a/c or fan. Wifi, dog friendly, secure parking. 
When we arrived they tried to give us a nice room on the city street side. I asked about wifi and they said it only worked on resturant side, but that side didn't have a/c. We were more than fine without a/c. We were freezing from our hike in pouring rain to the cascada I put in iOverlander. 
Room with a/c was 200Q for two people, room with fan but wifi was 175Q. The parking area is large so maybe a big rig could fit, and maybe they would let you camp. We found some tasty street food by the park for dinner. By the park is a grocery store too.

name: Museo Ixchel and Museo Popol Vuh
description: 50q admission per person. Ixchel- Outstanding museum about Guatemalan fabrics, fibers, clothing and customs.  Popol Vuh- Small but well done collection of Mayan artifacts. Both are a good value for the price and contain info in English and Spanish. Located in a beautiful university campus with loads of parking for any rig.

name: 500 years old Ceiba tree
description:
Nice 500 years old Ceiba tree in the little town of Palin.
We parked at the guarded Despensa Familiar parking up the main road. It's a 5min walk to the tree.

name: Corazon del Bosque
description:
Nice little park on the side of the road. Open 8h30-17h.
We paid 50Qpp for two days and one night.
Children playground and little swimming pool. Average WC.
We were there for the 2h trail in the forest. Very nice with couple birds.
Noise from the nearby road and crowded with many kids during the day.
Average wifi from the office.

name: Bomberos Municipales
description: Fire station. safe place for one night . The bomberos are very friendly. As a cyclist you can have a bed :)

name: Hotel El Sol
description:
The best place in Panajachel (Guatemala)!!

They allowed us to park in the parking lot (courtyard) and pay only to use all the facilities. This place use to be a restaurant so the kitchen is big and impeccably clean! Really hot showers (not that warm water the locals always call hot water). And for using all the facilities we only pay Q50 per day (for the 2 of us). We were even allowed to use their bikes to move around. The family that runs the place it is very friendly. I strongly recommend this place for overlanders. Everyone was saying that the rooms are very spacious too..

name: Costa Real Hotel
description: Total splurge after a late start on the Mex-Guat border crossing. $400 quetzales for 2 dogs, 2 people, with breakfast included, nice pool, on site restaurant, great hang out areas and space to walk around the"compound." Very comfortable spot to crash!

name: Hotel Las Gardenias
description:
Great, beautiful, quiet and safe place to stay after crossing the boarder from Mexico. Paid 100qtz (now may 2019 - 120Q) for 1 night. wifi and access to their awesome pool with slide. Well worth it after long border crossing. 
The wifi doesn’t reaches the parking zone. Outside cold shower by the pool.
cats were accepted but there is a sign that says no animal (maybe just by the pool)

name: Maple and Tocino
description: great spot for giant plate of chicken and waffles or a crazy doughnut topped milkshake. not super cheap but on par with other spots in town.

name: El delfín
description: This hotel has the option for share a room, are 40q per person has wifi, Pool and is very near of the bech, and its comfy beautiful and clean.

name: Hostal El Vagamundo
description:
We stayed at this hostal, it was 100q for two people. Private room and shared bathroom/shower. Very close to everything.
They don’t have parking lot but we left the bike outside until 9pm and then we were able to roll it inside.
They also have dorms for 25q per person.

name: Purificadoa del Fuente
description: Water purification shop. they we're closed when we stopped but looks like a hose could easily reach inside (Barb fitting)

name: Laundry
description: Two different laundry places. One under the stairs, one at the top of the stairs. $4q per lb. same day or overnight.

name: Exon Gas
description:
New station built in September 2017. the bathrooms were amazingly nice with shower too. 

electric outlets available in the parking area as well as a spigot though not at the same spot 

small store. You can get the collectivo from here it costs 25q each way, but you might be in the back of a pickup truck. 4x4 and crazy past linquin

staff all speak decent English and have classes at the station. everyone is super friendly. 

this place us close to the cave parking lot but a lot less bugs.
 No longer a free location. 50qz for the night, or free if you fill up (confirm first) 

guard on duty. pliers needed for hot water in male toilet

name: caoba farms
description: Saturday and Sunday great restaurant/beer/farmers market. live music. there's a shuttle from the main square or you can walk. it's not cheap but the pizza for 80Q it was good. great outdoor farm atmosphere. lots of imported beer,etc.

name: Parqueo San José
description: This is a grassy lot with a chain link fence and wide gates. No bar across top so fine for tall and wide rigs. Operated by a sweet family. Charged us 20q for overnight incl toilet, shower, dish sink. Electric may be possible as there are lights.  Gates lock at night. Secure for rigs, motorcycles, bikes, etc. Typical road noise, dogs and roosters. Mercado and restaurants nearby.

name: Formula One gas station
description: Large station with space for big rigs. Good pricing. Can fill RV tanks using hose with gas purchase. With cassette toilet, can dump. Sells garafons of potable water. Plenty of parking along wall. May even be able to spend night here.

name: Senora Veronica's Restaurant
description: After having problems to find a place to stay we found this little restaurant where we could park overnight for free and secure. We had some nice cheap dinner there and a quiet night. Very friendly welcoming people.

name: Posada Don Teco hotel
description: Small hotel with secured parking for about 3/4 cars up to 2,40m high. We are 2.50m high and needed to let some air out of our tires and have several people standing on the backside of the car ;-). Hotel is really clean, hot showers, nice owner, good wifi, near some restaurants. Really quiet place but kind of expensive (250q for 2 persons per night). For us it was worth the money to take a good break.

name: Tazumal Archeological Site
description: A small, tidy archeological site with a nice museum. Parking near the gates beautiful grounds with large shade trees. $3.00 per person

name: Biotope Campsite
description: If you pay the entry fee of 40.- per person the camping is included and free. The Biotop has a great 2-3 hour hike, lookouts and much more. Camping is possible with a car or a truck camper in the back and with tents on grass or under Palapas. There are nice bathrooms and showers. The whole park is gated. Just ask at the front.

name: Parqueo (open all night/early morning)
description:
Showed up to try and park/camp at a place near the Castillo de San Felipe, but everything was locked up when I arrived (very early in the morning). Saw a sign for “Parqueo” that pointed to an open field near some houses, and I pulled in. It was pretty soft/wet, so I had some trouble getting situated in the lot. The noise woke the guy in the house nearest the lot (who appeared to be the owner). I offered to pay him 15q for parking and the noise. He accepted and said it was fine if I stayed there all day and slept for a few hours until sun up beforehand. 

His name is Octavio (caught it later), and he said he is excited for more people to come and stay at his parqueo.

name: Mixco Viejo
description: Beautiful post-classic Mayan arqueological site.

name: Puerta al Cielo
description: This is a family owned and operated hotel and restaurant. The price for a room is 75Q for one person or 130Q for two. We could not find any other decent options in the area on ioverlander. All other hotels we checked were 300-400Q per night. The rooms are clean, the wifi works good and the food is great. Private bathrooms. The family is adorably kind. We highly recommend staying here if you need a place before or after the border. They have secure parking around back. Call the number on the sign if no one is here.

name: Kaffee Dieseldorf
description: free WiFi , good food ,great kaffee and cake

name: Rincón Oaxaqueño
description: Nice restaurant, six tables, Mexican cuisine. Opens at 12am. One menu per day: soup or salad, beef or pork or vegetarian, dessert, water or cold tea. 80 pp. Food delicious, friendly staff.

name: Mercedes Oaxaca
description:
They do maintenance and repairs to all Mercedes trucks and vans. 
Tel (951) 501 58 00

name: Welding
description: If you need anything welded at your vehicle, these guys will help you out. In our case the exhaust pipe was fallen off the muffler. The repair job took 1 hour and was 100 quetzals (10 euro). We have them 200, as this was a really good and fast repair and the guys were super friendly and nice.

name: At Pedros in Chajul
description: We camped at this property after asking for permission. The camping was free. No facilities. Next day we got a private tour from the owner. He showed us around, organized a Maya ceremony and his wife cooked for us. Everyone was really friendly. Ask for the price if you want to do the tour or the ceremony.

name: The Shack
description: Owned by Marvin, try the Shackburguer.  Frequented by expats from dx places.

name: Gas Station Don Arturo
description: Parking at the Gas station on the way from Guatemala to Coban. Free. Security guard

name: Bank DKB possible
description: here you receive money with your DKB visa card. other banks have problems....

name: Hotel Otono
description: Parking lot of the Hotel Otono. Not for big rigs, maximum 6 meter. We paid 25 Q per vehicle. Use of toilet included. Walking distance to the citycenter. Quiet and secure.

name: Aguas Calientes
description: Local hot pools. Really nice to bath and wash. Entrance is is only 5 Q. Absolutely worth it. Open all day.

name: DON ARTURO Gasstation
description:
A gasstation with a small parkinglot

they have toilets and showers, which are clean

the station is only open till 9p.m but a security guard during the night

name: Grutas Rey Marcos near Coban
description: A very nice place to visit. Accessible by motorhome  only perhaps the last 100 mètres. 30 min by car from Coban

name: Ferry crossing
description: Ferry crossing the river to continue on highway 5. Fast service. Was 15Q for our F350 with truck camper to cross. 10Q for smaller vehicles. All prices are listed on the ferry. They collect the money when your on board and moving.

name: possible camping spot
description: Flat gravel lot off of the main road next to a soccer field. Lot is huge, gravel, and level. We did not stay here, just pulled over to walk the dog.

name: Camping at Hostel-Restaurant Don Pedro
description: You can camp in the front parking lot of the restaurant or even inside the building. There are outside bathrooms (ok but not nice) and wifi. No showers. It's quiet and has a nice view over the lake. We payed 50Q per car per night.

name: San Benito near Flores
description:
Parking Municipal de San Benito. First we have gone to the Playa El Pedegral beautiful place near the lake but policemen told us it was not secure. So they recommanded us the municipal parking.
Very quiet. Free. Signal Claro and Movistar. 
We stay there 2 nights. Flores is at 1500 m. On the road there is a laundry (50 Q for 14 kg).

name: Texaco Gas Station
description:
gas station with toilets,showers and a big parking area

we stayd with our van around 100m away from the street 

also wifi available if you ask in the tourist office next to the store

name: Across from cafe Raíces
description: Free overnight parking across the street from the cafe. Lots of space, even on weekends to park our van. Good view of lake, no one bothered us, and plenty of restaurants and hotels nearby for bathroom and WiFi use. Police drive by a couple times a night but no one ever asked us anything or bothered us.

name: Campground and Cabañas Llanos de Flores
description: Large open grass field in the mountain forests. The campground is signposted on the 175, the access to the place is dirt road with some potholes, 2wd is ok. Nice place and friendly people. If you need electricity and/or toilet or shower, you can ask to get access to one of the cabañas. There are water faucets beside the cabañas. No cell signal. Camping is 25 pesos pp.

name: Hotel Parking Lot
description: We stayed here about a week to go to the Spanish school. It's 50 per car. Warm showers, clean Restrooms and wifi. The parking lot is not very crowded and your just a few minutes away from the market and the schools. But it's not very quiet, even at night. But I don't think any location in town would be.

name: purificadora de aua/ Panajechel
description: we filled up Our canister 20Liter for 10 Quetzal

name: Costom of Guatemala
description:
Exiting Guatemala, You go at immigration, they will stamp yout passport and give you a copie of the stamp, they will remove your sticker of importation, no cost but you need some other photocopy for el salvador border. 
They need a copy of your exit stamp in your passport to cancel your TIP. They don’t have a copier and the copy place (1q per copy) opens at 8:00 am
They copied everything on the spot for free (updated on September 19th, 2019)
---
Border crossing from E.S. To Gua : 1. Checkpoint police a little before border. Checked TIA and called us in at aduana. 2. Drive to Aduana, or DGA, left side of the bridge crossing. They stamp and sign papers. You need a copy of your TIA, best get them prior as there a not a lot of copy shops. The Aduana copied it eventually for us. 3. Walk or drive down to Aduana building, give them the papers as stamped by the bridge. They keep the original. 4. Go to immigration E.S. And do passport. 5. Good to go, drive across the bridge and a little past it. You'll see the building, can't miss it. 6. Go to immigration and get passport stamped/checked. 7. Go to Aduana, give them the copy of your E.S. TIP from the guys at the bridge, your vehicle paperwork, license and passport. They fill out the forms and you need to pay taxes (105q per motor). This is in an opposing booth which opens the following hours: Mo-fr: 07:00-19:00 SA: 07:00-17:00 Sun: 08:00-17:00 Aduanas closed from 1-2 for lunch. ##!! You cannot cross if you don't pay so mind the hours!! ## Note: they don't accept dollars so best get quetzal prior to leaving E.S. or pay a bad exchange fee (1$ to 7Q we payed). Sign some form and wait a little. 8. You get a TIP and a sticker. You don't need to stick it, just be able to show it. 9. Good to go! Took us about an hour to get it all done. Good trip! 
UPDATE: now need to pay 160Q to enter guatemala.

name: Laundry Petenchel
description: Laundry Petenchel in the village of Flores

name: hotel aury
description:
PARAGLIDING village!!! we stop in the village called sansare and we find this hotel beside the petrol station before arrive to the town of sansare. the owner ask 50Q to park overnight but we deal 100Q for 3 night. Nice Guard 24h water and we use the power but didn't ask as owner was not there on the weekend. 

we didn't check the petrol station but you could park there I assume. you could also park by the stadium or the school but should ask the principal first I have been told.

nice secure village with police patrol and no real crime other than drunk people sometime, the local say...

very nice village for it's habitant are really nice and don't see foreigners much, just the odd paraglider pilots like me....

name: soul food kitchen “Gary’s”
description:
Hostel with informal car camping. Gary has a big heart and will take in anyone. 

Offers: 
•rent room 
•pitch a tent or hammock in backyard 
•vehicle camp in gated area

Cold showers and three clean, tiled bathrooms with toilet paper. 

Restaurant menu offers Thai and Indian cuisine. Dinner starts at 6. Restaurant always at capacity due to influx of people staying at neighboring hostel looking for good food. 

30q per night for vehicle camping/tent/hammock

Unsure if price for formal room. 

Follow GPS to given coordinates. 
From main road, take left at driftwood surfer hostel sign (in the shape of a surfboard) follow that road till intersection. Gary’s property and restaurant is only building on corner

name: Aro
description:
Gas station with diesel.
We were relieved to find this on our way into the lake.

name: ASOAVA TOURS
description:
If you book the Acatenango-Tour with this guide for 250 Quetztales (what we can really recommend) you can leave your vehicle in his backyard. We slept there one night for free. Bathrooms are available, it's quiet and safe. Clearance 2,50 m. We loved the tour

Catalino’s phone is +50255004707

name: Chocolate Antigua Artisanal Factory
description: This is a small artisanal chocolate factory. You can see all the fabric process of chocolate and explanations by welcoming people. The visit is free and you can buy those delicious chocolates for half price than in Antigua center. Highly recommended !

name: valvoline mecanics
description:
Good to change oil , filter and engrase , 5,7 liters of oil , precio 450 quetzal , good work . wifi.
a lot of tyre are available here and they are nice .

name: Balancing and Tires
description: Shop for alignment and balancing (and maybe more). Nice equipment. Balancing was 35 per tire incl. rotating.

name: Centro Recreativo Laras
description: Beautiful camp at the Laguna. Private, gated property with (non-private) cold shower, flush toilets and the opportunity to get power with no extra charge. You can park besides the covered shelter. There are barbecues and tables as well. Price for camping is 50 (now 125Q in 2022) per person. You can rent kayaks (100 per hour), lanchas (500 per hour). The friendly owner Señor Laras lives on the property, but if you arrive late, it's best to give him a call 43291409.

name: Crucero Atitlan
description: Beautiful hotel which is still under construction and soon finished. We are staying here with the RV for a month. Peaceful area comparing to the centre. 20mins walk to the centre or 5q by auto rickshaws.

name: Sim card
description: We went to tigo store and bought sim card with internet package with  2gb per month for 160 q. (Cheaper now!)

name: Walmart
description: Super nice Walmart with guarded parking, take ticket to get in but no pay if shopping, also atm working to pick up money . Some limitation on hight entry ,we got in with truck camper

name: Hotel Posada Don Jose León
description: So, we got to the top of the hill from the border at Talisman, and a rest day was called for.  This place looks rather grand and old-fashioned inside, but it has some nice, spacious rooms - we got no 6 at the back, overlooking a sunny, plant-filled patio with tables and chairs.  No problem to put our bicycles in the room, and there’s secure parking at the back.  Parking fine for motorbikes and smaller rigs, but too low for big ones.  There’s coffee at reception in the morning - Nescafé and hot water.  We paid Q250 for a room with a double bed.  WiFi is a bit distant - the router seems to be at reception - so we didn’t use it.

name: Hôtel Fins Resort & Marina
description: very good place for relaxe after many driving day. big room, clean and really Perfect. the pool is very beautifull and personnal really welcomming. good place for fishing trip !

name: Na Bolom restaurant and museum
description:
Frans Blom and Judy Blom ,beautiful Museum of their research and lifework in protecting prehistoric Mayan tribes like the Lacandon ,which where not touched by the colonialism. 
the restaurant, across the street 'jardin del jaguar ' where you have to get museum tickets, has great food and nice atmosphere and is very affordable.

name: goodyear noriega s.a
description: good place for change tire and break  ! the boss foronda its à great expert

name: Finca Tatin
description:
This place was a little bit out of our budget but it came highly recommended so we decided to go and make up for it later, we are oso glad we did. We paid 130Q/night for two, a private room with 2 single beds and shared bathroom. The room with a queen bed was $150Q. Our room was basic but we only slept there. They have shared dorm for 60Q/p. They have much nicer bungalows, some on the river or in the jungle for more $300-450Q/night I believe? Unfortunately all Food is extra, but really freaking good. The breakfast is 30-40Q/person and Lunch is around 45Q/meal, both from a menu. We brought snacks and ate only one meal other than dinner to save some money. The pizza for two for 65$ is the best bang for your buck at lunch. The dinner is 55Q/pp and is a family style meal. (You can ask to not have your meal with everyone) We can sometimes be antisocial but we really loved sitting down and getting to know everyone, the people and food were different every night. You never had to worry about not getting enough. The bread and chimmichurri that comes with dinner is worth it alone. Drinks are also extra. Alcohol was expensive but we smuggled in our own rum 😊. Drinking Water is 3Q for 1L. Out front of the hotel is the river where you can enjoy the sun on the a dock or have fun on the rope swing. Behind the hotel is thick jungle with hiking trails. They have kayak rentals and offered a variety of hiking and kayak tours. We did the hiking on our own, the trails are on maps.me so it was easy. Highly recommend checking out the tiger cave, bring a flashlight. We rented the kayaks for a day and went to Livingston (about 2.5hours) they offer a shuttle back so you don’t have to paddle back up river (for an extra cost, of course). They have a sauna and a hot shower for extra cost, it isn’t much. Cold showers are free 👍 they have a gym and a place to do you own laundry and hang it up, also free. We spent most of our days reading in the hammocks and just enjoying the beautiful scenery and peaceful setting - also for free! 

One final note, the boat from Rio Dulce to Finca Tatin or anywhere on the river is rather expensive. We paid 125Q/p on the way there and 110Q/p on the way back. If I would try and only pay the 110 on the way there. Finca Tatin offers a shuttle for 90q/p but only if they have 6 people, email or call before your arrival and see if they have a boat coming. They have boats to Livingston twice a day so coming or going there is never a problem (not sure of price on that).

UPDATE ON PRICES SEPT 2018: hotel and food prices are all still about the same. Boat to/from Rio Dulce is fixed at 125Qpp each way, whether you get off here or go all the way to Livingston.

name: Cascada termal - hot Spring waterfall  (+informal campsite)
description: Tourist attraction as well as a camping place. Great hot spring waterfall in a nice clear river. Very unique. [updated] They charge 20 pp and 20 for parqueo. Don't miss it.

name: Shell Station
description: We just came from Mexico, so we don't know if this type of gas station is normal here! But this one is great! 24 hour security guard, said it's no problem to stay the night. Very clean bathrooms, parking spots for three rigs. Electricity outlets and water taps with very strong pressure right next to the spaces! Plus a market next door. Sure seems like a easy place to spend a night!

name: el mirador
description:
it's the cooperativa of Carmelita . Here you book the 5 or 6 days trekking to go to El Mirador , La Denta . 
We make the 6 days tour , very wonderfull expérience .
One guide , Enrique , speak spanish , good guide from the small village Carmelita . One cosinera Gladis , good meals every days ...
Very professional and local organisation . We payed 1500 quetzal per person after a good négociation . 
Probably Hard for children ...

name: poptun playground
description: We stay here one night , no problem for us . It's on front of a big playground . there is water . Closed a military area . I ask if it safe ,they say ok . Call them when you arrive to past a good quiet night .

name: Las tres Garifunas
description:
really good and very welcoming staff. the best Pina colada I ever had.
prices : 80 for the tapado. 50 for whole fried fish and rice/beans. Pina colada 25. lemonade 15

name: Calzada Mopan
description: Texaco gas station in the middle of nowhere!  Clean and nice place!

name: Agua Purificado
description: You can buy Garaffones or refill your own containers. Price is 2,40 Dollars per Garaffon.

name: El Vendaval
description: Parking lot of a steak house / truck restaurant. Very noisy BUT showers, water available for free. Restaurant with good wifi too.

name: Comidor Rosalita
description:
Small restaurant in a shack run by a local family. You sit outside, sometimes on boxes. Owners are very friendly and cook traditional food (only one dish available): rice, beans, avocado, salad of cabbage, chicken or on Fridays fish. As a side dish you get a very full basket of freshly made dark corn tortillas (this is a special kind of corn and very delicious). 

Dish with meat: 20Q
Vegetarian: 15Q

You can buy fruits too. Melon for 15Q for example.

This is a very good alternative for all the touristic and more expensive places.

name: African place
description:
hostel with kitchen 
quite and clean 
single 60q
double 120q 
hourly 4hrs 55/70q
