name: parking near cathedral
description: Parking lot of restaurant where you can park for the night. Safe and possible to get wifi from restaurants. Free at day if you eat.

name: Comedor for locals
description: Great cheap local food. 15 GTQ for  a launch. Very nice lady owner.

name: Really nice and unique church
description:
It is the main attraction of the town. This church have a nice facade with painting for indians to understand. 
the is also a Maya church 10 minutes walk uphill. 

interesante linda iglesia con pinturas en su fachada para que sea didáctico a los indígenas. luego más arriba hay otra iglesia pero maya. Si pasan por aquí recomiendo una rápida visita

name: Camping at Rancho
description:
This is a beautiful Rancho that's still in construction. They let us camp for 7.- per night, per vehicle. It's basically just a small, flat area where you can park your vehicle. You may be able to camp further down the road as well and set up a tent there. The lookout is really great and just 50m away. Can get windy up here but the temp is much better to sleep then at the beach. Basic bathroom with toilet. Picknick-Tables and a small shop available. And of course a great view over the bay.
The road is no problem in a 2WD. Maybe a bit of clearance is nice to have.

name: Hotel San Fransisco
description: Basic but clean with secured parking. No hot water but the beds are comfy. Paid 120 qz.

name: Spanish School Casa Rosario
description:
Vicente, the owner, is very special, helpful and friendly. His Spanish school lies in his huge and beautiful garden with direct access to the lake.

After shopping around a lot, we understood this is by far the best place to look for a Spanish class. I personally liked it a lot learning with Rosa, as she's very experienced and knows well how to adapt her teaching depending on the needs and capabilities. 

www.casarosario.com

name: Hospedaje «El Comal»
description:
family House very welcoming held by Remi and Andrea. we arrived here by chance in the heart of San Juan. village much more peaceful and less popular that San Pedro. we parked and slept in our camper 24 feet on the guest parking free subject to consume restaurant where found pizza baked bread and local flavor. top. prices are correct for standing. the hotel rooms are new, misunderstood bedding, hot showers are impeccable. TV, WiFi ... the price of a room is 100 quetzals per person. the amount is negotiable depending on the duration. the father of the owner product coffee bio in the vicinity, it will be pleased to you will guide. really a good meeting in a locality nice filled artists.
---
Maison familiale très accueillante tenue par Remi et Andrea . Nous sommes arrivés ici par hasard au coeur de San Juan . Petit village beaucoup plus paisible et moins prisé que San Pedro . Nous nous sommes garé et dormi dans notre camping car de 24 pieds sur le parking de l'hôtel gratuitement sous réserve de consommer au restaurant où l'on trouve pizza au four à pain et spécialités locales . Top . Les prix sont correct pour le standing . 
Les chambres d'hôtel sont neuves ,incompris la literie, les douches chaudes sont impeccables . TV , Wifi ...
Le prix d'une chambre est de 100 quetzals par personne. Le montant est négociable en fonction de la durée . Le père de du Propriétaire produit du café bio dans les environs, il se fera un plaisir de vous y guider . 
Vraiment une bonne rencontre dans une localité sympa remplie d'artistes 
---
Casa familiar muy acogedora en manos de Remi y Andrea. Llegamos aquí por casualidad al corazón de San Juan. Pequeño pueblo mucho más tranquilo y menos popular que San Pedro. Aparcamos y dormimos en nuestra autocaravana de 24 pies en el aparcamiento gratuito del hotel a condicion de comer en el restaurante donde encontramos pan horneado con pizza y especialidades locales. Los precios son correctos en general.
Las habitaciones del hotel son nuevas, la ropa de cama, las duchas con agua caliente son impecables. TV, Wifi ...
El precio de una habitación es de 100 quetzales por persona. La cantidad es negociable según la duración. El padre del propietario produce café orgánico en la zona, estará encantado de guiarte allí.
Realmente un buen punto de reunión en un lugar agradable lleno de artistas.

name: Hotel Villa Nebaj
description: Nice spot centrally located. 60 Q for two people and van to park in their parking lot and use bathrooms with hot showers. Clean. Fast wifi in lobby.

name: La casa de las mixtas(cheap)
description: want nice view, cheap local food? go here. there are daily menus for 20q with soup main and little dessert with drink. more options too

name: tropigas
description:
we were able to refill our argentinian bottle of 10kg. 
120 quetzales pour 25 libras. 
really fast service

name: Las Brisas auto hotel
description:
"Pay by the hour" hotel, right off CA10 and perfectly located to cross into El Salvador the next day. Each room has its own private garage, so we had secure parking for our motorcycles. Room was nice and clean (at least without a black light).
One night for two people in room with AC : 150q
There was one room without AC for 80q.

name: Camping at Hotel
description:
You can camp in front of a hotel, a few feet from the water. There's a shower and a toilet. Everything is very basic. 100 per night, per vehicle.
The owners can arrange a boat ride to Palacio or wherever you want to go. We paid 500 for a 1-2 hour ride.
This small town is one of the parts of Honduras where only few tourists go.
The road to Batalla is dirt/mud and sand. You should have a 4wd high clearance to get here. Please ask the locals in Bonito Oriental if it's safe at the moment before you go. We drove it in 2 days, about 9h in total but it depends on the road conditions. At the moment the upper road at the beach is closed and you need to drive inland. There are a few junctions on the way. If you like to have the gpx-track please send us an email through Facebook.

name: Casatenango
description:
A lovely hostel in a quiet dead end street, you can choose a common bedroom or a private one with or without private bathroom. 
There is a full equipped kitchen, wifi, living room.
Everything is clean.
Guarded parking lot available for campervans for 25Q/24h.

name: tak'alik ab'aj - mayan and olmec archeological site
description:
really nice archeological park in the jungle. 
one of the oldest mayan sites.
foreigners : 50qtz per adult

no camping possible

name: Cuevas Andá Mirá
description: Spa with pools of sulfur water. Very good place the water gushes out of a cave. From 5 p.m. to 6 p.m. it is free. during the day they charge 10Q x person and 30Q for cars. You can sleep in the parking lot. Excellent site, special to relax after the border

name: castillo de san felipe de lara
description: very beautiful park withcastel from the year 1600. the most beautiful and clean park I have seen in Guatemala. 25Q per person and lots of BBQ area(bring your wood) and plenty of shaded area and delimited swimming area. wish I knew this we would of made it a day even and pic Nik here.

name: NorthQuest gasolinera - truck stop
description:
huge parking lot near gas station for truck stop.
road noise as for every truck stop, but you can park quite far from highway. 
free

name: Turicentro San Jorge
description: Restaurant with pool right by a big football field. There are cold showers and running water restrooms, and the staff is very friendly. No wifi. They let me camp for Q25 a night. Some kids came in the evening to play soccer but they were all very well behaved and friendly. I guess you could fit a big rig in the large parking lot in front of the restaurant but it would be right by the noisy highway.

name: Estación Puma - Chirijuyu
description: Between Guatemala City and Panajachel, we were grabbed by the night and decided to stay here. Ample parking. Station runs between 5 am/9pm. During the night the premises are not very bright but the employees remain in the administration building. Well, it was the best option for the moment. Free.

name: Parqueo Los Ranchos
description: Near of the main street of Panajachel and lake Atitlán. Secure and quiet at night, a little noise during the day. We pay Q 50/night. No big rigs.

name: Supermarket Despensa Familiat
description: Nice place to buy groceries when crossing from Belize. The Tigo shop for SIM card / pre-paid internet is across the street. Several banks to withdraw cash around.

name: Green World Hotel
description:
Decorated in Green. offer a dorm bed for 50Q.
clean.
For bicycle tourists, u can park your bicycle inside hostel. huge spaces for many bikes
but breakfast provided is in tiny portions

name: Ox Expedition
description:
if you are traveling on a bicycle and on Warmshower, u can stay here free for a night. Usual dorm bed cost $10.

They provide tours to the Volcanoes

name: Casa Familiar
description: Hotel in Todos Santos. A bit expensive at 200Q per night, but has friendly staff, good wifi, clean rooms, hot water. There is an empty lot about 5 min walk from hotel. They can also arrange a guide for the many hikes in the area.

name: Servicentro Oil Change
description: Recommended. They have a tall garage, and variety of different oils of all grades, both US and European brands. (Many other mechanics don't have the correct oil and so they try to convince you that it's ok to put a heavier oil in). At least one of the guys here speaks English and is very friendly. We have a Ford van but he says lots of European vehicles come here too.

name: Vista Verde
description: Beautiful place to rest a few days. Fast wifi, pool, restaurant and amazing views. We paid 150Q for a private room. There are dormitories too. the restaurant is not expensive and the staff is very friendly. Possibility to book a trip to Semuc Champey.

name: Da Gas
description: This place looks like a fortress surrounded by walls with armed guards on the ground and walking around the yellow perimeter walls but they are friendly and will allow you to drive in and fill your tanks with propane.   There is a funny little caricature named "Da Gas" on the yellow wall and a big metal sliding door the guard will open for you.   I believe he said the hours are from 9-6 M-F and on Saturday 9-1PM. They offer ACME & POL.

name: Road ends here
description:
If you are trying to go to La Castalia hot springs, don’t go this way as the road ends here. You will get stuck. It is a dirt road not recommended for cars. Very dangerous, steep, and narrow even for 4x4. Multiple cars have gotten stuck down this road needing to be towed out.
…

name: Jenna’s B&B
description: We stayed here for 3 nights - beautiful B&B with epic lake views of the volcanos. Extremely clean and tidy. Great food (healthy options too) and a outside bar to watch the gorgeous sunset. Jenna (the host who grew up in Italy and England) is amazing - she organised and gave recommendations for things to do. Strongly recommend.

name: CDAG Guatemala sport area
description: Outside of the gate, but there is a guard inside all night. Grassy field, near the road but really calm at night. Trees to put your hammock. Great place for 1 night, better than the playground (other overlander spot).

name: CEMACO
description: Home goods store with a small but decent camping section. They sell the 1 Lbs disposable Coleman propane tanks, 2 for 119 Q. Also sell a 4” propane adaptor if you have a refillable propane tank.

name: agua purificada
description: 5 quetzal to refill mt tank of potable water . it'son the same bulding of the iglesia bethel . New and good filtration system of the mountain water. we stay the night in our truck for some quetzal closed here at the hotel el comal. very cool place to stay

name: Start of the hike to Atatenango Volcano sommit
description: It's the start of the hike to this volcan. We take a guide at the association Amigos del volcanos . We hike 2 days , for hours to the base camp .

name: ASOAVA - guía al Volcán Acatenango
description:
We put our 24 feet RV here during the trip with the familial association ASOAVA (los amigos del volcan Acatenango). 
It's a free safe place along the small road , close to the house of Catalino , contact him on whatsapp or by phone at +502-55004707 . Very calm at night , there lights during the night .  Here you paid your trek directly at guides , the half price of Antigua agency , and the association refill some money at the community . We paid 1350 quetzals for 2 adults and 2 childrens (4&6 years old ),
one guide , a horse and the horseman , tickets of parc included , good food of Catalino's wife , good sleeping bag , good tent ,all included ,no bad surprise . 
Nice hospitality on this village . The horn on the morning is the backery car with good bread . Some womens come to sell local food , chuchitos very cheap and very good . You can playing football with the locals , a lot of good times in this small traditionnal village . 
With you want information for the Fuego Tour , ask ASOAVA buy facebook @asoava or buy phone ++502-55004707 , or simple by whatsapp.

name: Naj Tunich Parking
description: Parking space for a visit to Naj Tunich.

name: Naj Tunich Cave - Original one
description: Entrance to original cave. Very nice rock formations. Can’t see original paintings however. Replicas can be seen in a cave nearby.

name: Naj Tunich Cave - Painting replicas
description: Painting replicas from original cave are here.

name: Hospedeja El Rachita Tika’aaj
description:
This is probably the cheapest spot to stay on the whole lake. And the owner was super friendly.
We were able to sleep three in our truck for only 25Q a night. They also have small simple rooms for rent for 25Q per person. 
There are bathrooms and they have showers with the electric warmer so it’s still pretty cold. And it was a great place for our dog to run around and it’s all closed in. We had the whole place to ourselves while there. No wifi but that’s no problem as San Pedro is covered in wifi spots. I’m sure they have electricity for overlanders who need it in we just didn’t use it.
The owner’s name is Chema and if he is not around the tienda next store can get in contact with him and tell you when he will be back. 
Not sure you could fit a big rig in through the tiny road and entry way but any truck or bus there is definitely space. Also tent friendly.

name: Ranchon Los Esclavos
description:
The restaurant owner allows cyclotravellers to camp on their backyard. overlanders too. ample space for parking. 
good food and Wifi

name: Hotel Mansion del Lago
description:
75Q per night, you can stay with your vehicle
Parking for motorcycle or car
You might get cheaper price if you stay more than 1 night

name: Bomberos Uspatan
description: For cyclists: Nice Bomberos for staying the night after hard long rides up the steep hills :)

name: Hotel Pop Wuj
description: Great little hotel with secure parking. Hot water in mornings only. 2 blocks from center square and market.

name: Bomberos Santa Cristobal
description: For Cyclists: Camping possible in the station

name: On road side
description: If it gets late and you are still on autopista 5 (bumpy rocky and slow road) you can pull out here, there are 2 terraces flat and hidden from the  road far away from villages. Past these 2 sites coming from Lanquin the roads become paved. The lower one has a big rocky step to access but it’s larger and more hidden

name: Parkeo san Julian
description:
Parkeo in front of the entry of laguna lachua, 10qz parking, 15qz additional for overnight camping, we ask for a simple dinner eggs with tomato, cheese and and it was 20 qz pp.
Nice grassy area for tents. If you have a tent you can also go to camp into the park on the laguna really nice place to spend the night and see sunrise here the price of the park
FYI price of the park....
Extranjeros entry adults 50 qz, camping adults qz25 pp, room 70qz, 
Entry visitors from 7.00 to 2.30 when you are in you have ta walk 4km to get to the laguna. You have to leave the laguna at 4.00pm to go out . If you camp you can go in from 7.00 to 4.00 
Ps the attach foto is of the laguna NOT the campground

name: Yalambojoch
description: New gas station with diesel too. No gAs until Playa Grande but you can buy from villagers.

name: Garcia a dios - PEOPLE ONLY
description:
Border For PEOPLE ONLY there is migration office but no custom to cancel or issuing a TIP

There is no system for entering/exiting people on the Mexican side.

name: apple inn
description:
basic but big and clean rooms, inner courtyard parking, no wi fi, hot shower,150 quetzales per person. 

3 minute walk to market uphill

name: San Pablo La Laguna
description: Toll to get into town. 5Q per vehicle, you get a dated stamped receipt.

name: Jakuu'
description:
Xtra huuuuge massive plates! Easy to share! I'd say price range is between 20Q-40Q and definitely worth the money. We came here many times and met other people doing the same. Locals and foreigners know how big and delicious their plates are!

Many vegetarian options, vegan too but it's not written. (Their veggie patty is the biggest I've seen!)

Very nice staff!!!! Fast wifi and their playlists are sooo nice. Comfy couches to chill. Pet friendly, but they have a long ninja mama cat protecting her babies > she first tried to kick out our dog and did it with others too haha. She's super sweet with humans tho.

name: Lavanderia
description: Laundry Service 20Q for washing and 35Q washing and drying :)

name: Platform on Autopista 5
description:
Huge place close to highway 5 on a lower level. We asked some locals who played soccer on the upper level if we can camp here. No problem, we had a camp fire, (careful at dry season!) nice sunset and it was quiet at night. In the morning some people from the villages around passed by, all very friendly and curious what we are doing. Also they said it’s a quiet and safe to stay. 
Good place to rest in between this exhausting road.

name: Semuc Champey
description:
Beautiful terrace ponds in a national park. 50,- Q for foreigners, adults and kids the same price. 10,- Q for parking. The parking lot is narrow so no big rigs. 
The hikes in the park are steep, bring good shoes, mosquito repellent and water. Water in the park is expensive, 1/2 liter = 10,- Q. 
Lots of people on weekends or holidays. Officially they open at 7:30 am. We arrived at 6:30 am and said we don’t want to swim, only hiking and taking pictures. They let us in, we had the whole park for ourselves and paid when we left. Open until 6 pm. No dogs allowed. We saw hummingbirds, huge butterflies and a red snake. Don’t know if it was a coral snake which is venomous or a coffee snake which is not venomous.
Recommendation: Bring a lock, to lock up your stuff during bathing!

name: Shell
description:
Great service at this Gasstation. They also have Diesel, if you fill up your tank car wash is free and they did a great job! If you want your Car cleaned underneath what we did it’s only 15,- Q extra. You can also fill up your water tank. 
They check your tire pressure and even cleaned up our puppies poop :-)  Very friendly staff!

name: Lee’s Kayak Rental
description:
Lee, the owner of the hotel also rents Kayaks! We were staying at Pierre’s campground in pasajcap and hiked the Jaibalito trail to Santa Cruz. Then we rented a kayak for 200Q for a double kayak to keep overnight and paddled back to the campground. It’s a bit difficult to store the kayak at Pierre’s without a bit of extra help which we found. Got up for the sunrise and paddled back to Santa Cruz while stopping at Cafe du Mundo for breakfast!

Update 2022: 600Q per day..

name: Police check point
description: Three times this police check point has tried to fine us under false circumstances be careful of giving real documents. We pretend we don't speak Spanish and don't give in after twenty minutes the let us go in frustration.

name: Riverside camping
description: There are a few spots along the river but we like this one because you can pull off the road onto the grass.  Very quiet at night.

name: Local family experience
description: Only house on the road. This is a lovely local family opening their house to travelers. They found us camping on the side of the street and invited us over. They're the sweetest. The idea of putting their home on iOverlanders makes a huge difference for them. 20Q/ person a night. This place is not about money but all about a cultural experience. If you have any carpentry or plumbing skills it can be in a form of exchange. Ask for Juan when you get there. Basic Spanish is needed. Good toilet, great shower, hand washing laundry, parking spot and possibility to camp. Everything to be comfortable. Be aware, pigs and chickens around. Be mindful of the use of water and electricity. Religious family but very open minded. Referred by Gonzalo, Simon, Karolina & Anna

name: Puma gas station
description:
Puma gas station close from 9pm to 5am. Guard at night. No trucks on the parking. Some little noise of the road.

Station Puma. Ferme de 21h à 5h mais gardée la nuit. Pas de camion sur le parking donc calme. En recul de la route, donc pas rop bruyant.

name: Travel agency - local experience
description: A local guy opening his house to travelers. It's a travel agency, but you don't need to book anything with him. 15Q/ person a night. This place has frames of beds so if you have a mat it's the best. He also has space for tents. Acces to toilet, showers and a place to cook. It is not about money but all about a cultural experience. Basic Spanish is needed. Parking spot in front of the place is you need. Everything to be comfortable. Be mindful of the use of water and electricity

name: Licor Marrón - cacao tour, shop, ceremonies
description:
Very beautiful workshop with friendly staff! The cacao tour is short and free. They sell cacao tea, semillas, hot chocolate, bars and more. Everything is made here.

We also did the cacao ceremony and highly recommend it! It is with Anna, her brother and her mother in their very welcoming house. It's a very spiritual private ceremony. It has nothing to do with the one with Keith in San Marcos (which we do not recommend).

name: TaKalik Maja Lodge
description:
Up the road from the Takalik Abaj archeological site is the Takalik Maya Lodge. Camping on their parking lot (under trees, a bit cramped) or on the soccer field. Bathroom available at the reception.

The lodge restaurant is approx. 3 minutes away. And there is a pool and a waterfall at the lodge. A nice place since there's nothing else for campers in this area.

The last 2,5 km road is unpaved and steep but we managed it with our Ford-Transit without 4x4.

name: El refugio
description: Camping and small cabins after the balneario, they charged us 25pp for camping and 50 for cabañas which we bargained down a bit. Fire pit and flush toilets. Two small swimming pools right in front of river. Was quiet and nice for a night. Dont need to pay the 10qtz entrance if going there.

name: Cocina de Rosita
description: Really delicious menu de dia, we got beef with guacamole and rice, tortillas, small soup and a refresco or agua (blackberry water) for only 20qtz. Enter through an internet cafe, homely and very good value

name: Jaguar Gas Station
description:
24,10$/gallon diesel
29,49$/gallon gasolina 

Just when you cross the border from Belize. It’s worth it to wait on the other side ;)

name: Balam Adventures
description: I booked here my 5 days track to El-Mirador And I have to say it was my best decision. Not only the absolute best price you can bossily get, Ronald also helped me to find a safe place for my van while I'm in the jungle, and picked me up there (twice)! staying at the agency (before & after the track) to chill and enjoy the friendly company was a huge bonus as well. Highly recommended!!

name: Cruceo Autopista 5
description: Google maps & maps.me tell you to turn left here but we read many comments, spoke with many locals and even asked the police and we decided to turn right at the turnoff since the road is much better and safe apparently. Police said the road to the left is very dangerous and much longer + there are some road blocks since over a month since people are putting pressure on the government to have more money for schools and higher wages. (UPDATE SEP 2018 - police in Raxruja told us the route 5 to the south is very safe, no problems, just very rough. We did it and they were right! It's ROUGH!)

name: Orchids Cemetery
description: 100qz no services. We didn’t stay there since too expensive and no services

name: restaurant Uaxactun
description: Restaurant next to the AB entrance of the archeological site. Good food. Q25 for breakfast, Q40 for dinner. Huevos de rancho y tortillas de  mano. Very friendly family, safe and quiet (once Wednesday vespers are over at the church next door).

name: soccer field near mercado
description: Not a great spot, but a port in the storm for large rigs prior to or just after the border. plenty of space, no facilities, but across from the market, tiendas and comedors. quiet from 10pm to 5 am then people and buses start arriving. Free

name: Jardin del Rio Ccmalu
description: Nice place with swimming pool, restaurant, shower, toilets, no wifi, facebook: "jardin del Rio Ccmalu". All kind of rigs, no restrictions. River close. There is a separate camping area further away from the road. Ask the owner if it is accessible for your camper, since he should cut the branches.... now 75 q per person, electricity hook up extra 50 per day

name: Hotel Encantade
description: New rooms with great view of volcano Aqua and Guatemala. Perfect breakfast.

name: San Miguel Moto mechanico
description: motorcycle mechanic that can help with all aspects of motorcycle repair including tires and parts friendly and reasonable, very little English

name: Hotel Brisas del Mar
description: Reasonable hotel on the other side of the road to the beach but only 50m walking distance. has a nice pool and safe parking for cars and motorbikes 100 q per night with fan 150 q with air conditioning . like everything here busy on the weekends and quiet during the week. easy walking distance to many restaurants and shops. more of a family place than a party place

name: Hotel Peña
description: Nice and clean family run hotel in the middle of town with secure parking for several cars and lots of motorbikes. 75q for a double room with fan 125q for a three bed room with air conditioning, all rooms have private bathroom and flat screen TV

name: Tay Lu - Chinese restaurant
description: Big plates of freshly made chinese food - very tasty with lots of vegetables. Costs about 40-60Q per plate. Half plares available. Rice has to be ordered extra.

name: Posada Maya Mana
description:
Cheap and simple hostel with a nice and helpful host (Xwuuan/Juan), garden with birds and exotic trees, common kitchen and hammocs. Right across the street from the market where you can buy fresh fruit and vegetables. Kitchen and bathrooms could be cleaner, but they're okay. Walls are thin. Average WIFI is available in every room and in the outside area.

No parking available. Garden has patches of grass which probably can be used for tents. A very gentle white cat lives here. Can be noisy on weekends and on some weekdays when the nearby church calls for prayer with some kind of digital bells very early in the morning (once as early as 5:30 a.m.). A weird sound.

We paid $12,00/80,00Q per night for a double room with private bathroom. Cheap and nice restaurants are close by, a very basic supermarket (Super Q) about 5 mins of walking away. To San Pedro it's about 15 mins of walking.

name: bridge limit
description: bridge limit of 3.5 tons.  we have a Ford E350 and made it withtout problems

name: Tactic, big flat place near the city center
description: Wide and flat area where we stayed overnight and enjoy the village and the market the day after. Not a touristic place, yet enjoyable. An eco center is also walking distance, we didn't visit it.

name: enzo mechanic
description:
Good place for fixing the car or check it,even bikes,especially for vwbus or t3.
If you are travelling into Panamerican.

name: Police control
description: Traffic control. Friendly police men. Wanted to see original documents and asked for money...

name: Panulajaay
description: Swimming pools, bathroom and showers. Swings and slide for children. Advertises camping but we are already camping in San Marcos and didn’t inquire.

name: Lavanderia Marta Julia
description: Lavanderia, 4.5Q per pound, it can even be a bit negotionable if bringing many pounds. Very nice woman. Recommended!

name: Hotel Hacienda la Vega
description: An alternative to the shell gas station: Behind the hotel on a grassy area, with 3 swimming pools. Much quieter than on the Shell gas station. 100 Q for a big rig and 2 people. There is a cable at the entrance that you may have to lift up a little bit, but not a big problem. All kind of rigs. Nice place. We did not ask for further services (internet, shower, etc.), since we did not need it. If you need it, ask them. They may have a shower aside of the pools, electricity, etc.

name: Casa Shalom
description:
Cheap hotel in the center of Nebaj. Big rooms with private bathrooms. Fairly clean. Secure parking lot for small vehicles. WIFI is a little bit slow but okay. Showers are warm, each room has a TV. Traffic noise can be loud, but during night hours it gets quieter.

We paid 100,00Q (~US$ 13,50) per night for two ppl. Great for budget travellers.

name: Not for conventional RVs
description: I have a 5 speed automatic diesel and my transmission overheated going up and brakes faded twice and had to use emergency stopping procedure coming down.   This road has the steepest grade of any road I've traveled in Mexico, Honduras and Guatemala.  If you have a super low manual gear box and have a heavy load, then give it a try but there is no place to turn around on the entire road until you get to the top.   If you can't make it, you'll be backing down the whole way.   I have a heavy load in my RV and diesel powered but maybe you have more power and better brakes than me.   Buenos Suerte.

name: Mi Ranchito Restaurant
description: The man who owns this restaurant speaks very good English and allowed parking here for free if you buy a meal.  It's next to a gas station by a 3 way intersection.   Provided parking was right in front of the restaurant.  There is some music playing in the "game room" across the street and a few kids with boom boxes across the street but everything was quiet by 9:30PM.   There is a guard that stays in the open air restaurant of Mi Ranchito who watches the area after the restaurant closes at 8PM.   Bathroom available in restaurant by request.   No showers and not sure if he would let you use electric but maybe with a tip.  There's wifi by the bar but it doesn't reach far.  You may have to sit in the restaurant unless you have a repeater.

name: Extremely scenic road
description: The road from Agua Blanca westward to where it intersects HW 1, passes through San Manuel Chaparrón and finally meets HW 19 is an extremely scenic route in an area (state or department) that is not that scenic.

name: Bridge under construction - cross river gravel
description: This bridge is being reconstructed and you must deep into the creek bed to cross some gravel.   A very, very steep incline to get back up the bank.   Stay on the gravel road, however, as it eventually re-merges with the paved highway.

name: Volcan San Pedro
description:
here is the trailhead to San Pedro volcano. entrance fee is 100 qtz per person. this includes a guide if you wish to take 1. if you take the guide (without paying more than the 100 QTZ) you can chose to be guided for 25 min only or up to the top. 
I would say it takes 3 to 4 hours to climb and 1.5 to 2 hours to go down. and at least 30 min to 1h of rest at the top. 
for us it was a tough slope. 4 kms length for 1200 m of elevation. so much sores the day after .
but the view was rewarding. and plus you get to see the coffee trees at the beginning of the hike. 
another advice would be to go as early as possible because when we were there morning were always sunny and afternoon cloudy and rainy.

name: Hotel Tzolkin
description: Cheap hotel with safe private parking. Small rooms not very nice but nice little garden. It's ok for one night close to the border. Pets not allowed but hid my cat in the room, no pb. No kitchen, no filtered water offered.

name: centro intercultural
description: 4 museums, we did the ferrocarril one, interested and good guide! parking 10 Q

name: Alice Guesthouse
description:
This guesthouse has a nice parking in the jungle with great view (and monkeys)and can offer you great commodities. Shower/toilets are really nice and clean, you have hammock, badminton and petanque playground, and a really good restaurant. the Guesthouse also has a pier on the lake, really cool ! we paid 80qtz for 2. really nice owners. 
it's also possible to camp in the garden.
however, you should know that the way to arrived at this paradise is quite bad. You may be need a 4x4 for the last 150m and the path is tight.

name: Big rig brake burner
description: This drive is not for conventional RVs.   I boiled my brake fluid while going down this road.   I have a 5 speed automatic but the problem is that the grade is too steep to allow first gear alone to slow you down enough to make the snake-like hairpins, as brake utilization will be mandatory, particularly on the last stretch of the road into Panajachel.   I also carry an infrared "gun thermometer" to check the plates of the rotors.   An additional problem is on the steepest stretch of this road, there is no place to pull out and allow the rotors to cool.   My rotors were at around 500F when the fluid boiled and I lost all braking capability but luckily at a location at the very bottom of the hill when they completely went out.   A few minutes more the the damage would have been horrible.  What I do through Guatemala while descending extremely steep grades that the transmission with not slow enough is to stop every 5 minutes and check the rotor temps.   As they reach near 400F, I allow them to cool down into the 180F or so which takes normally 10-15 minutes.   Then I begin the descent again, stopping every 5 minutes and rest and cool again as I approach 400F.   A normal transmission will not slow you down enough to make the hair pin turns on such a steep grade.   So if you decide to take this road, proceed with caution.  (Note that the road down into San Marcos is ever steeper.)

name: Sunday Market
description: Very lively Sunday market here.   Fresh beef from Saturday is sold at markets on Sunday.

name: Family House / Casa de familia
description:
Family house with a grassy parking lot (some parts flat). Space for big rigs and tents. Pets allowed. Water available on site. 50Q per car (not per person). So muuuuch cheaper than the campings in El Remate and Tikal (which are 40Q/50Q per person). Excellent location if you want to visit Tikal (just 3km away on route). As this is a family house, it’s better to let the owner (Jorge) know before coming (in case he is not there at the moment). His number is: +502 46573247. Very nice people! Highly recommended! 

Casa de familia con parqueo verde (algunas partes llano). Espacio para campers grandes y tiendas de campaña. Mascotas permitidas. Agua disponible en el sitio. 50Q por auto (no por persona). Mucho mas economico que los campings en El Remate o Tikal (donde cobran 40Q/50Q por persona). Ubicación perfecta si quiere visitar Tikal (a solo 3km). Como es una casa de familia, es mejor avisar antes al dueño (Jorge) por si no se encuentra en ese momento. Su numero es: +502 46573247. Muy buena gente! Muy recomendable!

name: Barberia Elegancia
description: Cool and professional barbershop. 20Q for a 30mn cut with great result. Cool deal!

name: Big Rig Brake Burner
description:
The wrecker owner who had to tow me down this mountain says it is the steepest in all of Guatemala which could extend to all of Central America, as the elevation drops over 1000 Meters (3000') in about 7 Km (4 miles).    I would say this is not for conventional motor homes (not my Sprinter based 5 speed automatic) and perhaps best only for either very light campers or for the "full camper" rigs build on an army truck chassis.   At minimum you will need a standard shift with a super low gear, as 1st on the automatic simply will "run away" on this hill if you are a heavy camper.   Of course my rig is heavy with a full camper body and supplies on board.   

You choose your own margin for error on this drop but remember that the "brake burn out lane" is to go off the cliff.   So in case you need help, you can contact the only tow truck in the vacinity, listed below.  (At bare, bare minimum, I'd stop and cool the brakes at any opportunity, which you will find is only about 3 pull-outs with only a few feet off the road.)   

Otherwise, no problem in a conventional vehicle.   As always, only periodically give the breaks a few pumps to slow you down and don't ride them.   I use an infrared thermometer wand and I stop and check my brakes around every 5 minutes on steep grades down.   Brake fluid boils around 500F if I am not mistaken.

P.S. The name of the village at the bottom of the mountain is "Foot of the Slope".   This should be a clue if you are keen on taking them.

Taller y Guras Sanchez
5769 3129  or 5720 5737
San Rafael Pie del la Cuesta, San Marcos, Guatemala

robertosanchezgrua@hotmail.com

"Beto" Sanchez has one worker who knows a few words of English, otherwise only Spanish.   Quality of the tow was excellent, however the non-negotiable price of $200US was a bitter pill to swallow.

name: View on the Fuego
description: We hiked Acatenango by ourselves without a guide. It is possible, just make sure you have enough water, food, good equipment and map! The campground is very new and has a crazy amazing view on Fuego volcano! Valeriano can be reached in Soledad, there in the shop you can ask for him or in the café. He can give you a guide too or rent tents, sleeping bags anything basically... Only thing to bear in mind is that the area is high, so not many trees live there, and the few that do are cut by Valeriano or the other camp site owners for construction and fire wood. We know how terrible this is, they do not. So if you can bring with you already cooked food or raw stuff, torches and warm cloths so you do not need to burn the last pieces of the natural forest. Enjoy the volcanp it is breath taking!

name: Servicios Generales San Antonio
description: David an Jorge do a perfect Job, if you have motor problems along this frequented road. We mistakenly were filled at the Puma gasoline station opposite with Diesel (watch out, it happens there: ( ) and they just cleaned up everything in no time and at a very low cost. Highly recommended

name: laguna Chicabal - road to the entrance
description: just a few meters before the point iOverlander , to the left when you come from Xela. it's the road that goes to the entrance of the lake Chicabal. might need a 4x4 to go there (you can call one - there are phone numbers on advertisements here - price depends on the number of passenger ) you can walk too - 4 kms -  it climbs a lot. at the entrance of the park you need to pay 50 qtz entrance fees. 10qtz for parking and 15qtz if you want to camp. then you need to walk / climb another 1 or 2kms ? to go to the mirrador or you can pay for a 4x4 ride  . it was super foggy cloudy in the afternoon but still very mystic

name: Parking lot by the water
description: There are parking spots by the water. Some are long enough for long vehicles. It get noisy at night because the restaurants across the street play loud music. Free.

name: Shopping mall Pradera
description: Big shopping mall with lots of stores. Cell phone stores etc.

name: Merfisa: tech servicios, eléctrico y industrial
description:
Our windscreen wipers broke mid-downpour and we stumbled across this place going to another taller on iOverlander. 

They seem to do repairs to anything electrical (not just vehicle electrics). 

They tested the motor was working and were able to fix the main arm that moves the wipers so pretty handy guys.

We also asked about some electrical issues we had inside the van (severed cable in Mexico). We'd previously hunted all over San Cristobal for a junction box to no avail but this chap had them. 

Costs: 180Q for repair of the windscreen arm (about an hour) + repair the cable and included about 10Q of spare electrical parts.

name: Lekaf Restaurant
description: This is essentially just a restaurant but it is BEAUTIFUL! It was a greatly welcomed stop after driving through the border. It is just off the main road as you enter Huehuetanango - it has a large parking lot for RV parking. It had amazing food... awesome wifi, exquisite toilets. We had a breakfast here which includes free coffee, water, a complementary bowl of quinoa type porridge with a homemade cinnamon biscuit... breakfast for two shared was 45Q - pizzas from a stone baked oven were incredible from 50Q to 120Q, also great burgers around 45Q and the soups amazing too around 25-30Q. Also the teaaaaas! Haha we spent a lot of time at this place as you can tell but it was a great place to hang out and do life admin and eat amazing food! Highly recommended

name: VR gas estación Lanquin
description: Found this gas station with not much space at the end of Lanquin, they let us park our van with no problem for 20Q for the whole day and night while bathing in Semuc. There are bathrooms with no showers and a little restaurant open till 21:30. Quiet at night! Don’t think they allow more than 2-3 van though.

name: Road 5
description:
Very bad road.
UPDATE: no road Block on october 23th.


They’ve blocked us with the rope and asked for 100Q..give them 2 apples and some bread.
More than 2 hours in a rocky bumpy and narrow road.
Very scenic though. I wouldn’t do it again.
 watch out, risk to flat a tire or break your car touching the ground with the body etc..

name: Radiodores Portocarrero
description: Excellent radiator repair in Puerto Barrios, quote possibly the only thing worth visiting in the area. Theyoung woman that runs the show with her husband is Brenda, charged only 100 quetzals for an awesome job in fixing a leaky radiator. Took a bit of time as mine had a few leaks needing repair but cant beat the price! Brenda also speaks English, Spanish, French (I think) and learning Chinese so pretty good place to explain the situation in your mother tongue!

name: Agua Caliente
description: Free hot springs. Beside the water. Restaurant isnt anything much but swim is nice.

name: Stickers Shop
description:
Stickers Shop in Coban staff very helpful and friendly. Good job.
Deux Bretons autour du monde

name: Orsan fuel station
description: No ripoffs here, they even point at the 0 before they start.

name: Dejavu hostel
description: We parked in front of this hostel and were allowed to use their showers for 30p per person per shower:) slept well in van! Streets are tiny and pavements high, so navigating, turning and especially parking can be tricky. If you have a big rig, beware!

name: Marea Roja
description: Good restaurant with a big parking. They allowed us to park our motorhome for free in front of the restaurant, with security, water and bathroom. Closed at 7pm, but we could slept inside. And they invited us to a coffee. Very Nice!

name: Posada Ixchel
description: Lovely, small hotel. We visited it by bicycle and we could take the bikes in our room. Very friendly hosts.  We payed 120 Q for 2 persons. Above our bed a mosquito net was attached. We could buy drinking water there. Opposite there is a nice cafe and a restaurant ans nearby a small ship. The bus to Tikal picked us up directly in front of the hotel.

name: SPDA Pro Car
description:
Good mechanic who was quicker and cheaper than he’d originally thought he’d be! Finally a mechanic in central america who does not consider us a walking bag of money ;) he helped us with a leak in our overheating radiator. He can do electrics too.

Coordinates are not exactly right, it’s a bit more uphill.

name: San Pablo
description: Private cattle ranch with a restaurant included. Cheese and cream for sale. Owners will set you up for camping.

name: Tujaal
description: Nice little hotel beside the river. We payed 100 Q for 2 persons. Our room  (#1) with view to the river. Clean and simple. Very friendly staff. We are here by bicycle. When we arrived we had a 1 liter bottle of gallo beer(15 Q) and they served us a salad with tomatoes, cucumber, lemon and black salt, which is a speciality of the region, for free.

name: on the street
description:
Llegamos de noche y el parqueadero estaba cerrado. Decidimos quedarnos en la calle y la verdad el lugar es super tranquilo y seguro. Pasamos 3 noches.
We arrived at night and the parking lot was closed. We decided to stay on the street and the place is really quiet and safe. We spent 3 nights.

name: on the street banrural
description:
Dormimos y dejamos aqui el motorhome mientras fuimos a conocer Semuc. Seguro y tranquilo por la noche. Durante el dia hay mucha gente.
We slept and left the motorhome here while we went to see Semuc. Safe and quiet at night. During the day there are many people.

name: Cacahuatal - La Casa Del Chocolate
description:
Artisanal Chocolate products, Natural foods store and Cafe in Livingston.
Fabrica de chocolate artesanal, tienda y cafe. 
Local, Ecologico y Saludable
133 Calle Marcos Sanchez Dias, 18002-Lívingston, Izabal, Guatemala

https://cacahuatal-chocolate-garden.business.site

name: Myro Fotocopias
description:
If you need photocopy for the Police campground ;)
6 copy for 1,2QZ
Nice guys!

name: Pink house
description: Very nice little "hostel" located at the beach of lake Atitlan. They have 3 rooms and one shared bathroom, a corner with a cosy couch and a well equipped kitchen with a fridge, an oven a coffee machine and a toaster. We payed 200 Q for a double room. The owner was very friendly and everything was really clean. You can reach the place on a small gravel road along the lake. May be it is possible with a big rig, but we were here with our bicycles. We can absolutely recommend it. You can make a reservation in Booking.com. You find it under pink house.

name: Puma
description: This gas station has ultra low sulfer diesel. (for sprinters and other american/Canadian diesel vehicles)

name: Lago de Amatitlán
description:
There's another Lago spot which was on the other side and a little out the way for our journey to Antigua. We just drove down to the side of the lake that we had easier access to. 

The road isn't too bad - just a typical off-road CA track. Stunning views on the way down, especially at sunset. We meandered through this area and some access to the river is blocked as private property but we found this huge flat area by the lake. There's only a ranch to the side and a football pitch. Completely wild camping and no facilities - it's a nice quiet spot near the lake for a pleasant stop off, a little rubbish scattered around and the lake doesn't seem that inviting to take a dip or swim in. The river actually had a lot of white scummy pollution which was quite odd to see. 

We wouldn't suggest going out your way to this spot but if you want a stop over away from the (sketchy) town near by then we'd recommend as remote, spacious and nice views.

name: Opposite 'Tienda Sagrado - Corozon' green line of shops
description:
Parking area opposite a few shops and next to a basketball? playing field. We didn't quite make the border and needed somewhere to park for the night. We asked a woman selling street food across the way and at a tienda if it was okay to park up for the night and it seemed legit. 

Literally next to the main highway so not ideal but a wide space to park away from the roads edge. Suitable for a pre-border overnight.

name: Maya Pedal
description: Nice little Hostel with amazing projects with old bicycles

name: Volcanoes guide
description: Carlos is a young well known guide of the area. Super nice, interested in his guests and knowledgable about the Maya culture and traditions. He can guide you on hikes to the forested surroudings of the lake and to volcan Atitlan. you can find him at the cevicheria Ixchel or call him on +502 3173 5434

name: Quick Clean
description: Laundry in the center of Ixobel. 8am to 1pm and 2pm to 5pm.

name: La Bruja
description: Amazing vegetarian/vegan burger place with smoothies too! Frederico a guy from Argentina runs it and loves what he does! The courtyard is amazing! We got the bean burger with the side of salad and his chimichuri sauce was amazing on the salad! It is worth your money 110%!!!

name: San Bruno vet
description:
Friendly vet that speaks English. 
Gave us a health certificate in Spanish and English, but that was really pricy (400,00 Quetzal)

Other medicine we needed for our dog were cheap.

name: Puma Gas station
description: They tried to make us pay 100 qz more by pressing some buttons on the terminal. Not saying you shouldn't fuel up there, just be that extra little bit careful. The way they acted when I told them that the price is not correct (since the amount of gallons was not displayed) it seems like they play this regularly.

name: Mi Casa en la Playa, El Paredon
description: Great camp spot for tents or small cabins to rent.

name: The Clover bar
description: Really nice bar with happy hour everyday from 5pm to 8pm and all night long on Saturday. 2×1 cuba libre for 15 Q. Beer is 18 Q. Great food with big porcions and a lot of veggie options. About 35 - 45 Q the dishes. Nice terrace with a view on lake. Super nice owner. We spent all our nights here. It's not a only a gringo bar, there is a lot of locals here. To conclude we loved this place! :)

name: La virgen del rosario
description:
This is a Catholic institution with a secure parking lot, big enough for middle-sized rigs (we have a 24 ft. camper) It is in Zona 3, 15 min walking distance from the city centre. The administration opens a room with a basic shower and toilet. 100 Quetzales a night. Not perfect, but for Xela it was our best bet.
There are sometimes events at weekends during which they don´t accept overlanders...

name: Entrance to Las Marias K'an-B'a (cave tour)
description: Just before going over the bridge, you keep going straight to the water caves. Really cool place. While holding a candle to light your way, you walk, climb, swim and jump all through the cave. We went on a Sunday when there was a big tour group inside. It was unfortunately really crowded at times which sort of took away from the magic of it all. But still 100% worth it!! 60Q per person. You can do tubing after for 10Q as well (still accurate 08/2021). There's a rope swing too.

name: Fundacion Clinicas Maya
description: Clinic in San Marcos. Spanish speaking. We got by with our minimal Spanish and Google Translate. 100Q for consultation with doctor. We paid an additional 125Q for a med injection, tincture, and natural Mayan remedies. Patient and professional staff.

name: Texaco
description: Texaco with clean toilets and showers! Just bought gas, did not stay overnights.

name: Parque Nacional Naciones Unidas
description:
A nice small national park just outside Guatemala City. Spending the night can be arranged in the office-building next to the parking-spot. Calling ahead is useful (5651-4645 or 5651-4825)
As usual: Crowded on weekends,  quite empty during the week, nobody staying the night except us. Very safe, 24h Guard. 30 Quetzales pp for the night. We always left during the day for rock-climbing (awesome climbing spot at Lago Amatitlan 10 min drive away), otherwise its 12 Quetzales pp extra to spend the day. Lots of picnic-tables, bbq-spots, toilets, and even a cold shower you can use after 5pm (ask the guard where it is).

name: Quesería Lácteos Xelac with Good Cheese
description:
Here you can get very good quality cheese for a very good price. Cheaper than in a supermarket and much better. Tilsiter, Appenzeller, Emmentaler, Gruyére... Also Yoghurt, Butter, Milk, Creme and much more
www.lacteosxelac.com

name: Casa Girasole
description:
If you need a place to relax and enjoy all the comforts while in the beautiful Antigua this is the place. 
We book this place cause of the free secure parking (very difficult to find car park in Antigua) & hot shower. 
You literally get the full apartment for yourself!  
You can book through booking.com/ Facebook / airbnb etc... of course of you book directly with them the price will drop. This place get fully booked pretty easy! 
Price around 50 USD per couple (breakfast included) 
FB: Casa Girasole Antigua

name: Casa Gracia
description:
Beautiful place in the country side just 20 minutes outside Antigua!
Welcoming host. Clean rooms. Hot water. Fast wifii. Fully furnished kitchen. Modern house. Close to bus stop that run every 15 minutes to Antigua. Car park available inside the property for 1 car only.
Eve, the owner of the house she an artist and a wonderful host! She leaves between here and the US so she might not be here when you come. She will replied to your text whenever she is. 
She made us a special price cause we stayed  4 nights (25 USD a night for the 2 of us in a private room + bathroom) 
She will share with you her garden products and all her stories about Guatemala, the place where she really feels at home! 
She speaks currently English & Spanish. 
If she has the car park available she will be happy to let you sleep in your vehicle / tent and charge you a little to use bathroom & kitchen. 
Please try to whatsapp her before your arrival
Eve : + 1 (617) 417-3317

name: Trail to Indian Nose: banditos
description:
11th March 2019, British backpacker was found dead here, after days missing. more details in comment section.

On this path (from San Pedro) to the Indian Nose viewpoint there are 'banditos' active.

On my way in crossed into 2 young boys. Without asking, they will guide you to the viewpoint of Indian Nose. Like 20 minutes before reaching the top, they will stop for a break and announce to wait for some friends. One of the boys went into the bush for about 3 minutes, probably to imform his 'friends' they catched a tourist.

If you will wait, there is a big change you will be robbed by men with big machetes.

I was able to find an excuse to leave (going for a pee -> run!), but there are multiple stories of people getting robbed.

You can try to walk to Indian Nose with a tour guide or doing it yourself. But be aware when seeing see kids.

name: Dr Samayoa - Dermatologist
description:
Excellent English speaking dermatologist. 
I went to him as highly recommended by several expats living in Antigua. No appointment schedule, just arrive and wait your turn. Opens at 10:00hrs for mornings and 15:00hrs for afternoons (no afternoon on Weds). If you want to be seen first, wait outside the door about 20-30 mins before opening. Charges around Q200 for initial consultation/check-up + whatever treatment is required (prices reasonable). Accepts credit cards.

name: Salto de Chilasco ticket office
description:
A lovely short (3km each way) walk to Chilasco Waterfall (allegedly) the highest in Central America, over 130m high. This spot is the ticket office. The guy is not always there, but ask the locals and he will come. 35Q pp. Optional guide 50Q. Horses also available to rent. 

There are no signs to follow, and as yet it's not on maps.me or Google maps, but it's easy enough to find & follow if you know enough Spanish to ask directions (just say "cascada?" and they will point). Trailhead is 2-3km from the village. Hike is then 3km very pretty scenery but steep and very muddy if it's been raining. Very worthwhile in the rainy season when the fall is in full flow. Not sure what it looks like in the dry season - might be only a trickle, but it's a nice little hike anyway.
  
We arrived in the village too late to do the hike, so the guy kindly found us a local family with park-up space in their garden so we could do the hike next morning.
 
On the hike, there are a couple of miradors/rest-area spots with long-drop toilets where you could pitch a small tent if you want to camp out in the jungle for a night.

We have uploaded a 360-photo to Google Maps if you want to check out what you will see.

name: Hotel El Olvido
description: Beautiful cabins and campsite in the Las Minas mountains of Guatemala

name: Adra Hostel
description:
Adra Hostel is a really good location to stay few days or weeks. There are dorms with comfortable beds, lock boxes for your stuff. You can relax in the patio with a good coffee or cocktail. There are games, showers, bar, restaurant, all equipped and the price is not expensive.
There are two private rooms, each with five beds. 
Owners are from Guatemala, they speak English, Spanish, one speak French and the staff speaks english and spanish the bartender speaks French also. 
We enjoyed our stay there ! 
Pet friendly 
Wifi
Parking (cost) 
Electricity

name: UNO gas station
description: Large lot to park and sleep overnight. Large trucks on the stone lot on one side and smaller vehicles on the opposite side made it quieter than other places. Open all night. Access to a bathroom - free (just ask gas attendant for the key).

name: Cocori Lodge
description: Cute hostel with showers, bathrooms, the panda pond ( salty pool) voley ball  court, hammocks in front of the ocean, restaurant, bar, kitchen use, surf lessons and rentals. Price now 50Qpp.

name: Buga Mama
description: great food on the balcony overlooking the port. this is a community project training local youngsters in the catering & hospitality industry. they did a great job, prices are reasonable for the quality. nice Thai curry & lobster. project is worth supporting

name: Hot spring Santa Marta
description: Nice grassy área to camp next to a hot water pool Q20/ $2.50 per person

name: Comida Estercita
description: Stopped here - 30Q for the breakfast options (though not written on the menu - so ask) and then I had a steak for 40Q that came with rice, lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber, etc. Have come back twice now. Not bad as everyone has been posting about the cost of food around this tourist area.

name: Texaco none potable water
description: Best pressure we got in a long time. For free, easy, bring your own hose. Fill up for the week before heading to Police car park !!

name: Texaco fuel station Chichicastenango
description:
Texaco gas station with big parkinglot.
 We paid 50q for  2 overnight parking.

name: Bridge fees
description:
Update: she won’t take less than 50q.

To exit or enter Guatemala you have to pay a bridge fee. Make sure you have the right money for this. We heard from other travellers that it's 20q so we saved 20q to exit the country. Turns out that larger camper vans (like us at 6T) cost 30q, cars are 20q (they showed us the official charge sheet). After much discussion they let us off with 20q. This does not seem to be a scam. These are uniformed officers taking a toll fee, at a proper road barrier and you get a receipt for the money.

name: River Crossing to Cataratos los Amates waterfalls
description:
If you come along the rough 4x4 dirt road from Pasaco to the southwest, this road ends at a foot bridge and a deep rivee crossing.  Depending on rains it can be 6' deep and a foot of mud on the bottom.  Not passable if it's rained much lately.  

The waterfalls are a 1 km hike from this point.

name: Cascades Cataratas Los Amates (El Niagra)
description:
Some camping at a waterfall complex, fairly tall with a few pools for swimming.  The road here can be muddy and rough in the wet season.  

Camping area has a few flat spots and is fenced but not secured.  We didn't pay, but I've heard they sometimes collect a fee here.  

Ask in town if you can't find the entry road, as it is a bit hidden and google maps doesn't know about it.

name: Museo Balam
description:
Very small museum with artefacts from the local area (Pre-Hispanic to modern times). 
Also a small collection of photos & musical instruments. 

Fortunato, the creator of this museum is a very interesting person. He’s now retired but was the first Mayan from Todos Santos to become a certified teacher. He has a very good knowledge and understanding of ancient and modern Guatemalan history and is very willing to share it. (We are not sure if he speaks English). 

40Q per person. 

Please be respectful and remember that this is a small “museum” that he has created in his own home. It is much more about the cultural experience than the museum itself. 

Highly recommended.

name: Small restaurant with huge parking lot
description:
Restaurant with huge truck stop. We stopped at the back, very far from the road and the trucks.

Good meal at the little restaurant : 20 Q / plate (chicken or beef / rice / verdura).

Toilets 
Shower
Tv where there are hammocks.
Possibility to refill water at the fausset before leaving.

25 Q / night / vehicule. + 25 Q / day / vehicule

Super nice family at the restaurant running the area.

Perfect for our first stop after the border, going to the bank, buy tigo cards for the phone and go to the market.

Arrivals at the market are on Friday !

name: Restaurante Ernesto
description: We asked to the restaurant's owners if we could camp across the street in a beautiful grass field next to the lake and they agreed. We paid 40 quetzales for 2 (NOW: 25Qpp). WiFi ok at the restaurant but not that great on the camping spot. Restrooms and cold shower available too. It was really nice and peaceful during the night.

name: San Lucas Toliman
description: Quiet spot, for small vehicles and tents, lots of locals during the day, no amenities.

name: Cafe Ache
description: great place, great crepes sweet and not sweet (ham, chicken fish etc...) AND the best Mojito we ever had!!! Owners are super nice!!! Prices in the low, mid range and totally worth it... what a feast!!! Unfortunately only open from Friday to Sunday.... I would go there every day!

name: SHELL STATION
description:
Refilled the camper with water from here. Good pressure ! 
Huge place to park and maneuver.

name: Place on church
description: Nice and quiet place during the night in front of a church. Very nice view over the landscape.

name: Hotel Rest Brisas del Mar
description: Prob the best option to stay before crossing. Got toilets showers and pool for 50 (for the 2 of us). Huge door, and quiet. What more do you need? And the food is good and cheep.

name: Kabana don Santiago
description:
Big restaurant with WiFi and very good meals.
25Q/plate (pollo or bistek de res or (poivron (Rory I forgot the English and Spanish name) + rice + salad or patatoes salad (the day we came : 23/10)

Very affordable and tasty ! 
We appreciated it on the way to Guatemala City.

Just facing the huge uno gaz station.
Super clean toilets and nice staff

name: DUNLOP TIRES
description:
Huge and well furnished place.
Only place we found the trailer tires. 
Competent staff and affordable prices.
And moreover we found what we needed which wasn’t the case until here !

name: Aqua Nissi
description:
Purificadora de Aqua.
you can get water in garafon or directly whith your hose.  price is 7 Q for 18 Ltr.

name: Pura Vital
description: 10q for our 23l tank. Friendly and quick

name: Zunil-public parking
description: Looks like a free public parking lot, at least there was nobody around asking money and nobody told us to leave. Local church has nice facade and you can visit Mayan saint - San Simon in the market (he is drinking and smoking!). Girl was asking 5q for entrance. Don't ask about him in the church, they will not be happy. Zunil town is not big rig friendly, lots of narrow cobblestone streets full of people and cars.

name: Soccer field
description: Soccer field, no amenities, calm at night, access through a dirt path from hwy, no 4x4 needed, you just need to get through a shallow ditch. We were partially hidden behind a corn field. It's not the prettiest spot due to an old dump (getting overgrown by grass) and lagoon, but you can choose the further corner. Good spot before ascending the volcano.

name: Cocorí Lodge
description:
Cocorí Lodge Monterrico is beach front adventure lodge based in a yellow and green coconut plantation reservoir. 

With more than one hundred meters of beach front along the pacific coast of Guatemala, our place is the best way to experience our sandy black beaches in the privacy of a natural retreat. We offer more than 10 in house sports and activities, surf and SUP tours and delicious meals with fresh ingredientes. 

Live the experience of the sunrise, learn to surf, rent a SUP, travel the guatemalan coastline in search of the perfect wave, check the amazing mangroves and its fauna, release sea turtles or just chill around in our hammocks or bar, enjoy of a bonfire night or just relax and take in the view.

name: Cocorí Lodge El Paredon
description:
Cocorí Lodge El Paredon is beach front lodge based in a the first surf town of Guatemala. Our spot, directly located in front of the most constant beach break of our country will guarantee your surf experience.
The town has small restaurants, bars and hotels that keep the vibe and intercultural experience. We offer a full surf school, boards and equipment, and guides that will lead you to the wave you are searching. 
In our playground lodges you´ll find more than 10 in house sports and activities, delicious meals with fresh ingredientes prepared by friendly local staff and volunteers. 
Live the experience of the sunrise, rent a kayak or paddleboard to explore the mangroove, release sea turtles or just chill around. Our Panda Pond is a landmark where you will surely enjoy a good tan as well.

name: Showers in Hospedaje Santo Domingo
description: This place offered me hot showers, for 5q.

name: Shortcut
description: Shortcut to San Andres Itzapa. High clearance and 4x4 needed in some places, rutted and probably very slippery when it rains. Road winds through corn fields, you'll meet farmers with horses.

name: Car/Motorcycle Mechanic Syncro Servicios
description:
Car / Motorcycle Mechanic shop that specializes itself in BMW, but they can fix pretty much everything. I had a broken gasket in my BMW motorcycle and they even explained me how to fix that in the future in case that would happen again. They can organize cheeper parts, very helpful and understanding. I don't think you can find a better place in Guate Ciuadad.
The place is run by Markus and Johann, they are speaking Spanish/English/German/Italian.
I left less money than for spare parts for my GS.

name: Markusplace
description:
Informal camping spot next to a garage. 
10$/night for camping under a roof.
Cold shower, toilet, USB plug from solar panels.
TIGO 3G/LTE reception.
Great views at the hills. Small shop few minutes before the spot.
Call Markus +502 52020545 before coming to make sure that the guard knows about that.
Honk/nock at the gate steel when you arrive.

name: Hotel Fran-Pab
description: Nice hotel 1-2 km outside Santa Eulalia. Parking space for motorcycle and cars (Landcruiser size or smaller). Slow wifi. Restaurant (did not use). 80 Q/pers. Private bathroom and hot water in the morning/evening at specific hours

name: Volcano views B&B
description:
Very relaxed and one of the cheapest places in Antigua. 130q for double room, shared bathroom, other options available. Shared kitchen, free tea and coffee, breakfast optional, upstairs patio with bbq, hammocks, benches. Weekends get busy, but during the week you might have the house to  yourself. We had hard time leaving. The owner is young Irish learning Spanish. It is 2km from city center, walkable, but the bus leaves from the corner of the house. Parking is very limited, we fit our Xterra into the yard after little tight manoeuvering. Bikers and cyclist would fit alright. Pet friendly. Seems like a safe neighborhood, I would leave the car on the street next time. Look for corner house #41, there is no sign.
It is listed on Booking.com, phonecalls are prefered, call Shane +50 254 500 072.

name: Ben Dinat Restaurante
description: This is a really good restaurant run by super nice people! You will get an Italian atmosphere with breakfast and traditional italian dishes, for example a really delicious lasagne! The prices are reasonable. The chef speaks english and also german (what a surprise!) and learned cooking in Europe.

name: Hostal Paraíso Escondido
description:
This Hotel belongs to the same owner as the Restaurant and is also really good. We paid 110 Qz for two people/one room with a TV, Wifi, hot shower and safe parking. Gate is closed from 10 pm to 8 am but you can speak with the lovely owners if you want to leave or get back in between these hours. There are also some birds you can watch. We liked our stay here and can only recommend this place! 
If you have a big rig you won’t fit in the parking spaces next to the rooms but the restaurant has a parking space where you could park.

name: Auto Check
description:
Super clean and furnished garage with really nice workers.
We went just for a check of the breaks (150 Quetzals) and they fixed a leak they saw at the same time for free and added a liquid to stop the more oxidation/rust under the pick up.
Definitely recommended !

name: Texaco gas station
description: Free parking for customers, clean bathroom (toilet seat, paper and soap), guard on duty, he told us it's not a problem to stay overnight. Pretty quiet at night, only downside were buses honking horns early morning. Sign said camping is available too, but we haven't seen where, maybe behind the building.

name: Clinica Hermano Pedro
description: Doctor Dany Mogollon, pediatrics 150 qtz loved the way he treated our son! Studied in Italy. Calle 6 6-34 zona 2 Solola +50250176206

name: Parking spot before the dirt road to Lanquin
description: Small parking next to the restaurant, a good place to park if you don't want to do the dirt road to Lanquin. They charge 50Q per day, we bargain it to 30Q. It is secured with a gate

name: Estacion De Servicio Texaco / Texaco Fuel Station
description: Fuel Station. Very friendly staff. Super quiet at night. Free. we spent one night here.

name: Fuel Station SHELL - Free
description:
You can spend the night here.
- wide space.
- clean bathrooms
- very nice staff
- wonderfull view
- very cold at night
- safe

name: Almelsa pneu big rig and all véhicule
description: Big stock of tire all types and if they do not have in stock they order from Mexico. Past the big black gate and ask the guards.

name: Land Rover Specialist
description: Awesome Landy shop.. perfect English and a big garage with full diagnostics, parts and great knowledge.  Ask for Andres

name: Hotel Jere
description: Nice hotel with parking for motorbike and small rig (van, SUV, Defender). Clean room with private bathroom. Hot water. Medium-good wifi in some area, but doesn’t reach into some rooms. 100 Q, 1 person. 150 Q for two.

name: Agua purificada veredita
description: Agua purificada for  6 Quetzal the Gafron.

name: agua purificada
description: Here you can fill your bottle of water 3Q for 10L.

name: Balenero camp
description:
Camping option at a balenero approximately 40km from the border with Mexico. Basic facilities but friendly guy running the place who charged us 5Q pp/pn. We are by bicycle and pitched our tent under one of the roofs.

Many covered BBQ areas further down the hill (and therefore further from the road) with seating and space to park a rig or motorcycle. Swimming also available but I guess you would pay additionally for that. Slightly steep entrance but shouldn't be an issue. Basic tienda onsite and across the road but they only really have eggs and snacks.

name: Auto servicio Alvarez
description:
We had a turbo problem. Angel disassembled it and sent to the "casa del turbo". I insisted they clean all the hoses. It is necessary to insist. The assembly of the turbo went well.
We stayed three days in the garage and watched the day. The wifi is good. I negotiated the workforce at 800Q instead of 1000Q. The oil is very expensive, you never know if it's the right price. I recommend this mechanic.

name: Barbara's Boutique Hostal
description:
Ótimo Hostal para estar uns dias relaxando, a ducha é maravilhosa, café da manhã delicioso, aconchegante, muito lindo e limpo.

Possui quartos compartilhados e privados.

Recomendamos.

name: Showers
description: Showers 37 Q for two persons. Hot showers and clean

name: Texaco
description: We park one night here. They charge 20 Q and they allowed to use the bathrooms

name: Centro de Convenciones EL GRAN PALMAR, Hotel y Restaurante
description:
Best spot spend the night before the border. It’s a restaurant and hotel with outdoor gardens and patio, grass field, and play areas and trampoline for kids; lots of trees. The staff are very friendly. They allowed us to camp here for free in their parking/grass field if we used their restaurant, or pay Q50 for the night for both of us. Like all hotels around here, it is on the highway so you will hear traffic noise but it is at least set farther back and you can go as far back into the field as you wish. 

There are bathrooms for use off the patio, and a bathroom with a shower inside the restaurant/convention area. There are two security guards at night. They allowed us to use a plug in for electricity. 

We drove up and down the highway trying to find a good spot to sleep in our van and this was the only spot that met our sleeping needs as well as having a safe and relaxing ambiance.

name: Fricciones clutches
description: Great mechanic where we change the brakes

name: Playa San Jorge (north shore of lake)
description: Recreational beach, clean, nice breeze, camping under trees

name: Blue star Shower
description:
10 Q hot shower, with shampoo, soap and towell.

Ask first if they have hot water .

name: Embarcadero to Santiago Atitlan
description:
We asked the police and the locals both told us that it was ok to park here. Every one told us it was secure, but we know we are by our own risk. 
Lovely view of the lake. 
this is a flat spot on the street before the dock.

name: Las Viñas road
description:
Good restaurant on the road.
Delicious burrito for 5qzt
They offer coconut for the traveller, maybe because i'm a cyclist but they gave me 3 for free.
Nice people

name: panam emergency nightstop
description: If you ran out of light As I did: Safe, due to multiple 24hr guards and police patrol... quiet, with earplugs... free,.... WiFi  Saritas Restaurant works in the parking lot. restaurant with big windows to watch ya rig while you take a beer, abuse the WiFi, watch TV.

name: Ivan kayaks and volcano hiking
description:
Ivan is an excelent man who rents kayaks 15 Q pp per hour. 
Also he does as guide for hiking Indian Nose 150Q pp and Volcan San Pedro for 150Q pp.
We did hike with him and it was amaizing. Excelent views of the lake and all the villages. 
Take water and shoes for hiking. 
He speaks some english and knows a lot about these lands.

Phone 54638530

name: Hostal Buenos Sueños
description:
A nice hostel with a huge garden. Dorm beds are for 50 Q., private rooms for 150...
Kitchen, wifi and computer is available...

Recommendable!

name: The Laundry Room
description: Laundry Service, we left our clothes at 10am and got them back in the evening same day. 40Q per bucket which seems to be a little pricey due to the tourism here on Flores...

name: tire repair
description:
tire repaire, near Tikal.  Friendly people.
we paid 150 quetzal for a tire repair.

name: Close to road PET-13 on the way to mexican border
description:
In the middle of nature. The driveway leads over farm paths. The gates are not completed. Please close again after passing through. Say hello and ask at the 1st farm (after about 1 km) if it is ok to stay here. The people are very friendly and will invite you to stay near the farm ...
Here starts the driveway:
(16.9244954, -90.2690973)

name: Hotel del Centro
description: Simple and clean hotel in the center of Salama. Good Wi-Fi and electric hot shower that works ok. 125Q for a single room. A gated lot for parking, downfall is the lot is 2 blocks away. No parking at the hotel.

name: Hotel El Reposo
description:
Family managed hotel.
It offers singles, doubles and triples with private bathroom. TV, showers with hot water and a nice garden to rest. Includes parking inside the hotel. 
The price is around $12 in a single room to $10 each in triple.

name: Eurospecialist Christian
description:
A very knowledgeable and good mechanic,who is specialised in European cars, but knows his way around all kinds of cars. He helped us with our Toyota 4Runner to do some general checks and exchanges. He is honest about broken things and those which don't need to be exchanged, so we felt treated very fair. 
It is a quite modern workshop in an industrial area (Centro 5, Bodega 20). Maybe it's best to give him a call or contact him via WhatsApp before you come. He only speaks Spanish, but is willing to speak slow and understand you.

name: Ministerio de la cultura y deporte
description: We asked the guy who works there if we can set up our tent on the area. Was no problem for him. Quiet at night.

name: Shell Station - with potable water and overnight parking
description: We asked for water and they let us fill our water tank for free. The guy told us it is potable water and we could also park overnight.

name: Posada Montaña del Quetzal parking/camping
description:
We asked for parking, cost 25Q pp per night. Can pay with card.

Bathrooms dirty and icy showers. When we went to take a shower there was no hot water. They let us use the shower of a cabaña. Ask about it.

Swimming pool and a river near. Also orchid garden. Nice place.

name: Square next to Palacio Municipal
description:
We asked the police and they give us the ok. From 5pm to 7 am it's free. After that they charge 4 Q per hour.

We only wanted to overnight because it was a rainy day and it was already dark.
Noise from the traffic.
They sell  sweet corn at the square.

name: AMA
description: A fascinating place: they sell beautiful quality weaving from Mayan women who live in remote villages. They also help them to organise themselves, give them confidence and independence. It was started for widows and they now work with the third generation of women. A model project. Wednesday afternoons they demonstrate weaving techniques.

name: Rio sachichá Parque Ecoturistico
description:
Camping 60 Q pp per night. 
Toilets, showers and flat area near the river.
There are caves as well

name: LEM HA
description: 10 Q fill up gallon and wash. Good and fast over the boulevard. Beside guate pizza

name: Parqueo Mejia
description:
Gated parking lot next to a gas station. Allowed me to stay overnight for 50Q. They have toilets and a sink to wash dishes. 
Very close to the famous Chichicastenango market.

name: Shell Gas Station
description: Parked for the night in our RV. Gas station closes at 8pm, trucks noise on the road but not too bad. Nice manager and workers and we were able to fill up our water tanks. No cost but did give a tip

name: Hotel Casa Santa Lucia (toilets & showers)
description:
