description: broad street just to the exit of the city. not of worries with our 24 feet. Of many bus are also parked. A little of noise in evening but very calm the night. Sufficient for one night.

name: Agua Pura de la Roca
description: Super nice guy. Fill up 20 litres for free.

name: Taller Mécanico Giovanni
description: Giovanni is a trained car mechanic. He worked on our car on a Sunday and did a thorough job. He found good solutions to problems despite of lack of spare parts.

name: DHL-Shop to send drones avoiding Nicaragua !!!
description:
Drone are forbidden by law in Nicaragua. When coming to the border they will take them forever!!!
The lady in DHL Antigua speaks English well.

With DHL Express and sending to Costa Rica or Panama you are fine and lucky.

name: Mr Jeff
description:
Lavanderia and dry cleaning. The place looks very new and modern.
70Q for one big bag of clothing.

name: Panorama Ranch
description:
Beautiful ranch with an incredible view of Acatenango Volcano, organic avocado orchard, mango trees, banana trees and coffee plants. It is Rolando’s ranch, he’s very friendly and warm. Spanish only. Plenty of space for cars and larger rigs, pretty flat and grassy land amidst the avocado trees. A few friendly dogs. He’s also building a fish pond in the beginning of January. Toilet and shower in the little farmhouse. Very quiet, secluded and secure with someone always onsite. In the morning you can clearly see the volcano, it’s very close!! And if you’re hiking the volcano, Rolando can get the bus for you. Rolando’s son Jason is a great cook and can make food for you. Good cell reception. 50 Quetzales per person, so worth it! 

Take little windy roads through the small town, down the dirt road past sugarcane and trees painted white. Big rigs may have a little trouble on the skinny roads!

name: Julio Mecanico
description:
Good young mechanic that made the extra mile to fix our camper van. Speaks only Spanish. 
Julio Tel: 3362-6657.

name: RN5 (going west)
description:
From here traveling to the west on the RN5 you have 27km very rocky road. First 10km reasonable gravel. Then narrow rocky road. High clearance absolutely necessary. It took us 2.5 hours with a small 4x4 truck. 2x we were stopped by a rope blocking the road. One guy was very rude, asking 100Q he picked up a stone but we where not impressed and drove through the rope. The second guy about 10 km further was very polite, he was actually repairing with a shovel the bad spots. We gave him 10Q and some cookies, he was very happy with this. Beautiful scenery, with a lot of local children waving and shouting "gringos!"

This road is in truly horrible condition and should be avoided. The roads going around are always the better option.

name: Laguna de Ayarza
description: We wanted to stay at the Restaurant Secretos del Lago. But I think, it is abandoned. So we drove a little further and found this beautiful place. The site is free, but you have to pay 30 quetzales at the entrance of the park. There is a palapa with a fogon and water faucet nearby.

name: Tropigas
description: Got 20 lbs for 88 quetzales filled Into my garafa. Friendly stuff.

name: Area below road
description:
This is a flat sandy area below the road. It is hidden from the road with some noise from traffic. Good view of Volcano de Aqua. 

More suitable for motorbike, walkers and cyclists. Not much space to turn around a vehicle. I encountered sandflies and mosquitoes here.

name: Ocós beach
description:
Gravel road going parallel to the beach, after the village not much is going on apart some abandonned houses, plantations and palapas. 
A local said it's ok to camp somewhere along here, so I picked a palapa that seemed accessible and free. take care if you drive in the sand (take some air off the tires). some nice waves to surf. quiet.

name: Balneario El Chulaquito
description: Large, nice and very well kept place with a pool filled with crystal clear water from a creek. There are lots of palapas, tables and benches, a couple of BBQs, a children’s playground and a small bar. Cold outdoor shower (no soap allowed). There is WiFi and electricity where you could plug in but we didn’t check that. Quiet at night (except the road noise) but very busy on a Sunday afternoon. Paid Q50 for two people in a camper right at the pool (see picture).

name: La Garza
description: Backpacks, sleeping bags, tents, knifes, flashlights, thermobottles, bottles, small camping gear

name: Resortes de León
description: Best place in Guatemala City and country for fixing truck suspension. They are very professional and can fix any trucks and cars. We had problem with our air bags and we canceled them by adding leaf springs on both side. The estimate was accurate and we didn’t paid one penny more than what they estimated it for. Can fit any big rig!!

name: Veterinaria Pets and More
description: The veterinarian is incredibly helpful with the health certificate and export permit needed to cross the border from Guatemala to El Salvador. Very knowledgeable with reasonable rates. Speaks good English as well. Highly recommend! (Tried to get the coordinates as accurate as possible, but it's easy to find in a search, by name, on Google maps.)

name: Taurino’s Steak House
description:
Restaurant building next to service station. 

Good quality food and sides, steaks dish Q75. 
Tasty menu de dia. Q35
Also both dishes came with a few sides, delicious soup and drink.

name: Maico Electromecanico
description:
We had an electrical problem with our transmission and Maico gave us a super service and fixed our problem very quickly!
Strongly recommend ;)
+502-4776-5446

name: La Trufa Chapina chocolateria
description: Delicious handmade chocolate.  Family business.  They also offer workshops.

name: Hotel El Ray Conquistador
description: Older three story hotel in the town of Malacatán. Clean, plenty of off street parking, bicycles can go in room.  No air-conditioning but good ceiling fan.  Cold shower.  90Q for single room.

name: Tikal ticket check
description:
Here is the boom gate where you enter the Tikal ruins by foot only. The tickets you bought 17km down the road at Tikal main entrance are checked here and you get a bracelet.

Enter by car here to get on the road which takes you in 23km to the town and ruins of Uaxactún. Tickets to Uaxactún cost 50Q pp and can be bought at Main entrance only. You additionaly need a permit to enter which you get at Tikal Main entrance or at the administration building a couple of 100m from here.

Road to Uacaxtún is a very decent dirt road with yearly maintenance. 4km before the town the maintenance crew was still fixing the last stretch but was still in good condition for 2WD and RVs.

After visiting Uaxactún you can visit Tikal ruins without having to pay 150Q extra by parking at the turn off to temple IV which is approx. 1km from the Tikal ticket check boom gate.

name: Nuevo Horizonte comunidad
description:
This is just  little piece of paradise.
if you want to enjoy the nature and discover the history last 40 years of Guatemala you have to come here. Just open your mind and try to think what happened here from the '60 to '96. 
we stayed three days in the center of the village with our big truck, here you have a small restaurant so e little shop and a really nice small bar where you can drink a beer. 
There is a laguna to discover, a bosque and all the story of this self sufficient community.
other option to overnight is in front of the laguna, really a gem.

name: Ciao Cacao
description: Whole vegan cafe place, serving hot and iced coffee, some vegan sweets and vegan ice-bars in various flavours. They have nice garden with hammocks and tables.

name: Dormidero Maya Hotel
description: A hotel 15 minutes walk from the island of Flores. Offers rooms with balcony, private bathroom and AC. We got ours with two beds (single and double) for 200 Q for the two of us. Bit out-dated but clean. We couldn't connect to the WiFi on our room, but seems signal is stronger downstairs. They have huge fenced parking lot. We found only one electricity plug in our room (was in the bathroom). Only cold water in the shower, at least in the room we got.

name: Parqueo
description: 5 q per hour to park here while checking iut the church

name: Taller Mambo Soldering
description: Our exhaust pipe fell and this shop was fast, professional, and cheap. They completely re-soldered our exhaust pipe for 60 Q and the owner said they can help with any soldering needs car or otherwise

name: Gasolinera Don Rolando
description:
Buen punto intermedio en el camino desde/hacia Semuc Champey - Flores en gasolinera Don Rolando. Parqueo, baños y ducha sucios pero todo gratis. Estándar Wi-Fi Rolando-2019. Ruidosa ya que está a la par de la carretera y funciona 24h.

Good mid rest point on the way from/to Semuc Champey-Flores at Gas Station Don Rolando. Parking, dirty bathroom and cold shower but all free. There's a basic Wi-Fi Rolando-2019. Do noisy ad it's next to the street and it's 24h open.

name: Hidden Wave Surf Hostel
description: Big sand parking lot at 2 minutes walking from the surf beach. CD

name: Verde Eventos
description: This site is a park where they host weddings, birthday parties, etc... it s big, has a flat parking, toilets, an there is a big truck entrance (not the main entrance). Isaac asked 75qtz/night/van. One night there was a party, but finished around 10pm. We think it s a beautiful parking spot, compared to the other ones, with flowers, plants and all. Toilets were quite clean. There are faucets everywhere. Very calm at night. Isaac (the door guy) lives there, so even if it s closed, you can ring and he will be happy to host you. Easy and quick walk to center. Isaac s number +50231574343

name: Car Wash/Auto parts
description: Decent carwash for 25 q, well stocked parts store across the street. Nice place to hang out while they wash your car as well

name: La Luna Coffee&Chocolate
description: Unique and beautiful café, sip a hot chocolate or some coffee surrounded by beautiful things. they also have food, but we didn't try it. great place to spend a couple of hours even.

name: Parqueo
description: Parking, no height restriction, just saw it, didn't check the prices

name: Mercado de Antigua
description: Huge market where you find everything from fruits and vegetables, to electronic stuff and food. Funny to see and good prices!

name: Servicentro Formula Uno
description: Nice and professional mechanic! They did a very good jobs servicing our brakes!

name: Casa del Rey
description:
fancy hotel, a bit out of town, very quiet. 
huge grassy parking lot. 150Q/camper per night.
use of bathrooms in the reception area.

name: Automax
description:
Came to check the breaks. Very professional, didn’t need to do much work but knew his job! 
They even attended us after closing hours on Saturday (14h)

name: Cafe San Juan
description:
Don’t think you are being tricked by stopping in one of the first cafes coming down the lancha! Coffee here is of high standards, its made with an italian coffee machine and each coffee comes with the barista presentation.
They plant and process their own coffee, even if you’ve been to other fincas it’s a really nice stop in San Juan if you love coffee

name: Artesanos de San Juan
description:
Great cooperative of 35 women, who show you and teach for free how you pick the cotton, prepare it, dye it and creat the tejidos. All 100% natual processes. The ladies are very nice and it’s really interesting to learn about how the beautiful fabric is made.
There’s a a shop where they sell their products so if you want to buy something, better do it here because it goes straight to the women and cooperative : 80% for the families, 15% to the cooperative and 5% to maintain the infrastructure 
Highly recommended!

name: Utz Hua
description: Typical Guatemalan kitchen only at this restaurant! Very friendly service! Dishes between $30 and $50 quetzals.. we had a wonderful authentic chicken dish. We finished with a coffee and a cookie.. close to the parque

name: SENDERO Ecológico “el aprisco”
description: Beautiful grassy area surrounded by a pine forest focused on preservation of the forest. For day use by locals (or you), playground and trails into the forest, used for educational purposes as well. Crowded on a Sunday but everyone was gone by 1700. The owner, Nicholas was happy to have us in our Tacoma for one night, 35qz pp. Not for big rigs. Parking area only offered a few flat spots. The grassy area is flat for tent camping as well. Flush toilets and running water (nonpotable though!) No food or drinking water available on site. No WiFi, just spotty 3g. Gate is locked all day and Nicholas lives on the grounds. Felt extremely safe and welcomed. The morning after, a group of locals arrived for what seemed like a church service/gathering. Everyone was so nice. Pets are not allowed but he let us keep our husky in the car until everyone left. There’s one older female dog on the grounds but keeps to herself and is a good security system. Great stay for one night!

name: Gasolinera TechRon
description:
Gas Station with a small store with bathroom inside. A bit noisy because it's st the main street. Open until 10pm, then a security guard all night. Free, we couldn't find other place for free around.

ESPANOL
Gasolinera con una pequeña tienda con sanitarios. Algo ruidoso por estar sobre la carretera principal. Abierto hasta las 10pm y luego guarda de seguridad armado toda la noche. Gratis no encontramos ningún otro lugar gratis por la zona.

name: La Puerta Verde
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner or manager. It has not been overlander verified. 

I have space to camp/park. Secure area with cement slab. Power and toilet are available.  2 minute walk to the lake shore. (502) 3133-8264

name: Tropigas
description: This place will fill your bottles by the weight. The Zgas on iOverlander only does by the full 20pounds (even if you have half empty bottle). Here we paid 88 quetzal for 20 pounds.. go in, they weigh your bottle, then you get paper at gate, then pay and then they fill up.. very friendly!!

name: Anita Mayan Cooking Class
description:
Incredible cooking class run by a local woman, Anita, who uses the class to empower other single mothers around the lake. You will get to choose between a few options for your main course, side, dessert, and drink. Once you've chosen, she'll take you to the local market, where she knows the vendors and take you around to buy the necessary ingredients. From there, you'll walk to her house (where this pin is placed) and start chopping! The cooking part lasts 3 hours including the meal. Her story is incredible and beautiful. She runs the class in English and Spanish. 275Q pp is well worth it, especially knowing the money goes back into supporting women in the community.

Anita is a trained tour guide who started her own company thanks to her tourism experience. She helps support single mothers by providing jobs, running a local weaving co-op, and fundraising for scholarships for children of single mothers to be able to attend elementary through high school.

To get in touch with Anita and book the class:

E-mail: mayankitchen88@gmail.com
Phone: +502 5824 7440

name: Hôtel Berthelot
description: Nice place for 150 quetzal , it's Clean and very quiet . There is a swimming pool but its dirty. It's possible to put the bicycle in à room.

name: Private Cabaña
description: Its a small cabin in the mountain with View of the lake. Its has one huge bed, a clóset, a desk to work. Also has a wonderfull bathroom with a big shower with views at the lake. The owners are a wonderfull family that lives in the house down in front of the lake. They also offer safe parking lot to all sizes motorhomes.

name: Local restaurant inside tikal
description: Great place for some local lunch in the park. You need to stop by in the morning before starting your tour as it's reservation only. 125Q pp with a fresh juice and worth it in my opinion.

name: Taller Chivas
description:
not the prettiest workshop but a friendly mechanic who changed the brake fluid

+50230196105 rodrigo

name: Carolina’s Resort
description: Stayed here before crossing the border back into Mexico. Really nice place with a bar, pool, and WiFi (though not really in the room). We paid 23$ for two people even though their initial price was 28$ for valentines weekend. Rooms were clean and we had two double beds. Shower was cold but still a nice bathroom. There are two other places next door as well but they were around the same price.

name: Miguel Angel Peche boat tours
description:
Miguel Angel is a great and humble guide who lives in the town just in front of Flores. He’s very interesting and offers different kinds of tours. He tries to clean the lake and preserve their land and culture. Highly recommended if you want to visit the lake by lancha. This spot is where he stays with his boat but you can contact him via Whatsapp +50253206540 
We took a 1h tour for 200Q, but he can offer a wide variety of tours and prices

name: River refreshing
description:
Blue water in the river, no people, one of THE overlander spots. 
see you on the road - your Diesel-Gypsies!

name: El Ganadero
description: Stoped for a late breakfast and had a wonderful brunch at this beautiful rural restaurant.

name: Llanresa - Chemaltenango - Serious mécanico / repair workshop
description: Serious, well organized and professional  team and workshop. Did a good job to change the bolts of the back dobble wheels of our RV Ford Transit. This « the » Guatemalan city for garage and repairs (all the bus and trucks of the country come in Chemaltenango) => Gives you access to many different solutions, material and spare parts nearby if needed. Llanressa is Easy to find, just at the back of Uno gaz station, which is on the main road. Highly recommend.

name: Parking with playground
description: Parking for several shops including depensa, burger king (wifi). In front of the parking lot is a small soccer field and a children's playground. Friendly security guard. Water tap.

name: Lake Atitlan Spanish School
description:
Excellent Spanish school in San Pedro. 
Teachers are really qualified and Selvin, the director goes beyond his school duties to help you out with any needs. 
The have single or couple classes, for 2,3 or 4 hours per day. 
Rates are available at their website

https://lakeatitlanspanishschool.com/pricing/

They do a test before starting the classes so to assess your Spanish level and tailor classes around your needs. 
They always offer activities in the afternoon, like cooking classes and weaving classes so to practice the language. 
It is also possible to stay by a host family, in order to get a full experience. 

We spent almost two weeks at the school and could really improve our Spanish. 

My teacher’s name was Marlon and I highly recommend him. I knew a bit of Spanish before starting the school and in 10 days he could really elevate my level.

name: Custom Boots Shops
description: This town just north of Antigua is famous for it's leather shops, mainly shoes and boots. there are dozens of shops hand making boots. it took me about 15 minutes to get my measurements, pick a material, style and color for custom made boots. was half the price of store bought shoes in the USA. worth ordering while you explore Antigua

name: Dismar - reflective tape
description:
Here they sell the red&white reflective tape ("cintas reflectivas" mandatory for big rigs in Honduras)
7 quetzales for each red-white combo (1ft)
We put three on each side of the motorhome (rear, middle, front) and two on the back

name: AKI ferreteria - warning triangles for Honduras
description:
Commercial center "Parador del Rio" with food (La Torre), hardware (AKI) and clothing shops
At AKI they sell warning triangles and as we were heading to Honduras we needed two (it is mandatory and they should be 1ft tall)
About 60 quetzales each

If you are looking for reflective tape (also mandatory in Honduras but only for big rigs) the marine shop "Dismar" a little further on the right before crossing the bridge have some

name: Hotel Pino Montana - AKELA
description:
Coming from México on the right side before Huehuetenango.  Large secure parking for any size RV.  On pan Am Hwy 
Restaurant what is currently closed but there is a convenient store just across the highway   Large level area for tents also price for RV with one person is 30 Q.

name: Auto Hotel Anthony
description: AC, Private parking, big tub for a bath also with shower head. Warm water. Cable TV. Quiet place and friendly staff. 200Q either from 8AM to 8PM or 8PM to 8AM.

name: Piscinas Artesanales Pa´Siwan
description:
This is a quiet “large” parking lot (8 vehicles) at the end of the road (on a hill) good for small Vehicles (no rigs).
It is next to a forestal park where you can do zip-line in 4 different stations through the “jungle/ mountain” (25Qz)
We spent one night and it was very quiet, it was just us, and the police patrol came by a couple of times, but did not talk to us. There is a security guard. There is also several wc rooms (sanitarios) in a small yellow building at no cost. this is part of the centro eco Turistico and they have swimming pools further down with slides.. 
it was fun, but water is cold in every pool and also in the showers.. (that’s where we went to relax and when we asked if we could stay over there, they told us to come here better. )

name: Texaco
description: we stayed here one night, arrived around 6 pm and parked at the back next to some wooden chairs and concrete tables with nice plants and trees. The owner lives here so we practically parked in his property, you can also park in front of his house. there's a big field with cows just behind. It was noisy at first but the gas station closes at nine and the Super24 at ten after that it was very quiet and very safe.

name: Buena Vista
description: Nice quiet place that belongs to a small cafe, a corner shop and a ice cream shop. It has nice showers and toilets. And very fast wifi available from the corner shop if you just buy something there. Prob not accessible for big rigs since the entry is kinda small. Overal nice relaxing place and close to the beach. We paid $6 per night for two people. There is also enough shade  provided by nice palm trees :)

name: santa Domingo el Cerro (free shuttle)
description: many free exhibitions plus fancy restaurants. views of volcanos and Antigua.  a very nice and safe place to relax. get the free bus from hotel santa Domingo. that's a great place to explore too for free (except a few exhibitions)

name: Hotel santa Domingo (free ruins)
description: nice convent free entry. there are a few paid exhibitions but most of it is free. free toilets. free shuttle to their art exhibition up the hill with views. very nice and lots of security. see photo for free bus times. much safer than the public mirador

name: Playa Casa Americas Itzá
description: Gorgeous bit of paradise, with access to a private section of the lake. Caretakers are Silvia and Alvin who live above, but keep to themselves. Great place to swim and relax under shade after some days on the road. We stayed three nights, and were initially quoted 25Qpp but negotiable. Slept with the sounds of the lake and beautiful cool breeze, very few mosquitos while we were there. Highly recommend.

name: Cajero 5B
description: 45Q fees with a DKB card. We withdraw 2000Q and that was the maximum.

name: PUMA Self Service 1Q cheaper
description: At this gas station you'll pay 1Q per gallon less if you fill up the tank by yourself. As it's the first gas station in Guatemala for us, I'm not sure if that goes for other gas stations as well.

name: Las pozas lake
description: Nice, quiet and beautiful spot to stay for the night, for us was great!! Free!! Safe!!!

name: Hotel Don Juan Matalbatz
description:
simple, no frills but friendly service. only reason I am adding them into iOverland is because of the 9' ceilings for the garage/courtyard. it's only the 2nd time in central America my 8'6" tall rig has comfortably fit under a roof in a hotel. you could probably negotiate parking fee if you decide to take a bus to semuc Champey from here.

restaurant is fair price but not so tasty. highly rated in Google and hostelworld

name: Laguna las Pozas
description: Beautiful spot to spend a night on the lake.  Locals here doing their laundry all along the shore on wash rocks. There is a guy at the gate who let us in, no charge. Breeze blowing perfect for the night.  UPDATE: the lake is where the village does their laundry during the day, in the evening the men come to bathe. We were charged 10Q when we left..

name: Road mending fee
description: A man with a rope across the road  stopping all traffic & asking for money.  He asked us for Q100, we gave him Q10 & a cold coke. He was repairing the road.

name: Super pet
description:
Very professional clinic! One doctor can speak very good English and very helpful! 
They are the doctor with license!

name: Sticker HD Printing Shop
description: Pulled over to make a phone call and realized we were right out front an HD print shop. The owner is so kind and professional! We got vanwives for the back of our van and 200 stickers (9$ for 100 stickers!) we’ve wanted to do this for a while!!! Took 15 minutes.

name: Brake Burner!!!!
description: OMG! Unbelievably STEEP descent. Paved road but think twice before coming down this tight road. No places to pull out to let the brakes cool. We used 2nd low range gear with full engine brakes. And crawled down approx 8km.

name: Phillip - Mechanic
description:
Phillip helped us to fix our “check guage” code. 
He is very professional, has many contacts to find whatever you need and is fast and efficient.
We will come back to him when we are back in Belize for sure. 
He will be opening a yard with parts etc at another location too. 
Also a dog lover!

name: Soccer field
description: Just across the soccer field is a spot where the canoes are placed near the lake. We stayed the night here

name: Shell
description: Shell station with super, regular and low sulpher diese

name: Purify water refill
description: You can refill your large bottles here.

name: Propane Filling Station
description: Fill in your gas bottles.. if you need to buy one, they sell them at Brodie’s at 120 bzn $ or at the u-mall (cheap Asian supermarket) for 99$.

name: Toy 4 Boys - Drone repair
description:
THIS GUY IS AWESOME. 

Happy and knowledgeable 

So professional and fast!! He has direct connections for anything DJI as well. He ordered in parts to fix our mangled drone from Miami and woke up at 4 am to come to the office early to have it fixed before we left Guatemala City at 7 am.

YIPPIE! “Brand new” drone.

We also purchased a DJI gimbal with him. Got it the same day. 

+502 5203 2335

name: Kombi and bolcho club
description: Great guys  (Lico) helped me out with my Kombi. Have lots of used parts for beetles and Kombi. Also able to get new parts

name: ATM 5b
description: One of the few atms in the neighborhood ......

name: Shell station next to parque central
description:
Shell station with regular diesel, super 95, and regular 91

The shell station has 2 duchas and 2 toilets

name: Camping in the parque central next to shell
description:
Next to the shell station the is the Central Park. The park is a semi flat spot with some threes. There are two duchas and a toilet at the shell station, not yet sure if it stays open at night.

Police in town told it was fine to stay the night here(border was closed on Sunday afternoon)

Later at night the owner of shell station dropped by including some Metropolitan police, he told this is private area. He asked 25Q to stay the night and use the facilities. No problem we payed and he wishes us good night.

name: Tropigas
description: Good option for filling tanks. they were able to fill our cylinders and had the adaptors for the internal tank as well. only took cash payment.

name: Mountain Nest
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Rejected - must be generally available without reservation

This is a sweet cabin in the mountains with a spectacular view. Remy and Darina live on the top half of the property and love hosting travelers/overlanders. They are great company. It’s situated in an area where the village people speak an indigenous language called Q’eqchi, they are friendly and always seemed happy to stop and stare/wave :) Carlos, the caretaker, is very friendly and helpful, in front of his house is where you will park your rig and walk the 200m to the cabin. We were invited to have lunch at Carlos’ house with the hosts where his wife made a delicious spicy soup. The entire atmosphere of the area is magical. You should definitely come here. You can find the listing on Google or Airbnb (I’ve pasted it below too). It is a 45 minute drive to Semuc Champey. The road to the cabin is only accessible by 4x4, it’s steep and rocky and definitely washed out in some areas. Staying here was the perfect dose of peace & quiet to getaway from road travel.  


https://abnb.me/a574i74PSab

name: Agua Pura En-Gadi
description: Agua pura fill up window/store. Filled our 7 gallon tank for 6Q. Wide enough street to park our Tacoma. Nice family and people!

name: Turismo Laguna Brava
description:
Blue building on the left as you enter Aguacate. Stop here to pay for entrance to Laguna Brava. Q25pp for nationals and Q50 for foreigners. They’ll give you a ticket and tell you to go to the next blue building down the road and that’s the the road you’ll follow to the parking area.

Getting there: road is rocky and steep, you’ll need 4x4 & some clearance. It may be passable without during the dry season. Right now it’s still wet and feeling the remanence from Hurricane Iota & Eta. 

There are 3 places you can park. The mirador, the 1st parking area and the 2nd parking area closer to the Laguna. Getting to the 2nd parking area is not advisable by the locals BC it’s steep and wet in some areas but we saw pick up trucks do it. We parked at the mirador to sleep (no charge) and drove down to the 1st parking area then walked down to the Laguna to take a boat ride to the cenotes and waterfall. We negotiated Q500 for 2 people and a dog for the boat ride. Beautiful and worth it! There are cabins/rooms in cabins available or tent camping on a flat area next to the Laguna as well. Not sure what the charge is. 

If you don’t have 4x4, ask the guys at the turismo office if you can arrange for a ride down to the Laguna, we saw locals with pick up trucks full of people to drop off. Also- try to arrange to come during the week! Very crowded on the weekends.

name: CODACA Hino Dealer
description: Toyota Hino Dealer, only work on big rigs/trucks, sell parts for big trucks please note 7500kg over are big trucks. Great crew luis the manager and Pablo and little luis looked after my truck and did amazing job sourcing parts. as Mercedes was of no help

name: Sitio Arqueológico El Ceibal
description:
Archeological site. Dirt road. Cost 5Q for nationals, 60Q foreigners

Sitio arqueológico con muchas estelas y dos estructuras. El camino para llegar es de terracería. La entrada cuesta 5 quetzales para nacionales y 60 quetzales para extranjeros.

name: SHP Laundry
description:
Wash and dry Q6 per pound. Ready the same day. Staff was very friendly and clothes smelled good after wash. They are open 7AM to 6:30PM every day.

Lavado y secado a Q6 por libra. Todo listo en el mismo día. Los encargados fueron muy amables y la ropa olía muy bien. Abierto de 7:00AM a 6:30 PM todos los días.

name: Villa del Profe
description:
Large grassy land for all sizes of Camper.
Big rigs are welcome.
75Q/night.
Excellent wifi.
10 minutes walk from Castillo de San Felipe.

name: selina hostel
description:
this place is awesome!
very lage hostel.
clean and nice atmosphere. 
i had the place for myself 
because of the covid epidemic. 
there is a very large indoor parking.
10$ for a dorm.
they have a pool and a bar.

name: Iximché
description: Mayan ruins. Guatemala's first capital. Thanks to the english speaking guide it was a great experience.

name: Hotel Oxib Peck
description: We tried other options before coming here and everybody denied us. The guys here received us very well! For 50 quetzales we slept inside the car, used a toilet, a shower and WiFi. Felt very safe inside the parking lot. Only for small rigs.

name: Hacienda Del Café
description:
It's actually a boutique coffee farm that has an amazing accommodation with amazing facilities at a reasonable price.
And if you're into coffee, you hit jackpot.
The owner is very friendly welcoming and willing to help.

name: Purificadora
description:
So hard to find a purificadora around here for some reason. Water tastes good and the guy said it’s free! They filled our 20liter/5gallon jerry can three times. 

The street is tight so in our van we had to repark for a bigger vehicle but most cars got by.

name: Centro Recreativo Chixot
description:
We wanted to see the natives paintings of comalapa. We saw this place next to the road. Nice grassy area, with swimming pool, toilets but no shower.
30q the night or the day for 2 persons.

name: Acqua Life
description: They filled our 5 gallon or 20L jerry can for 10Q. It’s in a gated shopping center with a guard but he just waved us through.

name: Purificadora
description:
They have garrafones. filled our jerry can.

10Q for 5 gallons or 20 liters

They don’t have a sign so keep an eye out for a place with a big silver metal garage door and blue overhang. The door will be open

name: Sipacate Tranquilo
description:
Moderator Note: This Place is rejected as the location appears to be inconsistent with the description and the photograph. Email sent to user on 21 Feb 2021.

Nice, clean and shaded spot right on the beach. A few families on the weekends, they all left after sunset. There are garbage cans that ~most~ people use. Police pass by but only to make sure everything is safe. There is a restaurant across the road with inexpensive food. They also have bathrooms and showers. The bathrooms are free and the showers are only 5Q. 
There are street lights that stay on all night. So even when you head to the beach at night you can see your stuff. 
We stayed in our van and our friends pitched a tent. 
Perfect place! Just after sunset the mosquitos go wild for a lil bit but the rest of the time it’s not bad. 
The road is dirt but fine with 2WD.

name: La Mojarra Dorada
description: Very Good little restaurant to est fresh fish. They have fish in a pool and They prepare it directly. Mojarra costs 40Q

name: Comedor Selenita
description:
Amazing food. BBQ beef or chicken, and served on a plate with beans, rice, green onions, and macaroni salad.
2 plates and a drink for 55Q. Great value and great food. Good size parking spot right in front of the restaurant.
Comes with free WiFi. 
Clean bathrooms and great service. Definitely recommend.

name: Shell Gas station
description:
A big Shell Gas station with 1 cold shower and 2 toilets.
It's between the shop/restaurant and the car wash service. 
The stuff and the owner (with shaved head) are very friendly and helpful.
We used the showers while staying overnight (on the weekend).
Some big buses stay there overnight too. So it can be loud, because they come and go during the night. 
There are cameras installed, but the lights will be switched off after the stuff leave (even though the owner told us, that they are switched on the whole night). 
We felt safe, but hadn't got a good sleep at all, because of the loud busses and the smell of their engines, which they switch off very late after arriving.

name: Chortiz
description: We arrived in this litle mountain village just after sunrise. We asked a local if we could stay somewhere for the night - brought us to the caretaker of the cabin. The cabin had not been used for almost a year because of covid-19, but both the cabin and the bed linen were clean. There were a single bed, a double bed and a bunkbed and extra blankets for cold nights. Outside is a water tap which we used for cooking and drinking after filtering it. The toilets are next to the school building. The price was 20 or 25Q per person, I don't remember it exactly.

name: Gasolinera con lavado gratis
description: Gaz station where they wash your car for free. They did it very well si Wenger let them a tip. Nice guys!

name: La Casa Del Resorte
description:
Very helpful Mechanics Shop specializing in suspension for large rigs, but they were very willing and helpful to replace our driveshaft universal joints quickly. 

All hands on deck when we arrived, 3 men  worked together to remove the 2 piece shaft with 3 u-joints, inspected everything and replaced the failed joint with a quality part in under 2 hours.

name: Pool at Finca El Pillar
description:
Outdoor swimming pool called El Paraíso Azul located at the Finca El Pillar terrain. The entrance is Q25 per person.
The water is not heated so prepair for a fresh swim and shower. They have a 1m, 2m and 3m deep pool. There are flush toilets with paper on site. In the weekends it can be bussy with locals and there will be food vendors.
You can also rent MTB to go up to a viewing point and back. 
We took a Q30 mototaxi from the other side of the city to get here (but we probably could have got a better deal). Just say Finca El Pillar and they will know where it is.

name: Hotel Francelia
description:
First of all: if you don't need to go to Escuintla, don't go.
The city is chaotic, dirty and it was the only place in Guatemala where we felt unsafe.

Hotel Francelia is okay. We slept with four people in a room with two matromonial beds Q250 in total. The shower is cold and the rooms hot. There is no real sitting area inside or outside. The outdoor area, which is also the parking lot for the hotel, is covered by a sort of sunscreen, but still can be very hot. The wifi is fast.

name: Vet Pro
description: What a great place to take your cat or dog. English speaking vets that took great care of our stray kitten. They provide vaccinations, flea treatment, de-worming, and sell high-end, imported food for both cats and dogs. 815Q for the full treatment including a bag of dry food. Perhaps not the cheapest vet in the country, but a very professional service.

name: Autobahn
description:
Really honest, tidy and very capable place for all kinds of auto repairs. 

We stopped here to ask for a tool we needed to change a part on our car.
The owner Camilo was very helpful, lent us the tool and let us do the repair inside his workshop.

As it turns out, Camilo has studied in Germany and speaks good German.
He and his experienced mechanics helped us with several problems we ran into during our repair.

Camilo did not charge us anything and did not even want to accept a tip but told us to give the money to his mechanic.

We would come here again with any mechanical problem.

name: Crater Azul
description: This is the parking lot for Crater Azul when turning off of the PET 12 and driving through fincas. The turn is not marked. Look for a tiendita almost directly North of this gps spot. It’s next to the dirt road where you’ll turn. There’s a ranch house behind the tiendita. At the house the family will charge you to drive through their fincas. We were quoted Q30pp to drive through the fincas to access Crater Azul, Q100 for access + camping (for 2 people), negotiable. The family is very friendly and will answer any questions you have about Crater Azul. You’ll drive through several livestock gates that you’ll have to unlatch and re-latch as you pass. The road is a bit rutted out but we saw a local van make it. High clearance will be helpful, but not necessary. It looks like it’ll get muddy when it rains. Not suitable for big rigs due to the low tree branches and a narrow, wooden plank bridge. We came in a 2.5m tall Toyota Sequoia. Flat, shaded parking spaces, trash cans, a pit toilet (just a hole in the ground) with plastic sheet walls on 3 sides. You can make a fire for grilling; there’s wood around. Crater Azul is actually a spring (not a crater) with crystal clear water. It’s very pretty and good for swimming. It looks more beautiful when it’s clean, but after busy days there can be lots of trash around. It can get overcrowded on weekends and holidays, as boats of people also come from Sayaxche. Mostly National tourists. Recommend visiting during the week. Bring everything you need, including insect repellent. Claro signal unreliable/spotty.

name: El Cuartito
description: Breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Artsy, relaxed atmosphere with nice people. Local beers, too! Food is international (didn't eat, only had beers which were good). only open until 8:00, though....

name: Panaderia Masa Madre
description: Very high quality bakery. Absolutely delicious sourdough boule for 20q  and they have some tools and cookies, too (but the sourdough, oh my, the sourdough). No cakes or things like that, but the bread is stellar.

name: Don Arturo
description:
Asked if we could stay and they said yes like this was not the first time. I would almost assume that most Don Arturo's offer camping, because we have stayed at others before.

15q for the van, we could park behind the store (away from traffic), and they asked for my name and phone number.

Good option if you're looking for a place late in the day and heading out the next morning.

name: La Cuevita de los Urquiza
description: This place just waits for tourists to rip them off and should be avoided for the plethora of other fantastic fare this town has to offer. All plates are 80 Q for food that is average at best. And the waiters will try to add extra charges for no reason and then tell you that the bill does not include tip.

name: Laguna Beach
description: Restaurant and swimming pool with a large grassed area

name: Aguateca nacimiento (spring)
description:
This is the swimmable source of a river with crystal clear, 24⁰C water. It's also the trailhead for the Aguateca ruins (guided 45 mins on foot one way). During weekends, families come here to swim, BBQ and drink. There are toilets, picknick tables, palapas and fire pits. It's in the jungle, with the fauna that comes with it (birds, mammals, insects).

The last stretch of track is not on Openstreet-, nor on Google- nor on Apple maps. Have your GPS guide you to an unpaved road that starts North in between the residential blocks in Las Pozas but then goes North-west. By the time you're close to the waypoint, look out for a track on your right (that is not on the map), with a white, bulletholed and completely faded sign. Follow it, take a left after you've opened (and closed) a barb wired fence. The track can be muddy and two wheel drivers left their vehicle just before the last water/mud pool.

Claro LTE coverage.

Original: We found this place looking for the aguateca ruins. It’s a small dirtroad on your right if your coming from Las Pozas. It has a big white sign in front if the road that says aguateca. It’s a beautiful awesome place with alot of mayan history. We camped right next to the river where we could hear the monkeys howl all day. The river is great for bathing and connecting with the local community. If you want to hike to aguateca it’s 100q for the guide and 20q per person to enter the ruins. For camping its 25q per person. And you can basically put you tent, van or hammock anywhere you want. Definitely a place that i would recommend if you want to experience jungle life!!

name: "Hearts in Action" Jungle School
description:
"Hearts in Action" is a great place to stop by and check out. (best to call ahead +50252012959)
We thought to stop by for an afternoon, and ended up staying 5 days, soaking up their positive energy, helping with a project or two, and enjoying their endless stream of new ideas. Great stop on your way to El Mirador, or to be in a remote area and still go to the lake in a hot afternoon.
Suzanne and Mario (+1 8327039005 in case you need English, whatsapp preffered) have built the Jungle school from the ground up over the last 30 years, bringing education to the remote areas and jungle around San Andres. They normally have around 350 kids coming to school here every day! As part of their expanding school, they started with follow up programs to enable the kids to grow into a better future when they finish school. They have a thriving wood carving business on site (Itza Wood), a jewelry workshop, artisanal products, and a pretty impressive hydroponics experiment site (where you can camp as well). 
They're also looking to expand into tourism with a nice 6p cabana (on Airbnb), restaurant (delicious food!) and various camping options around the farm, all with pristine toilets. 
You can camp next to their house and be close to the sites activities and wifi, or you can camp in the middle of the jungle in total solitude.  It's a 800 acre/320hectare beautiful farm with hiking trails, birding, organic gardens and a bee farm, sure there will be a spot for your rig.. ;) As they've been here for a long time, they can arrange all kinds of local guides, hikes, tours as well.

name: Main Plaza
description: Safe place to sleep. Very Clean, with bathroom beside church - 3 quetzal to use. We talked with the Police  to ask for permission. Ok

name: Distribuora universal
description: Huge parking lot next to the collectivo boats. Seemed safe to us, friendly people, parked here for 3 days/2 nights. Paid 80q.

name: PA Autos -  Alienacion
description: Friendly staff with Good knowlodge. We aligned our defender 110 tyres here. Good machine too. Recommended

name: Comedor Katampe - Mercado central
description:
Good lunch and cheap 20q churrasco with juice. 
Recomended.

name: Antojitos Salvadorenos
description: Good place to pupusas tasty. 10-12 Q. Juices 12-15 Q. Recomended.

name: cascadas de Santa Avelina
description: Nice cascadas, nothing super spectacular, but quite remote and unvisited. The drive in these regions is very nice, lots of small towns, indigiounous people and colorful dresses. No absolute need for 4x4, but a bit of clearance will help.

name: Hotel y Restaurante Puertas Del Cielo
description:
We have got to this hotel through google search, we called to ask if they have parking place and they approved.
When we arrived, a woman came to open a gate lock in front of the hotel which can contain around 3 RV.

The restaurant has affordable price and good food, the room is small but really enough for a refreshment and the shower is good.

name: New place for ticket to PN Pacaya
description:
They are charging you here now. If you don't to National Park don't pay (they get crazy with this). We just visite the villages because this we didnt pay. 
IF you go to NP, you can pay in the others entrance of iOvernalder . A lot of guides Will Try to charge you.

name: Finca Campo Alegre (JOB)
description: JOB is a nice guy that are planing to do a campsite here, completly wild and beautyful. Here is the Best of the lava and The volcano Pacaya. The to this point is very narrow, but we did with our defender 110. The maximum height is 2. 4m, but you can go to another site with better way. Call him in the vilage Patrocínio and figure out The Best place to Camp. Phone +5025938-8847

name: Hotel Mansion - Villa Residencial
description:
This place is the worst. We only stayed there because it was somewhat close to the border, we were exhausted from entering from Mexico and it has good reviews.
It is located in a sketchy and dumpy neighborhood. I know this is Central America but this neighborhood is extra shady. The food the hotel restaurant is overpriced rubbery meats. They charged us more than the price listed in the lobby. During heavy rain water came into the room underneath the door. They kept telling us to keep quiet even though we were just reading and chilling with no music or tv; and even though they put us in a room next the the street where dogs were barking nonstop. 
After we showered we used the towels to dry ourselves and used the wet towels to wipe up the water on the floor. It rained heavily and water got into the room. As we were leaving the manager berated us and told us we need to pay Q300 for the two towels. She claimed the towels were left unusable. We tried to reason with her but she became more angry. So finally we gave her Q300. This place is the worst. Don’t let the positive reviews fool you.

name: Taller y Servicentro Fauggier
description: Knowledgeable and professional staff. They quickly diagnosed a coolant leak and replaced a hose and two clamps for Q310. Jorge, the owner is a friendly guy. He gave a ride back to where we were staying so we didn’t have to wait with the van. He was genuinely interested and curious about our travels and gave us advice on how to travel through Guatemala safely. He even called us after we left the next day to make sure the van was running fine.

name: Stadium of Tactic
description: Quiet during the week. A little bit noisy during the week-end. Police come to see if all good. Stay few days. Safe and secure.

name: Taller Ruiz
description:
Small road side mechanic. He doesn’t have a lift but has a covered working area. Helped us fix a stuck brake caliper and flushed the brake fluids. He also diagnosed a misfiring cylinder and calibrated the distributor. At KM98 on CA8, just past Puente San Francisco on the way to Jalpatagua. His number is:
+50248291066

name: Miratenango
description:
A nice campsite from where you can start the hike as well. Can also leave your car here. Probably they can arrange guides, but we didn't ask.
Way up is doable for every car, the access gate might be a bit tight for bigger rigs.
We paid 150Q for 2 cars, 4 adults and 2 kids.

name: PCR test site
description: Cheapest we could find, 560Q per test. Needed it to cross the border with El Salvador. You can park here, and do the test next to the parking lot. Good service, possible to pay with cards.

name: Grupo E
description: Easy to find but in any case... now it’s on the map... still looking for Grupo F&H!

name: Grupo A exact location
description: We walked the whole thing but with a half decent car you could probably drive all the way to the car park. (Best done with high clearance, definitely not with an RV!)

name: La Bodegona full stock supermarket
description:
Well priced, where the locals buy their supplies and alcohol.
Comprehensive range of everything

name: El campo
description:
Basket ball and football field.
More or less quiet. Calm and safe. 
Best spot in this town. Close to Coban. On the way of lanquin(semuc champey )

name: Municipal stadium
description: Front of the stadium...basic place ,no special view ...but quiet and safe ...more good of street parking

name: Parking of a private hospital
description:
We arrived late in Huehue and asked the police where we should park for the night. He suggested this place. We went at the end of the narrow road and then down to a big empty field.
We spent a super quiet night but at 6 am the security guy told us we had either to leave or pay for the parking. As it's not easy to find a place in Huehue we recommend this. The police is nearby so it's super safe. It might be a bit difficult to get there with big rigs because the road is narrow and there's a steep downhill to the parking lot. Ok with 2wd vehicles.

name: Fábrica de Cerámica
description: Small shop full of the local pottery, all hand painted and glazed. Since this is where it’s made it’s cheaper than all the other towns on the lake. Friendly owners, large selection, shame we couldn’t take any with us.

name: San Antonio Market
description: Decent size market, under cover, worth a visit if in the area... also good photo opportunity place.

name: El Rincon de las Crepas
description: Nice crepes and coffee! They have a whole selection of coffees and crepes along with other postres.

name: Seven waterfalls
description: Very nice swimming holes ans small waterfall. Easy accès by tuk tuk and 30 min easy walk or get dropped from a man ha. Entrave is 20 Q pp. really worth it

name: Robberies
description:
CAUTION: this is the section where the armed robberies take place... best to ask for a police escort in either town.

There is a steep 3km rough section here, clearly hasn’t been maintained in a long time! If going west (from Santiago to San Pedro) you’ll going uphill which might be doable in a high clearance 2WD IF it’s dry (I wouldn’t recommend trying it) in any case high clearance strongly recommended if your care about your undercarriage. 
Going in the opposite direction (downhill) high clearance 2WD should do the trick.

name: By the river
description: Best spot, clean for one time, front of the river, no garbage, no noise...

name: Boat tours to Aguateca or crater azul
description: Here starts boats tours to Aguateca, crater Azur, Ceibal or las Pilas. Lazaro is a fantastic guide., Very reliable and honest. We did Aguateca one day and the second morning crater Azul and rio Negro. Both were fantastic , saw crocs, terapins, birds and swam in incredible clear and blue water. Price 700 for 2 as a private group, 150 pp if more than 5. If you are not afraid of mosquitoes you can stay here too- next to the river, safe and fairly level. Enough space for a few campers. His number is +50232143613.

name: Free Covid test
description: At the hospital of antigua you can get free fast antigen covid test. It’s only until 11:30 am. You can take it if you are a tourist and they give you the result immediatly.  Is also pet friendly because it’s an outside testing clinic so you can take your dog with you.

name: Albania maze and zipline
description:
Nice tourist attraction park. Has a big maze, zipline, big swing and some more stuff. Restaurant with good coffee as well.
We slept (car+RTT) at the parking lot after opening hours. Ask for the gerente Linda, she is the friendliest Salvadoran you'll meet.

name: Great Italian food! Piccolo Giardino
description: This is a nice place worth recommending. Actual wood oven, thin crust, not with extra sugar in the dough, and reasonably priced, situated in a nice green garden. We didn't try the other dishes, but they have a good menu with other Italian dishes.

name: Casa Museo
description: Small museum just across from the church, free entry open everyday. By small I mean 15-20mins you can see everything. The friendly host gave us a tour explaining the locals customs and history around the lake, asked a small donation at end

name: laboratorio clinico biologico
description:
Covid test lab.just up the hill 50m from the bus stop
950q for PCR test, 24 hour wait for results
650 for quick test
Results sent via email

name: Puma fuel station
description: Flat area for trucks just behind the pumps. Outdoor shower and loo at gable end of shop. Pay 20q for the facilities. My vehicle is self-contained so I paid zilch. Safe at night, quiet enough.

name: Hotel Pasabien
description: We asked the woman in the reception if we could park here for the night (camper truck  2 ppl) She had to call someone first but eventually we payed a parking fee of 20 quetzales to stay in their gated parking space. There are some toilets but we didn't ask for water or electricity, so not sure about that. There is a pool at the hotel, which we also didn't use as we just asked to park. Very nice and lots of space

name: La Ceiba Hotel and Resort
description: Called ahead to ask if we could stay for the night before crossing the border in the morning. Reception lady was very friendly. cost was 100 qtz per person with showers, toilets, fast wifi and pool. Don't know about electricity or water as we didn't ask for this. We are travelling by camper truck and if your are taller than that you can't enter.

name: Gasoline Station/Oil change
description:
We did Oil change here, for our RV with a Ford motor. We Asked to the Gasoline Station next to the bridge, a friendly man did it. We gave him a “propina”.
Notice that we had bought our oil before, because it was 5W30 one.
There is a nice restaurant next to, where we spent the night too. Nice staff.

name: For those who like tough roads...
description: Pretty sweet view, fun dirt road, super steep for those who are into this sort of things... 4x4 and motos only.

name: Tigo shop to buy SIM card
description:
You can buy a SIM card from Tigo here for Q10. Bring your passport. Don't get tricked into buying a plan (that's what they'll try to sell you). Go to tigo.com.gt and check out the prepaid options (prepago). I got the SIM for Q10 plus a prepaid packet for Q120 that includes calls/sms and 12G internet for 30 days. If you're staying for only a few days or weeks there are cheaper "paquetes" that you can buy.

The Tigo shop is part of the "Zentro Plaza", which includes a supermarket, ATMs (5B and BI), restaurants, and small shops.

name: Parque RV, Camping y Ecológico Casa Tzocomá
description:
Camping and RV park in Chichicastenango close to the market but in a very quiet and special area to camp and enjoy nature.

Available services:
RV Parking: Single price of Q100 per vehicle per night, regardless of the number of people.
Camp tents: Q35 per person per night.
Campfire: Q20
All services include:
- WIFI
- Drinking water
- Shower with warm water
- Area to wash dishes
- Electricity
- Vehicle toilet discharge
- Bird watching
- Flora and fauna
- Healthy and relaxing environment
- Visit to the Mayan altar north point of Chichicastenango "Heart of the sky"
- Allowed to place hammocks and tents
- Pets Allowed
- Wide and flat land
- any size RV vehicles can be parked
.....
Parque campamento y RV en Chichicastenango cercano al mercado pero en un área muy tranquila y especial para acampar y disfrutar de la naturaleza.

Servicios disponibles: 

Parqueo RV: Precio único de Q100 por vehículo por noche, sin importar el número de personas.

Tiendas de campamento: Q35 por persona por noche.

Fogata: Q20 

Todos los servicios incluyen:
- WIFI 
- Agua potable
- Ducha con agua tibia
- Área para lavar trastes
- Electricidad
- Descarga de inodoro vehicular
- Avistamiento de aves
- Flora y fauna
- Ambiente saludable y de relajamiento 
- Visita al altar maya punto norte de Chichicastenango "Corazón del cielo"
- Permitido colocar hamacas y tiendas de campamento
- Permitido mascotas
- Terreno amplio y plano 
- pueden estacionarse cualquier tamaño de vehículos RV

name: Jade Museum
description: Free museum with a boutique at the end of the tour where you can buy jewelry. The guide that gave us the tour was excellent and made it really interesting. A great way to learn more about Mayan and Aztec culture. There is a workshop and they explain the process of working with Jade, the different types, colors, where it comes from, and so on.

name: Sanitarios Premium
description: Cold showers for 10Q, clean, but cold...

name: Parqueo Cenotes Own- Ajab
description: Permitted Camp site by Yalaurel Community. Located at the parking lot for visiting Cenotes. From this camp site to los cenotes de Own-ajab is a 30 min Hike.

name: Church and park
description: Nice park, big square, some food stalls, a church. Pretty quiet and chilled.

name: Playa El Chapeton
description:
Excellent quiet beach to spend days off, quiet and safe public beach you meet friendly locals and they help you with whatever you need. 

Ask for Mamarre, is a character on the beach who helps you with whatever you need


excelente playa tranquila para pasar días de descanso, playa pública tranquila y segura te encuentras con pobladores amables y te colaboran con lo que necesites. pregunta por mamarre es un personaje de la playa que te colabora con lo q necesites

name: Red Door: International Food Warehouse
description:
Got this tip from my Spanish teacher in town. It's the place where all the international restaurants buy their internal ingredients. The place is run by an English (?) guy and he drives to Guatemala city every week. Very good prices. Lots of cheese, meats and Italian products (as well as drinks / rums).

A bit hard to find: Next to a pharmacy is a red door. If the place is open there will be a sign "open / abierto" and you can knock on the door to get in.

They are open every day from 9:00-15:00 except Sundays.

name: Pura Cora (Purified Water)
description: Shop for Purified Water, easy to park in front. Friendly people, filled our own containers as well, Q9 per garrafon.

name: La Estancia (bad!!)
description: Insipid food and they charge 20% propina (tip)... It's a tourist trap. The restaurant looks good and the food also looks good, but it's just canned food with a nice presentation.

name: Girasol garden
description: If you are into flowers, bees and such things this is a neat place to check out and take photos. Q10 to get in...

name: Cafecito Del Mar
description:
This is the location you probably hear other travellers talk about! Good coffee, small breakfast/lunch menu offering smoothie bowls, avo toast etc. Vegan&normal desserts, juices, cocktails and beer. Open 8am-3pm.
Check photos for current prices/options

name: ISAGAS
description: Closest fuel stop to El Ceibo. Small shop here and in Lagunitas village.

name: Monte Carmelo
description: Nice and wide campground, spots with shade and others with sun. Areas for barbacoa, a field of volleyball and soccer, play ground for kids. Up in the mountains they have open a tunell that cross a small mountain in the property. They also rent small casitas with a bed bunk's Q30 pp. They offer bathrooms and showers. the showers are cold but if you talk to Erick the guy that takes care of the place he can show you a small house with a hot shower. So we stay here 1 week and they charge us Q20 pp we are two adults and two kids they didn't charge us for the kids. We needed this place after border la Mesia and because we need to fix our truck. You have access to water for your camper and also they sell water for drinking in the property in the small tiendita they have. Good option for Huehuetenango town.

name: Hotel Sheny
description: Cheap basic hotel. A local lady took us here and she managed a good price for us. We paid 150q for two people in one room. There is place for parking but its limited since there were alot of cars here. Was a good stop for one night at the border. Wifi in the room!

name: Shell.
description:
Shell. Opened Sept. 2021. 
Shop, toilets, no overnight parking. 
Unfortunately its position completely overpowers this small community.

name: Bici Abeja, Coban
description: The best bicycle shop in town. Good selection of parts and knowledgeable mechanic.

name: Playa Chechenal
description: A beautiful spot on the lakeside under the trees. Private beach. Day entry 5 Q + 25 Q to stay the night. They shut the gate to day visitors at 5pm so you have the place to yourself until they open at 8 in the morning. Flush toilets are very clean. The attendant allowed me to hook up to power at their kiosk. Road in is gravel but OK for medium sized rigs. Busy with family on weekends with competing stereos but they go by 5. Felt very secure. No showers but good spot to swim. BBQs. Everything is well maintained and clean. The kiosk sells drinks (beer, water, softdrinks)

name: Texaco. Nuestra señora de Guadalupe
description:
Large flat truck parking area. Not the quietest but good for one night. No shade.
Toilet. I was allowed to use staff shower. Not the cleanest but free.
Bar and snacks. Didn't ask about WiFi.

I wasn't charged to pitch a tent in the far corner.

name: Lotificación Ayutla
description:
Quiet roads in new housing development. Plenty of options. Best entrance is from road exactly opposite bus station.
Map marker is at small park that has tin roofed palapas, barbecue places with built in grids, trees and lawn. Nicely manicured.

name: Aldea La Barrona
description:
We arrived in the middle of the week the beach was quiet. It is a quiet and safe beach, but the cleanliness of the beach leaves much to be desired. You will find shower and toilet services. 

We parked next to the Rancho Margarita, the owner of the place. Don Francisco is very kind, on his property he has parking for $ 20 Quetzales. 
We had access to his bathrooms and drinking water to fill tanks. 

There is a turtle man, at night if you are lucky you can see the turtles that come to spawn. You must do your errand before arriving as you will only find small shops selling food and drinks.
The access road to get to the first kilometers has deteriorated pavement and the rest about 16 kilometers more is a dirt road, some parts better than others.



Llegamos en medio de semana la playa estaba sola,  es una playa tranquila y segura, la limpieza de la playa deja mucho que desear, encuentras servicio de duchas y sanitarios, nos estacionamos al lado del Rancho Margarita el dueño del lugar. Don Francisco muy amable , en su propiedad tiene parqueo a $20 Quetzales, tuvimos acceso a sus baños y agua potable para llenar tanques. hay un tortuga tío, de noche si tienes suerte puedes ver las tortugas que llegan a desovar. debes hacer tu mandado antes de llegar ya que solo encontrarás tiendas pequeñas lugares de venta de comida y bebidas.
La carretera de acceso para llegar los primeros kilómetros pavimento deteriorado y el resto unos 16 kilómetros más es de carretera de terracería algunas partes mejores que otras.

name: Surprisingly Peaceful Gas Station
description: Gas Station with parking away from the road. Got a good night's sleep before heading across the border to Mexico.

name: La Casa de Don David
description: Very nice restaurant with a view of the lake, amazing sunsets, and some cool stuff like a cable that transports food to the lakeside terrace, and bird feeders close to the dining area that are enjoyed by both exotic birds and iguanas! The food is good and reasonably priced. Fast wifi, power plugs at tables, and spotless bathroom. The owner is American and has lived in El Remate for 40 years!

name: Laboratorio medical PCR test
description: Closest place to the border to get a last minute fast PCR. Normally they say 4hrs but they had our ready in 40 minutes.

name: Roadside Churrasco
description:
15Q per plate. Nice and convenient place for a quick stop to eat before heading to/from the Belize border. 

Friendly family service.

name: Hotel Finca Chijul
description:
Excellent camping spot, Q175.00 p / person, somewhat expensive but safe and good atmosphere.
---
Excelente spot de camping, Q175.00 p/persona, algo caro pero seguro y buen clima.

name: Parque Quetzali
description:
Little  town  Park north of San  Marcos next to  the road. 
30Q for camping. There  is  a parking  lot  but  we  parked on the  football field.

name: Hotel Villa de Don Andrés
description:
A nice hotel or B&B only one block from Parque a Centro America.
Owned & operated by a nice family 
Clean & quiet
I was able to park my motorcycle in their garage
Breakfast was nice
Wifi was fast & consistent

name: la casa rosa
description: great place to stay, many rooms and amenities, great view of the lake and super quiet

name: Tire repair shop
description: We stopped here after getting a really bad flat (sliced, not punctured) and had an amazing experience. The older gentleman and his young helper were great, they did a good sturdy internal patch and then swapped it out for our spare, done in an hour and cost us 150Q. Very enthusiastic and helpful with English speakers.

name: Hotel del Sol (Cafe del Sol)
description: A rustic hotel on a black sand beach. I was only charged 250GTQ. They have reasonable WiFi, good parking and beautiful views.

name: Mirador Chuich Ok’ Ok’
description: Very beautiful mirrador with space for medium sized rig (we have a long sprinter). Longer than that it won’t fit in the very narrow road that goes up there. Decent bathroom available, lots of BBQ's, tables and seats to eat. No wifi but full LTE Claro signal. Had to negotiate, but could have it for Q50/pp per night. We didn’t do the Indian Nose trail as this spot has the same view, for cheaper, without the need to start the hike at 5am. Amazing sunset AND sunrise here !!

name: Mechanics Chay
description: Good Place, when you have trouble with your Rig doesn’t matter if it’s a small or big one. The Boss is super helpful and has a lot of experience.

name: Banrural atm - Cajero
description: Atm here - seems easier to park and less of queue than the main shopping street. Wd 2000q no problema

name: La Chasah
description:
Good restaurant and Parking
Un bon restaurant à proximité des museo de la capitale

name: Las Tejas
description: Excellent restaurant. Road for Copan (Honduras). Big parking area.

name: Finca La Escondida
description: Excellent place for camping, have security, bathrooms, mini houses if you dont like camping. Jose is a security for the place, he is a nice person.

name: Rancho alegre
description: Very clean and open restaurant. They have a great menu and a family cooking food. Enough parking for big rigs. Clean washrooms and wifi to get work done

name: Farmacia El Ahorro
description: Alternative Place (pharmacy) to pay Guatemala TIP fee if Bank is closed. We arrived at Border the day after xmas so Bank was closed. So our helper took us to this place which is an agency for the Bank

name: Potable Water to refill your tank
description: Potable Water to refill your tank. 5 Qtz for 20 L. They wash your tank before refill it with potable water. You can stop in front (not big space but ok). Friendly and good service.

name: Tres Picachas
description: Very popular local swimming hole. Passed by on a Sunday afternoon and it was packed with cars down by the river, and several cars and even a school bus parked up on the road! Lots of people swimming and barbecuing by the water. Sign posted stating 5 quetzales pp ($0.66 USD) + 5 more quetzales for parking.

name: Big and quiet private parking
description: 100 meters away from road (still earing a little bit the noise of traffic but ok), you can park here for the night in a private parking closed at night. Flat, no shadow, ok just for one night on the road. A few trash. You probably can park your camper here for many days if you are going to Linvingston. Prizes started at 75 GTQ/day but we get it at 40 GTQ/night after bargaining and telling that we will leave at 8 am. Prize are 40 GTQ for day parking, 40 GTQ for nights, 80 GTQ for 24 hours. No services. Very friendly owner speak a very little english. Ask at restaurant at entrance.

name: Amazing balneario
description:
Wonderful Balneario, with waterslides, access to the river. We are cyclists and we were allowed to camp on the premises for 18Q, only Balneario is 12Q per person. Employees asked us for 30Q, but we agreed with the boss on 18Q, maybe because we arrived late 

Very quiet place at night.

name: public picnic spot
description:
We slept here one night in front of the lake, it’s a picnic spot so some locals come here to swim and eat, but it was very quiet at night. 
We met 2 police officers when we arrived and asked permission to stay, and it was ok. Enjoy the place it’s close to shops and restaurants.

name: Laundry Shalom
description: Full service 5Q per pound ready same day.

name: TECNISER Coban
description:
Very friendly mechanic ! They took time to find our problem, to check the whole engine. Then there was an educational where they explained all to us. I highly recommend going there, had issue on our Astro Chevy and made 2 others place before finding this one.
Charged us 200Q for everything.

name: Quiet street
description: It’s a quiet street near the center. No traffic at night. The market is at 10-12 minutes from there. No services, no water, just a street where you can park for free. We slept two nights here without problems. Very friendly people here who invited us at home! There is a bakery right in front of us.

name: La Torre supermercardo
description: This supermarket we think is better than one in town. Plenty of parking and other stores here too such as pharmacy

name: Aldea Canaán
description: Cell chips, phones, flashlight, chargers. Electronics

name: Autobel
description:
This family business (with Alfonso 'always there' Beltranena, his brother Ricky and their father) specializes in 'traditional' vehicles. The father has been here for 60 years, the sons all their life. There's a lot of mechanical knowledge in all of the people that work here. They're well connected and know where to source parts, quickly. Themselves interested in extended travel, this is a shop that won't treat you like "we'll never see this traveler again, so why bother?"

Alfonso uses WhatsApp, Messenger, but also Signal: +502 4646 9122. Spanish and a little English. Carmen responds to their email: autobel@hotmail.es.

name: Grutas de Cunen
description: Very nice place we park in front of a little house with a store. We pay Q15 for parking and Q15 for the night to sleep in our Camper. We have to walk 15 min down to get to the grutas. We pay Q15 for adults and Q10 for kids to enter the grutas. Nice natural water spring with natural pools.

name: Lavanda Guatemala
description: One of the best views at Lake Atitlan. It is a Lavender farm that does tours for 60Q per person including lavender tea and a yummy croissant. I also purchased some lavender honey that is absolutely delicious. The owners are a very nice french couple that also speak English. They also allowed us to stay overnight in our van. The parking is gated in so felt very safe.

name: Turismo y Guardabosques
description:
This the place where you register and pay for climbing Agua. Some pressure to book a guide for GTQ 350. We declined: the track is well marked with yellow arrows and dots. They want you to report back when you're done.

Parking is a problem in this town.

name: Guatemalan kids
description:
We craved a quiet spot on the beach, looked at satellite pictures and came here. It's at the far end of the village Champerico.

We were immediately invited to camp in one of three private back yards. We chose the one closest to the ocean. We were flocked by children who wanted to play, swim, boat-ride, catch crabs, cook, eat, share their parent's Ceviche with ours. (We did all that.) Parents and other villagers would come by and look at our vehicle. We were happy but exhausted after one afternoon.

Brace yourself: don't come here for peace and quiet.

Paid nothing, but shared all of our beer and soft drinks with the villagers.

name: El viejo Café
description: Very good Coffee and bread from a swiss baker as well as the best wifi we had in hole antigua

name: Acatenango tour - Asoava tours
description: Here is the location for the headquarters of asoava tours , they will take you up the volcano. It is cheaper than booking in Antigua. You can camp here the night and leave your vehicle while you go up the mountain. It is 4-5 hours up on the first day. They have tents without sleeping gear but mattresses are included. The view of Fuego volcano erupting is amazing. You walk down the next morning. Well worth the walk. Call Catalionos on What’s app: +502 5500 4707 for more information.

name: End of Franja Transversal del nrte
description: end of road. dont trust google maps.  road is fully washed out. use the road through yalanhuitz which is 4x4 high clearance track only..

name: solarguat.com
description:
Equipment for solar systems, excellent service, easy access, good prices and variety. They inform you well regarding installation.
Highly recommended.
We acquired lithium batteries 12V 200 AH

Equipos para sistemas solares, excelente servicio, fácil acceso, buenos precios y variedad. te orientan al respecto de instalaciones 
Recomendadisimos 
nosotros adquirimos baterías de litio 12V 200 AH

name: Lower slope of Chicabal
description:
This spot is on the side of secondary road leading to a small village below. It's public terrain (we asked several passerbys) and is used for camping by locals (fire pit, garbage (which we collected)). It is very visible. Leveling our vehicle was difficult.

We arrived at 2:00 pm, cooked and ate a meal (outside) and we were acknowledged by almost all (slow moving) traffic. The whole village must have known we were there. After sunset, the traffic died down but picked up again at 6:00 am. Nobody bothered us all night.

It may not be the best, but we chose this place because it's not as high (and cold or windy) as the ones nearer the top of Chicabal, which was hidden in clouds this afternoon.

Very poor Claro and Tigo signals.

name: Private jungle
description:
Before leaving Guatemala, we wanted to see Quetzals in trees (instead of wallets) but we were too late to camp at the Refugio.

This iOverlander waypoint is at a Tienda and restaurant, owned by entrepreneur Manuel (cell, WhatsApp: +502 4015 1551), who offered us a flat spot in the forest on his property (5 minutes by 4x4, high clearance and low gear, 15 minute walk from the Tienda). The site is easy to find at N 14.92993, W 091.87842, at 1713 meters altitude, but the road there is closed with a chain right behind the Tienda.

The camping area is not big and in between trees: shade all day. Quetzals to be seen in the trees. On Sunday, we hiked (with Manuel) to a mirador and a river. There's access to a waterfall which we did not visit.

Manuel enjoys the company of foreigners and likes to practice his English. He's thinking of developing the site and have bathrooms and more flat space.

name: El Tipo Gas Station
description:
Seems to be a brand new gas station (not visible on google street view). Open 24 hours with security. They let us stay the night. Leveled parking.
Litlle shop with possibly some food available and clean toilets. 
Gas station takes credit card.

name: Propane bottle refill
description: Propane bottle refill next to taller Autobel. There is a propane place that refilled my bottle/cylinder. We found it walking through the mechanic Autobel. But there must be an access from the road. Fair price.

name: Hostal Casa Bethel
description: A clean, comfortable, cheap simple hostel, for 125 quetzals/person, room with private bathroom. Secure, locked  parking for motorcycles and a few cars in front. Close to El Calvario church up a hill, and walking distance to main square.

name: Hostal Casa Vieja
description:
Very nice, clean with A/C rooms for 190Q. Secure parking inside, huge patio with hammocks and fruit trees. Nice cafe/restaurant in the patio. Owner Leonel is so kind and helpful.
Electric shower, warmer water if you regulate for less water to come out.
Near bakery, pharmacy, grocery stores, and the main square. A nice stop before or after crossing the border with Honduras (60km). Big rigs won't have clearance to pass the entrance gate.Signs inside rooms say no pets are allowed.

name: Herrería el martillo en las palmas
description: Very good mechanic if you need a muffler he can fabricate one in no time for very cheap… we needed a new one and he charged us 60.00$ to do it and put it one.. very pleasant

name: cajero electrónico
description:
ATM for visa & mastercard in the shell fuel station, outskirts of Iztapa

servicio de cajero electrónico visa MasterCard en la gasolinera shel a las afueras de Iztapa

name: ATM Cajero 5B
