Nourriture excellente(les meilleurs camarones qu on ait jamais mangé! ) comptez tout de meme 15$ par plat. Parking,douches, piscine gratuits en prenant le repas . Il y a trois chiens sur place mais le propriétaire acctroisles animaux. Eau potable disponible.

name: La Tigra National Park, centro visitantes Jutiapa
description: Very well maintained area with big parking lot. Also have special areas to set tents. The park is very big and have like 6 to 8 different trails very well marked that you could do by foot by yourselve. We made the Esperanza and Cascada trails  (both like 10 kilometers in 3.5 hours). The road is very well maintained (we do it in a compact front wheel drive car) a few step hills. We paid 250 lempiras (like $11) for the entrance and for camping one night for two people. It's a beautiful park if you enjoy the nature.

name: Parking lot between petrol station and restaurant
description: Parking lot a little off the highway, between Puma service station and restaurant, across the street from police station. Very quiet from 20-6h, might be noisier on weekend nights. Sun and shade, level, rubbish, felt very safe. Free.

name: Parking lot next to restaurant
description:
Level gravel lot a little off (and invisible from) the highway. At night they close the entrance (with a simple fence,  no high-security measures). Sun only, no shade. The lot does not belong to the (pretty fancy) restaurant but rather to the family living in the barn-like shed right by the entrance. I left them 20 L. Had a very quiet night, felt safe.
Coming from Tegucigalpa and heading for Valle de Angeles, turn left about 500m after the Santa Lucia turnoff.
Room enough for an aircraft carrier or two.

name: Centro de Servicio
description: Garage has multiple lifts.  Mechanics seem to know what they're doing.  I had wheel bearings replaced in a Ford F250.  Took them a day to get the parts from San Pedro Sula. They couldn't get grease caps so they made them. Price was a fraction of what the job would cost in the US. No English is spoken.

name: Centro Turistico Sambo Creek
description:
Small concrete level parking lot right by the beach. Next door is Centro Turistico Sambo Creek, run by TouristOptions agency in La Ceiba.
This is where boats leave for trips to Cayos Cochinos. Call ahead to TouristOptions to find out about sailings/schedules, minimum five people. Paid about 950 for a half day snorkeling trip which was great. Left the van here during the day and slept here two nights in the van. Busy with (friendly, respectful) locals, especially around 7 in the morning and after sunset, but absolutely quiet at night.
I was reassured (and, at some point convinced) that the car was safe here, and that nothing had ever happened to any car here before.
Local watchman kept an eye on the car, asked for a little tip, so he got 80 for two days and nights.
Parking is free, probably even when not booking a trip to the keys. Neighbours offered to use their water tap and toilet hut. And then you still got the Centro Turistico bathrooms which the watchman will open for you on demand.
Beach is nothing special. Saltwater spray to the car is not too bad.
One big rig should fit, but locals will be curious. Access road thru town is bumpy.

name: Island Shipping
description: Shipping agency to ship your car or truck to Roatan. Four sailings a week. vehicle only, no passengers. Should you insist to drive your vehicle onboard, you have to be at the dock around 4 am for loading. Arrival at Roatan same day around noon. Cost for a VW bus: 8100L return.

name: Nice lot between houses
description: This is a nice, pretty flat lot next to a comedor, surrounded by trees and (then) a few houses. You won't have the place to yourself but it's reasonably quiet during the day, dead quiet after 20h. At night a few trucks might join you, so you're better off in the slightly higher lot. Good overnight stop. Facilities probably during opening hours at restaurant but didn't check. Free.

name: Wide open field infront of orphanage
description: Large grass/dirt field about the size of a football field (and right next to one). Pretty level, no shade. The christian-gringo-run orphanage centre is not operating, so no kids. Parked right next to the entrance/guard hut. Friendly guys, let me use bathroom. Area is not fenced-in, no security guard at night (sleeps in a house about 200m away. Very quiet. 13'C at night. Restaurant next door. Free.

name: Ferreteria parking lot
description: Level concrete parking lot of Ferreteria Santa Fe and Fremoni's Café (coffee, breakfast, sweets, wifi). Right by the highway, can't miss it. Out of town (San Jeronimo), so it's quiet (apart from a little passing traffic). Watchman on duty at night, felt very safe. Toilet and shower available. Free.

name: Hotel Antigua Comayagua
description: Large secure parking lot that could accommodate truck camper when needed a few nights not boondocking. Moderate price includes breakfast. Two blocks from historic central plaza.

name: Hotel y Restaurante Mario Chavez
description: Stayed here for one night (850HNL) in a nice, clean room with A/C. Nice  family owned place. Good restaurant. Safe parking. Stayed with a Toyota Landcruiser of 2,20m height.

name: Petrol Station
description: We filled our Propan gas tank. They use it for the cars.  Cheapest Propan of all our travel in South America for 14 month.  Very friendly staff.

name: Macaw Rescue Center
description: Highly recommend to visit. They take care of injured macaws and try to set them free again. We had a very interesting tour with guide who was included in the price of 10 US$ (July 2018: no guide, but plenty of signs in English so you can learn lots of interesting stuff about the birds. Price still $10)

name: Tropical Inn
description: 600L/$30 per room per night. 55km away from the border with El Salvador. Large secure parking, shops and restaurants walking distance away. Large rooms with en suite bathrooms (cold water, obviously). AC, TV and clean.

name: Texas Guesthouse
description: nice and comfortable place. we payed 800 Lempiras for 2 Person. The owner helps a lot with tips and stuff you need. A little breakfast is also included. Internet is a little tricky. Water is really warm and the rooms have enough space and Power supplies.

name: PUMA gaz station
description: Perfect place to overnight, 25 minutes before el salvador border. Big flat secured area with table, tree for shadow, WC, kind of shower, small shop. As usual, quite noisy. Price free.

name: Puma Gas Station
description: Gas Station. Security at night. Toilets close at 23 h with the shop. Be prepared for the loud music from the restaurant. Price: free

name: Palmira Hostel
description: Great hostel with amazing staff. 220L per person in the dorm and 5$ the hammock. 200L pp just to park and access (April 2022). Large, clean facility with strong wifi. Very minimal parking, our truck/camper was on the street with 2 cameras watching over it.

name: Estacion de servicio
description:
You can fill pots and tank here. Very fast We pay for a 25lbs bottle 180lamp


Se puede llenar boteillas y tank aqui. Muy rapid
Pagamos por una boteilla de 25lbs 180lempira

name: Casa Encantada
description: Not a backpackers or campsite but a very nice and new upscale  hotel for L1150 (hearty breakfast included) in Danli. Not much choice in town. They have a large secure parking and a gorgeous patio. Good internet...perfect to relax before or after the border crossing.

name: Hotel Doamar
description: Nice Hotel for L500 for a double room . Good internet, large gated parking. Noisy road but a good stop after the long gravel road from Olanchito to Danli

name: Roatan Backpackers Hostal
description: Very nice hostal run by the friendliest person (Mel). She is very welcoming and will give you all tips about the island. Nice atmosphere and place

name: Shark Dive
description: Amazing shark-feeding scuba dive near Coxen Hole. Operation is dodgy though and price is high at 100USD for the crappy boat which took 40mins to start the engine for our return. Having said that, the actual shark experience is very thrilling! I guess the boat trip is more dangerous than the sharks...

name: Police check point
description: standard police checkpoint. nice people. very professional.

name: Casa Blanca
description: Best Deal on Utila 20$ for a Double room with private bathroom, the owner is very Nice and helped us in any Kind of problem.

name: San Rafael Cafe
description: Restaurant with espresso bar, grow their own coffee, produce local cheeses including Gouda and manchego and many more. Breakfast ranges from 120-180L including coffee. Many fancy grilled cheese sandwiches, cheese/meat trays, bruschetta, and wine. Pretty garden setting. Also sell bagged coffee (whole bean and ground), bottled beer, and packages of their cheese.

name: Aside El Naranjo arqueological site
description: Parked just outside the parking lot of El Naranjo arqueological site. Felt safe; very quiet.

name: Comayagua San Francisco Park
description: We stayed here two nights. Very lovely colonial town. Free parking aside the park, just in front of school. Safe!

name: Danli Central Park
description: Nice little town with very friendly locals. We stayed here two nights after entering from Nicaragua. Loved this place! Free parking and free public wifi from the plaza.

name: Fresh Bakery & Cafe
description: Serve breakfast and lunch Mon-Sat. Bake everything on site and it's all good. Egg breakfast for 110-140, bagels start at 60, lunch 120-150 (sandwiches and salads). Espresso bar, fresh juices and teas, smoothies.

name: Balneario Los Lobos
description: Beautiful balneario right on the river. This part of Rio Cangrejal is perfect for swimming. The grounds and facilities are well-kept. Clean but simple flush toilets and cold showers. There are picnic palapas with bbq pits. Lots of space under the trees for campers or smaller RV’s. It’s about a mile before the Pico Bonito visitor center and river lodges, so it’s close to hiking and rafting. There were only a few people there on the weekend and none during the week. The entrance gate is on the right with a small sign that says Balneario Los Lobos, if it’s locked and no one is around, inquire at the house directly across the road. Enrique, the caretaker, lives there and will open it up for you. Enrique and the owner, David, are lovely people and checked on us regularly to see if we needed anything. There are electric outlets at the palapas, but we didn’t use them, so not sure if they would want extra money or not. There is also a water spigot at each palapa. No wifi or tigo available. 100 lempira per person/per night. We checked out all the other camping options in the area, and for us this was definitely the best!!

name: Gran Hotel Yadaly
description: we camped in their parqueo next to the swimming pool.  we got them down to 350L for the night, including use of the pool and facilities. Fairly good WiFi near the building and nice friendly people. they let us hook up our electric at the bar. the showers are open showers next to the pool.

name: Hotel Isis
description: Small hotel just a short drive from the border with Nicaragua. L300 for a single room with no AC. Rooms with AC and larger beds available. Wifi cuts in and out but when it works it's a decent speed. During my stay there were power surges which ruined most of the lights in the rooms, also some TVs, smelled of electrical fire. Secure parking just around the corner for vehicles.

name: Propane
description: Filled our 20 gallon removable propane tank. Charged 225 lempira

name: Carnitas nia Lola
description: Really groovy cool bar with good food a huge personality. Must visit!

name: Agua Purificadora La Gotita
description: Agua purificada. 24L (1USD) to fill our 20 litres container.

name: Crossing El Salvador - Honduras border close to Perquin
description: We drove all the way to this crossing point thinking of reaching La Esperanza, in Honduras, just to find out that these border officers couldn't  deal with our foreign car's paperwork (the exit stamp). We had to drive back and head to El Amantillo.

name: Paradise Divers
description:
diving school
free accomodation with course or 2tank dive
very basic simple room with shared bathroom and small outdoorkitchen
all equipment and gear are a bit worn down
the prices 58us$ for 2 tank dive
35us$ for nightdive
258us$ for a openwater course

name: Casa Tina
description:
I asked around when I arrived late in this area. People recommended me Argentina's (that is her name) house. If you want to feel like living the real Honduras you will be at the right place. Accommodation is simple but has everything you need. Shower, sink and wide bed. From the window you can look down the nearby river. Little town in 5min walking distance. I had my motorbike parked close to the house but space is very limited. Cars can maybe park outside. Just ask around... The lady is really nice and she was taking good care of me. We didn't really speak about a price. I gave her 500 Lempiras which included the room and food for the time I stayed. She seemed to be quite happy with that. Note: This is a family stay and to much of negotiating can be considered rude. Just enjoy being part of the family for a while...
Tel: 97939190

name: Angeli Gardens
description:
Cool place to spend a day.  The only place in San Pedro Sula for RVs.
Restaurant , Craft Brewery, hiking trails and Ziplines on site. Enjoy the manicured gardens and very safe and friendly enviroment.
Welcome!

name: Multiplaza Mall
description: Spent one night on the parking lot if this upscale mall, with a Walmart/Paiz supermarket (the food court has some wifi). Asked first the security guy about staying overnight, and he agreed without hesitation. Felt very safe, security around all night. The parking lot is not big, and mostly covered, but there was one spot suitable for our 28' camper just on the left at the entrance.

name: La Colina Hotel
description: Simple but nice budget hotel with parking for cars and motorcycles. Had a lovely room in the second floor. The once downstairs looked a little bit run down. Paid 280 which seemed to be alright. The town is quiet and there is like 0 tourists here. So it makes you feel like being really in Honduras...

name: Ranchitos Manglares Restaurant Parking
description:
ADMIN NOTE: WARNING!!! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution. 

Update! Our truck was just broken into. They busted the passenger door lock and almost broke the driver door lock. Luckily nothing was stolen. Just a heads up. A nice place but keep your eye on your vehicle.

name: taller mecanico electrónico
description:
best place in town: "cheap well and fast" quote by a canadian expat living in la ceiba / roatan. we ran into that guy there. he had his car checked there. our alternator was gone just before leaving to roatan, so i asked around for a good place in town. it is qute easy to miss i hope gps was right but it seemed like it, you will see cars with open hoods in the street you found it. a white board above the shack names it. it has a green spot across the street and to its one side. you can park on the street, where there is plenty of space for bigger rigs too. 
there were plenty of taxis pulling in too.

my spanish is not the best and the guy running the place was speeking fast honduran spanish but we were able to cope. je repeated multiple times, usually just saying the 1st word slowly but he was patient. he looked over every car quickly diagnosed and then one of his assistants would do the job, but he looked over everyones shoulder, had them redo stuff if he thought it needed to. 
they had pleanty of alternator pieces lying around and did all sorts of messy looking cable work and aperently they do all car works. trannys and motorblocks we lying around, too. he did not have my alternator but he drove around town and ordered it for the afternoon. just the interior piece, not the whole case and they put it back together. so it cost me rougly 20us$ work and 30us$ for the piece (i payed in Lempira) (i have an american f250, cheapest alternator i found online to ship within the us was 100us$)

good work, nice guys, cheap! to conclude this long text, sorry.

i did not have my cell to take pictures, but they had a chevrolet truck from the 2000s opened dash board. cables everywhere it lokked like a pess but they were not tired to rewire and repair the fault, i was impressed, never seen anyone so clearminded an determined about so many cables to check and rewire. (his main assistent did that)

name: Gualaco-Instituto de conservación forestal
description:
Just a safe place to stay for the night. The caretaker let us in and allowed us to camp.
Very friendly but not yet accustomed to tourists. 
Shops and restaurants in town.
We gave 50lemp propina.

name: Sambo Creek Free Camp
description: Public gravel parking with no obligations to any restaurant, hotel or people to ask.  Free. No services, gate or rifle-man. Walking distance to some streetfood. More then enough space and easy access for all rigs. Quiet and peaceful.

name: Fruits control
description: We were stopped by a fruit control from La Ceiba to Trujillo. Bananas were OK but oranges and apples not. They allowed us to eat them all on the side of the road.

name: Hotel La Caxa Real in Gracias
description: Very nice, clean hotel with fast WiFi and warm showers. Price is in the medium to lower range with great value. Private parking off the street. Walkable to town center but tuk tuk is only 10L. Gracias is on the smaller scale in terms of city size. I spent only 1 night here.

name: Caserio Valuz Country Inn
description: Very cosy place, there are rooms and dorms and Jorge will probably let you camp if you ask. Rooms are pricy but you should ask for a discount. The dorms are priced ok.

name: Hotel La Guadalupe
description: Clean, quiet location with off street, gated parking. 750L for one night for one adult. This includes a room with air conditioning, TV and WiFi. WiFi speeds are average but reception is poor in the rooms. I would say this is a mid to upper quality hotel for a good price.

name: Balneario Los Cipreces
description:
Nice and quiet overnight place on the grassy shady parkinglot. As we stayed here midweeks, they cleaned the pools and the restaurant was closed. So it was extremely quiet ;). Seems to be busy on weekends.
We agreed to pay 200L/night/2 people.

name: Hotel Guanacos- Gracias
description: Great hotel run by a Dutch owner, double room with bathroom $35 USD, comfortable beds, clean and nice rooms, hot showers, fast wifi, beautiful gardens, good restaurant and great views over the town, secure parking, highly recommended. Worth the money. May be possible to stay in your vehicle in parking lot with access to toilet facilities, we didn't ask, as we needed a break from camping. Big rigs may have trouble turning into parking lot.

name: El Restaurante de Julio
description: A good restaurant on the main road into Valle de Angeles: coming from Santa Lucia, on the left hand side, right before crossing the bridge that leads you into town. Julio has an amazing garden area where tents and RVs can fit. Bathrooms available, no shower but a big cold water container available if you want to take a shower with buckets. Julio is super friendly and he'll tell you everything about the little nice town. No night life here. There's a guard that stays starting from 8pm when the restaurant closes.

name: Fruit Check NORTHBOUND
description: Coming from south there's a checkpoint, fruits and tomatos are forbidden, all other vegetables are fine.

name: Mado's Hotel
description: 20 dolars for twin room. Very clean with safe parking. The cheapest we found in the city. Rooms are spacy, with air conditioner. Parking soace is big enough for any size but there maybe a height restriction in the entrance. We parked our bikes even under a shelter. Wifi is average but working for most needs. There is potable water in the garden. Very close to wendy's to eat great burgers :) absolutely loved this place.

name: Hotel Mejia Batres
description:
250L for 2 people 1 night. safe parking behind gate. 
ok wifi but only near reception.
not super clean but ok for a night.

name: Tipicos Papusas Juanita
description: Great little restaurant, very friendly family establishment. L20 papusas and bebidas. Other food offered as well. On right hand side when heading uphill put of the city.  Mirador a la cuidad tambien.

name: Cuevas de Taulabé (cave)
description:
Really cool cave. The first 300 meter has lumination and has a foot path. After that you have to have flashlight and are supposed to hire a guide. But you can climb around a little yourself.
the entrance is 4 USD or 96L.
h
open from 8 to 4 every day.

name: Cascada el Ensueños
description:
70 meter high waterfall. 1-1,5 hour hike through dense jungle. We were there all alone. The trail is in bad condition and there has been many landslides. to get on to the trail  you have to climb up the side of the road about 10 meter away from the original trailhead.
there is another waterfall even further up the trail but we were hot and hungry to turned back at the first.
it's an adventure.

name: Hotel Victoria
description:
Cheap hotel with a grumpy old man in the reception. The rooms were clean. No wifi. we payed 300L for 2 persons 1 night.
no private parking but we could park 2 bikes in the reception.

name: Parking of canopy extreme, La Campa
description:
Unlevel (you probably need levelers) simple but big  parking outside of the canopy. Steep rough track to reach it. We arrived a saturday in June, no one around. I quess there are only people around the canopy if some one is doing a canopy ride. No office or other facilities. Asked police in La Campa. Consider overnight stay safe. You are high above La Campa and there is view towards the mountains and canyon.
Very quiet. Free.

name: Public Balnearia in Rio Lindo
description: A public river access site in the town of Rio Lindo. As all public sites in Central America some litter. Depending on where you park and the size of vehicle you are not or a little visible from the road. A country road, though, and very quiet during night. No facilities but close to small shops and eating places in town. We asked both locals and the nearby police if the place is safe for overnight. They all considered it safe. During a weekday it was very quiet, I guess weekends can be different. Free.

name: Guanacasco Restaurante Tipicos
description: good tip thanks. great food, friendly guy. we stopped for lunch on our way to Gracias. Had we been later in the day we would have asked to park-up for the night. big flat grassy area suitable for all size vehicles and tents. There are clean toilets outside the main restaurant (didn't see shower) I can't imagine the nice guy would refuse a night stop.

name: A cote du park municipal
description:
Quiet and pleasant place to cross the border. Place of the village, next to the church, the neighbors are friendly.

Endroit calme et agreable avant de passer la frontiere . Place du village , a cote de l eglise , les voisins sont bienveillants.

name: Posada Sandra
description:
22 dollars a night, two people in a big room with ac, wifi, water, private bath and secure parking. Clean.

Downstairs is a great and cheap restaurant. Good coffee, great steak, amazing chocolate cake.

Friendly owner and room for lots of bikes, cars and big rigs.

name: Pirate islands divers
description:
Organised dive and snorkel trips to Cayos Cochinos Islands. Also does dive courses.

info@pirateislandsdivers.com

name: Chez Milady
description:
Nice bungalow style apartments 10 minutes out of town, in the forest, owned by an eccentric Honduran artist who decorated all apartments with her nice paintings There are a variety of rooms, from standard double hotel rooms to small and large apartments with kitchens and living room areas. All rooms have a deck with chairs and hammocks, as well as private baths. Some have AC which is $5 USD extra per night. 

We stayed at a small apartment with a kitchenette including a stove, oven, sink and fridge, plus all cooking utensils and a dining table. We paid 40 USD per night, an awesome deal. Cooking at a real kitchen was a nice change of pace from our camping setup. Everything is well designed, clean and very nice. Some apartments can accommodate up to 6. Book online at booking.com. Or call and make a reservation directly and the owner Milady will discount your price by 15%, same as the commission to booking.com.  

Since it's a little out of town, its best to rent a bicycle or motor scooter for transport. It's also pretty easy to hitch  rides on motorcycles or quad bikes.

name: Pico Bonito Centro de Visitantes
description: Entrance fee for the 3-hours-hiking to the beautiful waterfall El Bejuco is 8usd or 180hnl pPers. Parking overnight is save, quiet and for free.

name: Rio Coto hotel and restaurant
description: Restaurant with large Parking lot and area near beach to park overnight.  Decent but old bathrooms at the restaurant. No showers, no electric. Free wifi at restaurant. Nice small pier. Good Breeze and safe. . There is pool onsite, bit green, but they were filling it while here.Sheep on premises. Careful of the big one, head butted our 4 year old.  Beach is very dirty with litter. But, guy from hotel was out there raking all day and had half cleaned before we left. Price is very negotiable, we paid 50L per person, kids free.  Didn't see any services for fishing or diving nearby. Area rather run down.

name: Tela gas
description: Tela gas Fills propane cars here and has tanks. They have one truck "Eco gaz" that can refill canisters. It's not always here.  We chased the truck down and caught him just down the street as he was driving away.  Refilled on side of road for us. Phone number is 2440-5061/2440-5565/ 3178-5072.

name: Caserio Valuz
description:
Zambrano, where I live, is around 1 hour North West of Tegucigalpa, in the countryside. It is half way between Tegucigalpa, the capital and Comayagua, the ex-capital of Honduras, more or less in the center of the country, half way from the Bay Islands, Copan and Nicaragua. Directions: 1,5 kms Camino a La Catarata Escondida. Zambrano, Francisco Morazan. 
Buses from the North to Tegucigalpa, on the main highway, get off by the 1st pedestrian´s bridge or from Tegucigalpa to the North, by the 3rd pedestrian´s bridge, in the town of Zambrano at km 33, at the "Camino a la Catarata Escondida" (way to the hidden waterfall), named as well "Carretera al batallon" (road to the battalion), or calle empedrada (cobbled street), then 16 minutes walking or 5 minutes by a small moto taxi for 15.00 Lempiras to Caserio Valuz, my home. If you call me when just getting here, I would pick you up as well, cellular phone 99964294. The country code for Honduras is 504.

name: behind Lagolandia
description: in Lagolandia there are 2 restaurants and between them there is a dirt road (no 4x4 needed, ground is solid), you drive by them and to the right and get right at the lake, amazing view and swimming spot, we arrived early in the morning and asked the ladys if we could pass, the lady said we could if we bought something, 2 coffees after we were in paradise, we later spoke to the place admin who allowed to stay for the night, there is also a guard at night, safe and private land

name: SIAN KAAN
description: Beautiful secure grounds offers ample space and amenities. includes outdoor kitchen, pool, sauna, and cabanas. Close to the ruins. Walk to Centro 10 min.

name: Puma gas station
description: We asked the guard to overnight. Cost 5usd but we needed to leave before 6 am. Not the most beautiful spot but we wanted a safe place. There were some trucks spending the night as well and the armed guard stays all night.

name: Wild camping Grotto parking
description: Grassy spot next to the grotta (chapel carved in mountain). Nice view over town. However, we advise not to sleep here, but go to the central plaza (church), in front of the police station instead. We slept at the Gruta  but at night some young guys came, started fighting with each other and throwing stones, until people who live there must have called the police. We were never bothered, but it could have been different. Driving of was tricky as it was a one way street and we would have to pass the troublemakers.

name: Zeta Gas
description: On the right side of the road, large trucks ok. They have the adaptor to fit American style propane tanks to refill.

name: Centro Turistico Diana's Sport
description: Best stop by far in the area (as there's not really much else around currently). We walked up and asked if we could park and sleep in our vehicle, they said of course. It's almost like a mini RV park anyway, there's a restaurant (really good food) and bar, pool with slides (almost like a water park), a zip line, kids mini train, swings, gazebos to eat or relax at. We parked on the grass lawn at the back, which was nice and quiet. They didn't charge us for camping, but we ate and drank at the resturaunt and used the pool which is 100 lp /adult or 60 lp/kid. The owner and workers were extremely friendly and happy to help and thought more overlanders would be great. It's a unique dream for the area the owner has and is continuing work on. Give them some business and continue this spot for overlanders. Should be easy to spot it has red,yellow, green gate and huge yellow tire advertising for the canopy.

name: Bahia
description: We just asked if we could park overnight and the manager said yes it was fine, it's a resturaunt that closes at 10p but they had a security guard all night. They just asked for 50lp so we gave them that and a tip and bought food and drinks, which were both really good. It is a nice beachfront resturaunt and the staff we're all really nice... hopefully they would do a similar thing for others again.

name: Copan Ruins
description:
Here is the ruins. Parking is free. Entrance is 345 Lempiras per person (foreign tourist) for just the ruins. 

Tunnels and museum is extra. Rummar is that the tunnels are not worth the extra money. You will find guides here as well. 

We have read that they are a good idea, but they are a little too expensive for us today.

name: Taller De Radiadores Salgado
description:
About 5 radiator repair and make shops in a row.

Took my motorcycle radiator here which needed to be cut up to fix a leak and cleaned out of the pepper I used to plug the leak.

Took a couple of hours costs was 350L

name: Campamento Armadillo
description: We passed this place, which is slightly further down the road than this spot (200m closer to Las Naranjas). Didn't stop in but has flat area for camping and a pool. Alternative if Finca Paradise is full.  Looked nice but no idea of other details

name: Sagastume -tyres and express mechanic
description: Stopped in here concerned about our suspension. They were very professional, courteous and helpful and friendly.

name: banco atlantico
description: a bank with an atm--has a parking lot and security guard. the atm door for the atm is separate from bank door. use your atm card to get in. no transaction fees.

name: Parqueo
description: Parking in Central Comayagua, just down from the Central Park. Secure overnight 10 Lempiras per hour.

name: El Estoraque
description: Amazing food. I read about this place in one of my travel guide books and thought we should try it since our hotel restaurant food is not to brag about. We ordered one meat and one seafood parilladas and both are amazing. Please try this place, super clean and she's a wonderful cook. Mom's home cooking is what you taste here. The pickled veg is out of this world ( complimentary ).

name: Riverside Parking
description: Large rocky platform next to the riverside with a 4WD path going down (presumed boat launch for rafting company). Don't recommend during the rainy season. Can't hardly see the campsite from the road, but would still recommend setting up camp after dark. Police station just down the way-seems relatively safe, and free!

name: Taller Los Hermanos
description: Super friendly workers. The place is run by Bryan and his father, a Honduran family. They are very helpful and determined to solve your issues. We spent three hours at their workshop due to many small issues and they only asked for 500L for a great job. Place might look a little shabby but it is safe.

name: Fuente de Vida
description: Very helpful family business. Garafons of water C$68

name: Guide for Montana Santa Barbara
description:
Even though the access to Montana Santa Barbara is free, it is highly recommended to take a guide (the paths are not signalized).
The spot indicated is Leonel Chavez's house, the only guide on this side of the mountain, and who is really good.
With him you can arrange tours for going to the top of the mountain, birdwatching, etc.
His coordinates are :
(504) 3206 7319
panamosab@hotmail.com

If you're staying at Cortijo del Lago, his son works there and can help you arranging the meeting.
We did a birdwatching tour, and we managed to see quetzals (the price was 250L per person).

To go there, you can either climb with your car (4x4 recommended, we didn't manage to climb all the way in rainy season with our 2WD Chevy van), or park in the adjacent city of Las Vegas at the main park, and from there take a collectivo up to El Cedral, asking for Leonel (he's well-known). Price is 20L per person per way

name: Cuarentena/Pet Paperwork
description: Elevated train car, ask for SEPA; 625 -ish Honduran for two dogs; they take lunch at noon, so get there early

name: Padillar. Agente aduanera
description:
Padillar’s offices are at Bo. Copen 9- 10 Calle, 1 Avenida cuadra y media antes del centro penal. Puerto Cortes. 

Teléfono 2665-3152/5658

Servicioalcliente@agenciapadillar.com

We dealt with Keylin Orellana and Jenny Martínez. 

The Seaboard Honduras details (for the shipping container if Padillar need you to organise this - we did container first, then Customs agent) are San Pedro Sula +504 2553 2044. Ask for Ingrid Regalado or Zuly Pérez.   

Once you are close to shipping you may be better basing yourself in Puerto Cortes as it is a good hour (55km) from San Pedro Sula.

name: Near Tegucigalpa
description: A good place to spend a night near Policía Nacional de Honduras and peaje. Bogota parking. Noisy but secure. Toilets and shower

name: Ivo’s coffee
description: The owner is super friendly and her English is really good. Our dog was more than welcome (she even took a picture to show to potential clients that they are pet friendly). The coffees and shakes are amazing!

name: Bomberos Choluteca
description: Very nice place with welcoming fireman. Quiet and ok for big rigs

name: Tela
description: This is Enrique's home in Tela. He is such a lovely guy who also has his home on airb&b. You can park outside his home for a small fee and use his bathroom and kitchen. He also has a room you can rent. He speaks perfect English and his home is an a quiet and safe part of town. We stayed for 2 nights (in his spare room we found through airb&b) to visit the gardens. His email is bonillaj383@gmail.com or his number is 32 341385 if you want to call him. He is incredibly friendly and helpful!

name: Laundry-  La Casa de Todo
description: A drop off laundry service. There's also laundry service at Iguana Azul, but both of them have the same rate: 20 lempira for one pound, (44 lempira/kg).

name: Hotel Plaza Real
description: Hotel Parking lot within wifi range. Safe and comfortable for our 24' sprinter. They imitially did not want to allow us to park overnight, but then accepted for a 200 lempiras payment for my 2 adults & 3 kids family.

name: Lorendiana Envasados y Dulces
description: A beautiful collection of home canned fruits and vegetables and chutneys and compotes and chili’s and.......  Meet the woman and she will explain the products (in Spanish)

name: Hospital Evangélico (with overnight parking area)
description: Medical services full range. Grassy lower parking area, okay to stay overnight. Received exam, X-ray, blood work, prescriptions and excellent care all for $127 USD. Do not hesitate to stop here if you need anything. No appointment needed. Full care from routine exams to emergency. Even dental and vision on site. Nurses speak Spanish. Doctors speak English. Just tell the guard that you are for a “consulta”. Show id and drive up the hill. Note- google will take you on dirt road to old entrance. Use logic, stay on paved to new entrance gate.

name: Casa Vieja
description: 24$ USD per night 2 people in a good sized, clean room. Did not ask about sleeping in the lot. Large parking lot could fit big rigs and is locked all day and night. Hot water and AC included. Cheap restaurant attached. Didn't try it but there were plenty of locals there and it looked good. Very good wifi. Nice staff even did our laundry for free. Free filtered water for refilling your bottles (not your tanks). Recommended.

name: El Cuco - cerca de la policia
description: At the entrance to El Cuco, next to the police. With good shade. Very quiet and with friendly people.

name: dippsa petrol station
description: we stayed here for a night. the petrol station closes at 9pm but the there is security guard overnight.. safe place and it's free.we gave 50 limpiras to the guard as tip but he never ask for.

name: hotel aventurero
description: parking lot of the hotel. we felt safe. toilets and outside watertap. paid 50 per car. easy going town, all people very friendly.

name: Hotel Casa Blanca
description:
Nice well kept hotel. We asked and they let us sleep in our camper in the parking lot. The entrance gate has a bar, but we had no problems entering with our 3,6m high camper. The parking lot ist not big, but enough space up to medium size rigs.

Apparently we were the first with this unusual requests. They started with 400 Lempiras but quickly agreed with 200. We we're not using their bathroom, not sure if they would agree. The WiFi is good, even inside the Camper. 
The hotel seems to be a bit pricey and was busy with guests.

For us this was a perfect halfway Stop from El Poy (border with El Salvador) to La Ceiba. If you start early at the border, you can make it to here in one day...

name: ATM / Not for german DKB
description:
In utila there are currently two ATMs. This one belongs to the bank Atlantida.
The other one is down the Mainroad to the east (appr. 50m).

Attention: For German Travellers with a DKB Credit Card: This ATM did not work with both our  cards. Comdirect ist working, but a daily maximum limit of 4000 Lempiras.

The ATM down the road east is not working with any of our cards. 

Our diveshop charged 8% Credit Card fee! So you might want to bring cash with you...

name: Utila Medical Center
description:
This is a private doctor/Hospital on Utila with rooms to sleep in case you need to be watched.

The standards are good for Honduras and the Staff knowledgable and friendly. We asked around in town, and everybody recommended them.
Apparently they also do dive examinations in case you need it.
They are open from 8am to 6pm but have a 24/7 emergency contact.

name: L.A. Utila Apartment
description:
Great place to stay. Very friendly owners, nice and clean apartments, great WiFi, nice pool, very hot showers, short walk into town, very quiet.

You can book with Airbnb or booking.com. They will pick you up at the ferry if you let them know when you arrive. We enjoyed a great week here. Much better and cheaper than the diveschool accomodation for a private room. We payed 24Usd/night for a big apartment with  fridge+Microwave and complimentary drinking water. They offer rooms with AC too...
Great WiFi!!!

name: Hotel y Hostal El Almendro
description:
Good place to rest after a long trip. 

The price for a dorm costs 4 to 6 dollars and private room costs 15 dollars (with shared bathroom probably a bit less).

The hotel is 4 streets close to the central park (in a small hill).

The staff are friendly and the place is charming, you can cook there if you wish or eat in their restaurant (depends on what the price could be cheaper or not XD) 

The rooms are clean and they have hot water (not like to cook a chicken), they provide towels and other amenities.

name: Hotel
description:
This is a hotel on the Cay Islands. Perfect to relax after a few days on Utila. Rooms are quiet nice and a double room with private bathroom and hot shower is 30 USD per night. If you want to have A/C it's a bit more. Free Coffee and water. Lunch meal is 7 USD. There's a kitchen where you can cook your own meal. The boat ride from Utila (beside the ferry dock) is 50 lpm per person. You can rent snorkel gear or get a boat ride arranged to the smaller islands nearby. There are restaurants (even a cheaper fast food) and small shops on the Island.
The hotel has a really nice reef in front where you can snorkel.

name: Agua Purificado
description: Place that has Ice and purificated water. They can fill your bottles. 22 per Garaffon.

name: Hotel Guacamayos Backpackers
description:
The hotel offers private rooms with private bathroom for 20 usd and share bathroom for 15 usd, dorms costs 10 usd per person.

The rooms are normally clean but also it seems to be that they don't care to much about maintenance.

The staff were normal but they couldn't provide information about the city.

name: rio santiago
description:
You can literately dine with the hummingbirds! There are loads flying around your head. 
we had lunch here, but you can also stay overnight (don't know about the price). Alex is a friendly guy and showed us the owls that live near the restaurant. There is also a kind of an ozelot cat there which we saw. short trail to a waterfall.

name: Comayagua - san francisco plaza
description: Parking on the place san francisco. Possible plug electricity on the light of the place.

name: Las cuevas de Talgua
description: Visit the cave of Talgua. 500m inside the mountain, beautiful stalagmit and big cathedral at the end. 1h inside. Price: 6 USD for adults, 100 lemp for children and 100 lemp the guide for a group of less than 10 people.

name: Main plaza
description: Central plaza close to the church. Flat place. Busy at the end of the day but quiet at night. Safe.

name: Beack Sambo creek
description:
Pass in front of the differents hotels and park in front of the sea on a grass land. Windy and only the moise of the waves. Free and quiet. The beach is not beautiful. We stay only for the night.

Passez devant les hôtels et se garer sur le  terrain enherbé face à la mer. Brise légère agréable pour la nuit et bruit des vagues. Gratuit et calme. La plage n'a aucun intérêt.  Une nuit suffit.

name: Cucuyagua
description:
On a little cute square with a lot of trees and shadow. Calm, secure and free. 

Sur une agréable petite place verdoyante. Ombre le matin. Calme, secure et gratuit.

name: Rio Mejocote
description:
Wildcamp near the rio. We used it on a dry season. Easy to cross the river with our 2wd. Some garbages as usual. Away from the road, calm. No problem with the security.

Bivouac au bord du rio. Accessible à la saison sèche,  saison humide?? Accès facile, traversée des rio sans prob même avec 2wd. Reculé de la route, calme. pas de prob de sécurité.

name: Minu Super Dinora
description: Well-stocked shop with meat, specialty milks, dairy, alcohol and other essentials.

name: San juan opico
description:
parking of the market MiSuper. A little bit close to the road but quiet at night.
The market close at 8pm and open at 8am.
Guarded.

name: Comayagua Golf Club
description:
Nice staff allowed us to park overnight in the lot after playing on the golf course. We parked near the pool area, where the bathrooms and showers are. It's somewhat level.  The showers are cold-ish but pretty clean. Interesting alternative to parking in city. 

The course is not well groomed, to say it politely (horses sometimes do the grooming in the middle of the fairway), but we looked at it as a challenge. It was affordable fun, and the mountain scenery is gorgeous. We actually played on two weekdays during Semana Santa and only saw one other group playing. So if you're a beginner, you can take your time, mess around, and not have the pressure of other players behind you. 


We entered with our 12' tall camper van. You may hear the peacocks at night.

Pool pass: 100L/person
Golf: 200L/person
Complete set of clubs including push trolley: 200L (they allowed two of us to share a set)
Golf cart (optional): 400L
Bag of ten balls: 50L

name: Guasale
description: Description of crossing from Nicaragua to Honduras.  There will of course be a truck lineup for about 5kms but eventually make your way forward and stop at white building.  Show all vehicle documents and passports.  They will give you Aduana form.  Continue through chaos and find the immigration building aptly labelled "Banco Lafise"?  Man with blue shirt will check aduana form and your vehicle (not much interest in finding anything).  Go into immigration to officer on far side of square.  Show passports and pay 45cordobas each to exit.  Continue down passage to aduana- hand over all vehicle docs and TIP - which they keep.  Drive towards Honduras- stop to give officer stamped aduana form and show receipt for exit tax.  In Honduras stop at migracion (actually has a sign on the building!).  Pay usd3 or 70limpura each. Find aduana - they will direct you to an office at the back where the SUPER unfriendly clerk will shuffle paperwork for the vehicle and take EXACTLY us$35 (for transit) as "she has no change" .  You go over the road through a maze of trucks to find nice gentleman to make copies, go back to clerk who issues TIP.  No insurance required for Honduras.  On drive out show officer TIP and you are free to go.  Just a caution:  the road into Honduras here is really bad - not recommended for night driving.  We were stopped once on this road the next day.  They searched the vehicle but did not ask for the fire extinguisher and reflective things (suspect this fad has faded).

name: Mirador / Viewpoint
description:
Beautiful viewpoint with a very friendly owner who maintains the property. There's no entry fee but I would recommend 1000 per person.
Camping on the property might be possible as well. Just ask. A lot of wildlife around. Standard 2WD Gravel to the property.

name: Acor Forever
description: We lost our AC in Belize. found this place. no problems with business but had two very nice locals helping us. did not get the owners name. he was very helpful with us trying figure out the issue. it is a very hot country, ac is needed while driving.

name: Berakah BnB
description: Private room with 2 beds for 20$ per night. Private parking available 2 blocks away in the Berakah Hostal. You can use the facilities of the hostal even if you stay in the BnB (kitchen, pool table, parking). I asked for my cat and they said it was ok in a private room but not in the dorm.

name: Jardin Cafe Restaurant & Hostel
description: Beautiful clean hostel. 10$ for 1 bed in a dorm. Beautiful garden. Restaurant on site. They let you use the kitchen of the restaurant if there are not too many clients in the hostel. Private parking. Ok to let your pet in. Highly recommand this beautiful place. The town is very charming too

name: Taller Sosa Kaibiles
description:
We have been having mega problems with our coolant system for months.
Asked on Pan American for recommendations in Tecugicalpa and one guy came back with this place.
Mario travelled across town to look at our truck. Gave him a summary of our problems and arranged to deliver the truck to him.
Seems our water pump on our 1992 Mercedes had given up. Mario sourced a replacement.
Will give an update on whether it worked.
Just felt like mentioning this guy. He is part of an off road club and services 4x4's

name: Estacionamiento supermercado Tania
description:
Lugar super seguro y tranquilo. Estuvimos 4 noches. Estas a 300 metros del parque principal. La gente muy amable. Quedas alejado de la ruta por lo que es mas seguro. 
Super safe and quiet place. We stayed 4 nights. You are 300 meters from the main park. The people very kind. You stay away from the route so it is safer.

name: Hotel Something ;-)
description: After a long driving day just before dark we arrived at this place. It's a sort of hotel and we asked if we could stay the night in our Camper. We asked if we could use the toilet and showers that was fine but we needed to pay the price for a room, 15 dollar. This room is realy not worth it, shower was not working and in the shower where standing this big cans of rain water where you can fill the toilet reservoir with ;-) The place though feels safe and although it's besides the panamericana at night it was realy quiet and nice cold. I think if you asked only to use theyr parking place for an overnight only without the toilet, it should be fine for 5 dollar.

name: Vans to the border
description:
Here you take the van to the border with Guatemala. 20 lempiras pp (< US$1).

I left my car on the border just to visit Copan Ruinas.

name: Grissy‘s Hotel
description:
Camping at the hotel, 300L per camper, pool access is 40L extra pp. 
Close to the beach, about 100m. 
A bit expensive for what you get but ok for a night.

name: Laundry
description: A lavanderia that washes your cloths for half the prices of d&d brewery (5kg = 100L).

name: Hotel Elvir
description:
Great hotel right in the center of Santa Rosa, and super quiet at any time. There is a big and secure parking lot from where you can access to the room.  
Room are big and very clean. We stay 2 night and we loved it. There is a inside yard surronded by plant just perfect to have breakfast or enjoy a book. 
Staff  very friendly and helpful.
There is also a small pool on the roof with nice view of the city.
Also from the Hotel there are a couple of nice walk to do up to a view pontit and another one that goes  along a river. Very nice Hotel

name: Hotel Casa Vieja
description:
Camping at the parking lot of the Hotel Casa Vieja. 
200L for a night with access to a room with hot shower and toilet. 
There is a water dispenser and coffee in the lobby. 
Wifi very fast and reaches the parking lot. 
Run by a very nice family.

name: Marios Place
description: Sort of an unsuspecting resturant on a dock over the water. Doesnt look like much, but its fairly cheap(180L for fish plate and many less expensive items) and the food is fantastic. They serve up what they catch and have an extensive menu beyond that.  Fish soup is a hangover favorite. Homemade hotsauce is amazing as well.

name: Hotel La Muralla
description: A great stop half-way between Tegucigalpa and La Ceiba. Nice guy. We slept in our truck in the large, secure car park and he gave us a room key to use the shower. The room was clean and nicely fitted with TV and fans (no a/c required up here as it's a cool climate). Modern bathroom and the shower was the best we've had in a long time - very powerful and hot. Taking a room would have been L370, we paid L300, but we could probably have negotiated harder to get a better price. Plenty of room for big-rigs inside, cable across the gate around 3.5m high.

name: Lin Fan Comida China
description: Chinese food in Honduras? Crazy enough, there is and this scratches the itch. Fried rice with French fries and an entree was $150L. The rice was tasty and while we’ve had better Chinese food, it was a welcome change from tortillas and pollo.

name: roncador gas station
description: Garded gas station right on the highway. We slept there 1 night it was alright

name: La Flor de Copan Cigar Factory
description: A really interesting guided tour. Not advertised, just knock on the pedestrian gate & the guards let you in. 10:00hrs and 14:00 hrs weekdays. Must wear closed-toe shoes and long trousers. Very professional and health/safety conscious inside. See the whole process from picked leaves, sorting, fermentation, drying, rolling, packing.  US$3 pp (min 3 people - if there are only 2 of you, you have to pay for 3). Guide speaks English. They give out a couple of free cigars each at the end too. Really enjoyed it.

name: Hotel Sunset
description: Hotel on the Pan America highway about 30km after the border crossing from El Salvador. Clean and simple rooms with a/c, TV, Wifi and private bathroom. Off road parking through a gate. No height restrictions but it's not super wide. $22 a night. Restaurants and gas stations near by.

name: Underwatervision dive center and Trudy hostel
description:
Great hostel and dive center ! To begin with logistics: the place is well located by the sea and has a small private beach with volleyball court and sunbeds and it is easy to drop in the sea to cool off and swim. There are plenty of hammocs and the bar has a pool table. Prices are really cheap : 299$ for the PADi and you get free accomodation for 4 nights as well as 2 fun dives if you take a class  , otherwise the price for accomodation is 6$ for a shared dorm. There are several private dorms that accomodate 2 people so if you get lucky only, you can have one of this room for the same price (and the room has its own bathroom). 
With regards to diving course; I was really impressed by so much professionalism. Nico and Steve were so great instructors. Nico is really passionated about diving and the ocean and wants to communicate that joy with you. He won't let you down if you panic. In a word , safety was always present and learning diving became a great experience I won't forget. 
With regards to the hostel it is truly a younger population here (mainly from England ?) But everybody was friendly and the music was not overwhelming at all.  Found buddies all over the place. Recommend +++

name: Military checkpoint
description: A really friendly military guy asked for our papers (both our passports and our vehicle permit), asked where we came from and where we were going right now. After asking us if we smoke weed (because we are from Amsterdam) and checking the dates on our documents, he wished us a pleasant time in Honduras.

name: termas ribot
description: is a small termal Park. Very good for night.

name: amerigaz LPG in the back of comedor marita
description: They sell propane 50L for 1 gallon and they can fill american tank

name: Armed Robbery on Beach walk
description: Armed robbery on Beach walk between West End and West Bay. Guys hide on the bushes and come down when people walk by some rocks in the water, rob you and then go back up into the forest.

name: Banco de Occidente
description:
Banco de Occidente is the only bank to use for paying the TIP on the Honduras side now. They only accept Lempira for the $35 tip fee. Hours for accepting TIP payments are 9am-12pm and 1pm-3pm only. 

Exchange dollars to Lempira on the ES side of the border, even if you're just passing through to Nica the same day.

name: La Casa Pizza and Cafe
description: Big grassy parking lot, which belongs to a garage and the pizza place. Gets a bit muddy after rainfall. The owner was very nice and allowed us to spend the night on her premises free of charge. We had some delicious pizza and a silent night. Only a short walk to town. Guarded during the night. Perfect for visiting the ruins.

name: Beach camping
description: Continue on this road next left there is Free camping right on the beach! Really quiet! Felt safe

name: Carolane's Spot
description:
At the end of the road on the corner there is 1 place for a big rig. Pretty quiet with a stunning view on the mountain.

Felt safe

Note: overgrown and garbage

name: Patty's restaurant
description: Great place to eat beside the plaza. Good prices, fast internet, lovely owners/workers. The bathroom is clean and there's a shower in it, but I never asked to use it. The owner, Patty, told us to knock on their door if we had any issues after hours since they live right next door. Nice homey feel.  Safe to park/camp at night in the plaza too.

name: mini super la familia
description: Medium sized grocery store with most things you need or want with a good sized car park beside it

name: Auto llantas
description:
Tires shop with professional service. They have a wide range of products to choose from and they mount, balance and align the tires. Lucky or not, but my 4x 215/85R16 Sumitomo tires (4x4 heavy duty) turned to be surprisingly cheap... 13'000 lempiras so 542USD. For the four of them and the service. 
 I haven't missed anything, looks like a deal to me.

name: Parque Aurora
description:
Absolutely perfect place to spend a night or two. Reminded us of camping back in Canada. 

Massive, gated turisto parque. Includes a very clean pool, clean cold showers and flush toilets, boat rentals for the small artificial lake, horse riding, and ALL the camping areas! Oodles of dispersed picnic areas with benches and fire pits.

Closes at 4pm weekdays, or 5 can't quite remember. Think it was 5. Gates lock and a security guard with a pair of dobermans wanders round. 

40lpp to enter, we got charged the same to camp one night so 80 for two, bargain!!! (extra charge for pool and rentals, cheap)

As of Jul/19 $100l includes pool and everything.

We were the only people around at night (Wednesday) A dozen police swimming in the morning, team building?

If you keep left of the pool and go past the concrete pitch before crossing the river on your right you get to the GPS spot which is round the back of the lake on the water, a 3 minute walk across a foot bridge to toilets and showers.

name: Gravel Parking Lot
description: pretty big parking lot at the highest point of the road. Some comedores  nearby, wehre the truck drivers stop. quiet at night. low temperatures at night

name: Hostal Contigua
description: Cheap hostel just 200 meters from the ferry departure to islands. Also just ~5 kms away from town center of La Ceiba. Local buses run all day for 12 lempiras. Has safe parking for motos indoor, maybe a car or two. Plenty of space outside. Most rooms have aircon. There is a sundeck with a bbq and hammocks. Rooms are quite simple but will do for a couple of nights. I paid around 10 USD pr night for a room who should be without aircon but I was allowed to use it. Private bathroom.

name: Mitos Hostal
description:
Family owned hostel, bed and breakfast style, with swimming pool and large grass lot for camping. 

Private rooms with private bathrooms and showers. Rate is 500 lempiras per person including breakfast. 

Camping rate is 150 lempiras per person including breakfast. It is 100 lempiras per person without breakfast. There is access to clean men’s and women’s bathrooms. 

There is a gated entrance without height restriction to access the grass lot to park and camp. The gate is only 8 ft (2.7 M) wide. 

Place is relaxed, has a good vibe and staffed with very friendly family members. English speaking as well. 

Temperatures are perfect. Cool nights , sunny days. And no bugs.

name: Anibal Casa River Camp
description:
You can camp on Anibals property next to the river (beautiful spot) just ask at his house which is south of the bridge if you can stay and he will let you set up wherever you want. He speaks perfect english and is really nice and welcoming! 
Anibals number: +504 8765-1912

name: Playa Los Rios
description: Nice Beach with Restaurant and Bar only on the weekend in Nov. 2018. Chilled music,  Good food , friendly staff. Big trees, lots of shady places. Only few insects. Very quiet during the night. Paid 200 Lempiras per night.

name: Museo del Aire Honduras
description: Air museum. 50L adults, 30L kids under 7y. Small and interesting air museum, only in Spanish, history of commercial and military flying in Honduras, outdoor exhibit too. Monday closed. Tue-Fri 8:00-12:00, Sat-Sun 10:00-17:00 Apparently the largest museum of it's kind in Central America.

name: Balneario las Orquídeas
description:
Beautiful place around the forest with a wonderfull camping área.
The place is run by a really friendly guy called Jorge. They start a campfire just for us. Really secure and really near of the main road.
Some steep hills and a little ground clearance needed. 
They charge us 80 lempiras/$4 for two people. 
Also have a cascade inside the property

name: Rainbow Village
description: Excellent hotel in La Ceiba which we needed after taking the afternoon ferry from Roatan. Secure parking. Big rigs might not but our van fit the 8 foot height in the gate. Two bedroom suite, wifi , pool, and lovely host with German Shepard. $55US. Restaurant on site

name: Hospital Veterinaria de Sur
description: Nice clinic with profesional a super friendly stuff. Helped us after we found a perrita hit by a car on the street. They kept her for the recovery and will find her a new home after :)

name: auto servicios evolution
description:
great garage even now english.
(+504)99171878 Osman

name: Villa de ADA
description:
It is a smal Hotel with a huge Parking on Gras for Campers... there is abut 4 pools, even with slides.... just a few people, showers and Toilet all there. Smal restaurant...
Big rigs no problem... up to 3.8 mtrs on the short entrance from the city side... there Is a second entrance from the other side with no height restriction.
They asked for 200. Agreed on 150 Lim. We spend 4 days here ... needed to solve a health problem...

update 10 2021 : n'acceptent pas de camper uniquement camping en tente

name: El Pescadar Restaurant
description: An open air restaurant at the end of a dirt road, directly on the Pacific shore, with volcanos in the distance. We found this place empty, a sort of rustic looking place and sat at a table in the sand, under a tin roof held up by thin logs. A lady came out and asked if we wanted food. She was very friendly. We ordered fish and shrimp. It was very good served with plantains, and very inexpensive. The owner arrived and spoke English.  Also very friendly. She said we could put our tent up right under her shelters and offered us hammocks to sleep in. The strong breeze kept us cool and kept any bugs that might have been there away. She said the place was safe, with only a handful of locals in the area, but the van was not parked far from where we set up. It was raw natural beauty.  There were local dogs around so I’m sure pets would have been welcome even though we aren’t traveling with any. Our kids played with the local kids there.  They didn’t charge us to camp there, to use their toilet, (which you had to carry a bucket of water to flush), or to use their hammocks.  I wouldn’t recommend big rigs as the road is rough and the sand soft. We were in a 15 passenger van with no problem.

name: Tranquility Bay
description: Laura and Larry, super friendly Canadian couple have luxury seafront cabanas, clean white sand beach, big garden with relaxing areas. They let us camp in the spacious and shady parking lot and use their facilities. Toilets are very clean, outside cold shower. Restaurant on site that seems delicious but we were cooking by ourselves. They have 2 tuckans, 2 monkies and 2 friendly dogs. Laura and Larry has many amazing stories to share with travellers and they welcome overlanders. Fast wifi. We paid 10$ per night per car. The property is on the right side of Campimiento where they asked 400 lemps per night.

name: tropigas
description: filled our American  tank in 10 minutes 220 lemps for 20 lbs tank

name: Restaurant Ecologico El Ocotal
description: This is an unexpected surprise! A restaurant in the front and a full blown zoo in the back. The restaurant has delicious Honduran food, at very reasonable prices. The zoo admission is free. It is family owned and operated. Inherited from the grandmother who first established it. And the family is very friendly, gracious, and helpful. We loved the zoo, especially the monkeys. It is well shaded by its own jungle. Definitely a must stop if you are in the area.

name: Bomberos (fire department)
description:
I came to ask if I could spend the night and after a minute, I was given a yes.  They took down my passport details and then put me in a large dorm style room and gave me a bed with a fan.  Had access to a bathroom and shower.

Was also given use of the kitchen and tv area.  Also had plenty of safe drinking water to refill my water bottles.  Plus, they even offered me the WiFi password.

Might not work so well for anyone traveling with a rig but they are super friendly to people traveling without a vehicle and eager to chat.

name: Border crossing
description: We came from Guatemala and crossed to Honduras - easy and fast process - some young officer speaks english pretty well - fast process after 7pm - asked if we can spend the night at the Honduras side with the trucks in the parking lot - and the officer said its all ok - safe place and there is a washroom to use

name: Street Parking
description:
Dormimos aquí una noche. Calle muy tranquila a una cuadra de la plaza central, todo el pueblo parece muy seguro!

We slept here one night, quite street. Walking one street you are in the main place. The town seems very safe.

name: Lavanderia La Esperanza
description: Laundry in La Esperanza!  There is a little gate, and you can just knock if it isn't open.  It was about $170L/load to wash and dry.  Very nice sisters who own the business.

name: Los Taquitos
description: Fabulous taco restaurant in La Esperanza.  It's also home of the California Hotdog, which is delicious!  Food is affordable, service is great, and cleanliness is taken very seriously.  Javier, the owner, came up with the idea for the hotdog while living in Los Angeles- it's an uncommon find for these parts!

name: Hostal Las Victoria
description: Very nice hotel run by Yuri and his family. Room and bed are super comfortable. Much better than sleeping in Ojojona where there is only one hotel. 500 lemp for a double room. There is no camping here.

name: Hotel Celaque
description: The only option in the village, but it is quite nice. Secure parking, hot water, and a few comedor nearby. Initial price was very hight, but just raising an eyebrow and asking for a lower price, I got a room for 200 lemp.

name: parking in front of the park and the beach
description: it's a totally beautiful place to enjoy your time a rarely visited beach but so beautiful in our opinion even better than tela and Utila and cheaper. the parking is in front of the restaurants area and the park police pass by very often and if you go eat from the restaurants in front you even can get water wifi bathrooms and showers. meals are since 100L

name: Toncontin Airport Long Term Parking
description:
Secure long term parking at the airport where you can leave your car if flying out from Tegucigalpa (we stored our car there whilst visiting the bay islands).

When entering the airport from the main road, there will be a boom gate and parking area to the left, which is the short term parking area and not what you want. For long term, turn right and go through the gate, there should be security there. We payed 12USD or 300L per 24 hour period. 

As a side note, we arrived the night before our flight and the security guard let us park for free just outside the gate to the parking lot, and then let us in the next morning.

name: Puma
description: We asked the guards if we were able to stay the night in our van at this petrol station. They were hesitant but agreed once we showed them that we sleep in the van. Toilets are decently clean and they had intermittent wifi. Did not see anywhere to connect to electricity. Fine and safe for a night, not too noisy but we left around 6am.

name: Don Taco
description: Inexpensive restaurant run by a friendly family who serve tasty Mexican food in good portions. I highly recommend the Chilaquiles Tinga for 75L (vegetarians can ask for it would meat). The two sons speak some English if they are there when you visit. Open for lunch and dinner (I think every day). The food was the best and cheapest we had in Honduras, let alone Comayagua, so yes we would say it was exceptionally good value.

name: Hotel Alameda Colonial
description:
Good mid range hotel with secure gated parking and close to old city centre. Clean room with air conditioning was 700L.

Nothing particularly special good or bad.

name: Hotel La Fuente
description:
We passed Tegucigalpa direct because we felt insecure.
Our way to Copán has this city called La Paz-La Paz. The hole country has politic problems and so we found this hotel and after talking with Carmen Sierra (Rose) she was very gentle and let us use the big parking lot to place our car with rooftent.
Rose permited we use a bathroom and showers. Has electricity and water. You can also make a barbecue.
Good and safe place. We recomend for all Overlanders on way to Copan.

name: Parque Aquatico El Yate
description:
It is a public acqatic park. We arrived in a monday, day when it's closed. But the gate was open and so we talked to Tania the manager.
She allowed we to park our SUV with rooftent and use all facilities.
First price was 400 Lempiras but we paid 170 Lempiras for 2 pearsons.
Three pools, showers, bathrooms, gazebos with tables and banks. Shadow, has monkeys, racoon, araras, and other animals encaged to watch.
Safe and gates closed at night.

name: panamericano comedor
description: We were crossing Honduras in one day and were looked for some restaurant. found this comedor with friendly staff and good food. 4 meals cost 360 Lempira. two of us vegetarian, just ask about it.

name: Oxidiana ancient mines
description: there are lots of deep hole, man made, wich believed to be oxidiana mines to make arrow tips for ancient people. There is no oficial info about. just ask the locals near. very interesting place

name: hilados los encinos
description: local comunity project to make original colorfull cloths you will see in la esperanza plaza. worth a visit if you. would like to support locals. 4w in rainy. but 2w high cleareance good enough.

name: taller automotriz dennis
description: we were recommended to this mechanic by Sayed from our hotel casa vieja who said he used this mechanic for his own car repairs. we were having problems with our brakes. Dennis was friendly and helpful and prompt, and although he didn't speak English, one of his apprentices spoke English reasonably well and helped us. they were able to fix our brakes and air filter at a reasonable price, the main cost was for parts we needed which they showed us receipts for. the labour cost was miniscule.

name: Google maps correction - CA5 is complete
description: we drove from tegulcigalpa to lake yojoa but followed Google maps which currently says that the CA5 is not fully built and so led us off the CA5 here and on some crazy off roads that should be 4x4 only. don't be a dill like we were! the road is fully built and a smooth ride north so just ignore Google maps and keep going up on the CA5. we wasted a good 3 hours and drove our brakes into the ground going the way Google maps told us!

name: CA5 TOLL ROAD Available
description: Gps are not showing this toll road available. It's a 2 lines both ways from San Pedro Sula to Tegucigalpa.

name: Texaco
description: The best of this fuel station is the big playground and options to eat: subway, pizza...

name: Unimall Choluteca
description: Parking lot at Unimall Plaza, Choluteca. Ask in administration before, friendly people. We stayed one night, very quiet. Free. Good Wifi. Safe. Water.

name: Playa Bonita
description:
Good and quiet spot in front of the beach. We stay 4 days and feel safe. People around super friendly and helpful: Mauricio, Roberto and Rey are good people. Security guard at nights. 
In the past another overlanders stayed here too. 
There water, cold shower, bathrooms, palapas and palm trees on the beach. 
Don’t forget to try Las Baleadas, the typical food.

name: Coral bay
description: Good spot for snorkeling!! A lot of corals, fish and turtle (we didn’t see).

name: three j,,'s
description: thermal pools, lake, restaurant super quiet. Stayed with F-350 truck camper, 100 lempiras

name: Restaurante Tipico with WiFi
description: Delicious typical food and friendly staff. Great parking available too and our sprinter fit through the entrance gate. Altogether $13 before heading to the next border (or if you’re coming north) great stop very happy :)

name: Uno Gas Station
description: Good place to stay. Luis the owner is very friendly, Aldo Osmar the guard with shotgun who stay all night long. no public WiFi but they let me connect to their private net, works inside car, away from store

name: Los telares
description: Hand woven cloth, made on wooden looms. This is a beautiful area, cool, producing vegetables & still very traditional. The church in the foto Is in a nearby village Valle de azacualpa,  & is a community project being built by 30 local villages & it's huge, will seat 2500! We stayed in la Esperanza but I think you would be able to stay anywhere up here, all the people are super friendly.

name: Finca El Compadre
description: Simple restaurant with chicken & fish plates for a reasonable price. Cost was 260 lemps for 2 chicken dishes with fresh salads and rice and 2 drinks. Quick and kind service, clean bathrooms & right next door to a gas station! What more could you ask for? Wifi you say? They've got it and it was average -- good speed.

name: El Quetzal
description: Small hotel in the midst of finalizing opening owned by extremely kind hostess Raquel. A double room with 1 double bed and 1 twin with A/C & fan and TV cost 660 Lemps. Very clean. We were welcomed with a jar of filtered water in our room. Wifi is due to be installed this week but was not available during our stay. Secure parking for 1 car or multiple motorcycles.

name: Restaurante Mis perlas
description:
Parking under palm trees, next to the restaurant. We only pay one drink in the restaurant. There are bath and showers available. The people is so kind. Very quiet and safe place. We are alone on the beach!



Estacionamiento debajo de las palmeras, al costado del Restaurante. Solo pagamos una consumición en el restaurante. Hay baño y duchas disponibles.
La gente es muy amable. Lugar muy tranquilo y seguro. Estamos solos en la playa!

name: Restaurante leo’s
description:
It is a Reataurante at the edge of the road. Very good and cheap food. We stopped here to ask if we could spend the night and they said yes right away. We courtesy dined here.


Es un Reataurante a la orilla del camino. Muy buena comida y barata. 
Paramos aquí para preguntar si podíamos pasar la noche y nos dijeron que si enseguida. Nosotros de cortesía cenamos aquí.

name: Police check point
description: They didn’t stop us, but there was a cop on each side of the road and cones in the middle. They waved us through

name: Military inspection point
description: Waved us through at 8:45 am. Two guards with rifles.

name: Final Border Checkpoint
description: This is the last place where the officials check your TIP. If you have a pet they will check the paperwork here, but didn’t take a copy.

name: Hotel Iberia
description:
Budget Hotel with excellent staff and lock up secure parking. They have cameras keeping and eye on things and the staff are always there so its very safe. A large gated parking lot but probably not suited for R.Vs as its a Hotel.
$590lp for a large room with a/c and internet, they even let me park my moto there for 6 days while I was away on Utila. 25lp for cold beer and they have other cold drinks too. Not the flashest hotel but a good place to spend the night safely.

name: Small river stop
description: Only 1 way down to a few open grassy spaces next to a small river. There is a cascade nearby. Hidden from road. Climate is cooler in the mountains. If not staying the night great place for a lunch or let the dog(s) out to stretch and drink. Spoke with a local at the spot who said his father owns the area and will hopefully one day start a small camping and restaurant in the location. For now its free.

name: Free street parking
description:
Free parking at a very wide, calm and secure street, near the city center (15min walking), near the bus stop to Valle de Angeles (Hospital San Felipe) and to Picacho and La Tigra (Hotel Granada III). Near the agricultural market. 
There are 6 houses and a restaurant with private security 24hs. Tegucigalpa is a dangerous city, but we felt safe to leave the car during day and go out. At night very calm also.
We spent 4 nights here.

Parqueo gratuito en una calle muy amplia, tranquila y segura, cerca del centro de la ciudad (15 minutos a pie), cerca de la parada del rapidito hacia Valle de Ángeles (Hospital San Felipe) y Picacho y La Tigra (Hotel Granada III). Cerca también del imperdible mercado del agricultor.
Cuenta con 6 casas y un restaurante con seguridad privada las 24hs. Tegucigalpa es una ciudad peligrosa, pero nosotros nos sentimos seguros aqui para dejar el auto durante el día y salir a pasear. Por la noche muy tranquilo también.
Pasamos 4 noches.

name: Free WiFi Puma Gas Station
description: Kush gas station ok coffee ac and free WiFi

name: D'Fogon
description:
Moderator Note: Please note that the traveller did not stay overnight and usually this would be cause for rejection. However, the place is accepted in this case because so much valuable information is provided. 

Restaurant with typical food (chicken, pork or beef with rice, salad, avocado and refried, beans) for 130 lempiras and 25Lps for beer.

Only restaurant which makes use of the views on this road.

As there are no camping spots on ioverlandr for many kms in this area we did ask if camping is a possibility and were told yes.

Space for 3-5 vans or 2 rigs slightly tilted but levelable with wood under the wheels.

Your campspot is 10m above the road but we were told that the noisy trucks stop passing buy at 21:00.

Nice family runs the place. Father works in diary cow farming
Son speaks english.

Toilets available
Water, showers and price need to be arranged with the owner as you would be their first campers. Maybe you can arrange to camp for free if you consume dinner and lunch with them.

Business card says open 7 days a week from 07:30 to 20:00. They live there so later arrival should work too.

+504 9918 6729

name: Mirador del Ocotillo
description:
Public view point with some horses  hanging out. Between high pine trees and plenty of flat space for vans.
Were told that area is safe so this spot should be too.

Ojojona is a small colonial town and  the climate is marvelous like May in central Europe. T-Shirt and short during the day, Sweater and long pants after sunset.

Half of the area with decent amount of garbage coming from picnic and lunches locals had here.

Benches and firepit and good LTE celular coverage.

Did not camp here but because of  zero of ioverlander spots in Ojojona area i added this spot.

We did go further up and camped on a private property with lovely owners who come for the weekends from the capital.

name: Pabellon Artesanal
description:
During the day a handicraft market with teeny restaurants and at night the parking lot surounded by the U-shaped building with shelter served us as campspot in our van.

The owner of the restaurant with the menu written with beans which is open until 19:30 opened us the key to the bathroom until they closed for the day.

She let us stay the night and told the watchman about us.
