Tap with big sink filled with water in the back right corner. No water comming out of the tap during our stay.

Felt safe and enjoyed the shelter and benches on the very rainy evenning and night.

Free.

name: Hotel Villas del Valle
description:
Hot shower!! The real kind with heater and not the electric suicide kind.

There are some ranchitos with bbq and parked next to one to extend our van's front porch with the awning to the ranchito.

Rather flat and easy to level your car with stones or bricks. Next to a road which quiets down at around 20:00.

We got access to the bathroom and shower of the room they call suite while the bad of this room was in maintenance.

Pool!

Camped here 2 people for 15usd pn incl. breakfast and bool.Parked next to a rancho with our awning extending into the rancho.

People are very attentive and we did 2 big loads of laundry.
1 for 200lps with dryer
1 for 100lps w/o dryer

Rooms start at 46usd pn. Check picture for price list and contact details.

name: German Calderón in Angeli Gardens
description:
When staying at Angeli Gardens the owner had a car mecánic stop by to fix his ATV. We took advantage of his visit and had him look at our car and gave us a very honest recomendation to fix our issues once we arrive to Mexico were spare parts can be found for our VW.

The owner of Angeli Gardens recomends him as good mecanic and i have the impression that this is true.

Call or WhatsApp him on +50433843311 

If you need somebody who specialices un VW he can refer you to a colleague.

name: Military Checkpoint
description:
If you are stopped they will likely inspect your car (hacer un registro). Not sure if they are allowed to do that without probable cause. Make sure you watch over the inspectors shoulder so that nothing goes missing or he plants something.

2 years ago the police forces had a major ckean up and many police men especially the ones not doing theie jo s accordingly were kicked out. You will notice that by the young age of today's police force in Honsuras. Since then the police corruption situation has improved.

30 days in Honduras we encountered only one situation which was either are fake police, a very inexperienced police or a bribe situation. So no 10-15 corrupt police stops anymore as wikioverland states that travellers had when traveling through Honduras.  All our other 3 stops were professional, friendly and helpful.

name: Hotel Los Arcos
description:
Hotel just after the border with El Salvador 🇸🇻 
Rooms with fan or A/C
Grocery and lots of shops in the street
Basic room
We paid 600 lempiras for a room with 2 beds and A/C
OK for one night

name: Hôtel Via Melida
description:
New hotel in town . Huge room with 2 beds, A/C , fridge, shower, wifi.
Everything is new and clean .
We paid 1400 lempiras for 2 persons with breakfast.
A great place to stay in Choluteca

name: El Salvador Sim Card
description:
Tienda Jireh, the first shop when leaving the border premises sells sim cards for 1usd.
Nice guy who activates the sim card which takes a phone call and ID.
Go get the sim cards you need while your travel partner does the aduana papers.

name: Antenas en Cerro Tecapa
description:
1h hike up from the Laguna along the crater rim with splendid views of Vulcano San Miguel, Santiago de Maria and the Pacific.

Once up there possibility to continue to Alegria orvwalk down to the Laguna on a dirt road.

Trail up to Antenas:
1h, often close to the edge of the crater rim or through 2m gigh grass, unexperienced hikers might not enjoy this trail
 Facing the guard house walk up the cobblestone road for some 50m to your left and before the road starts going down ask at the houses there were the trail to the antenas start.

Road up to Antenas:
1h20min
5,2km on dirt road, by car only on 4x4 i was told, best to take it walking down after a hiking up the crater rim trail

Private road from Antenas down to Alegria:
1h
Ask military boys at the Antena which road leads down to Alegria.

name: Police checkpoint
description:
Very nice policemen. 
Checked our passports, drivers licences and TIP.
Ask where we were coming from and where we were going.

name: San Antonio del Norte
description: A nice, big and flat area near San Antonio del Norte. It seems very quiet and safe. Nice panorama and beautiful village. Locals very friendly.

name: Restaurante Flotante Orchideas
description:
Floating Restaurant Owner told us you can tent camp at his place. Food is fine.

Likely a very nice experience, you can put up your tent on the wooden floor or hang your hammock.

It is located in front of an manglar island and to get to it you ask at the Puerto el Triunfo for floating restaurant and you will be taken for free to the the business.

Food fine but pricey. Menu and phone number in attached pictures.

Did not talk aboutovernight cost but i am sure you can arrange a minimum consumption so that the owner lets you stay the night.

Running water, toilets. No shower.
Rain water collected from the roofater

name: Beach camp
description: We crossed the border late, were looking for a rest and entered this village. at the end you'll find a promenade at the sea, where it is possible to park. was quiet all night (saturday) and we even got invited to park our van inside of a private compound. a few restaurants, but we didn't eat there.

name: River Bank free
description:
next to the river is a bank of rocks where we stayed one night with our vw combi 78. the last part to get on the bank is a little adventerous and maybe not all vehicles can do it. 
talked to people if its safe, said it is
felt safe and the watet is fresh and clear and no noise in the night. 
beautiful camp, even had a little campfire

name: Cantarranas
description: Such a beautiful place. Very small town just before to get to Los Angeles National Park. You can sleep in the center of town close to the main square and police station. Very quite and peaceful place. A lot of shops around.

name: Pier to Lago - free
description: At the end of the road comes a fisherport you can drive all way to the water and stand there for the night. A local showed us this place, because it shall be safe, quiet and right next to the lake with a mountain view. In the night a guard is around, with whom we had a little talk.

name: Texaco
description:
Clean nice gas station, friendly people working here 
Store, cafe, WiFi, bathrooms and plenty of parking 
We stopped to sleep for the night it’s 24 hours with security 
Oh and it’s free to stay the night

UP date 2021- very rude staff and manager. No recomended

name: Copan
description: Parking lot close to village and ruinas. not much else than toilets. they close the gate during night. 100 lempiras/night/car. staying at bosque, but invited us to stay here too

name: Copan
description:
they sell agua occidente here. 20 lempiras/garafon.
open all days 7am-5pm. sometimes on sundays too.

name: Tequila bar y restaurante
description: RV friendly, pet friendly , rigth in front of the beach. Owner used to rv travel. Nice food

name: La Central
description:
Coffee from 25 Lempiras.
Notebook plugs.
Wifi (acceptable).
Air conditioner.
Music: low volume.
Quiet place to work.

Café desde 25 Lempiras.
Enchufes para la Notebook.
Wifi (aceptable).
Aire acondicionado.
Música: volumen bajo.
Lugar tranquilo para trabajar.

name: Hotel Athena
description:
Basic rooms but clean and nice. Air con (essential for us... we needed to escape the humidity and sand flies of a few nights camping at Punta Sal), private bathrooms, good wifi. Large parking lot across the street. 

600 lps for 2 people in a room that could sleep 7.

name: Bomberos - Fire Station
description:
Pequeño espacio para aparcar en frente de la escuela, queda al lado de la estación de bomberos. Lugar seguro pero algo ruidoso al estar al lado de la carretera. Muy amables nos ofrecieron sanitarios, ducha caliente y agua para llenar el tanque, gratis.

Small street parking site ik front of the school and next to the fire station. Very safe place but a little noisy because beeing next to the street. Very friendly guys offered us bathrooms, hot shower and water to refill tank, free.

name: Road side
description:
Couldn't find anywhere to sleep in town so came out here. Wide shoulder on a quiet road next to fields and a few houses. We didn't have any problems. Quiet until around 5 when the cockerel, dog and moto alarm starts ;-)  

There's a narrow squeeze on the road in, no problems in Ford van but a big rig might struggle.

name: Vista Al Rio
description:
Vary nice traditional foods overlooking the Puente Juanaca, were you can have great food and drinks or go swimming in the river to cool off, the owner is welcoming man with a big heart. also has a finch of coffee, he has family and also owned a lot of property just behind Three J's were you will see his house and farm on the right side right after Three J's to the right. if nobody is at home he will be at his restaurant,  just ask for Mr German he is the owner of Vista Al Rio just a little bit down the road. the area is vary safe and peaceful. 
,

name: Vista Al Rio
description: Camping next to Vista Al Rio Restaurant, Mr German speaks vary good English and Spanish, he has a grassy area behind the restaurant which he can setup water and power if needed, there are bathrooms at the restaurant you can use, at this time no showers but he hope's improve the site, he is also adding to his restaurant a new patio and inclosed space with A/C. just ask for Mr German at the restaurant or just down the street behind Three J's on the right side of the dirt road the white house.

name: Station Texaco
description: Big parking for trucks who is find behind the station texaco, the only who has well wanted we accept. The guards we you fact park just behind the building under lighting public and we have asked 30 lempiras. Night calm until morning or the trucks have started to start. For one night that is well.

name: Wild Trail - Waterfalls
description:
You can walk freely without paying. Natural trail to the forest and wild adventure with more than 3 waterfalls.

Trail is clean, not marked. Can't get lose but better be prepared. Just for walking, no car, no bycicle.

name: La Chorrera
description: Best camping spot ever, cascade and free camping place.

name: Espresso americano
description: Cafe with lots of coffee options and friendly staff. We got 2 large lattes and a few sweet things for US$5.50 (they take card!!). Also has good WiFi, a good coffee stop between borders.

name: turicentro el porvenir
description: Very friendly man who owns this restraunt on the beach. He lets you stay here for free and use his bathroom all night. There is a guard so it if very safe. He speaks English and has traveled to canada and the usa. it is a very beautiful spot. Beach is not the cleanest but water is nice. New update Mon and Tues are the days thenight club is closed. I guess Fridau and Sat they go until 6am. last only unti 10pm

name: splash inn and hostel
description: beautiful place in the west end. staff is really friendly. you can get a 2 bedrom suite for 99 US or a 4 beds hostile for 25US. free breakfast and a free snorkling trip with a villa. free breakfast with dorms. You can leave your car at the ferry in la ceiba in a guarded parking look for 7US dollars a night You also take the ferry to Utila from the wharf in la ceiba

name: Puma gas station with propane
description: Vehicle propane not cans.  Fast service for attached propane tanks.  No problem for American connections.  No vehicle size limits, was here with a 25' Class C.

name: Lux Restaurant
description: Really nice restaurant on the way to Tegucigalpa. Great clean bathrooms, cash only. Good views and the owner was super friendly and excited to have travelers

name: Las Hamacas
description: Good option if you want to go to Roatan, Utila, etc. As long as you stay there for a night, you can leave your vehicle there while I’m the islands, and they actually offer a free shuttle to and from the ferry terminal.

name: Texaco el mirador
description: Texaco Gas Station, they let us Camp here for free. Friendly staff, clean toilets available. There's a small Shop and a coffee, open until 10 pm. It's guarded 24 hours.

name: Football Pitch
description: A large, partly grassy area next to a football pitch. Some traffic noise but generally a quiet night. Friendly locals walk by with a smile. 15 minute walk into the town.

name: Palmira Hostel 2nd building
description: Annex building of Palmira Hostel, beautiful kitchen, laundry service for 5$, supermarkets on walking distance, in this building are only private rooms but are cheap. The building is on a very steep hill and the parking lot is limited, tall enough for a big rig but if you can’t find space there is a security guard during the night. It can be noisy during rush hours, you can pay 5$ and sleep in your rig and be able to use their kitchen, wifi and toilets

name: Pan y mas
description: Really good french bakery, they make delicious cakes and bread

name: Bazar Canton
description: Asian store, lots of asian products, good prices too

name: Clinica Veterinaria Soto
description: Veterinary clinic Matamoros stablished in 1958. Good service

name: Leña y Fuego
description: Best Pizza by the wood oven in town. I recommend it

name: La colonia Supermarket
description: Well stocked supermarket, it is inside a commercial center.

name: US Embassy
description: USA Embassy mission building and consulate

name: Green clean laundry
description: Laundry service and dry cleaners, a little bit expensive

name: Agua Caliente La Paz
description: Family run hot springs with camping options. There is trash around but it's  cheap and the hot springs themselves are decent and clean. Nothing spectacular but a good stop over place for us as we crossed the border from Nicaragua to Honduras that morning, heading to Largo Yojoa. Family is kind and it's definitely a local spot. Paid US$4 to camp and use the hot springs for two people. Not sure the rate for just the hot springs. Easy to find using Google maps, called Hot springs La Paz on Google. Camping was quiet during the week (outside of the always barking dogs in CA) and we had the Hot springs to ourselves.

name: By the Church in Santa Lucia
description:
Parked for one night behind the church, after asking locals about where I could do so.
Nice small picturesque village.
The town is not for anything bigger than a van as streets are very tight.
No facilities.
People are following Covid sanitary measures better then any place I’ve been to. Everyone is using masks even to walk alone on the streets.
Very quiet village.

name: Roadside
description:
We found this beautiful place by accident, we were driving from Copan Ruinas to Reserva Natural Erapuca on a dirt road. Much of the road does not even show on the map, but the communities living here use it every day. 
We camped near a small river/fall with a great view to the mountains. 
Apart from a few cars or motos that pass by, it is quiet and remote. Also safe, all went well.

name: Baños El Quiscamote
description: Public showers stablished in 1902, the fresh water comes from the mountain and the municipality built the structure free for everyone. I would recommend daring to take a cold shower here and enjoy the view with a delicious natural juice or hot coco at the restaurant

name: Beach
description: Empty lot with some coconut trees and a sand dune next to the beach. Friendly local people and a restaurant 1 kms away.

name: Next to a lagoon
description: Before reaching Panacam there is a lagoon where you can do Kayak, there is a field where you can park and reach the water, there is a nice breeze and the views are breathtaking

name: El Picacho
description:
You see the big Jesus up there on the hill? Well you don't have to go right next to him, and the view is great up there!
It's just 15 minutes ish drive from the Palmira hostel or free park spot near there. 
Entrance at night is double, but city lights! Still just 50L pp at night. Parking is free but some dude may try to tell you which spot to park in and then have the audacity to ask for 30L for annoying you (didn't pay). Even before the parking theres a spot with a prime view! Walking from the parking you have other nice views, but to go closer to Jesus you have to pay more and they don't allow dogs from that point onward. So don't pay and be atheist.

name: Empty lot at the beach
description: Empty lot in front of the beach, it has some coconut trees for shade, it is level so you can park and sleep comfortably, you hear the noise of the beach, feels like there is no one else in miles. The lagoon is on the other side of the lot. If you have breezze there is no sand flies.

name: Amerigas
description: Propane filling station in a gas station

name: Ricas Pupusas ao paso
description: Pupusas, Very delícious. See attached photograph.

name: Tacos Tatiana
description:
Cheap food and generous portions. Natural juices. 
Recommended.

Muy buena comida e econômica, los platos son grandes. Jugos naturales Recomendamos provar las Baleadas.

name: Small tienda
description: Small tienda with snacks cold drinks and a hammock and chair in the shade to chill. Nothing fancy

name: Hotel Don Pepe
description:
Simple hotel. Paid 500 lempiras for a big room with 3 big beds, they did not have anything smaller. We brought our bikes in and enjoyed the AC, private bathroom+shower, TV. Felt safe, good stop if you want to rest by the border. We were tempted to keep going and cross to Nicaragua but had the budget/time to stay here and go through the strict Nicaraguan border crossing with fresh energy the next morning :)

The hotel has a pool and some hammocks around. The pool was half full when we were there - did not use it but it is quite big and it seemed cleaned.

The hotel offers food for $80/meal. We did not take it but we had read reviews (google) about the food being really good here.

name: Tecnicentro ABC
description:
In contrast to the other side-of-the-road mechanics in town, this one is big, tidy, well equipped and well organized. 

They offered to change our break fluid right away without any waiting time and (after negotiating the price) we were able to watch the capable mechanics doing an accurate job. They were also very helpful answering any questions we had. They checked some other bits and pieces while they were working but did nothing without consulting us first.

Surprisingly, they even had our tires in store which we had been looking for in Central America for months now.
So we had them change our two worn down rubbers as well.

All the employees were transparent, honest and friendly all the way.
In the end the owner dropped in and after a little chat with our bad Spanish he gave us two t-shirts and four chilled bottles of the purified water he produces next door.

The prices may have been slightly higher than some other mechanics but for us it was totally worth it:
Break fluid change: 1800 lempiras
Bf Goodrich All Terrain KO2: 5750 lempiras (each)

name: Mirador above Santa Rosa
description:
Small level grassy are next to a small gravel road overlooking the mountains and the town. Great views, quiet at night, no amenities at all. 
Nice cool breeze, Claro 4G reception. 

This place was recommended to us by one of the bomberos in town. It belongs to the municipal so you are not on private property. 

There is a small ruin that might have been a restroom once, a few overflowing trash bins and a fence that separates the area from the road. 
To get in you have to drive through a gate in the fence which is always open and around 3 m wide. Also there are some wires hanging over the gate so if you are much taller than 3 m you might have trouble getting through.

We arrived around 5 pm and until 9 pm there were quite some locals coming by for the view, the sunset or for walking/running.
Everyone was very welcoming and friendly and assured us it was very safe to stay here.
After 9 pm we had the place to ourselves and the little traffic on the gravel road died down almost completely. 

We were told there are several hiking trails starting here to explore the adjacent mountains but we have not checked them out jet.

name: Printing
description:
This is a little tienda that has a printer, copier and a computer. This is a place to print stuff for the border. We got there around 3pm.

If you ask nicely, they might let you connect to their WiFi - only to send whatever you need to print to their email. 

You can bring your USB drive as well.
 
Very friendly!

name: Adolfo's house
description:
Fenced property in residential area that offers a level gravel parking lot with a nice view over the neighborhood and an apartment under construction where you can use the restroom with flush toilet, sink and cold shower. 
You can also ask Adolfo to use one of his bathrooms with hot showers, his kitchen or his washing machine. No height restriction but the lot is shared with other cars so there is no room for huge rigs. 
Adolfo was born in Honduras and moved to the US as a young man where he lived and worked for almost 30 years. Now he is retired and moves back and forth between his house in the states and his home in Honduras.
He is a great guy with an inspiring life story and very interesting to talk to.
He is eager to meet overlanders and is working up the courage to maybe start overlanding himself. So encourage him, please :)

If you would like to stay at Adolfo's place, give him a call or send him a text/WhatsApp in advance to see if he is home:
+504 9807-7757

name: Luna Jaguar spa
description: Beautiful setting in surroundings nature with a lot more that one would expect in the mountains. Lots of pools different temperatures, massage available too. The road is a bad track but manageable with a good vehicle. A must! We paid US$ 15 pp

name: Anibel's Restaurant at Playa Grande
description: This is a restaurant at the end of the Playa Grande strip. Prices comparable to seafood prices, a bit more than the rest of the island, but you get access to the beach, black sand, locals swimming, free showers, toilets parking, probably could camp here too, but we didn't.

name: Atlantida Cajero/ ATM
description: ATM on the island! may or may not be the only one, but hotels take card!

name: Hotel Villas Playa Negra
description: This is a hotel, rooms for 2 people they said were 1050 lempira, we didn't stay here, but they have all amenities. Looks a but older, but nice pool, access to Playa Negra, much cleaner on this side. Food to eat for a stop riding around the island as well, fair price, 200 lempira for a pork plate.

name: Hostal Islas
description: This is a beautiful little hotel and is the nicest accommodation on the island. Don't believe the locals when they say the hotels are expensive and overpriced. One tried to offer us a small room for $25 with a twin bed for my husband and I and a bucket shower and dirt floor. We walked out and checked in here, very satisfied, US standard, toilet seats, AC, Wi-Fi, in the center. We paid $32 a night here.

name: Aparthotel santa barbara parking lot
description: Perfect place to stay a night before crossing the border to Nicaragua. Parking in front of the hotel, you can take a long walk to the beautiful Rancho at the back. The place is clean, safe and quiet. Edith and José María are the owners and they are happy to help with everything you need. 200 (Now L500) Lempiras for parking and they borrow you a bathroom with a nice hot shower. We couldn’t find the other restaurant. Highly recomended.

name: puma gas station
description: on the main highway a gas station that closes at night. the guard let us stay and asked for tip. we told him we will stay until 7 and he said o.k. we gave him 50 lempiras pretty noisy.

name: Rapid Antigen Test Covid
description: 50m after the barrier leaving Nicaragua, at the right hand side, there is a kiosk with a red door. Here they provide covid rapid antigen test required to enter Honduras. 50US$/person, results within 15-30min.

name: Restaurante Ricardo's
description: Delicious seafood, tender angus beef and more. Tables right at the main plaza. Ricardo speaks English, recommended.

name: Parque Eco Arqueologico Las Naranjos
description: Entrance to the park. Nice 6km walk, partly on wooden walkways through wetland and jungle. 6US$/person.

name: Rawacala
description: Private natural reserve with a pristine waterfall, parking lot big enough for a big rig, toilets, showers, restaurant, hiking, tours and camping and canopy.

name: River bed
description: A place to dip into fresh river water to cool off or bathe. There is a lot of small fish to give you a thai massage. The water is crystal clear and shallow. There is a place where you can park and a small path to walk to the river. There is a little bit of thrash from the locals but nothing that stops you from enjoying the refreshing water

name: Entrance to the park Pico Bonito
description: After paying 3$ for foreigners and 30 lempiras for locals, you can park at the entrance of this trail where you can hike to the waterfall, there are some bathrooms in the parking lot, if you don’t feel like hiking there are some spots by the river to hangout there is also a smal waterfall. Water is cool and crystal clear.

name: Lab. El Buen Samaritano
description: PCR test for crossing into Nicaragua or El Salvador (both only allow PCR at this time or a proof of vax for ES if you have it). 1.5hrs to get results. Costs $52.5 per test (today's exchange). Will accept debit card, lempiras or USD. 1250L They also provide you with 4 color copies. Open on Sundays til 4pm

name: Mountain Paradise
description: Family home, close to hot springs. Small campers and bikes welcome. Internet most of the time. Happy to help. Water, outside washing facilities. Hiking, and gardening.

name: Gasolinera Uno Copan
description:
UNO Service Station, you can spend the night in the rear parking lot for fuel consumption or for 100 lempiras / 4 USD per night, there is a convenience store until 12 pm and the bathrooms until 12 pm, they have clean water to fill tanks, sale of jug of drinking water, sale of fast food, there is a car wash in front, the center of the city is 2 blocks away, there you can find an electronic teller machine, the ruins of Copan are 5 minutes away.
---

Estación de Servicio UNO, puedes pasar la noche en el parqueo trasero por consumo de combustible o por 100 lempiras/ 4 USD la noche, hay tienda de conveniencia hasta las 12 pm y los baños hasta las 12 pm de domingo a jueves, viernes y sabado 24 horas por lo que llegar vehículos a escuchar música y consumir bebidas, tienen agua limpia para rellenar tanques, venta de garrafón de agua potable, venta de comida rápida, al frente hay car wash, el centro de la ciudad esta a 2 cuadras allí consigues cajero electrónico, las ruinas de copan están a 5 minutos. el lugar muy seguro.

name: Espresso Americano
description:
Coffee shop with coffee, pastries, and free wifi.
On-street parallel parking, no dedicated parking area.

name: Papeleria Gonzalez Mejia
description: Copy shop, nice spot to get copies made before crossing in Guasaule

name: Parking gardé
description:
Parking for 10usd the night, no border road.wc.
.....
un peu en retrait de la route ce parking e. terre battue peut convenir pour une nuit.

name: Angeli boutique hotel
description:
This place takes overlanders and has 8 rooms and cabanas , totally perfect and great service. I can’t say enough about this place. Prices start at $70 per night , good wifi, restaurant and microbrewery and swimming pool. 
Email: hotel@angeligardenshn.com

name: Picnic area
description: In front of the bar and restaurant. We were here during Christmas after 10:00 no sound . Nice area to stay one or two days .

name: Farmacias del Ahorro/ PCR Tests
description: Here you can get your PCR test and it costs 1100 lempiras. (Antigen test 500 L). First you have to fill out a form then you pay (possible with card) and finally they do the test. You'll get the result at the same day per e-mail but I've been told to come back the next morning to pick up the printed result which is just printed on a more fancy paper. That's the only difference to the e-mail. She sad that this is what they want to have at the Nicaraguan border. In fact they will take and keep the original one no copy needed.

name: BAC atm
description: ATM in the city center. The other one was closed at 5:55 pm on a Monday

name: La joya del lago
description: Very nice location by the canal. Freddy the owner of the kayak rentals (100 lempiras per person unlimited for the day) is a sunny person who really wants to exchange and share. The restaurant opposite (Ratatouille) is excellent and all the staff are lovely. The location is free if you consume (kayak or restaurant). We have access to the toilets. very beautiful spot and especially very pretty people. Only negative point: the proximity of the road

name: New Star Terminal
description: This is where the New Star freighter arrives / leaves on Roatan. Very basic, mostly carries construction materials and such but can be used as ferry from and to La Ceiba. Currently runs twice a week, Wednesday night and Sunday but better ask as this is no ferry but a freighter without fixed schedule.

name: Camp Bay Beach
description: Camp Bay is a public beach but the parking for it is on private land. Officially the parking closes at 21:00 but you may negotiate with the owner who let us stay for a small fee. Alternatively you may park in front of the gate, also private land but it seems that nobody cares. Entry to the parking is through a gate at about 3.40m height. Spot is very clean and maintained by a local living there, also providing security. Super chill and quiet place, great swimming and snorkeling and not far to the kite school at Camp Bay Lodge.

name: New Star Shipping Dock
description: Here leaves the New Star freighter for Roatan. Enter the port area (you need to show an ID and vehicle registration at the office and pay a fee) and load here to go to Roatan. New Star is a freighter and not a ferry with a set schedule so check with them beforehand to see when they sail and if they have space. Currently runs twice a week.

name: Analiza Laboratorios
description: Covid PCR test for 1300 L results sent via WhatsApp in about 5 hrs. You can stop back by to get a printed copy for travel. GPS coordinates are for side street parking. Easy to find.

name: Hotel Maria Rosa
description: Very nice hotel. Free breakfast, hot water, A/C, secure, covered parking for motorcycles and cars. Gracias (the town) is a gem, everything walking distance, including the Fort up in San Cristóbal hill. Just 4.5km from Aguas Termales hot water pools (awesome), easily accessed in paved road. Got a deal for 400L (17 US$) a day for the room, because stayed 5. Normally 500L.

name: Tire Hernandez
description: If you need a mechanic you can stop here they are very friendly as we need work done and they helped us it’s right in front of the las Flores. Very cheap and very friendly people highly recommend it

name: Casa Sur B&B (former ZZur Lodging)
description: B&B inside a gated condo, very secure place in Tegucigalpa if you need to stay overnight in the capital. Laura hosts people at her house, provides free breakfast in the 36US$ fee for a comfortable room with fan and bathroom. Closed garage for 1 car or 4 motorcycles, but you can park outside  just in front of her house, in the inner secure street.

name: Texaco
description: Large dirt/grass lot behind Texaco gas station just before the small town. Not fabulous, but access to decent restrooms and internet when sitting by the store. Some picnic tables by the store to cool off in the shade or cook by the store. There is a fast food stand that we did not try. Suitable for big rigs to vans and tents. We didn’t have an animal with us, so it’s unknown whether they can be here, but I would be surprised if it were an issue. There is a night guard for the gas station - we felt safe.

name: Tekas lugar familiar
description:
informal campsite in a playground. all facilities, toilets, shower, water tap refill, 3 swimming poils.
gate closed at night and hidden from the main road, very calm.
also a restaurant opened on saturday and sunday but we were staying there during the week, so didnt try.

paid 250 lampiras per night (2 adults, 2 kids of 4 and 6).

better to call the owner before arriving as the gate was closed when we arrived at 5pm : +504 33 60 90 34.

Maybe one of the best place in Honduras as the ones existing in the app are mainly gas station or non secured parking.

name: Plaza Inn Hotel
description: Nice little Hotel restaurant with secure parking and a pool, Also a coffee shop. Good stop for the night before crossing the boarder. The owners were super friendly and spoke good English. It was 1100L for two people and included breakfast.

name: Hotel Valle Colonial
description: Small, pet-friendly, family owned hotel. After are car broke down on the way to Nicaragua, we had to stop here last minute. The family that owns the hotel took us in with open arms. The WiFi is perfect, there is secure parking within the gates of the hotel, breakfast is included. The family even helped us with laundry. The location can’t be beat in Comayagua, literally one block from everything. Highly Recommend!

name: laboratoire Buenos arias
description:
we make our pcr test to go to Nicaragua here. 1800 lempiras by people. did at 6:30 am. results at 2pm same day.
open saturday and sunday.

name: McDonalds
description: always free WiFi and bathroom available at mc Donald. enjoy climatization also if you need it

name: Camping at a river bank
description: Definitely a little closer to town than we would have liked but we were not able to find a spot further up stream. This was a great place and easy to get to. Solid packed pebbles and some spots with shade further at the edge. Perfect place to relax in the water and enjoy an awesome sunset.

name: Hotel casa lenca
description: Is a parking lot where the hotel let us stayed with security, bathrooms and wifi. We arrived at night and left early in the morning.

name: COVID Test for Nicaragua
description: This place does COVID tests to cross into Nicaragua. He did do an actual swap sample and we got the result within an hour. Whether it's a Rapid or the needed PCR test... I don't know. what matters is the result letter you need for the border says PCR. 1250Lemps per person.

name: Love hotel and a perfect place
description: Went to another place on iOverlander that allows camping. But I have a tent and it’s raining. This was the first motel when you enter old town. The outside wall is green and has their numver on it. I got a covered garage for motorcycle and a room with washroom. It’s very budget. Safe and secure. Huge lot for large vehicles to park and turn. I paid 220 in Honduras money. Cheaper than what people are paying to camp. I’m sure they would allow car camping. No wifi

name: Hotel utila
description:
Nice and cheapest place we find to sleep in utila. Besides captain morgan. 700 LP the night in a private room for two people with private room (other places we researched were all over 35 usd)
. Only cold water (we don't feel we neef hot water) and fan. You can get a room with a/c and hot water if you want. You have tables and seats in front of the sea. The restaurant works fron thursday to sunday. Good wifi to work and nice view.
If you dive you can find other places that give you night in shared rooms for free (fir example our last night we stayed in parrot's dive hostel in a shared room because we made the first diving experience...also was the cheapest we found as most of the first diving experiences were 120 usd pp but in parrot's diving was 90 usd).
Great staff in this hotel.

name: Street parking in front of police
description:
It's just street parking at the main plaza in front of the police. Secure and relatively quiet.
We asked the police before if it's save to park here and they confirmed.

name: Safe place to wild camp
description: Locals told us it was safe and they were right. Spend 2 nights here camping at the beach, nothing happened. Everybody was friendly. There is shade and  it was mostly quiet. Unfortunately there is trash lying around. There are sandflies. Mobile internet (claro and Tigo) reception. Some friendly stray dogs

name: Texaco las delicias
description: We stayed one night here heading to Ceiba, very quiet and safe with a security person. It has bathrooms and showers (not so clean but they work), toilets in good condition.  quiet good for overnight

name: playa la Ensenada
description:
beach ensenada, very nice and quiet place to camp on the beach or park your RV ... it's free .. very safe .. the people in the community are very friendly ... there are restaurants nearby with high prices, on Saturdays and Sundays  there are more people on the beach but during the week it is very lonely and quiet, relaxing we spend 5 days here in our kombi .. ask for joseth or Rosemary.. in front of his house is a great place to camp or park in front of a beautiful sea with waters  crystalline..

beach ensenada, lugar muy bonito y tranquilo para acampar en la playa o parquear tu RV ... es gratis.. muy seguro.. las personas de la comunidad son muy amables ...hay restaurantes cerca con precios altos , los sabados y domingo hay mas personas en la playa pero durante la semana es muy solo y silencioso, relajante pasamos 5 dias aqui en nuestra kombi.. preguntar por joseth o rosemary.. frente a su casa es un estupendo lugar para acampar o estacionarte frente a un hermoso mar con aguas cristalinas

name: Restaurant and Pools LA ROCA
description: we park our kombi in this place .. 100 meters from the central park of the town, very safe and the people very friendly .. family place .. ideal for parking and spending the night .. you can leave your vehicle and go through the very typical town and picturesque, we paid 6 $ to spend 2 nights and you can use the pools and also the bathrooms (very clean) there are also showers .. there is a restaurant with low cost and very good food .. we felt very safe staying in this place. At night the gate is closed and there is a security person.

name: Lavandería sinmacula
description:
Lavan y secan la ropa, se toman unas cuantas horas. 16 libras a 256 lempiras.

They wash and dry the clothes. It takes a couple of hours. It was 16 pounds for 256 lempiras

name: B and B of Joan
description: A great place to stay near the centre.  They let us park our motorcycles in their small court yard.  Joan and his wife were very friendly.  We paid 800 limps for a big room with two double beds including breakfast.

name: Copias
description: Copy place. Able to make copies or they have a computer and printer you can log onto and print out COVID results, hotel reservations, etc

name: Frank Coffee Roasters
description: Good coffee, big tables, good WiFi, plenty of plug sockets, AC, parking in front of the window. Great place to get some work done while keeping an eye on your vehicle.

name: Riverside
description: Next to a river. Good cellphone reception. Saw a few friendly locals who told us the area was safe and it is. Very quiet. Clean water. Small place and the road leading there isn’t very wide either so probably not suitable for big rigs. Stayed here for two nights. Only reachable with a 4x4! If there’s lots of rain this place will probably flood!  From the main road (toll) you turn into a dirt road. These are the coordinates to the entry of that road: 14.53822, -87.81705

name: Parque infantil Toronjal
description: This is a little park in La Ceiba for kids, it has slides and swings. There are no other parks like this in the whole city. I think is important for travel families with little kids. It has security all day. It has water to drink or wash your hands. Pets allowed.

name: Drunks beggars and thieves
description: We stayed one night in paraiso to cross the border next morning. Mistake! Even though somebody told us it was safe, “no pass nada” in the night some things were stolen from the back of our van a knife had been used to cut it lose. We were also bothered several times by (drunk) beggars. Paraiso has nothing to offer as well. ATM’s were not working.  Better drive straight from Danli to the border.

name: K'awiil Coffee Shop
description: Really nice coffee shop and a great place to get some work done. WiFi, AC and plugs.

name: Hotel Sandoval
description: Nice mid range hotel. 595L for one person. AC, hot showers, secure parking garage, breakfast included.

name: Paseo los Girasoles
description: In this place they plant sunflowers, 12 minutes from the main street of Copan Ruinas, they have a restaurant.  nice place to take pictures with the sunflowers.  the entrance has a price of 40 Lempiras ($2) / person.

name: El Morito Mariscos & Lounge
description: If like us you do not have a SIM card for Honduras and are in need of wifi, especially when waiting for your covid test results to come through (farmacia del ahorra next door), then we can recommend this restaurant. Wifi was fast. They specialize in seafood but serve other food. The meals were OK. It‘s a popular place amongst locals but plenty of space both in restaurant and car park.

name: Las Tablas
description:
This is an exceptional restaurant. Trust us. If you’re meatlovers like us - you need to eat here. We ordered the tenderloin filet and it was the best we’ve eaten in all the Americas so far!! We usually stay clear from steakhouses as we prefer to grill ourselves, but this was sublime. This dish (Corte de Filete), served with papas and veggies cost L420 ($18) and was worth every penny. The staff were super friendly, attentive and welcoming. It was a pleasure for them to host us, they even prepared their specialty hamburger on the house for us. It was huge! 1lb of beef! La Torona de las Tablas would normally cost L285 ($12). And out of the blue, I received a free cocktail (costing L120 -$4) 
If you want to make a night of it, you’d probably be able to camp here too. We asked the manager and she said yes. The wifi btw was very fast! And lots of playground equipment for the kiddies. Definitely recommend eating here.

name: Uno gas station
description:
It’s free. It has a big parking space, very quite at night. There are 3 restaurants so there are restrooms and Wi-Fi available if you buy something to eat.

Es gratis. Es una gasolinera amplia y muy tranquila de noche. Hay 3 restaurantes a la par entonces hay wifi y servicios sanitarios disponibles si se consume algo.

name: Cabañas Agua Azul
description: Accidental and wonderful find. We met Eduardo in town, and he invited us to camp on his property. It’s a place with cabanas, a really good restaurant, and a boat launch. We camped right by the launch, but to the side so people could still pass. We were here Monday and Tuesday nights and it was so peaceful. I’m guessing it’s not as peaceful on the weekend. There is a bathroom to use closer to the restaurant, and a water spigot there (it’s hiding between the restroom and event room). No shower that we know of. At the restaurant, we recommend the pizza (after 2 pm), burger, Buffalo chicken sandwich, and poboy sandwich. Free to camp if you eat at the restaurant. Decent WiFi at restaurant. Lots of flies one of the two days we were there, but no mosquitos. Excellent place for bird watching and listening. We camped in our Jeep Gladiator.

name: Local bar and restaurant
description: We had a lovely afternoon meeting some locals. We asked if we could stay parked in front of the beach and they offered us a spot right by the restaurant. We had a great dinner of shrimp, chicken and rice and beans and a couple beers each plus a big bottle of water all for L 400. Access to bathrooms and water for washing (didn’t drink). Great spot except all the trash in the beach but very friendly people and felt very safe.

name: Hotel Casa D'Luna
description: Private parking, allows dogs, AC, small pool. Safe, secure, quiet. 900L/$45 dollars. Covid test at LACM a 5 min walk away.

name: Laguna San Julian
description: You really need to want to go here, because the road from Danli is unpaved, the whole 25km or so. But then you arrive at a nice lake. Talked to some fishermen and we all agreed it was safe. And quiet. No (Tigo) internet or perhaps "E".

name: Hotel Quinta Avenida
description: $24 a night.  Allows dogs.  High clearance vehicle secure parking.  Clean and quiet.

name: Pull out
description: Just a small opening on the side of a dirt road. Good for a night, if you don't want to spend it in town or on the main road. Space for 1 (max 2) vehicle(s), no RV. No need for 4wd. Super quite spot, only two bikes passed in the evening.

name: Garden Coffee & Cabañas
description: Beautiful spot to spend a night. José, a very friendly owner of the Garden Café told us he doesn’t mind letting people sleep in the van near his café. He left the toilets opened for us and didn’t ask us any money. Café (and the gate to enter) closes at 7PM. No obligation to consume in the café but obviously it’s a nice thing to do. Nice cabañas available on the site (28-35USD). Very safe, clean, super friendly people.

name: Rio Jalán
description: Nice leveled spot by the river. We stopped only for lunch, but I guess it would be alright for a night. There is a farm on the road where one could ask. Road is unpaved, no need for 4wd right now, but some clearence helps. Probably hard for RVs or big vans.

name: Scenic route
description: Beautiful unpaved road that connects Campamento with Teupasenti. It goes through the mountains, through tiny small villages and lots of platano and coffee plantations. Beautiful views. 4WD high clearence ONLY! In certain sections, the road is narrow, muddy and very steep. Good GPS also recommended due to many intersections with other roads.

name: Pulperia lot
description: Opening on the side of the road which belongs to the pulperia nearby (red house). We asked for permission to camp for a night and it was no problems. They sell their own coffee (very good) and super tasty platano chips. Very friendly locals, very quite night. Possible to fill up drinkable water if you ask to the pulperia (free). There is a football field 50m further down which, i guess, you could use for camping (but kids from the school will be there early in the morning). Another football field which could be a possible camp spot was a few km north of this site. Road to get here is 4WD high clearance ONLY!

name: Fun 4WD road
description: Fun road through the mountains. 4WD high clearance ONLY! Very narrow, rocky and steep in some sections. Nice views. Not sure google maps has it, we found it on Gaia GPS.

name: River Park Hotel & Cabañas
description: Very nice Camping, with electricity, wifi, pool, restaurant, clean bathroom. Owners very nice. Charged us USD 30, but for future referenced from iOverlander will charge USD 20. No dumping, but is willing to have in the future. Next to the road, but really quiet anyways. Have outside shower at the pool, but is also willing to build them in the future if more Overlanders come visit.

name: Little Comedor
description:
Nice place to camp with a tent for cyclists!
Very friendly people in a little Comedor (Restaurant) let us camp on their meadow where they keep their cows. Stunning view into the valley!

name: Bigfoot Hostel
description: Cheap mojitos, a small pool and pool table. Street parking only. Internet was down (and had been for a few days) when we stayed here.

name: Guesthouse Ari
description: Has secure parking for one vehicle, no bigger than a mid-size SUV. The kitchen was constantly dirty.

name: La Maquina
description: The park has a set of nice waterfalls, a good place to go for a swim. Look out for scorpions at night. The bathrooms were pretty sketchy.

name: Finca Magdalena
description: Lots of covered camping spaces with parking close by. Good place to hang out a few days and explore the island. The trail up the volcano starts from behind the farmhouse. Wifi available in the restaurant and decently fast. With extension cord, we were able to get electrical hook up.

name: Hotel Dalinky
description: Hotel Dalinky is a small hotel with about 15 rooms. They charge mid-December 25US $ for a room without Aircon and 35 US$ with aircon. There is a TV, a fan and a bathroom and a pool. I negotiated a discount of 5 US $ because of no breakfast. I parked my RV (21 foot) outside and nothing happened to it. If you have a much larger vehicle than 21 foot, it won’t fit in front because it will block the road. They also have a little inside parking for motorcycles with a gate. The beach is about 300 meters away. There is a restaurant at the beach. The chef is Italian and his food is excellent.

name: Hostel Indio Viejo
description: Great place to stay. Camper with two persons 220.- per night. Bathrooms and showers are clean. Gated parking in the backyard of the hostel. Nice community-area and restaurant. They can organize tours to the volcano.

name: Outside Hotel Alhambra
description: We were allowed to park the van for the time we were out at night but didn't sleep there as the kids on the street were annoying and hanging out by the van.

name: Playa Roca Hotel, Puerto Espino
description: We pulled in on a Friday and they set us up with power by the gate. Charged $6 pp. BTW we saw an ATM in the village on way here. Good Claro reception. Pool not open and looked like it hadn't been in a while. Banos clean with TP and seats; there is an outdoor shower on the beach side of bar and an inside one by the banos that you have to ask for the key from bartender to use. Friendly staff.

name: Mountain Resort Selva Nega
description: You have to rent a hotel room, so much to expensive.  Price: $ 30.00

name: Centro Turistico El Mirador
description:
Easy paved parking lot but guarded. At the Centro Turistico El Mirador in Catarina  Price: $0.70 USD / 20 Cordobas for cars.

Price for a 25' Class C is $40C.

name: Fire Station Granada
description: Secure parking at the fire station.  You could sleep here, but we didn't see any bathrooms and it was a bit dirty.    Price: $5 for 2 days of parking.

name: Hostel Amigos Del Rojo
description: Pretty, clean, quiet hostel.  Unfortunately our room was right next to a school that started at 0630 in the morning with noisy kids playing.  Private room with ensuite bathroom and fan, fast internet, cold showers.   Price: $17/night.

name: Brio Hotel
description: For rent by owner home set up on the hill above Gigante.  Two bedroom, 1 bathroom with hot water, a/c, awesome pool, wifi.    Price: $25/couple with 2 couples.

name: Campestre Esteli (closed for vehicles at the moment)
description: Power (with long cable) – outside sockets didn’t work but there is a socket inside on the upper level. Water. Flush toilets. Bad showers in block by pool. Swimming pool and tennis court. Parking on concrete or grass. Nic$230 per night. Ensure vehicle doesn’t touch trees here, we had problem with large ants as a consequence.     Also possible to camp at Hotel Campista, 100 metres or so along the road on the right hand side after Campestre Esteli. Hotel run by Welsh guy and Nicaraguan wife.

name: Finca Lindos Ojos
description: At altitude so cool. Parking on grass. Road is rough to get here (dodgy in wet season). High clearance needed. Horse rides and hikes available. Communal dinner available. Cabanas and outhouses with shower. USD5 camping cost per person (July 2017). Maximum vehicle size, 25 feet long due to tight right hand turn into Finca.

name: Fortaleza de Coyotepe
description: Possible Free Camping just before reaching the fort on flat area to the left. If more than 10ft high park at foot of fort rather than drive to gate as you can’t turn round (we had to reverse part way back down the hill). If you go here, ask for a tour, they are great value (English available) and the story is amazing.

name: Mirador De Catarina
description:
Camping possible here for a fee in spacious parking lot on the left. Close to Restaurant/Disco though which is open until late. No facilities but close to restaurants.

,

name: San Juan Del Sur – Malecon
description: Camping possible along sea front. Free. Left far end from town better as near police station and quieter. No facilities.

name: Paradiso Hostel
description: Found it hard to leave. Initially they asked $10/head, but agreed to $5. Parking in the small unfrequented parking lot at the top of the property. At the time of our stay it was cool and breezy, a welcome respite from the Nicaraguan heat. The property is right on the shores of Lake Apoyo (great soft warm water), with facilities and a good affordable restaurant. We did not use electricity but it can be made available (fee?). Big rigs might be able to fit and can always land just outside the gates in what seems like a very safe area. Water truck comes on Monday.

name: Playa Amarillo
description:
Security issues were a few years ago. We had absolutely no worries. Just keep your rig locked when you're not in it. Locals can also watch your car.

GTT ROBBED!! NOT RECOMMENDED...
Remarkably uninhibited beach just north of playa El Gigante. Just as you are leaving El Gigante heading on the northers road take the dirt road the turns off to the left over the little hill (don't take the sharp left to the restaurant). Long stretch of beach shared with a few cows, monkeys and the occasional surfer walking to the next beach over. Good access road in with several boondocking options.

name: Finca Esperanza Verde
description: A beautiful coffee finca in the hills of Nicaragua. To get here, head to Yacul. (Don't follow Google maps suggestion). At Yacul, you'll turn north to head to the finca. Follow the signs at this point. This finca is extremely Eco friendly, recycling and reusing almost all their waste. Restaurant is stocked with food from their organic garden. Highly recommend. Cost is $20 per night. Camp area is in small dirt parking lot. Free all you can drink potable spring water and coffee available.  You may also be able to buy some veggies here if they have excess, but the restaurant is amazingly good.

name: Red Cross Parking Lot
description:
This is the parking lot for the Red Cross in Granada. Not amazing facilities but not far from down town Granada
paid 100c for a van for a night and they were ok with us sleeping in the van. The toilet is terrible. it was a quiet night only a small amount of noise from the road. a quick walk to the nice parts of town, and the malecon on the water.

name: Red Gate next to Monkey Hut
description: Miguel manages this lakefront property. There is no sign but the entrance is a red gate off the main road. Yell "Miguel" at the gate or ask the neighbors to track him down but he is on the property from 9-4. Plenty of space down driveway and at the bottom where the lake is to park/ camp. Private lake area to yourself. Property has rental rooms w a/c but they look gross. There is a bathroom you can use. Right next to Monkey Hut (walkway near lake) so you can eat next door. Using wifi from Monkey Hut with extender (good signal). Paying 100 cordoba/ night to park.

name: Tropigas
description:
Filled propane, you have to go the back first and pay and then with the recipe you can fill you tank. You need a passport for the bank. Don't go to the bank during lunch siesta or you will be waiting hours. If you come on sat after 12 they will accept your cash! (maybe)
Get there early as they will give you a price and their bank details so you can make a deposit at the bank, and receive a deposit voucher. You need a passport for the bank. THEN they will fill your gas cylinder. I paid 189C for a 5lb tank. overpriced but I was out of gas and no other gas plants around.

name: El Mirador
description: This is a restaurant just outside town which will let you camp in their parking lot. Relatively quiet when we were there, but we don't know how it is in weekends. The owner can also arrange for a tour through the canyon - the local tourist highlight.   Price: 110 Cordobas

name: Sollentuna Hem
description:
05.05.2016: camping not possible.

Jinotega is a cosy highland town. The hotel Sollentuna Hem (a Swedish name) let us camp in their backyard and use the hotel facilities. Not sure if this will work for everybody, as I have a feeling that being able to speak Swedish really helpt in the negotiations. However, the hotel is nice and the rooms are not too pricy. There was also a possibility for camping at the hotell across the street (see the other camp list).   Price: N/A

name: "George's holiday house"
description: Great camp site, but there is no name on the gate. The reason is that this is a holiday house for the owner and his familiy, and getting the right permits for running a camp ground is not too easy. However, this place has a beautiful location right on the lake, and the swimming is really good. The parking is not very level so it might be necessary to move a few rocks around. The owner encourraged us to let other travellers know about the place, and it is a good base for exploring the area. It is about 20 minutes to drive to Granada, to Volcan Mazaya, to "the white towns", and to the Volcan Mombacho.   Price: 100 Cordobas

name: Mirador Catarina
description:
Moderator note. As from March 14th this position is correct.

Emergency parking spot, loudly. Beautiful view of Laguna de Apoyo. Cordoba 40.00 / night  Parking

name: Hostal Suenos del Mar
description: Hostal near the church.  Private room with private bathroom and shower, TV, wifi, free coffee every morning, shared kitchen. 20 USD/night.  AC is available for extra, not sure how much though.

name: Tropigas
description: 226 NIO for a 20 pound tank - Note: Men may not enter the plant unless they are wearing long pants and closed toe shoes, women can wear whatever they want.  Additionally, we did not need any adaptors, the whole process was really easy.  They even carried the refilled tank to the gate for Victoria!

name: The Monkey Hut
description: PROS:  Private room with private ensuite bathroom was beautiful, lake front location is amazing, free wifi, free use of kayaks, inner tubes & floating dock, fully equipped camp kitchen – CONS: restaurant is not owned by hotel so you must pay cash at time of order, bar closes at 8pm, no laundry service although website states they offer it – Private Room: 45 USD plus tax, Dorm: 16 USD per/person plus tax – GNOTE: Camping in their parking lot costs 16 USD/person/night plus 20 USD for electric plus tax and does not include showers.

name: Hotel Nahuatl
description: Secure parking in the backyard (garden) of the Hotel Nahuatl, with trees and palms. Big entrance gate, we had also no problems with the height (3.30m). The hotel is in the middle of the town.We used the bathroom of a hotel room or a dormitorio (cold shower). 300 Cordoba/night for two persons (electricity included).

name: Hostal Real
description: Very nice place!!! You can stay in the parkinglot or on a grassy field. Directly on the beach. Beautiful swimmingpool, clean location, friendly staff. Toilet and cold shower in a separate building. 20 bucks a night, electricity included.

name: Rancho los Alpes
description: You can stay in the parkinglot of the beautiful Rancho. Clean toilet and shower are available. Very friendly owner, who lives on the property with his family. Price now 15 USD for two adults. You find the entry road at N 12.414249; W 86.960413.

name: Multiple options here
description:
- multiple options here
- we stayed at a "Finca" by the infobooth for $2 per person a night - parked in the garden in front of it
- the house was empty (except for some bat crap- couple of them live here)
- cold shower, flushing toilet
- talk to Henry at the place that sells tours at the fork where the dirt road leaves the paved PanAm.
- they also offered us to stay behind the restaurant (dirty parking lot) - obviously to sell us some food and drinks
- we went for the Finca, which offered more privacy, but was not really spectacular
- There are more camping options if you follow the road down to the river (behind the information booth, you need to pay the entrance to the park first - 2$ pp). There seemed to be a nice camping right at the end of the road before the river.
- get ready for some very pushy locals trying to sell you the canyoning tour. Prices start at $20 pp, we got it down to 12$ pp, but didn't go at the end because we didn't feel like getting wet (it wasn't really warm and we've already been to ATM in Belize, but it should be nice)
- If you just want to see the canyon, you don't need a guide - pay 2$ pp at the entrance booth and either leave your car there or drive down to the river (parking ca 20 Cordobas) and walk up stream, crossing the river twice (jumping across on rocks, you don't have to get wet). At one point the path ends and you can take a small boat for 25 Cordobas pp. 500 meters further into the canyon. There should be also another path that would lead you up to the canyon rim and a mirador (it is marked on OpenStreet Maps).

name: Las Penitas Surfing School
description:
- we stumbled upon this place while looking for a place to camp by the beach
- the owner looks like he is more into fishing than surfing, but he is cool anyways
- he didn't ask for any money, so it is basically "name your price" (we gave him 100 Cordobas + cold beer)
- toilet with a bucket flush system
- view of the ocean in the front, locked gate from the street in the back
- really private and quiet (nobody here at night, the owner lives elsewhere)

name: Parking in front of Restaurant Paso del Tran
description:
- free
- this was a last resort situation - it was dark, we were tired and all other options failed
- camping on an unsecure parking in front of a restaurant under some street lights
- we asked in the restaurant, they didn't mind
- we ended up having a dinner there, which was pretty good

name: Totoco Ecolodge
description:
- free
- slow wifi
- we were invited here by friends we made on the ferry, who were staying there
- fancy ecolodge, we camped on the parking lot next to a palapa
- awesome views of the western volcano, lots of animals here (lizards, toads, howler monkeys, ...)
- the owner Martijn (Dutch) seemed OK, maybe he would let others stay as well
- the road here is ROUGH and STEEP (but the worst part is being repaired - Jan 2014)

name: Parqueo Cañon de Somoto
description: Parking on a grassfield with very little infrastructure (just two outhouses). Very quiet and a beautifull landscape. The owner family is very friendly and will make you dinner if you ask. To get there you have to pay the entrance fee for the national monument or just book a canyon tour (includes the fee). To stay overnight $5/vehicle/night.

name: Tropigas
description: They refill North American type tanks here. Very easy to find- it's at the roundabout on the way to Ometepe ferries.

name: Laguna Beach Club
description: Inexpensive hostel with a few private rooms as well. Located right on Laguna de Apoyo. Very new facility and $12 per night per person for the dorm room. Private rooms around $40-55 and sleep 2. Restaurant on site in the $4.50 to $12 range per plate. Excellent secure parking for small rigs or motos. Owners are very nice and run a great place. There is a full kitchen on site for your use as well. Closest major market it 18km away in Granada. A small tienda is located just outside the gate for basics.

name: Playa El Ostional
description: Free Camping on a wunderful beach. 20 km from San Juan del Sur, behind Playa del Coco. 15 km unpaved Road in a good condition.

name: Port Of San Jorge Ferry Terminal
description:
Ferry terminal for Ometepe.
Reservations not needed during the week.  Super easy and cheap.  We paid 50 cord per person and 80 cord for our vehicle, showed up right before departure.   
Reservations recommended  call: (505)2278-8180 or (505)2569-4101. The guards at the gate offered to let us sleep in the lot if we payed them $100C to each guard. We stayed down the street in front of the hotel instead. 

----------------------------------------------------------------
Best to make reservations ahead of time, making them day might not work out. Ferry el Che Guevara - 256-34779 (other possible numbers 86941819, 88807739, 83844296, ferryometepepequiroga@yahoo.es) There are two other ferry companies.

name: San Ramón Cascada
description: We did the hike for $3 usd and took about 3 hours round trip. Really nice waterfall! The guard at the gate and later the owner, Edgar, offered us to stay across the road on the lake in their gated property for free! Private beach and palapa. Bathrooms until the park closed.

name: Hacienda Merida
description: Great little hostel on the water. Nice and quiet, away from the wind, really good food, kayaks, and a great dock for sunsets. $5 for parking on their even parking lot. They are also located next to one of the more adventurous trailheads for Volcan Madres (tough 7ish hour hike).

name: Rancho Esperanza
description: Great location on a white, sandy beach with quiet surf scene and waves for all skill levels. They cater to many types of travellers with camping, hostel and cabana services. Restaurant serves 3 meals per day including all day breakfast and a snack service.  $1.25 beer on the honour system. Very laid back vibe with lots of hammocks and places to chill.  Off the beaten path nearby a traditional fishing village. You have to drive 7km on gravel road to get here. Clean bathroom facilities with composting toilets. DIY laundry - sink and lines. $5 per person per night.

name: Tropigas
description: Propane fillup on right side of road about 1km past round about traveling southeast

name: La Flor Turtle Sanctuary (de Vida Silvestre)
description: Beautiful large reserve dedicated to turtle conservation and breeding. We were able to release 50 baby turtles at sunset, an experience I will never forget! If you want to tent camp inside the park cost is $500C/tent and if you want to stay in your camper in the lot they only charged us entrance fee of $200C/p which is a bit expensive but all for a great cause. Whether you see turtles is determined by the time of year.

name: Hostal Chico Largo
description: $5 pp parking on a flat grassy areas with views to the lake. At the time we were here the internet was not working. Ok spot pretty close to the port. Think tent camping may be possible here but sure.

name: Caballitas Mar
description: This is a restaurant with kayak rental and tours run by a relax Spaniard. He also has rooms. We stayed 2 nights next to his place. We did a kayak tour one day and ate at his restaurant the other day. We didn't have to pay anything for the night. Toilet, shower and wifi available. We were allowed to use electricity from outside socket. Beautifull sunset! Very quiet. Recommended.

name: Playa Marcella (Restaurant)
description: We couldn't make it up the final hill to Playa Maderas (4x4 and high clearance needed). So we ended up at Playa Marcella. We stayed one night at the restaurant at the end of the road right at the beach. You can just stay on the parking lot for the night for free. Food was not really good. Between 9pm and 8am there is nobody in the restaurant. Very quiet. Notice: there is a crocodile living in the river next to the parking lot. For the next night we switched to the other end of the beach.

name: La Flor Wildlife Refuge
description: Camped in parking lot of turtle conservation project. Just had to pay entry 200C/person. Limited services (water, shower and toilet) but a great opportunity to release turtles and watch them hatch as well as watch adults lay eggs. If you want to tent camp however it is 500c for a "tent platform" by the beach.

name: Barca de Oro
description: Small hotel with rooms, dorm and cabanas on a laguna that opens on the ocean. Restaurant and an area with hamacs and tables.  Kayaks and surfs on location. Parked in the back of the property; closed parking, kind of small and needs some levelling but our 24 feet camper fit. French owner. Ext. showers on the beach. DIY laundry. Mosquitoes at sunset (mostly). 15usd per night.

name: Coconut Delight Bakery
description: Good bakery with sandwiches (chicken with egg very good) and bread, donuts, etc. Very friendly owners. They offer tours as well. They speak English and Spanish. Located across from the wharf.

name: La Hacienda
description: Camped under nice shaded spot in parking lot. All they asked is to patronize them and eat at least a meal in the restaurant. We ordered burgers, some of the most affordable items on the menu. Spent 400 Cordobas which is still pricey but at least you get food, a camping spot and clean restrooms. Very friendly staff.

name: Hotel Jackani
description: Good place to stay. Very clean and good breakfast, friendly ownerfamily. Near the boatharbor to el rama (2 Blocks) and citycenter. 70$ for a family room. Hoteljackani@gmail.com

name: Hotel Casa Ulrich
description: $35 for 2, $40 for 3 sharing, clean rooms with shower. Good restaurant and lots of sitting areas with rocking chairs. Wifi poor and only in restaurant. Parking for motor bikes and maybe a couple of small cars (2m height restriction). We parked outside a house down the end of the road for 100c per night.

name: Kabu Tours
description: Kabu Tours offers boat trips and cultural tours to outlying  villages only reachable by boat to the Pearl Islands. One day or overnight. The website is: www.kabutours.com and phone +505.871.451.96. They speak English, Spanish and Miskitu.

name: Hotel Castillo Real
description: Double room with shower  300c without AC but with fan or 600c  with AC. Clean rooms with TV and fridge.  Secure parking for several cars.

name: Mulitservicios Aviles, Rivas
description: Quick and efficient oil change with vast choice of petrol and diesel oils and filters (even original Toyota oils and filters). They also clean vehicles and we had the underneath cleaned and sprayed with a marine spray.

name: Hotel Paraiso
description: The dutch owner also allows camping

name: Punta El Cacique
description: Tent camping and small rig in parking area. Primarily a restaurant but has plenty of different areas for tents and they advertise camping. Only current tent camping on the lake as other locations that previously offered tent space said no. Good swimming beaches

name: Backpackers Inn and Unique Hostel
description: 15 per night per person plus tax for dorm. Motorcycle parking in lobby. Full kitchen, two courtyards one with pool and hot water. Really nice place. Very clean. Beautiful artwork throughout. We were able to get the ok for our dog but receptionist had to call manager.

name: Ducati's Resting Place
description: We realize this is very unconventional for iOverlander but it is important nonetheless. Our Chihuahua Ducati from S&M Boiler Works was in the beginning of a round the world motorcycle trip when a tragic accident happened on Ometepe Island that took his life. He is buried here. The camping and food here are wonderful (hacienda Merida) and it is a great place to stay. If you are here stop over and say hi to Ducati under the tree to the south of the dock on the beach and add rock to the pile. He was a lover of travel and adventure.

name: Playa Virgin
description: Free. Firm grassy area on the lake shore behind the private houses. We asked local people if it's ok to park here for a night, and they were very nice and friendly. There are horses and pigs walking around, but the area is clean. Nice view, quiet, but windy. Driving from Costa Rica side take a right turn 100 m after the Playa Virgin sign, follow the road to the end. You'll see sort of road going to the rocky beach to the left, and grassy area to the right. We stayed on the right side as per locals advice.

name: Parkplatz vor Restaurant España
description: We first tried to find something in Corinto - but without any success. If you leave the peninsula via the bridge you can see the Hotel "La Valencia" to the right. The owner told us that although we could not stay in the hotel courtyard, we could camp in the parking lot in front of their restaurant, which is located on the other side of the estuary on the left. Since the restaurant was guarded at night, the parking lot was safe too.

name: Restaurante Puesta del Sol
description: Free. We parked in the street outside this restaurant for free. Quiet area, no problems for us. The staff told us that otter overlanders have parked here with no issues either. There is security at restaurant but inside. We had access to bathrooms all night but that might have been an oversight since we were told that they closed at 8:30.

name: casa hotel sanjose
description: new build, internet ,pool, pet friendly, hot showers clean can cook your own food or restaurant close supermarket town 2 km away.spent 3 nights very nice 25 dollars per night

name: Hotel Las Peñitas
description: Campasite woth water, maybe electricity, and a lot of space. Shadow in the hammocks. Is a new place for Rv in las peñitas, only one block from the beach. Fit every kind of rv

name: Auto Lavado "Valle"
description: Great spot to get your car washed and oil changed. The owner Carlos speaks great English and was very helpful with many other problems that I had. Honest and priced fairly.

name: Comedor Suhamy
description: Great beach front camping for 150 cordobas! Plenty of shade and hammocks to use. There is a well to draw water from for bucket showers and a decent bucket flush toilet. The restaurant has great food and also sells non-potable ice.

name: Hotel Congo
description: Nice and clean rooms (paid 35usd/night for a family room). Very quiet, about 3 minutes walk to the beach, restaurants at the beach. Good for surf.

name: Camping Matilda
description: Fantastic hostel with private rooms, mini casitas and dorms, right on a beautiful quiet beach with gorgeous waves. Secure parking for 2 or 3 motorcycles, perhaps more. Mini casitas are good for single people at $8 per night. Private rooms $15 for one person, $25 for two. dorm beds $10. Bring food, as there is no restaurant but there is a little bar. Situated 8 miles north of San Juan del Sur on a very navigable dirt road.

name: Parking At Restaurant "Natural"
description: Free camping in a small 1 space parking lot next to a great restaurant "Natural".  Natural has good bathrooms and wifi, water tap.  Garbage bins in parking lot     Must eat here if you are veg or vegan

name: Hostal Los Tres Hermanos
description: Not recommended. Cafe Revolution is changing owners and is closed. Tres Hermanos allowed us to park in their lot and for $3 allowed to use the bano (with a bracelet and asking for the key). However there wasn't water in the toilet and barely a trickle in the sink. One night after a person with us used the showers they came over and ripped off our bracelets and said no more bathrooms, nothing. Very unwelcoming vibe. Too bad there is such a nice wave here....

name: Hotel El Ensueño
description: 350 cordobles ($13 USD) for 2 people, 1 dog, 1 night.   Our car broke down, first place in Rosita that we found.  Grounds are fine, no gate.   Room is slightly dingy but is normal for the price.   No a/c.   They seemed to have a problem with our dog staying in the room but seem to have made an exception.   Wifi is good.

name: Hotel Bosawas
description: $300 cordobles per night for 2 people and 1 dog.   We stayed 2 nights because of car trouble, reasonably friendly staff, no problems with me working on the car all day in the parking lot.  Nice room for the price, no a/c, good wifi.  Nice location, 1 mile out of town and a little ways off the road.  No gate, there appeared to be a night watchman.   Very noisy at night for some unknown reason, it sounded like they were doing a construction job.  Restaurant is good but expensive, $130 per plate.  Nice restaurant with better prices and interesting food across the road.   FYI, the road is in very poor condition from here to Puerto Cabezas, low clearance vehicles not recommended.

name: Playa Virgen 2
description: Free lakefront boondocking. No facilities. Coming from Costa Rica turn right down gravel road just after small bridge. From Rivas, just before the small bridge. I parked on left, small gravelly areas near grass. Lots of goats, pigs, and horses wandering about. Friendly woman in house behind. Some men by the lake until dark. No problems. Stayed here to cross into Costa Rica in the morning.

name: Main Park Granada
description:
We park on the Libertad st. in front of the Cathedral Park. No services cause u r on the street, but it`s a safe town, great location, free wifi in the park and lot of restaurants around. Free! \\\\\\\\\\\\\
Estacionamiento sobre la calle "Libertad" frente a la plaza principal de la Catedral.
Buena ubicación, seguro y Gratis! Muchos restaurantes al rededor y wifi gratis en el parque.

name: Hotel Cacique Adiact
description: $55 U.S. a night and up. Secure indoor parking. Kitchenette in each room. Pool, WIFI. Free hot breakfast. Gym. Owned by Danish family. In center of Leon . We were also able to plug in our rig.  Can organize tours.

name: Casa de Rigo Sampson at Salinas Grandes
description:
A house for rent right on the beach. The owner allows camping on the grounds also. The beach is almost deserted and has some nice waves when conditions are right.

Meals can be had at the nearby Los Cocos hostel. There's a turtle hatchery on the site, which prevents turtle eggs being sold for cooking, if you're there at the right time it's possible to see them hatching. The groundskeeper, Pedro who lives on sight is very humble and friendly and more than happy to talk about his work with the turtles and anything else.

The water at the site is brackish, so bring plenty of fresh water!

Contact the owner before arriving, don't just show up, contact at: journeynicaragua@gmail.com

name: Mexico, Cabanas and Camping
description: $15us a night for two people. Electric with long cable. Secure, gates locked at night. Cold showers. Five minute walk to playa Marsella. A bit muddy when it rains but nice people and quiet. A few restaurants very close but the provided kitchen is big and well stocked.

name: Sarren
description: Maybe the only one in the island. Expensive

name: Rancho Merida
description: Right next to Hacienda Merida- looks like a new place. Big open areas with a small shop at the entrance. The owner Is a friendly guy who speaks good English. Camping for $3 (they charged us $5 per car, 2 people) or a double room for $7 pp, or even cabanas. Place is clean with reasonable wifi. Restaurant on site. Washing area for clothes. I am sure they will accept rigs- but maybe through the back gate. Can organise tours from here or rent a horse, kayak or bike. Howler monkeys and one of the volcano trails nearby. We loved this place. Food is good, there is also a great local place right behind with reasonable prices and big portions.

name: Hospedaje San Jorge
description: Nice clean hostel with friendly owner. There is a swimming pool, save parking for motorcycles and cars (hight restriction gate is 2,5 m). Double rooms with private bathroom vary from 12 to 15 usd per room. Located close to old center and directly at the market.

name: Simple Beach Lodge
description:
