small, really nice house right at the beach opened by a fellow motorcycle traveller. offers simple but beautiful rooms, place has a nice breeze, some space for parking.

notice: really small place. not for camping or big rigs.
matt was still busy building the place up when i was there.

https://www.facebook.com/simplelodge

name: Las Manos, Honduras to El Paraiso, Nicaragua
description:
Nicaragua-Honduras, Las Manos Border.

Important: To enter Nicaragua, you need to fill out the following online form 7 days in advanced: http://solicitudes.migob.gob.ni/

On Nicaragua side as described before. They are building a new office for the aduanas/ migracion so right now it is a bit chaotic, where to go....

Zika check (fiber) on Nicaragua side

 Exit Honduras:  Immigration and aduana in same building with different offices. Passport stamped out (no fee). At aduana, vehicle temporary import paper taken and exit stamp put in passport (no fee).  

Enter Nicaragua:  Directed to fumigation (no cost), then to immigration to get a tourist card and receipt with stamps cost USD$12 or 282 Nicaraguan Cordoba Oros (NIO).
Insurance cost USD$12 or NIO282. 
Also pay a road tax of USD$1 or NIO24 (receipt was given) to the guard at the border, before another border guard who checked all my other paperwork would let me pass.

name: Guasaule, Honduras to Somotillo, Nicaragua
description:
This is the border crossing from Guasaule, Honduras to Somotillo, Nicaragua.

Be prepared for lots of tight weaving around trucks going both directions and double parked to get through the Honduras side. 

Nicaragua - 1x passport copy & 1x vehicle title for passport person & $13 usd for stamp + admin fee. no copies for TIP & it's free. 

The Nicaragua process starts by parking on the footpath just as you have finished driving down the wrong side of the bridge. Get a customs form outside the hut in the middle. Drive up to the next building for passport and customs. Insurance at final check if you don't have it.

name: La Fraternidad, San Marcos de Colon, Honduras to El Espino, Nicaragua
description:
EL ESPINO Border Crossing (Honduras into Nicaragua) 
Open all day and night  

Honduras to Nicaragua 
Tourist entry fee: $10USD/pp
Some entry tax: $2USD/pp
Dog import: $26USD/pp
Fumigation: $4USD/pp
Photocopies: $2USD/pp
Mandatory insurance: $12USD/pp

Keep your tourist card and receipts.
No fees when exiting Honduras. 


Nicaragua to Honduras
Nica exit fee: $2US/person
Tourist entry fee $3US/person
Car import permit fee $40US (790 lempiras, ask for receipt to avoid agent keeping the cash)
Photocopies: $0.25US 
Pet import fee: $15US

name: Simple Beach Lodge
description:
Small Hotel owned and run by two biking overlanders. Three comfortable double rooms with ocean view at the best location in Las Penitas right in front of the surf break.
Right next to Playa Roca and very close to the best bars/restaurants in town. 
Prices from USD 25 to 35

name: Cafe con leche
description:
We are a beachfront hotel that will happily accomodate all overlanders! Myself being an overlander !
Totally new hotel restaurant camping on the beach. Actual camping on the beach or in secluded garden. Owned by two Canadian brothers, run by a lovely girl Erika. I paid $10 for a night excl. breakfast for camping in my car. $30 pp for a room with fan, other price for suites and included meals. Excellent surfing and swimming right in front of the hotel. Questions can be asked to Marc Bonds 5523-4980 cl or 7693-4595 mov info@cafeconlechenica.com

name: Las Tablillas/Los Chiles
description:
DECEMBER 2021

COSTA RICA TO NICARAGUA

PCR required, not more than 72h old. The strange formulario you're supposed to send by mail did not matter for me. 

Very bureaucratic, come early. 

IMPORTANT : you only get 30 days MAXIMUM for your vehicle and have to go to Managua at the Aduana offine to have it extended. Very annoying and nothing else I could do apparently. I do not know if it was because my vehicle was Costa Rica plated. Please correct when this it figured out for next travelers.

Nicaragua is really slow and messy, Costa Rica is fast and modern. 

Bring Cash. They change it at the border but at a really bad rate so better change early. Note : Both sides seem to accept USD. 

-----------

NICARAGUA TO COSTA RICA :


New border crossing opened in May 2015.
Very quiet no 'helpers' around as yet and not much traffic passing through.
I went from Nicaragua into Costa Rica. No need to buy any photocopies as they take what they need themselves. Staff very helpful on both sides.
I was unlucky as there was a planned power outage on the CR side, but without that I would have been through in an hour.
No costs on the Nic side and just compulsory insurance on the CR side.
There was a money changer on the Nic side, didn't see any on the CR side.

name: Las Tablillas/Los Chiles
description:
New border crossing opened in May 2015.
Very quiet no 'helpers' around as yet and not much traffic passing through.
I went from Nicaragua into Costa Rica. No need to buy any photocopies as they take what they need themselves. Staff very helpful on both sides.

Small immigration charge on the Nic side and just compulsory insurance on the CR side.
There was a money changer on the Nic side, didn't see any on the CR side.

name: Official Toyota Workshop Auto Nica
description: This is the workshop. There are two more sites in town where they sell parts

name: Rancho Del Nestor
description: Very basic and local hotel which looks quite funny, but the sheets are fresh and clean. No wifi. Private room with toilet and cold shower for 200 Cordobas ($6) for 1 person or 300 for 2. Friendly owner. Food is quite standard. The water smells chlorinated so it should be potable. Apparently there are two more hotels in San Juan de Limay. Could park my Landcruiser in the restaurant at night, guarded by a dog. The whole thing feels very safe.

name: Hostal Flamenco
description: Hostal Flamenco is an affordable hostel located just around the corner from the paid parking lot on iOverlander (30cordobas per night) with private rooms with ventilador for $20/night and rooms with A/C for $22 per night. Open to discounts if you stay more than one night.They have a shared kitchen available, hammocks in the patio area, and a sometimes iffy wifi connection.

name: Hostal Tamarindo
description: Hostel Tamarindo, $20 per night (554c). Private secure parking on site for 50c more per night , but with small entryway with height/width limit. Great hotel with shared kitchen, TV in spacious rooms, fans, short 10 minute walk to the center. No longer has a dormitory.

name: Cabinas Leykos Parking
description: I was allowed to set up my tent in the parking area opposite of the Hotel. I was able to use the bathroom but had to pay 5$ for one night.

name: Comedor Mi Ranchito
description: This is a small Restaurant located at the end of Playa Santa Cruz. Their food is really good and if you need space to park your RV you can park just opposite with a view onto the lake. They will let you stay their for free if you eat at their restaurant. There is enough space for two small sized RV’s (22ft long and 10ft high). You can also rent scooters, bicycles & kayaks. They also have guides up to the volcano Madera y Concepcion. There are also Picknick tables next to the parking so you can enjoy the view over the lake and the beach. Highly recommendable!!!

name: Hostal Brisas y Olas
description: Small rooms with private bath, decent wifi, shared kitchen, a few blocks from the beach. $20/night for a couple--but it was $18 if we stayed more than one night. Street parking here as with most hotels in SJDS.

name: Tropigas
description: Come here between 8am and 1pm! if you arrive later they might not (be able to) help you.

name: LazyBones hostel
description: Really laid back, clean hostel with spacious common areas. Big pool and hammocks for lounging. Great wifi and nice large room for $20 total for two people.

name: Hotel Puma
description:
We spent the night on the secured parking of this "love motel" / "auto hotel" before crossing the border to Honduras.
Nothing fancy but only few km to the border.
We slept in our van but they opened a room for the bathroom.
Paid 200 Cordobas.
We left at 6 AM and were in El Salvador at 10:30 AM ;-)

name: Hotel Frontera
description: $30 USD for room with double bed, bath & fan. Secured parking, restaurant, pool. Decently fast wifi. Good place to stop before border cross in the morning.

name: Solitario hostel
description: $6 per night to set up a tent right near the water. Lots of safe parking space. super friendly family. Bar and restaurant near the water. quiet. Hostel is $10 a night

name: Don Pepe
description: Little spot directly at the lake 3 cars/vans(not shoes;) fit in this place. 5US$ per person. Showers and toilets are ok. It used to be a restaurant. Just before Monkey Hut.

name: Wilder Miranda
description: The owner is a helpful guy and his workers are good. It is not a garage, it is the terrace of his own house, but he got tools.

name: Shell Hostal
description: They have some nice spots for camping here, right next to the sea. Nice place for watching the sunset as well. 7$/Night

name: Dulce Mareas
description: Very nice rooms at the back of the Restaurant. Beautifull clean rooms. The restaurant makes very nice Pizza. It's run by an canadien couple who are very helpful with organizing whatever you need. We could park our bikes indoors, but they own also the lot next door so they can organise parking no problem.

name: Casa Los Cocos
description:
We are a beachfront guesthouse with a big area plenty of trees which provide good shade.
All overlanders are welcome to camp in our secluded parking or garden  right in front of the gorgeous Guasacate beach!
5 $ a night to pitch your tent, sleep in your vehicle or in a hammock. 10 $ for a bed in a shared room. 25 $ for a private room.
We prepare nice meals for fair price. Breakfast 3$. Lunch and dinner 5 $. 
Great surfing in the area as we are located just 10 minutes walk from the famous Popoyo and right in front of the world class Guasacate beach break.
Other activities include fishing, tide pools, thermal waters,horse riding or just relaxing on the beach.
For any questions call the ­75397512  or email casaloscocos@gmail.com

name: Casa Los Cocos
description: We are a beachfront guesthouse with a big area plenty of trees which provide good shade. All overlanders are welcome to camp in our secluded parking or garden right in front of the gorgeous Guasacate beach! High speed Wifi , toilet, electricity and kitchen available to all campers. 5 $ a night per person to pitch your tent or sleep in your vehicle. 20 $ for a private room up to 2 people. The Bed  in the shared room is 10 $. Great surfing in the area as we are located just 10 minutes walk from the famous Popoyo and right in front of the world class Guasacate beach break. Other activities include surfing lessons, surf safari tour, surf bot trip, fishing, tide pools, thermal waters,horse riding or just relaxing on the beach. For any questions call the +505 78944358 or email frossiberluti@gmail.com

name: Tropigas - Integrated Tanks
description: After much effort found this tropigas who fill integrated tanks. USA RV .. You pay at the site so real easy ...

name: Estación biológica
description:
From the entrance road, go left 800 m. It's next to the school separated by a road. $4 USD to tent. Very basic toilet and shower. Secure place to park motorbikes. Average wifi, by the lake, cool showers and running water toilets. Clean. There's restaurant where the most expensive food is about $5 USD and very good and filling. By the lake. 
Big rigs might have a difficult time making it down the driveway and there's little space to turn around.

name: Hotel Victoria
description: Nice old style hotel , friendly staff . We needed to wash n clean up after a series of wild camping and liked the surf place but our RV big for most hotels, these folks have a warehouse behind hotel where you can safely park indoors. Not cheap at US 127 w breakfast but we glad we did it...

name: Colorado surf shack
description:
Perfect, quiet spot to camp next to the Colorado Beach break and Panga drops. We originally stayed at El Camino Gigante but once we found out about this spot we moved here because it is much closer to Panga drops (it's normally a 45min + walk from El Gigante) and much lower key. This used to be a surf camp run by Dale Dagger but it is now rented by an Argentian/Italian couple.  They may have moved on when you decide to visit and it is up in the air whether this place will be running. 
To get here you have to cross the gate into the Hacienda Iguana compound.  tell the security guard you are are going to Dale Daggers place.  tell them you have a reservation. drive for a while until you see a road going left with some yellow rocks to mark it.  if you get to the 2nd iguana gate you have gone too far.  drive on the road until you get to the surf shack on the right.  5$ pp. 
phone number: 8417 3795

name: Hospedaje Amelia
description: Homestay & Comedor - we stayed with a nice Nicaraguan family for a few days in a no frills town. Short walk down a path to an empty beach with a small turtle hatchery.  Ate meals with the family from 50-140C, they also sell ice cream & drinks. Mario & Amelia's English is limited but they try hard to communicate with you, great chance to practice your Spanish. Good chance to experience local life. Camping by donation (with the expectation you eat with them), double room with private bathroom $16.  ~30km from San Juan del Sur about 20km of that on a dirt road mainly in good condition. The road that goes along the border is supposedly a rough 4x4 road.

name: Hostel Tadeo
description: $32/night for 2 ppl private room including breakfast. Tiny pool. Decent WiFi.  Gated parking. Showing up incorrectly on my map. Located where Los Trapitors & Av. La Bolsa meet.

name: Ulab Yasica
description:
Very beautiful and quite hostel with garden. Tranquilo
Not very much parking space but we could stay for 3 weeks with VW-Bus. 10USD the night for two person, got it for 8 USD because we stayed such a long time. 15min with the bus to the center.
Very nice stuff. Public kitchen but you have to pay 1 USD each day you are using it.  Causy atmosphere.
I guess the best place to stay in Matagalpa. Follow the road to San Roman, 300m after the Puma Gas Station, next to a cute Chocolate Factory.
Better ask them before if they have free space for a vehicule.

name: Ojo De Água
description:
Great place for motor home. Restaurant, natural pool. We paid $ 6.00 per person with pool access. 

*Update late November 2017: they now ask $8pp including access*

*Update January 2018 - they ask for $10 including pool access*

*Update March 2022 It now costs $10usd per person, per night for overnight camping in your vehicle. They don’t allow dogs

Ótimo lugar ara motor home. Restaurante, piscina natural. Pagamos $6,00 por pessoa com direito a piscina.

Even if pets are oficial forbidden. They were okay wit our dog 😊

name: Taller La Volkswagen
description: Very good mechanic. We had to replace our brake plates and needed a new waterpump. Very fast and good work for a good price. Victor is the owner. They fix all kind of cars, we have a doge ram.

name: Oasis Hostel
description: Good hostel, clean, quite,free coffee all day, nice pool and free breakfast. 9$ for dorms.

name: Volcano Hostel
description: Nice and quite place. Close to the town center. Small pool and free coffee in the morning. Price start at 6$ for a dorm. 19$ for private room.

name: Los Zarzales
description:
On the lower side of the road in front of a super home 

Sur le bas côté de la route devant une maison super accueil

name: Taller Amadeus
description: Excellent mechanic!! The owner "Oliver Wiesnegger" speaks German, Spanish and English. He and his crew fixed a serious piston damage on our Steyr 12M18. It took 5 weeks (!!!) to organize all parts from Germany, fixing the damage and finally test all systems. Oliver let is stay all the time in his secured shop and we could use his Wifi, electricity, water and restrooms. They made a fabulous job!

name: Cerro Negro
description:
At the foot of the Cerro Negro entrance of the park 130 cor. Per person 2 cor. For the vehicle. 

Au pied du Cerro Negro entrée du parc 130 cor. par personne + 2 cor .pour le vehicule.

name: Doña Elba Cigars
description:
Showroom and workshop for cigars, new location from 2015. 
Very friendly workers will explain you about all the process and details they are working on (also in English) or even try to roll by yourself. No push for buying, just a donation/tip as you feel... or buy some cigars right from their hands.
Nice experience!!

name: Léon
description:
On the square behind the church, close to the city center and the super quiet market. 

Sur la place derrière l'église, proche du centre ville et du marché super tranquille.

name: Bord De Route
description:
We arrived a little late and did not find any access to the beach we parked on the low side of the road very quiet. 

Nous sommes arrivé un peu tard et nous n'avons pas trouvé d'accès à la plage nous avons stationné sur le bas côté de la route très calme.

name: San Jorge
description:
On the beach to the right of the landing stage ideal to wait for the ferry facing the two volcanoes of isla of Ometepe. 

Sur la plage à droite de l'embarcadère idéal pour attendre le ferry face au deux volcans de isla de Ometepe.

name: Next Hostel Hamacas
description:
On the other side of Hostel Hamacas is a white fence. It's no sine, but the guy who lives there let you stay (2 people for 5$). His name is Rafael Castillo.
Wifi from Hostel Hamacas worked well (PW: 1122334455).
Shower and bathroom are very simple and dirty, but if you are looking for a cheap and safe place in the shadow.

name: Volcan Masaya Entrance
description: $10usd pp for night viewing. at the moment (Jan 2022) not busy so you can arrive at 4pm and stay till 7.30pm no time restrictions. There are some great walks to do before sunset. there's 2 main craters and 2 smaller ones. Also a museum with English and Spanish signs.

name: Hospedaje Valeria
description: double bed a night 30usd with AC ., nice location near Main Street and cheap price, owner very nice you can park car in front of hotel.

name: Recreation area by the beach
description: camping in car park for the point. There's bathrooms at restaurants. and the lake to take a bath. There's a few restaurants here but they close at 5pm. no one here at night. flat parking, close to lake and point. not many bugs if there's a breeze.

name: Hotel Colon
description: Basic rooms with secure parking and okay wifi. 200 cordobas per night.

name: Cigar factory Perdomo
description:
We could visit the facory for free. The women explaned everything (only spanish). For us was very cool to see how they make the cigars and take great pictures. We could buy cigars, but they not really have a shop. 
There are other factorys in town, like Drew (probably in English), but you need reservation there.

name: Nicarao II Hostel
description: it is a very quiet place. basic and cheap. Dorms are 4$ per bed, rooms with shared bath 12$ and with private bathroom 16$. it is a nice place to stay and close to center.

name: Playa Maderas
description:
It is possible to camp here free. There is restaurants and showers for 50ni, a formal camping for U$ 5. Bealtiful beach with a lot of surfirst, good to swim. 
steep access but doable without 4x4 and without high clearance.

name: Near Lago Apoyo
description: A good place on the durty road 100 meters distante for the lake. Good to swimming. There are restaurants with bath. Tentei is possible on sand of the lake. Bealtiful view for the lake.

name: Finca/Eco Hotel Aguas del Arenal
description:
aguasdelarenal@gmail.com
Km 142,5 carretera Matagalpa – Jinotega, then about 3,2 km down a dirt road. Don't listen to Google nav; just follow the green signs that say “El Roble”. The entrance to the farm is on the right, before crossing the river to the El Roble center.

The owners are Bavarian-born Juergen and his Nicaraguan wife Anabel. They grow coffee, bananas and flowers and run a small hotel with several cabañas. Overlanders are welcome. We stayed here for a few days, had lunch with the family and made an excellent half-day hiking excursion into the cloud forest of the Cerro Arenal Reserve. This was better and much cheaper than our Monteverde visit in Costa Rica.

name: Taller Automotriz Sueco
description:
Hospital San Juan de Dios, 200 mts. al Sur, Estelí, Nicaragua, C.A.
Teléfono 27132242
Workshop, very professional. Directly on the Panamericana. Owner is the Swede Jonas Martensson. He lets you stay overnight in the workshop area. Quiet and safe. We stayed here for one night after some work on our camper had been done.

name: Playa De Mérida
description: Lovely spot right on the local beach. Come down the road to Caballitas Mar and turn left when you hit the water. I spent a week here and the locals were friendly and welcoming. No services but both the restaurant and a family renting cabins let me use their bathrooms for free and both had wifi. Do laundry in the lake on rocks like the locals. Great sunsets, excellent local vibe.

name: Gas station
description: Only to sleep, security all the night. There are bath, mini market an restaurant near. Noisy, near road.

name: Centro Plaza Ostari
description: Parking lot, overnight allowed, just ask to security. Restrooms and wifi inside plaza center. Security guards 24h .

name: La buena onda
description: Clean hostel close to center of Matagalpa. Dutch owned. There's a small patio at tbe entrance covered with trees and fence that I parked my motorcycle in. I was the only overlander but if you ask you might be able to fit a few bikes. There's a guy at the desk 24 hours. Nice garden in the hostel as well. Good wifi. Friendly staff. As of march 2016 $9 USD for a dorm bed including big lockers, coffee all day and filtered water. There's tv, movies and books at your disposal.

name: Police station.
description: Police station 24 hours. Not serviços.

name: parking
description:
30 NIO per day
Inside "Grupo AA San Juan De Dios"
gated, sleeping in car not allowed
Big black gate is 3.20 meters high.

name: Automotrices Mr. Miller
description: Excellent mechanic in Rivas with extensive knowledge of everything from old Toyota Landcruisers to buses (even my 1994 Hyundai/Kia bus was familiar territory). The shop is run out of his house but don't let that fool you, these guys know what they are doing. I spent three weeks in Managua at a very "legitimate" shop to get some oil leaks fixed which they failed to do and said I needed to rebuild my engine; Mr. Miller looked at the problem, called BS, and had me fixed and on the road in one day.

name: HulaKai Hotel
description: Beautiful place perched overlooking Playa Maderas. If you can't make it down to the beach in your rig (as happened to us) this is an excellent place to splurge. Rooms are comfortable, food is delicious (fresh green salads!) and the owners and staff are super friendly. No camping but Tyler, the owner, likes overlanders. The idea of the place is a hostel for people who have outgrown hostels. Very very good vibe and highly recommended!!

name: Hostel at Sun Kite School
description: We could park at the Hostel where the Sun Kite Surf School is located (i don't remember the name of the Hostel), toilet and showers are clean, close to the beach, $6/night

name: Kitesurf Spot
description: Kitesurf Spot, rental gear available at Sun Kite School

name: Hotel Fountain Blue
description: we stayed in the hotel for $20 for two people, guarded parking lot

name: Finca Samaria
description: we could park next to the hostel rooms, friendly owner, basic restaurant available, access to a beach, $10 for two people

name: Parking Lot Of Gran Ranchón Restaurant
description: Parked in the parking lot of the restaurant closest to the lake. $5 for the night and secure with a security guard. We could use the restaurant's baños and wifi. Lake view and tranquil. Nice to have a cooler night in Granada.

name: Bomberos, León
description:
A safe Parking Lot for overnight. No space for camping. Toilet and shower are very simple. We payed 60 Cordobas for 1 night. Only 2 minutes to walk to the center of León.

UPDATE (October 2021):
No toilets and showers available during COVID (C 20 per night)

name: Fausto Ramon
description: Fausto is a very honest guide for the somoto cayon. He lives in the small village near the canyon. He asked 15$ p.p. for the 4h tour with good equipment (others asked 25$). You can stay next to the small houses of his large family for free. If you want they will be glad for a tipp. We stayed 2days and had a great tour to the canyon.

name: Parqueo Centro America
description: Nothing fancy but it took us longer to cross from El Salvador to Nicaragua then we expected. Paid 50 Córdoba to park for the night. There was a restaurant with decent food and very cold beer. Bathrooms and showers were available. The trucks start to leave early in the AM so don't expect to sleep in.

name: hospedaje rio san juan
description: cheap hotel at a great location  in san carlos. great place too stay before or after  cr border. street parking but theres an ATM right in front so theres a security guy with a shotgun there aĺl night.. doubt anyone would dare to break in your vehicle.

name: Finca Los Jardines de La Cuesta
description: Finca close to Matagalpa, with a rustic Farmhous, only a few hundred meters away from a very poor village. Really bad road with rivercrossing, 4x4 recommended. You can park in front of the house, but there is no gate or security guard at night. Unfortunately the lady was very rude and she was only keen on making money. So she charged us 30 USD. We said, we are going to leave then, but the man was friendly and let us stay for a bit less. We didn't feel save at all, because the stinky dogs were barking all night long and at 4am the cock startet to cark and annoyed us. . Good WIFI was the only nice thing for us. Not recommended at all!

name: Salto Estanzuela
description: Beautiful waterfall to visit. The road is rough but should be doable with a regular car in non-rainy weather. The gate keeper let me into the parking lot at 7pm to spend the night. It's level with a rustic drop toilet. I paid 50 cordobas which I believe is the park fee. The gatekeeper lives right next to the park so if you arrive after hours just ask around. Great place to escape the heat, I had to break out the extra blanket overnight.

name: Street in San Juan del Sur
description: A rather quiet spot to park a car and sleep inside. There is a 24hrs guard at the end of the street who checks the entry to Pelican Eye Hotel. So pretty safe and less windy than the beach. Preschool right next doors so many kids in the morning but not extremely loud. WiFi options nearby (kindly ask for the password or order a coffee).

name: El Jardin la Vida
description:
A new Place run by Rachel and Trevor expats from USA. Very friendly People who welcome Overlanders.The place is directly nearby the Sea, they rent kayaks, building a dorm also at the moment. Also a kitchen and different other things. Construction is going on the place. So thing can change very quick!
At the moment there is one space at the entry for a 20-25 foot rig. We had a real nice stay with nice and friendly people.
There is a cold shower, you're allowed to use the kitchen.They charge 4 dollar per person...I think kids are free!

name: L'il Aussie Hut
description: Awesome place right on Playa Marsella run by a fun hard-partying Aussie couple with kids. Simple large rooms with fans in the breezy bamboo rancho ($30/person; kids free) or camping in the yard for $15/person with electricity and fans if needed. Shared bathroom; communal kitchen; use of washing machine. Lots of hammocks, beer, and beautiful sunsets. Highly recommended, especially for families with kids because they have them (18, 15, 11). Walking distance to several simple restaurants. Fruit truck comes by Tues & Friday. They have guard dogs so not recommended for other dog owners.

name: Biosfera
description:
PLEASE READ MOST RECENT REVIEW. Not one below:

The woman who owns this place isnt here so not sure how it is at that time....  

It is her house with a few beds and camping available. Dogs allowed (2 onsite). The hill to get up is steep and narrow and no parking near the house. $3 camping. Dinner $4. I dont think she allows the kitchen to be used for personal meals. 

eco toilets...

this may be a little much for some.

name: Choco Cafe Museo
description: Very nice place, also make your own chocolate your stuff and maybe rooms? Good Tex mex style taco burrito place a few doors down the street as well. Wifi very good with lots of plugs for electric. Unlimited coffee, tea and juice. 195 cord for unlimited everything.

name: Camping By The River - comedor rios
description: Camping spot by the river  - This spot is free and only kms away from Somoto canyon. Right now the river is very low and slow moving. Not good enough to swim or shower. Temperature at night was good.

name: All Nica Cigar Store
description: Nice little cigar shop. The owners speak spanish and English. They offer free wifi and like to chat with other people.

name: Rancho El Cabo
description: Very nice family ran restaurant with plenty of space to park. We inquired about dinner and then asked for parking for the night and they where more then happy to accommodate us. There are bathrooms that are open 24 hours and we even became friendly enough with the family for them to offer us use of their showers in their home. They allowed us to camp for free because we ate at the restaurant. I could see them starting to charge a fee for camping once it becomes more common but I'm sure they will be open to negotiate the price especially if you are buying food and drinks from them. The mother and daughter both spoke English but are only here once in a while as they now live in the US and only come down to visit family.

name: Laguna de Masaya
description: Really nice camping spot by the lake. Right now sitting at the campsite at night where you can see the red glow from the lava from vulcano masaya. The road down to the spot is not very wide, so not recommended for bigger vehicles. There is a bigger spot further up when you come in from the road. I guess you can camp there as well but it's closer to the houses.

name: FINSA
description: Information -for shipping

name: El Españo-restaurant/parking
description: Very nice and friendly owner who offered us to stay in his parking lot , delixious fried fish

name: National Park
description: Nice spot where locals come and swim, shaded and secluded only one flat spot, under a tree. Cleared land in front of some houses. lots of bird life. water is a bit warm. some rubbish but the water is good.  Police came by and said it's safe and ok to camp  It's some cleared land in front of two properties. looks like government land. very quiet just local tourists and fishermen. not many flat locations, except one 50m further under a tree. there are sandflies - wear pants and shoes.

name: Hotel El Rosario
description: $20 for a clean basic room with private bath. You can sleep in your small rig for the same price with use of facilities of a room. Clean place with friendly owners. In June 2016 they will be opening a camping spot at their nearby finca.

name: "Playa Tupilapa"
description: Beautiful beach with (during the week) almost nobody there. Water a bit murky due to dark sand and drainage from nearby rivers. (If there has been rain especially.) Good for swimming seemingly. Not much interest for surfers. The last 1km or so of road is dirt and has potential for washouts - maybe it's possible to park at the end of the paved section and walk here. I wouldn't try it in a small car or a big rig.

name: parking lot by supermarket
description: Parking lot by supermarket on the centrál park. Save and quiet at night until 6.30 when they starting with the church ceremony.

name: hotel San cristobal
description: After a bad run through Honduras,  didn't make it so far so this place 20 USD room with fan parking in back , there is a night club in back also which will be busy at weekend's

name: Finca Agroturistica Don Chico
description: Beautiful spot right up against the Reserva Natural Macizos de Peñas Blancas. You can tent camp right near Don Chico's coffee plants or you can stay in your car right outside his house. 50c per car per night and includes a surprisingly nice bathroom with a shower. He is also a guide and will take you on an awesome hike up to the waterfalls and the highest point for 200c per person (~5 hours). There is also a tourist center a few meters down the road with cabañas and tours but they charge a lot more. No need for 4x4 to get here.

name: Hotel Madera's Inn
description: Good, clean, and cheap. We did the night tour at Volcan Masaya and didn't want drive to Granada at night so we posted up here and it was perfect. $20, wifi, showers, super quiet. No parking lot but we left our car right in front of the hotel on the street and there was a vigilante until 2am.

name: Police Station Parking Lot
description:
Great place to stay EXCEPT FOR the music of the bar right beside. We stay only one night so ask before. They gave us electricity

PhotosMuy buen lugar EXCEPTO por la música del bar de al lado... Nosotros estuvimos solo una noche, averiguar si es todos los dias. Nos dieron  electricidad y por supuesto muy seguro!

name: Magma4x4 / Axis
description: Professional and reliable mechanics very knowledgable about 4x4s. Experienced working with international expeditions including staff from Overland Journal. They can source parts and have and also offer full maintenance  service. Probably one of the best places we've taking our truck to during our trip. You can asked for Rafael Huncal, one of the owners, who's himself an incredibly knowledgable mechanical engineer.

name: Hostal Ulua
description: Great place run by Angelica!  Kitchen we can use with fridge, stove, and basics like salt, oil, etc.  Private rooms with bathroom go for 300 cords and can add another bed for 100.  Also, a bunk room available.  Great staff and family.  She goes above and beyond like letting use the washing machine, moving our clothes when they got wet, and cooking us plantains for breakfast.

name: La Horqueta Muelle To Archipelago
description: You can camp right by the Nicaragua Lake in the grassy parqueo for 150 Cordobas per day or for free outside the parking lot.  You can take a boat to the archipelago and visit the various islands where you can eat and camp at the islands or bird watch. You need to turn onto a dirt road and drive 23km to the lake. This is a great off the  beaten track.

name: Hotel San Francisco
description: Clean and nice budget hotel. Paid 400 Cordobas for a room. 300 cordobas rooms also available as well as more comfortable rooms. Rooms w/ AC are more expensive. Wifi reaches only in common area. Friendly staff. Small little town nice sunsets at the pier. Enclosed parking with security.

name: San Miguelito Parking Lot.
description: Parking lot with friendly security guard. Restrooms in lot. 50 Cordobas per day/night. Simple but secure and affordable. Restaurants within a few blocks. Cute town on the lake

name: isla queracho
description: island near big hotel/hostel. restaurant very nice with a nice pool.

name: hotel colonial
description: nice place in the center of town. 50$ a big parking lot.

name: Bucaneros Restaurant
description: Kind of a mix between wild camping and informal campsite. We slept here after the night tour to Masaya volcano. The restaurant staff allowed us to sleep at the parking lot in front of the official restaurant parking lot and use the toilets of the restaurant which stay open during the night. So you sleep on the public parking lot quite near to the street but the restaurant night guard has an eye on you as long as he is there (until 12 pm) and there is a security camera facing towards you. We could also use the showers at the pool in the morning. Pool use would cost 60 cordobas per person. We stayed for free but found it polite to have a drink at the restaurant which is reasonably priced and nice because it has a beautiful mirador over the Masaya lagoon.  Good local breakfast for 6 USD.

name: Hotel coco azul
description:
We asked the guard and let us sleep at the door. The place was safe. Just a little sound. Wifi key:  [passwords are not allowed ]

Preguntamos al guardia y nos dejo dormir en la puerta. El lugar fue seguro. apenas un poco de sonido.
clave wifi:  [passwords are not allowed ]

name: Lavanderia Mapache
description:
Good laundry. The owner jairo makes you discounts if you are a traveler. Service good and fast 

buenisima lavanderia. el dueño jairo te hace descuentos si sos viajero. servicio bueno y rapido

name: Centro Turístico  Villa Verde
description:
We were the first overlanderers and convince the owner to let us stay (other places don't receive campers any more). We negotiated US $12,5 per night. Luckly very few people. Big pool with kids area. They have electricity and bathrooms, not so clean really. Very tiny entrance!

Fuimos los primeros viajeros en llegar y tuvimos que convencer al dueño en dejarnos aparcar. El lugar es una villa turística armada para recibir gente durante el dia, tiene una gran pileta con juegos para niños, restaurante, electricidad, baños  (dejaban bastante que desear) y una cancha de fútbol muy linda. Tuvimos suerte y no había nadie, me imagino que con mucha gente puede ser bastante incómodo. Negociamos 12,5 dólares por noche. La entrada es muy chica!

name: San Juan del sur
description:
Ample parking place with cabins and a police post. Safe and without services. Showers and toilets nearby for 10 c. 

Amplio lugar para aparcar con cabañas y un puesto de la policía.
seguro y sin servicios. Hay baños y duchas cerca (10c)

name: Camping Luna
description:
We stopped by at this place which is just a few meters away from the Cafe con leche. It is a big flat area which has two bathrooms and an outdoor shower. They do not have Wifi,  but the guy said that electricity plug in would be possible. They have a possibility to make a fire and do a BBQ and also have a little camping stove. It is all looks a bit improvised. 6$ per person for the first night and 5$ per person if you stay more than one night. 
Also, there is a small restaurant right next to the campsite with great food and great prices (130-200 cordoba per dish)

name: Pacha Mama Hostel
description: Increíble place! This is a new hostel, beautyful rooms, nice swimming pool. Honestlly the best hostel we ever stayed. Too good to be true. Paid USD 60 per night for 4 people.

name: Hostal Doña Vero
description: Really clean and centrally located hotel only a block from Parque Central. We paid 300 Córdoba a night for a room with one double bed, tv and fans. Shared bathroom outside the room. They also have a nice outdoor pool and a hangout area with hammock! Also have coffee and filtered water available at all times. You may be able to park a motorcycle inside but not sure.

name: Parking en cul de sac Terraza las Palmas
description:
Parking from a bar owner of boats to make a tour between the islets. Very friendly, they offered to fill up with water! Free with a guard (propina recommended) 

Parking d'un bar propriétaire de barques pour faire un tour entre les îlots. Très sympa, ils nous ont proposé de faire le plein d'eau! Gratuit avec un gardien (propina recommandée)

name: Juancitos Taller
description: Right next to Porta Del Sol Hostel, recommended to us by the owner. We had the mechanic change our engine oil (200 NIC, we had oil and a filter already) and check out a creaky clutch. Quick and friendly.

name: Cyber Plus
description: We went here to get some copies of all our documents. As we had a little incident with the police that day we decided that we want to make laminated colour copies of the driving license. Here we could get the copy and the laminating for 28 cordobas.

name: Be aware of incorrect police controls
description:
We got pulled over by the Police at this point. They wanted to see my driving license, I gave it to them and the they told me, if I want it back, I have to pay 100usd.
Just for your Info, in Nicaragua when you get a real Ticket from the Police, they give it to you and you have to go to a bank and pay it there. 
You never ever have to pay directly to the officer.
Just a few kilometers in direction to Leon, we got pulled over again.
Both Times we were lucky and could come out of this situations without paying.
However, we made copies of the driving license and laminated them in Leon. Just to be prepared for the next time.

name: Los Cocos Hostal
description: Nice tiny place on the Salinas Grande beach. Basic outdoor kitchen with a fireplace. You can also have meals there that they are cooking. There is a toilet and two outdoor showers (without walls). Plug in for electricity was possible. WiFi is also available at the communal area, but is not really fast. In the price breakfast is included. We payed 6$ per person per night.  Update 10/2021: we paid $3pp/night (no breakfast) for a van. I guess $6pp is for a dorm.

name: Playa Tesoro
description: Normally bungalows are rented here,  but camping is also possible. The toilets and showers can be used from one of the bungalows. Electricity and WiFi should be available, but when we were there the power was out. They also have a kitchen,  but we did not ask if it is possible to use it. It is directly on the beach where swimming should be possible too. Also they have a pool on the site. The price should be something about 10$.  We didnt stay because of the power out but it seemed like a nice spot to stay at the beach. 4x4 is highly recommended to get there, high clearance is a must.

name: Ometope Ferry
description: Pickup Truck w/slide in camper.  480 For Vehicle & Camper + 120 Ometepe Tax + 50 pp paid at window. 50 additional tax paid after and given second receipt.  Arrived at 8 am without reservation. 9am and 10am were full. Got on 1230.

name: Viejo Leon
description:
Very close to the lake, quiet, people are very friendly. Plan something to eat, we do not find much here. 

Tout proche du lac,calme, les gens sont très sympa. Prevoyez de quoi manger, on ne trouve pas grand chose ici.

name: EcoHotel Luna del Rio
description:
After a tour of the hotels on site, the choice was simple: one of the best views, air conditioning, impeccable cleanliness, nice and helpful owner. $ 50 per night in a double room with toilet and hot shower and breakfast included. Only negative point, the wifi is not available except by connecting to the phone of the boss. 

Après avoir fait le tour des hôtels sur place, le choix fut simple : une des meilleures vues, la climatisation, propreté irréprochable, propriétaire gentil et serviable. 50$ la nuit dans une chambre lit double avec WC et douche chaude et petit déjeuner compris. Seul point négatif, le wifi n'est pas disponible sauf en se connectant à téléphone de la patronne.

name: Parking
description:
80 cordobas per 24h secured, perfect to discover the islands or el castillo. Attention, not possible to sleep in 

80 cordobas par 24h sécurisé, parfait pour découvrir les îles ou el castillo. Attention, pas possible de dormir dedans

name: mi rancho del mar
description:
Restaurant by the sea with possibility to enjoy the pool but for a consumption of 500 cordobas where we were able to sleep 2 nights. The first night we had electricity and the second guard asked us to unplug at 5am. Possibility to fill up with water. Good wifi pin: BIENVENIDOS Keep h24 

Restaurant au bord de la mer avec possibilité de profiter de la piscine mais pour une consommation de 500 cordobas où nous avons pu dormir 2 nuits. La première nuit nous avons eu l'électricité et la seconde le gardien nous a demandé de débrancher a 5h du matin. Possibilité de faire le plein d'eau. Bon wifi pin: BIENVENIDOS Gardé h24

name: Hervideros de San Jacinto
description: Boiling mud and smoke from Telica Volcano.

name: Réserve naturelle de Tisey
description:
Superb corner in front of a family finca, not possible to make more calm, possibility of eating properly for $ 5. Access to a mirador. C $ 100 for the night. Wifi picked up from the parking lot but requires an antenna alfa. Accessible by camper (since we were there) but reserved for experienced drivers. WC, shower and 2 bungalows available. 

Superbe coin devant une finca familiale, pas possible de faire plus calme, possibilité de manger correctement pour 5$. Accès à un mirador. 100 C$ pour la nuit. Wifi capté depuis le parking mais nécessite une antenne alfa. Accès faisable en camping-car (puisque nous y étions) mais réservé à des conducteurs avertis. WC, douche et 2 Bungalows disponible.

name: Mirador El Calvario
description:
Superb view not to be missed. 5C $ per adult, 5C $ per vehicle, 50C $ for the night. Quiet, guarded. 1.5km of trail. Comedor closes at 5pm 

Superbe vue à ne pas manquer. 5C$ par adulte, 5C$ par véhicule, 50C$ pour la nuit. Calme, gardé. 1,5km de piste. Comedor ferme à 17h

name: AutoMAX - ask at Hotel Mapy
description: simple parking lot at Car Wash, good wifi, electric plugs & water taps, quiet for parking in town. 100 C $.

name: DNP Gasolinera
description:
Service station at the roadside Matagualpa / Managua drinking water WC 50 córdoba the vehicle and 2 people, nice home, 2 small groceries has 50 m

Station service au bord de la route Matagualpa/ Managua eau potable WC 50 córdoba le vehicule et 2 personnes, accueil agréable, 2 petites épiceries a 50 m

name: Canyon Somoto
description: On the gravel street from Touist Information to Fausto Ramon's house in a little carrier a small grasse place, just in front the small house of Ariel a local guide of the community no show web not to ilets just a little hole with natural water it's Free

name: Jinotega Bomberos
description: On the parking of the Bomberos entrance AVenida Santiago Zelden

name: Gasolinera DNP
description: We Paid 50 córdoba for one night, WC water potable he said, stay on parking guard all night

name: Cerro Negro Entrance
description:
Before or in the  parking of the entrance  of the Volcano guy at the entrance asked 10$ for 2 person and our van, we can use shower and toilets,  the keeper said that is our house, we stay out to Can have sun for solar panel.

On top of the $5pp for camping is $5pp for entry to the volcano.

name: Leon Gaz Puma
description: parking of gaz station Puma 50 córdoba  much trafic to 9 pm many truck because also on the road many " chicas"  sait on the pavement, restrooms open over night also restaurant  "7" n'est than the fier station , more air

name: Tu Mirador Diriomito
description: A view on all the lake and Granada you can stay on the flat parking , water ans restrooms (open all night) , perhaps power the owner and his family have a good welcome, they like and know the Napoléon Bonapartés story

name: La casa de las botellitas
description: A great hostel built enitrely by bottles, promoting and developing sustainable living in the area. The area is one of the poorer parts of Granada but it has a great cultural vibe. The owner Gisha is awesome. We stayed in a double room for 10$ each. Dorms are cheaper. They have also spaces for tents. You can park the car safely in the hostel. Sometimes they offer activities with the children circus which also lives there. Recommended!

name: Saber entre volcanos
description: We stayed at the house of a local family. Extremly kind and nice people. They have also rooms but we camped in a tent under a cabin. The senora can prepare you an awesome meal for dinner. The car can be parked inside. Staying there is a truly local experience. It costed us 100c for two people per night. Another 80-100c if you want to have dinner there. Totaly worth it. The beach is just few meters away and often horses wander around. Beauty!

name: Uno gas station
description: We were allowed to sleep at the gas station. There is a guiard overnight and the people are friendly. We could use the toilet too (not overnight). If they say no first, just tell them that you are willing to pay. We payed 100c for the car.

name: bomberos /police station
description: After finding out that the Porto do sol was closed we had to find somewhere else. all the free options weren't possible due to parade in town. we went here and asked if we could camp and they said the police station in town would let us camp no problems but because access was impossible they let us camp under the pergola for the fire trucks. we had no problems and the police let us fill up our water tank. was free to stay

name: El Arca De Noe
description: Nice little hotel close to the cents plaza. Clean rooms and bathrooms. Breakfast with eggs, rice, beans, bread and coffee included. $23 a night. Owner Carlos speaks very good English and gave us a tour of the city in his car. That's free and sounds like he does that with all the guests if time allows. He is very knowledgeable about the history of Central America. Definitely recommend.

name: Hostel Rancho Esperanza, Jiquilillo
description: A nice beachfront hostel for chill out, good food, fantastic smoothie and interesting activities with local people's. We have paid 5$ pp to stay with our van on a big grassy field. The owners are very friendly and helpful.

name: Mama Sara's House
description: Nice Hostel, almost next to the Beach. Privateroom(2persons) with priv.Bathroom $25(a little negotiable if you stay longer;-))Room without own Bath $20. There are also Dorms,but don't know the price. Shared Kitchen. Mama Sara is a wonderful Host, she brought us yummi selfmade Lunch every day-for free! You feel like home🏘

name: Roadside behind the beach
description:
Roadside parking on tiny stretch of land between road (little traffic) and the beach.
While there are few reasons to stay on this (eastern) side of the island, this was an ok free spot for a night. Quiet, level, close to beach, across souvenir shop and hotel which were okay with me parking overnight.
High humidity, frequent rains and mosquitoes. Beach not good for swimming (muddy, dead fish). Reasonably quiet with little traffic noise during day. Wifi from hotel (charge) across the street if needed.

name: Secure truck parking
description: Level gravel lot right by the highway. Fenced-in, security, dogs, toilet. Traffic noise during daytime, quiet at night. Windy and a little dusty. Cool climate. The only suitable spot in the area I found. 50 Cordoba per car, 80 per truck.

name: Cathedral parking lot
description:
The friendly watchman/caretaker (Tonio) let me stay here for a quiet and secure night in the "centre" of town. He put up his hammock right next to my van. He didn't ask for anything but I gave him 100 Cordobas. At night nobody else is on the premises, feels absolutely safe.
Mall right next door. Fenced/walled-in,  closed after 19h. Bells ring occasionally during day.
Not sure if this was okay with the padre, but Tonio couldn't get him on the phone so he just assumed permission and hid me a little on the side. ;-)
Hot, pretty level, sun and shade, few mosquitoes.

name: Lavanderia
description:
Cheap, the only one in town. Ringing at the white gate


pas cher,la seule de la ville. sonner au portail blanc

name: Malecon
description:
ADMIN NOTE: WARNING!!! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution. 

Free parking at the waterfront. We were here Sundays and after 11pm there was nobody around. Also at the morning no traffic, no noise. Great. During the week I would bet it's very calm.
Restaurantes in walking distance, a guy offers showers and bathrooms for 10 Cordobas. Opens as long as something is going on at the beach.

name: hostel monte cristi
description:
Ideal for the airport. very calm. You can park by the side of the street. secured. $ 10 per vehicle with small electricity and wwif. 800 m before you have to pass a guarded gate. Room has 33 $


ideal pour l aeroport. tres calme. on peut se garer au bord de la rue. securise. 10$ par véhicule avec petit ddejeune électricité et wwif. 800 m avant il faut passer un portail gardé. chambre a 33$

name: At the beach next to the Hotel Vistamar
description:
Right were the sand starts. There is place for two cars, also large ones. Restaurant is pricy and the coffee wasn't good. WLAN was ok but not really fast.
No service but maybe one could ask at the Hotel (also for the pool) for a daily tip. Many palapas at the beach, which is super long. Great for some hours walking south. No traffic and really quiet.
Its even possible to drive directly on the beach and park around the corner.

name: Parque Central
description: Free parking direktly at the Parque Central. Police welcomed us. Restrooms are somewhere close by.

name: Parque Sandino
description: Free parking at the Sandino Park (back side, close to the ministerio de gobernacion). 900 meters to the cathedral. Very quiet.

name: grassy parking
description:
Nice grassy parking for 100C per night/rig.
lots of restaurants nearby and also the sea 
verry safe

name: Patricia's Restaurant
description: We had a delicious dinner at Patricia's Restaurant and she let us stay for free under her Palapa. I'm sure she will let you stay for free too if you have lunch/dinner there. The fish and the pinto gallo are amazing! And the coffee is great too!

name: La Garnacha
description:
At the end of the village. Very quiet and very cool


Au bout du village. Très calme et très frais

name: Chevrolet Dealer
description: Grupo Q. But no mechanics or service for general public.  They can refer you to another mechanic if you need work done on your vehicle

name: Casa Cross
description: Large garage that seems to work on many makes.  high entry way. Didn't have 5W30 oil but were able to get and we'll come back in two days  to get oil change done and will update as to service.

name: DGA Nica
description:
To renew TIP.  They will not "extend" but give you a new 30 day one from the date you are there in the office so best to wait till closer to the end if the existing one.

They have for the last 3 times given a new TIP for 30 days ADDED to last day.

name: Hotel Morgan
description: This is on north end of island with lovely ocean  views and a narrow beach close by.  Taxis on island are 20C pp regardless where you go.  Rooms are large. Breakfast not included but Nicaraguan breakfast available in hotel restaurant.  We paid $40 for double room with AC. Didn't work in first room  they wanted to give us (6) nor did it in the the room they did give us (5) but it was great in room 8.  Kurt was managing while owner was away and more than went out of his way to make our stay good.  He owns a snorkel tour group and we did one on Big Corn and an even better one on Little Corn with him.  $20 pp ea.  Rooms come with TV and fridge. Decent Wi-Fi.

name: Ancient Footprints
description: this is a nondescript yellow building surrounded by a white fence.  here you pay $2us ea to see the excavated site of 6000 year old footprints.

name: Tropigas Agencia
description:
a tropigas agencia in the center of 
Rivas, we went here to fill up our gas cylinder. A guy took it on his bike and went to the fillibg plant. in half an hour they brought it back. 
very helpfull an easy. payed 220 cordoba for 20 lb.

name: Eco Lodge Cascada Blanca
description: Small parking lot for Eco resort. No camping facilities. But restaurant and cafe have bathrooms. Short 70' trail to waterfall. Charged 200c for two people for parking overnight. Charged another 140c to go to waterfall. Security and fenced lot and gate.

name: Hotel colonial
description: Nice hotel near main town plaza in Somoto, with private rooms  with bathroom, with tv, comfy beds, spacious, clean, cold water showers (the town had problems with water so we got only bucket water for shower), parking lot a block away and typical  Nicaraguan breakfast included for 500cordobas (17usd this is has a discount) room with fan. Ac room more expensive (25usd to 30usd). Very nice place! They also offer tours for the canyon and has a nice courtyard in the middle of the building. Only two blocks away from main highway and 30minutes from the border.

name: Cañón de Somoto
description:
The entry of the canyon is on the left side coming from El Espino border. There is a brown sign that indicates it.  There is going to be a man that stops you for offering you park and tours (he is kind of aggressive with it, pushing the tour on us and that we didn't have other options. That's not true, just say no thanks and keep going down the road until you reach the information wood house on the right). There you have to park and go in the wood house and they will inform you what's the canyon all about and tell you you have 2 options of tours with them, the short one that is 12usd p/p (2 hours) and the 17usd p/p (3hr30min: 4usd for the park entry fee, some for the boat and the rest goes to a cooperative of the guides families). We chose to do it by ourselves even they tried to tell us we couldn't. The long tour is the most amazing one and the better experience of the canyon (a hike, swim through the tall walls of the canyon, then boat and hike back). Again they will make you feel that you have to take the tour but you can do it by yourself (be sure you know how to swim well though). If you pay the tour we recommend a guide that we happen to meet on our solo walk, Teo Flores Figueroa. He was so kind and sweet to us, great heart, giving us free information even when we didn't payed for the tour. Contact him directly if you want (84266408). 
We only pay the 4usd of park fee and drove the car down the road to the next parking lot (30cordobas to the woman there). Then we walk down to the river and randomly met Teo that recommend us to do it the other way (the long tour). We did and was awesome!! We gave him a money gift just because he was so awesome to us, he never asked for anything and was genuinely surprised when we wanted to give him some money. Anyway, we recommend him specially and the swimming down the canyon is amazing (just beware that is a long swim and you go through a hike before it and on the river there are rocks parts you need to walk through). Overall, epic!

name: via via hostel
description: via via hostel/ hotel with restaurant and bar, will let you ride your motorbike through the bar to the back to park, 200 Cordoba per night dorm beds, big place with lots of areas to relax, beers for 25 Cordoba, website has lots more info, no car parking on site, right across the road from Bigfoot hostel

name: Hotel Jardin de Granada
description:
We pulled in with our truck camper hoping to rent a room. The night we pulled in they were completely booked but allowed us to overnight in their parking lot free of charge. 

Once in a room, clean and spacious. Breakfasts were good and varied each morning. 

Staff helped us locate for the camper's propane tank, a refill site and in fact, took tank to site and got refilled for us. 

Quiet and safe neighborhood. 

Laid back environment except when we needed service and they provided prompt service whether it was getting sodas or getting laundry cleaned.

name: Studio Bar & Cafe
description: This place is right behind Tacos Locos.  They charged $10 per night for 2 people with power.  We parked behind restaurant which has cheap beer (2x60) and fast Wi-Fi. Nice beach with great sunsets.  There is a shuttle into San Juan del Sur a few times a day for $5pp return.  Banos are locked but they let us have keys to the back one and a shower.

name: Palmera
description:
Hostel with cheap 5$ dorms, double private for 15$ and triple for 20$
Had trouble finding a place where they would accept camping in Las Peninitas and ended up here. 
Super welcoming host, paid 5$ for basic services and kitchen.
Has a nice little shaded area to set your hamac up.
Good waves right out front.

name: Hotel Selva Azul
description: Here you have a restaurant, rooms, private beach, swimming pool, shower, wifi,... Night in your vehicle cost 100cord pp. Only van type vehicle can fit in small flat ground.

name: Southern Nights Hotel
description:
A small hotel with a restaurant, strong WIFi, and protected parking.  Flat cement parking for motorcycles and a large fenced open area suitable for parking big rigs.
 Friendly America owners. $10 for a dorm room $25 for private.

name: Hotel El Puerto
description: Nice clean rooms, 4 blocks to beach, $25USD for room with fan, $32USD for room with A/C. Parking on street.

name: Communidad La Reyna
description: Here you can spend nights and days in a typical nicaraguan family. Walks to do to an old gold mine, help to take care of coffe culture for instance. 10 dollars a night and 3 to 4 dollars for the meals and an additionnal 2 dollars fee for the entrance. Not that cheap but go to the community. We negociated and they agreed for a lower price.

name: Hostal familial Casa Hograr (on Mapsme)
description: Very warm welcome here ! The friendly woman ask 5 dollars pp. The accommodations are just OK but you ll get a delicious arroz pinto for dinner. You may be able to cook your own meals if you ask. Fridge available. Wi-Fi very fast. I recommend this place if you have a low budget. Otherwise, suggest you the Hostel Family and Friends runns by a very nice young local couple. Clean, quiet, private rooms and small dorms. 10 dollars pp but manageable to have it for 18 for two if you ask.

name: Police - corrupt
description: police check stand. Looking to fine all foreign drivers for moving out of right hand lane. All drivers doing this.

name: Somar
description:
* Asking prices as of 12/2019 is of $10 pp.


Grassy area where they will let you park for 5$ pp 

Had dorms and privates

Right on the beach with a really hot pool. Nice place to lay back and chill.

Welcoming staff but not the most helpful!

name: Chez lola
description:
Nice parking lot with shade in a super nice lady's restaurant parking.
 
She let us stay here for a few bucks a night per person, was super welcoming and offered us good deals on food.

Can get wifi from the nearby hotels.

Has the best price on big beers

name: Southern side of Popoyo Playa
description: This camp side is directly at the beach with ocean view, a palapa (roof) and a round concrete platform. We discovered it while driving on the road which is running parallel to the beach. It is fenced in and you have to open a gate to drive in. The family which is guarding the place lives ca. 100-200 m south of the location and they opened up the fence for us. We paid 200 Cord for our car per night (we were 4 ppl) and the price might be negotiable however we felt 200 Cord is a decent amount which we paid gladly. There is also an outhouse which is a little smelly though..but better than nothing. We partially slept in the van and had a tent. We were told that there might be some thievery around this area, however we had a dog with us which made everything pretty save. Would recommend to lock up the important stuff. This place was a dream. Quiet..and sunset view.

name: Hotel Monte Verde
description:
Users report place is in very bad shape, please see check-ins.
Campsite, hotel, restaurant+bar. We paid 5USD pp amd stayed in our VW Kombi. Very nice owner and speaks English. Socket+water available. Free Wifi. Hammocks amd soon a swimming pool. Close to the beach. Very accessible. Big rigs fit.Hotel avec air de camping au nord de san juan del sur
charge 5$ pp, wifi, douche, piscine 
belle endroit à l'écart et moins dispendieux

name: Finca El Jalacate
description: Beautiful finca with sculptures in stone made by Alfonso Gutierrez who lives there. It worths the visit. You have to park in the gravel road where the sign is and walk for around one km down

name: Hotel Santa Cruz
description: New hotel in town two blocks from the highway in Somotillo town. It doesn't have a sign yet but it's the best place and with wifi we could find in Somotillo before crossing the border. It's on front of Fritanga Reyes and next to Barbería Junior.  Just ask someone and they'll probably let you know (on second street in town to the left after the river coming from ). Very  nice owner. Very clean, spacious, basic, with private bathroom (just separate with a curtain) and nice bed. With fan. Big parking lot and safe at night (they close the gate). Quiet too and the owner is a nice Nicaraguan lady that lived in USA for a bit so she speaks English too. 700cordobas for the private room. We got a discount if you ask nicely:) I guess you could ask if you could sleep in the car if you need to be cheaper. Recommended!

name: Local grocery store
description: Tiny grocery store with some basis: bread, eggs, sometimes veggies, etc

name: Comedor Julia's
description:
A very nice place on the shore of the beach. Julia, Mundo and her family are beautiful people who treated us as part of the family.
There is parking for two vehicles and tents. There is not much shade for the vehicles. But they left us a palapa that they had vacated at that time for us to use. 1 dollar pp / night. Shower and bath. There is no wifi but there is a signal from the restaurants next door. In the restaurant they give breakfasts, lunches, dinners, juices burgers ... Good price, abundant and great food. Totally recommended.

Un lugar muy bonito a orillas de la playa. Julia, Mundo y su familia son hermosísimas personas que nos trataron como parte de la familia.
Hay parqueo para dos vehiculos y tiendas de campaña. No hay mucha sombra para los vehiculos. Pero nos dejaron una palapa que tenían desocupada en ese momento para que usaramos. 1dolar pp/noche. Ducha y baño. No hay wifi pero llega la señal de los restaurantes de al lado. En el restaurante dan desayunos, comidas, cenas, jugos hamburguesas... Buen precio, abundante comida y muy buena. Totalmente recomendable.

name: Tropigas
description:
You can fill a bottle of gaz here. You need to pay at the bank directly. Payment 200 cord for 10 kilos 

Se puede llenar botella de gaz aqui.
Necesita de pagar en el banco directamente.
Pago 200 cord pour 10 kilos

name: hotel julieta
description: this is an eclectic hostel run by the wonderful Julieta. we paid $20USD for a double room with a fan. good for stopovers and very helpful with information on Nicaragua. they have had several cyclists. not sure for rigs, no parking so it would have to be on the verge

name: rene mecanico
description:
Good mechanic and honest. I came recommended by a local, for a noise suspicious of the box and ended up being something simple.


buen mecanico y honesto. vine recomendado por un local, por un ruido sospechando de la caja y termino siendo algo sencillo.

name: Hotel El Castillo
description:
Nice and clean hotel with views of the city and some rooms with balconies. Wifi measured at 3.7Mbps. Paid USD$25/night for a room without a balcony with a double and a single bed, including breakfast. Street parking only though.
Would definitely stay again.

name: Finca Mystica
description:
Great American owners from New Jersey. Ryan and Angela, a very friendly American couple knowledgeable about the area. Private cabins (cob construction) $38 or dorm $21/couple or $13/single available for rent. Call or email ahead. High clearance vehicle needed or better yet leave your vehicle on the mainland at the harbor. Plenty of tours available on site and amazing food with many vegetarian and meat options with fresh ingredients from their garden or from theirs neighbors. Homemade bread and sweets (best brownies). If you camp at the entrance of the Cascada stop by for a great meal. Breakfast/lunch/dinner.

It is a fabulous finca! No camping but the rooms are very nice.

name: Finca balcon del cañon de Somoto
description:
Marlon and his family live in the house at the front of the hostel gabriela.Se can park next to the house.The parking is not very flat but you can find a space.We paid nothing for both nights.Marlon has bathrooms and showers. In the family there is also Luis, a very sympathetic guide who offers a $ 10 per person tour. You can also have lunch with the family for a very cheap price of the farm (45 pp / 1,5 $ usd) very rich A nice and quiet place with a mervellous family. We really like it and recommend it.


Marlon y su familia viven en la casa al fronte del hostal gabriela.
Se puede estacionnar al lado de la casa.
El parqueo no esta muy plano pero se puede encontrar un espacio.
No pagamos nada por las dos noches.
Marlon tiene baños y duchas.
En la familia hay tambien Luis, un guia muy sympatico que ofrenos un tour à 10$ per person.
Se puede tambien almuerzar con la familia por un precio muy barato los productos de la finca ( 45 pp/ 1,5 $usd) muy Rico!
Un lugar bonito y tranquilo con una familia mervellosa. Nos gusta mucho y Lo recomiendo.

name: Bomberos
description:
Water. 
Firemen very friendly

name: Don Tono camping and parking
description:
Tono, pronounced Togno, wants to settle down and do what it takes to accommodate you. His camping is rudimentary but he installed the electricity for us. There are very rudimentary toilets, showers. Access to the beach all this for $ 10.00 u / s per night notwithstanding the number of people.


Tono, prononcé Togno, veut s'établir et fait ce qu'il faut pour vous accommoder.  Son camping est rudimentaire mais il a installé l'électricité pour nous. Il y a des toilettes très rudimentaire,  des douches. Acces à la plage tout cela pour $10.00 u/s par nuit nonobstant le nombre de personnes.

name: El Desayunazo - GREAT breakfast place!
description: Cheap and great food. Free refill on coffee and fantastic service by a huge number of staff. They have WIFI and hold open from 6 in the morning to noon. English menu.

name: Hostel Caracolito
description:
Great new hostel that offers parking for vans or truck campers in the shade for 5$ per person/night. There's a shower, bathroom, kitchen, wifi and great hostel vibes. The place is clean and secure. Gates are closed at night. Connected to electricity for the fan in our tent and it was fine.
Guests say the beds are comfortable. They have breakfast for 3$ and purified drinking water for sale by the litre. Laundry available.

name: parking Trucks
description: A parking lot just before Nicaragua/Costa Rica Custom. it's free, quiet and safe. On the other side of the road, a little shop where you can eat a good food for 100 NIO. we overnight here with our RV (7.5 m / 23 feet )

name: Hotel Paso Real
description:
Worst hotel I've stayed in in 3 months in Central America. Water wasn't running but they told me it would come on later. It didnt. Electricity would go out for brief periods. Roosters in cages in the courtyard squawk all throughout the night.  

Bad border town in general--everything closes at 6p and there are barely any places to eat.  Best to move on if you can.

name: Hotel Generalife
description: Motorcycles can park inside hostal, nice owner,breakfast included, $25 per night, very very clean, free coffee and water

name: Restaurant Asados El Empalme
description:
A roadside restaurant with a huge gravel parking lot. This is a known stop for many of the the truck drivers from Panama, Costa Rica and all over Central America. 

We pulled in at night, and slept on the floor of the restaurant. They would let us pitch our tents anywhere on the property for free. Very suitable for big rigs and people with tents.

name: Hotel / Camping La Punta Resort
description: Newly opened place (in December 2016) on the lake side. Price is 10 US per vehicle. Wifi is good, power hookup and for 80C you get a decent breakfast in the morning. Perfect place to stay the night when arriving with the ferry at the end of the day like we did. But also suitable for a couple of nights more to just chill and explore the island. Great five minute walk to a sandy beach that runs into the ocean for some cool sunset pictures. Showers (cold) available, toilets, hammocks and swimming pool. Staff very friendly, they helped us in various ways to make us feel welcome and comfortable. We loved this place.

name: Milara's Cafe
description: New cafe run by Marvin and his wife. they are setting up an internet cafe. Great place to stop and have yummy pupusas and traditional drink. They are also happy to let overlanders stay in their lot for a night or two. Perfect spot if you are catching a flight.

name: Playa Bluff Restaurante
description: Owners were not here and the workers didn't mind us parking here for the night. No need for 4x4 up to this point in our 2 ton van. Owners eventually came and just asked that we parked in their parking area. Highly reccomended

name: Restaurant Campestre-Parking lot
description: Good big place for stay in SJdS. 5$ for night. Friendly owner live in yellow house across the street. Pablo-88343428 claro. The Plase have a some shadow place of the right site . No facilities but we can take water from Pablo house. 3min walk to the super mercado Pali, 15min walk to centrum SJdS. We stayed 4 night, no problems. We can used good wifi from Pablo.

name: Miramar surf camp
description: Truly a magic place. Over viewing Miramar Beach with very good surf. The rooms are comfortable. A bit expensive though. 35USD pp kids go free for room in the back with shared bathrooms.

name: On the road somewhere
description: We had mecanical problem, so need to stop.. wery quiet and secure .. we sleep two day , and he had a security guard near us so very secure.. you know when you dont have the choice !

name: On the street, in front of police trailer
description: Free ! Secure and windy ! We change place because in front of the police station its was very noise ! Music and a lot of car so we decide to move and don't choose the red cross parking , but wery near of it. Near of restaurant and everything , its was perfect for one night. We eat at the wok and roll ,, huuuummm delicious 6,5$ us per meal . A good spot for do our laundry the next morning, take a taxi from police station ( not trailer ) cost 60 cord for goes at the cathedral..

name: La Lavendaria
description: It is 30 cordobas per pound for wash, dry and fold. They no longer let you wash yourself. Open 8-4 mon-sat, Sunday closed. 7$ dry and clean ! Corner of calle la libertad y calle el cisne .

name: nicaragua Libre
description: this is a community project the is managed by local nicas. They offer excursions by horse to different lagoons near the volcano, cacao and coffee plantation tours and chocolate making classes. profits go to the local community. that being said, the have rural lodging options and meals for an affordable price.  rigs are welcomed, maybe tricky for bigger sized rigs but possible for sure.

name: las fronteras
description:
paid 400 cordobas for a private room with AC and private bathroom, but NO WATER!!!!! So it was shower bucket!!! This city seems to have regular problems with water alimentation....
Parked my car in a shelter of the hotel, but the place is NOT closed, open to the street. Owners said it's safe, but I'm not really sure....
The hotel is close to the "minimarket" on main street.

name: Los amores del mar
description: Nice spot in front of the palapa in front of the beach. 5 usd pp. 5 usd for electricity. Bathrooms are ok. Salty water shower. Nice food, but pricy all the places around have the same prices. Hammock sleeps in front of the beach 5usd.

name: Hotel Monte Verde
description: Most beautiful campsite in Central America. Free WiFi, hot showers, clean bathroom, picnic areas and a swimming pool. All size campers and trailers are welcome. Also has a primitive camp shelter already set up so backpackers don't have to pitch a tent. All this for only $5 a person. Also 100 yards across from the beach. And walking distances to several other beaches

name: Hotel entre amigos
description:
This a kind of youth hostel but they have also two double rooms (in fact they are triples). 
Without bathroom : 18$
With bathroom : 24$
If you need towels : +2$ !...
Basic accomodation, bathroom not very clean but when we arrived on saturday all cheap hotels around were  full; the only one with vacancy (La Bocona) charged 60$ for a double (with breakfast). 
Positive point : free coffee all time, a nice small garden with tables, wifi, and friendly backpapers. 
Bomberos parking lot just in the corner of the street : they charged us 70 COR per day for our Defender (Big rigs allowed)

name: La Libertad
description: Casual hostel with pool and hammocks, allows dogs (including in the room). Dorms for 7 USD. Secured parking lot a block away. Wifi is not great.

name: Police checkpoint - esteli
description: Police checkpoint. We weren't stopped but they had another car pulled over.

name: Checkpoint
description: Police checkpoint.  Again, we weren't stopped but he looked like he wanted to but was talking to someone else so he didn't have time before we passed thru.

name: carribean cigar trading co
description: cool little handrolled cigar factory.  spoke with guy at the gate about buying a few. manager came out and took us inside for quick tour and to pick out our own.  3 cigars for 150c (5.00)  fun little stop.

name: Central Lodge
description: Nice little hostal. Clean private rooms and cute, clean shared bathrooms. Parked on the street but they have a security guard out front to watch the car overnight for propina. Very friendly lady runs the place. Free fresh water, coffee, tea and they have a refrigerator/freezer available for use right outside the rooms. Wifi is fantastic! Very quiet and easy to sleep.  Rooms were a little pricey at $28 for 2 people in a private room with queen bed or $30 with AC.  They allowed our dog to stay.

name: El Divisadero
description: Grassy parking lot of a restaurant with pool, restrooms, wifi. Paid 10$ USD. Difficult to access with a big rig but feasible.

name: Bar Pollo Cervecero
description: A place for local people, delicious and cheap, we bought a fried fish $100c and a litre beer $52c (12oz) with and excellent service, staff super kind.

name: Restaurante Bar el Mirador
description:
If you are looking for an amazing view over the lake Nicaragua you have it and for free , ideal for a last last before go out Nicaragua or if you are going to Costa Rica .
Denis own the place an he is really friendly ! You can have a drink and eat to his place prices really affordable (4, 5  $)

name: Casa sirena surf lodge
description: Awesome little hostel with 4 rooms. 45us for a large room with two beds or 30us for a small room with two beds you can also camp for 10us Showers and toilets shared. Serves food and drinks. They can set up some activitys. Greg the owner is working hard to make this place something special. Definitely recommend right on the beach. Parking for smaller rig or motorcycles inside gates

name: Vista Del Pacifico
description: Hostel with cabanas and camping. Beautiful spot just as you turn into the main street for the town. Look for the wall with turtles painted on it and "pizza" written. We camped for $5 per night per vehicle and an extra $2 for electricity for our small fridge in the vehicle. This place is right on the water with a stunning view and great break just out the front.
