Also has an excellent little bar with cheap beers. Flushing toilets with seats and paper, and showers (cold obviously, you don't need hot showers here!!!). They don't allow electricity connections down at Rancho Esperanza any more so if you need power this is your best spot in town. Even if you don't need power it's cheap and awesome!

name: Closed to Cerro Negro Entrance
description:
The guy at the entrance ask for 15$ then 10$ for our van and 2peoples. Including showers and wc.
We choosed to move this spot, 100m down and we stayed overnight for free.

name: El Malinche
description:
Really cool cheap hostel not to big and personal. Great staff and secure parking for motorcycles. Can fit 3 or 4. Walking distance to everyting. 
Hostalmalincheleon@gmail.com
2315-5577

name: El Chocoyero-El Brujo
description: Reserva Natural with a loop hiking trail about 3.5 km long through dry forest. There are two waterfalls, the trail to the El Brujo waterfall is closed, El Chocoyero waterfall is tall but low flow but is situated next to a parrot nesting area in the rock wall. There are two types of monkeys as well as many different birds and mammals. You can camp in your vehicle in the dirt parking lot or in tents in one of the many dispersed camping areas on the trail. Admission is $5 per person, exchange at the current rate if you pay in Cordobas, the car camping was no additional fee. The road is mostly dirt with some pavers and packed rock areas, single track sometimes, high clearance and 4x4 not needed when we were here. It was very quiet except for staff coming and going on motorcycles which ended at 10:30.

name: Free wifi in Central Park
description: Free wifi outside in beautifull park. free WiFi, security 18:00-5:00 am

name: Arlen garden
description:
Arlen works in a travel agency (Gecko Travel Nicaragua) and she is happy to welcomed Overlander in her garden. 
She let us parked for 10$ with showers, flush toilet and electricity.

name: Hostal Mi Casa
description: Not the most beautiful hostel we've stayed at but it has a gated parking = success! We paid $7 per person and got a private room with a shared bathroom. Parking would fit two cars, height restriction ~2.8m. Possibility to use their kitchen for extra $3. Good location, fan in the room, cold shower, mediocre internet.

name: Talleres Traelmep
description: Geovanny is the owner of the taller. He's a very nice and friendly guy. He knows a lot of cars and he's very honest. We had to change our clutch,checking the brakes and put the Toyota at the computer.. very professional. He also explains everything very good!!!! oh and he also speaks english.

name: On the street
description: A nice small town to stop if you crossed the border Honduras to Nicaragua late afternoon. It took us about 4 hours all-in-all to pass the border. It's the first town after the border, 45mn drive. Nice, clean with a beautiful small park. The street where we parked overnight is wide and has plenty of space, so no problem for big rigs (ours is 28'). However, don't park further up the street : around 3am, a big truck parked, and they started unloading 50k bags of sugar... The building was a storage... We moved near the park, and everything was fine...

name: Hotel Blanca
description:
Good Hotel with perfect parking just in front of your accommodation. Space for cars and motorbikes. Prices start at 15$ for a simple room up to 30$ for a double with aircon. Lovely and safe town. Just met friendly people.

Greetings

name: Triumph Nicaragua
description:
I wanted to check my valves here, ended up not doing it as a suspect sound was not there anymore when i showed the Mechanic. 
If you need stuff done in Nicaragua, try here, very nice people, they do all moto brands. They told me it would be 35$ for an hour of the Mechanic but maybe they can do better deals...

name: Nice Park with beautiful Dinosaurs
description: Our kids love this park - for free! With wifi

name: Parking Lot Of Basket-ball Court
description: Although we didn't sleep there (my kids wanted wifi...), the place was appealing : big rig friendly, basketball court, very nice and clean shadowy park with life sized dinosaurs and some tables and toilets. It felt safe, just like this nice little tidy town.

name: Casa Inti
description:
camping in the garden of the guesthouse. Very safe, nightguard. only for small riggs. Very close to Masaya, Granada,... 
Swimmingpool, toilet and outside shower that you can use. Fast wifi. 
Also rooms available and breakfast. $5pp to park

name: Maria del Socoro
description:
Great place for tents. Third entrance left of Xalli Hotel. In the garden under the trees, very quiet and safe. Really nice family, we had a good time with Maria del Socoro and her daughter Maria Manuela. Breakfast available with delicious fresh fruit juice if you ask! Good location to visit the island. Eventually one room for 2 persons available.

 Great spot just 30sec from the beach and the lake & 2min drive to restaurants, hotels, your booking and scooter rentals. Family is very welcoming, said others have camped in the yard (120Cord / night) with your own tent. Made great breakfast 50Cord, great dinner 120Cord. Just before hotel Xalli if coming from ferry. An Uncle speaks English thou only here on weekends thou my Spanish is basic and they got the point across. Has pit toilets and a shower, we just bathed in the warm lake. Might be able to park a camper van near the front. I put some photos of their long lava rock linned walkway entrance. Very nice just ask if you can stay :)

name: Migración y Extranjeria (Visa extension)
description:
This is a place to extend your personal visa (not for the car). Very friendly, took about 30min. Located in the Multiplaza las Americas shopping mall. Place is also open Sat&Sun.

Needed a copy of the 
-passport first page
-the page with the first CA4 entry stamp
-the 10US$ small sheet you get when entering Nicaragua

cost is 500C$ per 30 days (not payable in US$)

There are 2 more options in town: the direccion general de migracion and an office in the metrocentro shopping mall.

name: Laundry Express
description:
Self service laundry with really clean machines-the lady is happy to just do it for you! 
wash&dry 200 C$ per load
wash only 120C$ per load

name: Hostel Los Cheles
description: Nice hostel with private room for even 4 people for 24$. Half less than the next one hostel. AC, fan, wi-fi, private bathroom, we put motorcycles inside:) they have volcano boarding tour for 26$! The others offer the same for 35!

name: Somoto Canyon Tours
description: Nica run tour operator with cabins and camping in a lovely field on the river. Henry is the local owner and the operation is managed by Brian, a Brit who is here to help Henry grow his business. Camping is $5 pp and there is a lovely shower, flush toilets and the campsite is quiet and serene and right next to a swimming hole. You can hike to a stunning mirador or take a tour of the canyon: jumping, floating, hiking, swimming, take a horse ride or just relax at the river. Tours are very reasonably priced, we did the 6 hour for $30 including guide, snacks and lunch. Horses are $15 for a 3 hour long and scenic ride. Booking online is recommended. Very responsive to email.

name: Finca Organico El Carrizo
description:
Ok go here. Don't pass go. Don't collect $200. Go straight here! This place is amazing. The people are amazing. Stay for at least 2-3 nights!!! It's worth the side trip!!!
Camping- by donation or eat their super healthy simple organic farm meals, take tours, support the community and camp for free. Meals: 35C/per person/per set meal. Cabanas $20, rooms $10, tours $10. Tours: all worth it! Organic farm of this family which includes a swim in a volcanic lagoon. Local artesanias. Various mirador hikes through the fincas. The finca escultura de Alberta Gutierrez. Local caves. You can also visit Reynaldo's mothers natural medicine clinic for. Bioenergia consultation and recommendations or get relaxation massages from the same place. Seriously do everything. It's good prices. Good people and a wonderful example of community sustainability in Nicaragua.  Volunteer options for those staying more than two weeks. Fincaorganicaelcarrizo.Wordpress.com call Reynaldo 85244764 or Marcos 82087168 for volunteering info. Great goat cheese in this town too. But no gas, groceries or booze.

name: Finca San Cristobal
description: Prices are $5/person for the entry. They will show you the trailhead and don't require that you take a guide but will guide you if you want. Recommend coming up the night before to sleep in the cool mountain air. Photo attached with phone number for more info.

name: La Casa Ecologica
description: Great place. Great food. Camping possible.

name: Las Penitas Free Camp
description: Along the soccerfield, space, tranquilo, local touch,  less tourism, friendly locals. No shade, but free. Easy access for all rigs.

name: La Perla
description: This is the campsite for tours departing from La Perla booked through Treehuggers in Esteli. Surely they would let people without reservations camp as well but I'm not sure if you would be able to book a tour from here. Tour is $15 in Spanish and $20 for English per group (1-3 people). Camping is $2pp additional. Typical food is also available but we did not try it. Much cooler than coastal regions.

name: Condega Central Plaza Free Camp
description: A helpful local policeman showed us this boondock place on the main square. Free open wifi. Shady trees. Close to the police station.  Music from bar/restaurant stopped just after midnight ( on saturday night ). Quiet night. Lots of birdies singing in the morning. Park your rig on this side of the plaza near the hostel (english spoken). Pali supermarket on the other corner.

name: Ramsar Lodge
description:
This is a Lodge/Camping founded by the 'Comité Colaborativo Reserva Natural Padre Ramoz'.
Paid 8US$/2people. Cabañas cost 8US$/pers
Clean toilet facilities, cold shower. AND: Thermal bath next to the site.
From here one can organize guided tours to the vulcano Cosigüima or Scarlet macaws birdwatching. They organize every tour for you. Ask for Martin, he speaks fluent English as he studied 2 years in the US. One should leave at 4.30am as the macaws are active between 6 to 8 am. Its a 1h drive (24km) and an easy walk uphill.

name: Flor de Caña
description:
One of the world best Rumdistillery you find here. 
Cost: 10US$/pers
Very nice tour with interesting details and tasting.
Vladimir speaks fluent English as well a little German.

name: La Selva-Out in the wild
description:
Boondocking at its best. Varias places to camp next to the sea. A few 100m lives the guardaparque!
Don't drive here in wet season. High clearance recommended, no need for 4x4

name: Boots cleaning for motorbikers
description:
Francisco Caballero... Super friendly man that will bring your biking boots back to life after the sandy roads trough Nicaragua. Pay him a visit and say greetings from Martin... "The German guy!"

He asked for 20 ... gave him much more since he worked like an angel...

:-)

name: motorbike shop parking lot
description: Parking lot of a motorbike shop. Not a closed space, but felt very safe. at night, a security guard take care of the place. Cheap. 30 córdobas per night + 30 per day. No facilities. Near the city center.

name: Hotel la Arboleda
description:
Quiet friendly hotel, perfect if you don't want to go into central Managua.
We paid 750cordoba for a huge room, double bed, single bed and table chairs and air con. 
They have a kitchen you can use and a supermarket across the road.
We're bike tourers so not sure about big rigs but there is plenty of parking available, feels really safe away from the main road.

name: Behind Restaurant
description:
Behind the restaurant you can camp $3 usd per person. Dog friendly. Clean pit toilet. outside shower. You are many meters from the big empty beach. Not a swiming beach! The town is very limited. The camping is hot and dusty. The family is building rooms, and flushing toilts. Maybe the camping will get better.
Don't count on eating here. We asked what time the restaurant closed. They said 8, at 6:30 we went for dinner. They said they were closed. Bummer, super hungry and we didn't set up our kitchen and Joe's place too far to walk is only other resturant in town. Side note you can rent a room for $9 per person at Joe's Place and they might have room to park a normal sized rig, also dog friendly.

name: Jesus Statue
description:
Giant Jesus Statue right outside of San Juan Del Sur. It's 26m tall!
$2 pp for non Nicaraguans. $1 pp for locals. Great view!

name: Veterinary C.V.L.O
description: Good veterinay in Léon. We had our dog checked and treated for tick transmitted parasites in the blood. The veterinary is the wife of Axel, the owner of the Rancho Los Alpes outside of town.

name: Hospedaje Framar
description: Nice little place to stay right on the square. We paid C200 for 2 people in a private room with 3 beds and a fan. Shared bathroom and shower. The owner is very nice and speaks great English. Excellent value.Open Wifi has been cut.So no open park wifi. We were able to bring our motorcycle in the front and park them inside.

name: Hotel Campero
description: Simple hotel 6 blocks from the square. We paid C200 for a room with two single beds and a shared bathroom and shower. We were able to park our motorcycles in a gated hallway. If you are driving a car you might have to park on the street. No wifi in the room but there is free open wifi at the square.

name: Police Checkpoint
description: Cones in middle of road, followed other drivers around and got stopped. Cop asked for license, import docs and insurance. Didn't show the latter. Got chewed out for bypassing the cones. Instructed in the future to await police signal to proceed past cones. Gave us our docs back and let go with a warning.

name: Cacao Pool Club
description: Pool located inside the choco museum and hotel. They offer day passes for adults for $6 per person. Open from 10am-6pm. Lots of chairs, changing rooms, and bar. Perfect way to beat the heat in Granada! Entrance is on calle centeoamerica.

name: Cacao Cooperative (Factory)
description: The Coodeprosa Cacao / Chocolate Factory offers free visits of the cacao processing facility and paid introductions to chocolate making. A very nice and friendly place worth visiting if you come to El Castillo. They offer excellent hot chocolate (20C$ per cup) also with rum (25C$). Dog friendly.

name: Parqueo Santa Rosa
description:
Parqueo a little uphill of San Carlos center. Sleeping in the vehicle is allowed (we had a nice breeze in the night). 50C$ per night.
With a little creativity you can park your car leveled. Power available but not sure about the cost (line was cut by a truck when we were there). 
Dog friendly.
Silvio, the owner also has a farm down the access road where he sells beef and milk products.

name: Somoto Canyon
description: They made an easier entrance for bigger rigs today. Here, on your left, when you drive towards the river. If it's still too narrow, drive 40 metres further to the other Parqueo place on the right. (San Rafael is nicer though).

name: Al Cielo
description: Most beautiful place we've stayed in a long time!! Families welcomed! Owners are two very nice frenchmans. Nice cabanas for rent and it is also possible to stay overnight in parking for 10$/vehicule.  Restaurant with excellent food where their pizza is considered the best in Nica!  Nice pool.  Lovely 2KM walk to a great beach.  Beautiful views on a 12 acres lot.  We were even able to wash our cloths in a machine for extra cost!  We were sad to leave this little piece of cielo!

name: Hospedaje Casa Sinai
description:
A very comfortable but inexpensive hotel in Ocota.  Run by a very nice young couple, this hotel had large rooms with airconditioning and quality beds and pillows. Our $20.US  room had a king bed but other rooms had twins, or doubles.
There is hot water but only in the morning, not a problem because it is hot here and a cool shower in the pm felt really good. 
There is indoor parking for motorcycles.

name: Al's Auto Service
description: We were referred by Diego at Mind the Gap Nicaragia to Al for some tires.  Al was great about getting us tires,  helping us get a jack, and he even let us park in his lot over the weekend while we waited to get the tires on Monday.  Good prices and he speaks English (He's from Georgia.  i highly recommend him. full service mechanic.

name: Mercada Artisianal
description: Great market for clothes, wooden toys, furniture, pottery and souvenirs. Local feel, not touristy. Parking available on the street surrounding.

name: Among pine trees
description: Nice free spot on the trailheads to 2 hikes. One for each side of the road. Nice place to camp. Out of the village between the trees. One trail is signposted that 1000M to mirador. Easy 1-1,5hour hike uphill. Some places trail is not that obvious and had to just keep heading uphill. Nice 360 views all the way from the top. Gps tracker logged 5,6km with return. Other side hike is shorter but nice as well. No fees or guide needed. The shortest road from Esteli is some places kind of rough. Nothing too bad. There was small passenger car on this road so its doable in any kind of vehicle

name: Telica
description: Thats the furthest you can drive. Hike trail starts here. Rough road after the last camping spot on this same road.

name: Road to Telica
description: Thats the farthest we could drive with our 4+tonne rear wheel drive Sprinter. Road gets a lot rougher and steeper from here. Its rough road all the way from last turnoff but its getting even rougher after this point. Easy walk up tho the to grater. Started 2:30 at night and had plenty of time looking red volcano before the sunrise. 7,5km return hike from here and prox 4 hours. The hiking trail is marked in Maps.me app and easy to follow. Its scary up in top in dark. You will hear the volcano roaring before you see the red magma in the bottom of the crater. No costs involved and drive up to this point is doable in 2wd. We are 3.45m high and it was some places challenging. Anything under 3 meters in hight would be easy.

name: Tito's restaurant
description: Restaurant with a variety of choices. Lunch of the day starting at C80.

name: Free beach access
description: This small rocki path leads to the free beach. Save 5 dollars per person and park on the road side here and walk down

name: Ola Verde Hotel
description: Nice, clean, simple hotel accommodations with the options for dorm rooms. Camping not allowed. $30usd per night for private room with private bathroom. Water is room temperature and is salty at times. Price comes with AC (air). No TV in room. WiFi was spotty in room but good in the patio/restaurant area. Food was great in restaurant and plenty of bottled water and beer. This is a surf destination and the hotel is right on the beach. The sand is clean and the water is clear. Strong and large waves most of the time so make sure you can swim well. I think this is the best value for the area. Especially for an uncrowded beach.

name: Auto Servicios Miranda
description: This is a repair and parts shop with a huge lot in the back. There is electricity if you have a long extension cord. There is non-potable water and washrooms available (probably nasty, I don't know as I have my own). Guarded 24 hours. I am the first Overlander here and he wants 100 C$ per night as I asked for in/out privileges and that means the guard has to be more vigilant on the gate. Not a bad price. Totally big-rig friendly although the town has streets that are not! Pets are allowed, but at night they have guard dogs so your pets have to be closed in for safety at night.

name: Lake site - Free
description: Very nice place on grass and directly at the lake with great view. People are very friendly and we thoroughly enjoyed the last night in Nicaragua. The music from the restaurant was to hear but otherwise extremely quiet.

name: Artesanal Market
description: Amazing pottery mercado artesanal. Just off main road.

name: Daría Mirador
description: A lot smaller and quieter than Catarina Mirador (also a good spot). There is a gate but it was open on Monday morning and there doesn't appear to be any charge. We didn't stay here but looks a reasonable spot - probably quieter but maybe not as secure as Catarina

name: Casa Barcelona (& Camping)
description:
Beautiful hotel 7 blocks out from the centre. It's a woman's project supported by a loan from Spain and Netherlands.

Enough room for a small (Eurovan/Westie) van inside the gate but we had to park on small road outside which is apparently very safe.

Camping using their facilities is $10 + whatever kilowatt hours you use, and in May they have a promotion for $25 for a BEAUTIFUL en-suite room with fluffy towels and lovely linen. Not the cheapest in Nicaragua, but this is Granada and it's worth every penny.

name: Hostal El Guïs
description:
Place for 5-6 rigs, wifi, outdoor shower, toilet. 5$ a night total (C$200 18 May 2022 and didn’t negotiate) ! Great place, friendly people!

Decent sized flat grass field advertising camping. Basic toilet and shower. Only a short distance from the main road and avoids the bumper section of the road until to the Finca
We stopped to ask but there wasn't anyone there but may come back later. 

Super little hostel near the beach. Very calm and nice. Baños super clean. You can camp for 3$ (per car) on a grassy parking lot from of the hostel. Otherwise dorm at 7$ with private bathroom. The owner is nice, recommended.

name: Hostel (Hotel) Santa Cruz
description:
This place has unbelievable views of the volcano from its terrace. We met some friends here and asked to park overnight. Despite the car park being empty they were a little reluctant but agreed. They asked for 150C but accepted 100C.

No electricity, but obviously showers and toilets.

We moved from the slightly sloping parking lot to the flat concrete pad near the restaurant after it was dark.

name: Turicentro Estelimar (hotel)
description: Nice place well kept garden and swimming pools. Gated and guarded. Charged $15/usd per night but I was in no mood to haggle... was getting dark and not many better options around. Power available with extension cord. Water and washrooms. Pleasant staff. Great internet (no other guests at the moment)

name: Cabañas Gabriela
description:
Really quaint hotel will all services available including canyon tours. They offer a tour package $35 per person includes a night in hotel, tour, breakfast and dinner.
Really nice owners, happy to have the business. Great food. Very well kept hotel.

name: Free wifi Central Park
description: Free wifi in Central Park. Requires Facebook sign in (for some odd reason)

name: Pure Gym, Spa and Guesthouse
description: so this place was completely unexpected.  really cute gym, yoga center and spa where they also rent out clean, decent rooms for between 21-40 dollars.  I think they have 3-4 rooms.  best part - you can use the fully equipped gym and attend all yoga classes for free while you stay here!! also a vegetarian cafe and 20 dollar massages onsite.  you can work your rig in front of church next to casa San Francisco (a couple of blocks over). talk to eddieberto, the unofficial, official night watchman. for two dollars he will watch your car - it's what all of the hotels say to do so it is legit.  I tried to add a bunch of photos but Ioverlander was having a hard time.

name: Parque Central Somoto
description:
Ample street parking alongside the Central Park. Police told me 48 hours no problem and if I wanted more just supposed to register my plate at the police station. There's been no shortage of parking for anyone who wants. Free, not quiet in the morning, well lit. Free wifi. Might be water available in the park to fill a container... didn't check. Security in the park all day/night. Park closed at 9 pm. 
I stayed 2 nights and felt safe (in a camper). The usual town drunks who will ask for money but they're harmless.

name: Polideportivo Estelí
description:
A soccer facility with a parking lot and open field beside. Guard said ok for a night. Not ideal, near highway coming through town so there will be traffic noise, but I was rejected at the spots listed north of town as I came in from Somoto today. There's a water spout beside the building with good pressure so I filled the my tank :)
Guard is a nice guy... will tip in the morning if I don't get robbed or kicked out :P

name: lakeshore bar
description: chilled with a few beers at the bar here on the lakeshore. very nice people, they have a security guard at night and said he would keep an eye in us and promised we would be safe. we offered a little cash but they said it was fine. great views and good breeze. no facilities, they have a toilet, and there is open WiFi nearby.

name: Finca Neblina del Bosque
description: It's 27 kms from Estelì deep inside the protected Area Miraflor via a dirt road. From Estelì there are buses coming in the area almost daily. A Germán lady runs it. 5 cabins with restaurant. If you decide to stay in one of the cabins, breakfast, lunch and dinner are included for 900 Cordobas per person. You can also decide to camp on the property but we don't know prices. We came in with our 4x4 (almost ;)) RV but the only option was in the parking lot. No way into the green of the property with a car or anything on wheels.

name: Hostalito Fatima
description:
There are not many options on this way. This town is just in the middle of Managua and Leon. We found two hotels. One is this one and the other is two blocks south. Very basic room with two ventilators tv, bathroom. No internet. 300 cordobas. If you want to use the parking 50 more for two motorbikes. Parking is no so huge but many overlander can fit inside, but the town is pretty safe. You can leave your car outside i guess. We asked for neighbour house for using their internet and they allowed ;) 

The other hotel said 600 cordobas and their parking was less safe then this one, but they have internet.

Obviously we stayed in the first hotel.

name: Hotel Plaza Cosiguina
description: A great Hotel, clean, safe, with safe and private parking lot, breakfast, a.c., WiFi, bathrooms, etc. it's a little bit expensive, but after a day on the road crossing from El Salvador to Nicaragua, was the best price we found to stay and relax. This is the first city after the border, and has everything you want. They charge u$50 per night with all included for 2ppl in a private room (Jun/17).

name: Somoto Canyon (official campsite)
description:
Really nice flat area with thick grass. Clean toilets and a shower. Even a small roof to sit under when it rains. 
100 meters to the little restaurant.
Ask about camping at the tourist information. We payed 100C or person pr night.
The owner comes by and tends to his garten and cleans the bathroom. 
if you need electricity there is a small extra fee.

name: police checkpoint
description:
Officer stopped us and tried to say my US driver's license wasn't good after 3 days in Nicaragua (we'd been there four) and that there would be a fine unless we gave him money for coffee. 

We made it clear we didn't think it was a real regulation and used extra poor Spanish while remaining polite and he gave up. 

Our first bribery attempt in 8 months on the road.

name: Migración Central
description:
Welcome to hell. We went to both of the other immigration offices (in the malls) to extend our visas and in each case they refused and sent us here, although I don't know why. Take a number, waiting over 5 hours and counting...

Read other posts for instructions

name: Telica
description: Nice free camping spot in front of the Telica Vulcan. The trailhead starts here and it's an 2 hours return walk to the mouth of this nice crater. It's an active Vulcan, so be careful and ask some locals if it's save before you go up. 4wd required even in dry season cause some parts are very steep. We done it easily with our 4wd pickup in wet season. At daytime here some guys of the cooperation and ask for 5 usd per person to go up and at night time we were alone but felt very safe. Quit night and nice temperature. Highly recommend 👍

name: Boca de Sabalos
description:
informal camping with local family. The Family lives in a very small house and speak very little spanish. The oldest kids read and speak spanish.
only room for a tent behind the house. If you are in a car there is safe parking/camping on the left just before the river.
if you are here for a tour on the river we can recommend Migdonio Treminio. Just ask for him in town or call 89213127
The road there is gravel but it is really good and hard packed to even in rainy season you can get there in a car or motorcycle.
Did not get a picture from the front of the house but it is on the top af the little hill on your right side just before you get to Sabalos.

name: Hostal Casa San Miguel
description: Really tidy hostel with friendly staff. 20$ for a room (I travel alone) with good wifi both in room and reception, breakfast included. They let me get the bike into my room no problem. There's also kitchen and fridge for guests to use. Around 500m of main park and Supermarket. Highly recommended.

name: Rancho Tranquilo
description: A lovely hostel with cabanas and space on level ground out front for overlanders, great vegetarian food at very reasonable prices $3-4. Isabel who runs it along with 'mama' who cooks the food are lovely and extremely helpful. Clean toilets and showers too....right on the beach. Nice bar too!

name: Volcan Telica
description:
If you have a small vehicle ( we drive a landrover with rooftop tents, you can drive up some thing a little bigger than that), 4x4 and high clearance you can drive very close to the crater of volcan Telica. The dirt road starts at the beginning of the main road  between telica and chinandega coming from telica.
Its a veru slow drive of about 1,5 hours. You arrive at a small parking where there might be a guardian charging the  entrance fee of 3 US pr person. From here you can walk about 1.5 km to the crater. Great views along the whole trail and also from the parking.Asked guardian. Said you can spend the night. Safe.
We continued another 10 min along the dirt road which deteriorates and becomes somewhat diffecult. Ends up at a small community where there is a kind of cabana where people visiting the volcano can sleep in hammocks or on mattresses. You can camp there as well. No view but the hike to the volcano and mirador is shorter and easier, about 20-30 min. We spent the night there. Both overnight spots are free. The first parking more quiet. No roosters, dogs etc. 
Both places have very simple toilets.
Volcano and views from volcano towards Volcan Momotombo and San Cristobal fantastic. Worth the long and slow drive.

name: Fortaleza Castillo de la inmaculada Concepción
description: Monument built to resist the pirates entering the San Juan River to Nicaragua, take boat from San Carlos 140C $ Cordobas per trip, entrance to the castle 2dolares plus a dollar for each camera, a lot of hotel and restaurants in the area

name: Fortaleza el Coyotepe
description: Amazing historical place, q was initially built as a fortress to defend the city of Masaya, then was given prison use for guerrillas and political prisoners at the time of the dictatorship, tour the basement 2 $ p / p, amazing

name: parq central de moyogalpa
description: Quiet place in the center of town, next to the church. Wifi, sanitary for 5 cordobas, keys to load water.

name: Parque central de Altagracia
description: Quiet place in the center of town, next to the church. Wifi, sanitary for 5 cordobas, keys to load water.

name: parque central de San Jorge
description: Quiet park, near the church, with free wifi, water and electric connection.

name: mirador Nandasmo
description: Tourist lodging, overlooking the Masaya lagoon and the volcanoes Santiago and Masaya, has swimming pool, health services and restaurant. Value per person 10cordob for pool use 60cordob

name: Ruinas de León Viejo
description: Historical and archeological site of the first capital of Nicaragua, the population was transferred to 60km, what today is known as new Leon.

name: Police check
description: Checked passports, waived us on. Friendly

name: Beach access
description:
There a various entrance along the road.
This one we like the most. 
It is the entrance to the beach. So there might be cars coming and going aswell as peoples (depending on the season). Nice to stay overnight. The beach is nice with wave to surf.
We felt safe.

name: Oriental market
description:
Nice Market. Has everything from fruits  to car parts. It is hough!
They told us that it is not that safe... so don't take a lot of things with you.
We had the feeling that they don't like if you take pictures...

name: Big Fish
description:
Great double and triple rooms. Air-conditioning, TV, WiFi. We paid $35 for triple and way nicer than the others we looked at nearby. 

Gorgeous little beach directly over the road and free use of sunbeds. Also free coffee and cake in morning and free water refills. 

Fantastic bakery 1 minute down road and 2 of the best eateries super close (Sea Side Grill and Maris Comedor). 

10 mins and 20 cords in taxi from airport and ferry. Definitely worth staying a night or 2 to/from Little Corn.

name: Hotel Austria
description: Nice hotel. paid 75$ USD per night. two beds. fast wifi. They have a separate parking lot that fit our 3m tall van. definitely could fit a bigger car in the lot too. price includes breakfast.

name: Restaurant Malinche
description: Private room for $10/night, camping available for one camper next to the road, tent and hammock spots. lovely swimming beach right in front. restaurant serves food all day which is delicious and cheap (Nica plate 70 c, smoothies 35c). Friendly staff and dog friendly.

name: Supermarket
description: Best supermarket in Somoto centre. Parking in the street.

name: Beach Side Camping
description:
There's a row of palapas along the beach and near the end before the arroyo there's a semi grassy space to camp.

Its all divided into lots so someone probably owns it but we spent a peaceful night here without any bother, other than the boy selling nacatamales in the morning :)

name: Quetzaltrekkers NGO Tour Guides
description:
A charity tour organisation who use volunteer (but well trained) guides to run tours and camping trips to the volcanoes surrounding León. All profits go to charities supporting the street kids and tackling drug/glue-sniffing challenges.

We volunteered here for 3 months and it was an amazing experience. Guests often told us it was the highlight of their trip. 

León is only place in the world you can board (sledge) down a volcano! Combining this with a 2 day camping trip (El Hoyo) is very popular, as is camping just below the rim of the smoking and lava filled Volcan Telica. There are also more and less strenuous tours available.

This is the only charity tour operator and they offer the best trips in the city. All equipment is provided - you just need to bring enthusiasm.

León is a fantastic vibrant city full of nightlife and cheap eats thanks to all the students. The Maribios volcano range is just awesome - where else can you stand  on the edge of a 120m vertical drop into a highly active crater and see lava with not even a warning sign in sight?!

Unfortunately there isn't a good official overlander spot but there are many roads that are wide enough to park on (be warned this is not a quiet city so expect fireworks, and the twice daily air raid siren!), or stay in a cheap hostel ($20-25 for a private room) and pay a buck to leave the van in the parqueo.

Nicaragua is the land of lakes and volcanoes so don't miss a chance to explore and let your dollars improve the lives of kids who struggle to get a daily meal.

name: José Antonio's house
description: We found this young guy that offer your house to park our Rv, with electricity and water. The place is very close to the Miramar surf spot.

name: All Nica Cigar Store
description: They have free WiFi, coffee, and clean bathrooms. The owners said they will allow overnight stays, but they have pit bulls that patrol at night. Great people and over night stop and secure, with all night security.

name: Kathys Waffle house
description: Excellent breakfast spot! Sit out on the veranda. It's shaded with views of the street for people watching. Huge pancakes, great waffles, and everything breakfast. We parked big rigs on the street In easy view of our table. Well worth the visit.

name: Rancho Tranquillo
description:
Nice hostel with dorm rooms and little cabanas. We could camp on the property  behind the chill area/bar/restaurant just behind the beach. You can also camp at the big and shady parking lot. But the view in the front is much nicer, only works for small rigs though. You have to pass between the main building and fence where they currently had some branches laying around (see picture). They said they would remove those if more camper would arrive.
The food was really good and the prices were fair (main dish 3.5 - 4.5 USD).
Basic but clean bathrooms and showers. No Wifi and didn't ask about electricity.
Check out the turtle rescue station about 150m North on the beach.
Price was 5 USD per vehicle (2 persons), they asked for 8 USD first.

name: Sea Turtle Rescue Jiquilillo
description:
At this place you can experience all different aspects of a turtle rescue. We saw Hawksbill baby turtles hatch from their nest and could help releasing them (87 baby turtles) at sunset into the sea. 
We went on a night watch with Ramon and were looking together for sea turtles laying eggs. The people from the Rescue Station do their best to find the turtles before other locals do. Who take the eggs and sell them as a food delicacy as a mean of income, particularly in the largely impoverished coastal regions.
Robert, who runs the organization uses his retirement funds to pay his stuff and tries to buy as many eggs he can afford from the locals (for example 100 eggs about 560 NIO).
We were also there when a local came by selling the eggs, and we could assist to bury them in a safe and secured nest, where they hatch about 40-50 days later.

The Sea Turtle Rescue Station doesn't ask for money but donations are highly welcomed. They also sell small plastic turtles. Made by women from the village who use recycled material. One turtle is 5 USD, 1 for the woman and 4 for the organisation.

It was a breathtaking and amazing experience to see so many different aspects of a turtle rescue and to have the possibility to be involved as much as you want to.

You can find this place if you walk 150 metres north on the beach from Rancho Tranquillo and look for the small sign "Sea Turtle Rescue Nicaragua". You can just walk in and say hello to Robert, the American who runs this place, and ask about the turtles. 

Released turtles 2016: about 6000

name: Hostal Libertad
description: Cheap little hostel with dorm rooms and a pool, parking further down at the old fire station with great guys that can help with anything you need.

name: Bomberos Parking
description: Parking at the old fire station, these guys can help with anything you need, I needed a mechanic and they had a guy with me within the hour also safe and secure parking

name: Finca San Roque
description:
For now, wild camping. Large levelled area to accommodate up to 8 overlanders. Big rigs not advised as road into the property has some tight turns and a small river crossing. Water and electricity coming soon. Right now you can park and camp for free. Call or email to make sure we are there or can arrange for our manager to unlock the gates for you. Dogs welcome but would be best if we introduced you to our 6 dogs in person.
James and Enedee 8365 7295 (Claro)

name: Managua Backpackers Hostal
description: Very nice backpackers. Private rooms (US$32 incl ac and private bathroom. Cheaper options may be available) and dorms (US $9). Pancakes and coffee for breakfast. Pool to cool off in and close to transport to the Malecon.  Very helpful staff and two small spaces for off street parking, but parking in the street is safe - quiet neighbourhood and security guard watching the van.

name: Hotel/informal camping  Xolotlan
description: Amazing owners, son lives in the US. We paid $35 for room with breakfast. Very clean. They say they are willing to let people sleep in the car and use facilities they have space for vans. If it’s a big rig and don’t fit they have a place nearby with security to let the van with no charge.

name: El Trapichito
description: This place is next to Centro Turistico El Trapiche.  That place is rather unkempt and didn’t feel safe.  This place is a private swimming pool and bar/restaurant with security, open 24 hours.  We arrived on a Sunday afternoon and the pool was a welcome cooling off point.  The locals were in full swing, music blaring, but fun to relax and have a beer (1litre C$70.  At 6pm the music stopped. Entrance to the pool is C$80 pp.  we asked for camping, swimming and security and were charged the same.  Later the guard asked for more money to keep an eye on us.  We declined, saying we’d been told it was all included but as it turned out he was only looking for C$50 so we paid up.  A good place to stop overnight. Safe, large level car park with lots of shade, either on the way into or out of Managua heading north.   Food in the restaurant is expensive and apparently not that good. We just tried the cold beer and had a great swim.  We were warned by the security guard not to leave anything lying around when swimming - take usual precautions you are in a busy place. Rather bizarrely has to pay C5 for toilets but not in the morning, only when pool open.

name: Manyaku Hostal/Informal Campground
description: Very comfortable new hostel in a great central location just a short walk to metro centro.  Fast internet, dog friendly and overland friendly.  You can park out front for the night for $10 and have access to wifi, the kitchen, bathroom, and pool in the common areas. If you want a room, it's $13 I believe for a shared room or $27 for a nice private room with private bath (that's the price for two people)...both include breakfast (not sure if that's included for overlanders). Very kind and bilingual owner/employees.  Pizza place right across the street too, or many restaurants a close walk.

name: Nena Lodge and Tours
description:
This place was recommended to us by a Dutchman living in Guatemala for 18 years working as a guide though Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua and Costa Rica. Very knowledgeable.  

A trip with Nena Tours into the Indio Maiz reserve was great. Saw lots of different birds (blue heron, great herons, kingfishers, green ibis, yellow oriel, toucan, egrets), caiman, basilisk lizard, tiny poisonous frogs, chameleon, spider monkeys and capuchin monkeys, different medicinal plants and info on the trees, all followed by a swim in the river.   Well worth the money. 

The lodge is lovely. Very welcoming.  $16 for double shared bathroom, $25 en suite.  Would recommend you eat elsewhere as there are loads of good restaurants around. Haven’t marked them - too many, but just ask for recommendations. 

You can’t drive here. Park in the port (will mark. C$75 per night and v secure).

name: Casa Sirena Surf Camp
description: On the beach, great chill out place. Owners super friendly and place to relax. Food is awesome. More affordable than miramr surf camp. Secure gated compound. Surfboard rentals too

name: Parking at the Port
description: You can park in the port and leave your vehicle for a number of days. Very secure as it has Navy, police and military guarding the place. We were charged $75 per night/day.  Right next to the ticket office where you can buy your tickets down the Río San Juan.

name: Centro Turistico Finca Los Angeles
description:
Great place to beak the journey between San Carlos/CR border and the north (Managua etc).  A Baleario with restaurant and accommodation. We asked if we could camp the night and they agreed. In the knowledge that we would eat and have a drink they did not charge us other than C$40pp for using the pools.  Children’s play area and pool and rabbits around (so not sure they would allow pets)   The location is set back from the road, so quiet, secure (guard), everyone very friendly and the pools a refreshing break.  Very clean. Excellent food. Beer cheap.  The owner gave us a key to one of the rooms so we could use the bathroom/shower but there are public toilets anyway.  We didn’t connect water or electricity. There are taps around. Don’t know if they would allow this as we didn’t ask. 

Also a great place to stop and have a refreshing swim and bite to eat it you want to continue on your journey but just need a break.  

A great place.

name: Bar el Parqueo
description:
Nicely kept bar and lot, about a block back from the beach. I sat for a beer with the owner and he said overnight vehicle camping would be 100 cordobas.
The bar has nice cold beers, and food for sale (pizza, ceviche, seafood, etc).
Wifi and full bathrooms.

name: Parqueo & restaurant
description:
Another Parqueo along the pan-American. Nice folks. Basic facilities include a restaurant with low prices. Guarded all day & night. There is one mean dog... always tied up.
They told me 50 cords per night... but then another 50 per day. I needed a week so I struck a deal for 500.
More money, but nicer than the one down in Diriamba... and even slightly cooler climate.

name: Parking
description: Secure parking close to the center of town, open 6am- 10pm. C$30 for the day, C$50 for overnight (24 hours). Next to the Bomberos.   We have been told you can also park in the Bomberos but didn’t try. They have a restaurant and toilet here. Not sure if you could stay overnight.  We didn’t ask.

name: Playa el remanso
description: Nice beach, not to crowded. Not difficult access after two days of rain. Bar and surfboard rental

name: Parqueo "Cafe Matagalpa"
description:
Parking lot in the center of Matagalpa, just after the firefighters'place.
30C per night, 20C per day.
They allow sleeping in your car.
Plenty of space and no height limit.
It surprisingly was quiet during the weekend.

name: repuesto bici
description: awsome shop for bici, like in the US ! every parts you need for your bike.

name: El Chanchito
description: Great little restaurant on the road side. Bit of a trucker stop but busy and the food was excellent. About C$80 pp for a substantial and delicious lunch.  Highly recommend it if you are hungry or need a break.  Had cerdo frito with rice, beans and salad. It was delicious. So is the chile.

name: Hotel Casa de Agua
description: brilliant host, Gerry who will deliver a great welcome and discuss what might be of interest to you by way of bars, trips tours etc, a quality hostel style hotel with private rooms only, with the ability to use a shared kitchen. 2 plunge pools and good security (night guard). excellent breakfast, free coffee / tea though the day, filtered water and ice, cold beers 40nic.  parking is a block away at a private garage 200 nicaraguan a night for a motorcycle.

name: Hostal el bosque
description: cheep place with a few room. Large bar. I paid 250 cordobas for one night. free wifi in t the village

name: The Hostel Matagalpa
description: Quiet hostel with washing facilities, kitchen, cute courtyard, dorms and private rooms. Really nice owner and clean tidy hostel, beds are comfy (mattresses a little sinky) and dining area is simple but clean and does the job! $7 a night, going down to 6 after the first night in the dorm

name: Hostal Pacifico
description: good hotel very close to down town. good internet. it cost me 18usd for one night for 1 person.  breakfast included

name: Anastasio guía Cañon de Somoto
description:
Anastasio nos recibió en su terreno dejándonos pasar la noche ahí gratuitamente, al lado de las cabañas Gabriela , nos invitó comida, nos contó su historia, la de la cooperativa de guías del cañón a la que pertenece, y nos guió por el cañón a muy buen precio y de forma segura. El lugar es seguro y muy tranquilo. Preguntar por él en Cabañas Gabriela. 
---
Anastasio welcomed us on his land, letting us spend the night there for free, next to the Gabriela cabins, he invited us to eat, he told us his story, that of the guides cooperative of the canyon to which he belongs, and he guided us through the canyon to good price and safely. The place is safe and very quiet. Ask about him at Cabañas Gabriela.

name: Puerto
description: you can sleep directly inside the puerto for 20C$ per car. There is a Hotel too, like 200C$ for a room with a fan. During your time at Corn Islands you can let your car here for 20C$ per day.

name: Loma de Tiscapa
description: Great mirador - views of Managua and the lake with the volcanoes beyond and south including the laguna. For history buffs, there is the tank Mussolini gave to Somoza. From one dictator to another.

name: comedor sunshine
description: Very good comedor with decent prices. Burritos were huge, tasty and with lots of vegetables and chicken. it changes from the common rice and tostones ! recommend it !

name: Backyard hostel
description: $6 a night for a dorm, small kitchen and swimming pool, pool table and bar. Bathrooms are ok and dorms are relatively spacious

name: Pedro's Rancho / the Boom Hostel
description: We were able to camp here in our camper for $5pp with clean flush toilets, wifi and outdoor showers. Pedro and his family are super friendly. Several cabañas to rent and 2 more being built. Restaurant on site which we didn't try. Cabañas looked really nice with private patio and hammock, but didn't ask how much. 10ish minute walk to the beach. Electrical was available for extra charge but we didn't need it.

name: El Pital
description: Absolutely beautiful place to chill out for a few hours. Chocolate balls are delicious but 240 cordovas!

name: Next to an baseball field
description: We spend one night here after the Masaya night tour. Parkinglot next to a baseball field next to the dinosaur parque. Public toilettes for 5 cordobas. Quit at night.

name: Hostal Familiar Báez
description:
Well located family run hostal, close to downtown.
You can also purchase meals for extra cost, or find a tour around.
Secure parking for motorcycle, we fit a Harley in the living room.
No parking for a vehicle right in the house, but half block away there is a facility for 1 dollar a night.
You can phone 505 82338179 Patricia Baez, only Spanish spoken and a bit of French. You can also find them on Facebook.

name: Bananoz Surf House
description: If you are looking for a nice Hostel at one of the two Surfbeaches, with opportunity to park your car/small van, then this might be your place. The Hostel is owened by a frensh couple (Camillo and family) who know many people around. They organized that we could stay at the neighboors place with our small camper for 100Cob including electricity. At the Hostel we could use the bathrooms, store our surfboard and hang around. Paid 5USD a day. You could also rent surfboards, buy wax and smaller stuff. They also serve good breakfast for 3USD and lunch for 5USD. We liked it here, especially because it was a bit away from the two other crowded hostels and the "main" beach.

name: Cruz roja
description: Big campground in the center of Tipitapa. 40cordobas for the night. We storage our RV one month for 1000pesos.

name: Hotelito Oasis
description: Hostal with private rooms for two people for $25, dorms for $8pp. Right on the beach. Restaurant onsite, cold beers, breakfast/lunch/dinner. Let me park inside the gate from 8:30pm to 8:30am. Only room to park 1 SUV/Van. No camping available. Quiet location near 2 surf breaks.

name: Hotel California
description: We checked out all the other hotels first. Because of the heat we wanted a room with climat. This was the best price (the rooms looked all the same anyway ;)) (30 per room with breakfast). Good parking. Clean & quiet.

name: motozone esteli
description: Moto repair shop. Owner is very helpful and speaks great english. wide variety of parts can be ordered. Owner also knows lots about the area and has many contacts in central/south America if you need anything.

name: Miscellaneous Mi Señor
description: A little shop where they sell Garrafones.

name: Paddy’s Hostel
description: Parked around the corner at the fire station and took a room for under ten dollars each.  Awesome place.  Super clean and friendly staff.  Definitely make it a stop on your way through beautiful Grenada.

name: MM Recreativo
description: That’s ok, with ac and fan very small the room with the bathroom just separete by a courtain. No wifi. Pool. And a little restaurant inside. 400c for two persons. Very far for the main road.

name: Pizzeria la veccia
description: Delicious thin crust wood fired pizzas for a reasonable price, lots of toppings to choose from

name: Las Vacaciones
description: Nice hostel, Dorms $8 pp. Room with private bath 24 incl. tax, shared bath 20 a night. Not a party place though still mostly younger people. Breakfast included, quiet all the time. Laundry service, good, free WiFi. No parking, but there is a parking not far, 3 blocks down the road, for 30 Cordoba a day. Staff speaks Spanish and English, one of them even German. Close to Center and Supermarket, they have a Kitchen and fridge you can use.

name: River Beach Camp
description: End of the road river camp in a quiet flat spot with hard sand. We made it there slowly in our rwd sprinter. Lots of shade all day long. It is a road for some people to cross to their homes on the other side of the river. We were there in dry season, not sure about wet season conditions. beautiful beaches with empty tide pools perfect for swimming. There were stray dogs and cows passing often as well as motos. No problems with safety but locals did warn us of recent break ins on the other side of town. Feels like tourism is just getting there as there are some hostals and bars and expats starting to emerge. Best sleep we've gotten in Nica. Watch out for ants though... They bite quick. Mosquitos present but not that bad.

name: Big Truck Stop / Restaurante "Parqueo DIXAS"
description: Very large secured / fenced gravel parking lot. Features primitive toilet and shower  (cold) as well as restaurant / bar. Payed 1USD for the night. Suprisingly quiet during the night, trucks leave early in the morning.

name: Unknown
description: It’s a restaurant that they can’t be bothered to open most of the time with lots of space for camping, doesn’t appear to have a name. The woman who runs it is a crazy b****. She has grabbed my arm to drag me into the kitchen to point at a dirty dish that wasn’t ours and generally tells you off a few times a day for random things that are either irrelevant or nothing to do with you. She stole my friends hammock over a dispute about a broken blender that was so old it just fell apart. We camped for $3 per person which is great but there are other places around for the same price. The owner is incredibly difficult to deal with and I would not recommend!

name: la colonia
description: La Colonia - great supermarket for all sorts.  pricey though

name: parqeo
description: secure off street parking. just next to casa San Miguel. $1 from 7pm till 11.30am. gate was closed when we came back from the volcano but the señor happily opened up when we knocked.

name: Javier’s family home and beach
description: Javier and his family let us park and camp on his lot.  Right on the water and even got to use kitchen and toilets.  Such a beautiful family. Will be back on the way north for sure. Other future travelers are definitely welcome to stay.

name: checkpoint
description: don't go this way to penas blancas as military checkpoint won't let you through.  Google maps suggests it as the route from la Flor.  think it's military lands!

name: Papagayo
description: A comfy place, clean, on side to the lake and cheap!, $5dls per person on an private room, bathroom is outside is ok. Is difficult to arrive, you have to walk through a path of trees, until the lake, if is night is scary for the darkness, but we arrive at 9pm and nothing happen. We are cyclotravellers so we don’t have problems to arrive,  no car can arrive here. (The place will change of ubication to the center of the Moyogalpa near gas station.)

name: Turtle Hatchery
description:
Scott, a really awesome human, when he came to live here, while he was rescuing all the dogs as he could, he realized that the locals were picking up all the turtle eggs for money, so the way he found to prevent this culture trade and considerable decline of the turtles was to buy the eggs back from the community. If money is the problem then he decided to buy them and also help the community. 

If you want to have an incredible experience volunteering at sanctuary turtle rescue program helping turtles come into the world with your own hands - because it is part of the rescuing protocol, otherwise they would not be saved, and release them in the sand to make their walk to life through the sand, and then contemplate this unique scenario, you shouldn’t miss this place!! If in the season they release every single day between 200-500 baby turtles. Just keep in mind that the opening of the eggs happens around 1:00pm and the turtles sand release around 5:00pm. Check also with Rachel or Matt from Salt Escapes Lodge if it is the right season. https://www.saltescapesnicaragua.com/ 

Scott allowed me to park on his property for free right on the beach. Not easy to drive here, not at all! you must really enjoy driving on dirt roads, but it’s worth it! 

To get here from Managua: Drive north towards Leon turn left onto Camino Salinas Grandes about 25 km from Leon or about 7 -10 mins after the highways meet there is an antenna with a movie star logo on the north west corner. Take the road until there is a fork in the road and then stay right. Continue until just after the cemetery on your left , you will see a road called “Los lirios”. Go left onto that and follow till the clearing. Follow the playa Tesoro signs until you reach the blue wall, then go left. The sanctuary is at the house where the wall ends - Tundra Propriety. (DO NOT FOLLOW GOOGLE MAPS - it will take you to a road that actually it is not correct.

If you do not want to drive through that really tough “Los Lirios” dirt road, another option is to park at Casa de Rigo Sampson and next day you can walk along the sand to the sanctuary, shouldn’t be that far.

Enjoy it!

name: Mirador Volcan San Cristobal
description: Great view of the Volcano and hiking is available also horse ride to top 6 or 4 hours

name: Centro turístico Volcán San Cristobal
description: Cabins 10$ per person 5$ to camp. Hiking or horse ride available to volcano crater. You can call Sr. Fred Fonseca 78711053. We not stay overnight but posible and close to main road an if you combine with the visit to Ron Flor de Caña.

name: Bomberos Rivas
description: It’s a big building. As cyclotravellers was perfect for camp in the second floor. With bathroom. For Vans or RV I think is not so possible.

name: GM Granada
description: Great little Hostel with pool and bar . Good Kitchen facilities, friendly, helpful staff.  $ 20. US for private room shared bath, $7 more for AC. Free pool table. Dorm Rooms are cheaper. Tidy and clean!  Parking for motorcycle or small car in gate, bigger vehicles park on street .

name: Volcán Cosiguina
description: A large gravel highway is in the end stages of being built, and it's a perfectly nice drive to this point. The road widens into a parking area right across from the trailhead. Trail is basically unmarked, it's not maintained and looks like a slightly overgrown foot path. Very easy hike, about an hour to the top. There's a camping site halfway up, which is marked but seems unmaintained. We stayed in our vehicle in the parking along the main road and went undisturbed, expect for a bit of noise from a tour bus that arrived around 6am

name: Mechanic
description: Good mechanic, who change differents parts quickly for a good price ( 35 $ )

name: Hotel Panamericano
description: Scouted out a few mediocre places nearby and was quite impressed when I found this place. $10 USD per person, per night. They have a pleasant garden, rocking chairs, art, and can help organize canyon tours. They offer $3 breakfast, have wifi, cold showers, and several secure parking spots. Would definitely recommend.

name: Cool Place/ formally Dale Daggers
description: Nice clean place with mini super on site. Dorms, private rooms etc. right on beach . We came on a motorcycle, but looks like overnighting in rig is possible . Big rigs can fit. We had a very nice second level private room with balcony and outdoor kitchen, with refrigerator. 40$ us per night. other rooms are cheaper. One of the nicer rooms we have had on our journey. Nice beach with plenty of pangas to buy fish and lobster from on beach. Good surf near by in season.

name: Playa Tamarindo
description: Nice little spot on lake before crossing to CR

name: Budget hostel la Mexicana
description: Great place for budget travellers. 15usd for a double room with shared bathroom and kitchen access. Location is really good, within walking distance to central plaza etc. The owner is very friendly and nice. There is also a Mexican restaurant but we didnt try it. Wifi is good and fast. You can park your car At a parking lot nearby for 100c per day or a bit further at red cross parking lot for 50c per day as we did. They will surely let you take your bike inside. It isnt the prettiest place in town but for us it was a really good value for money.

name: Malecon San Carlos
description: Parking in front of the lake. Just near the information center. 100m of the main bars and restaurants. Safe

name: Gas station - San Ramon
description: Free parking behind the gas station. Police station at 20m. Square very close.

name: Entrance to Cerro Negro
description: this is the entrance to the sandboard volcano

name: (I don’t know the name)
description: The Santa Cruz hotel was full, so the lady refeer us to this hotel. ( at about 30 meters from there) It was very late so we didn’t have the choice. Rooms are OK, not the cleanest but for 1 night it’s good, no showers (bucket), there is a shared bathroom. No a/c but there are fans. Simple bed, 2 in each rooms. It was 200c per person. Very safe parking with gate lock.

name: Hostel Salina
description: Very nice Hostel, nice pool, nice common aera with long chair and sofa, upstaire there is a bar and they make food, we paid 20$ per person in a dorm, but it was very clean, lots of people, hammoc... there is a guard in the parking during the night (and day too i think) good vibe, shuttle every day to the city and to the beach... wifi is the best i had in central america and suprisigly : HOT water in showers...

name: Smiles Coffee Calle Real
description:
cafe restaurant held by mute and deaf people. 
you choose out of photos the food you want to eat. 
not the best cuisine ever, but definitely a nice place to have a coffee or a juice. 

Smiles Coffee Calle Real Xalteva, junto Hotel Real Merced, Granada 43000, Nicaragua +505 8559 8315

name: El Peru - Camping in Restaurant/Bar Parking Lot
description: We parked on the big flat parking lot in front of the beach/river facing the volcano and with the other volcano behind us. You can take kayak tours too. We asked the owner Meel (?) to park our vehicle and he was very welcoming. We had a drink at the bar with Meel and asked if we can use the toilet and shower for the night which he gladly let us. Beautiful spot, didn't pay anything, good swimming spot! No wifi, lots of dogs around - Sasha the guard dog for security, and chickens.

name: La Casa de la Pradera
description: Had decent dinner here while staying at Casa San Jose next door. The place also offers rooms and secure parking. No info in hotel/hostal amenities. The restaurant is nice and clean with good wifi.

name: Matagalpa downtown
description: In the street, close to the cathedral and in front of Budget Rent. Security all the nigth. Not too noisy. Internet available: use Mokali cafe.

name: Suzuki
description: Motorcycle shop. Repairs and parts. These guys are great

name: Finca Forestal San Nicolás
description: Beautiful camping area amongst pine trees. Park on grass. A few palapas and fire cooking areas. One sink with running water. Bathrooms with paper but no seats. Cold showers. Short hiking trails. Just up the road is Don Alfonso Agua Termales. Paid $3.00usd per person.  Price now $10us or $325 Nicaraguan.

name: Termales Delia
description: Warm water swimming pools. Palapas. Restaurant. Paid 50c per person to swim and stay the night. Expected to buy a meal. We bought breakfast for 60c per person. Friendly people. Quiet night once the music went off.

name: Tourist info
description:
cigars factory that we could visit for free if you buy cigar.
you can get one for 3 dollars eacg

name: Museo de Historia y Arqueológia
description:
A small museum with information about the history of this area. $20C per person. 
Free WiFi in the park. A nice play area for kids. A big library. The stadium is across the street. Very nice area.

name: Café Las Flores (coffee production)
description:
This is a coffee production located in a really nice place. 
You need to park at the entrance and you will go to the production with a collective truck because the road is steep.
This is a guided tour of 1 hour when you see all the production process. Best season to visit is between November to January because it's the coffee picking and you will see the real process. Still really nice if you are not in those months. Everything is organic and sustainable and they show you why. About 14$ per person.

name: Parking for El Jalacate
description: Parking area for El Jalacate. Enter green gate. There are no signs or info. Follow “road” down hill. Pass through second green gate. Then watch for signs.

name: Puerto Las Brisas (Muelle San Jose del Sur)
description:
Other ferry option from San Jorge - Ometepe - San Jorge
Ferry "El Rey de Cocibolca"

Ferry schedule
San Jorge to Ometepe
09:30am
17:00pm

Ometepe to San Jorge
07:30am
15:00pm

We pay C$ 470 for our Land Rover Defender 110 + C$ 50pp. On the weekend recomended reserve.

I think is posible overnight there If you go to San Jorge at 07:30am.

From San Jorge to Ometepe (Moyogalpa) we pay C$ 500 + C$ 82,50 port fee + C$ 50pp on ferry Che Guevara (San Jorge to Moyogalpa).

name: Police control
description: They stopped us and tell us that we were in infraction because we drove on the left lane, but everybody did. So we explained that if we were in infraction, they have to stop every car, but then they let us go ... by the way, they checked our insurance that we took in Guatemala for Central America, and said it was perfect.

name: El Puerto
description: Best place to stay in San Juan del Sur. We looked in every place in the town to park our 24 ft RV but everything was too expensive and parking was at the street. This is the new harbour, and you have electricity, bathrooms (no shower), water and security 24 hrs for just 14 US.

name: Pietra magnifica, petroglifos
description: Pertoglific, some trails from the finca bring you to different site where you can admire petroglyphs

name: El buon ambiente
description:
Very good restaurant to stop before undertaking the Aduana mission!
Super clean, good food with a few vegetarian options! 
Clean toilets

name: Panadería Alemana
description:
Hidden treasure for all those who want more choices for bread/pastery than the usual you get. 
Price range is fair, might be a little bit more than what local bakeries (if you find one) take. But in return you get for example delicious, fresh croissants with ham and creme cheese for 50 Cordoba ($1,50/1,30€ at the moment). Considering that cheese and ham is quite expensive all over Central America (at least from my experience in supermarkets), decent price. Also offer bread, sweet pastery and what do I know - my eyes were glued to this croissant.

name: Managua
description: Behind the Uno station, electricity at the foot of a pole as soon as night falls. wifi from the supermarket of the station. Super nice employees. decent bathroom.

name: Odoyo Hostel
description:
We slept there with our van for 10$ a night. Space for one car only. Or outside. (safe area)
You can sleep there fore 20$ pp pn. the best deal in town!!! No sign so to find it. go in front of miramar surf camp and that's the 2 house on the left.
Aloha
Enjoy your travel!

name: Parking lot. 30 Cordobas/day
description: Gated parking lot. 30 Cordobas per day. Big black metal gate. Guarded. Sign say closed from 12 to 2 pm. NO CAMPING. ***Actual gate is across from gps dot on iOverlander map***. There is a monthly parking price.

name: Old gate to volcano
description: Opposite old stone guard booth. Flat area for a 4x4 or two. Tent camping possible. Nice breeze. Free.

name: Ruamoko Hostel
description:
New Hostel near the beach. Dorms and camping space only. Private rooms not built yet. 

Good: Fully enclosed and secure. Big rigs no problem. Plenty of tent space. No A/C
No community kitchen, but they offer a group dinner for $6 ($5 for vegetarian)
Breakfast $4
Lunch $4 - 6
Dorms $12
Camping $5

Bad: Nothing yet. It's a party hostel. so it's it's not your thing....

name: beach point
description: in the end of the road, no people , quiet at night.

name: Badaboom Hostal & Surf
description: Great spot for both backpackers and overlanders alike. Cedric, the owner (speaks Spanish, French and English) allowed me to park my van under a large palapa giving me shade all day long $5USD per night. He provided me with electricity, good wifi that reached the van from the hostel and he allowed my dog to stay as well. They have a great bar and restaurant and are a 10 minute walk from The Boom. Really great surf spot. Highly recommended.

name: Museo precolombino de Chaguitillo
description: A small museum of precolumbian artifacts! Can also leave from here on a tour to the carvings.

name: Carne Asado Chayito
description: Great hot plate bbq joint. Fair prices. The beef tongue is great! Parking out front on street w/security.

name: Ingeniería Celular - Mario Trujillo
description:
Repair of computers, cell phones, and camera, go pro, drones etc. Very good price. Very good service. Repaired my track pad in one day!
WhatsApp-  +50588321692
Many men will try to get you- only find Mario.

name: Iniser Seguro
description:
In case you missed the car insurance at the border, you can get one here.
12 USD for 1 month. 1 month is minimum.
Car insurance is mandatory in Nicaragua.

name: Katy’s Hotel
description: Basic Hotel. Clean rooms with cold shower, toilet and sink. No AC but two fans in the room. There is lots of secure parking inside. There is room for big rigs in the parking area, but there may be an issue with height getting into the gate. Maybe 2.5 - 3 meters. Bar/Restaurant in the front of the Hotel with cheap drinks and Good food. Room cost 300 Córdoba for the night. Average meal is 150 Córdoba. Decent wifi works everywhere.

name: Water - blue doors
description:
You can buy the big 5 gallon jugs of water here. It was 126 C for 2 them. 

You don't have to pay for the bottle (carafon) if you bring it back right away. 

They were open when we arrived at 7:45 am on a Saturday

name: Sand Flats near Playa Santana
description: Leveled spot on the sand flats near Playa Santana. No 4x4 needed. Only some motorbikes passing by in the evening and morning, other than that really quiet. Cool breeze in the evening, so not too many mosquitoes.  5 minutes walking to the beach.

name: Finca La Canavalia
description:
This is a cooperative eco-friendly farm from the community. They basically have everything: cacao, coffee, bananas, cattle, pigs, sheep...
We were recommended this place by a local. They  make a great tour around their Farm and explain you everything. It costs 100 cordobas per person.
They also asked us if we want to stay the night. we did not, so not sure about the price. They also offer food and some rooms.

This place is off the tourist grid and really nice and local. And the best thing: There are many sloths on the premises!!

We highly recommend this place!

name: Central Park w/ wifi
description: Central Park with free wifi. A little church too. Play structure for kids.

name: vulcanizadora (tires repair)
description: We had an issue with one tire of my f250 truck camper . got fixed and backup tire set in truck. good job. fair price

name: Pali Supermarket
description: Supermarket with clean bathrooms and t.p.

name: Congo beach
description:
Beautiful spot on the side of the road. Beach entrance to the lake, level-spot, some shade under wonderful trees and if you're lucky, pigs, dogs and monkeys will visit you during the day. 
And amazing sunset!

name: Taller Mechanic, Luis
description:
Asked a guy along the Panamerican for a mechanic because we were overheating since Honduras. He drove me over to this place where a mechanic came out and said he'd come by our hotel (Panamericano) to check things out. His name is Luis. I have his friend Gabriel's number for WhatsApp 50587301159. Did some diagnostics, added some coolant, went for a drive. Then we returned to this shop where they took out the radiator, drove it 30 km away to another town where it got cleaned (and they epoxied a hole), and returned and reinstalled it. Seemed professional and patient with my horrible Spanish. Gave us the number of a friend in Managua if we wanted to get a new/used radiator and told us to call him back if on our way to Esteli we broke down. A lot of guys in the shop but we left our van there all day and no issues. Cost for spending all day doing this was 2000C - seemed pretty cheap.
He's a Honda buff.

name: La vieja Managua
description: One of the first places in Central America that we are surprised by its deliciousness. we all know central american food is not great but this place is an exception. you pay for it (~$8-15) but it is worth the gastronomic satisfaction. Nothing incredibly fancy but good service and very good meats.

name: Hostal Colibrí
description:
Good hostel close to the cathedral and city center.

They offer dorms for 8 usd and rooms with shared bathroom for 22/23 usd (breakfast included)

They also offers laundry service for 6 usd, drinkable water and kitchen if you want to cook.

Moreover, they offers outdoor activities through a travel agency.

The place is quite clean and the space make you feel comfortable, also they have a small and beautiful garden where you can rest from the warm day (pay attention because you might can see hummingbirds)

name: Casa Huesped Vic-Pal
description:
Cheap place in Matagalpa, for 250 cordobas you have a private room with shared bathroom and 400 córdobas with private bathroom.

They also have dorms but I don't know they exact price.

They offers breakfast for 70 cordobas.

The place is quite clean and comfortable, perfect for backpackers.

name: La Vita e Bella
description: Delicious pizza and pasta in the cozy restaurant. Street parking available.

name: Naked Tiger hostel
description:
it s cheap during the week ($10) but goes up during weekend. Sunday is party day so it's wild. this is a party hostel with good facilities but no kitchen. showers were Coldish. 2 big dogs. plenty of parking. just kind of a bumpy road to go up. 
if you don't like party hostels, this isn't for you.

name: El Parqueo de Teresa
description: In the middle of the Bay, much quieter than Popoyo, Less than tourists here and especially less expensive. Small parking on the edge of the beach. Unpretentious in the heart of a fishing village. Field padlocked in the evening, no worries of insecurity for us. Family Teresa organizes trips at sea for surfing and fishing. there is a tap freshwater and shower outside (with moderation, lack of water here). It is possible to buy fresh fish with the fishermen when they return from fishing in the morning. Price for a night on this simple parking 100 cordobas after negotiation with the owners.

name: Hotel Internacional
description:
One room with one/two beds and shared bathroom for 200 Cordobas and private room with private bathroom for 300 Cordobas.

The normal room was unclean and the shared bathroom was also the same, besides the smell of cigarettes and not comfortable bed.

But the private room was quite clean and pretty good so I suggest to the travelers to spend 100 cordobas more and get a good room (If you feel that you want to get quality and comfortable bed)

name: Museo de Leyendas y Tradiciones
description: A clever museum combining some history, folklore and prison information. Housed in a prison known for torture it has displays and information in English and Spanish. $50C per person. Well worth the time.

name: Rivas plaza
description:
Ok to stay here , safe . Closed to basketball ground , a parking front of pkayground. A lot of restaurants , fast wifi in the park , water and WC.
Cool free place . Ok for our big 24 feet RV

name: Apoyo Lodge
description: We stayed here for Easter - yoga vegan retreat by the lake. Free yoga class So in morning at 7pm and delicious vegetarian food for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Run by a spanish couple. Great company with mostly young professionals needing time out - 20-40 year olds guests. Only downside is the road here - don’t attempt unless you have a 4v4. The roads are more like rough rocky beach tracks with tire puncher stones and pot holes! Also tiny width roads and trees so can have issues with high clearance if over 7feet high and traffic jams when cars try to pass. Beautiful part of the world otherwise!

name: Hotel el Pantano
description:
ADMIN NOTE: please be aware that this place has been submitted by a stakeholder of the place.

Hotel  el Pantano offers clean and comfortable rooms for individual travelers, families and groups.

We are not the “standard” Nicaraguan hotel because our location in a green area of 8.7 acres  just at the edge of town makes you feel being in nature itself!

But it’s not “exclusively rooms and food” we strive to offer you, we also care for your complete holiday experience! We know that you want to get to know the area, the people and the most interesting places to visit. That’s why we included a section called “Places To Visit” for you to plan and decide what to do during your stay with us. And if you need some help with information or arrangements you can count on our staff to help you as best as we can!

name: Managua International Airport
description: Here's the deal for flying out of this airport and leaving your vehicle long term.  The airport charges 150 cordobas per night to park.  Parking is directly in front of the airport.  Completely hassle free although Tuesdays and Thursdays the parking lot closes at 1030pm (if you fly in after that suspect you can just sleep in the camper).  All other days it closes at 2am.  Opens at 5am.  We are not sure if they would hassle you to actually sleep in your camper in the lot so we slept at an Puma gas station just down the road with a truck stop area at the back (bring earplugs).
