description: Takes about an hour to walk around, plus whatever time you spend in the butterfly House. We saw monkeys on our walk, the butterflies are amazing and you can swim in the lake. 5 usd per person, we asked to park here overnight and told to ask in the adjoining hotel - they said no.

name: Parqueo Bonanza
description: A really huge parking area with a restaurant where you can sleep securely. After/before the border. Just 30 cordobas with electricity!!!!! Free for tents.

name: Queso La Garnacha
description:
Cow and goat cheese made with swiss techinque only to be found here and in Costa Rica, San Gerado de Rivas.

Since eating the cheese in Costa Rica i was most eccited to finally visit la Granacha in Nicaragua.

A Spanish restaurant in Managua buys their cheese.

At the moment they process 100l of milk/day to produce 20lbs Tilsit cheese which according to Pablo (Manager of the cheese association, you find him at the Comedor) is the one which lasts the longest without going bad.

160c$/lb Tilsit cow cheese
260c$/lb Tilsit goat cheese
Costa Rica is more pricey and also thecheese costs about twice as much there. But you get a bigger selection of cheese, yoghurt, Mozarella, cream cheese etc.

Local coffee, teas and lettuce sold hete too.

160c$/lb

name: Near Chapel
description:
Large flat grassy area  between road and chapel. Better wind protection then soccer field at the town's entrance.

Calm and relaxed. Only people entering are young kids for some playing.Townies very respectful and do treat lone woman well in comparison to most places in Nicaragua where men do consider lone women as prey.

Left our table with kitchen utensils out while walking the little hikes. Nothing was taken.

Walk to the end of town for toilet and sink (marked on iOverlander as 'La Garnacha')  in the Comedor/restaurant for 6c$.

Slightly windy at dusk or before rain. Wind seems to come predomantly from the road to the chapel so park your home accordingly.

name: Centro Recreativo Villa Verde
description:
Big pool and restaurant. You get to park and camp behind the pool on the soccer field. In rainy season the grass needs to recover so only camping on the parking lot in front or narrow stretch next to the soccer field.

Has kids pool and lots of tables under shade.

Had the place nearly to ourself. No boom boom music. Were told that on weekends especially in dry season it gets crowded.
Watchmen and administrator sleep on permises.

Outdoor shower
Water toilets
Drinking water
Restaurant

2 people in one van negotiated down from 500c$ to 300c$ + 2×70c$ for breakfast and consumption of drinks 


Much much better option to Hotel Estelimar. Their pools are empty. No shower, no upkeep and dirty toilets.

Villa Verde spot a bit further up north coul refer to this one here.

name: Miscelánea Castillo
description: Nice tienda which also changes small (so called barbecue) gas bottles with 20lbs. Not the best bottle quality but better than a ride to Rivas.

name: Moto Zone Accessoires & Repuestos
description:
Kawasaki, Honda, Yamaha, Suzuki, Indian, Harley Davidson. or Other Brands.

Call. Mikel 85118606
Facebook: MOTO ZONE ESTELI

name: Hotel Primavera
description: Lovely Hotel 5 mins walk from the produce market.Very clean.Space for bicycle.Friendly women.Cheap only 150 Cordobas for single room.No fan but no problem cos' it's not hot here.Free water.

name: Mirador Los Volcanes
description: Awesome little restaurant with great food, cold beer and stunning views of Lago Nicaragua and Volcano Madera. Moises is very helpful, and speaks a little English. Sit on the reclining chairs and just soak up the view!

name: Buena Onda Beach Resort
description:
a great place to stay along the beach, with a swimming pool.
Very friendly and helpful owners
Very quiet and clean

name: Next to Katranica Asados building
description:
We asked to the police at the port gate for a safe place to spend the night and they brought us here, talked to the guards and guaranteed us that this is a very safe place. The restaurant seems not working, now is used for the guards as operations base, they are here 24/7. Guards and police were making rounds all night long. Gave access to the bathrooms and offered water to fill the tanks. Next morning some of them came to thank us for visiting their country, very friendly.
There is a tree for shade.
You can leave your vehicle safe here and walk to near nice places as the malecón, Luis Alfonso Velazquez Park, Revolution Square, etc. 

----------

Preguntamos a la policía en la puerta del puerto por un lugar seguro para pasar la noche y nos trajeron aquí, hablaron con los guardias y nos garantizaron que este es un lugar muy seguro. El restaurante parece no funcionar, ahora se usa como base de operaciones de los guardias, están 24/7. Los guardias y la policía hicieron rondas toda la noche. Nos dieron acceso a los baños y ofrecieron agua para llenar los tanques.  A la mañana siguiente, algunos de ellos vinieron a agradecernos por visitar su país, muy amables.
Hay un árbol que da buena sombra.
Podes dejar el vehículo aquí seguro e ir caminando a lindos lugares cercanos como el malecón, el parque Luis Alfonso Velásquez, la Plaza de la Revolución, etc.

name: Campuzano Swimming Hole
description:
Nice place to spend the day. Swimming hole with water from natural source. The place has 22 natural water sources, they only use 2 of them.
Small fish can be a bit annoying, a good option is to swim with a shirt. 
Entrance 30cord or 1usd, you can camp in your vehicle for 50cord (80cord whole day). Also can rent the cabins next to the pool for 100cord.
Bathrooms not too clean. Nice people.

name: La Parrillada
description:
Great local restaurant : choose 1 of 3 meats (grilled chicken or fried chicken or minced meat with veggies); they add a big serving of rice with beans, choose one side (tortilla or grilled banana or banana chips) and they top it with coleslaw, choose your drink (coke, water, juice...) -> you have a big plate with drink for a bit more than 3,5$US :)

Staff really friendly, served super fast and really tasty

name: Repuestos Resadom
description: For all Ford driver, that's the only shop offering spare parts to Ford, or at least that's what all other shops told us. We bought new shocks for 5x the price Amazon tolds us. But if you're desperate... Good luck with your search!

name: La Lancha
description:
Beach front seafoods restaurant.
Lobster, octopus, fish... everything seems to be really fresh. 
200C for the shrimps and 150C for the octopus. Prices are really fair for the food. Portions are not too big but tasty.

name: El Pacifico Hotel
description: It was such a pain to find a nice place to stay in our camper in San Juan that at the end we took a room in the hostel... very dirty room and at night when we wanted to sleep we saw bed bugs and a worm in the bed... so we decided to sleep in our van even if the parking is sloped. The day after we tried to pay and explain them that we didn’t use the room so maybe we can have a price but they didn’t want and it was such a mess because even if its an hotel they didn’t have credit card terminal and we didn’t have cash as we were leaving for costa rica.... so bad experience, this city is not overlander friendly. Unless you sleep at the port, but paying 17,5$ for no services, no thanks !

name: The Beach House
description:
Very nice bar and restaurant on the beach front.
The smoothies and fresh juice are very tasty.
We tried the “empanada de banana y queso” and it was really good - 3 pieces for 3$US during the happy hour.

Staff is very nice, attentive and fast.
The view during the sunset is amazing

name: Hotel Gran Oceano
description:
Nice hotel one street from the beach front.

We stopped here because it is one of the only option with a gated parking in town. Perfect for vans, SUV - medium rigs might fit.

Rooms are quite simple but have A/C and a TV, shower with hot water. Everything quite clean. Breakfast is included (scrambled eggs with ham, 1 piece of toast, butter, rice & beans) 50$US/ night.

Clean nice pool and restaurant onsite (we did not try the restaurant). Wifi is available in the whole hotel and quite fast.

The staff is very friendly and the reception opened 24/7.
 
Perfect location close to the beach, the restaurants, the bars - and 30 min walking to the “Jesus” on the hill.

name: Salinas Grandes
description: Salinas Grandes Day Beach Resort. An amazing beach club with room for 1 RV (for now) and multiple Vans. We had the beach all to ourselves. There is a restaurant and bar open on the weekends. The beach is super clean and the water is crystal clear. Everything is fenced in and safe.

name: SeaTurtleRescue.org
description:
Sea turtle rescue. 
Just few steps after Rancho Tranquilo, walking along the beautiful beach of Jiquilillo, you will find this place, where Dennis (from California, but based in Nicaragua/Arizona) create a please all around turtles. He’s rescuing turtles eggs, make a nest for them to grow peacefully, and as soon as they are big and strong enough he put them into the ocean, giving them a bit more chances to survive. He’s really passionate about it. 
If you would like to see how he works, help him and know more about the project, you can just drive to his place, where he also built a dorm with shared kitchen a toilets, or park your van in the big grass in the back of the house (just few steps from the beach). Prices are 10$ for a bed pp, or to park you van and use toilet is about 5/7$ per car. 
See the business card in the picture, and get in contact with him if you wish. Highly recommend if you want to spend few days in Jiquilillo area.

name: Hostel Los Abuelos
description: A nice family run place on Ometepe Island.  A had a single room with fa. and private bath for only $7.  I stayed here when I arrived in the evening on the ferry. I was able to park my motorcycle off the street in the garden. The room was clean and comfortable.  There are several nice seating areas and a kitchen area.

name: Balneario Campusano
description:
A spa with Camping, has crystal clear blue waters, has fish that clean the dead skin of the body, is a nice place, although you should know that it is popular, you may have by monetos strong music and people drinking, although there are people who place order and are willing to help you. We spent a very quiet night, there are many mosquitoes, has bathrooms and you can arm shop and park in the parking lot, you have to look for a flat place.

----------- Spanish Version --------------

un balneario, tiene piletas de aguas azules cristalinas, tiene peces que limpian la piel muerta del cuerpo, es un lugar agradable, aunque debes saber que es popular, puede que tenga por monentos música fuerte y gente bebiendo, aunque hay gente que pone orden y están dispuestos a ayudarte. pasamos una noche muy tranquila, hay muchos mosquitos, tiene baños y puedes armar tienda y estacionas en el parqueadero, tienes que buscar un lugar plano.

name: Cruz Roja Nagarote
description:
Very kind people in the Cruz Roja
Let me put my tent. I’m a bicycle traveler but they would have more than enough space for cars also.
Toilet, shower, internet and electricity

name: Rancho Hermanos Carrión
description:
This is a perfect restaurant for sunsets, the owners are incredible. You can eat a plate with fish, fried banana and rice from 100c depending the side of the fish and the fish, you can eat also meet, the special plate is lobster with garlic (langosta al ajillo), beer is 35c. Also you can sleep in the car for 100c. There is a person looking the restaurant at night. Very quiet! 

Es un restaurante perfecto para ver la puesta de sol, los propietarios son una familia increíble. Puedes comer un plato de pescado con arroz ensalada y plátano frito desde 100c depende del tamaño y el tipo del pescado, la especialidad de la casa es la langosta al ajillo(nosotros lo comimos esta buenísimo) y también puedes comer platos de carne. La cerveza vale 35c. También puedes dormir por 100c, tienen seguridad toda la noche. Es muy tranquilo!

name: centro diagnostico veterinario las colonias sur
description: The first really good vet we've found in Central America! Really knows what he's doing, has a Lab to do Analysis like Heartworm, Erlichiosa etc directly. Pricy but worth it!

name: Machete market café
description: Really nice place! We went there for Friday Pizza Night, and the pizza was amazing (I’m Italian! It was the best pizza I had in Central America, no doubts). They let us sleep for free in their big secured parking lot, under a tree. Nice staff and good service.

name: panoramic route, depart. nueva segovia
description: beautyful. panoramic route from Ocotal - Santa Clara - Susucayán - short before Quilalí turn right to San Juan - Palacagüina. Mostly best street.

name: Morries Surfshop and Surfclasses
description:
Morrie is an extremely cool and very nice guy from New Zealand who rents out good quality boards and gives surflessons too.
Boards are at 8$/24hours.

name: 24 hours security parking lot
description: just walked by and saw this, secure parking for vehicles 24 hour

name: tire repair
description: we were brought here by a mechanic that is listed closeby. they repaired our ripped tire for 700C in 30 minutes.

name: Baho Vilma
description:
for 120C we had a nice lunch here called baho. it's slow cooked beef with yuca, plantain, cole and pickled onions served on a banana leaf. really tasty!
it's just a stall outside of the mercado, you can sit outside in the shade. 
note: we were looking for a bamboo mat and were sent to this part of the market by the guy from the parking lot close by that is marked on overlander.
here it's more authentic and cheaper than at the mercado artesanal turistico that is listed on overlander, too. over there you will find a baho vilma also as we saw later when we checked it out.

name: Las Cabañas Encantadas de Nindiri
description:
we just wanted to see the volcano at night and be on our way the next morning so we asked if we could camp on their parking lot  for the night. they said yes and their parking lot turned out to be more beautiful than some actual campsites, grassy, with a swing and lots of green and a magnificent view over lago masaya when you park in the far right back!
they didn't ask for any charge and even gave us the wifi password, the wifi reaches the huge tree you will camp next to. 
no further facilities. 
downside is the loud noise from the road. the view and the surrounding makes up for that, especially if you sleep inside your car and if it's only for the night that you want to drive up to the volcano. 
for us this was the best option around masaya!

name: quesillos bendicion de jehova
description:
Nice stop for a tortilla con cuchada and a spiced cold cacao! we had breakfast with drinks for two for 3$. very friendly people!
you can also buy fresh milk here if you bring a bottle.

update: still dreaming of that cacao.

name: Hotel Bahia
description:
$30 for two ,RV , within breakfast!
Parked by the beautiful pool!
Very good place!
Close to the beach

name: Freddy Salgado
description: Specialist in VW. Very friendly with a nice family. He just repaired our plug. You can sleep there! They have two T2.

name: street to the beach - free
description:
Between the melting elefant and the barrel we spent a couple of nights in our van. nobody seemed to care. many places with toilet or shower around. light in the night, a bit annoying, but making it maybe safer. 
tents could be put just on the beach i guess. place enough for two vans maybe.

name: Las Palmeras
description:
Stayeid here for 5 nights!
Perfect place to relaxed before going to Honduras!15 min to Leon!
Safe and quiet place.
Paid $40 per night.
Clean with AC rooms!
Owner Tim(American) is very helpful and friendly person!
They also except Overlanderes!

name: Hostal María
description: A very nice hostal with simple private double room, fan, very fresh shower, towels, toilet plus seat with paper from $10. There should be a dorm but did not look for it. Also really good food (breakfast, lunch and dinner) and fresh fruit drinks, high variety of dishes for reasonable prices. Comedor Maria. Also guests from surrounding hostals come to eat here. Wi-Fi fast in restaurant. Friendly people.

name: Don D’erick pizza y buffets
description: Great spot! Damn good food, all you can eat, we had shrimp, fish, chicken, with salads and rice. Really well prepared! 140 cordobas per person, come with drinks and chill music

name: Paralel road to the Panamerican Highway
description:
Spot where you can park your rig 150 meters away from the Highway, on a paralel dirt road. Close by there is a private property, quite large so we had privacy and so did they. 
The area is quiet since there are no other houses, place gets a lot of wind and breeze, making it cool to sleep at night and even during the day. This was the best part, far from noise and cool to sleep. 
There are no amenities whatsoever, just a wild spot to rest for a few hours. 
There is fauna around: wild rabbits, birds in the morning of course and the dogs from the property close-by.

name: Spot with great view and windy
description:
This is a spot with great views over the mountains and a lot of wind. No houses around, 50 meters away from the main road. 
Easy to park if driving a high clearance vehicle. 
Good to rest for a few hours due to the breezy air.

name: No end road, away from main street
description:
This is a side road next to Hostal Caracolito. It’s quiet, free, no one bothered us. There are some houses around, but not next to our parking spot.
Best thing is that it’s free. Easily accesible for cars, for large vans might be a bit tricky. Check it out.

name: Rancho Ochomoguito
description:
A big open gravel parking lot. Mostly for trucks. At night ( after 10 p.m.) quite and safe with guard.
On the road is a restaurant with baños and showers (free).
Wifi is fine.
Parking for free.

We stayed 10 night with a damaged clutch. The owner Denis is very helpful.

name: Veterinaria Clinica
description:
Dr. Marcio Ruiz Silva. health certificada, you will need this, if you are staying longer then 72 hours in Nicaragua for the CETREX-Form /IPSA

Very friendly staff, no English speakers.

name: Ozomahtli Hostel
description: Amazing hostel in inner heart of Ometepe. Amazing place, front of the beach and really charm people. Best place ever to stay.

name: Casa Verde
description:
Casa Verde works with kids to help them to grow and develop new abilities. It helps them to have a better life without crime and drugs.

The place is not for camping, it is a house with volunteers and they do a lot of recycling. We talked with the manager and they said it's okay to camp for a few days and the price is: The money you want to give will be okay.

Good place with wifi, kitchen, in front of the ocean, water and bathrooms. I think it is an amazing place because all the money and things you do will help the kids and the organization to work more.

Ask the manager about staying few days :)

name: Reserva Natural La Garnacha
description:
I spent the night with a group of friends and it was okay, there is nothing to worry about dangerous people or someone trying to take your things during the night.

 Private property but you can talk with the owner of the restaurant, he ask us for 25 Cordobas each and there is also access to the water in the school ( Showering is without privacy. You can wash your clothes if you wish).

name: Casa Oro
description:
Huge hostel with about 80 beds. Private rooms and dorms.
We had a private room with AC own bad/shower.
Good wifi.
Own bar/restarant.
Lots of service.
They accepted to stay with our dog in one room.

name: Peluqueria Canina Pelu-Can
description: We found this place to get our dog groomed, they did an exceptional job! I don’t think his ears have ever been so clean! 600C for a large dog, 400C for a small. They also have some medication for sale, flea/tick, worms, etc.

name: Puerto de Granada
description: Broad parking where we left our rv of 24 feet for make one turn of boat very nice of 2 hours on the lake and around of islands. Has the outcome we asked if we could there stay for the night. They we request 100 c for the night. Pregnant closed and kept, night very calm.

name: Monkey's house
description:
Nice hostal run by Juancito and Rudy. 10$ for private rooms, 4$ for dorms. good wifi, cheap and delicious food and good prices for tours on the volcanos around. Juancito also offered me to volunteer on a project he's starting with kids of a less favored neibourghood. He feeds volunteers three meals a day a offers the dorms for 2$ if you do so. Kids were awesome. 

No parking, but plenty of place if you have a bicycle like me or even a motorcycle i believe.

name: Quinta O
description:
Splendid ecological lodge close to the Mombacho volcano. François and Odette built a cilindric house with the idea of being as self sufficient as they could. Fruit trees, gardens, bees, rainwater collectors, compost toilets are one of the main features of the place. Monkeys on the gorgeous trees. Lots of birds and insects. 

Expensive but beautiful :
70$ for the main room
35$ for the Pepino, a small casas with  dome shape. 

Road acces is a definetly narrow and uneven. No room for big rigs, but they host cyclists for free.

name: Dutchy’s Deli
description: Homemade bread and really nice breakfast, lunch and coffees. If you are looking for good bread and cheese, this is the place to be!

name: Attempted robbery
description:
We walked from Aras into Pearl Lagoon at around 6pm as the sun was setting. We should have known better, especially as Raby had asked what time we'd be back and looked concerned (but when directly asked if it was safe to walk, he'd said yes) and a local guide in Awas tried to get us to pay him to walk us, but we refused. 

We were initially followed and approached by a teenager simply demanding 'give me your money'. My boyfriend insisted we had none while I kept walking. He left. 

A few minutes later the same guy came back with his friend and cornered us in on the boardwalk section. They tried to grab my bag, I resisted as it seemed they were not armed, all 4 of us scuffled and I managed to keep hold of the bag by lying on it. At this point another group of people approached and the guys left, and we ran into town. 

We went for dinner anyway assuming we'd find a taxi back after. Struggled to find a taxi but fortunately some friends of the Queen Lobster owner offered us a ride. 

Together with a robbery in Awas too (see entry on there) and some general verbal abuse and bad feelings, we left Pearl Lagoon much sooner than we'd planned. This is the first time in 3 months in Central America we've had any problems. Disappointing as the town is beautiful and has huge potential for tourists, and Raby and his family are amazing.

name: mechanic shop
description: came here because of suspected bad drive shaft. they verified, and replaced the u joint (using parts I had on hand) in 30 minutes. good work. cost 700 Cordoba so very reasonable.

name: Puk's Place
description: ask for the hammock rate which allows you use of facilities and can sleep in vehicle. it was $5/pp. facilities are far from their good days when it was Olas hostal but the price is right, location is beautiful and staff is fun. Thursday-monday place is a party hostel and parking is limited so best during the week. can also consult naked tiger next door for better facilities. very safe up here. very windy for RTT

name: Hotel Puerta Del Cielo
description:
luxury hotel overlooking volcano masaya and the Laguna. posh pool, restaurant, bar, bathrooms and cold showers available. the hotel lives up to its name. rooms are costly ($200+), can book through TripAdvisor or email. it's targeted for couples and less family, quiet luxury.

we were the first overlanders here. due to the political problems, his tourism hasn't picked up so he was happy to let us camp and eat here. $15/pp plus food. very secluded gated hotel so very safe. very flexible check in and check out. we just swam and relaxed most of the day.

name: Public parking for beach
description:
Wonderful spot with motmot and monkeys! FREE!
Ample space: we were 3 rigs of 24ft.
Next door restaurants sell 1l of toña beer for 60cordobas! what else?
Clear, clean and warm water in the lake! 
Quiet in the week.
Tiendita at the end of the road.

name: Parking Lot
description:
Big parking lot, almost new, has faucet, has toilets (clean), great guards, quiet. Our guard even turned off half of parking lot lights to let us sleep better. Close to LaColonia and La Union. Walking distance of center. 50NIO/night/van, 100/for a day. Total of 150 for 24hrs. For us much better than RedCross, since it was not dusty. Bad thing: shadeless. 

The landlord also rents out a new looking house in Granada for 180USD/month. +50577768601

name: Casa vista de Apoyo
description: Parking area for a house, fits, let's say, 3 vans (shouldn't be too long or bulky, narrow curves to enter; we have a Hiace and it was ok). Steep easy access road, but 50m (sign says 200m). Not completely levelled, but good with level-helps. Place has a cool bar, toilets, access to laguna, showers, nice garden and Pedro the guard is very nice. Paid 15/2people/2nights.

name: Mirador Los Volcanes
description: Restaurant, mirador, chill-bar (dont know about weekend situation). Asked if we could stay here, and paid 5USD/van. Has a table already standing there, toilets were clean. Flat parking with great view and nice breeze. Some trucks in the early morning, but all in all quiet. Great with van or small RV.

name: Coco Calala
description: a wonderful vegetarian restaurant, very healthy alternative. AND, they have a pool! if you eat in the restaurant it's $3USD pp to use the pool, if not it's $5USD pp. there are a few room available at $30USD pp. there is a small garage available, room for a car, or two motorcycles...it's all located in a wonderful garden area. a nice break from the León heat.

name: Hostal Izzacalli & Camping
description:
Great little accommodations at the entrance for Somoto Canyon. French owner keeps the place spotless and is more than accommodating. Currently in the process of expanding. This place has secure parking and can accommodate a rig of any size. Great breakfast is included. $25 USD per night for a room at the time of writing.

Michel WhatsApp: +50584967380

name: Beach Access
description: There's a small road to the beach. Shadow to park, a view palm trees and a nice ocean breeze. No facilites, but nice people that offered us water.

name: ATM Banco Lafise
description: ATM that gives US currency or NIC cordobas

name: Free WiFi
description: Free public Wi-Fi by the beach. yellow benches. Wi-Fi name EPN

name: Mirador Tisey
description: Nice view spot next to parking place. , 10 Cordoba.

name: Spanish classes with Heysel
description: Highly recommend taking Spanish classes here with Heysel if you visit Matagalpa. She provides private and group lessons, at great rates. She also incorporates cultural experiences as well (cooking, coffee tasting etc.) she is very kind and patient, and speaks pretty good English. She also provides classes on-line. She is located in Matagalpa Tours you can contact her via her Facebook page "Spanish school Matagalpa with Heysel"

name: Bluefields Ferry
description: 7 hours of stuffy ride. if you can afford to fly buy a ticket. people were puking on ferry. not very pleasant

name: Best pupusas EVER
description: This lady and her family have a pupusas and drinks stand here, and they’re open every day. We crossed all of Nicaragua and El Salvador (where pupusas come originally) and we haven’t had any as good as these ones! Come have your pupusa for 35 cordobas and enjoy the rest of the visit with your belly happy and full!

name: G&G Big Corn Island
description: nice hotel basics but clean. nice people. But everyone is friendly here. Nicawaqua has been really nice.

name: Dos Tiburones Dive Shop Big Corn Island
description: This is a great dive shop. The staff is really nice and helpfull. There are fun dives and different levels of dives. The breakfast is the best we have so far in Nicawagra. Scrambled egg omelete, homemade toast, coffee, and a large bowl of fruit in season. nice hostal across the road. Phillip is really nice and rooms are clean

name: Puerto Momotombo
description: Beach on the lake, 2 restaurants, flat place, relax.

name: Hostal Punta Popoyo
description:
Absolutely great hotel/hostel.
Private rooms 20$ dorm rooms 12$. You can safely park your rig either & inside his gate or if you are too big right in front of it (see picture). The place has everything you need including a big kitchen, hammocks, showers, toilets, surfboard rentals & lessons.
Adrian the host is probably one of the best hosts we had since we started our trip. Super nice guy who went above and beyond to make our stay awesome!
Ps: ask him if you can take Toña the house-pig out for a walk on the beach, you wont regret it!

name: Fuel scam
description: This station brought three guys over to distract so they could not zero the pump. Cut off before full so the amount seemed correct

name: Cetrex
description: the location is across the street from these coordinates, in a small yellow shopping center.  cetrex, here is the third step (after going to vet and bank, and before going to IPSA) to get exportation papers to Costa Rica for the pets. they ask for 2 copies of the receipt you receive from the bank for cetrex (you can make copies next door), a copy of your passport and original vet health certificate (they give it all back). very straightforward. open 8-5 M-F, with 30 minute lunch break around noon.

name: Mirador turístico Nandasmo
description: Wild camping just past the gates down the hill.  Great spot if you arrive late and want to stay after visiting the pool and Mirador.   Not level but partial shade and ok for the night.   Very quiet and breezy.   Road is a bit rough where the pavement ends but not a problem.  Parked here in a 25' Class C.

name: German bakery- with delicious cakes and homemade breads!
description: There is a German lady who runs this place- they have delicious cakes coffee and bread with a great quality

name: Hostal Josfina Big Corn Island
description: Nice clean hotel across from the dive shop. If you are diving ask dive shop to take you over for a discount. Phillip is a really nice man and will help you out with things you need. Basic but clean across the road from the beach also.

name: Overlander Sanctuary
description: No signs except that the outer wall is aqua color with a big black gate has a couple of big frogs on the top of the wall. If you ever need any help or just a good cup of coffee even if you want to spend the night over you can ask for Ben. Most of the time around, tools for repairs available, water and bathrooms but overall is a place for overlanders to have a great cup of coffee and feel safe and welcome.

name: Entry Somoto canyon
description: Here at the official entry of the park, you can book different lengths of canyon tours. Good explanation. Prices are ok and good guides! They have still very little tourism now, so we didn’t bargain on the prices. We had a guide just for ourselves, which is pretty much always the case now. You can also camp here at Michel’s hostel. Only 100 Córdoba and 25 for a real hot shower! Convenient when you want to make an early start because of the cooler Temperatures.

name: Finca Música del Bosque
description: Come and join us for your stay of ultimate relaxation. Away from the noise and heat of the city, you can relax with us and enjoy coffee grown on site, varied worldwide vegetarian cuisine, exclusive hikes, farm tours and cosy, en-suite rooms.

name: Pacific Breeze Guest House
description:
Pacific Breeze Guest House is situated in the fishing village of Las Peñitas, in Léon Department, Nicaragua. The Guest House has a magnificient view of the natural reserve Isla Juan Venado and is situated in front of the restaurant Rancho Matia.
Each room has a charming view of the patio and is furnished with private bathroom. 
The Guest House provides also shared kitchen, a lot of space to hang out, a relaxing and familial atmosphere filled with fresh breeze from the Pacific Ocean.
Services are offered such as surf and dance lessons, fishing trips, mangroves boat tours and wakebording.
Pacific Breeze Guest House is at 119 km of Managua city and only 20km from the historical city of Léon. 

Pacific Breeze Guest House está situado en Las Peñitas en el departamento de Léon, Nicaragua, con maravillosa vista hacia la reserva natural isla Juan Venado. Está ubicado a un minuto de la bocana de Las Peñitas oposito restaurante Rancho Matia.
Las habitaciones tienen vista a un jardín armónico y están equipadas con baño privado.
Todas cuentan con zona tranquila de estar también cocina compartida y con mucho espacio para disfrutar del ambiente familiar y la brisa fresca.
Además, el Guest House ofrece servicios de escuela de surf y otras actividades variadas, así como clases de baile, tour de pesca, tour en los manglares, wakeboarding.
El Pacific Breeze Guest House se encuentra a 119km de Managua y a 20km de la cuidad histórica de Léon.

name: Behind The Gardens
description:
Was originally parked further away where the buses park.  Police came and moved me to here.  There is a dirt road that runs parallel to the paved beach road, and is the access.  Lots of space with no size restrictions.  Fits any size rig.  This spot is directly behind the gardens and is perfect for overnight.  We moved 20 meters under the trees beside the cement pad during the day for shade.  Very quiet as the bars are far enough away to be background noise.  But on weekends there is a ATV track nearby but stops before dark.  Beach is endless and right across the road.  Wifi available slow to average speed.  Parked here for one week in a 25' Class C.

Next door is a restaurant called Comedor Cristiano.  Owner is Albero, free toilet, washing sink, and $20 c for a warm shower.  He did offer drinking water but I didn't need any.  Typical tica food.  Shared taxi to the cathedral was $20 c. But an easy 25 minute walk.

name: Sabor Nicaraguense
description: Buffet-style restaurant, simple but tasty food. Daily menu for 100c. Easy when coming from or going to the ferry. Blue and white building about half a mile from the roundabout.

name: Asador Emanuel
description: Small privately owned restaurant in a mini mall next to a chicken place. We had the filete de pollo with jalapeño sauce and it is super good.. Nica prices and very friendly service. The road on the west side of the Masaya vulcano takes you through small villages where they grow pineapples!! Very scenic route!

name: Portal Del Mar
description: $15 to park for the night. Nice beach cove with small beach bar and hammocks and bathroom and outside shower. Very quiet. Windy when we slept here.. friendly people!

name: Official Canyon Guide
description:
This is the home of a local certified tour guide named Jancy Zelaya. You can find or ask for her here or in the official office at the entrance to the Canyon. 

She has a lot of experience and was an excellent guide. Some Spanish skills help but she does speak some English as well. She gave us lots of information on the long tour of the canyon (6 hours). There are three tours, short, medium, and long with varying levels of difficulty. We paid $20US per person or 660cord pp. which included 2 nights of camping, and the tour of the entire canyon with life jackets, boat ride, waterproof bag for your phone or sandwiches if needed (Jancy carries this so be aware of weight).

We read on other ioverlander spots that some people do this without a tour guide. After doing it however, all four of us agreed that having a guide is really your best bet. There are a few poisonous plants to look out for and one mandatory 2m jump into the water. Only if you are very well educated and experienced in these things should you go it alone.

Jancy can negotiate the camping so come here first. You can then negotiate with the property owners at the campsite for additional days if desired. We were able to stay extra days by simply purchasing breakfast which was very affordable $1.50US pp.

Jancy also accompanied us at no cost to Somoto and gave us some history of the town. She also took us on a tour of a local watermelon farm (she did not ask any money but we tipped her).

You can find her here or contact her on WhatsApp at +50589193043

name: Petronic Gas Station
description: Had to get some work down on our van until after dark so our mechanic recommended sleeping here. Had a comfortable rest, some trucks but generally quiet. Overnight urinals and gained access to a bathroom key when we woke up (7am). No one asked for payment. Beer and chips for sale

name: La Hermandad Reserva Natural y Refugio de vida Silvestre
description:
Most memorable experience in our 7 months of overland travel! We found the location on google maps and were unsure what to expect. The phone number connected us to the family and we were told that it is not recommended we make the drive without a 4x4 vehicle. We gave it a try with our 2wd Toyota van with regular clearance. The last km was muddy with deep puddles but we made it and are so happy that we did. The Mairena family are amazing and have a wonderful reserva where they grow coffee, bananas, beans, and produce honey. They respect the land and have incredible knowledge of the flora and fauna, which they share in abundance. We saw sloths, Congo monkeys, beautiful birds, and some sweet local dogs. There is room for 2 rigs below and a couple tough 4x4s could climb the road up and park on the flats higher up. There is a flush toilet and shower and even rooms with a bed. A couple bars of Claro 3G when up the hill.

We were welcomed into their home and invited to share in daily gatherings. It is hard to put into words the love and respect we feel for them and how much the experience impacted us. The price is $5usd/night to camp and $8usd/night for a bed. They never brought up money and weren’t sure how much to suggest as we were the first Overlanders. We sat down and discussed details for this post as all we want to do is help them moving forward. In the end, we gave them all the money we had as a symbolic gesture but the experience was priceless. Come stocked with food, the drive and beauty will make you want to stay several days. Potable water available fresh off the mountain.

Google maps may give you the wrong turn from San Ramón. Always take the Calle de la Hermandad. You pass through a very manicured coffee plantation. With about 1.5km left you can either go left on Calle de la Hermandad or right (both meet back in the middle). We took the right road as the left one seemed muddier. The last 1km is all dirt and very difficult. Stop when you see the faded reserva sign where you can either go up with the proper vehicle or camp below next to the bamboo (see photo). The family live close by and you will find each other.

name: Heladeria del Parque
description: Nice spot for ice cream near the square in muy muy. The other food is average but the staff are nice :) We chanced our luck after we had lunch and asked if we could stay out back. They were happy enough for us to camp in our tent there at no charge, maybe because of the lunch? There are some noisy birds and a dog nearby but not too bad.

name: beach place
description:
Nice flat and quiet place at the beach near fisherman houses. Access with gravel road, 4x4 not necessary but better. Not far from the very good French restaurant AL Cielo.
Do your shopping before coming. Nothing here but you can buy fresh fish.
For security, there are houses very close. We are now travelling since 2 months in Nicaragua and camp everywhere without apprehension. The Nicas are really very nice and helpful people.

name: Centro Lafise - Vehicle Insurance
description:
La banque à côté de la douane a refusé de nous renouveler l'assurance et nous  envoyé ici au Centre Lafise, avenue Masaya (12.115361,-86.256424). Un mois de plus d'assurance, 12$US. Prévoir le TIP et les copies du passeport, permis et carte grise.
A noter que dans les administrations et les banques, c'est contrôle obligatoire de température à l'entrée, gel sur les mains et parfois même désinfection des chaussures.


The bank next door to the Aduana sent us here at the Lafise bank center on Masaya avenue (12.115361,-86.256424) to renew our insurance. One more month for the insurance, 12$US. Bring the TIP and copies of passport, vehicle tittle and permit.
In the administrations and banks, they control your temperature at the entry, clean your hands and sometimes your shoes.

name: Java Jungle
description:
4 Private Cabins with private bathroom, AC, fridge, coffee machine.
3 people per cabin, on 2 beds.

Access to a shared kitchen.

Good ambient, really new.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

4 Cabinas Privadas con bano privado A/C refer y macina de Cafe
Cada cabina pueden dormir 3 personas...dos camas cada cabina

hay acceso por una Cocina Comunial

Nuevo y super comido con Buenaaaa Vibrasssss

name: Multiautos Best Mechanic
description:
Best Mechanic in Nicaragua! Deals with all car makers, has all the tools needed! We got there with 2 pistons not working, by the end of the day we already had the spare parts to fix it. Excellent service, we slept at the workshop. Clean bathrooms. 


El mejor taller que hay en Nicaragua ¡! Todas las marcas, todas las herramientas, profesionales de la mecánica ¡! Llegamos aquí con 2 pistones sin funcionar y al final del día ya estaban las partes para terminar la reparación ¡! Exelente servicio , dormimos en el taller, baños limpios ¡! Exelente trato ¡! Recomendable 100% .

name: Laundry
description: Asked for 100c per kg, but negotiated to 300 for a 5kg load. Ready in 2h.

name: Small commercial center
description:
Small commercial center with level gravel lot. Most units were empty, and we were told we could stay and that it was safe.
Stayed one night. Nice little town. Felt very safe.
Access is a bit steep but paved.

name: Ministerio de Salud - Health Ministry - Covid Test
description:
This is the only place (as of today) that you can take the COVID-19 test to travel out of Nicaragua.
It costs $150 and you can pay in dollars, local currency, or credit card.
The whole process was very straight forward and took 40min.
Test taken from 8-11AM and results gets ready at 4PM the same day.

name: Ministerio de Salud / Health Ministry
description:
This is the only place in Nicaragua you can get your Covid test to continue your journey.
8-11AM and results at 4PM the same day.
Cost $150 payable in cash (usd or cordobas) and credit card.
Straight forward and takes about 40 min from the gate until you leave.

name: Clandestino Hostel
description: Amazing little rustic backpacker hostel in the jungle. Five minute walk to the beach and surf. There's a skate bowl, yoga platform, regular barbecues, good people. The final bit of road to get up here from the Big Surf Drop House is a 4x4 must, even in dry season. There's space to park and camp, and the owners can let you use the kitchen and other facilities for a small price. Highly recommend this place, I spent two months here learning how to surf.

name: Jungle Cabins El Escondido
description:
Jungle Cabins El Escondido is a finca with coffee, bananas and cows in the middle of beautiful northern Nicaraguan mountains with great natural surroundings. A wild river passes through the finca. There are three cabins to hire and there is plenty of space for campers and tents.
Camping is 10 dollar per person, this includes shower, toilet, use of kitchen, electricity and wifi.

name: Casa Camaleón Managua
description:
We came here because our friend give the contact of this place. We have to do extension of the TIP. It is a good place because you can go to the Aduanas with a 20 minutes walk.This is a culture house run by a nice family. They have 100m2 lot for parking next to their house. The place is totally safe and close with door. It is not a big space but enough for a big rig or 2 vans. There is a toilet and shower facilities. They give you the choice of cooking some meals for you at decent price if you want. They have free wifi. Free drinking water and you can fill up your tank. Electricity is available for 5$ day. We pay 20$ per night for our 7m long truck.
Frank and Claudia are really friendly and very helpful

name: Vivero Nambume
description: Vivero Nambume is a indigenous family business. They make tours about ancestral and medicine plans. They have lots of knowledge about Chorotega indigenous culture. Very interesting visit, lovely people and close to Masaya. We didn’t sleep there but maybe you can ask to spend the night. They are very friendly and welcome.

name: Lokalimotxo
description:
Bar - Camping - Hostel - Open House - Cultural Center (español abajo)
Really nice place in the middle of a local comunity, sorrounded by nature and a river. Lots of monkeys around! Pets welcome. 
Dorms, hammocks and camping available. W/C and showers. 
Very open to recieve travellers and backpackers. Cheap price or possible to volunteer / exchange, depending how many volunteers there at the moment or what service/knowledge/workshop/activity you can offer. 
20 min walk from Marsellas or Maderas beach. 
————————-
Bar - Camping - Hostel - Casa Abierta - Centro Cultural
Hermoso lugar en medio de una comunidad local, rodeada de naturaleza y un río. Hay muchos monos! Mascotas bienvenidas.
Dormitorios compartidos, hamacas y camping disponible. Baños y duchas. 
Muy abiertos a recibir viajeros y mochileros. Barato y con posibilidad de voluntarear o hacer intercambio, dependiendo de cuantos voluntarios haya al momento o que servicio/conocimiento/taller/actividad puedas ofrecer.
A 20 min caminando de las playas Marsella y Maderas.

name: Hostel Luna
description:
Nice little hostel, runned by travel agency treehuggers.
Dorm for $8, private room with own bathroom for $20. Fans available, no AC. 
Small kitchen, wifi, laundry service, book exchange and excursions. Potable water for 10C per 1,5L. The walls are quite thin, so it can be noisy from time to time. 
Only streetparking possible.

name: AC & Electrical Repairs (Car cool taller de aire acondicionado)
description:
Our vehicle AC died and these guys were great at diagnosing the problem (evaporator) and repairing it so that our Mercedes Sprinter was cold again! then... a few days later the 12 volt AC in the "house" part of the van died (yes, incredibly bad luck)... we went straight to these guys and even though they were used to just normal vehicle AC issues, they jumped right on it! once they determined the compressor was good, they climbed into the "garage" and we're not intimidated by the electrical setup at all. It took about 30 minutes and they found a "burnt" wire that may have been undersized for the AC. They repaired it and had us on our way within a few hours. They do not speak English but are great with google translate.  Reasonably priced... fast service... great guys! 

we are 23 feet long and 10'3" high and fit in the parking lot. right on the main road. easy access

name: Entre Montanas
description:
Nice place to eat. Clean and tasty. Recomended.
Canasta de tostones con frijoles 90 Cordobas.

name: Entre Montanas
description:
Segurity place to stay, with pool, restaurant, is possible to camp, but we didnt ask the price. 70 C pp to use the pool. In future cabanas private. Food veary tasty. Recomended
Habitaciones en costruction.

name: Pulperia el Genizero
description:
Jugs of drinking water can be bought here. Plenty of room to park in front of store while filling tanks. 
No deposit needed if you dump and fill.

name: Finca La Huerta
description:
Large grassed area, not much shade. Geovany and Claudia are great hosts and will welcome you and tell you about the country history. Claudia cooks nicaraguan typical dishes.
Very close to the river and the canyon. Buses with families come on weekends.
Payed 100 NIO per night.

Area grande con césped y poca sombra.

name: Hotel La Perla Fina
description:
Fine and quite hotel, mostly used by Nicaraguans who travel for work.

Big parking lot at back of the hotel with guard at night. 

200 cordoba for a decent room with fan. Can be hot in april/may.

name: Centro Turistico Santa Fe (swimmingpool)
description:
We pitched our tent inside the park. The venue has several swimmingpools and slides. Many tables and hammocks as well. Music during the day, quiet and safe at night. 

We could camp for only 60 cordobas per person which is the entrance fee. We also ordered some food.

Street parking in front.

name: It's Coffee Time
description:
Nice coffee place with real cappuchino and tasty cakes.
Garden in the back to escape the city noises.

name: San Juan Green
description:
As the name suggests, this is a restaurant where you can eat healthy food for a very affordable price. Hard to find such a thing along the road in Nicaragua. 
Fruit and veggie (milk)shakes, bananaburgers, burritos and more. 
A happy change in menu after eating gallo pinto for days.

name: Beach Access Spot
description:
We camped here for one night.  You drive down the road by Rise Up and turn right as you enter the sand (left if you want to camp in front of boom break).  There is a house on the beach and we parked just before that probably 100 m from the road.  Very quiet, only a few surf trucks and motos.  Dogs as well but they didn’t bug us except for peeing on our tires. No one bothered us at all!  Beach is fairly clean which was a great change from some others we have been to. 

You should be able to access the site with 2WD as long as you don’t drive too far into the sand. 

Only 1 bar of 3G service on my T Mobile, but our Google fi phone had full LTE. 

Almaru (right up the road, formerly Rise Up) has great food, drinks and views!

name: Side of the road food
description: Big store, cold drinks and other packed food.

name: ATM
description:
BAC Credomatic ATM.
Inside the bank - big parking right in front.

name: Café Nagüa
description:
We are staying at Hotel Pacifico and this place is very close to us. It’s owned by a very nice guy and they make really good food. 

You can also try the Tiste - it’s a corn based and cacao cold drink. It’s so good and perfect for the heat!

name: Asados Pepe
description:
Excelente asados!! Vegetarian options too - 
Torta de papa 
Queso frito
Gallo pinto 

A variety of natural drinks. This is a great spot! We ate so much (did not have any meat) and paid around $180 for two people.

name: ProRiders (bike shop)
description: Great bike shop with lots of high end, good quality stuff. Mechanics are very knowledgeable. They do tubeless and have all kind of Specialized stuff. Very recommended!

name: Printing
description: Printing. This is one of the few places with printers but a bit pricy. Do it before the border if you can

name: Casa Unica
description:
Charming little place where they host people for day visits and overnights. 
The place is pretty, with sitting area, shower-toilet, kayaks and the public waterfront 40m away. The road here is fine most of the way. last 500 meters are not so great but with smaller rigs it is fine.
There is a place for 1 rig. We arrived with our 3.5m high rig. we couldn't enter. the entrance can fit 9-9.5 feet high rigs max.
the owner (benjamin) was super kind, let us sleep outside the gate with electricity, water and such.
The next day we drove to the public beach in front of their place, connected to their electricity, and had great time by the water.
apoyo laguna is awsome!
Talk to him before arriving. whatsapp. ‏‪+15142956665‬‏

name: Casa la aventura
description:
NEW RATES FROM THE OWNER: -10$ for 1 camper of 2 people(same price if you are alone) Included Wifi, shower and toilet access. no electricity or commune areas. +5$ for additional guest per day - 15 $= same things but you can plug for electricity -20$ : for 1 camper or 2 People. same things plus access to the cimmune areas, equiped kitchen, deck, free coffee morning, filter water ±5$for additional guest +5$ if you need electricity 3$ for children from 3 to 17 years old. Whatsap Gabriela : +50589809814

PRiCES UPDATES. starting april. 10/15$ or 20/25$ suite aux travaux (cuisine commu e,aire ouverte, deck de chilling.changements dans les prix. les campers sont desormais sur le terrain d'à côté. pour le moment plein soleil. devrait changer dans au moins 1 an car rien nest encore planté.

name: El Marabú surf resort.
description:
Nice little hostel right on the beach. 
French family owns it. Super nice and welcoming, safe and very quiet. 
His name is Samuel. 

Make sure you bring all the food you need as the only pulperia is maybe 15min drive away.

name: La Ceibita tours/campsite/restaurant
description:
Nice place with 4 apartments and space for 3-4 rigs and plenty of animals around for entertainment.. 
We camped for 2usd/p/n.
Francisco also does tours, and offers very affordable breakfast, lunch and dinner. The very friendly family showed us around on their property, we milked a cow in the morning and bought honey from the son who's keeping bees.

name: Technoluz solar shop
description:
Nice little shop with panels, inverters, cable, etc.
Not super cheap, but also not crazy expensive.
We could bargain about 15%of the prices

name: Uno, diésel low sulfur
description: Uno station selling low sulfur diesel, at least that is on the sign... None of the operators knew anything on how low, or any other info regarding the diesel

name: Zopilote Permaculture Farm
description:
Here you can park to visit the Zopilote hostel/restaurant up the hill. We stayed for two nights, paying just C$30 per night to the family living here. (and we offered an additional C$20 to use the pit toilet). 

Zopilote is a great place to visit! Great vibe, smoothies, juices, (vegan) food all coming from their own (permaculture) grounds. They offer free yoga, communal dinners and many other workshops.

name: Paved brick road (first half) to Cerro Negro
description: This road is brick layed for the first part on the way to Cerro Negro. If you follow this, you will get signs pointing to Cerro Negro all the way. There are a few options to switch between dirt tracks later on, but there are signs on each junction.

name: Cerro Negro Lava Field
description:
Awesome spot to camp (need to pay entrance once, $5pp and then $5pp per night camping). You are in the middle of the lava field at the end of the volcano boarding track. 4x4 not necessary to get here, but clearance and driving skills. Our friends in a lifted 2WD VW Kombi did it, just some sharp rocks on the way in. The sand is solid up to this point. If you want to go further and drive through the valleys, you need 4x4.

You can use the showers and toilets at the visitor center, but it's a kilometer walk.

LTE 4G, 3 bars.

Big rigs can fit (if they make it through the trees on the way up), but you need clearance. Wouldn't do it with a standard clearance sprinter, especially not a long one.

name: Nimbu Beach Hose
description:
Beautiful hostel run by an Austrian woman. Dorm room beds with breakfast included are $20 and they have a restaurant.

We asked about camping in our van as well, but they would only do it for $20 per person (with breakfast and dinner included) and their parking lot is quite small.

Should be good for working (fast wifi) and has direct beach access for surfing.

I think it's a good option if you are backpacking, a bit too much for overlanders, unless you are out of food anyway (the included dinner sounded nice). We had the fridge full and didn't want to spoil it so moved on.

name: Restaurant Barco de Oro
description: Nice restaurant and Hostal at the ocean side, clean and good food. Sandrine, the french owner welcomed us to stay with our Unimog in the parking and to use the facilities. We paid 5 $ for the night and had a meal in the restaurant.

name: Road closed
description: Tried to ride the dirt road up to the Chiltepe crater rim but there’s a locked gate blocking access at this turn off.

name: Bomberos Granada
description: Due to covid crisis, we parked our rig in the fire station for 18 months.  Good place and secure to let your rig for long-term parking.  We paid around 20 USD/month.

name: Don’t even!!!
description: Nope, don’t do it… not even on 2 wheels unless you have a very light and powerful machine (350 or 450) with no luggage. It’s steep and muddy and rutted out…

name: La Gran Sultana (moto friendly)
description: Probably one of the better deals. Walking distance from everything, motos can go inside their large lobby, pool, rooftop terrace, A/C… rooms are small but ok for short term. We paid $25 for a matrimonial. Friendly staff… comes with a basic breakfast.

name: Ojo de Agua
description:
Great place to relax in the shade of the old growth trees, swim in the crystalline waters of the springs, enjoy a rum coconut, some food… refreshing and relaxing
At time of writing it was $5 per person to get in.

name: Banpro ATM
description: ATM open late (maybe 24 hours). Door to the ATM is on the corner furthest away from the church

name: Aguasana
description:
Shop with garrafons, $70 per garaffon. They can't fill your own, but help you change it over. 

Next to La Colonia super. convenient with big parking lot.

name: Banco LAFISA
description: This is the bank where you need to pay for IPSA and CETREX for your pet paperwork. Long lines as always. ATMs here as well.

name: Traffic Police Stop (Bribery Attempt)
description:
Not sure if these are the exact correct coordinates, maybe +/- a few KM in either direction, but there was a police checkpoint and we got pulled over. Told we had “illegally crossed the middle yellow line” and had to pay a fine. Then they said $50 and we could go. Then went down to 700C. They threatened to keep our (old) license until we paid at the bank and said we couldn’t get our license back until the next day (eventually said we’d have to wait 15 days, lol).

We never paid, just kept wasting their time. Took us 30 minutes. Said we’d rather pay at the bank than give them a ‘multa’. Eventually, they let us off and even gave us back our license.

Maybe 8-10km after (correction going to Costa Rica) there was another police check point. 

Advice: in this area, don’t speed and don’t cross any solid yellow lines, even if all the locals do it.

name: Lavamatic Express
description: You can do your own laundry or have them do it. It takes 2-2.5 hours and they notify you via WhatsApp. The owner speaks perfect English, and was very helpful. He said he has the only laundromat in all of town. A bit pricy, 350C for 8-10ish lbs but everything came back clean and folded.

name: Brisas Del Lago
description:
Pretty and relatively quiet and cool spot to park or put up your tent for the night next to an unused lakeside restaurant.

The property is owned by Juan and his family who are living on the same lot but closer to the road. The restaurant itself is not open at the moment although Juan is planning to fix it up again and open it back up.

For now there are no facilities but a beautiful view over the lake, trees for shade, a roof to hide from the rain and a slight to strong breeze from the lake for a cool night.

Close to but not visible from the road, some traffic noise but not too bad. 
Convenient place to take a break from driving and enjoy the view and the breeze.

Juan did not charge us but asked for a voluntary donation so we gave him 100 cordoba.

name: Hotel Southern Nights Camping spot
description:
After „California Hotel“ didn’t accept Camper we asked here. The hotel is run by a very friendly US man. There is only one flat spot and the gate at the entrance is only about 3,20 meter. We paid 10$ for the night, they gave us a key for the bathrooms with shower. You can eat and drink at the good restaurant.

Update 4/22: it's $12 a night now.
We recommend this place.

Update 8/22: $15

name: La Engorda
description: Good place to stay a night. Restaurant with large parking lot for trucks. 50C for the night with toilet and shower. Safe an quiet at night.

name: Granada RV Park and Camping
description:
Safe Clean Camping/Parking for all vehicles or Campers
10 minute walk from Central Park
3 minute walk to Market
+505 88422587

name: Corrupt police at check point
description: Approx location on this road. I provided good licence, registration, insurance and temp import permit and the officer then proceeded to say we weren't wearing seat belts. watch out for these corrupt police. Don't give in to their lies they just want money. if you have a passenger that speaks good spanish get them to defend you otherwise don't get involved just play dumb. only hand over copies of everything.

name: Hush
description: The best views of sunsets in Nicaragua, good value for what you get. They have an infinity pool, good restaurant, friendly staff, cute puppies, the dorm is 22$ but worth it. Would definitely recommend to come and see the sunsets here

name: convenience store with shady tables
description: if your lucky parking out the front. cheap drinks. fried chicken and chips. basic groceries. 1/2 beach view from shady tables. cheapest beer in San Juan del sur

name: Manuel's / Bary's
description: Manuel's restaurant - the sign out front says Bary's. Meals range between $4 - $8 USD. Great food (especially the fish), nice bathrooms and shower, and Manuel (the owner) is the nicest person. When we told him we were camping he assured us the area is safe and that he would watch out for our van while we explored Granada during the day. After staying 2 nights we were sad to leave and say goodbye to Manuel!

name: El Cambio Accesorios y Lubricantes
description:
Oil changes only.

Oil and engine filter change $60 USD (includes 6L of 5w20 synthetic and filter). Price is for material and labour is free.

Hours: Monday - Saturday 7:40 - 16:45.

Small space would not recommend for RVs.
Recommended by Freddy & Freddy Jr. from the other iOverlander mechanic spot "Freddy Salgado".

name: Taller Soluciones Franklin - Chequeo Gratis
description:
Free brakes inspection.

They can repair on site good prices.

name: ATM Next to Foodmarket
description:
Of the left side of the Supermarket is an ATM
Dollares & Cordobas

name: Laguna to Mirador Hike
description: Nice Hiking trail from the Laguna de Apoyo to the Mirador de Diria. Start here and walk directly beside the shore. Trail is relatively well marked in red color and letters "TSA". The way up to the Mirador starts from a small bay and you can choose between a small road and footpaths. We saw a lot of monkeys in the forest. Roundtrip Duration 3-4 hours. You can park at the iOverlander Spot "Free beach- Lago De Apoyo".

name: Wild camp
description: Wild camp . Only animals and villagers were here . We had amazing view .

name: Field near the lake
description: Very closed to the city, this plane área is so quite. Lake view, not too much cars on the road. Only horses and cows will come to meet you !!

name: Rancho Gracias a Dios
description:
Very nice place and super friendly people, they are planning to build a campsite in the future but for now they are happy to let you pitch your tent overnight and you can order your dinner here for cheap, this a restaurant actually

Totally recommended

name: Casa Lula Hostel
description:
Very comfortable and quiet hostel with private rooms (w/bathroom) for 30US$ pp (cash) with fan, 40US$ with AC (from 8pm to 8am). Accepts cards too, + IVA tax. Also dorms with shared bathrooms. Full kitchen, washing machine (extra) and small secure parking for motorcycles or 1 car. Water and beer available to purchase, but markets nearby. Close to everything. No hot water, but it's not needed in León! Owners Roger and Selena very friendly. 2 dogs and 2 cats. Pet friendly, but your pets must behave.
+505 2311 1076/ +505 7660 7357

name: Charco Verde
description: We stayed in the parking across from the building to Charco Verde reserve for free. We left the reserve after the building closed, slept peacefully all night and nobody said anything the next morning when we left around 10.

name: La Birria
description:
Very tasty beef burritos (can also ask for chicken instead) for 160C. Theyre standard size, so I recommend getting 2. Options for dine-in, take-away (add 12C for packaging) or delivery (add 30C). 

They also have pulled pork, tacos, Ramen, and a couple other items, though I did not try them

name: Armed Robbery
description:
German traveller staying at my hostel was robbed by 3 locals, 1 with a knife, while he was walking on the trails back to Matagalpa from Selva Negra.

They only took his phone even though he was wearing a backpack with his wallet and other items

name: Comedor Los Cocos
description:
Nice little breakfast place (filled with locals, so you know it's good) 

Great pancakes for 50C
Tipico breakfast with coffee 80C
Other options available

name: Road Does Not Exist!
description:
The road from here to Bluefields DOES NOT EXIST! Look on Google Maps satellite view (or see pics)- where it says the road is, is clearly forest and a river with no bridge or ferry.

It is instead possible to take a boat from here up the river to Bluefields, but I did not ask for details. I'm guessing the actual road to Bluefields is from Nueva Guinea, but that needs verification. There's no road from there on Google Maps, but there is on Maps.me

name: IPSA Pet Export Office
description:
This “ventanilla” window for IPSA is the one you need to get your pet export certificate for Costa Rica. If you don’t have this certificate, they will not give you a permit for your pet in Costa Rica. You can take a chance without it but if the Costa Rican police stops you and you haven’t correctly imported your pet to Cost Rica, they can take your pet away from you. This IPSA window is hard to find, that’s why I am posting the GPS coordinates. It is right across from the Pasajero Terminal right when you pass the first pre-check where they give you your aduana form for the car. Past the two huge air conditioning units in the left. See the photos. They open at 8:30 am

Please note that prior to this you need to visit the Vet and Cetrex offices in Rivas to get a Pet Health Certificate and a form from Cetrex. Both are on IOverlander under pet services.

name: Iniser
description: In case you forgot to buy insurance at the border, you can buy it at any iniser in the big cities

name: Vulcanizadora Chanel - Tyre repair
description: In the back streets they work on the street. 180 for a large patch on inside of tubeless car tyre whatsapp +506 83880991 Manuel

name: Centro cultural next to Hotel sueño de la campaña
description:
After having some trouble to go to finca esperanza verde, we ask the police that lead us to this place. 
We met Harris, an incredible español guy who run the centro cultural and he let us stay here, use the bathroom and toilets. 
It just a parking lot but if you meet with Harris, it will make your day!
Good for one night, restaurant on site

name: Matagalpa Parking secure
description:
A large parking place in the middle of town. No restrictions. Much better than that at the restaurant or bomberos. 
100 cord. Night

name: Reserva Kilimanjaro
description:
Because Reserva Jaguar was closed we decided to go here. André (the owner) was really friendly even though he never received overlanders before, and likes you all to visit as well.

The road to get here is bumpy but during dry season no 4x4 was needed. Not sure about rain season, but probably still doable without 4x4.

A beautiful farm with cabanas and campspots. They grow coffee and fruits, and own a lot of horses, cows and pigs. They are self sustainable and have their own hydroelectric power. If you have 4x4 you can camp on top of the hill of their land and have a great view and a lot of privacy. 

There are different paid activities they offer like milking the cows, ride horses and do tours in the mountains. It is a cloud forest area and there are tons of birds. They asked for 15$ for two persons and 5$ extra for breakfast/lunch/dinner.

name: Camping à la pointe
description:
Translation:Wild camping in a tent on the beach, quiet place, magnificent sunset!
Small cabin, tables and restaurants.
In the evening after sunset there is no one, it is very quiet.
Possibility to stay in the parking lot with a Van or a 4x4.

Camping sauvage en toile de tente sur la plage, lieu tranquille, magnifique couché de soleil!
Petite cabane, tables et restaurants.
Le soir après le couché de soleil il n'y a plus personne, c'est très calme.
Possibilité de rester sur le parking avec un Van ou un 4x4.

name: French Bakery
description: Real French Bakery managed by a Nicaragua & French couple. We loved the break, real French bread and viennoiserie. Open from 8 to 4pm every day.

name: pita pita
description: upscale Mediterranean restaurant specializing in middle eastern dishes and pizza. apps from 5 to 8 bucks. entres from 8 to 12. BOGO cocktails from 4 to 6

name: Veterinaria Fletes Aguilar
description: Kevin at Grenada RV park found this guy for us that only charged 400C each for our health certificates for our dogs. Kevin's vet wanted 50 bucks for the same thing and others wanted 70 in town! quick and easy. had the account numbers ready you will need to go to the bank to make deposits. one was 150c and the other was 13$.

name: playa
description: Free place to sleep facing the sea. Quiet and safe with some shade.  I recommend

name: Tapas and surf
description: Private cabana with shower and bathroom with 2 beds for 50us. Free breakfast. Secure area. Middle of a wide surf. Great surfing area. Local beer 1.5$, corona 4$. Lunch meals are about $10. Need to take 2 kilometre gravel road. Top rated place. Has pool

name: fuente pura (agua)
description: gallons refill at a small water provide. the also sell smaller size. 87 cordobas for 5 gallons.

name: Nuestra Casa B&b
description: Nice, super clean. Large double bedroom. AC is cold. Secure motorcycle parking or one car. Paid $60us in high season, national holiday. Free filtered water and breakfast. Fast internet. It has a small sign and easy to miss. They have a sister hostel down the street. If no-one here go to hostel to get staff. 1.5 block from beach. A lot of activities at the beach.

name: Near Tapas and Surf
description:
Super chill and fresh place over night. We just parked near the way in front of the wave. 
If you consume in Tapas and Surf you can use toilet, the shower and wifi. Felt very safe

name: Solid Surf
description:
Nice place, right in front the beach.
All facilities, amazing kitchen, super big chill area, nice spot to do yoga while you see the wave all day long
15$ x day for two people in the van.
Rooms available

name: potable city water filling station
description: they have a tap inside the gate but  near the street that someone will access for you. its potable and i filled my 20pL tank for free.

name: lavenderia grand plus
description: hard to find a lavenderia in Rivas on google. as Abys lavenderia is closed

name: Comedor
description: We had dinner and slept in front of the little restaurant of this tiny pueblo and could even fill up our tank with water (water from the school). For 4 cenas and drinks and some homemade cookies 510C. People were very nice and the night was very very quiet. They said we can give something for the night, we did give 150C and we bought cheese, coffee and jams from the tiendq. All are delicious. We really liked this little detour in this community.

name: Las Palmas
description:
Hotel / House with an interior courtyard.
 John the owner is American, super nice and accepts that we stay in his courtyard for a few nights (not a month for example) and that we use the toilets at his house, the outdoor shower and the communal kitchen.  The real plus is the calm and cleanliness.  His Watsapp: +1 (303) 525 3122. Call him before coming.  We paid US$10 per night for 2 people and the Van.  Accessible for all sizes of truck but the terrain can only contain 2 or 3 maximum.

name: Park
description: We arrived in this village by chance.  We parked around the park in the health center parking lot.  The locals told us it was calm, safe and quiet.  Indeed very quiet during the night.  Everyone was very nice to us.  We ate around the park.  There is water in the park

name: Oldest church of Nicaragua
description: In a little town, ciudad Antigua, there is the oldest church of Nicaragua. White in front but when you made the turn you can see that the church is old. Nice town and really really calm

name: Water Spigot at a gas station
description: Have been looking for a place to fill up on water for a while. This gas station has a spigot with good pressure and the attendants were okay to let me fill up our tank...

name: Worldwash laundry
description: Laundry between Managua and Masaya. Convenient because right on the road. 1$ per kilo for washing and drying. Not cheap but good service. 1h30 for 18kg of clothes.

name: Uno - ULSD
description: Uno with ultra low sulphur diesel "Uno diesel con dynamax" available

name: Mister car Autocentro - Peak lubricantes
description:
The place doesn’t look like a propane filling place, but it is. Actually we were able to fill our tank even though it isn’t Tropigas.
We left our 10 pounds gas tank in the morning here, and it was filled up after lunch. It cost 182 córdobas. 

——————————————————-

Aquí llenamos nuestro tanque costarricense de gas de 10L por 182 córdobas. Lo dejamos en la mañana y después de almuerzo ya estaba listo. Es una venta de cosas para autos, pero también llenan tanques de gas aunque no sean marca Tropigas.

name: Ceramicas Miguel Angel
description: We loved this little place with tons of ceramics. Miguel’s shop and taller is 100% artisanal. He learned his job with his grandfather and parents. We went there to buy a few ceramics objects (vase, plate…) and we had the chance Miguel told us about the art of ceramics, and we all (5 of us) did try to do a piece. So it was basically a ceramics lesson. We paid for the objects, that’s all. Not for the lesson that lasted almost 2 hours. The kids and the adults loved it ! Miguel was very patient and very nice. Here is his whatsapp if you want to check if he is available before going: +505 8164 0611

name: Natural Pool
description: Recommend to us by locals. Unfortunately the pool was drained when we got there for maintenance but looks like a cool place and water comes from a natural spring feels really fresh. Petroglyph on site as well and just a short walk to Finca Magdalena...

name: Puerto San Jorge
description: Spent the night here to get the ferry to San Jose at 9:30am the next day. 100C for RV and family of 5. Gated, security, quiet, very safe. We arrived around 6pm and the nice guard explained we could stay here. Very convenient. A few palapas to sit down. Kids playground too. Nice parking option. FREE WIFI. Basuras everywhere. Possible to fill up water tank without problem.

name: Only ATM outside of Moyogalpa
description: ATM inside the gas station. Was told by locals this is the only ATM outside of Mayagalpa. Plays music, dispenses cash... pretty cool! 😀

name: Playas Mango
description: Nice little beach with restaurant, kayak rental, swings, super friendly staff, bon fires and the most amazing view of Volcano Concepcion. The sunsets here are amazing. Place charges a daily cover of 40cordoba per person.

name: Across the road from the Sendoro to Concepcion volcano
description: We were meeting our guide for hiking the Concepcion volcano the next day early so we slept directly across the sendero where the hike starts. This is next to the road so of course a little noise but there are so little traffic on the island these days, we heard like 5 cars and 10 bikes so perfectly ok. FREE spot where we left our RV for the day during the hike. Space for like 2 to 3 vehicles not more and ok for 1 night before hiking.

name: Road to Telica Volcano
description:
This is the correct start of the road to Telica volcano. Depending on where you're starting from, Google Maps and Maps.Me will lead you to a road starting from NN252 instead. That will not work out though if you want to reach the other spots where you can camp or park for an easy hike to the crater! Locals told us this is the only way. 
High clearance needed, without 4x4 you might not make it until the very end. If your rig is >3m in height and >2.2m in width you might not make it either due to overgrown tracks.

name: Playa Hermosa
description:
Nice beach, the entrance is $3 per person but they do not allow the entry of food or drinks, for which they force you to consume in the hotel bar. Prices above average. There is cell phone signal.

Linda playa, la entrada sale $3 por persona pero no permiten el ingreso de comidas ni bebidas por lo cuál te obligan a consumir en el bar del hotel. Precios por encima de la media. Hay señal de celular.

name: Zapatertours
description:
Boat Tours Isletas and Zapatera Islands.
Bilingual certified captain.
21 foot searay.
230 horsepower.

name: Apartments to rent for night
description: This is a family house that rents rooms for the night and cheap price. We are a couple that rent a private room with private bathroom for 10 usd (it isn't 5 usd per person...just the room for 10 usd). Just a bed and a fan. Every hostel was between 9 or 10 usd per person (with breakfast). We made this choice where you also can use the kitchen. We parked the car in the street and everything was good. The phone number is +505 89567950 (is on the door)

name: Puerto San Carlos
description: This is where you can take a boat to El Castillo. You can buy tickets at the office 150C pp (kids under 6 gratis) and there is a secure parqueo directly at the port, price is 60C/day.

name: Mr. Seafood
description: Great big area to park, guards at night. Of course we ate here, i dont think they would have let us stay here otherwise. People were very friendly.

name: Carwash
description: Perfect stop for a carwash with really nice guys! Fast, clean and fair price. Looks like you can sleep there too, - they have a big green garden with shade, but we didn't ask.

name: “Huellas”
description: Amazing place to stay in Balgüe, just 200 m down the main road, but it feels like in the middle of the jungle. Big beautiful property, the owner Phoenix is a very good person and lovely guy, he is always happy for volunteers- his Whatsapp contact: +50578771280. Overlanders are very welcome, you can park your car in the green parking lot. There is an outdoor shower, bathroom, communal kitchen and a big garden to chill out, looking at the volcano or the monkeys in the trees. They have rooms too and a dorm for volunteers. We slept a week in our van, helped a little bit around the house and could sleep there for free, using all the facilities. (And refill our water tank.) They have also a very sweet dog “Bella”, she will protect you day and night. We love this place and really can recommend it!

name: Universal Guesthouse
description:
