We paid 22,50 USD for a double pod style bed (yes they exist!). They have a fully equipped kitchen, common areas, laundry for 5 usd (lavado and secado) and parking for maybe 2 medium cars/vans. The place is calm and family style. Much better then the classic backpackers hostels.
Location is good!

name: Loco Coco Loco Hostel
description:
Nice and chilled place in a very good location. Close to everything really but far from the noise of the main road. No A/C during the day, so it s quite hot inside and in the dorms. Aside from this staff is really helpful and super friendly. Breakfast is great with a good variety of fruits, pancakes with maple sirup and good coffee.
Price is one of the lowest in town ($11 in big dorm room) and there's secured parking for motorcycles.

name: Leiza's Parking
description:
Safe parking lot 50 meters from water taxis to Bocas. The lot is very secure and the owner has 5 Rottweilers that stand guard at night. Leiza checked us in with a smile and was very helpful. $3 per day fee. There were at least 25 other cars in the lot and they suggest emailing ahead for a reservation in busy season.  
cristobaljarquitecto@yahoo.com

name: KINTE
description: KINTE is a Bond, where you can leave your vehicle if you want to leave the country without your vehicle. It is in Panama City, but very, very expensive, if you leave the vehicle for some weeks (or months)! The best solution is a about 20-30 minutes out of the city on the road to Colon, in Chilibre. There is a huge bond/storage place from the company "TRANSBAL". Cost US$ 1.50 per day for a MAN Motorhome! See further details (trasnport to/from Chilibre, etc.) in iOverlander in Chilibre.

name: TRANSBAL
description:
The best option for storage of your vehicle,  if you want to leave the country without your vehicle!! US $ 1.50 per day for a MAN truck, plus 1% insurance with a low value. It is a safe, professional and very economic storage place. They handle luxury cars such as Ferraris, Lambos, etc. as well. 

Afterc the storage you have to go to 2 other places in Panama City in order to leave the country. If you do not have a good transport, contact Lorenzo Gordon. He is a excellent taxi driver and speaks fluently english. lorenzogordon1905@gmail.com/ Tel. +507 6716-1851. He drives you wherever you want, cost per hour is US$ 15.-- within Panama City, Chilibre-Panama about US$20.--. You can do all 3 places in about half a day.

       From the bond at Transbal in Chilibre you get all papers. Then you go to Transbal in Panama City (Edificio Siglo XXI, office at ground level, coordinates 8.9958 -79.534081); they prepare the papers for the aduana/custom.
     Then Aduana Central in Panama City (coordinates 8.973909 -79.547051), there you ask for the counter "control vehicular". They put a stamp in your passport that you are allowed to leave the country without the vehicle.

When you come back, you do the same thing reverse, but first you will have to buy a new insurance (US$ 25.-- for a MAN truck for 30 days; for example at "Seguros Fedpa SA" in Panama City, coordinates 8.978285 -79.528618). The custom/aduana gives you the new TIP only with a valid insurance! After the insurance you go to the custom/"aduana central, control vehicular" (new TIP, no costs; and they put a stamp in your passport that you are not allowed to leave the country without the vehicle). Then go to Transbal in Panama City. There you pay the bond and they give you the paper in order to get your vehicle at the bond at Transbal in Chilibre. These 3 places in Panama City you can do within half a day. Lorenzo drives you there and waits for you. Transbal in Chilibre closes at 17.00 o'clock. Driving time about 30 minutes, depending of the traffic

name: Parking colégio international
description: parking just in front of the international highschool. light in the street and a guard call the police to signal our presence. very safe and quiet. just before the shipping. better than the parking next to the police station very dirty.

name: Hostel Mamallena
description: is a great hostel in Bocas del Toro . with WiFi , A/C , and can parking 2 bikes .is 18 usd with Breakfast .

name: Hostal Amador Familiar
description:
The hostel is near the DIJ, so perfect for the shipping actitities.
The parkinglot can hold 2-3 vans; our 21 ft rig fits but I woudn‘t go for a bigger one. 15 $ per Camper with shower, bathroom and wifi, $10 extra for shoreline.

The price was 15 dollars and 10 dollars for electricity. We were parked with cars. The beautiful garden with kitchen and also the access to the toilet and shower was locked at 5 p.m. with a chain and lock. In the morning we had to ask to open it. The woman at the reception is very unfriendly and reacts quite aggressively. So from 5 p.m. you have to ring the bell and so you go through the reception to the toilet, etc. So not at all camper friendly. And also quite loud because it is right on the street for those who are sensitive to noise.

name: Pensión Costa Rica
description: Basic, clean and convenient. $20 for a room with a double bed and fan.  Our bicycles fitted in the room, and there’s a secured area out front which could take motorbikes.  24 hour supermarket opposite, restaurants all around.  A block and a half from the central plaza.

name: Hostal La Aduana, señora Oladis
description:
Simple hostel where you can cook. Shared bathroom, rooms for two people at U $ D 20 with fan and U $ D 30 with air conditioning. It is located in front of the plaza del Town. The owner lives above the hostel, to find her you have to climb all the stairs, The hostel has no sign or bell, it is above the pharmacy. 

The owner is quiet, you can have the kitchen and have a good time. There are not many rules to fulfill. The toilet is not exhaustive but everything is kept tidy. It has no parking but you could leave the car outside because it seems a quiet area and from the balcony you can see it.

name: Spacious pull off right on the beach
description: We have been all over the island and it is slim-picking. This is a nice quiet area along a dirt road heading away from Bocas del Drago. It is tree covered so solar is absolutely minimal shade is great and a breeze today.  The road only goes a bit further before forking to two private gated roads. The beach is only 10 meters and no one within sight. An expat couple who live up the road drove by and suggested it was a great spot to camp. Bonus we heard and saw a troop of 12-15 howler monkeys hanging out just a bit further high on the trees above the hill towards the private properties and they were photogenic! 1-2 bars of Claro a bit spotty. Soft sand entrance for 50 meters no problem for our T3 Vanagon with tires slightly aired down.

name: Dentist - Clinica Arango Orillac
description: Dentists recommended to me by expats who have lived here over 20 yrs. The dentists speak English well, but the receptionist doesn't, so you need to first make the appointment in Spanish. Good treatment (& I needed a lot of stuff doing!!).  Prices were reasonable & standards are high. Parking is easy around here & shops nearby.

name: Country Side Cafe and Store
description: Nice cafe with organic food & coffee from local sources. Also sells home made breads, pies, cake & sauces etc to buy/take-away. Doesn't seem to open for breakfast  ( despite them having a great breakfast menu) but it's great for brunch or lunch. Plenty of parking in the area.

name: Grassy area
description: We slept under the shade of a tree in this little park. Everyone in town was very kínd and welcoming.  No cell or Movil  internet service.

name: Centro Medico Paitilla
description: A huge modern clinic/hospital with specialists of all kinds. Good for treatments or routine check-ups (mamograms etc.). If you can't find what you need here, there's another medical centre next door in the Royal Center (it's all behind the Hard Rock Hotel).

name: Riba Smith and Novey
description:
Good out of town Riba Smith shopping - great for treats and good quality produce, cheeses, breads etc. Easy parking & far easier to get to than the Riba Smiths in town. Also a big Novey hardware/homeware store.
Tap in the car-park is good for filling water tank.

name: waterfalls hike
description: Not far (approx 2km from the road to fall  No.3) but it's steep and muddy in places, even in the dry season. Nice waterfalls but nothing unique here. No wildlife that we saw. $7 is probably too much. Can swim in falls 2 & 3, but of course VERY cold water! For photos, the sun shines on the falls and causes nice rainbows in the afternoon.

name: Villa Coco
description: Nice chilling place! Gorgeous people. Near Santa Catalina Beach. Great pool.

name: Parque National Omar Torrijos
description:
This is the Ranger Station to the Park. The entrance is 5Usd/Person but when we took out our wallet, the Ranger said it is for free at the moment. No idea why or for how long...
From here there is a very rough 4x4 track to the summit El Calvario. From there you can see both oceans when the sky is clear. Really nice short hike (around 35min one way uphill).

Some advice to get here: Shortly after the Las Yayas waterfalls (on iOverlander) the gravel road starts. From here it is about 3km to the station. The road is a very rough and steep 4x4 track with several washouts. The rangers told us, that when it is raining, even they can't drive there anymore. For us the problem were very low hanging big branches. Thats why we needed to turn around and hike up. The road is basically only doable in standard SUVs...
If you make it up there, there is a relatively even parking lot about 400m behind the rangers station. We did not ask, but I am pretty sure you can overnight there, since there are also cabins you can rent... 
Really nice spot and great view!
Since we were not able to drive up, we parked at the waterfall and walked up. Takes about 4h return with some time at the summit...

name: Artesan Market
description:
This is the artesan market from the Lonely Planet. It is a little difficult to find, since it is not on Googlemaps...
They are selling different handmade crafts from local and indigene artists. We found the prices to be cheap and you support the local artists. It seems to be kind of a government project...

name: Va&Ven / Terpel Gas Station
description: Very good place to sleep overnight, secure, fairly good food at Va&Ven, 24h service, showers, clean toilets and it’s for free. Much better than a lot of paid campsites to sleep overnight.

name: Border Check Point with Military
description: Checked our TIP and Passports. Quick and easy

name: Rancho Juancho
description:
Very quite campsite with amazing view over the sea. There are all types of facilities one should need.
Shower, water, wifi, restaurant,... Eddie and Veronica are very friendly. ( they also offer horseriding, diving, kayaking,...)
Price are 5$ each for person in camping and there are cabañas (cabins) too
Eddie can help cycling guys to climb the hill with his car.
7kms from Portobelo

name: Part 2 - DIJ Vehicle Inspection to ship Vehicle
description:
This is the location for picking up your papers after you complete the inspection.
Bypass the line outside and go through the double doors.

Process can take over an hour

name: postnet, photocopie , copy
description: great place for photocopie , copy , create sticker or other service postal (DHL, fedex, UPS)

name: Street parking near DIJ
description: Very quiet, feels safe given near the DIJ, quiet area. Guard at the entrance said it's safe, and proposed us to move closer to the entrance if a space becomes available later, so that he can keep an eye on us.

name: Tropigas
description:
Local tropigas delivery can be found here.  They collect bottles and ferry across to the filling station north of the Bocas ferry port.  Turn around is usually 2-3 days depending on what day you drop it.  Cost was a $10 more than when we filled at a tropigas location on the mainland ($25 v. $15) but it sure beat the ferry price and drive to the middle of nowhere to do it ourselves.  

Recommend calling first to ensure the workers are there.  The boss is at 6584-2287 and if he doesn't answer a worker of his can be reached at 6389-0762.

name: J & H Garden Cabins
description:
Beautiful and quiet cabins in Carenero Island. Only 3 private cabins with private porch and with common big garden; palm trees, bananos, orchids...and the best; the sound of the birds.
Cabins are brand new; fast wifi, hot shower, big bed and kitchenette.  Owner; Robert & Eli speak perfect Spanish and English.                              In this tiny island there are 3 beaches within 15 min walk.      
Clear caribbean water and almost no tourist.                                                   From Carenero to Colon is 1$ /person taxiboat. 3$/person to Bastimento. For us it was a great option to explore the surrondings and have a quiet and private acomodation.                                                                               2 restaurants by the sea, big enough supermarket and surffing school in the island.
Low season 65$ High season up to 95$. But you can talk to them to arrange the price.  Phone: +507  66160200 

3$ per night secure parking at Almirento

name: Sotelo Hotel
description: Good value for money hotel, not appropiate location. Not a safe neibourhood for walking. Average WiFi signal. Restaurant cheap but not the best one

name: Casa Mona Lisa
description: Nice Hostel at the dead end of Calle 55 Este in Panama City. Dormprices between 12-15$ depending on the amount of beds...like usual. privat mini room for 22$. Breakfast included. Street parking possible. No camping, not for rigs. Do not drive down this street with a big rig!! Kitchen and chilling area are nice. A/C in room.

name: Loving Hut vegan restaurant
description: Nice place for vegans (mock meat). Place looks clean and reasonable price.

name: park in front of the "bomberos".
description: quiet place with playground for kinds and free wifi.

name: la fábrica
description: we refill our weather tank.  really good bar, very good beer. if you drink 2 1/2 liters of beer in one drink, you eat free.I do it.

name: Santos boat repair
description:
We had a great experience with Santos who help us to fix our back bumper and repair the exterior of our motorhome.
He was very helpful. He probably can help with shower. 
He usually repairs boats.
Not for mechanic

Contact WhatsApp : +50766919423

We stay at night near the site and it's very quiet and safe with family around.

name: Playa Chiquita
description: Hang a right after the baseball field and follow the road to the beach.  Beautiful beach but sadly covered in plastic debris... not from locals (there is maybe a single person who lives full time on the north end of the beach).  Still a mellow place to camp for a night and the reef has the potential for a good surf break in the right conditions.

name: Ludwig car mechanic and general
description: Ludwig is an English and Spanish speaking mechanic, a little bit German. He repairs many brands, Toyota, Mitsubishi and so on. He is very helpful and friendly. We recommend this mechanic.

name: Nancito Archaeological Museum
description: A small museum where you can see petroglyphs and some Chiriqui culture relics. Entrance is free. Information in Spanish only.

name: Terpel
description: Terpel gas station open 24 hours. We went there in the rainy season and they let us stay under a roof right next to the station. There are toilets, a cold shower and a very modest store. Noisy place, since it is right on the highway. Zero privacy. Good if you just need somewhere to spend the night.

name: La India Dormida Hike & Waterfalls
description:
Convenient place to stay for a night.Begin of a 3 hour trail on the India Dormida mountain. This is moderate / hard trail. We did it with our 3 kids (6,11, 13 yo).
Wonderful view at the summit.

name: Taller Robinson
description: General mechanic. Changed oil and other fluids, checked brakes, and fixed car up without appointment. Super super nice and helpful. 24 hrs  flat changes, battery issues. Mechanic on site until 8pm. Ph# 775-4348

name: Electromecánica Dario
description: Electrics mechanic... fuses, lights, radio, simple, normal car things. Didn’t ask about auxiliary battery, or system. Very nice and fair on prices. Open 8am until necessary. Happy to help more Overlanders. Call/whatsapp ahead: +507 6637-8710

name: las catalinas
description: hostal las catalinas is a colonial house of 130 years, very nice we have 12 rooms with air and wifi tv, and private bathroom, near the beach and jet.

name: Hostel Cristobal Colon
description: Great place to stop for a night before going to Bocas. It looks closed from the street, but walk up the staircase and there is a buzzer. We were charged 10US for a double room. Shared bathroom. The owner let us pull our motorcycle into there back yard for the night. Wifi works good in the common area.

name: Petróleos Ato gas station
description: Gas station close to Calobre. Asked to park and they let us stay for the night and also offered us showers.

name: Good beach
description:
If you come here during the week you can come here. It 's the beach in front of the Banana resort . We stayed one afternoon here . The guard ask us if we needed mask and tuba to make snorkelling. 
when you are one the island , follow the small hike one the left of the hotel mocombo . Climb the hill ,a few of steps during 20 minutes . A good nice beach to enjoy ;)
I m not sure if that work on the weekend ,why not try ....

name: Centro commercial colon 2000
description: Parking lot near hôtel Radisson and commercial center. Ok for one night before shipping. Police patrol with car during night and there is also guards for the 2 casinos nearby. Restaurants and bars around. For colon, it's an acceptable place, felt safe.

name: Colon 2000 Parking area
description: This is the parking area of the Colon 2000 complex that includes a Super 99 grocery store, a Radisson hotel and a couple of casinos among other stores. It is right next to one of the Zona Libre gates. We asked a guard if we could park overnight and he said no problem. There is free Wi-Fi (Internet Para Todos network) at these exact coordinates. Casino bathrooms available. Well lit and apparently safe area. Leveled terrain, and parking spots are big enough for our Ford Expedition -not so sure about bigger rigs but give it a try. We stayed only one night before shipping our truck to Colombia.

name: Restaurant Yolmar’s
description: Restaurant with local food. I paid 5.25 USD for a pollo asado and a coke. Has restrooms and a big parking area which might be used for an overnight stay (I only stopped for lunch).

name: Farmas- pharmacy and health products
description:
This pharmacy sells major medicines at great prices, also Doc Bronners, Burts Bees and many other health store supplies and brands you need. 
May be able to overnight across the street in parking lot. Small food court style dining options too.

name: Archeological Site El Cano
description: This is the turn. Proceed about one mile and follow signs. One of only two open to the public archeological sites in Panama. Interesting little stop. Costa $1 per person. Incl guide. Wear bug spray.

name: Entre 2 aguas
description: Nice and clean and well-organized bed and breakfast, reasonably central with safe parking for motorbikes and cars. rates are from $35 for a double room up to $56 for a three bed room including breakfast, airco, tv and private bathroom. quiet and safe neighborhood

name: Parking behind DIJ at little park
description: Good camp spot behind DIJ 2 at little kid park . Shady spot, Police said OK to park. Arrived in the afternoon for early inspection in the AM.

name: Casa Miller
description:
Treat yourself after the shipping bullsh*
$42 a night includes a breakfast buffet that will last ya all day. Big beautiful rooms, NetFlix in all languages, mini grocery across the street, awesome cheap street food around the corner. 5* restaurants close, staff is top notch. 
Ask for Victor- The Modern Gypsy!!!

name: Carmix Panama
description:
Such amazing mechanics here. Very nice and look for solutions to your car problems. Good prices. 
Put in “Carmix Panama” into Waze or Google Maps if these coordinates don’t work.
Gustavo: +507-6671-2563

name: Terpel gas and truck stop
description: good station, minimal noise until the morning, free wifi (you have to ask for password), showers (donation), bathrooms. felt safe. free

name: Locos Moto Work
description: Issac is an Excellent Mechanic - reasonable rates, worthwhile bringing your bike over on ferry - very competitive with mainland (David and Boquette) rates.  Whats App +507 6416 5840 No problem in getting parts to Bocas.

name: Aduana Divisa
description: You can renew your TIP here! No need to go to the PC or David!

name: Mountain Water Pipe
description: Roadside fresh water. Cool, delicious, and completely free. Pipe comes out of Barú National Park so it doesn’t get much better than this!

name: Fire Station
description: Bomberos here let cyclists stay.  In a room with lots of mats and ceiling fans.  They let me take a shower and use their kitchen.

name: Fire Station
description: Bomberos here are really cool.  Not much space but they fed me and allowed me to set up my tent behind their trucks.  If it wasn't the rainy season I would probably just set up on their lawn.

name: Citi Bank bei Niko's Cafe
description: Nearest Citi Bank to the Balboa Yacht Club and/or DIJ Police Inspection. Here you can pay e.g. when you ship with Seaboard Marine / Tea.

name: hibiscus garden
description: well run resort style hotel and hostal. has a few dorm beds for $15. I managed to get a private room for $20 with private bathroom because it was low season. heaps of parking for all type of vehicles. if you have a big rig they may let you park up here. not 100% sure as I'm on a motorcycle and was the only person staying at the time. there is honestly heaps of space. very secluded, very safe and quiet.  has a private beach which is just ok. not for surfing. WiFi slow. but Movistar works just fine. kitchen and restaurant. it's 10kms from santa Catalina. santa Catalina has More options of accommodation, food and surf. but this place is nice is you want peace and quiet. heaps of bird life. my guess is it is very busy during holiday season.

name: La Perla del Farallon
description: It is a small b & b located in front of a beautiful beach, very quiet, the area is very safe. It has 3 rooms with air conditioning, wifi, parking, hot water. Ideal place for families. Continental breakfast. Rooms with private and shared bathrooms. Beautiful nature

name: Pension Hostal Viajero
description: Paid €25 for modern double room with good ac and private bathroom. Kitchen available to use which was very clean. Laundry service €5 per 5kg. Fast WiFi! We stored our bicycles in the locked car park.

name: Raquel’s Ark
description: Raquel Frame, who lives in this house has opened an animal sanctuary on her Really small property to try to save as many animals as she is able to. The locals already know her and bring her animals that are in need of help, animals that are run over by cars, animals mistreated by people or illegally kept in captivity. She keeps accepting them... That being so, and under these circumstances, this will be an opportunity and a privilege of life to have a real and close contact with several animals, not to satisfy our touristy ego, but because they are within a rescue protocol program. If the animals do not meet the necessary requirements to be released into the wild you can even pick some of them up in your arms. We might not agree with all that we see there but it's a fact that she tries to do the best she can and knows.  https://www.aboveusonlyskies.com/things-to-do-volcan-panama/

name: Parking lot- Fotos/Fotografías
description: This is a gated, level, grassy parking lot across from the fire station.  We paid $5 for overnight.  There is running water and a pit toilet (rough).  Things are a little insecure in Boquete right now (according to locals) so this felt best.  Also allowed dog to roam free.

name: El Explorador Jardín
description: A wonderful, quirky garden and collection of clever sayings (in Spanish) and whimsical painted junk. All arranged beautifully. Benches, views, overlooks, swings and bunnies. Bring a snack and relax a while. $5.00 per person. Plenty of parking up a bumpy road. Well marked low wires. Could probably even park here for the night, very tranquilo.

name: Corto Circuito
description:
One of our favorite spots in Cambutal area. Drive up hill or (better) on the sand to get here. Walking distance from rivermouth, you can surf low to mid-tide a perfect right hand wave. Watch for turtles if driving at night.

Our Friends Benni and Alvaro live right next to the camping area.

Find pictures in our instagram @vibesofpanama

name: Broncos Lavamatico
description: Basic laundry- fast and cheap. Friendly lady

name: Express Inn PTY
description: Very basic, cheap hotel. Ask for room 212 for best AC.  Free airport shuttle. Breakfast incl. Pets okay.  Pool. Parking for smaller rigs.  WiFi in lobby and some rooms. Paid $50 per night for two persons. Very near Copa Cargo and Tocumen.

name: Don Quijote
description: Great place to have a great meal. Pizza, pasta, meat and fish dishes. Friendly French owners.

name: CopaCargo Mascota check in counter
description:
START HERE FOR PET RESERVATIONS- At this counter sits the woman with all the power.  She will either admit or decline your pet on the flight of your choice.  After you have done the veterinarian health certificate and the MIDA form you need to come here. Begin by looking at flights that work for you. (mornings are best so you have time for paperwork at other end, read about it in ioverlander at Cartagena airport before you go)
Once you have flight in mind, go to this counter with the kennel, the dog, copies of all paper work and patience. She will approve the kennel and the pet.  Note that if the pet is aggressive, scary, old, or certain breeds she can deny it to fly! You must have food and water taped to the kennel and two dishes to dispense them in.  (Kennels available at Discovery Center also marked on iOverlander)
Ask her to give you any forms that are needed.  Complete them and have her review and submit them  Wait for her to give you a bill of lading and confirmation number that corresponds with the flight you selected.  Pay the fees and confirm that things are all set.  Ask her where and when you need to check in with the pet.  Ask her to email you all confirmations and documentations. 
Our story- We arranged all the reservations by email with CopaCargo.  We went directly to the loading dock confirm the kennel. We submitted photos of all paperwork and were send confirmations.  We believed we were all set for the flight and then the night before they sent MORE papers to complete in a locked PDF format.  We found a way to complete them and emailed the papers back the night before the flight.  The next morning we checked in with the dog 3.5 hours before the flight. (as per the paperwork we had completed) This power-woman said that we were too late, then said that nothing was confirmed and we had no reservation, then looked for errors on the papers, problems with the kennel, etc.  She ultimately reviewed all the saved emails I had screen shots of and all the photos of being at the loading dock and relented.   Essentially she was trying to do everything possible to deny flying the dog on the flight we had reserved.  I have never seen a company work so hard to NOT accept business.  Even once we were finished and ready to walk away I was told I would get an email describing the pick up process and confirming the booking while we were in flight.  It has been a week and no such email has yet been received.  Please feel free to contact me for further info. 
NOTE: I cannot condone illegal or immoral behavior, but there are veterinarians that will write a certificate stating that your dog needs to accompany you on the airplane.  (ESA) If you and your pet are up for it, that may be simpler than this crazy process.  You still need health documents, but you can avoid CopaCargo altogether.

name: Camel service car
description:
a few KMS from the Sixaola border, very good service, secure parking, 100% recommended,
we change to our truck (Renault traffic) box oil, engine oil and engine filter, no problem and very good prices.

lubricentro a pocos KMS de la frontera Sixaola, muy buen servicio, predio con seguridad para aparcar, 100% recomendable,  
nosotros le cambiamos a nuestra  camioneta ( Renault tráfic) aceite de caja, aceite de motor y filtro de motor, ningún problema y precios muy buenos.

name: Pixvae Town
description:
From Soná, a 45 km dirt/gravel (with some very steep hills) road will lead you to this amazing town. ***4x4 ONLY***
Beatutiful landscapes, small river crossings, small waterfall on the right side of the road, lots of wildlife (Including big chances of seeing toucan and blue butterflies). There's no reception here, only wifi on the small school and solar electricity. Amazing food on "Merless" fonda, cold beers and "nightlife" (Karaoke, salsa, dominó, etc) there as well. You can take a local boat to Coiba (only 25 min away) or scuba dive in near reefs (We recomend Doña Juana Bay and Island in low tide. Camping on empty lot in front of the ocean, close to scuba company and the dock. 

For more info and pictures contact us: 
-Instagram/Facebook: @vibesofpanama
-Email: info@vibesofpanama.com

name: Finca Maria y Chon - Organic Farm
description:
Beautiful little farm in the middle of the jungle. Maria takes you on a tour of the farm (explains everything in Spanish only!) and then cooks for you the delicious organic produce they farm (total $10).

You can walk from town across a pedestrian bridge or take the 4x4 road down from El Alto: not on any maps apps. Just follow the dirt road down on the other side of the mountain. Its not too steep and a little river crossing. Need a bit of clearance - my Ford Explorer 4x4 did just fine.

name: Cerro Azul Waterfalls and natural Pools
description:
The best waterfalls and pools in Panama (free). You can easily climb from one pool to the next (5)!
The water is cool but not too cold. Come early or at noon to catch the sun...

(The Google Maps location is way off!)

name: Turn for Cerro Azul Waterfall
description:
Turn here and follow the main dirt road (no 4WD required) for about 2km, till you see a high fence with „Privado No Pase“.
Then follow the footpath and Manu stairs down to the pools.

name: Caracoral Hotel Boutique & Spa
description: Nice place, amazing rooms, thermal water pool and beautiful spa.

name: The swimming pool / La piscina
description: Beautiful quiet beach. It’s 40min-1 hr walk from the end of the road. We were the only ones there. Follow the trail on map.me or the trail along the beach. It’s paradisiaco Caribbean.

name: Báltija Ferry
description:
This is the right location where the ferry arrives and leaves. Schedule to Almirante 10am - 3pm (***or 5pm on Tuesday!!) *Monday closed. 
It is also 55$ to go back...

name: Epic Road, Epic Views
description: Turn off to this road is at la yeguada. Best motorcycle road we have found in Panama so far. Not on the map.

name: Pension Nueva Florida
description: Guest house / hostel, ok place for one night. We got caught in a heavy rainstorm and were directed here from a local. We got a double room with fan and private bathroom for 15US. It is a yellow house right beside bar y jardín fortuna. There is a phone number and a buzzer on the front door.

name: toucan smiles
description:
very comfortable hostel rooms $12 a night.  $30 at night for a private room with air conditioning.  excellent food at a reasonable price. this hostel is in an excellent location for travelers taking the sailboat to Colombia.  it is located in Puerto Lindo not far from the water
it is about 1, 000m
 from the Lynden Bay Marina. the only drawback is there is no Wi-Fi and cell service is unreliable. there is reliable cell service 300M up the road

name: Do It
description: Bed Bath & Beyond meets Home Depot type store. Had both iso-butane and 16oz coleman propane tanks for camping stoves and other camping gear as well.

name: Chiriqui Storage
description: RV Campground, Flea Market, Moving & Storage Service, Landmark & Historical Place. They hold garage sales with a wide variety of products. These take place on the first and third Sunday of each month. Location - 17km northbound 20km southbound David Boquete road (1.72 mi) Dolega, Chiriqui, Panama. Prices vary depending on the services required. Phone 507 6503 7756 We parked our 33 foot long (10 meter) motorhome at this site and the owners, Hellmut, Linda & Penny, were very gracious and helpful. Highly recommended.  We are happy to receive travelers - our location is quiet and peaceful.

name: APSSA
description: You can renew your car insurance here for a month for $25. Friendly service.

name: SBS Rooms
description:
Very nice place, newly opened in September 2018, surrounded by nature, no neighbours, very calm. Interesting for animal lovers, there are a lot of birds around. The owner Mike also speaks english, has a lot of infos about the area and can help you with organizing tours to the nearby National Park, to an indigenous village, sunset tours, horseback riding, fishing trips and ATV-tours. We stayed here for 3 days and he charged us 17 $ for a private room with shared toilets. Everything very clean and comfortable. One of our best accomodations on our travel. You can built up your tent in his garden and there is a lot of space for big rigs as well. 10 minutes by car to Playa Hermosa and 12 minutes to Boca Chica where the boats are leaving for the National Park and the whale watching tours (from Juli - November).
Phone nr.: +507 6144 2277
Email: sales@stepbysteptravel.net
It is the last house in this dead end road on the left side.

name: Terrazas de Sabanitas
description: New mall, which is located 10 km before Colon. Perfect spot for stocking up, if you arrive in Panama or prepare for shipment to Columbia. Flat terrain. Consider, that you have to ask the security first! They will double check it with their boss. Try to be there not later than 5pm.

name: Computer/ phone repair “Salva Mi Maquina”
description:
This place was a life saver for us. Our MacBook Pro died and in the stores it was really expensive to get a brand new one (around 30% more than US prices). 
Here they did their best to get our MacBook covered under warranty and when they couldn’t they sold us a near new second hand MacBook at a good price with warranty. They also repair phones, GoPros etc. Really nice team. Speak both English & Spanish. Recommended by Expats : )

name: Dive Base Coiba
description:
Dive operation for Coiba Island, surrounding islands, and local areas.  Contact the owner Kevan to set up diving trips.  He is a long time diver and explorer of the Coiba Natural Park and will take you on a much more insightful journey than the dive shops in Santa Catalina.

For details email:
info@divebasecoiba.com

name: Chávez shop
description: Super good mechanic, he help us a lot in our ford f 150 4.9 from the 95. MAP problem... he’s number is ‭+507 6673 3418‬

name: Spanish by the River
description:
A combined hostel and spanish school. Very clean and well managed. Nice and cozy garden with hammocks, sunbeds, fruittrees, chickens etc. 
Paid 14 USD for a room which actually is a two bed dorm, but I was alone in the room during my stay. 
Kitchen, TV-room, outside sitting/relaxing area.
Grocery shop and restaurant 2-300 meters down the road. Boqutete town center is ~ 4 kms away.
A quiet and relaxed place indeed!

name: Pencas Hostel
description: Very simple hostel but directly at the sea. Rooms are very small and only one bathroom for all dorms. We paid 8$ pp. they have a small kitchen and quite good WiFi. You have a terrace and you can go swimming directly from there if you want. What we didn’t like was the owner who was a bit weird and smoking weed inside the house in the evenings while watching tv. No power outlets inside the dorms.

name: La Palma by RLM
description: Very nice and clean hostel. Has an awesome big kitchen area. The dorms have fan and AC (at least during the night). Nice common areas with a lot of hammocks to chill out. We only paid $5 for the dorms but I think it was a special price since they are still working everywhere to finish the renovation of the hostel (the super nice and friendly owners took it over 2 months ago). Wifi works fine but not super fast. Enough space for some bikes.

name: Más Canal Turista Internacional
description: This tour goes to the Panama Canal and stops at a few places on the way. But be aware: although it says ‚includes transfer for Miraflores lock at the Panama Canal, where you will receive a brief explanation of how it functions, and with luck would be able to see the transit of a ship...‘ you pay 30US only for transport and another 20US to actually see the Panama Canal etc I find this deliberately misleading esp. as I asked beforehand if I could only see the Canal and not the museum etc  for no additional money

name: Auto Mercantil
description:
We originally went to Autostar, Mercedes Benz Trucks which is nearby. After spending 3 nights on their carpark they said that they couldn't help us as the had no spare parts which would have to come from Germany.
Mercedes suggested we came here so we did. They started working on almost immediately.
They identified both an oil and a diesel leak. They rectified the diesel and after a test drive they let the engine cool down to work on the cylinder head which had been replaced in San José, Costa Rica.
Following day we test drove again and oil leak rectified too. No spare parts needed, especially from Germany.
These guys seem to know their business. Heard the sound of torque wrenches being used which I didn't hear in Costa Rica.

name: Fedpa insurance
description: Fedpa insurance office in Penonomé. You can renew here your insurance before going to customs in Divisa. 25$ for a van.

name: Parking next to the beach (gated)
description:
Wide parking place right next to the beach. 6 dollars per night. You can find some nice shadowed spots. It can definitely fit bit rigs since once a big bus with locals parked there. When we were there (off season) the owner was just there on weekends but he let us stay also during the week and we closed the gate when we went away. No facilities but the restaurant on the other side of the road charges 1$ per shower.

For surfers: 
the parking is next to the beach break. if you wanna surf the main point of Santa Catalina, you might wanna go to a restaurant or hostel up in the hill or closer to the town, it's a bit of a walk from the parking.

name: Casa X
description: Restaurant with a few appartments. Verry friendly people, also english and dutch speaking.

name: Hotel Anachoreo
description:
Wonderful small hotel operated by two lovely Cambodian sisters with amazing cuisine talents where most everything is home grown.
Beautiful views of the National Park, WiFi, hot water and cute clean rooms. Safe for parking motorcycles and campers. Walking distance to the small village of Santa Fé. $66+ taxes (including breakfast) for two people. Also guest house also available for weekly and monthly stay ($300/week with private kitchen) www.anachoreo.com

name: Caledonia Community
description:
Normally it's a place for gringo tour but a guy with small boat gave me a ride from Puerto Obaldia, 40$ with bycicle.
The young guy who take care ask me 10$ for private cabaña, normally charge 16 or more.
Bucket shower, toilet, light. No plug for phone, wifi, kitchen... just enjoy the view and the tranquillity, i was alone here.
There is just one restaurant on this island but i didn't tried.
Water comes with a plastic pipe from mountains but they have three tank with a gravity filter.

name: Panamerican hill
description:
This place  works just for cyclo traveller or brave motorcyclists.
Coming from south I was able to cycle and push my bike in the water channel.
There is an hidden grass area with place for some tent or the flat sand area forward that is visible from highway but give you a best view and i think nobody will climb here...
Coming from south i found 2 waterfall, water taste good but think is better to filter/boil it.
Some noise of big trucks.

name: Yarisnori restaurante y hotel
description: Very nice restaurant and hotel on the beach 45 dollars for a room for 4 ps per night wifi, tv, hot showers, fan, run with solar panel. Beach good for kids in front of the restaurant, walking distance to playa estrella. Really nice owners!If you decide to leave the van and sleep in a nice place this is the spot! Take the bus from Boca del toro and get to Boca del Dragon, last stop, 2.5 dollars p/p.

name: El Tucan
description: Place of education for the protection of nature. To teach children. There is a little cottage for rent. They know the area verry well

name: waterfalls and swimming - best river spot ever
description:
An incredible big river of clean cool (but not cold) water with a lovely tall waterfall to shower under. Rocks to jump off. Places to explore.
Parking just before the bridge with steps down most of the way, then slippy rock to trip on as you approach the water.
Could happily spend a whole day here.
Unfortunately vehicle not visible from the river is a possible concern.
Didn't see anything bigger than an iguana but maybe keep an eye out for crocodiles?
Free. No one there when we were on a Friday afternoon.

name: like a troll, under a bridge
description:
Heading towards colon just before this bridge you can drive down a steep hill to the right, past a restaurant and camp along a dirt road next to a nice river. Lots of locals swimming in the day and fishermen.

We had no hassle and a good night's sleep. We hid under the bridge to keep dry before shipping in the morning. Loud by 530am but was a good sleep until then.

We know some others who came before us pitched their tent inside the restaurant after eating there too.

name: Immigration Office Panama
description:
Immigration office of Panama. Bring enough money. The guy wants to see at least 300 $ per person in cash and there isn't really a possibility to get cash. 
The trip by boat to Carti or Miramar and then to Panama City costs at least 160 $ per Person.

name: Western Union
description: This is the only possibility to get cash in Puerto Obaldia. There is a guy which whom you can do it. It works, but you have to pay 1 $ per hour in the internet.

name: Mae Lewis Centro Medico
description: I had to go to the hospital due to problems with the stomach. I came and wait for 30 minutes. The care was very good and cheap. I got medicine and after one hour I was ready to go! Nice place to go!

name: Hostal Carolina Princess Marbella
description: Nice hostal with different accomodations, swimming pool, breakfast, use of kitchen, laundry for 6 $ fast wifi. Parking in front of the house for small and medium rigs, end of a road felt very safe. We stayied for 3 nights for 50 dollars in a private room with bathroom, breakfast included. 15$ p/p in dorm. Very nice and helpful staff.

name: Nahua
description:
Nice, basic hostel across the road from the beach. Pizza from stone oven, and good WiFi.

Private rooms with or without private bath, as well as dorm rooms. Safe motorcycle parking under roof.

name: solymar restaurante
description: Nice place with typical food at good prices. Beach front, parking. Highly recommended.

name: Place Simon Bolivar
description:
Around the central place at side of the church, shade at the middle of afternoon. Free wifi all around, very quiet at night and safe. People are very friendly and there is the municipal police all the day and night.
Many restaurant and tienda, bank. Water and electricity on the place.
Good spot for one or two nights.

name: Seguras Fedpa
description: Insurance for truck, probably new location of an other place

name: YarisNori Place
description: You can camp here in the parking lot next to the restaurant at the end of the road towards playa Estrella. They have WiFi, bathrooms, shower & water. You can use the restaurant as well as the sun chairs and hammocks. For us this is a better deal then the one just before. Ask the owner for the price he charges since he wasn’t too sure when we were there.

name: El Refugio Las brisas del Diablo
description:
If you are going to or from Bocas this spot is a MUST stop on the road. The sickest view of the volcano Barú and the mountains around. The hotel has 2 rooms and they offer the best food in Panama. You must reserve in advance for rooms & food service but it’s all really worth it !!
Nice Canadian couple running the place :)

name: Beside lake La Yegada
description: We were here during christmas time. With high clearance and small rig you could go all the way to the end of the road where you have an amazing camp spot for yourself at the shore of the lake with amazing mountain views.

name: Bomberos de Chitre
description: We stopped at the bomberos (fire department) and asked if they had potable water and they filled up our 5 gallon. Friendly guys !

name: Jilguero Cabins
description: We consider this just a one night step to catch the ferry at Bocas del Toro next day before noon, but the place and hiking trails of the Fortuna Forest Reserve are so nice that we extend an extra day here. ELSA the keeper is very nice and will allow you to stay camping for 10$ per night. At the entrance you have gorgeous space in a grassi area under trees that will protect from strong wind at night. Big rigs maybe have difficulties in the narrow entrance. 2 or maybe 3 cars could fit in.

name: Dirt Sunrise Beach
description:
Just keep taking the road past the Caretaker beach spot. Several water crossings. Nothing too bad for a slightly lifted truck with good tires. 
Eventually you'll pop out onto this beach. On one end is a small waterfall. 
Nice simple beach with no one around.

name: CMA CGM
description: Here you get the waybill. Here you get the waybill

name: Paraiso Police Station
description: Safe and shady Spot in Front of Police station. perfect view to the ships on the Panamacanal.free. Quiet at night

name: Limpia and Doblada Lavandería Laundry
description: $17 for 30lbs. Less than 24 hour turn around and we actually forgot some stuff so he did one more load for us within an hour and a half before we pulled out of town! Super nice owner. Highly recommend!

name: beach under San Lorenzo
description:
Beautiful place to stay couple of days before shipping to Colombia!
Grassy spot with big and flat surface. The see is not cleanest (no waves- it's a bay). Nice breeze and you get some shade from trees. Local come to fishing. A securuty guy come at 7pm to check us and let us stay here (no problem). Very few mosquitos and little black flies.You can hear howler monkeys. This is the best place we found in Panama right after Bocas del Toro. No services. Free

name: Posada Media Luna
description:
Posada Media Luna is an ecotourism project in the Naso indigenous community of Bonyic. 
Accomodation is in simple traditional houses for 15 / 20 USD. Meals can be arranged for 5 USD pro person (the food was delicious!).
The coordinator of the project is Raul Quintero (www.ocen.bocasdeltoro.org).
I have slept in a room. I have asked Raul if he is willing to allow Overlanders to camp in their cars and he said Yes (for a fee, of course. Suggested 5 USD per person or 10 USD per car; the money goes to the community). A simple toilet and shower is provided. 
Excursions in the Parque National de la Amistad can be organised, or boat trips upriver the Rio Teribe to visit the village where the King of the Naso people is living. 
Staying here is a great way to support a local ecotourism project: the village is super quiet, people friendly and one can swim in the Rio Teribe. 
The gravel road from El Silencio to Bonyik is in very good condition (ok for 2WD).

name: Tello & Tello Torneria
description: Came here as our spare wheel had rusted into our door. We arranged to see them through Josh in Boquete (highly recommended mechanic). Showed up at 8am and within 2 hours had a reinforced metal plate for a $30, a solution to a problem we've been ignoring since Canada. Super sweet couple working here.

name: CRC mechanics
description: Recommended to come here by Josh in Boquete, showed up at 11am within 20 mins were working on our alignment and charged a fair price

name: Club Pacifico Sur
description: Very quiet place in front of Cebaco Gobernaro islands (far from 30min by boat - 60USD go n return). Good to chill a couple days. Cost 27USD for double bed, Careful kitchen is not available as you can see on the pics but the owner will cook everything you want.

name: Heavens Cafe
description: Cute little cafe with good milkshakes. Not the cheapest ($3 shakes) but blistering fast internet. 30 up , 10 down. Great place to get some work done

name: El Llantero
description: Came for alignment and to fix a slow puncture. Nice lounge. WiFi down but nice people, super empty and chilled. Alignment was $30, puncture fix was $5. They showed me and explained why it couldn't be aligned as we needed new suspensions parts. First garage to not just give us a rubbish job and charge the full whack.

name: Hostal doña irma
description:
Very nice and clean hostal, two blocks away from the center. Irma was very kindly with us.
25 usd the room for two people.
The only problem was that the hostal dont have kitchen

name: Lavandería Mia
description: Great cheap coin laundry. Wash .75 fry $1. Fonda next door but we haven't tried yet

name: Lavanderia san juda
description: Came here when the other lavandería round the corner had no dryers. Identically cheap set up, 75c wash $1 dry.

name: La Cueva del Draco
description: Very friendly ecocamp established by a Quebecoise, based on working in exchange for accommodation. Very quiet nigth far from all the tourist crazyness, just listening  to the forest. Free camp in the parking entrance.

name: Quetzal Hotspring
description:
Nice cabins just created in a farm with access to three hotsprings. 5Km access road is well identified in the way coming from Volcan city. Need high clearance 4x4 and not for big rigs, but is a nice 4weling route with some challenging steps. 
100$ for a room of 4 very well equipped. Springs are not very hot 36-37 C, but enough to relax when outside is 12 C. 
Electricity is being generated by small hidro power plants. 

Crosing the river and continue the road will match with Mount Totumas lodge but could be challenging. Nevertheless could be posible to camp as we have been told.

name: Las Palmas Plaza Central
description: Nice pueblo, with welcoming and friendly people, you can stay at the las palmas falls, but here you can see the local kids playing at the plaza. Talk to locals and have a nice fell of people that lives here.

name: Sandy road
description:
there is a little part that is more rough, it is doable without stopping but be aware of the height of your vehicule with branches and bending tree. 
You can also stay at this point here there is actually a place to park just before another hostel restaurant with wifi by the beach! wonderful place

name: Taberna Griega
description:
Francisco, the owner, offers you greek food
There is a toilet, shower and really good views
If you are tired to be in town, this is your place
Teófilo takes care of the place and he is a really nice person!
They are both very friendly!

name: Cascadas Quiqui
description: Allegedly Panamas highest waterfall! Highly recommended! Very pretty! You can take a Collectiva puplic transport to here and walk just 15min! payed 3usd entrance fee! got him down from 5 ... but i think one or two dollars is the standard price! still worth it! enjoy the shower under the waterfall!

name: street parking
description:
Parked here for one night to visit the cascadas de Quiqui! 
I talked to the people around... shy but very friendly! left the Camper here and went with the Moto to the cascadas! you can take a colectiva from here as well!

name: Cacique, finally a lovely place
description:
After a night in PuertoBello and a might in Puerto Lindo finally I found the Caribbean paradise that I was looking for.
Cacique is a small village, by the Caribbean that have less plastic rubish than Puerto Lindo, Puerto Belo y Guaira. Beautifull beach, and very friendly people. hi
MapsMe don't recognize the road to this spot , that is a five km not paved but very good road, that begins 500 meters before Puerto Lindo.
I stopped just in the street. Even is a public street it is good to ask locals for staying here, it's a nice practice everywere.
Very recommended.

name: National park administration office
description:
I just asked the rangers if I can visit the park and sleep here at night and they told  that have no problem. I fell safe and I didn't pay anything.
The National park Alto de Campana is small, 4800ha, wirh a few good trails to enjoy the forest and the view. Recommended for a day. There is a
paved road to get here, and from here to the trails entrance have 3km uphill on the same good paved road.
I came wirh a big rig.

name: Wingo at Panama Pacific Airport
description: Cheaper flights to Cartagena on this airline than those leaving Tocumen Airport, but BEWARE:. if you don't print your boarding passes, they charge you $15!

name: Quetzal Eco Hotel and Spa
description: Hotel is at the end of the road after Cerro Punta. Asked after a room and was quoted $95 for one person. When I said that was over budget was offered dorm at $25. Dorms are three 12 bed cabins - really nice and each has own shower, toilet complete with towels, soaps etc. Good beds and bedding - important it got cold here at night. The cabins appear lightly used and I got it all to myself. Definitely much nicer than the average backpackers. Excellent wifi and secure parking immediately in front of cabin. Village is small but tourist orientated so some shops and food options.

name: spa very good
description: spa with rooms to rent out for cheap. very clean with private bathrooms. pool. laundry. kitchen. great vibe

name: Pozas de Águas Blancas
description: Site a few minutes from the town of Olá, there are no indicative signs to get to the point, it is advisable to ask the locals. A very clean river that contains very nice pools, with stones and different descents of water that form natural pools and different jets. very quiet and very safe, to enjoy the day. And Free :-) Rich to jump from the stones up to 7 meters high. --- Sitio a pocos minutos del poblado de Olá, no existen carteles indicativos para llegar al punto, es recomendable preguntar a los lugareños. Un río muy limpio que contiene pozas muy bonitas, con piedras y distintos descensos de agua que forman piscinas naturales y distintos chorros. muy tranquilo y muy seguro, para disfrutar del día. Y Gratis :-) Rico para saltar de las piedras hasta 7 metros de altura.

name: Pension Madrileña
description:
Best place we found here in Panamá City. Clean and near from buses and Metro.  Little markets, bakeries and other shops nearby.
We paid U$ 66,00 for 3 days here for 2 persons.
 Wifi, warm showers, TV and AC. 
Big room. No parking place. Perfect to travelers that wait their cars coming from Colombia.
Made our reservations through Booking.com

name: Camping at Maria y Chon Organic Farm
description:
Someone in town recommended me this place so I came and asked if I could camp here. They allowed me to set up my tent in one of three recently built leveled terraces made for this purpose in their backyard (6USD pppn), a lot of trees and roofed surfaces to hang your hammock and chill out. Clean bathroom with cold shower and they allowed me to use their kitchen. They know a lot of town's history, places to visit and hikes you can do, Santa Maria River is just 5min walk. 
The whole family is very welcoming and nice, they offer an orchid and coffee tour (5USD pp) and meals cooked with farm's products (5USD each).
There's a cars road in front but just a pedestrian bridge to cross the river so you have to cross in shallow waters. I did it with my loaded bicycle, crossing the bridge and riding most of the road but the last meters were it gets steeper.
Had an amazing two weeks sharing with Maria y Chon, learning a lot about Panamanians life, farming, organic practices and helping them when they needed a translator.

name: Meryland Hotel
description:
Nice place but lockated in a not so safe neighborhood.
Big rooms with slooooow Wifi, hot showers, TV and AC. Wery good Queen Size beds.
Best price of all we looked.
Better make your reservations before.
Has a nice restaurant with complete Menu for U$ 5,00. Beer at the bar for U$ 1,25.
We used it when we came to pickup our car that we shipped ftom Cartagena here to Colon.
Beware that almost any keys can open any door rooms. We where in the room and a suspect man suddenly came in and when he saw us he asked if we wanted towels. Do not leave money or every other valued stuff alone in your room.

name: lavandaria Mi Barrio
description: Self service or drop off laundry service about 5 minute walk from the ferry terminal where you take the carry with your van. The lady was super friendly and it was fairly cheap. Only small issue is it is in a fairly "ghetto" area, this was how everyone we spoke to referred to. The lavandaria is completely chill but we were walking around while we waited and a few blocks away people were stopping us and telling us we should wait at the laundry. But it was a lively little area super cool just to sit at and people watch. Also a fairly large supermarket just across the street. Not many fruits or vegetables but the prices for everything else was far less than we found in town.

name: Se Feliz Restaurant and Mall
description:
I was in shopping rush till 9pm in Discovery Center ... they have everything!!!! So i asked them if they let me stay in their fenced and guarded parking lot. The very friendly manager had to say no but recommended this place! 
talked with the two security guys here ... no problem. Cops wave friendly back when cruising by! feels save... restaurants might have wifi. corner casino could be entertaining! ...unfortunately  bit noisy! oh well ... homeisparkedsaveatleast

name: Restaurante y Bar La Costeña
description:
We camped here after talkink to the owner Alexander, that offered us a shadowed place right in front of the restaurant.
The restaurant closes at 8 PM during the week. At weekends can be noisy.
We stayed with the bathrooms key because they are locked to prevent water missuse.
Beach right in front. Shadow and other basic facilities.Showers and toillets have a cost of U$ 0,50 each.

name: Istanbul Place S.A
description: They sold me tires at a very good price compared to Costa Rica, they also checked my vehicle and agreed to let us use their parking overnight with electricty. Very nice clerk that speaks english and a very complete store for vehicles.

name: Istanbul Place S.A
description: Huge Gas Station, with lots of parking space for big rigs. Right beside to the car shop they have electricity and parking available. We were allowed to sleep in their parking spot for one night, just for filling and gas and we also bought sole tires at their shop. There are supermarkets across the street and walking distance downtown.

name: Hotel Semiramis
description: Right in the center of town, we got a very great deal for 30 usd the night we nice rooms for two people, their big parking lot made it easy for our big rig. Its just a minute away walking from customs, and supermarkets. We are looking to sleep in the rig for one more night in their big parking lot, they are ok with it.

name: Bicycle carton box - Rali Store
description:
If you fly from Panama to Colombia and want to take your bicycles you need carton boxes to put your bicycles in while flying.

At this big bicycles store called Rali Store we got two boxes for free.

Ask for “cajas de bicicleta” 
If you ask for bicycle boxes they have no idea what you’re talking about.

name: Spot before the Canyon
description:
We went here as the police denied us to sleep at the parking of the canyon. It seems ok for them here.
Good spot, it is a large grassy area,  with possible shade and access to the river

name: streets of colon
description:
Just get robbed by 3 guys in the street in front of people and a cop who doesn't even moved a finger. (just 1 street from police station)
avoid the city

name: Waterfall camp
description: There is a small park right before the waterfall. We arrived kind of late so decided to spend the night. Not perfectly flat but if you have even a small piece of wood to drive onto you will be good. Nice to wake up and go for a swim. Also good spot to break up the drive from bocas to the Pacific.

name: Good overnight spot
description: Quite, far from the road, cool at night and nice during the day. Just a pull of the road going up to Palo Seco Reserve. We’ve seen only one car going up the narrow paved road. Great to spend a nice night. No facilities, 3 bars Movistar, free

name: RDG Taller de Motos Parts & Service.
description:
Mechanc Shop for:
Harley Davidson, Kawasaki, BMW, Yamaha, can-am, Ducati, Suzuki, Polaris.

They Speak fluently french, and some Englisch.

Very helpfull....

name: STICKERS PRINT
description:
For 200 Stickers (7cmx7cm) in BEST quality we paid 76 USD (including taxes).
They do it for the next day. Very professional and recommendable!


www.stickersprint.com.pa
+507 388 19 09
Facebook/Instagram: stickersprint

name: Coconuts Paradise
description:
Amazing wild spot just 30m of the sea, very quiet and looked safe. There is some fishermans at night and early in the morning, very beautiful to see boats with the sunrise. Little bit of trash but you can take 5 minutes and clean a bit. Enjoy this paradise! 

Edit: Not a paradise at all. Not Quiet. Not wild. Not clean.

name: Police Station
description:
After we went to the parking close to the water taxi and got asked for 5$ per CALENDAR day (Ford e350 so not a big rig), we decided to ask here and they allowed us to stay for two nights (free, level, safe!).
We stayed first night (arrived at 6.00pm, got asked when we were leaving at 7.40am knocking on the door), then went to park to the place close to water taxi (day only and we agreed 3$). 
We did the boat tour (25$ + 5$ national park fee + 8$ return boat to boca del toro) for the day and then came back at 5.30pm and asked once again to stay. They agreed because it was the last day.

name: Road not passable
description: Google Maps may send you down this way. You’ll have to turn around.  The road becomes very narrow with rickety wooden bridges. The first two are passable but the third is only passable by bicycle or motorcycle. There’s no space to turn around. You will have to backup.

name: Amazing wild camping spot
description: Incredible wild camping point. You are in the middle of the jungle. There is a roof to cover the rain or to park next door and have a large gallery. There is also a tower of about 8-10m that can be climbed and have a great view. The sound of the jungle is heard all the time, mainly the howler monkeys. --- Increíble punto de acampe agreste. Estás en medio de la selva. Hay un techo para cubrirse de la lluvia o para estacionar al lado y tener una gran galería. También hay una torre de unos 8-10m que se puede subir y tener una vista estupenda. Se escucha todo el tiempo el sonido de la selva, principalmente los monos aulladores.

name: Comida China Buffet 5$
description:
buffet 4.75 all you can eat for lunch! 
5.25$ with tax. No need to buy drinks, they have free water with lemon at the end of the buffet.always super packed so get in early (noon). also ok for take away!

name: super 99
description: Parking. at 99 supermarket. security all night. quiet and safe. big rig friendly. asked the guard he said ok. toilets at the market. ok if you got here late.

name: parking lot beside pizza gavilan
description: plain lot right on the beach. big rig friendly, asked owners and neighbors. used toilet and open showers of pizza gavilan, also bought a pizza and got wifi. safe place

name: Centro de Informacion Turistica
description:
Google Translate:  Receptionist attentive, with detailed information of the region, banos, wifi, river view, cafe annex. 9:30 a.m. - 1 p.m. 1 p.m. - 5:30 p.m.

Recepcionista atenciosa, com informacoes detalhadas da regiao, banos, wifi, vista para rio, cafe anexo. 9h30 -12h almuerzo 13h - 17h30

name: very steep muddy hill.
description: We tried to drive to the cascada but could not make it up this hill after rain. We had a couple of attempts but 4x4 is necessary after rain here.

name: Hôtel Yadarien
description: Tiny room with private bathroom and A/C. Clean enough. No real parking. Maybe small rig on the street. One motorbike can fit inside the hotel but I had to remove one pannier. Some noise from nearby bars during but quiet in the evening, on a Thursday. Good enough option to experience Yaviza.

name: Bomberos
description: Let us (two bike tourists) camp though asked us to be packed up by 0700 when day shift arrived. Offered us water, dinner, and use of bathroom and kitchen.

name: Panamá Viejo
description: Entrance to Panamá Viejo. $15 for extranjero. Lots of history but not much to see for such a price. Nice museum. View of the city centre is much more interesting than the ruins. 1-2 hours is enough.

name: Andy’s Pets - Clínica Veterinaria
description:
What a great service from Andrea and her team! Very helpful and friendly. All in very good English. We went here for our Health Certificate and Andrea also helped us with the online form of MIDA - once completed you get a case number. 
We left with the document and an info sheet.
You find the vet office on the first floor, inside of the Parkdeck, on the far left end.

Info sheet: where to go to pay the MIDA Export fee, which is $5,-
You need to pay the fee at Banco National at “Plaza Edison” and go back the next day with the receipt to pick up the papers at “Ventanilla Única” (all on the info sheet)

Health Certificate incl. the MIDA online form $50,-
Deworming (for 3 month) $6,-
not the cheapest compared to other places I saw on iOverlander - but worth due to Andrea’s very professional but caring work.

We had contacted her via facebook - Andy’s Pets - on a Sunday afternoon and we got an appointment for the next morning.
She also has contacts with a Phycologist in the city if you want to verify your dog as an Emotional Support Animal for your flight (one time for a specific flight) which could be around $80-100,- but since we don’t need it we don’t know for sure.  
Besides: Andrea studied in Croatia and did some travelling in Europe too, so she seems to know a lot for this end too!

name: Banco National for Export Fee
description:
Step 2 of 3: After being at Andy’s Pets for our Heath Certificate & Co, we went to Plaza Edison (Info sheet from Vet) to Banco National to pay the us$5,- fee for the MIDA Export Document (“Licencia fitozoosanitaria de exportación”). 

One of the bank employees helped me finding and filling in the correct form for the transaction - went to the line up for the counters (left when you walk in), payed and got the receipt.
Next: to an office called “Ventanilla Única” (also on the info sheet of vet) which is walking out of the bank straight ahead down the walkway... 

PARKING: all parking at EdisonPlaza is paid parking and “fenced off” but possible to enter. We parked beside street, one stayed in the car, no costs.

name: Internacional de partes electromecanicas
description:
Our starter died the same day we had to deliver our camper in Colón. We were directed to this place as they are carry spare parts for alternators & starters.
Opens at 8:30 but since we got there at 8 and explained out situation they did maintenance on our starter as soon as one of the technicians arrived. Were done in 30
Minutes. Managed to delived the truck in Colon the same day.
---
Llegamos por dato a este taller de partes electromecánicas. El mismo día que entregábamos el vehículo en Colon para la naviera, nuestro arranque murió y tuvimos que llevarlo al taller. Abre a las 8:30 pero conseguimos que uno de los técnicos que había llegado antes comenzara a trabajar en el motor de arranque. En 30 minutos le hicieron mantención y cambiaron piezas. Pudimos dejar vehículo el mismo día en el puerto.

name: Riba Smith supermarket
description:
At the exit, the security started to search our backpack and they put an expensive bag of coffee in it claiming that we stole it. We spent 1 hour underneath some stairs with the security guards asking for a bribe not to call the police. He wanted twice the value of the coffee (i.e. 54 dollars). I gave 20 dollars and he left with the money, came back and claimed that he gave it back to me before leaving, in fact he pocketed it.
So in total they wanted 54 dollars plus the pocketed 20 and what they did is that they took almost everything we had in our shopping bag to pay for the 54 dollars and more. We ended up losing 80 dollars and more thanks to some corrupted security guards.

name: Olga’s café y desayuno
description: Decent breakfast, Olga is the sweetest lady and will make you feel right at home ! 1$ coffee free refills

name: Oasis Camping Rape
description: Admin note: Violent crimes and rape reported in this area. Advise extreme caution. Please see check-in for full details of incident.

name: Raquel's Ark
description:
Raquel who runs an animal recue program at her home welcomes overnighters. She offers access to toilets, laundry service and
 a hot bath :), WIFI and you can either pitch your tent in her garden or on her roof or park your rig in front of her house. There is no fixed price but it rather is based on donations whilst visiting her place.

name: immunology MINSA - rabbies vaccination center
description: Our son got bitten by a monkey and after being sent from clinic to hospital to centro de salud we finally had him given rabbies shots here. It is free and fast and the Dr said we could have come here in first instance instead of losing our entire day yesterday looking for the vaccine around town. The Doctor is called Paula Costa and the building is "Desposito de Biologicos". There are also centers in Santa Catalina and around the country.

name: Taberna La Malaguena
description: Spanish food - Great menu Del dia for 7.50$, includes a glass of wine or beer, a tapa, Plato fuerte that changes daily and desert!

name: La Rana Dorada
description: Brewery with happy hour 12-6pm - half off their house beers which were actually very good, they also serve food (didn’t try but looked delicious!) they have a few locations with different deals.

name: novey
description: it's more expensive to change your bottle here but they can change the standard US style gas bottles no need to sort out a different system. $23 dollars. A but hexy but better than driving to Panama city

name: water hose from machetazo
description: There is an official water dispenser to refill jerrycans/ garafones here but it didn't work today so the security agent showed me this hose being drinkable water. Official vending machine is 10m away from here on the left to the entrance to the supermarket and costs 2USD for 5 gallons.

name: Mailboxes etc
description: Easy stop to make copies before shipping. Very helpful, english speaking and let my dog inside the air conditioning.

name: Luis's house / La casa de Luis
description:
House situated on the seafront, big enough for almost any vehicle size, there are shadow and flat surfaces, potable water and the wc is available sole the owner is at the house.
Luis is very friendly and he likes to have travelers there, if you like to share moments with locals this is a good place. From Monday to Friday he goes to work early in the morning and he comes back after 5pm, you can wait for him at the door. The place is really quiet. 
------------
Casa frente a la playa, el terreno es suficientemente grande para cualquier tipo de vehículo, hay sombra y superficies planas, agua potable y baño disponible mientra el dueño está en la casa.
Luis es muy amable y le gusta recibir viajeros, si te gusta compartir con locales este es un buen lugar. De lunes a viernes sale muy temprano a trabajar y vuelve después de las 5pm. Podes esperarlo en la puerta del terreno. El lugar es muy tranquilo.

name: Very Good House
description: It is a hostel with private rooms, and there is a large courtyard for campers parking

name: Front of School
description: Nice spot ,with free wifi, There is a guard taking care of school property. Ask for permission or park and if you see someone in the door go to say Hi and explain you are just traveling. Police patrol. Don't leave garbage.

name: Cambutal River
description:
Quiet and nice place, with some traffic from the small town at the other side of the river. Friendly neighbors, one of them came twice to talk and offer access to a tap to fill my bottles with potable water. There is a small river where you can fill your tanks with non-potable but clear water. Be careful in rainy season, the river moves quickly. In that situation there is room for one or two small vans on the street. Introduce yourself to the neighbor next to the river so others know who are you and why you are there. 

Lindo lugar y tranquilo, hay algo de tráfico del pequeño caserío al otro lado del río. Vecinos muy amables, todos saludan, uno se acerco dos veces a hablar y ofrecerme entrar a cargar mis bidones con agua potable. Hay un pequeño río donde se puede llenar los tanques con agua no potable pero clara. Tener mucho cuidado en la época de lluvias, el río puede crecer mucho y rápido, en ese caso hay espacio para una o dos vans medianas en la calle. Presentate con el vecino que está al lado del río así los otros saben quién sos y qué haces ahí, están atentos a extraños.

name: Fonda Norelys
description:
Nice place with good food, almost half of the plate is rice but is according to the price. $3,5 for the menu of the day.
--------
Lindo lugar con buena comida, casi mitad del plato es arroz pero está acorde con el precio. $3,5 por el menú del día.

name: Next to Parita river
description:
The spot is really nice, has natural pools to swim and spend the day. There is place for one or two small van but there is not flat surface. It's useful if is late and you don't want to keep driving or just have a relaxing moment. The route is next to here so you listen the noise of the vehicles but there is not too much traffic. 
--------
El lugar es lindo, tiene una ollas naturales donde nadar y pasar el día. Hay lugar para una van o dos pero no hay superficie plana, sirve si se está haciendo tarde y no querés seguir manejando o simplemente pasar un momento de relax. La ruta está al lado por lo que también se escuchan los vehículos pasar pero no hay mucho tránsito.

name: Balneario Rio Guabo
description: We visited the balneario & realised there’s plenty of space to camp (whilst the river is low). Lovely spot. Bit of noise from the road but not going to stop you sleeping

name: Free bathrooms and WiFi
description:
There are free, clean bathrooms at the back of this retail plaza (at these coordinates). Handy if you’re camping out in any of the Central Boquete locations. Open til approx 7:30/8pm. 

The Banco National at the front of this plaza has free, fast WiFi. With no password.

name: 4-11 wild camping
description: Nice place in front of the wave. Shade from trees and about 10min walk from the little town-beach

name: La Arepita
description: Great food, great price. Right on the corner, lovely ladies ruling it. Decent meals for $4 - $5. They even give you a banana for desert!

name: Basecamp Boquete
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place was added by the owner. Has not been Overlander verified.

Unique fun hostel and campout area, located with unobstructed view of the volcano, accommodations for 8 max in hostel, sports training center features a climbing wall, tetherball, slackline, volleyball, guided tours available

name: Vale Motors
description:
A car mechanic you can trust. Italian owned and run in European quality.
Spare parts often need to be brought from USA.

Sourounding area very quiet and save. Pool for 3,5 - 4 USD 5min walking from here. Food court and toilets across the street.

name: side of the street
description: close to  the office where you do the paper work to ship to colombia

name: Toscana inn Hotel
description: Very good hotel with garage and fair price in Panama City.

name: La torre
description:
Excellent restaurant with nice service, and wifi.
A special mention to their arepas / amazing : 6$ for the arepas + juice (super good and sweet too).

name: Restaurante Adriana
description:
Small restaurant.
Good food for correct prices.
Not really overfriendly’s service but ok.
Was great to eat there instead of cooking during our stay at Marcella.
Open all days (morning to evening).

name: La fonda de papa
description:
Brand new restaurant.
Opened on June 3rd 2019.
Super closed to the hostal Amador (to sleep/camp).
Good prices, we ate pretty well and so important to say it in this country... REALLY PLEASANT SERVICE.

The « pescado frito » is a corvina and super good. 
We ate 3 ! the menu is changing everyday. Today is was a little bit more expensive (see photos) +/-6,5$ because it was seafood.

We recommend!

name: Pargo Rojo
description:
Small and simple restaurant  in the road to Punta Chame where they offer two plates: red snapper (pargo rojo) US10 and giant shrimp (langostino) US 13. Both come with fries or platano.
Very good meal! We recommend
 this place. Abel is the owner, the cooker and the waiter.

name: Bodhi Hostel & Lounge
description: Very friendly hostel right on the main Street but quiet.English and German speaking.Super clean Kitchen and very friendly Staff. They also have a cafe and smoothies!

name: Bike shop
description: Small bike shop with bike spare parts. I don’t know how they work

name: Violent Attack
description:
14-June-2019
While riding solo to Portobelo I was violently attacked by three men.  They knocked me and the bicycle to the ground, punching me in the face and head while taking my backpack, left rear pannier, and sleeping pad.  I held onto the front bag and was able to keep money and cards.  The police came and found and returned many things, thanks to their quick response.

This road is not safe for solo ciclists.  130 km touring on bicycle and this was the first, and hopefully the last time that I will be attacked.

name: Yokomotor - Toyota Oficial
description: Really friendly Toyota experts. They did an overall check on my car for free and answered a few questions I had. Really professional team

name: Villa Paula
description: Villa Paula is open again for Overlander! The new family living there offers kitchen access, a bathroom, electricity and water for the camper. The place has a huge (flat) garden for big rigs and a great pool. It's still 10 dollars per night negotiable.
