The Family living there is very kind, they just speak Spanish. +50762506524 is Henrys phone number, it's possible to write him on WhatsApp to prepare him for your arrival.

name: ESA - Flying with Dog in Cabin
description:
We rescued a dog in Mexico. He is now 18kg (40lb). We wanted to avoid having him fly cargo in a kennel since he has never been in a kennel. We got an official doctor prescription saying my wife has anxiety and needs to have an Emotional Support Animal. With Copa (and Wingo), an ESA can fly with you, in the cabin, for free. When you book your tickets online, you have to call them to let them know you have an ESA (at least 48h before the flight). At the airport, we were never asked for any document. We walked in with our dog on the leash, checked in, passed security, walked across the airport, waited two hours at the gate, boarded the plane and took off with him on our lap, without a single question asked!! We had the ESA prescription, but never needed it.

When we landed in Colombia, after being stamped, an officer came to see us and told us we needed to fill an import form and pay. We needed his health certificate, a photocopy of his vaccination (proof of anti-rabies) and the MIDA export form from Panama (don’t forget to do it before leaving Panama!). In all, it took about 20 minutes and cost ~48 000 COP. 

Welcome to South America with your dog the easy way!

name: Free Haircut
description: It’s a haircut academy and they’ll do it for free. It was pretty full now but I talked to some people here and they trust them

name: Juan Carlos Home
description: Juan Carlos works in the “Extremo” shop, super friendly offered me to stay overnight in his place, just over the extremo shop. You can sleep  in your car and he will offer you a priceless shower. He knows a lot about local climbing and he can give you good advice and planning local trips to the local areas. He has a climbing wall in his wall!!!!

name: Nice “Mirador” overlooking The Valley
description: I could even work to spend a night if needed. Great place for a morning coffee on this beautiful road!

name: Arriba de Salto Las Palmas
description: This is the top of the river and waterfall. Don’t go down to the waterfall, instead go into the dirt road and take a left. There’s a medium-sized, flat, grassy area near the ledge of the waterfall where you can camp for the night. A really beautiful spot with great views, sheltered from the road and people. Make sure you clean after yourself! it's the top of a cliff don't camp with children.

name: The Corner Hostel
description:
Nice big Hostel with Pool. 
3 mins from beach.
Easy undercover gated parking for motorcycle or car. 
Super friendly owners. 
$ 14 dormitory with great breakfasts

name: Beirut
description: Very good Arab food restaurant with great views from the Marina by Causeway.

name: Ceviches Mayce
description:
AMAZINGLY delicious ceviche! Dominican owned with Panamanian twists. We ordered two 8oz camaron ceviches in cocktail and pasion. Both were delicious! You can do both and it’s the gourmet dish. $10

We also ordered 1/4 gallon to go in Tupperware for dinners! $17

name: Cascada Loma Grande
description: Start of the small walking trail (20 min one way) to Cascada Loma Grande. You can swim in the pool at the bottom of the waterfall and enjoy the nature. Be careful, the trail is steep and muddy. So take good shoes with you ;) And of course, it's free!

name: Public Pool
description:
Olympic Pool run by Kiwanis NGO. 2,5 - 4,0 USD pp depending on time and residence.
If you camped or will camp in Ciudad del Saber you can state that you are residents of CDS and get the cheaper price ;)

Cold showers. You would not want to shower hot in Panama City.
Woman showers are boxed in (view protection). Man showers are 'communal'.

Wed, Fri: 08:00 - 17:45
Tue, Thu: 05:45 - 19:45
Sat, Sun: 08:00 - 16:45
Mon: closed

name: Waterfall
description: Great place to stop for lunch and shower in the small waterfall (with organic soap, of course!)

name: Locksmith
description:
We came to Carlos to help us with locking our vehicle for shipping. Super helpful and knowledgeable. Worked fast and was able to think on his feet. Highly recommend if you’re interested in changing your locks 
Contact through WhatsApp +507 6374-2277

name: under the bridge
description: Not much, but dry cooking and invisible from the road. there's a slightly overgrown dirtroad on the east side of the bridge, it leads to a large grassy area under the bridge, but a few meters above the water. Possible with a car aswell, but the trail might be a bit narrow. Noise from the road was ok, I just needed a place to sleep after dark because the last two places were closed.

name: Bridge ends in 5 meter deep hole
description: wacht out, only visible from a few meters distance, ugly falI. I could pass by unloading my bicycle and hoping over tree roots around the hole, a motorcycle or heavy bike couldn't pass

name: Cheap and skillfully bike mechanic
description: Helped me a lot changing the cables on my Pinion gears. They do have disk brake pads for Shimano, but with only a few high end parts

name: Butterfly House & Honey Farm
description: It was a very rainy day so we didn't do the tour of the entire finca. Instead, we did a honey tasting and it was really, really FUN and laid-back! We tasted 24 different types of honey, and the guide explained each in detail. You could tell she loved bees and teaching about how incredible they are. It was a very unique stop for us so we enjoyed it a lot. It was $7.50USD per person and it lasted for about 45 minutes to 1 hour. Recommended!

name: Tuesday Market
description: We walked from Pension Topas (where we camped) to this area and it took about 15 minutes, maybe less. It's worth the walk especially to see the river/mountain as you cross the bridge! A quaint little market that started at 10:00am (ends at noon). They had fresh food, artsy stuff, pastries, and lots of other handcrafted items. It felt like this is where locals come to catch up & shop! Recommended!

name: Panalpina. (bonded storage)
description: Crowley was in process of moving their facility so they sent us to Panalpina.  Easy process.  $7 per day for truck plus one time.  Kind of sketchy looking place but they assured us it was secure with 24 hr security.   Gave us letter which we take to Curundu aduana for passport control. Antonio Rivera contact.  He took pictures of everything including key, which we left with them in case the truck had to be moved.  Motorcycle storage inside.

name: Cheapest Laundromat - $1!
description: Amazing Terpel service. Laundromat (with hot water!!) and dryer for 0,75$ each! we did like 4 and spent few dollars, cheapest laundry ever. While you wait you can have a free shower and charge your computer using the free wifi, we loved this place, really worth the stop!

name: Bomberos de Colon
description: Friendly bomberos, we are two couples with a car and a van and they let us stay one night (before shipping) in their parking. We used bathrooms and showers. At 6 am they woke up us (good to finish our luggage ecc) because they were playing some football in the parking 😉 really safe place, Colon looks pretty unsafe

name: Escobal
description: It’s not possible to get to Arenosa on the other side of the lake without a private charter boat. I asked around if anyone could take me and my bicycle, but there was no option.

name: Don Chango Grill
description: This restaurant specialises in chicken. It is a wonderful, neat and clean restaurant run by Migel and his family. The food is very tasty. Good place to stop for lunch or supper.

name: Parque central Gualaca
description: Some leveled spots to park around the park, free wifi, quiet at night, nice playground for children, nice locals and in one of the entrances in front of the orange house there's a tap to refill your tanks and it's potable water.

name: Lavamático Doña Evidelia
description:
Self service laundromat. Attended by the owners, super nice people. $4 per charge/machine. Include soap, washing and drying.
Also, at the same building you can have breakfast or launch for $3,5 while you wait.

Autoservicio de lavandería. Atendida por las dueñas, gente super agradable. $4 por carga/máquina. Incluye jabón, lavado y secado.
También en el mismo local se puede desayunar o almorzar por $3,5 mientras esperas.

name: SRV Automovil (Roberto)
description: Roberto or "Robert" was a great guy! we try to fix my kombi (vwbus) here, but at the end, we cold not... We found a engine block issue... so he chat with a friend specialist in Panama City, and we are going there. But! I recommend his work! he is a great guy, helps a lot, we fix a lot of minimum issues until find this problem, fair prices and as well recommended for other people from the region. He works best with new cars, but do his best to work with old ones too.

name: VW Air cooled Specialist
description: The name of the macanic is Cigarruista, Samuel is a specialist in air cooled vw, but works with other cars too, the price is expensive, but he is the best in town...

name: Riverside next to the bridge
description:
We got stuck on the bridge during a protest road block. So we turned around and headed for the river. There is plenty of room, big rig accessible. A few different spots. The trail network on the other side looks nicer but we didn’t check that out.

We asked locals if it was a safe place to stay and they said yes “muy tranquillo”.

Restaurant on other side of the bridge. Location has good Movistar reception. Likely has Claro / Digicel too.

name: Value Motors - UK / US Mechanics
description:
Decent shop for general mechanic work.
Good service, good price too. Shop is clean and tidy which is always a good sign. The owner is from England, the Manager is American. Mechanics speak Spanish and seem reliable, knowledgeable and care for your vehicle. They may not be as hot on aftermarket 4x4 stuff but great for everything else. Recommended to us by @kissmybay

name: Lago Bayano
description: Right next to Shawalas there is a dust road is going to the lake. Nice and safe spot just for one night. Next to the lake behind the dam. No services and no people around just a few locals fishing in the afternoon. Felt very safe.

name: Hotel La Cresta Inn
description:
Nice and cheap place. 40$ a room with private bathroom and AC. Wifi in the room was super fast. It’s a bit old looks it was a great hotel long time ago. Free parking as well but my van it’s too high (parking for customers is on the basement , parking next in the right side is for employees) so the owner let me use the one for employees. Very friendly owner and staff. He is from Spain.  
Pool and small fitness room. Breakfast included. Also has a small kitchen on the room.  Free shuttle to airport. Very convenient location . Lots of restaurants around.

name: Villa Miramonte
description: Chuck and Connie Holton are happy to let you park your vehicle or tent in their yard and love to meet new people.  They have several friendly dogs and two monkeys in a secure, fenced yard.  Feel free to contact them if you need a place to stay.  holtocw@gmail.com or Panama number 6402-1207.

name: Casita Rio Indio
description:
Casita Rio Indio is a marvelous place where you can rent cabañas and also camp in a van.
As they do more rental, it’s good to get in contact before coming (507)6650-6634 (507)6807-3193 (507)6521-5331.
They speak Spanish French German and English.
About the camp site: cold showers/wc, kitchen.
You camp along a small river at the entry of the jungle. Amazing spot for animals: monkeys (3 different kind of monkeys seen in less than 24h!) toucans (2 types!), white eagles, slots, butterflies, lezards, caimans, turtles, frogs...
If you want to discover more than what lives just in front of your windows, ask Pascal for a trail in the jungle (from 2 hours to 5 hours tours!)
You can also join the beach by horse. You can do a tour at night to discover the nocturnal fauna.
Super quiet, super nice, super fauna!!
Go there!
10$ppn

name: Purple house hostel
description: The purple house hostel is a nice hostel in a quiet neighborhood. There is a shared kitchen, cold showers and a nice garden. The owner is very friendly too. We paid $10 per person and we could leave our bikes inside the house. There is free coffee in the morning. As the name suggests the house is very... purple.

name: Travelers Hostal
description: Very decent hostel in a relatively quiet region of Santiago. They have a 6 person dorm for $20 pp (1 couples bed, 1 single bed and 1 bunk bed) and 2 private rooms (4 person) for $38. The rooms have AC and wifi and there is a shared kitchen. We could leave our bicycles in the common room.

name: Hotel El Majo Del Valle
description: The room we stayed in was very clean, with a hot shower and AC. There is a nice garden to hang out in. The hotel is located in a quiet part of town. The rooms typically are $40 but she gave it to us for $30 because the power just went out the moment we arrived.

name: Backpackers Inn
description: Cheap hotel, relatively clean, nothing special, just the way we like it. We paid $25 for a room for two. Spacious rooms. We fitted our two bikes in the room.

name: JG-parabrisas
description: A very good wok shop to repair windscreens and other glasses of the car. Very friendly owner

name: El Chorillo
description:
Ok, so El Chorillo is not a "tourist" attraction in the common sense.  Indeed, it has long been considered one of the most dangerous neighborhoods in Panama City, ever since the US invaded to take out strongman Manuel Noriega in Dec 1989.  It is today a vibrant but downtrodden neighborhood which everyone will tell you to avoid.  

We hooked up with Victor of @localinpty (Instagram), who does cultural walking tours of Casco, Santa Ana, and El Chorillo.  He also gives a lot back to the community, teaching English to both adults and children, setting up safe places for kids to play and learn, and is creating an amazing community outreach and educational program for adventurous travellers.  We were completely safe in Victor"s hands and our two hour walkabout was one of the highlights of our time in Panama.  

Victor charges $75 per person for a three hour walking tour, but realize that he gives back so much to the community we felt like it was a worthy cause.

If you want an experience well out of the mainstream, we highly recommend Victor.  He is the only one doing tours to this area and has a good rapport with the police and the locals.  WhatsApp Victor at +507 6118 7621.

name: Dr. Harley Clinica Veterinaria
description: Call  or WhatsApp # 507 6475-9050 Vet speaks English. OPEN 24 hours!! Excellent service. Clean modern hospital! Specialized dog food available. Also boarding services.

name: Delta Gas Station
description: Water faucet with good pressure. It’s a gas station so gas and diesel also available. Toilets too. Big, new, clean, non store yet though.

name: Hospital Mundo Animal
description:
Very recomendable place where you can get the Health Certificate for your pet.

Certificate is 15$ and it's done in 5 minutes, no (consulta) need It. 

Susana the lady in the corner (from the caja) was super friendly and see gave us also the paper for the payment in the bank and explain us everything. 

In general friendly staff, eficient, clean. They do everything else for good prices.

name: LOS CANGILONES DE GUALACA CANYON
description: This place is amazing. Beautiful mini canyon for swimming. It’s free and we took the dogs. We were here on a Friday and only had to share the place with a few other people. Very clean.

name: Bomberos Gualaca
description:
I am adding this location as a cyclist/runner. Place to camp for free with bathroom facilities and most importantly during rainy season: roofed. The people I ran into here were super friendly. A store is just 50m down the street.

Thanks Bomberos for having me.

name: Building Ruin
description:
Building Ruin next to Panamerica. Old building ruin, with big roofed area next to it. Ask the people from the car mechanic and they will gladly allow you stay here. 

Recieved the recommendation from the security guy, who works at the store, across the highway. Everybody is super friendly and I felt safe. Particularly because there is a big black dog on a leash, right next to the old building. Just do not interfere with his leash radius! 

The location is probably better suited for cyclists. But the parking lot has plenty of space for rigs as well!

name: Calovebora
description:
At the end of the road on a small village square. We asked the locals to stay overnight, they said yes. 
The whole road is paved except one brigde is under construction and you have to cross through the river. 4x4 and high clearance needed.

name: Crossing Rio Caloveborita
description: The whole road to Calovebora is paved and only the bridge at this location is under construction. You have to cross through the river. Only possible with 4x4 and high clearance.

name: Air BNB Casio Viejo
description: Patty’s casitas.  Go to http://pattyscasitas.com/  and book direct, but she is also in Airbnb.  Great studio, been here twice and would stay again.  Very well appointed and comfortable, on nice quiet street a few steps from Iglesia la Merced.  A bit of a splurge for most overlanders but a nice treat for us.  Free parking on the street but a challenge to find an empty spot.  There are other lots nearby and not so nearby, or you can park in a lot along the costanera at the bottom of the hill by the start of the causeway.  Patti and Rudy are great hosts.

name: Altos del María
description: coming from Anton valley, this is the place where the public road ends and the private property begins - you cannot drive through

name: Altos del María
description: drove half day from the gate near Anton valley to get stuck at another one ... it's the same private property and they didn't let us through

name: Boquete
description: Police checkpoint , asking for passport and tip. Very friendly.

name: Gas station Terpel
description: Small gas station Terpel.  No big facilities but friendly staff and clean bathrooms.  Just ok for one night.

name: Selina Casco Viejo
description:
Pretty modern Hostel if you have to stay in the City Center
. Realy good and fast WiFi all over the place. We got a Deluxe room for two people with private bathroom and City/ocean. Payed 25 wach per nicht nur you can get much cheaper If you want to.
They do have a pretty stunning roof top bar which I def. recommend to visit. Even If you dont stay here.

name: Balboa Inn
description:
This place is amazing. They let us stay here with our 3 dogs! The room is $40 A night and they charged us $10 more for the dogs so total $50. You can add breakfast and coffee for $5 more per person. The rooms were clean, big, and had hot water. It was a nice luxury during the whole shipping process. oh and they were beyond friendly. Nice neighborhood. Nice yard. We loved this place.  
I’m not sure if you can camp here and we do not think a big rig could park here. We parked our tundra with fwchawk comfortably under the lite car park. Pictures show parking.

name: VIP Vacation Kennels
description:
If you travel with dogs and need a place to leave them, this is the right place. After visiting some dog hotels in the city and seeing how small and dirty they are, we found this one with a HUGE green area for them to play and run around, a pool, a ball pool and couches everywhere where they can rest. Friendly staff, they take pictures of your fury friends and post them on Facebook, so you can see them everyday.
They charge $25 a night but if your dog stays longer they apply discounts: 10% if they stay for a week, 15% (of the total) if they stay for two weeks, and 20% (of the total) if they stay for three weeks.

name: Puma, duchas
description:
Puma service center, Cold shower, 0,50 usd. 
---
Estación de servicio Puma, con ducha fría a 0,50 USD.

name: Restaurante 3\4
description: Super sweet Restaurant with a stunning view. Friendly people, let you park wherever and how long you want. Food is good (if you want) and WiFi for free. There are showers and toilets. There is also a walkway to a stunning viewpoint.

name: Terkel Gas station, about 30k from Colon. Allowed a night camping free. Manager Santiago was helpful.
description: Small Terpel Gas station with bathroom, just off Hwy #3. Flat room, for two rigs.

name: Istmo Brewing Co.
description:
Panamas first craftbeer brewing company. Here you get 7 craftbeers on tap. Pint costs 5.50, jarra for 9.50. The beer was good and we got a sample of each beer in the beginning!
Also snacks and food available.

name: Katané - Speedy Pizza
description:
Looks like a normal fast food, but the pizzas they make are out of this world.
If you are looking for good reasonable priced food in Panama City this is the place to go.
Only downside the don‘t sell beer or wine

name: Hikaru - Japanese Restaurant
description:
Very good Japanese restaurant with nice ambient and friendly staff. The Gyoza and the ramen noodles are to die for.
The restaurant is a bit hidden in a backyard. Just walk between the two other restaurants (Rustica and a ceviche place) and you find it on the left side.

name: La Bicicleta - Comida del dia
description:
Asked around for a less expensive restaurant and got to this nice little one. “Comida del dia” is $5,50 and includes a bottle of tap cold water. It’s only available from 12 to 3. After that only menu options, which I didn’t bother to check.
Good classic rock‘n roll tracks.

name: Small lot on the water
description: Small level parking lot right on the water.  Posted price is $5 includes bathroom and shower. Bathroom is $1 and cold water shower is $1. Just past the police station sandwiched between houses and the water. Very quiet, lot is empty most weekdays, may be busy on the weekend.  Small food and drink tienda on sight. Suitable for small truck campers and vans, no overhieght problems. Oversized longer vehicles may have problems squeezing in.

name: paraiso next to car wash
description: car wash and small restaurant owned by very nice colombian family. we slept next to the carwash. had a lot of talk with both the son and the daughter.

name: Tourist parking downtown
description: Parking right in center of town.  Not suitable for larger than 28 ft rigs.  I parked here to check out the sights in a 25' Class C.   Free parking.  Did get some offers to have the rig watched.  I didn't feel it was necessary.  Some of the streets are very narrow.  Go where the buses go.

name: After intersection to Santa Catalina
description: Checkpoint... easy and No Problem... wanted to See Passport and Vehicle Insurance.... realy friendly

name: You Market
description: Excellent supermarket to stock up.   Large parking lot, no size restrictions.   Good selection of none fresh goods.  Minimal selection of fresh fruit and vegetables.   Excellent meat counter.  Get your fresh fruit and vegetables from the roadside stands.

name: truck parking
description: Big truck station, 3$ à night, safe but truck atmosphere... Toilet and shower available.

name: Paki Point
description: Super nice spot to camp. Right next to Paki Point restaurante and super cool Surf spot.  It is for free as long as you have some drinks and food (prob. the best pizza on the Island). The owners are a young italian couple and super friendly.They close at 7 pm which means you get the WiFi all for yourself and a super quite night. They have toilets and outside showers as well. Check Out the picture.

name: Path between Wizzard and Red Frog beach
description: We didn't know that before but we wished we would. Almost every local told us afterwards that the track between Wizzard and Red Frog is extremly dangerous and many people get robbed there. They meant we got super lucky... maybe the pooring rain was our watchdog... I post it because I think people will at least bring no values. Stay safe.

name: Rey supermarket and mall
description: Mall with different shops. But mainly, if you’re Swiss (or like Swiss chocolate) you can find Villars tablets for basically the same price!!

name: Panama channel viewpoint
description: Nice place to see big boats driving by right next to the channel. Good stop on the way to colon...

name: Coconut Hostel
description: Cute hostel where you can rent a room, dorm, hammock or camp. It's 6$ per person for hammock or the tent. You can put your tent on the second floor (on the wood) but it's sheltered from the rain. Very nice people. Very noisy on thursdays night and weekend. Refill water for 25cts and non potable water from the tap.

name: Lookout from the sea
description: Nice mirador and park surrounded by bike lanes and gardens. Only accessible by walking, bikes, scootering, etc but not by car

name: Vegetarían restaurante
description: 70cents a portion, DELICIOUS, and a huge variety of food served semi-buffet style, Chinese and Italian food mainly. I ate too much and it Hurts

name: Fire department of Chame
description:
I was cycling in the evening passed this fire station. I asked if I could camp here and it was possible. They also offered to stay in a room but I preferred to camp. The room is probably better because of the traffic noise. Free wifi was available. Maybe you can take a shower if you ask. A small shop was across the road. 

Most likely only cyclists.

name: Puerto de Carti
description:
This is going to be long post but it covers my trip from Carti-Necocli.
I heard tons of different info but nothing clear so went and did it myself. 

Make sure you arrive to Carti with food,snacks,water,and plenty of US dollars to cover a few days,small and big notes.There's virtually nothing here.Tourists get brought back & forth to the islands.Every morning/lunch the "restaurant" severs food & coffee & drinks.If you don't have a bigload of money to spend for an private express lancha who will take just you and bicycle to Obaldia then here's how it will probably go.
Be patient!
Lanchas leaves here early in the morning between 06:30-08:30.You'll need to be pro-active about finding a boats.Not many lanchas go all the way to Obaldia.But once or twice a week it happens because there's enough passengers needing to go there.But it's random.Obaldia is mostly a military place with military and their families living there.Chat to everyone and let them know what you need.Negotiate for a price.

It's $50-70 ( + add bicycle $25-30)so $80-100 to Caledonia in total with bike...and $40 from Caledonia to Obaldia total with bicycle.
Or $80-120 all the way Obaldia from Carti.

There's a high chance that either way they'll make stops along the way to drop off people or if most passengers are going all the way then less stops.Locals will probably get the price for less,plus as gringo they add on more.Up to you to bargain for it!

There's rooms on Caledonia if stuck there $7-8.Little basic tiendas,cold drinks,bread is made daily on the island.You can get food cooked by locals for you too.No one knows when lanchas pass so patience is needed.

It's 4-6hrs from Carti to Caledonia.
1.5-2hr from Caledonia - Obaldia.

At Obaldia the port first needs to register you,dogs sniff your bike,then you go to get immigration stamp.Photo copy of passort next door needd too- 0.25cents.
They close at 4pm!

NOTE: There's another port where smaller lanchas  leave from more often to Capurgana 5 mins walk for immigration office.Ask locals.I got stuck there cos' it was too late so I wild camped under roofed basketball court in centro.Military are friendly and there's no crime there.Very safe.Small tiendas,bars restos,cafes have everything you need.

Lanchas from Obaldia to Capurgana are no more than $20 bike included.Up to you to bargain for it!
45 mins to Capurgana
Capurgana is a tourist place.Immigration are friendly.Takes a few mins.2 mins walk from port.
Big fast lanchas leave what seems like several times a day to Necocli and Turbo.Necocli is higly preferred over Turbo.Mariapolis Hostel is a perfect place to rest after the trip.Cheapest prices through Booking.com.
It took me 3.5 days in total and about $170 spent.
I felt very safe all the way.
Everyone was friendly.

name: The Wandering Sloth
description: Restaurant with a bar. They serve draft and bottled beer. Wednesday is Wings night. Food is good and they speak English.

name: Pedasí Natu'rio Camp
description:
We went there for like an informal workaway: we helped the owner and worked in the camping in exchange of a place for the tent. 
This is a huge finca for nature lovers run by Vincent, a French guy and his Panamanian girlfriend Micaela. They are absolutely adorable and very welcoming. They offered a lot of home made food, all natural and cheap food: ice cream, pâté, chicken, eggs, fruits and vegetables... DELICIOUS. You can eat a whole lunch all natural and home made for 4$.
Activities on site: horse ride in the finca, taking a walk on the river and the cute waterfall on the finca too, paddle rent, Vincent can take you on a ride with his 4x4 to make you visit the beaches and all around.
We spent a really great moment with Vincent and his family they are really simple and lovely. We loved this site in the middle of the nature with lot of ducks, chicken, dogs, monkeys.
Very safe place to camp. You can rent a big tent or hammock or bring yours. Prices start at 5$ per person and per night. New abilities to come. 
They speak French, Spanish and English. 

You can contact Vincent for anything: +507 6487-6978
Email : logliscivincent@gmail.com

name: water refill station
description: next to green Market. you can refill your 18L bottle for 2,200 at the machine. purified water

name: Hostal Casa de Campo
description: A beautiful big house with balconies & special views of nature. Price by end of 2019 was $36 for a 2 people room. Owner’s name is Alberto, he does not live here.. must call +507 6070 8816. He speaks spanish, don’t know if he speaks english. We were short in cash to pay for the night so he accepted a deposit in his bank account (this was easy for is since our bank account is also from Panama). Has private parking for 1 or 2 vehicles.

name: Supermarket Rey
description: Much better food choice than the 99 in Allbrook mall!!!

name: PanaPass Toll Road
description: We were shook down for a bribe when unknowingly approached toll road. Avoid as you cannot pay toll in cash. Unless you have Panapass sticker drive elsewhere.

name: under the bridge
description: Nice place under the bridge with access for swimming in the river. Near a little supermarket.

name: Montana Sagrada Brewery
description: Local craft beer. Happy hour Tuesday to Thursday 4pm to 7pm $3 pint, regular $4.50. They also serve very good food for reasonable prices.

name: Speed check / police stop
description:
Pulled us over here claiming we'd done 90 in a 50 limit. Seemed to be a 100 limit as far as we could tell and everyone else was doing the same. 

They asked for cash. We refused and said we only had a credit card, no cash, and pretended to speak no Spanish (which isnt hard to do for us!!). Eventually they got bored, gave our papers back and let us go.

name: Hotel Bellagio
description:
Parking allowed in the garage (no more than 3m High) of the hotel with electricity (with an extension cord) and access to bathroom and cold shower, for 10$ à night.

Fast wifi. 

Quiet. 

Very nice owners.

name: Hotel Avicar
description:
Parking allowed on the parking lot of the hotel with electricity (with an extension cord) and access to bathroom and cold shower, for 10$ à night.

Average wifi at the terrasse. 

A bite noise from the road. 

Very nice owner.

name: Trailhead for Sendero los Quetzales
description:
Lovely nature trail with possibility to see quetzals. The park ranger Carlos is very friendly, will ask you to register but did not ask us to pay. Restrooms available for use. Trail takes you down through lush jungle, up past sheep pastures, through the cloud forest, and to the mirador which is about 6km in. 

Took us about 2 hours to get to the mirador, and about 1.5 hours to get back. Mostly uphill, muddy, with many little creek crossings and bridges. We did not see the quetzals but others did!

name: Cerro Cara Iguana Trailhead!
description: Suuuuch a lovely view! This is the formal trailhead, though most vehicles would need 4x4 to get here. Many people drive part of the way up and park at a pullout, or simply hike from in town. Not a very long hike up, but steep. You emerge from the pine forest at the trailhead onto the rim of the volcano, incredible views of the entire valley. One of our favorite miradors on the trip. You can walk all along the rim. Amazing sunset!

name: Old gas station of fort shelter
description:
Nice place, secure as you are between the Marina and the Aeronaval camp.
It’s a good free alternative to the Marina parking lot wich is very expensive... The Marina boss say to us that’s ok to stay here. 
You may have to say at the entry that you go to the Marina if you want that the military let you enter the site...
We stay here with our 29’ RV for 2 nights.
We feel very secure on this place for waiting our shipping.

name: Panama to Costa Rica
description:
No info on the other entries on going Panama to Costa Rica. 

Easy, quick and free! Park before the bridge in Panama (tricky!). Walk down side street to Migracion and exit Panama. Walk to bridge and enter containers down and right of bridge entrance for Aduana. Cancel TIP (no paperwork given back). 

Drive across bridge. Officials will inspect passports and vehicle. 

On Costa Rica side, pass through fumigation then drive up and left and through cones and park. Walk down to shops then back to bridge. Migracion is first in a white container, then Aduana is opposite. 

We only reactivated CR TIP but I'm sure getting a new one would be just as easy. but only if you have been outside CR for 3 months. You'll need to purchase insurance if you don't already have it - not sure where. No copies required.

name: Rastro Sanchez - Parts Yard!
description:
Pretty good salvage yard nearby El Valle. We busted our 1995 Trooper rear window and dented the door, these guys had a 2002 Trooper and swapped out our full door assembly in an hour!! 

They have all sorts of cars, old and new.  Japanese and American parts! Plenty of stuff big and small, fair prices. Ask them not to give you the gringo prices ;) Nice guys. Two phone numbers for the place, one is 6264-6309 and the other is 6215-0859.

name: Panaderia & Restaurante Rico Rico
description: Nice bakery with restaurant on the upper deck, where we hung out and did work. Their sandwiches are extremely tasty and the coffee’s pretty good! Moist banana bread. We enjoyed being able to see life go by from the deck as well as a view of the water. No WiFi, but would recommend!

name: Restaurante Jonathan
description: Such a good little fonda/comedor! The only well priced food we could find in the area, most plates run around $3-4. Pick and choose what you like from different chicken and pork, plantains, rice, beans. Standard fare. Not the cutest spot but what good food for a good price! Left with full tummies. It’s also on Google Maps if my coordinates are off.

name: Burica Surf
description: We dry camped here for a week in the dry season and loved it. Saw white faced monkeys, yellow monkeys, a sloth, and even a small jaguar. The access road was very muddy and slippery since it had rained the night before. You definitely need a high clearance vehicle and even 4x4 if it’s been raining at all. I wouldn’t try the road in the rainy season unless you have a serious Jeep. The owner of the hotel let us camp on his land down the road that he’s trying to sell. He also let us fill up our water tank.  Nice little surf spot in front and also some good waves on the other side of the island. We stayed for free. Enjoy!

name: Hotel Panamericano
description: Nice little clean hotel. Fast WiFi. Low season $33 US/holidays $40 US. Very convenient and secure with cameras and night guard. A little noisy with traffic but dies down later. Get here early because it fills up every night.

name: Llanteras y Servicio Rosa
description: This is a great light mechanic tires and service shop. Family run. Speaks great English.Clean and organized and big rig friendly. Worked on my truck for an hour and only charged me $20. Right next door to hotel Panamericano. Highly recommended.

name: Cerra Banco
description: a field in between houses in the village of Cerro Banco. after the waterfall tour the locals allowed us to setup our camp in a flat spot. they were very friendly and interested in seeing the rig. we left a table and water tank outside overnight and the locals didn't touch anything

name: Playa Venao
description: Stayed here a few nights after passing on the public parking due to lack of shade. Steep entry road. Might need 4x4 if it’s been raining. Small bits of shade under the trees. Short walk to surf spot. Very quiet during the week.

name: Free Camp!
description: Free camping at a dead end dirt road. Very quiet and private. Turn left just before Oceans Hostal.  Go straight until you see a ranch gate and turn left just before it and you'll see a vacant block that has been levelled out.

name: Cabañas & Camping Lourdes
description: Beatiful place in front of La Yeguada Lake.   BBQ Area, parking, gardens, Toilet facilities and Lodging Rooms for rent.

name: Sheraton Grand Panama Hotel/24hr cafe
description: We arrived here late on the evening before going to DIJ inspection. It is only Hotel/Street parking. The hotel staff are very welcoming and there’s  A/C and fast WIFI so you can lounge there as you please, they didn’t mind. Many people here using WiFi for laptops. There is a cafe open 24 hr so it’s great when you need to get up early for DIJ inspection and grab a coffee. Also Hotel and Casino security all night. Can be a small bit noisy but we slept well

name: Iveco garage
description: Very big iveco garage and very responsive and nice people.  They have the computer too. Highly recommended . Called also MPS

name: eco-gavilla
description: Eco gavilla is an oasis of jungle and beach located in the bahia bajuco, directly across the bay from playa hermosa. Listen and watch howler monkeys in their native habitat, a must for anybody traveling in the tropics. Fishing and diving are popular around here and the restaurant will cook any catch for a small fee. Full services are offered with restaurants, bar, and rustic accommodations and yes, your cell phone works fine here. Guests may choose to camp in the shaded camping area or in beach ranchitos, also a small  farm house rancho. Catamaran tours to nearby islands and fishing, diving, and surfing tours are available. The calm bay at gavilla beach is ideal for those who want a mellow, relaxing vibe,and enjoy the many wild species here. The road in to eco gavilla is a bit rough, once turning left onto the dirt road, just before reaching playa hermosa you will have a 7 mile dirt road, that is a bit rough in a few spots, but doable at slow pace,no 4+4 is necessary until rainy season. Some prefer to park at Playa Hermosa and take a water taxi, there is secured parking for 3$ per vehicle and the taxi across the bay casts 2$ per person, each way. Reservations are recommended midweek but weekends not necessary. Note that boats run from around 10:30-5:00, with exceptions due to tides, but captains will accommodate special requests. Camping is $5per person per night, ranch house rental$30 per night±50763602461, reservations and more information

name: Airport 1st floor restaurants
description: At this spot you can get unlimited wifi. FYI, the airport wifi disconnects you after 30 minutes.  Anyway, enjoy your wifi

name: Seguros Fedpa
description: They sell 30 days insurance so you can extend your TIP

name: Calovibora-end of the road
description: This is the end of the new road to the Caribbean coast of Panama. It’s been open a few years but until February of 2020 the bridge was not complete and you needed a good 4x4 to reach the end. Now you can make it in an type of vehicle but make sure your brakes and cooling are in top shape. DO NOT ATTEMPT THIS ROAD IN A HEAVY RV.There’s one particular set of S curves just past the national park that will test your brakes on the way in and your cooling system on the way out. TRUST ME. We paid the owner of the little market $5 a night to park with no services but the hostel next door has everything listed if you need it just ask. The drive in is gorgeous and you can take boats to other villages nearby.

name: Monkey jungle
description: Camped here for a few days waiting for shipping to Cartagena. Big wide level street with plenty of room for like 10 big rigs.The only people around are walkers from the marina.There’s shady and sunny spots. You’re right in front of an old abandoned US military housing. Great place for walks and very safe. Lots of monkeysLoved it!

name: Customs and sanitary control
description: Just after the border, customs control and health control, they will visit the vehicle.

name: Lavamatico Super Clean
description: Cleaning Laundry, very friendly owner, we dropped off our laundry and recovered it 3 hours later, the price is 5 dollars the machine, washed, dried and folded.

name: Playa gravila
description:
Spent 3 days here, alone... tables with hammock, kayak, basic sanitary. No power, no WiFi (but good cellular reception), no kitchen. Fish and lobster available! Esteban the owner is a nice guy.
Very dirty road (the last 4 kms) but we did it with our RV (7m).
We payed 5$pp (adults only) + 5$ for the car
Really nice place!

name: Basketball court and soccer field
description: On my way to Torio I found this ok place to spend the night. No services. On the main road, but only 3 cars passed between 7 PM until 5AM.

name: Sobeys Car Wash
description: For $ 15, they have been completely the camper-out, outdoors and underdrawn. Very good job, there has almost spent almost an hour. Ideal before shipping

name: Boquete
description: nice german bakery, good coffee, cakes and (soft) bread

name: Mirador El Nancito
description: Space for 2 medium cars. Nobody around. No services. Almost no traffic between 7 PM and 6 AM.

name: Coronado 'la Casa de las Baterĺas'
description: Here you can find all types of batteries for your car. There is an other branch of this company in Panama City

name: Farmacia Arrocha - Copy Shop
description: good place to make here your photocopies. easy and fast!

name: Bodhi Hostel
description: Great safe spot for parking your camper! You can fill up your water and charge up, communal showers and kitchen space!

name: Auto Service - Land rover and others 4x4
description: This guys are specialized in Land rovers and others 4x4 cars. Excelent service and good price.

name: Chorro el Macho
description:
We arrived at night and parked at the entrance to the road that leads to Chorro el Macho, there was no one there, and in the morning we went to meet and bathe in that excellent, cold-water place.
___________
Llegamos por la noche y estacionamos en la entrada del camino que lleva al Chorro el Macho, no había nadie y por la mañana fuimos conocer y bañar en ese local, excelente, de agua fría

name: Alquileres Barahona
description: At this place you can rent a room. Bathroom included. No internet, no kitchen.

name: bar y parrillada costa del mar
description:
We've spent two nights close to the bar. the big roof was awesome to dry some stuff. In the evening the owner's serving beer (maybe more, but due to Corona not now). Some people came for a beer in the evening.The lady let us use their beach palapas and the power. 

There are also small houses for rent, I guess the price was 40$ per 24 hours. 

We bought some beer, gave some fruits and veggies and stayed for free.

The beach is huge and flat, nice to drive at.There is a beach access and also a river under the big tree at the end of the property. At night algees where glowing in the ocean as we took a bath.  The waves are small, so we felt like in the Carribean =) 

A nice spot to spent a day at the empty beach

name: Lavandería
description:
18kg for 8$, wash, dry and fold. if you come before 12, it will be done the same day. New washing machines and hot water.

Now 2,50$ kilo (July 2022)

name: Venao next to the main street
description: Hose directly next to the trash container at "Camino viejo" after the bus station at playa Venao. I've asked a guy and he said we can use it and drink it. High pressure and easy to fill the tank

name: best vet de centro América: las colinas
description: the best vet on all our trip! after one year of several vets all over Central America Señora Díaz finally found out the disease of our dog (spondylose). she has fair prices and, more important,really looks and cares about the pets. she doesn't speak much English but she's doing an awesome job and we're sooo happy to found her! really recommended!

name: best italian pizza of our trip
description: palati fini is an awesome little restaurant with the absolutely best pizza we've eaten on all our trip!!! the cooks are Italian and get their ingredients from Italy  too. loved it!!

name: Boquete Camp (Riverside)
description: An addendum to the main spot here. There is a tiny road that takes you down next to the river. Less exposure to street traffic and a wonderful spot to camp. I stayed in front of the hotel a couple nights, which does feel a touch safer and gives you walking access to town but this is a superior spot. Not suitable for big rigs. Tigo LTE. Free.

name: Playa Reina
description:
awesome place between the river and the ocean, shade and sun, relatively quiet but I guess lots of people at the weekend. close to the surf breaks!

good tigo reception and claro at the river,
hotel and restaurant close by

the road is paved

and there are some nice spots to pitch a tent

it's a dream

for more information or impression: @mandarinemarie

we really enjoyed it here

name: Wonderful Surfcamp, Hotel and Hostal Guanico
description:
Awesome place to relax, enjoy the quiet beach, nice waves, awesome vibes of Guanico. Nic the Swiss owner is more than welcome, the Surfcamp designed with lots of love! 

We stayed here and could use the pool, yoga room, Chillout area, table tennis, billard, Wifi, books, electricity, showers and toilet. Using kitchen and fridge is sometimes possible, when there are few guests.

So come by and enjoy the chilled vibes, surf board rental, awesome view of the waves and lots of good experiences.

If you want to see more and follow our trip: @mandarinemarie

We paid 5pp, dorms are available from 12pp and rooms for about 40$.

name: ServiciosCarlos, Spare Parts & Workshop
description:
Spare parts shop for Fiat, Renault and Peugeot cars and a workshop to fix those vehicles. Luigi runs the shop, his brother Carlos the workhop. Gianni, the son of Luigi speaks fluent English and is easy to communicate with. If a part is not on stock, they order it directly from Italy or France. Carlos and his mechanics changed the front braking discs and the timing/tooth belt on our Fiat Ducato, all within 48 hours. Prices are reasonable. Very helpful and friendly people. Business card attached.
(pls. give them 5 stars, I could not do it on iov myself)

name: Water Spigot
description: Nice clean water accessible on side of road. Next to bus stop.

name: Cerró Tute 4x4
description: A serious 4x4 route for a seriously epic spot. In the dry season you’ll have an amazing sunset over the entire range. Small rigs only. Tigo LTE

name: La India Dormida, 930müM
description:
One of a few hikes up to the crater rim. We camped at La Casa de Juan and it took us 1.5h to reach the top. Once you have entered the parque (3$ for non-residents), the trail passes the Piedra Pintada and some nice natural ponds. On top, one has a good view down at El Valle and the crater the village sits in.
Because we don't  like going back the same way, we continued towards the Cross and then followed a steep trail down to the village (1h). See maps.me for the details.

name: Laguna Yeguada
description: We wanted to circumvent the lake with our mountain bikes (10km), but part of the trail was very soggy because of heavy rain and we had to turn back. Although the laguna had little water, it took us 3h to hike around. At the north side, one needs to wade through a river with a nice waterfall.

name: Neighborhood
description:
Moderator Note: Please check carefully. Overnight parking may not be permitted.
.....
nice flat parking spot in safe area, surrounded by jungle, lots of animals. there's a roundabout at the end of the dead road. lots of cars park during daytime but in the evening and weekends it's empty. I haven't slept here but I guess you can. check out the wonderful hotel Bodhi close by.

name: Taller Exodo, Repairs/Services of Electro-Mechanic Parts
description: We went there to have our starter checked (did not engage reliably anymore). Because the car is a Fiat Ducato, Yiyo had to order the spare part from Panama City, delivery possible to Santiago the next day. Instead, we spent a few days at the Laguna Yeguada and, on our return, the starter was fixed within 30min.  Very competent, efficient and has reasonable prices. Highly recommended. +507 6618 7855

name: Nico’s Beach restaurante
description: Restaurant with a big parking lot and in front to the sea. Nice peoples. The owner permit us parking overnight. Fast internet

name: Servicios Electro Industriales
description:
Israel and his crew repair everything related to electrical motors, transformators, generators, pumps, etc.
We had a voltage transformator 120V2200V with a short circuit (rain water) and they disassembled, repaired, rewinded and assembled it within 48h for 75$. Professionally done.

name: Litchis Garden
description: We were on our way to Costa Rica and spent a night (5$) in our 7m motorhome in Richis garden. Because we are self-contained, we didn't ask for utilities, but just ask,  Richi speaks English well enough. They have two dogs who guard the garden.

name: Balneario Camping El Berrigon
description: Nice couple owns the place, limited covered tent camping sites for rainy season, 8 USD, cabanas 15 USD. Bamboo rafts to run the rapids, if you are so inclined

name: Súper Market Ojo de Agua
description: Larger grocery store and small taxi/truck/bus terminal. Some vegetables and lots of snacks/cold drinks. Cash payment only.

name: Bambú Asados/lunches/breakfast
description: Nice family run place with lots of lunch/breakfast options. Clean bathrooms available. They also have machine coffee

name: Hotel Residencial Aguadulce
description:
This is a hotel with enclosed parking. Room with big bed for $26, includes private room, AC, tv. The hotel is very close to the highway but in a very quiet area so we had a great night of sleep. 

There is a Peruvian restaurant 1 minute walking from the hotel and a big Super 99 (5 min walk) on the panamarican highway- the supermarket was very big and had some gourmet products from Europe and the US (some cheeses, cookies, teas) and some vegan products (Ice cream, nutritional yeast).

There is an ATM inside this Super 99

name: Tarpel rest stop
description: Wifi clean bathrooms showers and restaurant. It’s a great stop !

name: Villa Nome
description: Hostel with shared kitchen and spacious rooms. Double rooms with AC $26, shared bathroom. We are on bikes and the room was spacious enough for both of our bikes to fit in.

name: El Sol
description: Incredible spot! Friendly and welcoming English/Malaysian owner, stunning views over the mountains and coastline. Clean place, pool and rooms, including ‘surf rooms’ overlooking the surf. Best food in Panama, mix of Asian style - was incredible! Lovely rescue dogs too! We didn’t stay as had place already, but lunch and coffee was amazing, and can highly recommend. Been quiet with Covid but open for business. Contact: +50766161632.

name: Cocuye
description: Cocuye (Years ago called Cocuye Lodge) is a paradisiac place in the mid of nowhere!!! According to the old, abandoned, and too deteriorated facilities this place look like here functioned an 8 Stars hotel or VIP’s hidden place for the more exclusive people with access only by helicopter!!! Today it is a ruin full of mosquitoes, spider webs, and decayed wood. Far away from the hotel ruins, the place is amazing!!! The perfect Caribbean beach!!! White sand, crystal clear water, summer weather, and no other people!!! The road is a little complicated only for 4x4 vehicles and experimented pilots. Two hours from Colon city in the Caribbean Panamanian we may say Cocuye is one of the better beaches we’ve met ever… There is nothing there!!! Not water, not a place to buy, no people around… Nothing!!! So you get to go fully prepared if you pretend to stay there. Overall bring ice because the temperature is mega high.

name: Mamoni Arriba
description: Mamoni is about 1 hour and a half from Panama City on the way to Darien (East) The river cross around the province and has many beautiful places to camping, This way Mamoni Arriba (Upper) goes to join La Mesa way and also Cerro Azul way. All these roads crossed themselves at any point…

name: Hippie Pizza & Camp
description:
Private property with two food trucks run by a good friend of ours in Santiago. Safe, close to mechanics, shops, super market . 

Offering restrooms, electricity and amazing food if wanted. 

Check them on Instagram @hip_pizza

name: La Miel
description:
Awesome village on the border in the Darien gap. Sea access only unless you feel extra gnarly. 

No facilities, just beauty and a bay that captures sunset perfectly. Great policeman called Happy.

name: Super Gourmet
description: $.25 per gallon of "Pristine Water" out of a purification machine. Right by the ferry if you just came in or out. it's the same machine Skully has, but without any green stuff growing inside the bottom. although his water was safe to drink

name: The Overland Embassy
description:
I'm Alejandro from @vibesofpanama_ and we've created this space in our warehouse to help / support fellow travelers while in Panama. 

We work on shipping logistics, restorations, mechanic and paint jobs, modifications, documents, vehicle storage, etc. Also we can share routes, places to visit and more.

We have space inside for all types of vehicles (including "big rigs"), wifi, restrooms and tools/woodshop if needed. The place is secured with cameras.

Feel free to call anytime @ +507 67800065 or message. 

Safe travels!

name: Planta Potabilizadora
description: We saw bikers filling up their water bottles right as we needed water! A purification plant with water taps outside.

name: Casa Thai Spa
description:
A friend recommended this spa and wow. This is a fantastic spa and we love it very much. Right in the heart of Casco. We are cyclists and treated ourselves to massages here. This is a professional spa with professional masseuses.

The decor is impecable and the service you get is top notch. If you want a real Thai massage Casa Thai is where is at. The staff is amazing too. They have Thai massages, hot stone, oil, foot massage, pre natal massages, etc. English and Spanish are spoken :) 

Make sure you make a reservation, this place is a gem and is well attended by international tourists. It has some great reviews on TripAdvisor and google too. 

You can book online 
https://www.casathaipanama.com/booking-massage-panama/

name: Private Parking Mario
description:
Flat fenced area right on the shoreline. Fee for day parking is $2. We arrived past 5pm and were able to spend the night for that price.It was quiet and felt safe. There is a toilet but we didn't use it. Shaded space only for one camper, the rest of the area is in the sun. Mario also offers bottled water, sodas and fried fish with patacones. There is a restaurant next to the property but nothing else, so you need to bring food and potable water.

Update: During the weekend we endured very loud music all day long and until 10pm

name: Rock and Roll Sushi (Vegan!)
description: A very creative restaurant with great food and fine prices. Lots of sushi rolls, 2 kinds of bao, desserts and more. All vegan!

name: Central Cafe
description: pretty fancy little cafe, with great wifi. attaching picture of the speed test. food looks good but haven't received ours yet

name: Chorros de Ola
description:
We slept right at these GPS coordinates on the road side and walked from here a short way (10-15min) to the waterfall, which you can explore around by foot a fair amount. This was a great swimming hole, and a beautiful waterfall. 

There is an additional closer parking area farther up if you have 4x4. We didn't pay anything. Below this point there are a couple houses you can pay to park your car (2 or 3$) or use a bathroom, but some other folks walked from where we parked so we decided it was safe enough. 

Google Maps was generally good until very close to the waterfall it was a bit off...but don't take an earlier exit from the highway, you have to enter the falls area from the Southwest or else there's a crazy mountain 4x4 road up and over.... anyway both sides were a beautiful drive!

name: Overnight spot hidden w cell reception
description:
This spot was out of desperation since camping is not allowed in the protected first reserve area right now due to the pandemic. We found this little quarry side road and it worked for the night, also there's cell service at the edge of the hill which is the only spot in the area. 

To get cell service, a cop rolled up on a 4 wheeler. But he said he didn't come for us and let us spend the night anyway although the current restrictions. when the pandemic lessens this spot will be a better bet, but it's also useful to know there's service here!

name: Cerro Azul 3
description:
The view from here looks away from the city, but if you just want to cool down, not too far from the city, and you don't need any amenities, this was a chill spot!

Plenty of room to dig a hole if you need.... pack out tp of course. The road is a little rough for the last short stretch, but then there's a nice flat area with a view and cool temps. We don't have 4x4, just go slow for the last little bit and be smart. 

Wouldn’t recommend a big rig because the last stretch of road, but the spot itself is large enough.

name: Hospedaje Aruba
description: Awesome accommodation and not just for the price, clean rooms, hot showers, TV, A/C next to a well-priced restaurant. Down the street is a plaza, food stands and this is a great stop before Yaviza or La Palma, but there is a nice hotel on LA Palma, you just have to take a lancha to get there. We paid $20. AND if you tell them you are on a budget, they will let you Camp here! Tons of space.

name: Almacenajes Minidepósitos, Colón
description:
had our car here from february till july 2021 (had to leave Xplore cause was sold). Good and safe place, very clean, water, electricity, toilets available, 
~135$/monthly.

name: Sacred Heart of Jesus
description:
Opposite MacDonalds with WiFi, next to Smoke King restaurant, in front of the church with tower and statue.
Big rig, loads of space, next to busy noisy road, but a God send after a late border crossing from Costa Rica.

name: Gymnasium.
description:
Park with back to gymnasium, facing the road. Almost flat on broken tarmac and gravel. Asked local people in houses over the road, facing the gymnasium. All very happy.
Quiet at night, felt completely safe. 
Planning to stay here several days.

name: Bomberos Sabanitas
description:
The friendly bomberos let us pitch our tent in the hallway of the bomberos office building. We could even use their shower and fridge.
There is free slow public wifi reception from the medical clinic next door.
Fence closes at night so felt safe.

name: Panagas
description: Refilled my small one gallon tank for $3.70

name: Seaboard Marine
description: These are the right coordinates (not what Tea told us)

name: Fonda Teresa
description: This fonda is clean with fresh batidos next store, great stop and very economical. Great quality!

name: Colón, Plaza Margarita
description: at the new gas station you also find a plug for air and fresh water

name: Colón: pay for shipment
description: after the blue gate (garita) we had to come here to pay the $ 82 for shipment and go back to the little blue gate to show the paied bill.

name: Ojo Bio Panama
description:
We offer camping and secured parking for your vehicle while you explore the islands of Bocas Del Toro! We are on the mainland, 20 minutes outside of Almirante. Location on Google Maps is "Ojo Bio Panama". 

Before you contact us,  READ THIS PROFILE IN FULL!! It has all of the information you need to know. Yes, it is all up to date. If you wish to reserve, TEXT US (no phone calls, please) on Whatsapp +507 6983 2065 You must arrive to our property no later than 6pm so we can get you settled in before dark. NO price negotations on any services.

CAMPING
-NO electricity, water, or showers provided. There is a toilet at the bottom of the property. You must be 100% self sufficient.
-Shady places to park at the top of our property, right off the main road (may be road noise). 7 minute hike to the toilet at the bottom of the property (steep with lots of stairs). $10 per night 
-If you have a 4x4 vehicle, you can park in the shade at the bottom of our property, just steps from the Caribbean Sea (and the toilet!)! $15 per night. 
-Property is securely fenced. Well behaved, people and dog friendly pets are welcome! We have dogs on our property that are dog friendly.
-Wifi access at the bottom of the property for $5.
-Laundry services: Wash and line dry: $5 per load. Wash and dry in a dryer $10 per load. No folding service.
-We have ocean front access- You are welcome to snorkel/swim off our dock for free! Two-person kayak rentals are available for $15 per hour. Snorkel gear is $5 per hour per person.

SECURED PARKING
-If you wish to visit the islands and need a secure place to park your vehicle, we offer covered carport parking inside our fenced property for $6 a day.

We can give you a ride to Almirante to catch the water taxi to the islands ($20 one way, 4 people maximum), you can take the bus from our gate, or you can have someone pick you up directly from our dock.

Please note: We are in a secluded and remote area. There are no restaurants or stores nearby. Please stock up before you arrive! NO SMOKING anywhere on our property.

name: on the side walk
description: at the end of the all weather sports facility, on the side walk, small white cap.... unscrew it and you have a potable water tap

name: Black Mountain Coffee Roasters
description:
Absolutely amazing coffe, croissants, cinamon rolls, cakes and so on!
Beautiful settings!
Best coffee place we have been since the US.

name: Magic Clean - lady Ilsa
description:
Really really nice little laundry place. Lady speaks some english and is super smiley. 
Price is 4usd per load which she washes and folds and everything.
We dropped off around lunchtime and was done next day at 10.00.

Highly recommed

name: Freeway Laundry
description:
Open six days a week. Closed Sunday.
Park in front of the place

name: Official Health Stamp for Vet papers
description:
If you need to authorise the health certificate from a veterenarian it is done at the Ministerio de Salud (health ministry)

You can follow step by step from photo.
Bring 10 usd (not 20😂)

REMEMBER: Long shirt and long pants

(for example we needed to authourise the vet certificate from Andys Pets - otherwise it would not be allowed for traveling to Chile)

name: Pannitos
description: Not many eateries around, we liked Pannitos for big portions and good quick food (no alcohol at present). Hamburgers, pasta, pizza, clean and cool.

name: Police check Divisa
description: Official check towards the peninsula. We were waved through, nothing special. Mind your speed, only 40km/h

name: Pan & Cake
description: great breakfast spot and bakery. fast free wifi

name: Pan & Cake
description: fast free wifi while enjoying breakfast, lunch or coffee

name: Hostal Pachamama
description: small scale resort with huts, but also tents and hammocks at 10 dollars a night. ocean and lagoon, great place to see turtles hatch and enjoy the island life.

name: Hotel Playa Reina
description:
we are a beach hotel that has availability to campers, with benefits for your comfort when visiting the southern coast of Veraguas.
---
Somos un hotel de playa que tiene disponible para el Viajero de carro casa, con beneficios para su comodidad al momento de visitar la costa sur de Veraguas.

name: Mata Oscura Beach Spot
description: Wild spot right in front of the ocean. Quiet and easy to get there (2wd and van friendly). Stayed here for one night and it was great! Place for two (max. three) vans/motorhomes. There are also two more spots right in front of the ocean at the entry of the spot.

name: Kilian
description:
Country cabins, in Farallón, Rio Hato. steps from the beach. Restaurant and 3000 mtr2 of outdoor land.
.....
Cabañas campestres, en Farallón, rio hato. a pasos de la playa cuenta con restaurante y 3 mil mtr2 de terreno al aire libre

name: kilian
description:
Restaurant located in Farallón, steps from the beach, Mediterranean and signature cuisine with large open lounge and outdoor terrace
.....
restaurante ubicado en Farallón, a pasos de la playa, cocina mediterránea y de autor con amplio salón abierto y terraza al aire libre

name: Kilian
description:
country cabins, restaurant and camping on land with more than 3000 mtr2 in Farallon, River Hato. steps from the beach
.....
cabañas campestres, restaurante y camping en terreno con mas de 3 mil mtr2 en Farallon rio hato a pasos de la playa

name: Big grassy area
description: Big grassy area with a few trees for shade. Is an empty field that aparently belongs to the electricity company but is open. We asked the neighbors if it was ok to spend the night and they said yes. Police passed during the night and didn’t say anything. Very safe, right in front of a few house, soccer fields close by and a minute drive to the canyon. Big rigs would fit perfectly.  We spend two nice nights there.

name: Lavandería Coronado lavamatico
description: It is a laundry place where you can do it yourself or they do it for you and deliver it. They wash, dry and iron clothes.

name: CouCou Crazy
description:
Cafe, bakery and brewery run by the Belgian owner Dennis who let's travellers stay on his property and use the facilities for 5 USD per person and 10 USD for pets (consumption in the cafe is appreciated and well worth it). 

Really nice and quiet place with bathrooms, showers, outdoor kitchen, a grassy patch for tents and several areas to sit and chill including a view tower. 

Dennis built this place himself. He roasts his own coffee, bakes cakes and other pastries, brews his own beer and makes homemade sodas like ginger ale.
He also has some pigs and goats.
He is very helpful, well connected in case you need anything and let us use some of his tools to change our diff oil.
He speaks Dutch, English and Spanish. 

Awesome place to stay, definitely recommended. 

5 minutes to Playa Toro, 10 minutes to Playa Arenal, the places also rents a 20 foot container and another two little houses tru airbnb.

You can contact Dennis via WhatsApp (+507 6270 6485) or email (info@coucoucrazy.com)

LINK FOR THE AIRBNB ROOMS
https://es-l.airbnb.com/rooms/40329279?guests=1&adults=1&s=67&unique_share_id=ff4adf3f-d3c6-4496-b229-54297c237aaf

name: PC's Center
description: Cute copy shop with plants, snacks, and drinks. We paid less than $3USD for ~25 copies

name: BMW
description: This is the location for parts and maintenance for Motorrad. Overpriced and average service but… if you need those filters?!!!

name: Coco plum
description: Well, we stopped and ate here all I have to say is the food is less than average but at least it’s expensive! Can’t recommend

name: Air Cargo Pack
description: This is where you leave your moto if shipping with cargo rider or direct with air cargo pack. We shipped 2 bikes based on recommendations from other riders via Air Cargo Pack / Cargo Rider. It’s by far the most economical way to fly the bikes. They don’t crate them so you save a lot of hassle and cost but… both our bikes arrived with damages… scuffed paint on the fairings and top case, obviously poor strapping job and mine must have hit a door from when being moved with the fork flit. Unfortunate but not the end of the world.

name: Free Water, Fire station - Bomberos
description:
Asked the fire department if I could use their hose
To refill my fresh water tank.  They said no problem.  It’s right out front near with coastline.  Easy peasy.

name: Fundación GRINBIO
description: Very nice place in a self sustainable farm. Here you can learn for an extra charge a tour about sheep production, chicken-eggproduction, coffee, fruit trees,  as well as sustainable cropping and biodiversity. Also for an extra charge you can have Yoga lessons or participate on Yoga and Spiritual retreats. The owner Diane and Wladimir Uliantzeff  are very friendly.  Cost $10 per person. They have clean bathroom, hot water and wifi.

name: Jungle Bluff Beach Paradise
description:
We offer camping in your own mobile home, pickup, tent on our property only 150 meters from the awesome long Bluff Beach on the Isla Colón/Bocas del Toro. We are surrounded of big trees, which will give you natural shadow, a lot of tropical animals and birds. You can hear and watch the hawler monkeys, see the sloths, parrots and toucans. We are totally off-grid and enjoying our economic lifestyle. We can provide you with electricity, fresh natural rainwater and WiFi. Now we can offer a guest toilet and a cold and hot outdoor shower. Hotplates, pots and dishes to prepare your meals are available as well. The distance to the next restaurant / Beach Bar is 300 meters. Price / fee per night and place 20 $! We have 2 places for camper vehicles on a prepared, dry underground. 
Some restaurants in our neighborhood are available by foot (5-15 minutes walk). Bluff Beach is an developing area, you can see and hear construction workers between 8 am and 5 pm. The nights are calm, only natural vibes from the waves, birds and monkeys.
Looking forward to your message to Britta via WhatsApp +49 151 54641297 or send me an email to info@brittascholz.de

name: lago el flor
description:
big grassy area on a lake.
there is a gravel road that leads to the lake, that road is on maps.me. after 500 meters there is a sharp right turn into a dirt road, that's not on maps.me. the dirt road could be difficult wen wet.

name: water @ pump
description: The other marked pump had no pipe. the pressure was low here but the pump wasn't running. could hook up hose. lots of chlorine

name: Ciudad de Saber Miraflores
description: A very safe and quiet neighbourhood where you can sleep close to the locks. After minimarket (well stocked) turn left and after 20 meters behind the building you will find the parking area. or you can stay at the sports ground.

name: Manzanillo Harbour
description:
Burglary in a mobile home when shipping from Cartagena to Panama with Hoeg Reederei! Only 16 hours on sea. 

On Board of Hoegh Beijing they tried to brake in in our cabin. Luckily we had two door locks, therefore they did not come into the cabin.

But they opened four more small doors, including the one for gas and the toilet.

The storage space door at the bottom was also broken open but only beer was stolen.

As our shipping agent told us, at this time less motorhomes were shipped so it happens OFTEN.

The shipping company Hoegh has not responded to our ad after a week.

name: Laundromat
description: $1.15 for wash (30 min) $1.50 for dry (45 min) 5kg machines. BYO washing powder. mon-fri 7.30-5.30 sat 8-5.30 closed sat. other services are available e.g. wash fold and iron. some parking at front. the dryer wasn't working properly so they dried my clothes in their big dryer for me

name: Fonda D'Paso
description: Traditional Panamanian food. smoked sausage and ribs. The Hojakldras are delicious. The hospitality of the owner is fabulous.

name: free parking next to old town Casco viejo
description: lots of space in the morning. right next to old town. there was No one hanging around here although there is a big old apartment building overlooking the parking  police did occasional patrols. a great parking spot. access south bound on Cinta Costa. it's not worth driving in the old city if you can get a spot here

name: boat tours
description:
$5 water taxi to the Emberá community. $45 to enter the community but if you speak Spanish you might be able to enter for $20 but negotiate before you get on the boat - say you don't want lunch and the show. we opted for a $35 tour to the waterfall and passed by the 1st and 2nd embera tribes, driver waited for an hour while we swam, a bit of boat tours competition at the river bank so ended up paying $30, it's about 30 mins to the waterfall.
free parking on the left where buses park, police nearby

name: Va & Ven
description: Half way between David and Boquete. Not a full size Va y Ven but way more space and quieter than the one in David. Check when you go to fill up with fuel if you can stay overnight as trucks don't park here. 24hr toilets and soda refills. There's a tap on the front lawn with a hose. Don't drive on the grass lots of hidden sprinklers park on the concrete.

name: Roadblock by locals
description:
You currently can't pass through the village during the day, locals block the main access roads and you can't go around it (there is one very bad side road, but only for light 4x4 pickups because of deep ruts and wooden makeshift bridges). This has been going on for the last few days.
They seem to let you pass around 4 or 5 in the evening.
Couldn't find anything in the news about it.
Super unfriendly and don't explain why they are protesting and blocking the road. Also seems that only a handful of people are involved, most people in the village were friendly when we tried to circumvent the blockade (but no luck, we are too heavy for the tiny wooden bridges).

name: Parque Nacional Sarigua
description:
Nice little national park with some trails and a desert landscape. You can camp on the salt marsh, near the entrance at the ranger station or if you have a tent hike into another location. Toilets at the ranger station (see tourist info icon for more info).

Crazy hot during the day, nice and cold at night. Not many visitors, even on a Sunday. The ranger was super friendly.

Free entrance and camping as of February 2022 (regular $5 + $3 per person?)

name: Picnic Spot by the River
description:
Really nice and relaxing spot by the river, you can reverse your van down the hill closed to the river before barb wire fence.
Bridge and haunted castle nearby.

name: Plaza
description:
MODERATORS NOTICE:iOverlander cannot verify if wild camping is permitted at this location. It is your responsibility to verify local laws or obtain consent before staying the night. 

Decent size and flat parking lot / strip just behind a plaza. Restaurants, wifi, bathrooms, and pharmacy at the plaza. Very comfortable and safe. No issues staying here for a night. Some traffic in the morning and evenings, but just business people and restaurant goers. Many people come by and take photos on the little bridge over the creek to the plaza. It’s nice.

name: Ofiuras Hostal
description: Simple lodging for $25 per night. Fan in room and spotty wifi. Comfortable little beach access with some outdoor chairs to enjoy the morning. Cold water showers and kitchen. Google Maps showed the place had no availability, but when we went here they had a couple of open rooms. Worth checking in person, as there is no website up and running, yet. The owner is very easy going and helpful!

name: Gearbox Specialist
description: They can repair manuals and automatics here. We paid $275 for complete gearbox strip down in order to change the bearings and also swap some other gears in which we already had. Took two days. Friendly guy. Very reasonably priced and good to find somewhere that will work on a manual.

name: on the beach
description: A quiet spot on the beach. A bit tight when reversing in and need a bit of ground clearance for the step up. locals surf and collect coconuts. the other side of the road is vacant property so no one to annoy. no Claro reception

name: Hostal Bulaba
description: Very beautiful Hostal with a garden where we pitched our tent. The owner is really nice.  There is a kitchen with a fridge, freezer and a laundry. They have a hot and a cold shower. The place has everything you need as a camper

name: Shower & Water faucet
description: Super friendly community with lots of expats and one of them pointed out this water point to us. Next to the sports field are two outdoor showers (no privacy), a sink and a water faucet. You can probably drive onto the sports field to fill up your tank if your hose is not long enough. Chlorinated water as everywhere in Panamá, but probably potable.

name: Coin laundromat at the marina
description:
The marina / yacht club has a coin operated laundromat with washer and dryer. 4x $0.25 for the washing machine and 6x $0.25 for the dryer. Takes 30 minutes, only takes quarters like the commercial washing machines in the US.

They also have toilets and showers.

name: A1 AutoMecania
description:
preventive and corrective maintenance, complete inspection of vehicles, supplier of spare parts and certified workshop. 

————————————————————————————————-

mantenimiento preventivo y correctivo, revision completa a vehiculos, proveedor de repuestos y taller certificado.

name: A1 AUTO MECANICA
description:
MECHANICS SHOP AND SPARE PARTS. 
GENERAL MANTAINCE, OIL, FILTERS, BRAKES, TIRES.

ELECTRICS CHECKS AND INSTALLS.

name: Mendoza Mini Mart can make copies
description:
The Mendoza Mini Mart has a printer and can do copies (but no USB printouts).

Expensive ($0.25 per page) but opposite of the police inspection if you need an urgent copy.

name: Playa El Arenal
description:
when you arrive at the beach the left side is parking for isla iguana and a restaurant.  Went to the island and eat supper at the resturant.  Washrooms and showers did not use not sure if hot..  Chicken and fish good food.  slept here one night.
 On the right side public parking slept here one night also.  Washroom and resturant.  Did not eat here.  Water.  Very busy on the weekend.  Open parking lot sand beach you can walk for miles.  tigo signal weak only in parts of parking.
Isla iguana $70 per boat up to 5 people  Not much on island bring your own food and drink.  small white sand beach blue water a few short trails and of course lots of iguanas.  I was told snorkeling was good.  return is at 3:00

name: Lavanderia yLavamatico Fermina
description: Great service and price. They can wash for you or you do it yourself.   I did it myself.  $5.50 2 loads washed and dried.   large spot to park just beside.  Great location.

name: Bucanero Beach club
description: This is actually a hostel. Toilets, water use of kitchen.   Rooms also available.  Directly on the beach. We parked in a lot.  $5 per day.
