The owner Chello was very friendly and helpful.  A few people each day,  not busy even on weekends.  We arrived on a holiday the only time it got busy.  Cello does not tolerate loud music and parties.   Great beach, you can walk a long time in both directions.  Calm and not busy.  Electricity if you have an extension.

name: Taller automotriz power motor
description: behind the store called black Friday.  turn beside store it is In the back.  does not look fancy, but good service Yosbel the owners son speaks English.   Great service good communication while waiting for parts.  Knows alot about American cars and trucks.  We even slept here one night.

name: Guayaha Hotel
description:
Large open guarded parking lot.
Leveled and suitable for large rigs.
Nice clean toilet and nice restaurant. Beautiful clean swimming pool. 
200 c per night for the parking.
A really good new paved road till San Agustín Lanquín.
We took a pickup truck to Semuc Champey, steep and unpaved road, cost us 50 c per person for both ways - worth every penny.

name: Bye as Llantas S.A.
description: Well equipped tire shop where we got a used tire to replace one that was damaged. They attended to us right away and had us set up within 20-30 minutes. Very professional and $35 including installation.

name: El beso del Dragón
description:
Local restaurant with local prices. 
Good food and juices.

name: Military Checkpoint
description: Intimidating inspection with a drug dog by two men in military fatigues and an older man in a polo shirt with some official logo. We were held up for over 30 minutes. It felt like one nice guy who spoke a little English was really trying to distract us from watching the other guys while they inspected our van and filled out their paperwork. I was directly told not to take photos. It felt very off, and we hope there is not another checkpoint ahead to prove us right!

name: Terpel Full Service Travel Center and Gas Station
description: Free showers next to the Lavenderia. Just go to the main check out counter and ask for the FOB. They will ask for a piece of ID and will return it when you return the FOB that opens the shower door. Very nice and clean. Cold at first, then it warms up a bit. Best shower since our campground in Austin, Texas. This service was intended for the working truck drivers. Please keep this in mind and give them priority.

name: Terpel Gas Station and Service Center
description: Free open Wifi at the Terpel Gas Station. A great place to stop and eat if you have a dog because there’s an outdoor seating area in the back.

name: Bathroom at the Puerto Panama City
description: There is a clean bathroom with two showers and toilets for free. During the day there are some marine officer who secure the place. There is also a sink and laundery room.

name: Krume Bäcker
description: Lovely Bakery incl. Restaurant in Panama City with the best bread we had in whole Central America. The owner is from Austria and the ingredients are all organic. Enjoy a Wiener Frühstück - we love it!

name: La Granja Campo y Aventura
description: Big camp ground with everything you need. Big grassy area where you can get your van ready for the shipping. A lot of animals around - cat, dogs, coati, ducks, horses as well as a little goat. Staff and owner very friendly and helpful. Best place around!

name: Jaguar Cabanas
description: Nice spot on the road to port of Cali.  Stayed here the night before we took the launcha to Colombia.  No power, cold shower and 60$ a night but it’s close to the port, maybe 20 min. Comfy bed.

name: Rim Repair- Torneria Don Bosco
description:
Great place specializing in rim repair and welding. Fixed 2 dents on my front moto rim after hitting a pothole on my way to Yaviza.

Charged 90US, took just over an hour

They'll take your wheel off your car, but I had to take my wheel off myself, being a moto (they can take the tire off the rim themselves). Or you can bring your bike to a mechanic to take your wheel off and bring it here

name: Wild camping by the river
description: This is a nice wild camping spot by the river, close to the bridge. Traffic on this road is very low, especially at night. Rocky road that leads to it diverges from the main road just after the bridge (assuming you are going east). Only for 4x4, normal cars and big rigs won't make it. Dedicated rather for cyclists. Photo attached, place seen from the bridge.

name: Hostal Los Tecales
description: This a small hostel run by a local couple Julia and Carlos. They have a beautiful maintained front yard garden which they are open to give use for camping for Campervans. The lady is lovely and makes delicious food. (We had chicken fried rice and was blown away) The internet is fast, there are clean bathrooms and toilets to use. They have power outlets but we didn’t ask if they were extra. Its $10 per night per vehicle. After struggling to find a place to camp in town of santa Catalina, we accidentally stumbled here and had a lovely time. Our dog loved played in the gardens.

name: Lavanderia Yi
description: Quick, same-day (3 hours), drop off laundry service.  Friendly enough. Like many things in this area, not cheap.  $15 for rather small bag!  However, 90 degrees and humidity with afternoon rain + being lightly packed while waiting several days for van to ship= desperate for clean, dry clothing.

name: The Garden
description: Great food. great prices.  Salad made to order lots of choices.  Daily specials.  We went 2x  it was so good.  Pizza excellent.  We asked about the tacos. we had seen a picture online.  The special was not every day.  She made it a few days later.  We also asked for cheese and gravy (a quebec poutine)  They made it for us.  yum.  Great ice tea.  Homemade ice cream and baked goods also available.  A small store inside with fresh veggies, eggs etc.

name: Finca las lagunas
description: Excellent camping site. Sure, it has a shower, bathroom and kitchen (kitchen use 5 dollars). You can fish. They charge $5 per person. ---Excelente sitio para acampar. Seguro, posee ducha, baño y cocina (uso de cocina 5 dólares).Se puede pescar. Cobran 5 dólares por persona.

name: Pipeline Trail
description: Nice little trail (check all trails for more information) to a waterfall at the end (not much water right now) and also an ancient tree. Putting this on here as it was a great place to spot quetzals, we easily saw about 5. Made it worth the $5pp we paid. Take bug spray. Toilets available.

name: Hospedaje Villamar
description: Clean single floor hotel. With pool, kitchen to use and extra washroom by the pool. We came on motorcycles, they have room for campers but didn’t ask if they allow campers or tents. Paid $41 for room with washroom and ac

name: Agaseke lodge
description: 5 bedrooms family run lodge; some private some with multi bunk beds. Secured parking. Great wifi. Spacious kitchen to cook. Large front veranda with tables and chairs to relax. 3 min walk from town yet very peaceful and quiet. Perfect spot to spend a few nights and explore Boquete. Paid $40usd for a private room using booking.com.

name: emachservices
description: Hello, My name is Ed. I am the owner of the hostel in October 2021. I started this business with one room. Today I have three rooms available, two with private bathrooms and one with a shared bathroom. The place is located in Almirante on Kilometer 67. You can also give me a call at +50769789026 or message me for booking a reservation.

name: RTR Motorsports Husky/KTM
description: If you need KTM parts or service go here and not the other location listed on Google (that's only a showroom). Friendly English speaking staff,  Small stock of Mitas tyres (call in advance to order a specific type/size - they don't usually have Dakar in stock), and Motorex oils and such.  They also have tiny sachets of fuel stabiliser if you're shipping!

name: La Estancia Restaurant
description:
La Estancia is a restaurant with a few bungalows.
It has a big garden where we could park ou 21 ft camper.
The place is very quiet, 10 min walking from town center.
The owner, Dennis , is very nice and charged us 10 USD per night.
We could get potable  water and charge our computers for free.
In law season the restaurant only opens on week end but we could stay as long as we wanted in the garden.
Dennis WhatsApp in case there is no-one there on your arrival :
+507 6791 7233

name: tiny camp ground
description: 10 usd per person kids free. two cars or five tents. toilet, shower and sink. fire place two. at the end of bosquete, fresh nights!!!! ask for keys at cafe.

name: Chorchita's shelter
description:
Village event hall with roof, neighbors told we could stay for the night. View on the Chorcha fall and really close to interamericana. we have put our in the middle of the hall, hammock on the side.
on Friday night kids come to play football and Saturday there is a party so not possible then.

Water acces and kiosk in the village.

name: playa los panamá
description:
small beach parking with a few trees and a kiosk... 
we stayed one night on a saturday and even though it was weekend, the night was quiet.

name: Camping Paraiso Escondido
description: Lovely camping with the view on the valley and coast. 5.5USD per person

name: The Surf Lodge
description: The Surf Lodge is a bed-&-breakfast offering a private room (sleeps 4) and a hostel room. There are a big kitchen, bathroom, patio, balcony and dining area for guests to share. Camping spots are allocated informally around the perimeter of the spacious property with ample shade, grass and fenced-in for good security. They offer water refill.

name: amechservices
description:
B&B. Great breakfast, basic rooms but all you need. 
Safe parking for motorbikes not for camper/RV
Great host, speaks English and he can help you with any formalities, translations and more

name: AutoMed: Motors & Dents
description:
AutoMed: Motors & Dents
Mechanics
BodyWork & Painting
Detailing
Maintenance
Auto Diagnostic Scan

name: valley overlook
description: after driving down this road hoping to find a free spot overlooking the lake, which we didn't find, there is a small 50m spur off to the west that overlooks the pine forest and a beautiful green valley below. this spur is kind of off camber at the entrance but there is a nice flat spot for a couple of cars or 1 large van at the end. don't bother going down the road across from the main road here. it doesn't go anywhere and no where to camp, I tried. only 1 truck drove by in the early morning. we caught a guy walking back to the asphalt and said he worked at a farm further up the road that we should stay at, but we were already packing up to leave.

name: Jungle ecoreserve
description: A wonderfull place. Alwin and Joy have a camping and cabanas. Beautiful walkingtracks with a lot of wildlife and birds. A perfect stop for a couple of days between de caribean and Panama city

name: height restriction
description: at this bridge there is a height restriction. we are 2.8m and did not fit. there is no sign but if I had to guess I would say it was maybe 2.6m. there is a nice spot on the town side of this bridge to drive down to the river.

name: steep hill
description: this section of road is incredibly steep. our rig barely had enough power to get up this curvy bit. if you are very long, very heavy, or under powered then I would avoid this nasty section. the other way out of town is nice and easy.

name: sketchy bridge
description: we were trying to find out if this road connects, across the river, to the other side via a water crossing. according to our maps is doesn't, but Google Earth like like it's possible. coming from the lake we came across this bridge here. it's super sketchy wood planks on 2 tiny steel beams. we are 4 tons so I got out and walked around it. maybe you would be fine but there is no way I would drive across this. unfortunately I still don't know if you can cross that river crossing up ahead.

name: Bocas reef residencial
description: The cheapest option we found for a friday night in May. A private room with ac and private bathroom with himot water 30 usd total for two. Good wifi. You can pay with debit or credit card. In front there are lot of supermarkets and places to eat. Just one street away from water taxis. Ermelinda the receptionist is really kind and helpful. Advice: the first street is full of places expensive. Just move one street to the third and price are really cheaper. Then if you travel by car we recommend to leave it in almirante, because here the roads to best places are on construction and many times you need boats to move from one place to another

name: Copa mall kiosk
description: right at this pin location on the second floor of the mall. if you are flying with dogs, you need to come to a Copa office like this one to tell them you will be flying with animals. this cannot be done online. we decided to buy tickets here as well to make the process easier as they can print your boarding passes and assign you proper seats with extra space for the dogs. we did this step last because we assumed they would require all of the paperwork, but they only asked if we had it, and didn't actually need it. so buy your tickets as soon as you know you're departure date and save yourself some time. this office was very friendly and fast and at least 2 of the people here spoke great English. took maybe 15 minutes.

name: Casa Bruja Brewing Co.
description: excellent craft brewery with great food and better beer. they are even doing spontaneous fermentation and barrel aged stuff upstairs. absolutely nailed every style and had 16 of their own beers on tap and 4 of their own hard seltzers. huge covered outdoor area and very small indoor area. dog friendly. 4.90 for most pints and the food was decently priced considering how tasty everything was. try the honey chicken strips! easily walkable from Overland Embassy.

name: Supermarket Rey
description:
Safe place, fit our 7m van easily,. Police sent us here as they said the mirador is not safe and here they will watch us. Quiet during night.
@frodobeule_the_van two germans going North

name: Parque Nacional Campana - Camping Zone
description: Plan terrain with and old housefrom the turism autority of panamá, old instslations and one abandoned house, is a tiny plain terrain of a 100mts2 aprox

name: Kumho tire
description: Great service. We came by a local recommendation. 73 usd total price for general revision, complete service (change oil and air filter) and wheels rotation. You can write them before asking for budget: + 507 6670 0215

name: Covid Antigen Test - $25
description: Covid tests at drive thru site. Just $25 for antigen test with results sent in an hour. There was no line on a Sunday so it took just a couple mins!

name: Grassy spot Next to kid park
description:
Just a pullout on the road next to kid park, really quiet road at night and even in the day, close to town and restaurant. 
We were there on Sunday night and it was really quiet. 
You can hide a little bit more from the road if you want to be more private

name: Low hanging telephone line
description: Low hanging telephone line diagonally across the street. Steep slope on the side of the road to a creek. We are 2.95m tall and slowly squeezed through having the line touching our roof. May be able to lift it with a tall stick, just be aware.

name: The Overland Embassy
description: Safe parking area for overnight camping with wifi, water, restrooms, cctv and many other services.

name: Parque
description:
Park in a residential area, calm, quiet and safe.
---
Parque en zona residencial , tranquilo, silencioso y seguro.

name: Parque Nacional de Chagres Visitor Center
description:
After being told by a local that it was too dangerous to camp by the river down the street, we asked the rangers here at the visitors center if it was okay to stay for a night. They said yes and to my question if it was safe, they answered that the property is fenced (true), the gates close at night (true) and 3 dogs roam and protect the property at night (also true).
At least one of the rangers lives on the property.
We had a quiet night and felt super safe!

name: Military Checkpoint
description: It was an easy checkpoint. We were waved through.

name: Military Checkpoint
description: It was an easy checkpoint going south. We were just waved through.

name: Two Gas Stations
description: Not too many gas stations on the way down so marking these here. Texaco and forgot what the other one was...

name: End of the Road Sign
description: Here is the sign at the end of the road. You can keep driving a little further and a loop around town as long as you're not much higher than 3m. Not much else to see and do in this town but we're glad we finished the trip all the way!!

name: Spot next to the river
description:
Lots of space.
Easy to reach next to the river.
Very quiet, only few cars on the street.
Safe.
Refresh in the river.
3G connection.

name: Copy Shop
description:
Printed 11 pages of a document and scanned 1 page for USD 3.42.
It's on a busy road but parking right in front.

name: Firefighter Station
description: Beside the firefighter station and the community gym. Super safe as the Panama Airforce and marina office are here also. Open WiFi and water source.

name: La Fleka de Guánico
description:
Perfect place for breakfast ! Delicious chocolate croissant, normal and ham and cheese! Pizzas to order, with delicious breads and super well-priced! All handmade and fresh! A very nice couple from Barcelona is expanding the menu of products (burgers, hot dog, and vegetarian options).  Highly recommended! The telephone number for orders is +507 6756 9594
.....
Lugar perfecto para desayunar ! deliciosos croissant de chocolate, normales y de jamón y queso! demas hacen pizzas por encargo, riquisimos panes y súper bien de precio! todo hecho a mano y del día! son una pareja muy maja de Barcelona y están ampliando la carta de productos (hamburguesas, Hot dog, y opciones vegetarianas) muy recomendado! El teléfono para encargos es el +507 6756 9594

name: Playa Caracol
description:
Spot after spot of empty beaches. It’s all sand and small plants so you need a 4x4 preferably unless yo know your car can make it on sand. Very safe and quiet. There is good surf on the beach (it’s about 2km wide) and a bunch of trees you can find some shade for the car. We stayed 2 nights and it was great. Nothing around except for some housing being built on the end of the beach, so bring everything you need. 

To get here you take the road to Playa Caracol. Then take the dirt road and go for about 2km  keep your eyes open to take an “exit”
To your right that will take you to the beach. If you look on satellite google maps you can make out the exit point from the images.

name: Pelican's Shack Home
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Contribution by owner, check-in to report

House for rent for days, weeks or months! the house is perfect to spend a long season in the middle of nature and for 4 people! You can walk to the river and the howler monkeys are nearby! you can also share the space and rent by room! They have a private bathroom and air conditioning! The place is 5 minutes from Playa Guanico by car! Contact telephone number +507 6756 9594 speak to Virginia

Español
Casa de alquiler por días,  semanas o meses! la casa es perfecta para pasar una larga temporada en plena naturaleza y para 4 personas! Se puede pasear hasta el rio y los monos aulladores están cerca! también se puede compartir el espacio y alquilar por habitación! tienen baño privado y aire acondicionado! El lugar está a 5 minutos de Playa Guánico en coche! Teléfono de contacto +507 6756 9594 hablar con Virginia

name: Parking lot at Bodhi Hostel
description: We spent 4 nights at the parking lot of Bodhi Hostel and it was really nice. They charge you 5 dollars per person per night for using bathrooms and kitchen and you can also use the common areas with nice hammocks. For 2 more dollars you can get a very good breakfast with cafe, fruits and pancakes :) Very quiet, safe and nice, with a good vibe! The parking lot is small but we stayed perfectly with our Suburban.

name: Kapu Rancho Almendros
description: Amazing spot surrounded by nature and wildlife, just in front of Matapalo Beach! They have cabins for rent but we asked “Macho”, the person in charge of the place, if we could stay a couple of nights in our campervan. He had never done this before but he allowed us and charged 10 dollars per night. There is no bathroom but we could use the outside shower and the yoga covered terrace for cooking with our own staff. They have only a hammock and 2 chairs there. It is a rustic and very nice spot… it feels like if you where in the middle of the jungle. We could see lots of animals around including monkeys, toucans, and even a snake! We stayed here 3 nights and it was an incredible experience. The place is very calm and feels very safe. Just watch out your food from monkeys!

name: Behind electricity towers
description: Behind the electricity block is a place with flat surface where you can put your tent or car, is little before the return to the Panamericana Hwy

name: Autopista Interamericana
description: Watch your speed! Widespread radar speed enforcement since I crossed Costa Rica border. High quality road encourages speedy driving. Don’t.

name: Behind the giant rock
description: Behind the huge stone is a lot of place to place your tent or your car and is free

name: La Concha Rosada
description: Private accomodation, gated, beach access, pool.  Laundry available for $5.00,  Bath with shower (outdoor/private).  No dark water disposal available.  Cell phone service is sketchy at best.  $15.00 per night/camper/2pax.

name: Even closer to Punta Chame
description: Large pulloff on water.  Suitable for trailer or big rig.  No cell.

name: E-Cargo Logistics
description: Air-freighted my Yamaha Ténéré 700 from Panama to Bogotá. Excellent service, great communication, competitive pricing. They help with the Panama exit paper processing. They have experience with bikes and they  were careful with mine. There were a couple of Dutch guys picking up bikes they’d brought in from the Netherlands.  Recommended by Gonzalo, the Mexican guy who broke the record for Ushuaia to Prudhoe Bay this summer (31 days, beat that…) Contact Teofilo Guerra, the General Manager on +507 6902-8242 via Whatsapp. Office number is +507 303-8958.

name: Organically Store
description: Large organic grocery store with coffee shop too.  Not inexpensive, but lots of hard to find products.

name: Serenade Lodging Rooms
description:
Quirky little hotel, small but cute, very clean.
Small breakfast included in price, 7am.
Located in nicer part of P.C., lots of shops, pubs and restaurants nearby.
Possible parking availble for even a tall Sprinter.
Entrance off of Calle 75 Este, not Via Isreal as Google Maps currently shows.
Push "Ring" doorbell or Phone: +507 6615-2715
